Source: This text is step-specific; it will be replaced when the quest proceeds to a new step.
Same as for regular steps, this will appear in the journal to describe what must be done for this optional step.
I've collected Jes' weapon crates from the bandits, who will no longer turn the weapons on innocent travelers. I should return the crates to Jes.
Jes asked me to venture to the bandit camp southeast of Camlorn and retrieve his stolen weapon shipment.
Before I can speak with the Countess I must speak to her Chamberlain
Countess Virolynn believes her Chamberlain was headed to the town of Crosswych, in Dwynnen.  She told me to check with the Warden Godwyn, who oversees the town.
Warden Godwin had not seen Chamberlain Godwyn.  He handed me a letter from Oron, urging me to return to Camlorn at once.
I must decide to help King Sebastien, by journeying to Eagle's Watch to defend Northmoor, or to assist Oron by investigating Gargast's connections in Crosswych.
King Vincintian suggested I assist Averos in the defense of Eagles Watch. I'll find him in the west tower of Eagle's Watch.
I have decided to assist Oron. I will journey to Crosswych and see if I can find any trace of Gargast or his allies.
I have heard very little of the spirits haunting Camlorn, and the Abelard in the temple in town cannot help. I should ask the townspeople if I want more information.
I've gathered a smattering of opinions about the Hands of Northmoor from the populace of Camlorn. I should return to Baron Winoc with what I've found.

The blacksmith in Camlorn will be able to help, but will need some protection getting his supplies to the lumberjack camp. He's asked me to inform Lord Jes at the Hands of Northmoor holdings that an escort would be greatly appreciated.
I've been asked to deliver an order for the blacksmith in Camlorn to fill.
I must show this missive to a guard to gain audience in Camlorn's court.
I've found Oron and I can help get to the bottom of the murder.
There are several large bags of salt on the Biren farm, with a distinct leading towards the Circe farm. I would seem someone in the Magis Order is behind salting Tarrant's land.  I should inform him.
I should speak with Aquil Gervine. If he's behind Tarrant's failing crops, he must be stopped.

Aquil is aware that Tarrant suspects him, and he seems hurt by the accusation. He thinks Tarrant's troubles come from the Biren farm to the south of him. It was abandoned after one too many poor harvests, but he swears people live there still.
I've stumbled upon a small contingent of Magis Order members living the in the abandoned Biren farm. They deny knowledge of any farmland sabotage, but I should investigate the area just in case.
I must question Vincintian about the Shrouded Throne.
Oron wishes me to help him by journeying to Crosswych to investigate rumors of the Shrouded Throne and whatever ties Gargast had to the area.
I have decided to assist Oron. I will journey to Crosswich to look into any allies Gargast may have had there.
The Bagot family is safe. I should see if Aurore needs any further assistance.

Baron Winoc asked me to ask people around Camlorn about the Hands of Northmoor, pretending to be an uninformed visitor. He hopes I will be able to gain honest opinions about the Hands that he could not gain himself, due to his position at their head.
I am headed to the south of Grayborne in search of the courier.
From the marks on his body it appears the Spriggans did slay the courier.  I must inform Inquisitor Roche of the courier's fate.
I should talk to Inquisitor Roche again.
The courier is dead.  I should examine his body to determine how he was slain.

I was surprised to find myself in a world similar to the one I stand in now, but filled with that of lost and damned souls. A small whisper told me to defeat those who stood against me and now I stand back in the world of the living.
Natasha Bladespire, located in the Bloody Eye grounds, holds more information regarding what this "Veil" is and what the Coldun army would want with it. I should speak to her at once.

I've discovered that the source of the spirit realm lies inside the dark statues erected about the town, channeling the power of the Dreadlord. \n\nI will only have a limited time to destroy the statues; otherwise I will be damned in the spirit realm
I have been charged by Warden Caldrun to hunt down and destroy Gargast.  The beast must be put down.
With the beast slain, I wonder where Gargast was headed...  What is this Shrouded Throne?
Brennoc asked me to speak to Roche about some trouble in Grayborne.
I have been charged by Warden Caldrun to hunt down and destroy Gargast.  The beast must be put down.\n\nI must reach the bridge just north of Aldcroft.

I've obtained both the Chalice of Gwedrun from Inquisitor Danain and the Soulstone of Brall from Jes of Wayrest. I should return them to High Priest Canning in Camlorn's temple so he can summon Ranser's spirit and reveal the murderer.

High Priest Canning needs two relics to summon Ranser's spirit, the Chalice of Gwedrun and the Soulstone of Brall. Once I acquire both relics and return those relics to him, we can complete a ceremony to summon Ranser's spirit.
High Priest Canning is going to attempt to raise Ranser's spirit using the power of the artifacts I've gathered. I must ensure he is not interrupted.
When High Priest Canning attempted to summon Ranser's spirit, a hooded figure appeared and attacked. The fiend stunned Canning and disrupted the ritual. I must make sure Canning is all right.
I have given four Dark Acolytes over to the spirits of Glaes Maar. I should inform Claude.
I need to leash four Dark Acolytes with the Crystalwan and bring them to the Altar of Glaes Maar.
The Spirits of Glaes Maar are destroying the Dark Acolyte!
The Spirits of Glaes Maar are destroying the Dark Acolyte!
I need to leash three Dark Acolytes with the Crystalwan and bring them to the Altar of Glaes Maar.
The Spirits of Glaes Maar are destroying the Dark Acolyte!
I need to leash one Dark Acolyte with the Crystalwan and bring him to the Altar of Glaes Maar.
The Spirits of Glaes Maar are destroying the Dark Acolyte!
I need to leash two Dark Acolytes with the Crystalwan and bring them to the Altar of Glaes Maar.
I must locate four of the Third Squad's missing soldiers.
Captain Geves will be expecting my return.

Undead are attacking the Redoubt- I fear High Priest Canning's failed ritual unleashed an undead horde.  I must kill as many of the dead as I can, and rally the Magis Order troops by fighting beside them to repel the assault and save Camlorn.
The undead siege has diminished, and the Redoubt defenders fight with renewed vigor. I should return to Inquisitor Blarae at the Redoubt.
I must locate four of the Third Squad's missing soldiers.
I must locate four of the Third Squad's missing soldiers.
I must locate four of the Third Squad's missing soldiers.
Thetis asked that I journey to a spongy island at the center of the lake and pour his remedy into it - he believes the island will allow the remedy to seep into the lake at a safe rate.
I've slain the corrupted lake monster and started the purification of the lake as Thetis asked. I should return to Thetis and see if we must do anything else.
I should return to Ranger Lord Merin and report my culling of Silvermist Castle's undead.
The blessed chain was not enough to bind the vampire within the crypt. I will need to destroy it, now that it is free.
Cleric Sellan wants me to speak with Ranger Lord Merin, so that he can determine the Gravebinders' next course of action.
I should speak with Cleric Sellan. He will want to know of the vampire, and of its worrying report of more powerful evil here.
I must speak to Kerry Bladespire in order to find out the thing that haunts the realm of the dead, and find a way to stop it.
Return to Vestrial
You should return to Vestrial.
I am to be inspected by Glaewon the Discriminant.
Report to the Queen
Quest NPC is sad because his midget has dissapeared.
I found Quest NPC's midget.  He was eaten by a large undead wolf.  I should return to Quest Giver NPC at the start of RL_DungeonTest to tell him the good news.
Report to the Immaculate Tabernacle in the Turquoise district where the Queen awaits.
Report to the Queen
I've been tasked with finding a magical tome, somewhere in RL_DungeonTest by Discheveled NPC.
The well dressed mage told me that he would make it worth my while to give him the tome instead of the disheveled guy who origionally asked me to find it. I need to decide who to give it to...
Give the Tome to the Mage
Give the tome to Discheveled NPC
A well dressed and important looking mage suddely appeared after I picked up the Magical Tome. I should see what he has to say.
You should return to Commander Lafavre.
Find Commander Lafavre's Soldiers.
You should return to Commander Lafavre.
Collect Nightmare Dust from Spectres.
You should return to High Mage Dilborn.
The Baron is slain. I should return to Merin Brushe and leave this place.
The Baron's Guard Captain is a werewolf - this I have seen with my own eyes. I will need to report this to Merin Brushe.
I have seen the nightmares the Baron keeps in his cellar. The undead walk through his keep, welcome as if honored guests. Merin Brushe will wish to know of this monstrosity.
I told Duke Nathaniel that I killed the <<1>>. I've made my decision about Sir Hughes. I should talk to Duke Nathaniel again to hear his reaction.
Sir Hughes has fallen into a deep sleep in the infirmary beneath Firebrand Keep's Great Hall. I need to go down and speak with the healer, Odette, about Sir Hughes' condition.
I should examine <<1>>. He's unconscious in Firebrand Keep's infirmary, surrounded by a magical aura.
Inside Sir Hughes' dream, I've encountered echoes of his recent memories. One of them told me I must slay the Omen of Fear to free Sir Hughes from his paranoia. The Omen is in the throne room.
The gate guard said Count Hosni is at his manor house with <<1>>, his betrothed. I should talk to him, see if I can get close to the Dream Shard.
King Emeric gave me an invitation to Count Hosni's betrothal celebration. I should take it to a guard to gain entry to the at-Tura estate.
Azura's Winged Twilight gave me a Duskstone I can use to enter King Emeric's dream. I must return to Wayrest and check in with Abbot Durak.

With the help of some strong, determined spirits, Reezal-Jul's abomination was destroyed. Sadly, Crestshade is now a ruin as well. I should tale to the mayor one last time before she departs this world.
I should go to the throne room to speak with High King Emeric.
I have the Duskstone, so I can enter Emeric's Dream.
I must enter the palace and kill the Night Terror so I can rescue High King Emeric from this dream.
I should take a closer look at Countess Ilise's mirror.
I rescued <<1>> from her mirror. Now that her mind is clear, I should speak to her about what happened.
Now that I've entered the mirror, I should begin my search for <<1>>.
I used Handre's gem to secure the freedom of the packhorse Fadeel. Once Fadeel is set free, Handre's last wish will be fulfilled.
Queen Ayrenn can be found at her palace in Alinor.\n\nI should deliver the Coffer to her.
Queen Ayrenn can be found at her palace in Alinor.\n\nI should deliver the Coffer to her.
Queen Ayrenn can be found at her palace in Alinor.\n\nI should deliver the Coffer to her.
I've relit the signal fire in the lighthouse. I should speak with the lighthouse keeper one more time to say goodbye.
I discovered that Fort Arand has succumbed completely to the Blight, with no survivors.  The Davon's Watch Quarantine Master will want to know.
Fort Arand is to the southwest of Davon's Watch.  I should go there and find proof of what occurred there.
<<1>> asked me to find  knights in Firebrand Keep still loyal to the duke and send them to Edmund. I won't know which knights are loyal to <<1>> until I talk to them.
I've found several knights in the keep who agreed to join us in deposing Sir Croix. I'll check in with Sir Edmund now to see where we stand.
Sir Edmund asked me to enter the tower in Firebrand Keep's Great Hall and blow the horn there. The sound of the horn will signal the knights to begin the attack.
I sounded the horn in Firebrand Keep's Great Hall. Sir Edmund has begun the assault. I must leave the hall and find him.

Sir Edmund was wounded and lacks the strength to engage Sir Croix. He entrusted that task to me. Sir Croix is in the garrison on Firebrand Keep's west side. I must blow the siege horn in the garrison to stop the battle â€¦ after I kill Sir Croix.
Sir Croix has fallen, but battle still rages in Firebrand Keep. I must blow the horn in the garrison. That will signal to Sir Edmund that Sir Croix is dead, and his knights may stand down.

I've sounded the garrison horn, claiming Firebrand Keep for Sir Edmund and his knights. The battle is over, but Sir Edmund received dire wounds in the assault. I should seek him at the entrance to the Great Hall to learn his fate.
I should search the library for anything that might yield a clue about this place or my captor.
I've found a large serpent guarding what might be a Daedric artifact.  I should try to get to the artifact and destroy it.
I should explore the ruins and see what's to be found.
At the Duke of Camlorn's request, I rescued a second prisoner from the Bloodthorn cult, Gloria Fausta. I should make sure that <<1>> made it back to Aldcroft.

The Lion Guard has come to Aldcroft to take control of the investigation of the Duke's kidnapping. They may have discovered where the Duke is being held. I should talk to Lieutenant Harim, who was last seen near the lighthouse.
Lieutenant Harim said the Bloodthorns are holding Duke Sebastien in the lighthouse. I told him there's no time to wait and that I'll rescue the Duke.
I found Duke Sebastien at the top of Aldcroft's lighthouse. He's trapped inside a magical ward. He asked me to smash the crystals to set him free.
When I destroyed the crystals, the enchantment holding the Duke prisoner was broken. Now the Duke wants to speak with me.
I killed Lumpy
Sister Alarvyne sent me to collect Mountain Tail for her.  It grows to the north of Ebonheart, near the base of Mt. Threndr.
I've collected Mountain Tail, and should now return to Sister Alarvyne in the southern part of Ebonheart.
Kill the Spy
I have found a curious vault that seems to be pulsing with spiritual energy. I could open it, unleashing whatever is being held inside.
Thorkan asked me to destroy necromantic altars on the Ruined Steppe.
Normar wasn't convinced by my work on the Ruined Steppe. He's given me some allegedly necromantic fetishes to show to Thorkan.
I've destroyed the altars on the Ruined Steppe. I should let Normar know his town has been purged of necromancy.
<<1>> told me his brother took the book east into a small courtyard to read.
I spoke the correct incantation to release the apprentice from the book's enchantment. I should talk to him.
I found the apprentice! Unfortunately, I used the wrong incantation to end the ward, and the man was transformed into a chicken. I should pick up the spellbook.
I should collect the teeth of dead ogres in Shinji's Scarp.
I've collected more than enough ogre teeth for Captain Dugakh to make a necklace. I should go and speak with him.

The cavern's been collapsed and the Ironhand Ogres are no longer a threat. Perhaps now I can find out more about these plans General Godrun has made cryptic references to. I should report back to the Command Center in Shinji's Scarp.
A spirit appeared and spoke to me while I was examining Countess Ilise's mirror. I should speak to it.
<<1>> asked me to meet him in a ransacked storehouse, so we could speak in relative safety.
I've collected the items needed for Breloth's perfect burial. I should deliver them to her husband, Michel.
I should look around Wind Keep for the items <<1>> has requested for his wife's burial.
Now that I've stopped the ogre advance, I should report to General Godrun at the base of the tower.
I have collected a bunch of Wayward Branches for Alreal. I should return them to his location outside of Elden Root.
High King Emeric's dream is a nightmare vision of Wayrest, filled with chaos and destruction.  I must find the king and help him escape.

It's clear that I can't free King Emeric until the Night Terror has released its hold. Emeric suggested that the Night Terror was in the castle, but apparently I need to face the Night Terror's minions to get the keys to the castle. There are three.
I collected three keys. Now I can now enter the palace and face the Night Terror.
I found Arcady. Though the dreugh buried him in mud like the others, he's still alive. I should make sure he's all right.
I should search the Shadowsilk Goblin camp for bottles of Balmora Blue.
Now that I've collected enough bottles of Balmora Blue Wine, I should return them to <<1>>.
Adiel begged me to search for her husband in the nearby dreugh spawning pools, where they took those citizens they captured.
I discovered Baron Sorick had his men bring eggs into Dreughside so the dreugh would slaughter the residents. I agreed to take a bribe to keep this secret. Baron Sorick has some coin for me.

The evidence clearly implicates Baron Sorick. I'll find Sorick on the top floor of Arbogasque's house. If Baron Sorick ordered the eggs brought into the slums, he's responsible for the deaths of all the citizens the dreugh killed.
Sorick admitted he ordered the eggs delivered to the slums. He hates the lower-class citizens with a passion. I could turn him in, but he's offered me money to keep his secret. I'll consider it.
When Baron Sorick fled, the peasants downstairs caught him. He's at their mercy. I should speak to Constable Charlic about this.
Master Altien and the abbot are somewhere in the Cave of Dreams. I must find them.
I've used Durak's scroll to summon a storm atronach and save the Spirit Wardens' field. Altien and Durak should be safely back at Pariah Abbey by now. I should tell Altien.
I found Altien guarding Durak's unconscious body. Altien asked me to take a Scroll of Summoning to the surface and read it near the largest fire. Meanwhile, Altien will get Durak to safety.
Sister Safia asked me to put out any fires I see in the fields near Pariah Abbey. She warned me to stay away from the largest fire.
I've put out fires all around Pariah Abbey. Sister Safia's waiting for me on the northwestern edge of the fields.

I've been asked to speak with the monastery's healer, Frizwyr. I should help him rouse the abbot of the Spirit Wardens from his endless sleep. Only their leader, Abbot Durak, knows how to retrieve the Dream Shard.

Frizwyr told me Durak is locked in a dream from which he cannot awaken. None of the Spirit Wardens can dream, so they cannot rescue him, but I can. Frizwyr gave me a Dreamstride Potion. Drinking it will place me in Durak's nightmare.
I've entered Durak's dream. If I can find him, I can ask what I must do to set him free.
I've recovered the key to Durak's prison. I should return to Durak inside Pariah Abbey.
When Durak awakened from his dream, I awoke as well. Durak asked me to speak to him when we were both awake. He wants to tell me more about what happened.
The nightmare that imprisoned Durak has ended. When I speak to Durak again, I'll awaken him from his dream.
I need to use the glow dust and azurite to cleanse Azura's shrine.
<<1>> wants me to burn their territory markers at the north tower, south tower, and east gate.
I've burned the Goblins' territory markers. I should look for <<1>>.
I've returned with Valoria and Vestriel
I should report to Captain Ernard.
I must retrieve the Stonechewers' tribal totem, and take it back to Commander Kurt.
Falice asked me to use her poultices on other injured Spirit Wardens. They're probably still in Pariah Abbey's fields.
I've used up all the poultices Falice gave me. I should return to her and see if she still needs my help.

Durak is trapped in a dream. Within it, betrayers lurk in the abbey. Durak needs a key to unlock his chains. One of the dream outlaws in Pariah Abbey carries it. If I kill enough of them, I'll eventually find the key.
According to the letter, Mashana was in Wind Keep. I should head there to see if she is still in the village.
Durak asked me to personally return the Dream Shard to the Statue of Azura.
I've returned the Dream Shard to the chapel at Pariah Abbey. Durak is inside the chapel. I should speak to him about our ongoing battle against Vaermina.
I burned the slavers' tents, freed the captured sailors, and rescued Elvira from the slavers' leader. I should speak to Elvira to say goodbye.
Now that I've got the burning the log, I can set fire to the slavers' tents and burn the stolen goods at the very end of the dock.
The first mate suggested I create a diversion before releasing the captive sailors. I should pull a burning log from one of the slavers' campfires and use it to set their tents on fire.
I must first speak to High King Emeric at the palace in Wayrest.
I need to meet Grandmaster Durak at Shinji's Scarp. I have no definite signs of the Omen at work in Gavaudon, but I heard that General Godrun has been acting suspicious.
Now that I've broken the enchantment holding Ingride Vanne, I should talk to her to make sure she's all right.
Now that I've released Perry from his bonds, we're going to find a safer place so he can further explain the situation.
I will need to collect several items to break the spell on Ingride Vanne: a pristine Scamp heart, a Dremora's heart, and a ritual candle.
I should search the bandits' tents for tabards and bring them back to Sir Graham.
I've retrieved several Knight of the Flame tabards. Sir Graham will be eager to have these back.
The Daedra is dead. I can go to the altar and release <<1>> from her bonds.
Now that <<1>> is safe, I can tell <<2>> that the Daedric danger is past.
I've somehow entered into Sir Hughes's dream. The dream-world appears to mirror Alcaire Castle, where the murder of Duchess Lakana took place.
In this dream-reality, Sir Hughes left his bloodstained sword in the library after the murder. The Omen may be within the sword. I'll search the library in the castle's lowest level.
NEVER SEE
The Supernal Dreamers are holding Ingride Vanne at Stonebridge Mill. I'll need to find her and use the ritual items to break the spell they've placed on her.
I've slain the Omen of Fear. I should find Sir Hughes so we can leave the dream.
Perhaps talking to Sir Hughes will allow me to awaken from his dream.
When I talk to Sir Hughes, I'll awaken from his dream.
I'll talk to <<1>> about the events in Sir Hughes' dream.
I told Duke Nathaniel that I killed the <<1>>. I've made my decision about Sir Hughes. I should talk to Duke Nathaniel again to hear his reaction.
Duke Nathaniel asked me to seek out Muran at Pariah Abbey and ask what he may know of this Daedra known as the "Omen of Fear."
Find the Daedric artifact, summon the Dremora, and kill it.
Now that the Dremora boss is dead, the miners' deaths are avenged. I should talk to Brek.
A freed citizen told me he saw dreugh dragging Arcady to the spawning pools "near the statue of King Joile." I may find Arcady there, if he's still alive.
I should look around Davon's Watch for an apprentice named Denthis. I've been told I could ask his brother, <<1>>, for more information. He's at a tavern southeast of the library.
I've found the unfortunate apprentice. He's tripped the ward on the spellbook. To break the spell, I should chant one of two incantations: "Arkay's Beard" or "Eyes of Akatosh."
I've found the unfortunate apprentice. He's tripped the ward on the spellbook. To break the spell, I should chant "Arkay's Beard."
I've collected the spellbook. I should return to the wizard and tell him what happened to his apprentice.
I've returned the spellbook to the wizard. I told him his apprentice turned into a chicken. I should speak to him again.
The Wolfman pesteing Mage has had its but kicked.
You have clicked the box like a good little player.
The beggar gave me a cryptic message to tell Yarah, and also told me where I could find her again. I should let her know her allies are armed.
I've collected enough Scamp heads to stop those Oblivion portals from opening. Now to throw the heads into the portals.
I closed the portals. I hope Gerard has found Muzgu. I should look for them both in a cave on the northern edge of Moonlit Maw.

I returned dreugh eggs to their nests and killed the creatures encroaching on Dreughside. That should discourage them from attacking again. Sergeant Stegine is still at his post. I should tell him about this.
I collected dreugh eggs. Now I should take the eggs to the nests in the spawning pools.

King Fahara'jad says the undead attack at the docks was the work of the Withered Hand, a group of dangerous and vengeful necromancers. He's asked me to consult with his trusted advisor, General Thoda, about how to proceed.

The undead attack at the docks was the work of the Withered Hand, a group of dangerous necromancers. Prince Azah may have clues as to what the Hand's next move will be. The Prince is not here though. I should talk to Ilmaha.

The undead attack at the docks was the work of the Withered Hand, a group of dangerous necromancers. They kidnapped Prince Azah as well, and apparently took down into an old shipping tunnel. I should investigate.
The undead attack at the docks was the work of the Withered Hand, a group of dangerous necromancers. They kidnapped Prince Azah as well, but I have found him. I should free the prince immediately.
The undead attack at the docks was the work of the Withered Hand, a group of dangerous necromancers. General Thoda says Prince Azah said he had heard rumors about them. I should look for the prince.
I should enter the palace and warn the king about the Withered Hand's plans.
King Faraha'jad is taking guards to the Impervious Vault, but he doesn't know how to get in. He's asked me to speak with Gabrielle at the Mages Guild to ask for assistance.
Gabrielle at the Mages Guild agreed to help us open the vault. She has asked me to collect reagents to help her break through the seal. She requires <<1>> and <<2>>.
I collected the reagents <<1>> needs to break the seals on the Impervious Vault. Then we can go inside and see if the Withered Hand managed to tunnel in.
I defeated the Withered Hand in the vault, but it seems some of them escaped with the Ansei Wards. I should inform the king.
I promised the monkey that I'd talk to Unishi in Sentinel's tavern and ask her to change him back.
Unishi has agreed to change the monkey back into an Orc, but only after I do her a favor. I must deliver two more potions for her and then return.
Unishi gave me a potion to reverse the spell and change the monkey back into an Orc. I should take this to the monkey.
I ignited the sacred braziers at the south, east, and north points of the temple. I should meet the Throne Keeper at the West Brazier.
I should visit the grave of <<1>>.
I should visit the grave of <<1>>.
I have killed the three ancient heroes that had been raised. I should return to Ramati and let him know the deed is done.
I should choose an Ash'abah healer or a warrior to assist me.
I must light the final brazier and then Throne Keeper Farvad will open the door into Tu'whacca's Sanctum where he believes I can find Uwafa.
I should wait for Throne Keeper Farvad to open the door into Tu'whacca's Sanctum where he believes I can find Uwafa.
I should enter Tu'whacca's Sanctum, kill Uwafa, and then recover the Ansei Wards.

I've slain Uwafa and recovered one of the Ansei Wards. The spirit of Ansei Radan appeared and thanked me, but reminded me that I need to find the other Wards. I should return to Throne Keeper Farvad outside Tu'whacca's Sanctum.
I should seek out the scholar Zohreh. She may have some ideas about how to find the other Ansei Wards.
Prince Azah and his soldiers are barricade in the eastern warehouse. Talia suggested that he might know more about what the Withered Hand is planning.

By reforging the blade of the Ansei Ward, I restored Ansei Maja's power and he was able to defeat the dark spirit Alasan had become. I have given the restored Ansei Ward to Prince Azah for safekeeping. I should speak with the Prince once again.
I shattered the Ward and disrupted Alasan's ritual. Ansei Maja has appeared. I should speak with her.
I should seek out Priestess Sermenh once I reach HoonDing's Watch.
The suspect in the disappearances, Bailiff Fakimal appears to have been murdered himself. I should search his house for clues.

Justice Istah has asked me to listen to rumors around town for clues. In particular, he wants me to visit the Crown and Forebear fellowship halls, A'tor's Oasis and Ra Gada's Respite. He's given me disguises so I can enter these places.
The rumors I've heard suggest that Bailiff Fakimal may be responsible for the disappearances. I should investigate Bailiff Fakimal's house.
The caravan guard gave me an antidote to treat anyone I find who was poisoned by the snakes.
I've cured the poison victims I found in the oasis. I should return to Letta to the west of the oasis.

In Bailiff Fakimal's house, I found a note that proves he killed the people who disappeared. The note also suggests he was killing people under orders from a superior. I should return to Justice Istah.
It seems the Magistrate is locking Justice Istah in the stocks. I should watch and see what happens.
I collected the Nedic essence I needed. I can now encounter and slay Warchief Haakon as well.
I collected the Goblin ghost essences. I can now face the Goblin's chief.
I collected essence from the Orcish ghosts. I may now face General Theshaga.
I collected the essence of Breton ghosts. I should go to the fourth tier and face the representation of King Joile.
I fought the ghosts of HoonDing's Watch and learned the lessons of the past. I must ascend to the top of the monument and speak to Farvad.
Nahirah's journal indicates that Shiri is actually daughter of Suturah and sister to Uwafa and Alasan. The scholar Zohreh has just arrived. I should tell her what I learned.
I collapsed the tunnel the Imperials were using to enter Satakalaam, and it appears the king's army has retaken the city. I should speak with General Thoda.
It appears that many of the Ash'abah warriors have fallen ill, including Marimah himself. I should speak with Mazra at the chief's tent.

I shattered the Ward and disrupted Alasan's ritual. To stop the necromancer, I must restore the Ansei Ward by gathering goat's milk to honor Morwha, earth from the grave of a warrior to honor Zeht, and the Desert Wind to honor Tava.
Frodibert's Will posed the riddle: "After day turns to night, you must follow the light." Hmm. What stays lit up at night in the streets of Wayrest?
I discovered an arrow carved into a nearby street lamp indicating a specific direction. I should look for more street lamp arrows and see where they lead.
I found a marker with an arrow pointing down to the ground below the street lamp. I should search around the base of the post for a clue.
I've decided to keep the money. I should take it from the chest now.

At the end of the street lamp trail, I found a key with a note attached, offering this clue:\n\n"You found the key in streets, but now you must search the sky. No time for sleep or drink, go straight to the top of the clouds."
A monk asked me to rush to Pariah Abbey on the hill behind him, saying I should talk to Sister Safia. Maybe I can help her and the rest of these monks.
I delivered the cure. I should speak to Miranda.
Now that I've collected the jewels and puffball caps, I should meet Serge Arcole at the boathouse in Farangel's Landing.
I should pour the sleeping potion into drinking kegs around Farangel's Landing.

Miranda's steward Elbert told me about a supply of dried vervain we can use as an antidote to the poison. A crate of the substance is on the beach east of Farangel's Landing. I should get there before it's too late!
Now that I've found Miranda, I should give her the antidote.
<<1>> asked me to look for survivors at the western gates of Cumberland's Watch.

Watch Captain Ernard asked me to return the Stonechewer tribal totem to the Stonechewer Goblins. He suggested I might want to speak with a scholar named Nellic Sterone before I enter the Stonechewer camp.
Serge Arcole wants me to search the houses around Farangel's Landing for some valuable jewels. I should also collect puffball caps from a crate on the nearby docks.
Now that I've added the sleeping potion to the kegs, I should search for clues to Miranda's location in the counting house. It's just back of the boathouse.
I should find Miranda before it's too late.
I've slain the Daedric spirit. I should step back through the portal and speak with Gerard.
The Daedric spirit has been vanquished. Its threat has ended. \n\nI should speak with Muzgu and see what else must be done.
I decided to honor Muzgu's request and bring him poison. Then he can end his life and banish the Daedric spirit possessing him. The poison is on the altar.

Muzgu asked me to kill him. He thinks that's the only way to prevent the Daedric spirit from being unleashed. Maybe there's a way to save him, but the longer we delay, the greater the risk of the spirit taking over.
A panicked Wayrest guard told me Sergeant Stegine is in Dreughside, defending the citizens against attacking dreugh.
When I threatened to turn Baron Sorick in, he fled. I may catch up to him downstairs.
When I threatened to kill Lord Sorick, he relented. He agreed to have his men remove the dreugh eggs from the slums. The attacks will end. I should make sure he leaves the slums forever.
I collected enough dried vervain to serve as an antidote. I should head to the manor house and find Miranda before it's too late.
An injured monk sent me into Moonlit Maw to help Master Muzgu and Brother Gerard, who've been ambushed by cultists called Supernal Dreamers.
I decided to find a cultist who could be sacrificed instead of Muzgu. I need to find a sleeping cultist and use the Scroll of Dream Trapping to trap the cultist and bind him to my will.
I've collected a vial of poison for Muzgu. He can use it to end his life and prevent the Daedric spirit from possessing him. I should bring him the poison.
Muzgu sacrificed himself. The Daedric spirit is now vulnerable. I should enter the portal to the Daedric realm of Quagmire and kill it.
The scroll bound a cultist in dreams. He's under my control. Now I can lead him back to Muzgu to be sacrificed in the cave north of Moonlit Maw.
The cultist has been slain. The Daedric spirit is now vulnerable. I can enter the portal and kill it.
The cultist is now trapped in the ritual circle. Muzgu can tell me what to do next.
Louis claims he has no money, but an Orc named Ugurz owes Louis enough money to pay his debt to S'rashi. Ugurz associates with a gang of Orcs on Wayrest's southern docks.

Padier claims all his money is tied up in investments. However, he told me his grandfather was buried with some precious stones near the city's temple. If I dig up the grave and retrieve a stone, I can repay the debt to S'rashi.
I should look for the second debtor now, the nobleman, Padier Nytte. S'rashi told me that Padier claimed to be broke, but that he comes from old money and S'rashi doesn't believe him.
Captain Marck simply doesn't have the money. I'm going to have to persuade S'rashi to forgive the debt, pay it off myself, or kill the assassin Ramziq to settle a blood debt for S'rashi.
I've collected payment from two men who owe S'rashi money, and we worked out the money that Captain Marck owed. I should talk to S'rashi and get the share he offered me.
S'rashi asked me to help collect debts from people in Wayrest who owe him money. The first man, Louis Ervine, is in Wayrest's Market Square.
Ugurz said that if I can retrieve Louis' debt from his lockbox, I'm free to take it. This is probably a trap. When I open the lockbox, I should expect an ambush.
I've collected on debts from two men who owe S'rashi money. I should seek out the third debtor now, Captain Albert Marck at the Wayrest Docks.
Stegine is one of the few Wayrest guards defending citizens against dreugh. He wants me to help stop the fighting by collecting dreugh eggs and taking them to spawning pools outside the city.
Gerard fears the cultists will murder Muzgu. I've volunteered to close the portals while Gerard rescues him. To close the portals, I'm to kill Scamps, then throw their heads through the spell-doors.

We're ready to sacrifice the cultist. I can activate the Daedric ritual circle to draw the Daedric spirit out of Muzgu and into the cultist. Doing this will kill the cultist and send the spirit back through the gate to Quagmire.
Ondre the Grinder is dead and hopefully that means the end of the Backstreet Gang. I should return to Guard Captain Etienne to tell him the news.
I should check with the Captain of the Guard inside the palace to return the stolen items and ask about the thugs I encountered in the city streets.

Captain Etienne asked for my help shutting the gang down. He got a tip that the gangmembers contact their leader, Ondre the Grinder, by knocking on a drum down by the docks. I said I'd find him and kill him.
I can use the gang's signal drum and their secret signal to trick Ondre the Grinder into showing himself.
S'rashi's brother asked me to find him upstairs in the Cloudy Dregs Inn and find out how I can help.
I brought Phinis Vanne's sister to him, but she just kept going. She wants to get the safety of the castle. I should talk to Phinis again.
I've convinced Phinis' sister to follow me. I should escort her back to her brother, who said he would be inside a barn on the eastern edge of the farm.
Count Hosni wants me to find his father and ask him about a signet ring. His father is in the guest house across from the manor.
<<1>> is concerned for his wife, Sirali. He wants me to find her and ensure both she and the signet ring are safe. She's being held in the summer house behind the estate.
I found <<1>>, Rihad's wife. She thinks Hosni is being manipulated. I should speak to her and find out more.
I need to head south toward the shore. Then I can search a Supernal Dreamer camp for evidence that proves <<1>> is behind the Supernal Dreamers and Hosni at-Tura's manipulation.
I found a stack of letters from <<1>> to the Supernal Dreamers. I should return to <<2>> and give her the evidence.
I left Hosni's dream. I should speak with him about what happened here.
I should look for <<1>> to find out what he can tell me about Count Hosni's sleeping potions.
Destane the Bard says I should look for Count Hosni's sleeping potions in his mansion.
I entered Hosni's dream. I should find the <<1>> and destroy it. It's probably within the at-Tura Estate.
I destroyed the Omen of Blood. I must enter the portal in Hosni at-Tura's manse.
Now that the slavers are distracted, I can slip into the leader's house and steal the key to release the sailors.
Before we can relight the signal fire, I'll need to replace the focusing crystals in each of the four fixtures at the top of the lighthouse.
A gate guard granted me access to the estate. I should go inside and find <<1>>.
Count Hosni told me Abbot Durak is awaiting me at Pariah Abbey. I need to tell him the Dream Shard is safe.
I should search the area for the stolen relics first.
To stop the cultists from opening a portal to Quagmire, I'll need to recover a key to close the conjuration boxes.
I've recovered a key, so now I must close the conjuration boxes located in the northern and southern towers, near the Weeping Giant.
A spirit appeared inside the tower after I destroyed the conjuration box. I should speak with it.
I closed the portal the Supernal Dreamers had opened and slew the Daedra they had summoned. I should rejoin Brother Perry at Tabakah's camp south of the Weeping Giant.

According to the ancient spirit, the cultists summoned a Daedra. The Daedra is currently hidden with magic, but I can reveal it with this scroll of sight. I'll go to the base of the waterfall, use the scroll to reveal the Daedra, and kill it.
The reflective spirit is holding Countess Ilise's true self within the mirror. I must enter the mirror and find her.
I found <<1>>. I just need to guide her back to the mirror, so we can go back to the other side.
I should search the top of Nightmare Crag for the Supernal Dreamers' ritual scroll.
Now that I know how to summon the Daedra, I can light the braziers, just as the scroll instructs, and open a portal to Oblivion.
The portal is active. I should go to the portal and summon the Daedra. Once the Daedra appears, I need to kill it and end the threat it presents.
After I cleansed Azura's shrine, a Winged Twilight appeared. I should listen to what she has to say.

Now that the items have all been placed on an altar, I should perform the ritual. Perry was very specific: first, use the Dremora heart, then light the candle, and finally, use the pristine Scamp heart.
High King Emeric stands before the guillotine, surrounded by rioting citizens. If I speak to him, perhaps I can wake him from this dream.
I defeated the Night Terror. Once again, it appears as though I am forced to enter Vaermina's realm of Quagmire.
I should speak with Marlene in one of the houses at the Vanne Farm.
Marlene doesn't believe that I can actually protect her. She asked me to show her proof. The head of a Dremora should do.
Now that I have a Dremora head, I should return to Marlene and convince her to follow me.
I've convinced Phinis' sister to follow me. I should escort her back to her brother, who said he was inside a barn on the eastern edge of the farm.
I recovered Knarstygg's gear. I should give it to him.
I need to recover Knarstygg's armor, his axe, and his helm from the caches where he buried them near the levee.
I should seek out <<1>> in her home and see if I can help with whatever is affecting her.
I must find and recover the three pieces of the sword.
I should take the three fragments of the sword to the king's crypt in Aphren's Tomb.
A shade of King Aphren appeared. Perhaps he knows what I need to do to reforge the sword.
Princess Mira understood the significance of receiving her father's sword. She came to speak with him for the first time in centuries. I should speak with the king's spirit now to say goodbye.
<<1>> gave me the names of the two suitors she suspects. She says I should start with <<2>> .
<<1>> claims he didn't give her the mirror. He said I should speak to <<2>> or <<3>> instead.
<<1>> told me that the gentleman who dropped off the mirror went by the name 'Sirion'. He's somewhere north of town. I need to go after him.
I spoke to <<1>> and <<2>>. There are two other persons of interest, <<3>> and <<4>>.
I spoke to <<1>> and <<2>>. There are two other persons of interest, <<3>> and <<4>>.
I should speak to <<1>>. She might be somewhere near the countess's manse.
I need to find Janne's three companions, <<1>>, <<2>>, and <<3>>.
Instead of Sirion, I found Elin held captive. She told me the Supernal Dreamers plan to attack the countess at Mathias's funeral. I need to warn the countess.
I protected the countess from the Supernal Dreamers' ambush. I'm now to meet her back at the manse.
I should report to <<1>> in Shinji's Scarp. He's at a house on the south end of the battlefield.

I'll need to find all four focusing crystals and some combustion oil before we can relight the signal fire. The crystals are likely scattered among the slavers on the island, but the oil is on their ship.
I must enter the ruins and rescue captured local folk.
I've rescued Breton locals from necromancers before they could be sacrificed. I should report back to that Priestess of Stendarr, Pietine.

King Aphren repaired the sword. He wants me to give it to Princess Mira to make amends. Her crypt is down the corridor from his. Of course, the mage, Blaise Pamarc, also expects me to bring the sword to him. Apparently, the choice is mine.
I need to gather all the cursed skulls I can find.
Now that I have all the cursed skulls, I must destroy them at the charnel heap in the tower. Destruction will end their suffering.
A spirit appeared after I destroyed the skulls. I should speak to it.
According to information I found in the library, the messages to Alik'r were written by <<1>> herself. I should speak to Sir Hughes at once.
To defuse the situation at the castle gates, I'll need to speak with Sir Hughes, the head of the Knights of the Flame.

Sir Hughes believes King Fahara'jad has a spy inside Alcaire Castle. Secret correspondences have been intercepted, signed with the alias "Almandine." Hughes has asked me to search the castle library for clues to the person's true identity.
I managed to gain access to the castle library. Now I need to search through the books for clues to identify "Almandine," the person sending messages to King Fahara'jad.
I need to collect the various remains of Gathan's body from the mine cavern where he died.
Gathan's ghost is now free, and has come to the shrine where his bones are buried. I should speak with the ghost now.
I need to bury Gathan's remains at a small shrine located inside the entrance to <<1>>.
I need to board the ship at the Koeglin Village docks. <<1>> says the ship is part of the slavers' plan of attack. I should see what the captain has to say about it.
The captain claims his ledger will prove his legitimacy. Unfortunately, it's belowdecks where they have trapped the slavers. I'll just have to fight my way through to find it.

<<1>> took the evidence I found in the constable's house and set matters straight around town. The crew of Tava's Bounty was able to come ashore and get aid, and Dame Dabienne was set free. I should speak to Dabienne.
I should look for Lucas Oscent on the beach south of Koeglin Village. The boy's mother said he often went fishing down there.
I should speak to <<1>> and make sure her son arrived home safely.

Each time I reclaimed a piece of King Aphren's sword, Princess Mira's spirit appeared and cursed her father for abandoning her. I must carry the pieces of the sword into Aphren's Tomb. The entrance is at the western end of Aphren's Hold.
Ganise asked me to search the northern barn for any sign of her father.
A ritual was performed here recently. I should read the tattered book inside the barn and try to determine the ritual's purpose.
I found the key to the Nurin house. I need to go in and help Ganise.
The farmhand suggested I speak to Mrs. Nurin to see if there's any way I can help.
William and Ganise are back at the farm. I should go speak with them.
I need to speak with Murk-Watcher about leaving.
I should seek out Knarstygg and ask how he feels about leaving.

My entrance into the libray is blocked by an extremely stubborn knight named Sir Gregory. Sir Gregory might be persuaded to leave his post if I can arouse the jealousy he feels over his flirtatious wife, Vendi. She's usually in the market.
Sir Gregory's wife Vendi is being escorted home by another Knight named Sir Higgens. If I tell Sir Gregory, he might be convinced to abandon his post.
Ganise has apparently been tied up in her house and the door's been locked. She thinks one of the Scamps might have eaten the key. Pretty gruesome, but I'll need to kill Scamps until I find it.
I should speak with the duchess. She's in her room on the top floor of the castle.
The duchess asked me to speak with Thoda, the commander of the Redguards outside Alcaire Castle. To get his attention, she suggested I fight some of his soldiers to prove my mettle.
One of the knights I first met, <<1>>, is apparently behind an attempt on Duchess Lakana's life. I should inform her at once.
I found the ledger from the ship, Tava's Bounty. I can return to <<1>> and give it to him as proof of the captain's claims. Perhaps now he'll listen to reason.
I should tell <<1>> about Dame Falhut's betrayal.
<<1>> asked me to go and apprehend <<2>> on a charge of treason. I'll find her residence north of the inn.
Dame Falhut is dead. Sir Hughes said that he would send Knights of the Flame to support me. I should look for them outside Dame Falhut's home and report what's happened.
Sir Hughes asked to speak to me privately at his house north of the market.
Sir Hughes isn't coming. He sent me here to get me out of the way.\n\nI must reach <<1>> before it's too late!
Sir Hughes seems to have gone mad. He murdered Duchess Lakana because of his nightmares. I should speak with Duke Nathaniel.
Now that I have Sir Edain's blade, I must use it on each spectral opponent before I destroy it, so I can trap their spirits. I should bind the souls of Arie, Gilbert, and Emory of The Three.
I've cast the sword into the fissure and destroyed the souls of The Three. I must seek out Sir Edain's spirit.

I encountered the spirit of Sir Edain, once a Knight of the Flame. He begged me to lay to rest several angry ghosts of the brigands of Windridge Cave. I can bind them in his enchanted blade and then cast it into a fissure deep inside the caves.
I've bound the souls of The Three. Now I must cast Sir Edain's sword into the fissure deep inside Windridge Caves.
The duke believes Hughes returned to Firebrand Keep, southeast of Alcaire Castle. I should go there and ask the Knights of the Flame if they've seen him.
Rosalie asked me to tell her daughter, Ganise, to meet her at their house. Ganise is looking through the rubble in the westernmost house at Nurin Farms.
There are four portals that need to be destroyed.
I destroyed the four Daedric Portals. I should return to William Nurin.
I need to speak to Constable Pascal down by the docks. Hopefully, he can be reasonable.
The messenger who can exonerate Dame Dabienne was apparently captured by the slavers. He was either killed or they've taken him into the warehouse where they've barricaded themselves in.
I should return to <<1>> on the west side of the docks. Now that he's spoken with <<2>>, he should realize that <<3>> isn't in league with the slavers.
A Knight of the Flame told me to speak to <<1>> if I have further questions about the standoff at the castle gates. She's on their southern road.
I've encountered a spirit at the entrance to the Windridge Caves. I should speak with the spirit and find out why he is not at rest.
The book I found in the barn describes an initiation ritual for Supernal Dreamers. Ganise will want to know about this. She's in her house on the eastern side of Nurin Farms.
It must be recaptured and returned to its rightful resting place in the Temple of Ghartok.
The Elder Scroll of Ghartok has been recaptured. I should talk to Grand Warlord Zimmeron.
It must be recaptured and returned to its rightful place in the Temple of Chim.
The Elder Scroll of Chim has been returned. I should talk to Grand Warlord Zimmeron.
I should help take it from our foes and deliver it to the safety of a Pact keep.
We have captured the <<1>>. I should return to Grand Warlord Zimmeron.
I agreed to assist in its capture and delivery into safekeeping at a Pact keep.
Now that the <<1>> is in Pact hands, I should talk to Grand Warlord Zimmeron.
I have agreed to help capture the scroll and bring it to a Pact keep.
We have captured the <<1>>. I should talk to Grand Warlord Zimmeron now.
I agreed to help with this mission.
The Pact has captured the <<1>>. It's time for me to talk to Grand Warlord Zimmeron.
It must be recaptured and returned to its resting place in the temple.
With the Elder Scroll of Ni-Mohk ours once again, I should return to Grand Warlord Dortene.
The Scroll must be returned to its Temple.
The Elder Scroll of Alma Ruma has been recaptured. I should return to Grand Warlord Dortene.
I should join my comrades in this dangerous mission.
We captured the <<1>>. I should return to Grand Warlord Dortene.
I agreed to undertake the mission.
The <<1>> has been delivered into Covenant hands. I should return to Grand Warlord Dortene.
Grand Warlord Dortene asked me to join my comrades on this quest.
Now that the <<1>> has been delivered into Covenant hands, I should speak with Grand Warlord Dortene.
Grand Warlord Dortene wants me to join this effort.
The Covenant is victorious. We have captured the <<1>>. \n\nI should return to Grand Warlord Dortene.
I promised Grand Warlord Sorcalin I would see it returned to the Temple of Altadoon.
The Elder Scroll of Altadoon has been recaptured. I should return to Grand Warlord Sorcalin.
I promised Grand Warlord Sorcalin I would see it returned to the Temple of Mnem.
The Elder Scroll of Mnem has been recaptured. I should return to Grand Warlord Sorcalin.
I accepted the challenge and now must help capture this Elder Scroll.
We have captured the <<1>>. \n\nI should return to Grand Warlord Sorcalin.
I have agreed to take part in the raid.
Dominion forces captured the <<1>>. \n\nI should return to Grand Warlord Sorcalin for my reward.
I agree to undertake this mission.
Dominion soldiers wrested the <<1>> from the enemy's hands.\n\nI should return to Grand Warlord Sorcalin.
I have accepted this challenge and should assist in the Elder Scroll's capture.
Victory! The <<1>> is at last in Dominion hands.\n\nI should return to Grand Warlord Sorcalin to claim my reward.
I should travel there as soon as I can.
I scouted Fort Warden and should now return to the mission board.
I should travel there as soon as I can.

Now that I've reached Farragut Keep, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Blue Road Keep, I need to take notes on what I see.
<<1>> has given a grand speech thanking me for returning the Ansei Wards. I should speak to the king and see if anything remains to be done.
Now that I've reached Drakelowe Keep, I need to take notes on what I see.
A dog approached me on the streets of Daggerfall. It seems agitated and wants me to follow it.

They plan to assassinate King Casimir! The masterminds behind it are referred to as Verrik and Angof. Verrik is hiding in the harbor, preparing to strike. I must get this information to Captain Aresin immediately.
The note appears to be a shopping list. I should speak to people who might sell the items on the list and see if anyone knows the dead man.

The shopping list is some kind of code. "Three blood oranges" means someone is going to die, "black roses" means dark nature magic is involved, and the crescent emblem signifies the royal family of Casimir. I should tell Captain Aresin about this.

Captain Aresin told me that the coded note says that someone related to dark nature magic plans to assassinate a member of the royal family. While he works to protect the royal family, he asked me to talk to Grenna at the Rosy Lion Inn.
Leveque called for help. After I deal with this, I should talk to Leveque and see if he's ready to cooperate.
Properly persuaded, Leveque was very helpful. He told me that Martine Lerineaux hired him to make a map of the secret tunnels beneath the city. I should tell Grenna about this.
I need to get into Martine Lerineaux's manor house and see what he's up to.
I need to find evidence pertaining to the assassination plot and the person behind it.

Captain Farlivere's plan is simple. I need to acquire some wolf's woe to mask the hostages' scent from the Red Rooks' guard wolves. I also need to find the key to the locked house where the hostages are held. Both should be somewhere in the camp.
I acquired a number of wolf's woe plants. They should allow the hostages to avoid the guard wolves and sneak out of the camp to escape. I also found a key I can use to free them.
Grenna, an agent of the crown who's disguised as a commoner, asked me to go to the inn's second level and confront a suspicious character she's been watching. He goes by the name of Leveque.

I need to disarm the traps to clear a path for the hostages. I should also create a diversion. Burning the Red Rooks' boat and archery platform should distract the bandits. Plus, the smoke will make it hard for the bandits to spot the nobles.
Now that the hostages have escaped, I should return to Captain Farlivere and let her know what happened.

I promised Lady Noellaume that I would recover her stolen jewelry box and return it to her after she's safely away from the Red Rook bandits. If I find the Orc named Tharkul, I should find the lockbox.
I defeated Tharkul and recovered Lady Noellaume's lockbox. I should return it to her once she's safely away from the Red Rook bandits.
I must restore the Ansei Wards to the shrine inside the Impervious Vault. Many people have gathered to witness this historic moment.
I should speak with King Fahara'jad inside the Impervious Vault.
The assassins are hiding in crates on the docks. Captain Aresin suggested I speak to the harbor overseer, Sasana at-Abbas. She should be able to help me.
I need to search the cargo on the docks to find Verrik and his assassins. Sasana, meanwhile, is calling out the guard to prevent any of the assassins from slipping past me and into the city.

Wyress Helene asked me to collect essences of Aetherius using a torchbug she gave me. She wants to craft a spell using the essences that will protect the villagers. Using the torchbug should lead me in the right direction.
The ritual worked and the mill is safe. I should speak to Wyress Helene inside the mill and see what else needs to be done.
Bernard Redain and his family escaped from Deleyn's Mill. He suggested I speak to the wyrd sisters and see what I can do to help.

Duke Sebastien believes that the Bloodthorn cult is holding another prisoner near the lighthouse. He thinks she poses a threat to Faolchu, but he fears that she's scheduled to be executed. I should find her and set her free.

The innkeeper Lafont claims he's innocent. He said that the pig has escaped before and always heads into the northeast alleys to root around for something to eat. I should see if Glutton's over there.
I entered the northeast alley and spotted Glutton rooting around in a garden. I should grab the pig and make sure it's safe.
Zhagush gro-Korlag works with the Mages Guild and is something of a plant expert. Wickton suggested I ask Zhagush about the strange vine I found in the alley.
The swineherd believes that Gregoire Lafont the innkeeper stole his pig and intends to serve it for dinner at the Rosy Lion Inn. I should ask Lafont about this.
I extinguished many of the fires and sent the surviving villagers to the mill. I should return to Wyress Jehanne and see what else needs to be done.
I need to search for surviving villagers and send them to the mill. While I'm doing that, I should put out as many fires as I can with water drawn from the village well.
<<1>> gave me an amulet that I can use to reveal hidden werewolves. If I point the amulet at Camlorn refugees and activate the spell, any werewolves hiding among them will be revealed.
I uncovered and killed the werewolves infiltrating Aldcroft, I should return to the Duke and let him know his suspicions were correct.
I nourished the roots of the Wyrd Tree with the pure life energy of the forest creatures. I should return to Wyress Jehanne and see if she can call of the magic of the Wyrd now.
I found the murderer. It was a werewolf! Matthew said Lieutenant Dubois might offer a reward for dealing with this. I should talk to him.
Gloria's blood cured the Duke. At least she didn't die in vain. Now that the Duke has recovered, I should speak with him.
Sergeant Armoil and his soldiers faced the werewolves at Camlorn and even managed to capture one of the creatures. The Duke thinks he can help me acquire a werewolf for Gloria's ritual.

With the help of Battlemage Lexi, who captured a werewolf at Camlorn, we should be able to retrieve one of the creatures for Gloria. We need to search for a werewolf outside of Aldcroft and then I need to weaken it so Battlemage Lexi can trap it.
I brought the captured werewolf to the cave. Now to go inside and find Gloria.

I need to kill the monsters near the roots of the Wyrd Tree. That will nourish the roots with their life force and replenish the magic. If I kill a creature too far from a root, its life force will be wasted.
The werewolf is safely trapped in the ritual circle. I should let Gloria know that we're ready to begin the ritual.
After searching the alleys, I found another murder victim and heard that some kind of monster was seen prowling along the river's edge. I should search there.
Matthew suggested I search the alleys of Daggerfall's trade district for clues about the brutal murders of the city's poor. I'll check the South Alley first.
Leon told me to start by fighting the town's invaders as Rosalind did. I should also look for a keepsake of hers, something to strengthen the bond that will form between us.

I retraced Rosalind's path, destroying skeletal raiders and protecting the town. As I lit the signal fire, I saw a vision of Rosalind. Her next stop was to check on the innkeeper. I should do that as well.

The innkeeper said that Muriel the Apothecary needs hawthorn berries to make more healing poultices for the wounded guards in town. Rosalind's next step was to collect the berries. I should examine the hawthorn shrubs to find berries.
As I used healing poultices to help several of Westtry's ghostly soldiers, Lieutenant Marlene called to me. I should talk to her.
I witnessed the events leading to Leon's betrayal of Westtry. Leon rejected Stendarr and sold his soul to Molag Bal while Rosalind watched. I should talk to Leon about this.
Gloria can tell me more about the ritual she plans to perform.
The ritual revealed Angof's role in Faolchu's return from the dead. I should talk to <<1>> about what we've seen.
The werewolf said that when the Duke of Camlorn was captured, he was infected with lycanthropy. I should speak with Gloria about this revelation.
The werewolf has something to say. I should listen to the creature's words.
Rosalind perished in the town's burial vault. I need to enter the crypt in Westtry and return her blade to her remains. That should call forth her cursed shade.
I summoned the cursed shade of Rosalind and it immediately attacked me. I must defeat it and set Rosalind's spirit free.
Rosalind Milielle gave me the Gem of Westtry's Torment. I can use the gem to free the spirits of innocent villagers around Westtry.
Leon and Rosalind are together inside the house. I should speak with Leon and tell him what I accomplished.
The Duke of Camlorn is dead. He tranformed into a werewolf and left me no choice. I should speak with <<1>> about the Duke's death.
I allowed <<1>> to say goodbye to his wife and daughter, but now I hear screams from inside their home. I need to get in there.
<<1>> sacrificed her life to save the Duke. I should hurry to the Duke's manor in Aldcroft and give him Gloria's blood before he fully transforms.
Guy LeBlanc suggested I check the Bloodthorn camps in the southern part of the Hag Fen, as that's where the cultists have set up camp. I'll look for the women or clues as to where they were taken.
I found the kidnapped women and set them free. They ran off toward the wyrd enclave in the southeast part of the bog. I should find Guy there and make sure the women arrived safely.
<<1>> asked me to find <<2>>. She should know more about Reach magic and why the guardians are silent.
I collected enough hawthorn berries. I should speak to the apothecary in town, as Rosalind did.
The spirit from the past stands before a set of armor that radiates magic. I should speak to the spirit and find out why she led me here.
Conjurer Grahla asked me to collect ancient relics from the battle site. They'll help a researcher named Sarvith cast a divinatory spell to look into the past.
I should take the ancient blades I found to <<1>>. He plans to use them as focus items in his divinatory spell.
I restored the relics to their respective altars. I should speak once more with High Priest Zuladr.
I must recover the Sword of Shabnam, Majeel's Scroll, and the Lamp of Satakalaam.
I recovered the relics. I should return to the temple now and speak to High Priest Zuladr.
I must now restore the three relics to their respective altars.
Now that I've reached Castle Alessia, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Castle Faregyl, I need to take notes on what I see.
The spell appears to have backfired on the mages, though a spirit did seem to appear briefly and try to communicate with us. I should talk to Sarvith and find out what happened.
Grahla wants me to examine the temporal ripples to see if I can locate this doorway that Sarvith opened into the past.
Sibellec gave me a charm to use on the corpses of hags I slay in the bog. This will charge the charm with power for when I face the coven's leader, <<1>>.
<<1>> is dead. I should return to <<2>> to tell her what happened.
The leader of the refugees is a man named Guy LeBlanc. I should find him and see if there's anything I can do to help.
If I kill crocodiles in Hag Fen, I can collect their teeth and turn them in for the bounty. Thanks to the teeth the dead mercenary was carrying, I already have a head start.
I killed several of the crocodiles that roam the bog and yanked out their teeth. I should travel to a camp near Dwynnarth Ruins and claim the bounty from Hoster Marceau.
The Aldcroft lighthouse and cottages are on the southern coast of Aldcroft. I should look there for Edrien's pipe.
I found the valuables that <<1>> hid under a tree. I should bring them back to his daughter, <<2>>. Then I can tell her what her father said about leaving Aldcroft and moving to Crosswych.
Now that I've reached Castle Roebeck, I need to take notes on what I see.
The ghost of <<1>> has appeared. He wants to speak with me.
Now that I've reached Castle Brindle, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Castle Black Boot, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Castle Bloodmayne, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Warden Mine, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Rayles Mine, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Glademist Mine, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Ash Mine, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Aleswell Mine, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Dragonclaw Mine, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Chalman Mine, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Arrius Mine, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Kingscrest Mine, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Farragut Mine, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Blue Road Mine, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Drakelowe Mine, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Alessia Mine, I need to take notes on what I see.
I collected what Wyress Helene needs to protect the villagers. I should tell her immediately.
We captured a werewolf! Now I need to meet <<1>> in the cave outside Aldcroft. The cave is northeast of the Aldcroft docks.
Now that I've reached Faregyl Mine, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Roebeck Mine, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Brindle Mine, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Black Boot Mine, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Bloodmayne Mine, I need to take notes on what I see.
We can't let Gloria sacrifice herself to cure the Duke. I should return to Aldcroft and confront the Duke before he transforms into a werewolf.
Now that I've reached Warden Farm, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Rayles Farm, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Glademist Farm, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Ash Farm, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Aleswell Farm, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Dragonclaw Farm, I need to take notes on what I see.

After setting Bethany LeBlanc free, I discovered that the other missing women were taken to a tower in the marsh. They're going to be traded to a hag coven. I should go to the tower and rescue them before this wicked trade takes place.
Now that I've reached Chalman Farm, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Arrius Farm, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Kingscrest Farm, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Farragut Farm, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Drakelowe Farm, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Blue Road Farm, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Alessia Farm, I need to take notes on what I see.
The Duke of Camlorn told me to speak with <<1>> if I want to know more about the amulet he gave me.
The charm is fully charged. I'm ready to face <<1>>. I can use the empowered charm to counter the effects of her vitality-draining power.

<<1>> told me to search a particular tree southwest of the lighthouse for a cache of valuables. He's been secretly saving them for years. He wants me to give them to his daughter so she can start a new life in Crosswych with her relatives.
Now that I've reached Faregyl Farm, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Roebeck Farm, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Brindle Farm, I need to take notes on what I see.
Sarvith thinks he opened a door into the past, but now he's unsure of how to proceed. He asked me to talk to Conjurer Grahla and see what she thinks we should do.
Now that I've reached Black Boot Farm, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Bloodmayne Farm, I need to take notes on what I see.
A spirit from the past says she'll show me how Faolchu originally died. She told me to find the nearby crypt and meet her inside.
Now that I've reached Warden Lumbermill, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Rayles Lumbermill, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Glademist Lumbermill, I need to take notes on what I see.
The spirit in the crypt says I need to put on the Direnni armor. Wearing the armor will serve as my doorway into the past and cause me to relive the last moments of the ancient battle.
I put on the armor and somehow stepped back in time. I'm the knight who wore this armor, Alana's beloved. I should speak to Alana to find out where I am and what's going on.
I reached the Direnni camp. Now I should find Commander Parmion and give him the Alessian orders.
I located the Alessian orders. I should bring the orders to the Direnni camp and warn them about what the Alessians are planning.

The Alessian orders indicate that stealth scouts plan to sneak Alessian troops behind Direnni lines. King Laloriaran suggested that my armor's magic should let me spot them. I need to take them out before they penetrate the Direnni defenses.

As I defeated the last of the covert Alessian troops, a Direnni scout approached and said with his dying breath that Alana was ambushed at Faolchu's headquarters. I should find Faolchu's lair and discover what happened.
Now that I've reached Ash Lumbermill, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Aleswell Lumbermill, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Dragonclaw Lumbermill, I need to take notes on what I see.
Lieutenant Marlene said that Leon was home praying. But something was strange about the prayer and it frightened her. I should investigate.
I brought the berries to the apothecary, who gave me poultices in return. I can use these to heal the injured guards, as Rosalind did long ago.
Now that I've reached Chalman Lumbermill, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Arrius Lumbermill, I need to take notes on what I see.

<<1>> can use the reagents I gathered to break the seal on the Impervious Vault just enough to let one person inside. Apparently, she and the king have nominated me. I should speak to the king before she begins the spell.
<<1>> has broken the seal on the Impervious Vault. I must enter the vault, find the thieves, and thwart whatever they're planning.
I followed Rosalind into her home. I should accompany her and see what happens.
Now that I've reached Kingscrest Lumbermill, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Farragut Lumbermill, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Blue Road Lumbermill, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Drakelowe Lumbermill, I need to take notes on what I see.
I need to retrieve Rosalind's sword from the chapel beyond the burial vault. As the symbol of her office, it may draw out her shade and remind her of her true self.
I defeated Rosalind's cursed shade and watched her spirit materialize at the top of the stairs. I should speak with her.
Rosalind Milielle gave me her sword. I have chosen to defeat Westtry's enraged wraiths and make the town safe for mortal travelers again.
I used Rosalind's sword to defeat the wraiths of Westtry. I should return to Leon and Rosalind's home, as Rosalind requested.
I set the innocent spirits of Westtry free. I should return to Leon and Rosalind's home, as Rosalind requested.
Leon and Rosalind are together inside the house. I should speak with Leon and tell him what I accomplished.
<<1>> has prepared her spell. I should wait until she breaks the seal on the Impervious Vault, and then I can go inside.
Now that I've reached Alessia Lumbermill, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Faregyl Lumbermill, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Roebeck Lumbermill, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Brindle Lumbermill, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Black Boot Lumbermill, I need to take notes on what I see.
Now that I've reached Bloodmayne Lumbermill, I need to take notes on what I see.
I need to show the orders to King Laloriaran and then talk to Alana. Commander Parmion wants me to defend the camp while Alana attempts to kill Faolchu, but I should be the one to deal with Faolchu.
The Direnni forces muster for a final stand against the Alessian army. Commander Parmion has a few words to say to the soldiers. I should listen.
I need to decide my next course of action. Do I go after Faolchu or should I try to save Alana and leave Faolchu to the remaining soldiers?
There's an enemy camp up ahead. I should see if that's where they took Alana.

I decided to deal with Faolchu personally. His lair is through the large doors ahead of me. I'm still not sure what his weakness is, but he died once in this time frame. I'll find a way to kill him again.
I rescued Alana. She told me she thinks Faolchu's weakness is fire. She wants me to help the soldiers and kill Faolchu with fire while she spreads the word to the rest of the Direnni forces.
I returned from the past with the secret to defeating Faolchuâ€”fire! I should find someone from the Mages Guild and let them know what I learned.
I somehow altered time by rescuing Alana. Now her descendant leads the Mages Guild's efforts at Glenumbra Moors.
I returned from the past with the knowledge about Faolchu's weakness. I should speak to Sarvith.
I should let Grahla know about Faolchu's weakness as soon as possible.
I retrieved the stolen regalia from the Bloodthorn cultists. Now I need to return each item to its proper tomb in the Burial Mounds.
When I returned each treasure, I heard a ghostly whisper. I should locate its source.
I need to speak to a mage named Alana. Could she somehow be related to the Alana I saved in the past? I should talk to her and find out.
I should let Grahla know about Faolchu's weakness as soon as possible.
The Bloodthorn cultists have hidden the stolen regalia in the groundskeeper's cottage to the south of the Burial Mounds. I need to go there and retrieve the stolen items.
I need to locate the Bloodthorn cultists enthralling the spectral soldiers. By slaying the cultists, I can release those spirits.
I must speak with the ghost of King Donel Deleyn. He waits on a hill of monuments in the center of the burial mounds.
King Donel Deleyn and the other spirits of the Burial Mounds have expressed their thanks. I must give the word to release them so they may go to their final rest.
Angof is holding the elemental guardians prisoner. I should meet <<1>> at the wyrd camp and get her to help me free them.
I collected the lurcher arms as <<1>> instructed me. Now I should go to the top of the ruins and burn them on the altar. Then one of the elemental guardians should appear.
An elemental guardian appeared on the altar. I should ask it why the guardians have stopped communicating with the wyrd.
A Daggerfall guard sent me to talk to Captain Farlivere. I should see if she needs help rescuing the hostages.
We set the guardians free from Angof's imprisonment. They can once again help and guide the wyresses. Now the <<1>> wants to speak to me.
I locked Camlorn's main gate. I should let General Gautier know I was successful.
Werewolves have overrun the Lion Guard's siege camp. I should help Shaza kill as many werewolves as possible as we make our way to the other side of the camp.
<<1>> suggested I use his hunting horn to signal when it's safe for them to make their escape. The horn is upstairs. I should retrieve it before I head out to deal with the Red Rooks.
I cleared the traps from the path and caused enough destruction to distract the Red Rooks. Now I need to sound the hunting horn to signal the nobles to move out.
<<1>> told me that four wyresses have gone to cleanse the standing stones to the north. I need to find the wyresses and guard them while they destroy Angof's corrupting vines.
I need to find Sir Granden's tomb and challenge him. The Bloodthorn cult has already enthralled him, so now he must forcibly be put to rest.
We've made all the preparations necessary for Wyress Ileana to perform the ritual that will free the elemental guardians. I should speak to her and let her know we're ready.
Commander Marone asked me to find his missing patrols. He sent them out to protect the redoubt, the ruins of Merovec's Folly to the west, and the Gaudet farm to the southwest.
I hear shouting inside the crypt. That's probably Wizard Benele. I should go inside and talk to her.
I should join with other warriors to launch an attack.
With Fort Warden in Pact hands, I should return to the Warfront board.
I should join with other warriors to launch an attack.
With Fort Rayles in Pact hands, I should return to the Warfront board.
A soldier is waiting for me at the Lion Guard Redoubt wayshrine. I should speak to him.
