I should make my way to the Spire, and begin my climb to the top.
The grandmaster told me to talk to his seneschal, <<1>>, if I need anything.
Now that I'm inside the barracks, I need to look around for clues. I must learn where the grandmaster's son is being held.
I must search for <<1>> within the Daedric tombs and set him free.
Ral gave me the prod he uses when tending his herd. I need to use the prod on the guar as I find them around Kragenmoor. That should send them back to Ral.
<<1>> fears the cultists plan to enslave the living skeletons of <<2>>. She told me <<3>> has a way to stop the cultists' plan, but it requires my help. I should speak with him.
House Indoril is ready to dispel the ward holding the gate closed. I need to wait while Garyn and Tanval open the gates.
With the ward down, I'm free to enter the area around the keep.
This is it. I must slay <<1>>.
The pirates consorting with Dominion troops on the docks of <<1>> know where <<2>> is holed up. If I show them I mean business by smashing a few heads, they may be more amenable to talking.

I got the information I needed from the pirates working for <<1>>, along with the key I needed to get in to the warehouse on the docks. I need to go to the warehouse and find the trapdoor to her hideout.
<<1>> wants me to kill <<2>> in her hideout. Hopefully, that will stop the trafficking of Dominion supplies into Shadowfen.
In the underground hideout, a Khajiit approached me, right after killing his leader. I should speak to him and find out what he wants.

The treasure <<1>> expected to be in the Khajiit's hideout was not there. A pirate named <<2>> said he and his gang would be willing to help me track it down, if I spared them. I should see what they have to offer me.

Before I can recover the <<z:1>> holding the villager's spirits from the Worm Cult, I must bring an offering to a nearby temple of Clavicus Vile, the Daedric Prince who cursed them. <<2>> will give me the key to the ruin.

The Dres captive told me her leader used some kind of device to control the Dwarven constructs, but it was damaged. She also told me the raiders were preparing to attack the guards at the entrance to the ruins. I should stop them.
I stopped the Dres raiders and should speak to Defender Maera at the main entrance to the ruins.
I must talk to <<1>> to begin the Trial of the Fang. I can find him in the pit south of the pyramid.
I should look for the assassins near slain Pact soldiers.
Ulov claims a monster is killing people and copying their bodies. He trapped it inside the cellar of the Sathram Plantation stables. I should investigate.
Tiril's double ran off. I must follow it.
The entrance to the tomb is west of the city. I can reach the tomb entrance by going down the western pass out of town.
The creature fled again. I must chase it before it copies Ruvali.
Ruvali gave me Ra-shadda's idol. The Khajiit is the only one who might know how to deal with the monster. I must speak to him.
Ra-shadda believes we can banish the dro-m'Athra using the Idol of the Hollow moon. To charge it, I must use the idol on the dark spirits of the plantation, then slay them to steal their power.
I've drawn many spirits into the idol. If I can force the dro-m'Athra to possess me now, it will be destroyed.\n\nI must return to Ra-shadda. He waits in Ruvali's house.
Ra-shadda asked that I finish charging the idol at an altar south of the stables.
The dro-m'Athra stole Ulov's body. He ran out the back of the barn. I must chase after him and slay him.
<<1>> has instructed me to drink the <<2>>.
While I was talking to Ruvali Ulov entered the stables. It might not be him. I should use the idol on him to find out.

Drinking the Hist sap put me into communion with the Hist. I've become an Argonian from long ago. My mind is filled with thoughts that aren't my own. I should explore Hissmir and see what the Hist wishes to tell me.
To commune with the Hist, I must drink from the bowl of Hist sap near <<1>>.
<<1>> suggested I ask <<2>>, the leader of Hissmir's Root Stewards, about Hist amber. He can be found on top of the xanmeer.
<<1>> traveled to the ruins northwest of Hissmir, possibly looking for the Hist amber needed to activate Hissmir's defenses. I should confront him there.
I recovered the Hist amber from <<1>>. I should use it to activate the Zaht stones in Hissmir to repel a Dominion attack.
I need to leave the ruins and enter the fort. The exit from the ruins is down the hall, around the corner, and up the stairs from where I spoke to <<1>>.
I've used all the healing potions I could recover from the Ashlander camps. <<1>> asked me to seek out <<2>> when I'm done.
I must make an offering to Clavicus Vile at the <<z:1>> in <<2>>.

Kagesh renegades took the tribe's medicinal herbs and alchemical healing draughts. Hedranna asked me to recover them and bring them to the temple. The crates are around Ashlander yurts. The draughts are carried by the Ashlanders themselves.
I've recovered as much of the medicine as I can carry. <<1>> told me I should bring it to <<2>> within the temple grounds. She offers it to the Tribunal monks as a token of friendship.

<<1>> thanked me for delivering the medicine. She'll attend to the crates of herbs, but she said there are soldiers throughout the temple who are near death. She asked me to take the alchemical draughts and use them on the worst cases.
Once I find the Dominion treasure ship, I can board it and take their treasure.
I've found the Dominion's treasure ship. Now I can board it and take their treasure. With that, and Tsanji's death, <<1>> will release <<2>>. The Dominion's trading in <<3>> will end.
<<1>> is waiting for me to return to <<2>>. Supposedly, she has some important information I must hear. <<3>> said she would be waiting on the docks.
<<1>> arrived to thank me for ending the Dominion's presence here.

<<1>> told me the High Elf in charge of the Dominion in <<2>> was waiting for her in a cabin on the lower hold of her ship. If I want to end this supply running once and for all, I should kill her before she learns of One-Eye's treachery.

<<1>> is dead. With luck, this means the end of supply running through <<2>>. That deals a severe blow to the Dominion's designs in Shadowfen. I should let <<3>> know the Dominion won't bother her town any longer.

<<1>> explained that three strange healing fonts in the area will heal my skeletal form, as will healing magic. I should recover the <<z:2>> from the nearby Worm Cult camp while I remain a living skeleton.
Saryvn asked me to find the key to his cage and an ancient Daedric tome. One of the Maulborn probably has the key, and he saw them carry the book into the lower tunnels.
I have the key and the book. I need to speak to Saryvn back at his cage and decide what to do about his indiscretion.
Saryvn has been freed and I agreed to cover for him. I should speak to his superior, Sergeant Maril.
Saryvn has been freed, but I refused to lie for him. I should speak to his superior, Sergeant Maril.
I should follow the directions in this note to learn what the rioters did next. I could start by following the note's directions to the area south of the barn.
The Khajiit sent to free the prisoners must have been slain. Once the prisoners were freed, they were to meet up in the quarters east of the barn. I should go there and continue tracing their steps.
A Khajiit named J'kur was the leader of this riot. He told the slaves to meet him in the pumpkin patch near the stables.
<<1>> is planning some sort of necromantic ritual in the fort's keep. I should warn <<2>>.
Our troops are pouring into the courtyard. I need to find where <<1>> is hiding. Walks-in-Ash thinks he might be in the keep.
I've freed several of the Argonian slaves from the depths of Oblivion. I should tell Neposh the good news.
I need to search Muth Gnaar to find <<1>>. Between the Ashlanders and the plague husks, his recklessness is going to get him hurt or killed.
I defeated <<1>>. <<2>> is north of Muth Gnaar. I should tell him what happened.
The crates filled with Llodos plague have been destroyed. I should return to the cave and speak to Naryu about our next move.
I need to find and destroy three arcane wards in the southern section of the cave.
I need to talk to <<1>> and find out what's happening in Kragenmoor.
I have proof of the General's death. I should inform Captain Valec that he was slain by a Dremora imposter.

I interrogated Ithis Omalor and learned that his superior, Magistrix Vox, sent him to attack the Hlaalu caravan. I agreed to grant him leniency. I should bring him to the Hlaalu caravaneers outside of Mzithumz.
I should search the cart for clues and ask nearby pilgrims if they witnessed anything.
I found a torn red jerkin outside a house in Hissmir. I should see if the relics are inside.
I destroyed the wards. I should return to Scout Kanat before the plague spreads further.
Hlaalu archers will try to destroy the cargo bound for Mournhold from the cliff above. I need to defend the archers while they make their attack. I'll meet up with Naryu Virian to signal the attack.
Neposh's father, Last-to-Water, is apparently still trapped in Oblivion. Neposh fears that rescuing Last-to-Water will attract the attention of the Daedra Fatestealer. I should be ready to fight.

The clues I've found point me to an Argonian in a red jerkin. Witnesses saw someone matching that description. Supposedly, he or she fled to the east. If the culprit is still here, I should search any dwellings or buildings in that area.
Despite <<1>>'s misgivings, he gave me a key to Clavicus Vile's temple near <<2>>. Once I make an offering, I can safely recover the <<z:3>> from the Worm Cult.
I should start searching for pilgrims on the road northeast of Hissmir.
I found the bodies of some of the missing pilgrims. I should continue my search.
I found another victim at the base of a small cliff. It looks like she was killed recently, then dropped. I should check the cliffs above her body.
I need to challenge and defeat the Redoran Sentinels. If I can show the fort they can be beaten, their power should fade dramatically.
I need to speak to Commander Taldyn in the training yard to determine what to do about the Sentinels.
I destroyed the <<z:1>>, ending the villagers' bargain with Clavicus Vile. I should return to <<2>> and see what became of the villagers.
I should observe Balreth while it attacks the Covenant forces.
I see several crates of supplies around the Vereansu camp. I should set them on fire to exact revenge for the Vereansu's attack on Muth Gnaar.
<<1>> asked me to hear out <<2>> and <<3>> before deciding the villagers' ultimate fate.
Now that I've freed the guards from the animus geodes, I should look for <<1>> on the hill near <<2>>.
I agreed to free the spirits of <<1>>'s slain guards. They're trapped in "animus geodes" around the necromancers' camp.
I need to decide not only Raston's fate, but the fate of the Mabrigash as well. I should talk to tribe members and the merchant's assistant before I inform the Farseer of my decision.
Speak to Raston's apprentice or some of the Mabrigash to get advice and gather opinions before making a decision.
A scout of the Kagesh tribe met me as I passed Iliath Temple. He explained the situation and asked me to meet the wise woman of his tribe. She's at her encampment east of the temple.
I need to collect six wasp gizzards. That's the basis for Churasu's concoction.
I have the gizzards I need to make the concoction. I need to go to Churasu's hut by the shore. Then I can use her alchemy journal and supplies to make the mixture.
I spread the mixture around and attracted a lot of angry wasps. They went right after the Khajiiti pirates. I should return to Churasu and let her know what happened.
Success! The mixture worked! Now I need to splash the concoction on the tree outside.
Drillk declared me the captain of his royal army. Now that he has addressed his "subjects," I should speak to Drillk about the keystone.
Drillk is dead. He gave his life to pass the keystone to me. I should return to <<1>> and let her know about the keystone.
I awakened Ayleid pilasters in the Temple of Sul. They revealed what seemed to be memories of the past. I should report what I've learned to Neeja-Meen in Hissmir.
Churasu said there would be an alchemy journal in the hut. I should be able to determine the recipe.

<<1>> is a bit unstable. He's tasked me with constructing a crown for him. After I indulge him, he'll lead me to the keystone. I can scavenge metal from crates around the village and broken glass from the grounds.
I should take the metal and bits of glass to the anvil north of <<1>>. Then I can shape them into a crown.
I've finished forging a crown. I should take it to <<1>>.
<<1>> asked me to free Zuuk subjects captured by the invaders. I took a Scroll of Release that should unlock the binding spell that ensnares them.
I made an incorrect calculation on the amount of materials I required. I need to collect another gizzard to make up for the lost one.
Drillk said the word "betrux" will remove the ward that blocks the Temple of Sul. Doing so will allow entrance into the temple.
I've entered the Temple of Sul. Now I need to locate and obtain the keystone.
I've unlocked the keystone's chamber. I should take the keystone and leave.
I should attempt to locate and awaken the pilasters.
To resolve the villagers' fate, I must return to <<Ac:1>> near <<2>>.
<<A:1>> is no longer abandoned. I need to make my way deeper inside.

<<1>> asked me to ensure the constructs can't be controlled again. She wants me to collect the resonators she believes received orders from the rod. She also asked me to destroy repair stations throughout Mzithumz so they can't be replaced.
I removed the resonators from constructs and destroyed the repair stations within Mzithumz. I should report back to Bedyni at the ruin's entrance.
<<1>> asked me to free his subjects being held by invaders in the lowlands next to the village. I should be able to steal a Scroll of Release from the invader's camp to free them.
I should retrieve the medallions from the recently transformed plague husks.
I recovered the medallions of Saint Veloth. I should return them to <<1>> on the road north of Muth Gnaar.
Vunal instructed me to use the Heartstones in a ritual at the <<1>>.
I must speak with <<1>> to begin the first trial. She's on the northwest corner of the pyramid.
I can make my final choice within the Vile Terminus. If I want to destroy the array, I can drop it into the <<1>>. To preserve it, I need to place it on the <<2>>.
I preserved the <<z:1>>, ending the villagers' bargain with Clavicus Vile. I should return to <<2>> and see what became of the villagers.
Sadal told me the mages are ready to begin. I should speak to Balreth as the final step before the start of the ritual.

Drinking the Hist sap put me into communion with the Hist. I've become an Argonian from long ago. My mind is filled with thoughts that aren't my own. I should explore Hissmir and see what the Hist wishes to tell me.

Drinking the Hist sap put me into communion with the Hist. I've become an Argonian from long ago. My mind is filled with thoughts that aren't my own. I should explore Hissmir and see what the Hist wishes to tell me.
I have the key. Now I need to go to the lower level and grab as many weapons as I can before the guards return.
<<1>> asked me to find <<2>> and deliver her last letter to him, whether he's alive or dead.\n\nSomeone in the <<3>> must know his whereabouts.
I passed a dead Hlaalu guard and a couple of wounded traders. There's a bridge ahead, and I see a Hlaalu guard lieutenant. I should speak to her and get more information.
If I find Risa's amulet while fighting the snakes, I could return it to her mother at Tal'Deic Fortress.
I found Risa's amulet and returned it to her mother.
The ghostly figure led me into a trap, but an Argonian managed to drive it away. I should speak to <<1>> and find out exactly what's going on here.
<<1>> asked me to free any travelers caught by the <<mz:2>> in the area.
When I tried to speak with <<1>>, a ghostly figure appeared and asked me to follow it. I should see where it leads me.
The ghostly figure led me into a trap, but an Argonian managed to drive it away. I should speak to <<1>> and find out exactly what's going on here.
I should look for <<1>> near <<2>> and see how I can help him. I was told the fishing village is just southeast of Hissmir.
Ulov is dead, and the dro-m'Athra destroyed. I must return to Ruvali and Ra-shadda.
To find out why, I should speak to their leader, <<1>>. Her hut is near the center of the village.
I've completed the ritual to empower an ancient relic. With this, I can trap the wispmother. I should speak to <<1>> to get it.
The High Elf's camp is on the southeast side of the xanmeer. I should investigate it.
A search of <<1>>'s camp may reveal his real reason for visiting with the Argonians in <<2>>.
I've attracted <<1>>'s attention while searching through his camp. I should speak to him to see if I can make sense of what I've found so far.
<<1>> believes the spirit is a wispmother. The monster has apparently taken the guise of <<2>>'s wife to enthrall him. After I retrieve an ancient relic, <<1>> can seal the wispmother.
<<1>>'s "wife" quickly rebuffed me when I questioned her, and <<1>>'s "house" turned out to be an illusion of a High Elf house within the cave. I should tell <<2>> of these strange happenings.
<<1>> claims his wife, once dead, has now returned to him. Proof of this lies within a cave near his camp. If she does exist, I should speak to her to find out how she returned to life.
I should bring <<Az:1>> to <<2>>. She said she would meet me by a ritual circle at the entrance to <<3>>.
I found J'kur's body. He was holding a note and a map. The note was intended for someone named Vahara. The map points to an area north of the plantation. I should go there and look for Vahara.
I must tell Ulov to go to the stables and wait for me, as Ra-shadda suggested. We will banish the dro-m'Athra there.
I've defeated the guardians. Now I must meet <<1>> at the top of the path.
Now that I've defeated <<1>>, I should speak to <<2>> outside.
Now that I've destroyed the Scamp caves, I should speak with <<1>> at the top of Ash Mountain.
I've finished with the idol. I'm protected from possession. Now I need to go inside the stables and find the dro-m'Athra.
I should find someone in the Pact military and report in.
The wispmother has been sealed away, though <<1>> fell to her charms. I should let <<2>> know the wispmother is no longer plaguing <<3>>.
I should return to Valrendil's camp and enter the wispmother's lair. The vessel's inherent power will prevent her illusions from affecting me.
<<1>> did not believe my argument against the wispmother, but I convinced him to let me into her lair. Now I must slay the wispmother and seal her remains.
The wispmother has been sealed away, though <<1>> fell to her charms. I should speak to <<2>>, so she'll know the wispmother is no longer plaguing the <<3>>.
<<1>> confronted me outside the wispmother's lair, as <<2>> said he might. Before I tangle with the wispmother, I need to talk him out of doing anything rash.
I convinced <<1>> of the wispmother's illusions. Hopefully, he'll stay out of my way.
The wispmother has been sealed away. <<1>> resisted her charms. I should tell <<1>> the wispmother is no longer plaguing the <<2>>.
The wispmother has been sealed away. <<1>> resisted her charms long enough to survive. I should tell <<1>> the wispmother is no longer plaguing the <<2>>.
Now that I've collected the hearts of the lesser Daedra, I should be able to summon Ash Mountain's ancient guardians. I'll need to perform rituals at the ruined altars on the mountainside.
Ra-shadda is bound, and Ruvali is questioning him, but I don't see Ulov. I should speak with her.
I can use a pickaxe to collapse the entrances to the Scamp caves.
I found Risa's amulet. I should return it to her mother at Tal'Deic Fortress.
I have recovered the crystal shards, and I should return to Geoffrey Stictal.
I retrieved all of the crystal fragments. I should return them to Lord Stictal.
Now that I have the crystal shards, I will return them to <<1>>.
BlahI need to take the crystal shards back to <<1>>
I killed Supernal Dreamer and recovered the five shards of the Crystal of Power. I should return them to <<1>>.
Defeat Supernal Dreamers within their camp and collect the crystal shards from them.
I need to find the five crystal fragments from the Supernal Dreamers hiding out in this abandoned farm.
I'm collecting shards of the Crystal of Power for <<1>>
I have been asked to collect the stolen crystal shards from the Supernal Dreamers.

The Supernal Dreamers have stolen a Crystal of Power from Lord Geoffroi Stictal. They shattered it into five parts to perform some terrible ritual. He's asked me to kill the cultists and recover the five shards.
I should enter <<1>> and defeat <<2>>.
Now that I've defeated <<1>>, I should leave <<2>> and speak to <<3>>.
The Ordinators have notified Almalexia of my arrival. If I sit by the fire, I should be able to speak with her.
Almalexia has words of wisdom to guide me. I should listen to them.
Magistrix Vox is protected by three wards that hide her from Almalexia's sight. I need to enter the ruins and destroy the wards. I should speak to Ordinator Muron for more advice.
I need to find three wards and destroy them. That should open the path to Vox's lair and allow Almalexia's power to flood into the Hollow.
I destroyed the three wards. Now I need to find the cave that leads to Vox's lair.
The path opened and a projection of some kind greeted me. I should speak to the projection before proceeding deeper into the cave.
I must defeat <<1>>.
I've unlocked the ward blocking the Temple of Sul. I should enter the temple and look for the keystone.
I learned a shocking secret. The people of <<1>> are living skeletons! <<2>> asked me not to be alarmed. I should speak with her further.
When I made an offering at the <<z:1>>, Clavicus Vile spoke to me. He transformed me into a living skeleton! I need to return the temple key to <<2>>, who last saw the <<z:3>>.
When I finished collecting ashreeds and crab meat, <<1>> ran up to me. I should ask what she wants.
I freed <<1>> and he ran off to safety. I should speak to him and make sure he's all right.
I need to speak to Jonathan and make sure he made it out of the camp all right.
To resolve the villagers' fate, I must return to <<Ac:1>> near <<2>>.
<<A:1>> is no longer abandoned. I need to make my way deeper inside.
I have freed Steve from his cage.
I'm saving his son.
I have help Harvey get away and I should make sure he made it back safely.
The son of Lord Geoffroi was captured by the Supernal Dreamers. They plan to sacrifice him as part of their ritual. He's asked me to set him free.
I have entered the heart of the coral. Sings-With-Reed is in here somewhere, as is the Coral Heart. I must find Sings-With-Reed and see what progress she's made in contacting the coral.
I must seek out Meejapa. He's trying to slay a powerful Orc. Meejapa was last seen east of Lukiul Uxith.
I must slay Borolg, as Majeepa asked.
I've slain Borolg. I must return to Lukiul Uxith to speak to Seven-Bellies.
I must slay a Covenant lieutenant southwest of Lukiul Uxith. Then I can use Pash-Riha's dagger, the Mota Fang, on his corpse.
The Covenant lieutenant is dead. I should return to Lukiul Uxith and speak to Pash-Riha.
I've created the <<1>>. I should speak to <<2>> and learn what she wants me to do with it.
I've freed <<1>>. I should make my way out of the tombs and speak with him again.
Geof has asked that I hit a button and kill Quest Boss 3760.
I have seen to Quest 3760 Boss. He is dead and I should go back and tell Geof that all his chores are done.
I've defeated the power fueling the spellplague. I should return and speak to <<1>>.
Edgard asked me to rescue his missing soldiers: Renard, Elise, and Laroche.
I rescued the three Lion Guard soldiers and fought a Daedric spirit. I should look for Edgard and his soldiers by the entrance to the Bonesnap Ruins.
The Goblins used fragments from the welkynd stone in their totems. I need to find the totems and retrieve the pieces.
I've collected all of the missing piecesof the welkynd stone Gaston needs to contain the Daedra in these ruins. I should take them back to Battlemage Gaston to have the stone repaired.
I've repaired the welkynd stone. I should check with Gaston to see if there's anything else I need to do.
If <<1>> is still alive, he's imprisoned somewhere in the necromancers' camp.
I helped the Argonians defeat Betina Volek and get their revenge. I should meet Sar-Keer outside to complete our business.
I should talk to Betina Volek and decide what to do about this situation. She's at the inn to the east.
Now that Betina knows about the plan to ambush her, I should escort her into her family home and help fend off the Argonians.
Betina entered her home. I'll follow her inside and spring the ambush.
I helped Betina Volek defeat the Argonians. I should meet her outside and make sure she's all right.
The Argonians are attacking Betina. I should help her defeat them.
I need to help the Argonians defeat Betina Volek.
Dathyra said lighting some greef brandy on fire might catch the attention of the Covenant commander.
I should return to the grandmaster's chamber to speak with Grandmaster Dres and his son.
I took notes on the whole performance, and despite the Randoro brothers' warnings, I've decided to give the notes to <<1>>. I should speak with him again.
I killed the Vanguard's commander. I should speak with Grandmaster Omin Dres.
I should seek out <<1>> in the Vanguard camp east of Kragenmoor.
I need to search the tombs near Kragenmoor for clues to the Dark Elf performance. If I discover anything, I should take notes and bring them back to <<1>>.
I need to speak to the Kothringi at his "castle" in Zuuk.
I stopped Namira's ritual of corruption. I can see <<1>> at the top of a nearby structure. I should go talk to him and see what's next for Xal Ithix.
The Ashlanders captured monks and afflicted commoners, tied them up, and tossed them inside burning buildings. I need to rescue them before the fire consumes them.
I should pray at the shrine on the main floor of the temple sanctuary. If the Tribunal sends a messenger, it will tell me what I must do next.
Almalexia's messenger told me I must first collect dust from the urns in the crypt below the temple. The urns contain the ashes of the honored dead: the remains of two Ordinators who defended Iliath.
To win the cooperation of <<1>> and <<2>>, I must defeat both in duels.
I need to scatter the ashes I gathered into the eternal flame braziers, so I can summon the spirits of <<1>> and <<2>>.
I've scattered ashes into both eternal flames.
Both Ordinators swore oaths to lead their soldiers in defence of Iliath's walls. As <<1>> desired, the Tribunal has provided aid against the Ashlander siege. I should return and tell him the news.
I informed Betina of the Argonians' plan to ambush her. I'll meet her in front of her family home, northwest of the inn.
I decided not to tell Betina about the ambush. She's going to meet me in front of her family home, northwest of the inn.
I need to search the bodies of the dead merchants to find three keys. Once I find the keys, I can open the three locked chests.
Kotholl wanted to steal the goods to make up for lost pay so that he could feed his family. I decided to let him have them.
<<1>> wants me to save the <<2>> before the Ashlanders destroy it.
Healer Hlaren told me Dolril was captured by the Vereansu and thrown into a burning building. I should find him and rescue him before it's too late.
I killed Merdyndril, the creator of the Llodos plague. Unfortunately, Diiril and his soldiers are dead, too. I need to let House Hlaalu know what I found.
I need to find Diiril. He was last seen leading troops toward the southern part of the Gorge. Luckily, I seem to be immune to the plague.
Diiril and a few of his troops are still alive. I should talk to him.
Diiril located the alchemist who created the Llodos plague. We're going in to find out how the plague was made so House Hlaalu can produce a cure.
We discovered an apothecarium within the ruins. This is where the plague was created. We should search the area for any clues that will help us.

We found the recipe for the Llodos plague, but we also walked into a trap. Merdyndril, the alchemist who created the plague, was waiting for us. I have to deal with the transformed guards before I can kill Merdyndril.
I killed Merdyndril, the creator of the Llodos plague. Unfortunately, Diiril and his soldiers are dead, too. I need to let House Hlaalu know what I found.
I met with <<1>>, who asked me to assist the Shadowscales in rescuing the townsfolk of <<2>>. Then I must look for the Rellis Lor Keystone.
I've taken part in a ritual that bound the Rellis Lor Keystone to me. I should speak to <<1>> to see what's next.
The hunter I met in Xal Ithix says if I want to know what's happening in the swamp, I need to talk to <<1>> in his hut.
I should go to Hissmir, northwest of Murkwater. I need to find <<1>>.
<<1>> told me the Vereansu believe that the monks have defiled the <<2>>. Now they plan to destroy it. We need to get to the monastery and protect the relic.
I've passed through the gate. Because of Serien's experimentation with Dark Elf rituals, undead are everywhere. I must make my way to the keep.
I recovered the <<1>>. I should give it to <<2>>.
<<1>> wants me to travel to the Vereansu camp and kill <<2>>. With the defeat of the Ashlander leader, the Vereansu should leave Muth Gnaar in peace.
Although they usually prey on small creatures, stranglers attacked the Argonian scavengers. I must search Xal Ithix's bog to rescue threatened scavengers.
An enraged kwama serving as hive guardian blocks the tunnel the miners use to get back to the entry chamber. I need to kill it to access the tunnel.
I should return to <<1>> and let her know I've dealt with the stranglers.
The keystone in the Temple of Sul is missing. An Ayleid spirit attacked me, saying that <<1>> had absorbed the keystone years ago. I need to speak with him.
<<1>> asked me to search for <<2>> in the trash piles.
I should speak to <<1>> and find out what the current situation is.
I should travel there as soon as I can.
<<1>> would like to talk to me before I leave to deal with the breach.
<<1>> wants me to weaken the timber supports holding open the Ashlanders' tunnel. To do that, I'll need a tool.
<<1>> has taken command of the defenders. He can be found near the Ashlander breach southwest of the temple.
I have the tools I'll need to weaken the tunnel supports. I should head underground now.
Wooden support beams hold up the ceiling. They're not well constructed. It should be easy for me to weaken them as I advance through the Ashlanders' tunnels.
Despite everything I've done, the Ashkhan must be slain. <<1>> has to die.
I need to use the <<1>>. The Ashlanders should pass them without attacking.
The Ashkhan has been defeated. It's time to pull down the last support and get out before the cave collapses.
I've defeated the <<1>>, and the Ashlander tunnel has collapsed.
Now that the vials are sealed, I need to find Edrasa's cousin, Renvis.
I need to confront Edrasa and see what she has to say about recent events in Deepcrag Den.
I returned the amulet to a regretful <<1>>. Now I need to speak to Boril.
Edrasa seems genuinely sorry for what she did. I can keep her secret or let Boril know what really happened.
I've found Pash-Riha. I should speak to her.
Pash-Riha, Elder Seven-Bellies' sister, chased after the Covenant soldier who led the attack. I promised Seven-Bellies I'd look for her. He said she ran to the northwest, seeking blood.
I've been instructed to speak to the Elder of Lukiul Uxith, Seven-Bellies. He'll know more about the Covenant's activities in the area.
<<1>> needs my help with some sort of divination ritual. A portion of the <<z:2>> needs to be placed at each of the steles surrounding the xanmeer, an ancient ziggurat.
I should meet <<1>> atop its ancient stone temple. He should be able to begin his ritual now.
I should speak to <<1>> and learn more about the situation at Muth Gnaar.
I should ask <<1>> whether his ritual revealed the source of Xal Ithix's problems.
I need to look for a Daedric relic buried at the base of an ancient stele near Xal Ithix's Hist tree, west of the xanmeer.
I should speak with the Kothringi held in Zuuk to see if he can help me find the keystone.
I must find Pash-Riha.
I should search the occupied village of <<1>> for the missing Shadowscale agents: <<2>>, <<3>>, and <<4>>.
Set the pile of timbers on fire to get the Ashkhan's attention.
Now that I've retrived the Relleis Lor keystone, I should find <<1>>.\n\nHe's waiting for me at an excavation site in Murkwater.

<<1>> asked me to kill the Dominion leaders, and to collect crystallized fire salts from the Dominion ship. Once I have the fire salts, I'll spread them on the river to destory the Dominion's lifeline, their ship.
Now that I've rescued the Shadowscale agents, I should meet their leader, <<1>>, at the rendezvous. <<2>> said it's on a hill at southwest edge of <<3>>.
I made the necessary cultural exchanges. I should bring the Dunmer book, relic, and clothing back to Rigurt the Brash.

I can find the items Rigurt wants in Muth Gnaar, Shad Astula, and the crafting district in Mournhold. I may have to convince the Dark Elves to trade, however, as they probably aren't aware of this Nord tradition.
I experienced memories of Vox's past and somehow she sensed my presence. I should speak to Aspera about this.
I need to find and speak to <<1>>.
I couldn't let Drillk die on my behalf. The keystone will be safe within him. I should return to <<1>> and let her know about the keystone.
When I retrieved the artifact, <<1>>, the shadowy figure of a Dremora appeared. I better talk to it.
<<1>> said I should take the relic to a ritual site high above Xal Ithix. The relic may somehow stop Namira's minions from whatever corruption they're performing.
<<1>> told me I could use the Hand of Namira to defeat the Dremora. I need to use it to stop the Aspect's ritual and keep corruption from consuming Xal Ithix.
Aspera wants me to experience Vox's memories so that I can learn what brought us to this moment. I need to find the western anima archive to see the earliest memory.
I should attune myself to the anima crystal to observe Vox's earliest memory. Once within the memory, I should speak to Aspera's projection.
I need to find the eastern anima archive to experience Vox's next memory.
I should attune myself to the anima crystal to observe Vox's next memory. Once inside the memory, I should speak to Aspera's projection.
I need to find the central anima archive to experience Vox's final memory.
I should attune myself to the anima crystal to observe Vox's final memory. Once within the memory, I should speak to Aspera's projection.
I should let Ulov know I've witnessed the creature he described.
Ulov is standing near the trapdoor in Ruvali's house. I should ask him if he's seen Ruvali.
The mercenaries have been cured and they fled Zehtswater Cave. I should go outside and find <<1>>.

I need to collect venom from the giant serpents within Zehtswater Cave. Then I need to combine the venom with the Antivenom Kit to create antidotes to the Lamia poison. With the antidote, I can rescue the mercenaries.
An Ordinator informed me that Almalexia wants to see me at the Temple.
Daedra have invaded the Tribunal Temple. I need to destroy them and close the portals that spawn them.

Almalexia informed me invaders still hold the High Chapel. The combined powers of the Tribunal protect the area from mortal entry. To enter the High Chapel, I need to attain the blessings of Vivec and Sotha Sil at each of their altars.
I prayed at Almalexia's altar and now I should speak with her.
In order to receive Vivec's blessing, I need to pass his trial. I should speak with Almalexia to ask for advice.
I need to find a way to repair the Arbiter of Perfection, and then I need to destroy it. When I'm done, I should receive the blessing of Sotha Sil.
I received Vivec's blessing. Now I should go to Sotha Sil's cloister and pray at the altar to start his trial.
I received Sotha Sil's blessing. Now I should go to Vivec's cloister and pray at the altar to start his trial.
I received the three blessings of the Tribunal. Now I should enter the High Chapel and hunt down the leader of this invasion force.
I found a Maulborn high priest in the High Chapel of the Tribunal Temple. He must pay for his crimes.
I defeated Vanus Sathram and saved the Tribunal Temple, but Vox escaped with the Judgment of Veloth. I should tell Almalexia what happened.
I need to return to the mortuary, so I can speak to <<1>>.
Vox weakened Saint Veloth by shattering his reliquary. I need to recover the pieces, scattered around the shrine, and bring them to Master Aron.
The reliquary can now be reassembled and Saint Veloth's powers can be restored. I must go back to the top of the shrine and repair the reliquary.
The reliquary is whole again. I can see that Saint Veloth's spirit has also recovered. I should speak to him.
I restored the Shrine of Saint Veloth and received his blessing. It's time to face Magistrix Vox at Eidolon's Hollow.

I met Acolyte Eldri at the Shrine of Saint Veloth. She collected Dremora hearts for Healer Dalen, who makes strong healing potions from them. I should find Healer Dalen at Eidolon's Hollow and give him the hearts.
I need to escort Elynisi to the inn in the northeast part of town.
I need to find Elynisi Arthalen on the road to Selfora.
The ritual preparation is complete. Talk to <<1>> and begin the final phase of the ritual.
I should use the ritual braziers to summon the guardians. Then I can open the portal into <<1>>.
<<1>> asked me to enter the mine and save some trapped miners, but she wasn't concerned about <<2>>.\n\nShe gave me food scraps to throw at and distract hungry Goblins I might find in the mine.
<<1>> said I need to get the Goblin totem. Then I can stop the Goblins from attacking and help him free them from slavery. The Goblin war chief has the totem. He's in the camp above the mine.
Now that I have the totem, I should give it to <<1>> or <<2>>. They're both waiting in the Mud Tree Village mine.
I gave the <<1>> to <<2>>. He can use it to lead the Goblins to freedom. I should speak to his brothers in <<3>> and let them know what happened.
I collected several pieces of Saint Veloth's Reliquary. I should find Master Aron at the top of the shrine and give the pieces to him.
Before I can seal the wispmother, I must defeat her from within the cave.
I've defeated the wispmother, but if she reforms, I'll need to slay her again to seal her remains.
I need to collect bog rats to use as an offering to Ghost Snake with the bag that I've been given. They can be found in Ghost Snake Vale.
My final trial is to defeat the Shadow Snake, a more sinister aspect of the Ghost Snake.
I have the offering. Now I need to place it in the offering bowl at the Fang Spires and see what happens.
I defeated the Shadow Snake. I'll seek the Ghost Snake's counsel on the issue of trade between the Mabrigash and House Hlaalu.
I walked the Coiled Path and made an offering to the Ghost Snake. It appeared before me. I should speak to it.
I need to lower the wards at the entrance to the Tormented Spire.
With the wards down, I can enter the spire and begin the long climb to the top.
Walks-in-Ash managed to sneak onto the spire after Tanval. She and her troops were cut off when the wards went back up. I need to find her and learn what I can about Tanval's plan.

Walks-in-Ash told me about a series of ancient wards that still block our path up the mountainside. Each one is beneath a Daedric ruin, and each one must be lowered before the Pact soldiers can reach the top.
I've found the first ward on the approach to the spire. We'll need to lower it before we can continue.
I must lower the next ward on the approach to the spire.
The northern pagoda leads to an underground room, which holds the crystal powering the second ward. I can use the House Dres key to enter the room and disable the ward.
I need to remove the crystal powering the second ward from the ruins beneath the northern pagoda.
Holgunn and Walks-in-Ash have taken most of the Tormented Spire. I should find them near the volcano's caldera.
I've found Tanval. I should ask him why he's injured.
The caldera ruins contain the final ward preventing us from confronting the Brother of Strife.
One ward stands between the Pact and the second Brother of Strife.
The final ward has been lowered. We should be able to enter the prison holding the second Brother of Strife.
The Dominion's forces have been routed. <<1>>'s ritual was a success. The Argonian spirits of the forsaken hamlet can now return to the restored Hist tree. They can be at peace.
With the Dominion's leader dead, perhaps <<1>> can find some peace.
I escorted Elynisi safely to the inn. She's speaking to someone named Meldras. I should wait until they finish their conversation.
The door ahead leads to Vox's Hollow. I should look for her there.
Vox draws upon the souls at the center of the Hollow. I should speak to her and provoke her into striking me with Veloth's hammer.
I've been transported to Vox's spirit realm, but the Blessing of Veloth protects me. My memories are still clear and my body is still whole. I should speak to the spirits here to learn more.
The key to lowering the final ward keeping us from Sadal lies in the grasp of a powerful Daedra. I must slay her and claim the key.
I've burnt the Dominion ships and retrieved the Relleis Lor keystone, I should return to <<1>> in Murkwater.
I can use the summoning bowl on the spire to summon Flamespinner.
Tanval said the first spirit is waiting for me on the platform in the center of the caldera.

The spirit of Arch-Mage <<1>> informed me that three Focus Stones are required to open Sadal's prison. The first Focus Stone is on the south side of the caldera. I must cross a pit of molten lava to reach it.
I have the first Focus Stone. I must return it to <<1>>.
<<1>> said another trial awaits me. I must speak to his colleague at the top of the stairs leading into the caldera.
Powerful spells are honed by trial and error. <<1>> wants me to prove my patience by retrieving a Focus Stone from the back of the cave. She said I must follow the spells they took to contain Sadal.
I have the second Focus Stone. I must return to <<1>>.
I must complete one final trial. I'll find the third spirit near a cave above the caldera.
Mavos has charged me with retrieving the final Focus Crystal. To do this, I must understand the ebb and flow of magic and be precise in my movements.
I have the final Focus Stone. I must return to <<1>>.
The spirit magi have agreed to help me. I need to place the three Focus Stones in the center of the caldera.
I've placed the Focus Stones as instructed. I'll finally be allowed access to Sadal's prison.
The spirits have opened a portal into Sadal's prison. At last, we can enter his realm and rebind him within the spire.
The Keeper has trapped several spirits within this realm. I should talk to the spirits and figure out how to set them free.
With the other spirits free, I need to convince Meram to join me. Perhaps by sharing the knowledge I learned with him, he'll regret his actions and join me.
The portal to the Reservoir of Souls stands open. I need to enter it and confront Vox.
I must fight through Vox's minions. Then I can confront Vox and end this.
Vox is dead. Almalexia recovered the hammer. I should speak to her.
Almalexia informed me that the Maulborn unleashed Daedra into the Tribunal Temple. I should enter the Temple and banish the Daedric invaders.
Advisor Varon suggested I seek the assistance of a group of villagers who decided to find the missing people on their own. Slips-Through-Fingers, an Argonian, is apparently connected to the group.
I gathered everything I could. I should return to <<1>>.
I should speak with the Enigma of Sotha Sil to receive its blessing.
I should speak with the Enigma of Vivec to receive its blessing.
I need to find a way into <<1>>.

The Imperial translation journal implies that they seek to create and control Dwarven constructs designed by the ancient Dwarven master Razak. They cannot, however, find the three keys to open the door to his vault.
I've found all three keys to Razak's vault. I should open the vault.
Razak's Vault is open! I should investigate the unsealed chamber.
I've found the cog mold. The Dwemer Journal included a map of the Wheel that emphasized a room to the south. I should take the mold to that chamber.
I should locate Razak's Machine and install the cog to see what happens.
Razak's Machine has spit out a strange Dwarven spider construct. It appears to be waiting for something.
I have made it inside <<1>> and must now search for evidence as to why the Imperials are here.
The Dwemer contraption formed a cog for me, destroying the mold in the process. I should retrieve the completed cog.
The Dominion spy using Saervild's form is dead. Now that I've collected the relics, I should take them back to <<1>>.
Once these medical supplies get to the tower above the overrun camp, I can find out where the keystone is kept.
I need to speak with <<1>> and tell him about the Keystone.
I've buried the remains, which brought <<1>> to the tree. I should speak with her before she passes on.
<<1>> is in a dilapidated building within the prison grounds.
I've retrieved Najeepa's remains from <<1>>. I should bring them to her spirit, so she can finally rest.
I should search the prison towers for any signs of Bezeer's mother. Her spirit has not yet left. I should be able to identify her remains.
I found the spirit of Bezeer's mother. She told me where her remains are. I should go to the tower within the prison and retrieve whatever is left of her remains.
It appears I'm in a vision of the past. I should speak to the Ebonheart Acolyte near me to find out what's happening here.
In the Ash Mountain of the past, Balreth summoned Daedric portals. The acolyte I spoke to gave me a pouch of silver stones. Throwing these into the portals will close them.
Before any of the prisoners can tell me where the keystone is, I need to retrieve medical supplies from an overrun camp on the north side of the prison.
<<1>> has requested that I find and kill the Imperial commander, <<2>>, and recover her lost orders from <<3>>.
<<1>> is dead and <<2>>'s orders retrieved. I should find and inform <<2>>.
I've freed <<1>> from her bonds. I should speak to her.
Now that I've summoned the guardians, I should wait for them to open the portal into Ash Mountain.
I should enter the prison dungeon and locate the keystone.
I need to find <<1>>, a prisoner who entered the dungeon while foraging for supplies.
<<1>> believes the keystone is located within the prison warden's office, which will be in the structure above the cells. We'll need to find our way up there.
I must make a choice: I can absorb the keystone or release the prisoners.
The power released from the keystone has riled up the cannibals. I need to kill them and survive.
I chose to absorb the keystone instead of using it to free the prisoners. <<1>> was driven mad. I must escape the prison and let <<2>> know.
<<1>> fled from the prison after I killed <<2>>. I should meet him outside the prison walls.
<<1>> must still be somewhere within the prison grounds. I need to locate him and tell him what happened to the keystone.
Acolyte Hlen saw the daedroth carry Saint Veloth's Skull into the nearby crypt. I must enter the crypt to recover the holy relic.
Selfora is safe now. I should return to the inn and tell Elynisi about her father.
Elynisi asked me to search the Selfora town hall to find her father, Tidyn. She gave me a key to unlock the building.
I'm in the town hall. Now I should search for Tidyn Arthalen.
The Forlorn One appeared over the body of Tidyn Arthalen. I should speak to the spirit and find out what happened here.

The Forlorn One is actually the spirit of Tidyn Arthalen. He was slain by Magistrix Vox and chained to Selfora by her echo. He wants me to go to the crater in the middle of Selfora, where he'll summon Vox's echo.
The spirit of Tidyn Arthalen summoned the Echo of Vox to the crater at the center of Selfora. I need to subdue the Echo of Vox and capture it by using the decanter.
I defeated and captured the Echo of Vox. It's trapped in the decanter and the curse on Selfora has lifted. Now that this is finished, I should speak to Tidyn.
<<1>> wants to speak with me before I do anything with the keystone.
Vox is dead. Almalexia recovered the hammer. I should speak to her.
I should find Healer Dalen at Eidolon's Hollow and give him the Dremora hearts that Acolyte Eldri collected.
Now that I saved Dithis, I should return to the other mages and give them the good news.

The tree-minder's missing items may be my first clue to solving the mystery. I need to find the broken staff, pages from her book, and the lost key.\n\nI'll head through the tunnel to search for the items in what lies beyond it.
Garyn asked me to journey to Othrenis and find <<1>>. He may need help.
The tree-minder's ghost appeared, hovering over the last object I recovered. I need to talk to this spirit.
I should report what I've discovered to Sees-All-Colors.
<<1>> believes we can use the spirits of the Argonians to revive the Hist tree. I need to use her staff's headpiece to capture some. I'll subdue some spirits and meet her at the tree.

Now that I've subdued some of the hamlet's tormented spirits, I need to take the headpiece to <<1>> at the Hist tree. I'll talk to her once I get there. Perhaps I may come closer to solving this mystery and ending the spirits' torment.
I should find <<1>> in the Fighters Guild. I need to give him the Ayleid tome and the Prismatic Core recovered within the <<2>> ruins.
I found the three keys. Now I need to find the three chests somewhere in the camp.
To imprison Balreth, I must gain control of the guardians at Ash Mountain. To summon the guardians, Garyn wants me to harvest the hearts of lesser Daedra.
The portal stands open. The spirit of <<1>> has appeared once more at the portal entrance. I should speak to him to see if he has any advice for defeating Balreth.
<<1>> believes we can use the spirits of the Argonians to revive the Hist tree. I need to use her staff's headpiece to capture them. The headpiece came from the tree.

Having returned the broken headpiece to the tree-minder, I need to wait and see if she is able to restore the Hist tree â€¦ or at least put her fellow spirits to rest. I'll talk to her when she's finished.
The Dominion is boiling the stolen Hist sap, tormenting the spirits. I need to burn the Dominion's containers of Hist sap to ruin the contents.
I've retrieved the <<1>> from Hectur. I should bring it to <<2>>.
If I'm to procure a bottle of <<1>>, I'll need to swap the real bottle with the fake bottle given to me by Heleran.

The Hist sap is free of the Dominion's refinement containers, so the Argonian spirits should be calm again, but the Dominion's soldiers know where I came from. I must return to the Hist tree and confer with <<1>>.
I've freed the prisoners by destroying the keystone. I should speak with <<1>>.

The tree-minder believes that with the Hist sap freed, she may be able to perform a ritual that will either restore the tree or create a new sapling in its place. She needs me to make certain the Dominion doesn't stop her.
While fighting <<1>>, I can use <<2>> to stun him. <<3>>'s aura will restore me if I'm exhausted.
I'm supposed to meet with Merric and Aelif, top lieutenants in the Fighters Guild. They're investigating a Coldharbour anchor near the city.

I need to protect the hamlet's spirits from Dominion forces. If they destroy the spirits, <<1>>'s ritual will lose its power, and the Hist tree won't be restored. If I fail, the hamlet will remain haunted forever.
He suggested I find the mine foreman, <<1>>. I need more information.
I've retrieved the <<1>> from Fedrasa at the Ebony Flask. I should return it to <<2>>.
If I'm to procure a bottle of <<1>>, I'll need to swap the real bottle with the fake bottle Heleran gave me.
My spider collected the parts Kireth needs to repair the emitter. I should find Kireth and give the parts to her.
Kireth entered the ruins without her brother, who was injured trying to follow her. He invented a control rod to deal with the constructs inside. I need to take it to his sister.
Kireth wants me to create a diversion so she can sneak through the next chamber. She suggested I use her brother's control rod to capture a Dwarven spider. She thinks it might take a few attempts.

Kireth needs spare parts to repair the Dwarven device. Since Dwarven constructs scavenge parts from broken automata, I need to break a few spiders. Then I can use the control rod to direct my follower to gather the parts.
The guardians have appeared. Now I must force them to do their duty and imprison Balreth.
I cleared the way out of the mine. I need to get proof from <<1>> before I allow him to leave.
<<1>> has arrived. He helped me imprison Balreth, a Brother of Strife, forever. I should speak to him and see if anything else remains to be done.
I've slain all three of the vicious creatures plaguing the wilderness of <<1>>. I should return to <<2>> and collect the rewards she mentioned.
I gathered the goods from the locked chests, but they turned out to be nothing more than trinkets. Valuable, but hardly dangerous.\n\nI should return to Kotholl and find out what's going on.
Kotholl wanted to steal the goods to make up for lost pay so that he could feed his family. I told him to return the goods anyway.
<<1>> thinks burning <<2>>'s banner is the best way to get his attention. I agreed to do it. If I fight him one-on-one, his heart will be in my hands in no time.
I need to find her children's remains somewhere in White Rose Prison's dungeon.
I have <<1>>'s heart, as <<2>> requested. I need to find him at the swamp's edge below the Dominion's southeastern camp.
I should find out what Orona plans to do with the kwama cuttle before I turn it over to her.
Balreth's body has been defeated, and his spirit is trapped inside the Daedric ritual circle! I must summon the guardians of Ash Mountain to contain him once and for all.
Now that I have <<1>> and her children's remains, I should take them to the tree she mentioned. It's in the northwest corner of the prison not far from its cave entrance.
Merric and Aelif were ambushed by Daedra! I should help Aelif fend off the attack.
I must use the open portal at Tormented Spire to enter Sadal's prison.
I've entered Sadal's prisonâ€”a strange, volcanic realm somewhere in Oblivion. I must help Tanval, Holgunn, and Walks-in-Ash defeat Sadal.
With Tanval's sacrifice, we've destroyed Sadal's shell. I must summon the guardians of the Tormented Spire before Sadal recovers.
The guardians approach. I must wait until they imprison Sadal's soul forever in Oblivion.
Sadal is defeated. He's imprisoned forever. It's time to return to Tamriel.
We have safely returned to Tamriel. I should speak with Walks-in-Ash.
Tanval's spirit has appeared outside the Tormented Spire. I may be the only one who can see him. I should see what he has to say.
Tanval's spirit is at peace, and Stonefalls is safe. I should give <<1>> the news about his new position as interim leader of the Pact in Stonefalls.

After a number of attempts, I finally got one of the Dwarven spiders to follow me around like some kind of pet. So that's what the control rod does! I should find Kireth Vanos in the next chamber and show her.
Edrasa Drelas asked me to gather plants so she could make a potion to counter the effects of the fumes. She can use either redweed or aloe leaves.
I gathered the ingredients Edrasa requested. I should take them to her so she can make more of the potion.
Edrasa asked me to bring the potion to her husband, Boril. He went back into the mine to help his workers.
The Dwarven spider following me was destroyed. I need to use the control rod to get another one.
Part 1 is to talk to QAT Talking Interactable
Return to the QA Quest Interactable
You must talk to the QAT Conversationalist to advance this quest.
The Dwarven Spider following me was destroyed. I need to use the control rod to get another one.
<<1>> intends to take the transformed Dithis as his Goblin matron. I must defeat the warlord to save this unfortunate event.
I should take Merric back to Sees-All-Colors.
I recovered a broken Dwarven relic from the locked chest. Kireth Vanos will want to see this.
I should adjust the prisms until they work in some way that makes sense.
I found a large chest and a Dwarven spider in the room beyond the huge door. Perhaps the spider has the key I need to open the chest.
I directed the beam of light until it struck a prism set above the huge door. I heard a loud click, as though a large lock disengaged. I should open the door.
Cultists and various creatures loyal to Vox lurk in the ruins of Eidolon's Hollow. I need to kill as many as I can to help out the Ordinators.
I killed a number of Vox's troops. When I get the chance, I should report to Ordinator Gorili outside the ruins or to Ordinator Eron in Mournhold and let them know what I accomplished.
I killed a number of Vox's troops. When I get the chance, I should report to Ordinator Gorili outside the ruins or to Ordinator Eron in Mournhold and let them know what I accomplished.
I killed a number of Vox's troops. When I get the chance, I should report to Ordinator Gorili outside the ruins or to Ordinator Eron in Mournhold and let them know what I accomplished.
I defeated the giant spider and found a key. I should see if the key opens the ornate Dwarven chest at the back of the chamber.
A dead man appeared as I came close to the island, and called out to me. I should speak with it.
I must enter the dungeon beneath the tower to save Merric.

An Ashlander named <<1>> seeks the death of three fearsome creatures: a clannfear named <<2>>, a netch named <<3>>, and a nix hound named <<4>>. These creatures have killed many people in recent months.
I survived the dangers presented by the Argonian spirits trapped in torment, and I reached <<1>>'s hut. I need to speak to the spirit that inhabits it now.
I recovered a broken Dwarven relic from the locked chest. Kireth Vanos will want to see this.
I found J'kur's body. He was holding a note and a map. The note was intended for someone named Vahara. The map points at an area north of the plantation. I should go there and look for Vahara.
I've killed the Dominion leaders and collected the fire salts. Now I should spread the fire salts around the river. I can toss the salts from the river shore.
I should talk to Sees-All-Colors once more about the forging of the weapon and the events at the Earth Forge.
<<1>> summoned the <<2>>, but it killed him. He never gave me the reward he promised, but if I decide to search his bag, he's in no position to object
There must be someone in <<1>> who can identify this figure.
<<1>> promised me a huge reward for bringing him the fetish. He's eager to use his new prize, and he asked me to wait.
I purchased the statue from <<1>>. He might know something about where it came from.
I was told a Dark Elf named <<1>> was recently in the area searching for a statue. He's currently searching the Daedric ruins on the plateau south of <<2>>, overlooking <<3>>.
<<1>> said his people occasionally find these statues buried in the Ashlands. He insisted that he didn't know their purpose. He suggested I speak with a priest of the tribunal at Kragenmoor.
The puzzle stones are now something called a Hist key. Keys unlock things, but what lies behind the lock? I need to talk to Looks to find out more.
<<1>> succumbed to the enchantment of the Fangs of Sithis, but he repented as he was dying. More importantly, I've recovered only one Fang. The other is gone. I must tell <<2>>.
I chose to keep the Fangs of Sithis and the decision stuck. I should talk to <<1>> and see what he thinks.
One of the researchers, <<1>>, has been watching the pirates. He may have useful information.
<<1>> knows more about these ancient ruins. Talking to him could help me decide whether to help them.
The pirates have stumbled on the key to a great treasure, but they don't know it yet. I need to recover something called a <<z:1>>. I can use it to find another piece of the puzzle.
The green puzzle stone can lead me to the next clue, but I have to be careful. The pirates camped here might be drunk, but they aren't blind.
The pirates have definitely found the clues to entering the Argonian xanmeer, but haven't put them together yet. I need to find the next puzzle stone.
At least one pirate thought the <<z:1>> was important enough to lock up. I should use the stone to find the last of the three.
Another stone was hidden away by the pirates. I need to find the <<1>>.
Merric was taken to a tower on an island nearby. I should go to this island in search of Merric.
Merric asked me to search the bodies of the Worm Cultists who attacked him.
That's the last of them. I'd best watch my step, or I'll draw the pirates' attention.
Now that I've reported in to Sees-All-Colors, she wants me to join Aelif. To keep Merric safe. I should make my way to them at once.
The last wisp floated up the xanmeer's stone steps. I should climb to the top and see what's there.
I need to see if the Argonian on top of the xanmeer knows about the puzzle stones and how they relate to the xanmeer.
Elynisi has asked me to go to the temple on the hill to look for survivors. I can reach the temple by taking the stairs to the south and crossing the bridge.
A spirit called the Forlorn One has materialized at the temple's entrance. It appears to want to speak with me.
The Forlorn One asked me to find a decanter of holy water on the lower level of the temple. The water has the power to quench the magical fire consuming Selfora.
Now that I have the decanter of holy water, I should speak to the Forlorn One at the temple's entrance.
The Forlorn One has summoned a vision of the past. I should watch and learn what happened to Selfora.
I should test the potency of the holy water on the brazier of magic fire in the center of the temple's lower chamber.
The Forlorn One shared a vision of the past with me. I should ask him about it.
Now that Elynisi is safely in the inn, I should talk to her and see what she wants me to do next.
I completed the memory challenge. I should speak to Arch-Mage Valeyn to find out what he wants me to do next.
<<1>> asked me to retrieve several valuable scrolls that should have survived the fires. He also wants me to find his fellow devotees: <<2>>, <<3>>, and <<4>>.
I've rescued the three devotees and recovered the scrolls. I should return to <<1>>.
I need to search the burning homes in the southern part of Selfora for the two people the Forlorn One mentioned. The holy water should put out the fire blocking the doors so that I can enter them.
I rescued the young man and the woman, just as the spirit asked. I should return to the inn and make sure Elynisi is all right.
If I want to visit Shad Astula, I need to acquire an invitation. Maybe I can get an invitation from one of the students waiting along the docks.
<<1>> has some definite ideas on how to conduct the investigation. She wants me to search Jofnir's quarters. I should examine his room to see what I can find.
<<1>> asked me to meet her elsewhere in the region. She wants to make the run to Ragnthar with me.
We've defeated the Dwarven automatons. I should speak to <<1>>.
I should witness what the spirit of <<1>> has to say.
I should speak to Merric about what to do next.
<<1>> summoned the spirit of <<2>>. He revealed Sees-All-Colors as his murderer. I should speak to <<1>> about what we witnessed.
While searching Jofnir's private quarters, I found a journal that mentioned a place called Ragnthar. I should return to Aelif and report in.
I should follow <<1>> to Ragnthar.
I should rescue the villagers from Dominion troops and find <<1>>'s husband, <<2>>.
<<1>> ran off as soon as I destroyed the master crystal. He's probably gone to his home near the village center. I should find <<2>> and tell her he's free.
The cave entrance is along the western pass out of town.
I acquired an invitation to the Academy. I should speak to the Boatmaster when I'm ready to visit Shad Astula.
I arrived at Shad Astula. My invitation says I should report to the Academy's registrar.
A villager I saved said <<1>> is being held in a nearby hut. I must free him by removing any crystals or Dominion soldiers guarding him.
I should speak to <<1>>, so she can start the ritual.
The ancient traps and deadly guardians of this underground ruin are dangerous. <<1>> is just as deadly. I must keep him from recovering the Fangs of Sithis.
The Hist key unsealed the door, which means I can enter the ruins. I must stop <<1>> and recover the Fangs of Sithis.
Merric has begun forging the weapon's core. He needs a small fire to begin the process.
The forging is well underway. Now Merric needs a medium-sized fire stoked to continue the process.
This is it. To complete the forging process, Merric needs a large blaze.
Somehow, the Arch-Mage knows I arrived at the Academy. He wants to talk to me in the main building.
The Arch-Mage needs to make sure I can handle myself around magic. He wants me to go into the next chamber and solve the memory challenge. I need to touch the glowing orb and memorize the sequence.
I watched the sequence of the lights. All I have to do now is touch the orbs in the same order.
I completed the memory challenge. I should speak to Arch-Mage Valeyn to find out what he wants me to do next.
Telbaril saw an old house up the trail. I should investigate for any signs of Rulantaril.

A note in the old house mentioned that Rulantaril studied magic. He learned his craft from a witch at a place called the Blackfeather Court. I need to find the court and see if anyone there can tell me more.

The magister said that Rulantaril locked the tower key in a cursed chest. The chest isn't far from the Blackfeather Court. If I'm going to get inside the tower and find Rulantaril, I'm going to need that key.
I acquired the key to the tower. Now I need to get inside.
The Daedric Lord called Crow Mother is inside the tower. She isn't rushing to attack me. I should speak with her to determine what to do next.
I agreed to help the Daedra Lord called Crow Mother. I need to subdue Rulantaril and make him honor his agreement.
I decided to destroy the Daedra Lord called Crow Mother. She fled into a tower. I should follow after her.
Both Rulantaril and the Daedra Lord called Crow Mother are reprehensible beings. I decided to put an end to both of them.
I "persuaded" Rulantaril to see reason and fulfill his obligation to Crow Mother. I need to tell Telbaril about the outcome.
Crow Mother has been banished, and Rulantaril is free. I should return to Telbaril and tell him the good news.
Rulantaril is dead, and Crow Mother has been banished. I should tell Telbaril.
<<1>> asked me to enter the mine and save the trapped miners. She wasn't concerned with finding <<2>>. She gave me food scraps. I can use them to distract hungry Goblins.
There are fires belowdecks, and I can see why. <<1>> has been using the second Fang of Sithis on her own crew. Time to take it away from her.
I must search the pirate ship. <<1>> heard screams. I should look for the ship's captain.
Rumor has it the innkeeper hates the stink of lizards, especially the ones from the Argonian quarter.
According to rumor, the innkeeper hates loud noises, especially explosions. I've been told an alchemist living nearby keeps some flash powder in his dresser.
According to rumor, the innkeeper hates the stink of lizards, especially the ones found in the Argonian quarter.
According to rumor, the innkeeper hates loud noises, especially explosions. I've been told an alchemist living nearby keeps some flash powder in his dresser.
I helped Lena, Tedras, and Hadmar pass their tests. Now I should return to Arch-Mage Valeyn and see if he's figured out what's going to threaten the Academy.

The Arch-Mage believes that Lena Dalvel, Tedras Relvi, and Hadmar the Thin-Boned will emerge as great leaders in the Ebonheart Pact. He wants me to help them pass their initiation tests so that his visions have a chance to come true.
I collected the healing supplies. I should bring them to Aamela at the inn.
I should search the town for healing supplies.
I should go speak to <<1>> about <<2>>'s strange silence.
I'm reliving painful memories from <<1>>'s past. I must say the things he wished he had said.

<<1>> was working beneath the Hist tree. He trapped <<2>>'s spirit with the same crystals the Dominion used on the villagers. Whatever he's doing to <<2>> also affects the Hist tree. It must be stopped.
<<1>> decided to return to Narsis, Feyne's hometown.
I must attempt the Trial of the Mind.
<<1>> has contracted me to kill <<2>>.
Now that I've killed my target, I should return to <<1>> to collect my payment.
I've cleared the tunnels as far as the final room. Now I must search for the Ashkhan and defeat him.
The Ashlanders should let me pass when I use <<1>> near them.
Shad Astula is safe again, and it's time to move on. The students I helped want to speak to me before I leave. They're waiting for me at the docks, near the boat back to Mournhold.
The Arch-Mage hasn't heard from the librarian, so he asked me to use the trapdoor to check the library vaults.
I can ask my fellow Dark Brotherhood members and other people for information on my current contract.
<<1>> is in town at a vendor stall.
He only drinks from his own flask. I'll have to find a way to get him away from his wine bottle so I can poison it.
Rumor has it that <<1>> trades in poisons.
He runs Flash Powder for the Blacksails, but lost his wares to fire due to an accident with Flash Powder. He may have some in his stuff that I could use to spook him.
<<1>> has asked me to accompany her to an ancient Ayleid ruin. She hopes our exploration will help us understand what we saw at Mzeneldt.
I need to put a <<1>>, a <<2>>, and <<3>> in their appropriate chests.
I need to put a <<1>>, a <<2>>, and <<3>> in their appropriate chests.
I need to put a <<1>>, a <<2>>, and <<3>> in their appropriate chests.
Now that I'm in the library, I should look around and see if I spot anything unusual.
As I investigated the library vaults, someone ambushed me. I woke up in a locked cell with Tedras and Lena. \n\nI should speak to them and find out what happened.
I should examine the gate. Maybe I can find a way to open it.
A small banekin scattered the Maulborn outside and walked through the locked gate. It appears to want to talk to me.
I didn't find Ra-shadda at Ruvali's home. Ruvali is kneeling over her husband's corpse. Perhaps she's spoken to Ra-shadda. I should find out.
Ulov is dead, and the dro-m'Athra destroyed. I must return to Ruvali and Ra-shadda.
A friendly banekin rescued us. He said that Arch-Mage Valeyn sent him. We're supposed to find Hadmar, who's hiding in the building next door.
Hadmar set his totem up near a large rock to the north. I can use the totem to reach the lockbox Lena hid on top of the rock.
When I found the lockbox and tried to open it, Lena appeared. I should speak to her.

Lena thinks we should cast a spell of unlocking to get into the library vaults and deal with the Maulborn. I'll need to gather dust from the illusory monsters and use the wand to collect scorched Scamp hide.
I collected the ingredients for the spell of unlocking. I should find the library trap door in the Arch-Mage's office and summon Tedras to cast the spell.
I found the Maulborn general in the caves connected to the library. He enslaved students and captured the Arch-Mage. I need to deal with this villain.
I defeated the Maulborn general. Now I need to shatter the crystal to release the spell holding the students.
I'm back at the library door and the Arch-Mage's familiar summoned Tedras to meet me. I should give Tedras the ingredients and tell him what we're planning.
I woke up in the Academy dormitory. It seems that everything is back to normal. I should talk to Arch-Mage Valeyn and find out what happened.
<<1>> and I have arrived at the entrance to Ragnthar. I should speak to her and find out what we should do next.
I must report to Sees-All-Colors about the incident at the Earth Forge.
I should speak with <<1>> to start the Trial of the Heart once more.
I must close the Daedric portals scattered throughout the Shrine of Saint Veloth. Each portal is anchored to this plane by a watcher. Killing the watcher will break the link and close the portal.
Now that the portals are closed, the priests can eliminate any remaining Daedra and resanctify the shrine.
I closed the portals. No additional Daedra can come through into the shrine. I should find Priest Dilyne near the central dais at the top of the shrine.
Hectur hates Valen's singing and will fight him if he sings.
Hectur hates the rats around here. If one gets into his bar, he'll chase it outside.
I found Wideem-Voh, but was too late to save him. I should find his necklace and return it to his father.
I should return to <<1>> with his son's necklace.
Aelif suggested I speak to some of the other guild members. Perhaps they know something more about Jofnir's trips to Ragnthar.
A daedroth carried off a holy relic, the Skull of Saint Veloth. I need to find Acolyte Hlen, who's been tracking the creature near the western crypts.
During the fight, <<1>> killed Garyn. Tanval attacked Holgunn in a fit of rage and took the Coral Heart. I should speak to Holgunn.

The treasure <<1>> expected to be in the Khajiit's hideout was not there. A pirate named <<2>> said he and his gang would be willing to help me track it down, if I spared them. I should follow him out of the hideout and up the ladder.
Telbaril followed me to the old house. I should let him know what I found.
A priest of Veloth claims the saint's fading spirit is expecting me. I should find the Vestige of Saint Veloth at the shrine entrance, on the stairs near the bridge to Tal'Deic Fortress.
I should speak to the talking crow and find out what I can about this toll.
The crows demand a feast. I've been commanded to kill eight bats as a meal for the murder of crows.
I've been charged with finding silver treasures in Crow's Wood. They could serve as tribute to the Blackfeather Court.
I paid the toll of flesh. The crows feasted on the remains of their monstrous foes. I should report to the Seneschal of Carrion in the Blackfeather Court.
The toll has been paid. I've been directed to speak to the Duke of Crows, the leader of the Blackfeather Court.
I should speak to <<1>>, the Mages Guild Mistress of Incunabula.
<<1>> believes she knows how to summon <<2>>.
We've summoned <<1>>. I should speak to him and see what he wants me to do.
I should enter the portal to Sheogorath's shrine.
I've retrieved the book. I should return to the Guildhall and speak to <<1>>.
I should speak to <<1>>
I should speak to <<1>> about the location of the tomes.
<<1>> said to follow the path outside into Cheesemonger's Hollow. The tomes I need are hidden there.
A monster bars my way to the spellbooks.
After I took one of the tomes, <<1>> made the rest of them disappear. I should speak to him and find out what he wants.
I recovered the holy relic from the daedroth. I should speak to the Vestige of Saint Veloth and find out what to do next.
I've collected silver trinkets the crows desire. I need to bring them to the Seneschal of Carrion in the Blackfeather Court.

The Randoro brothers were clear on what would happen to <<1>> if he performed their routine poorly. I've decided to keep it a secret and just throw away the notes. I should speak with <<1>> one more time.

The ghosts made it clear that if someone performed the rite incorrectly, he would be killed. I must decide whether to tell <<1>> about the performance and let him die. If I keep it a secret, that could save his life.
Like <<1>>, the pirate captain was driven mad by the Fang of Sithis. I defeated her and recovered the second Fang. Now I should find <<2>> at his camp.
Nojaxia requested my help completing her elixir's formula. I agreed to bring her grub grass for her experiment. It grows beneath the waterfall to the west.
I must return to Nojaxia with the reagents I've collected.
Nojaxia requested I give the elixir she made to an Argonian named Not-So-Quick. He's hiding behind a large mushroom in town.
Not-So-Quick became ill after drinking Nojaxia's potion. I should return to Nojaxia and report the effects of her elixir.
Nojaxia adjusted the elixir. She assures me she has it right now. She's asked me to drink it in the "exact center" of Lukiul Uxith.
I drank the elixir. Now must return to Nojaxia, so I can tell her what I saw.
<<1>> succumbed to the enchantment of the Fangs, but repented. More importantly, I've recovered only one Fang. The other is gone. I must tell <<2>>.
I eliminated the Daedric threat. Almalexia said to find her altar when I was finished. It's in her cloister.
I gave the <<1>> to <<2>>. Now he can return it to <<3>>. She's waiting in the village with my reward. <<4>> is safe.
I should give Sheogorath's book to Valaste.
I need to find <<1>>. He may know what's going on down here.
I need to report in to Vigrod. He must be told about the Reachmen's dark ritual.
I should find <<1>> in Shor's Stone to let him know I saved as many miners as I could.
I need access to the prison, so I can speak with <<1>>. One of the guards could let me in and tell me where the general is.
I defeated the giant chieftain. I should speak with <<1>>
Irna asked that I find her family in the countryside surrounding <<1>>. I should start by looking for her husband, Gjakil.
After we performed the Song of Sinmur <<1>> yelled to me that the bards were waking up. I should speak to her.
I retrieved the books. I should speak to the librarian.
<<1>> is building a pair of effigies to clear the way to the mine. She gave me a talisman to collect magicka from imbued corpses outside town.
<<1>> asked that I channel the corrupted magicka into the effigies. That should lower the energy shield around the mine.
I've collected the corrupted magicka into the Argonian talisman, as <<1>> requested. I need to get back to her.
The mine entrance is clear. I need to get inside the mine, find out if anyone is still alive, and discover what the Reachmen are doing.
Companion leader Vigrod Wraithbane is offering aid to the Pact at Shor's Stone. He's asked me to work with the Argonian, <<1>> to break into the Shor's Stone mine.

I must dig citizens out from under the rubble of collapsed structures. Fires must be extinguished using water drawn from the wells. Finally, the bodies of the dead must be burned to prevent the spread of disease.
I've worked to help the people of Riften recover from the giant's attack. I should report to <<1>> inside Riften.
I should take the runestone to <<1>> in <<2>> to see if she knows anything about the dead Nord.

The Pact's efforts to learn anything about the cult at Vernim have met with little success. Dajaheel wants me to help a Lieutenant Belron with a necromantic ritual. To begin, I'll need to cut the heart from a Worm Cultist.
