I should interrogate the cultist to learn why the Worm Cult and Reachmen are working together.
The Worm Cultists are transforming the Reachmen as a part of an agreement between Stral and the head of the Worm Cult. I must report back to Dajaheel at once.
<<1>> told me to look for a drunk bard named <<2>> upstairs at the manorhouse and convince him to help me perform the Song of Sinmur.
I found Gandis. He told me the Reach broke into an ancient Companion tomb deep beneath the mine. A pair of relics gave them access to the tomb. I must find those relics!
I've retrieved the pair of relics the Reach used to access the tomb. I need to place them to open the door.
I've made it into the Companion tomb! I need to find the shamans Gandis told me about.
<<1>> has agreed to help me. I should use the instruments hung on the walls to teach him the tune.
The toll has been paid. I've been directed to speak to the Duke of Crows, the leader of the Blackfeather Court.
The miner I found mentioned several others being lead away. I should seek them out.
I've performed the tune for <<1>>. I should speak with him again.
Now that I've collected Engling's Lute, I should head to the southern island. <<1>> awaits me there to perform the song.
Defend <<1>> while he performs.
I need to use water to fight the fires. My hands aren't that big, so I'll need to find a bucket.
I have a bucket full of water. I need to stand near the fires and use it.

The Sage of Skald's Retreat believes a powerful song can counteract Engling's spell. She's instructed me to speak with the bards of the Retreat. I must learn the lyrics and tune to the Song of Sinmur.
I've learned the Song of Sinmur. Odana instructed me to meet her at the Retreat's manorhouse.
Now that I have the crystal shards, I should return to Geoffroi.
I should return the <<m:1>> to <<2>>.
I have collected the crystal shards and now need to return to B. Stower.
I found the five shards of the crystal. I should return them to Geoffroi.
I have collected the crystal shards. I shoud return them to Julian Kalere just outside the valley.
I'm collecting shards for Geoffroi. The nearby Supernal Dreamers hold the pieces.
I should recover the crystal shards.
I need to defeat the Supernal Dreamers and collect the crystal shards.
Now I must murder supernal dreamers to collect antique crystal shards.
I collected a number of books. I should return them to the library.
I've done it. I need to grab one of the books set out on the stands.
<<1>> has summoned <<2>> to Cheesemonger's Hollow. This should prove interesting.
<<1>> disappeared after speaking to <<2>>. I should speak to the Arch-Mage.
The book has transported me to one of Sheogorath's realms of Madness. I should talk to Sheogorath to start the next trial.
I should meet Marcus outside the Supernal Dreamer camp.
I should talk to Daeril in a safe location, away from the Supernal Dreamer camp.
I have freed the Prisoner now I should talk to him.
I untied a guy. Hooray.
I should talk to ol' Bob.
I should talk to the young man where he said he would meet me, behind the house.
I'm freeing Kidnapped Guy.
I have released <<1>>, and he has escaped from the Supernal Dreamers' camp.
I've found a book about <<1>> and the keystones in the warden's office.
Tedras unlocked the library door. I need to find the Arch-Mage and deal with the Maulborn general.
Shad Astula is safe again, and it's time to move on. The students I helped want to speak to me before I leave. They're waiting for me at the docks, near the boat back to Mournhold.
To bring the family together at last, I need to find <<1>>'s ashes within the dungeon.
I should examine the book on the table nearby.
Sheogorath has summoned actors that look like the leaders of the Ebonheart Pact. I'll have to destroy them to advance this insane trial.
The "Queen Ayrenn" actress is the only foe still facing me. I should destroy her to move on.
The only opponent still standing in my way is an actor meant to represent High King Emeric, leader of the Covenant. He'll have to be destroyed if I want to complete my trial.
I think I've managed to complete Sheogorath's insane trial. I should speak to him to get my reward.
I should collect Engling's Lute for <<1>>.
I have killed the Twilight Boss so I should return to Julian Kalere.
Oh good I can die in peace.
Go back to <<1>>.
I should talk to Geoffroi, and tell him I've killed Remelie Frinck for him.
I should return to Geoffroi with the good news of Remelie's death.
I killed the boss. Now I should talk to <<1>> for my just desserts.
I have defeated the leader of the Supernal Dreamers.
I should have vocal intercourse with Troggg.
Remelie is waiting in the middle of the Test Realm.
I am off to murder <<1>>.
I must go and hunt down the boss and kill him
I should kill the Twilight Boss.
Kill Boss Man
I've killed Remelie and should return to Geoffroi.
I need to kill the <<1>>.
Now that I have the final book, I should speak to Valaste.
The beast is in the house.
Did you kill Cloggg?
Bosses are mean and don't feal pain the same way we do.
I should talk to Geoffroi, but lie to him about Remelie's death.
I need to decide whether to lie or tell the truth.
I lied about killing the boss.
Oh well even without the medicne I can die in peace, but in alot of pain.
I should return to the dying guy and tell him what happened.
I lied to Geoffroi about Remelie's death, but I may be able to get the reward out of him.
Tell him or don't.
Or or or.
I have defeated the leader of the Supernal Dreamers. Now I need to report to <<1>>.
I have defeated the leader of the Supernal Dreamers, but lied to <<1>> about it.
I totally lied to <<1>>.
Now I have to tell <<1>> the truth about murder or lie and say I didn't. I am the next phase of human storytelling.
I should follow <<1>>.
I should use the attunement crystal <<1>> has summoned.
The alchemist who created the Llodos Plague has taken control of the Obsidian Gorge. I should head there and offer my assistance to Commander Renli.
Varon suggests I speak to Naryu back in Narsis. She's uncovered information that she wants to share with me.
Corruption surrounds the Hist tree. I need to dig up the Daedric relic nearby and get it away from here.
I should look for Ordinator Kilao in Mournhold.
I've found <<1>> and retrieved the Goblin totem for him. Then I heard a cry for help nearby. I should investigate to see if the Goblins trapped one of the other miners.
I can use the totem to gain influence over the Goblin tribe. I need to engage Goblins in combat and show them the totem once they have been sufficiently weakened.
I must find a ruin nearby, which Valaste says may hold a store of ancient knowledge.
I've found the ruins <<1>> spoke of. Now to find those tomes.
<<1>> asked me to place the tome in the flaming brazier.
Belron left camp, hoping to learn more about the rituals. I should seek him out in the field.
I must obtain the heart of the Graveborn.
Belron needs more research materials from the Graveborn rituals being performed around Vernim. I have a lot of work to do.
I've collected three more hearts from the Graveborn. I must return to Belron at the Pact camp.
Belron suggested I slay any Graveghasts that channel energy into the Reachman.
I need to report to Guard Verilu in Narsis and explain what transpired at Quarantine Serk.
The Rift knows of the danger posed by the Reachmen. I should report in to Captain Jardirr. She said she'd escort her men back to the tower.
I've sent the Reachmen's clanholders to Oblivion, as Melril asked. Now to honor his memory, I must plant a Pact banner at the top of the signal hill.

Sheogorath says he wants one of his houseguests evicted, that they aren't fitting in. He also warned me that some of them are homicidal. I should talk to the guests and decide which one I want to evict.

Sheogorath wants me to tour another part of his Chateau, a maze. He thinks the ambiance in there is too dark, and wants me to light some braziers as I go. He also said something about "Bumps in the Night"?

I've found the heirlooms Sheogorath spoke of. He gave me some confusing clues as to what to do: "Four lights in a row, poke one to make it glow." and "Four lights in a trough, poke one to turn it off."
I'm guessing Sheogorath won't let me advance without having a chat first. I should speak to him.
I've survived Sheogorath's trials. Hopefully now he'll just give me the last tome.
I spoke with the Retreat's librarian, a man named Bragur. He told me that Vaermina's nightmare creatures stole the books to preserve her secrets. He wants me to return them to the library.

<<1>> leapt into the fighting at Boulderfall, hoping to save as many soldiers as she could. She's now missing. I've been asked to ease some of the pressure from the Pact troops. Some of them may know where she is.
<<1>>, the military leader I met at Shor's Stone, has taken command of the outpost. I should speak with him.
One of the pact soldiers told me that <<1>> has holed up in a small cave near the battlefield. I should find her there and ensure she's safe.
<<1>> is fine. She insisted that my priority should be lighting the signal fire at the top of the nearby hill. I need to make my way there.
I found the signal fire. I should light the starter fire near the pit. The smoke column should alert the region.
I should tell <<1>> what I've seen in the spellbook.
To gain revenge for his death, <<1>> asked me to kill the leaders of the three Reachmen tribes at Boulderfall.
I agreed to save the three houses from the fire. First, I need to fill the bucket with water from a nearby well.
I found <<1>> and an Imperial summoner, <<2>>. I have to stop him before any more Daedra show up to slay the remaining villagers.
I defeated the Imperial summoner, <<1>>, and rescued <<2>>. I should speak to <<3>>.
<<1>> said he won't let me pass unless I pass a test. He wants me to close a portal to prove myself.
I collected the Graveborn's heart. I should speak to Belron.
Paldeen and I have to get out of the Khajiit-controlled section of the ruins.
Paldeen has prompted me to search for a tablet in the chamber ahead.
The tablet suggests that I need to collect three sacred jewels from the ruins. The Eyes of Yokuda. They can be used to unlock the door to the Archive.
I opened the Yokudan Archive. I should escort Paldeen while he looks around.
I need to take the Cartulary of the Tamed Dunes from the unlocked chest.
I need to find the Cartulary and then lead Paldeen out of the ruins.
I survived the dangers of the Lost City with Paldeen and retrieved the Cartulary. I should speak with Paldeen again.
Now that the portal is closed, I should speak to <<1>>.
I need to follow the path to a town held by the Ebonheart Pact.
Sheogorath has moved on. I'll need to follow the path to the next town, held by the Aldmeri Dominion.
Sheogorath has moved on to the final town, a place meant to represent the Daggerfall Covenant. I should meet him there.
The spirit's voice spoke of missing relics connected to its knighthood. Perhaps if I uncover these relics, the spirit will find rest.
Upon collecting the missing pieces of the spirit's sword and shield, it accused me of graverobbing. Perhaps if I find its resting place I can return them.
The spirit appeared before me at its tomb. I should find out why it has taken an interest in me.
The spirit left to find its liege lord. Perhaps if I locate the liege lord myself, I can put the spirit to rest.
I found the tomb the spirit's liege lord. I should explore it to see if I can find a way to put the spirit to rest.
I should destroy the urn before the <<1>> returns.
The spirit drove away the ghost of the <<1>>, who had murdered the spirit's liege lord. It asked me to destroy the <<1>>'s <<z:2>>. The spirit believes doing so will end the <<1>>'s threat.
Almalexia suggested I start my search for Vox in the village of Selfora, east of Mournhold.
Now I need to throw water on the fires burning in each house to douse the flames.
After I put out the last of the fires, surviving villager <<1>> called to me. He's outside this house, so I should step outside to locate and speak with him.
I collected the Eyes of Yokuda. With the Eyes in hand, I should be able to open the Archive door.
I've extinguished the fires around the crops.
Paldeen finished examining the tablet. He wants to speak with me.
Belron thinks he knows a way past this death shroud. He's given me a jar of dark sludge and told me to drink it, if I want to get past the death shroud.
I've drunk the potion. I should speak to Belron to learn what my next move should be.
Belron has sort-of killed me. He hopes that will be enough to get me past the death shroud. At the base of the ruin, I should find an idol or totem. Destroying it should drop the shroud.
The way is clear and the soldiers of the Pact are with me. I need to enter the ruin.
With the aid of the Pact soldiers, I'm set. Time to kill Stral Blackthroat. When that's complete, we will need to regroup with the remaining Pact soldiers outside the cave.
Stral is dead. Unfortunately, he took Dajaheel and Belron with him. I should return to the encampment and regroup with whomever is left.
Once I've entered the cave <<1>> mentioned, I should look for <<2>>.
<<A:1>> can send me directly to <<2>>, the Dominion soldier responsible for corrupting <<3>>'s memories.
The idol has been destroyed, and the shroud is gone. Belron has arrived with backup. I should speak to him.
I can listen to <<1>> if I need help remembering the tune.
Destroying the crystals imprisoning <<1>> should also free the Hist tree.
There are at least a dozen Yokudan relics in this ruin that I can retrieve.
Nahrina is being harassed by a so-called debt collector. I should speak to him and intervene.
I need to finish my business with Nahrina and let her know of her husband's death.
I chased off the debt collector. I should talk to Nahrina.
Before <<1>> can give me a blessing, she needs me to gather a special mushroom. She told me to watch out for the wamasu used in cultivating the mushrooms.
I found the Yokudan relics. According to Tavo's note, Tavo's wife, Nahrina, is in Sentinel. I should travel to Sentinel.
I should return to <<1>> for the blessing that will enable me to locate <<2>>'s spirit.
Now that I have subdued the Gnaw-Root tribe, I should return to the mine and decide who should take the totem.
While I examined this soldier, it's eye fell out. It must have been rotting for days.
Bandages covering a soldier's mortal wounds are caked with clotted blood that has been dried for several days.
A soldier's hand is covered with necrotic lesions. It must have been dead for several days.
I collected a number of putrified body parts from dead Covenant soldiers. Strangely, these specimens appear to be long deadâ€”several days old, at least. Perhaps Garyn will know what it means.
I need to find <<1>> as quickly as I can. Shalidor says she's translated the last book I won from Sheogorath.
Sheogorath told me the story behind his "Uncle Leo." The beast is apparently now an embarassment to the family, and needs to be disposed of.
<<1>> would rather be destroyed than reanimated. He's asked me to light the room on fire. A nearby candle should serve that purpose.
I can use the candle to ignite the books in the tower. That should put <<1>> and his friends out of their misery.
<<1>> kept watch over me while I searched for and freed <<2>>'s spirit.
I need to tell <<1>> that Wuuthrad is missing.
I need to head to <<1>> and see what's happening in the area.
<<1>> can stay in Percolating Mire to train as a healer, but he's free to leave with <<2>>. I should help him make a choice.
<<1>> decided to remain in Percolating Mire to train as a healer.
Sheogorath sure does love the sound of his own voice. Time to talk to him again.
I've found my way out of the maze. Sheogorath is back again to have a chat. Time for another conversation.
I returned the flesh to the Argonian victims. I should speak to <<1>>.
I need to find the bodies of the other prisoners <<1>> spoke of and use <<Az:2>> on them. He said a Shadowscale, <<3>>, would then be able to find them.
I found four of the missing prisoners. <<1>> said <<2>> is waiting ahead, farther into the caves.
<<1>> says a lamia has taken pieces of his friends as trophies. Without them, their spirits cannot rest. I should slay this lamia and take back what she has stolen.
I retrieved the prisoners' flesh and bones. I should return to the antechamber to meet <<1>>.
I retrieved the prisoners' flesh and bones. I should return to the antechamber to meet <<1>>.
<<1>> has asked me to make the bodies whole again by returning what the lamia tore from them. He hopes that will console their spirits and allow them to rest.
I returned the flesh to the Argonian prisoners. I should speak to <<1>>.
I should head to <<1>> and find <<2>>. He may need some help.

Netapatuu gave me a crystal shard containing a fragment of Hakra's spirit. I have to jab the shard into one of the dead Worm Cultists just inside the cavern entrance. Hakra's spirit should possess the corpse.
The shard enabled Hakra to possess the cultist corpse! Now to speak with her.
I must destroy Hakra's burial urns. This will free her spirit and enable her to escape from the cavern, preventing the cultists from binding her.
I saved Charadin and he escaped. I should see if Nila made it out of the cavern too.
Now that I've reached <<1>>, I should speak to a local to find out what's going on.
I should speak to <<1>> at the Mages Guild.
Now that I've found the tomes, I must return to the Mages Guild and speak to Valaste.
Sheogorath has created these actors that look like Pact soldiers to attack me. I'll need to destroy them to satisfy the Mad God's whims.
Once again, Sheogorath has pitted me against actors shaped like soldiers. I'll need to destroy the Dominion forces to continue my trial.
The actors representing important members of the Mages guild must be saved for me to move on.
I gave Roselle the final page from Ulrich's journal which explains she's actually his daughter.
There's a lone skeleton wearing Lion Guard armor.
I found the empty husk that remained of Ulrich. He clutched on to the final pages of his journal.
I have enough pages to reconstruct part of the journal. Now to find out what it says.
Pages torn from Ulrich's journal are strewn about the ruin. By collecting enough of those pages, perhaps I can locate him.
I've completed Sheogorath's little test. Time to speak to him again. Hopefully this will be one of the last times.
I've slain Deathclaw. I should return to Hoknir and tell him his bounty is dead.
The Daggerfall Covenant is backing the bandits at Hozzin's Folly. That's bad for Bleakrock. I need to speak with Seyne.
I've safely recovered all the Fighters Guild soldiers. I should return to <<1>>.
I should be able to find the lair of <<1>> by following the trail of things he dropped. Once I do, the beast might come out for some food.
<<1>> asked me to speak to <<2>>, the Pact commander stationed on Bleakrock Island. I'll find her in her office off the central square.
I should return to <<1>> and let him know the travelers should be safer now.
<<1>> told me that the summoner took surviving villagers captive, including his daughter, <<2>>. I need to find his camp behind the rock outcropping and rescue them.
I should speak with Merric about what happened in the Halls of Submission.
<<1>>'s companions have been taken by arachnids. I'll need to break open cocoons in the area to find them.
Aelif has opened a portal to the Earth Forge. I should enter the portal.
It sounds like there's a commotion coming from belowdecks. I need to find the key to the hold so I can get down there before the entire ship burns.
I need to enter the tomb.
I made it to Stonefalls, along with Captain Rana and the refugees. I should check in with Captain Rana.
I should return to <<1>> and tell him of my victory.
Molla led me to a wand. I'm not sure what's important about it, but it's obvious she wants me to pick it up.
I've arrived at the Earth Forge, a secret Guild locale. I should speak with Merric, see what he wants to do.
Merric is eager to get started. I should try to keep pace.
Merric is prepared to begin forging the weapon. I should see what help he needs.
We've done it. I should speak to Merric to congratulate him on our success.
We're under attack! I need to stand by Merric's side in defending the forge.
Merric and I have defeated the undead interlopers. I should speak with him again.
The spirit of Jofnir Iceblade appeared once more, this time in front of Merric and Aelif! They both seemed shocked. I should speak to Merric.
Darj believes the ancient Dragon priest that once tended this shrine might be able to tell us how to get inside it. I should use the shrine to summon his spirit.
I've summoned the Dragon priest's spirit. I must speak with it to learn how to enter the barrow.
Now that I've collected three runestones, I should be able to place them in their proper locations. Then I can enter Skyshroud Barrow.
A necromancer dressed in the colors of the Daggerfall Covenant is working to corrupt and control the Dragon priest. I must sanctify the priest's body to make sure this can't happen again.
My first goal should be taking over the Goblin tribe. I need to kill their chief and take his head.
I have the Goblin chief's head. Once I mount it on a spike for the whole tribe to see, they'll revere me as their new leader.
With their old leader dead, the Goblins now support me. I should lead the charge into battle against the dreugh in the depths of the cave.
Battle is joined. I must now defeat the dreughs' king, so the caves of Fungal Grotto will be free of all hostile creatures.
<<1>> has come to the bottom of the cave, where her sought-after shrine is. I should speak with her there.
Molla finally seems ready to talk to me. I should see what her story is.
<<1>> told me a mad mage assaulted her and her friends. She's asked me to restore her friends. They've scattered across the island, and they're now skeevers.
The way into the shrine is open. I should enter and learn what has disturbed the dead.
<<1>> will want to know that the threat from the barrow has ended.
Eiman is somewhere inside Orkey's Hollow. If he's still alive, I must find him.

I found Eiman trapped in the ice. The "Frozen Man" challenged me to a game. Before he'll free Eiman, I must discover his true identity. I should search the cave for clues and then talk to the Frozen Man.
I've discovered the Frozen Man's identity. He was once a spy for the Aldmeri Dominion. He invited me into his lair to play a "game of shells."
The Frozen Man challenged me to a "game of shells." I must find and touch the real Frozen Man while avoiding his many illusions.
The Frozen Man fled when I won his game. I must track him down and force him to release Eiman.
I'm not quite sure how, but I convinced the Frozen Man to release Eiman. Now I must free Eiman from his prison and escort him back to Rolunda.
Rolunda and Eiman are reunited. I should see if anything remains to be done.
Ulrich betrayed those who followed him to Silaseli, but did so to protect his daughter, Roselle. Now I need to decide whether she should know the truth about Ulrich, or believe in a myth.
I gave Roselle Ulrich's journal, describing his quest for immortality by allowing the cultists into Silaseli.
I've restored Molla's hunting party to its proper shapes and sizes. I should find her in the village and speak with her again.
I need to talk to Captain Rana and find out her plan.
I must enter Orkey's Hollow to find Eiman.
To disable the traps, I must flip a switch on the far wall of the first room.
I need to speak to Captain Rana to find out the next step.
Captain Rana needs me to unlock a door deep inside the tomb. The door has two stones on it. Each one bears the likeness of a flower.
I unlocked the door. I should catch up to Captain Rana and find out the next step in clearing the tomb.
Captain Rana will unlock the door at the bottom of the stairs. I must enter the room beyond.
Captain Rana needs me to flip the switch in this room so she can enter the door above it.
Captain Rana has run into the room beyond. I should use the door on the far side of this room and follow her.
We must be close to the far side. I need to talk to Captain Rana.
Captain Rana wants me to wait for the refugees to leave the Last Rest before I move on.
I should untie <<1>>.
Now I need to free the captive held at the Bleakrock Isle bandit camp.
I need to put a stop to the bandit activity on Bleakrock. I'll begin by burning their supplies.
With Sheogorath gone and Valaste's sanity returned, it seems we're well and truly in control of Eyevea. I should speak with Valaste to see how she's doing.
I've found <<1>>! I should speak to him.
I should head to the mill and try to call Rexus.
The dog looks upset. I should pet it to calm it down.
<<1>> wants me to follow him. Perhaps he'll lead me to Geilund.
The Frozen Man's mind defies traditional logic. Perhaps if I talk to him long enough, I can convince him to free Eiman.
We're saved! Captain Rana is speaking with someone on one of the boats in the cove. I should speak with her.
I need to enter the portal Valaste opened to get to Sheogorath's realm.

Seyne wants me to explore the mine and discover what the raiders are doing here. To get inside, she wants me to take a uniform from the raider scout she killed. The raiders' sentries can see through my disguise.
I've found evidence proving that the Daggerfall Covenant hired the bandits. The Covenant wants access to an Oblivion portal and the power it holds. I need to get into the mine and put a stop to this.
With the help of the disguise, I've entered the area outside the mine. I have to find out what the raiders are up to down here.

The cultists left behind an artifact called the Unspeakable Sigil. It's maintaining this pocket of Oblivion. I can't risk the bandits or their Covenant masters getting access to the power here. I must destroy the artifact.
Shalidor shouted that he sensed something wrong, and dove into the portal. I should follow him.
Shalidor is waiting for me to speak with him about the island. I should do so.
In his anger, Shalidor confronted Sheogorath. The Mad God easily subdued the Archmage. I should talk to Sheogorath and try to resolve the situation.

Shalidor asked me to close the portals on the edges of Eyevea. That should stop the influx of Daedra. Sheogorath told me that to close the portals I'll need to pull out the nearby crystals powering them.
Shalidor removed the ward from the Guildhall doors. Time to face Sheogorath once again.
Sheogorath says he isn't the fighting type, so he's instructed Haskill to spar with me. I should do my best to defeat the Mad God's assistant.
Sheogorath has "kindly" created a portal so I can continue my tour. I suppose I should take it.

Seyne wants me to explore the mine and discover what the raiders are doing here. To get inside, she wants me to take a uniform from the raider scout she killed. The raiders' sentries can see through my disguise.
Now that I've saved the villagers, I should head to the tomb.
Denskar is inside. I should get him out.
I need to speak to Seyne.
Daedra swarm the island of Eyevea, and Shalidor is furious. He's gone ahead to the island's main Hall to look around. I'll need to fight my way through the Daedra to meet him.
Sheogorath has given this island to us, but Daedra swarm from the open portals. I should talk Shalidor to plan our next move.
Molla wants me to follow her. I'll see what's going on.
Aelif says she will open a portal to the Earth Forge, where Merric is working on the Prismatic Weapon. Together we'll try to hunt down Sees-All-Colors.
The Covenant has taken the signal fire. Rana needs me to work my way to the top of the tower outside town and light it.
Now that I've lit the signal fire, I should meet up with Tillrani. Rana said she can get me to the rally point.
The reconstructed journal reveals Ulrich to be a coward and traitor. He let the Black Worm into Silaseli in exchange for escape. I should find and confront this Ulrich.
Captain Rana has disabled the traps and summoned the refugees. I should wait for the refugees to reach safety.
I've closed the portals and slotted the power crystals out front of the Guildhall. I should speak to Shalidor once again to see how he's doing with the ward.
Captain Rana asked me to help her locate missing villagers. I must talk to her about where to go to begin my search.
Rana asked me to go to Skyshroud Barrow. I need to look for Darj, a hunter who left to investigate reports of undead in the area.
Rana asked me to go to Orkey's Hollow to look for Eiman and his sister Rolunda. The centurion believes the young man went to the cave. Perhaps his sister left to search for him.
Rana asked me to go to Hozzin's Folly to look for her sergeant, Seyne. The Dark Elf warrior went there to investigate reports of bandits.
Tillrani is dying. She fears for the safety of the few villagers remaining in town. I need to save them. To start with, I'll have to get a bucket of water to douse the fires.
I've got the bucket filled. Tillrani said that Denskar headed into the bunkhouse. I need to extinguish the fire outside the building, so I can get inside.
Littrek ran off into the village. I should look for him. He might be hiding.
Aera is inside the building. I'll need to pull her out.
Trynhild ran off into the village. I should look for her. She might be hiding.
Aera returned to her home, hoping for protection. I need to extinguish the fire outside the building, so I can get inside and find her.
I must decide whether there's enough time to recover all the villagers before preparing to depart.
I convinced <<1>> it's time to evacuate the island. I should speak to her to set this plan in motion.
I found and rescued people from Bleakrock Village. I can tell <<1>> we're ready to go.
Skorvild took some meat from the giant's leader and ran over to a stand of rocks. I should meet him there.
Eiraki's borther Skorvild is gathering a force of warriors in a house north of the fishing camp. I should speak to him about how I can aid the village.
Skorvild asked me to help the surviving villagers. He also wants me to gather supplies for his militiaâ€”rations made from an old family recipe.

I found Burj. He explained that Skorvild and his militia have been eating the flesh of giants. That's why the giants are so enraged. I need to decide if I want to go along with Skorvild's plan or tell Eiraki the truth about her brother.
I should head back to town, so I can make sure everyone made it to safety.
When I returned to Dhalmora, <<1>> called me over with words of warning. I should speak to her.
I think I've found all of <<1>>'s guar. I should speak to him, just to make sure.
The Covenant's advance forces have trapped Dhalmora's farmers. I need to find them and send them back to town.
I have the <<z:1>>. It's time to light the signal fires and warn Davon's Watch of the Covenant attack.
<<1>> gave me some <<z:2>>. He hopes it will entice his "family" to come home.
Now that I've closed all the portals, I should return to <<1>>.
I should close portals around the grounds of Fort Zeren.
Aera told me of a powerful portal forming in the heart of Fort Zeren. Darj wants me to help him close the portal and kill the Covenant general leading this attack.
Alhana followed me into the house. I should let her know what I discovered.
An Argonian told me that Covenant troops have trapped fishermen in the windmill. I should free them before soldiers set fire to the building.
A Nord ran up to the windmill shouting that Seyne needed help. I should talk to her.
I must reach Seyne on the docks. If she's under attack, I need to jump into the fray before Covenant troops overtake her.
I must help Sergeant Seyne fight off the Covenant attackers.
I must find Trynhild and Captain Rana. Seyne said they're on the other side of the docks.
I've found Rana gathering her strength for another attack. I should speak with her.
I must follow Captain Rana below decks.
Rana and I have cornered the commander who led the attack against Bleakrock Isle. We must put an end to him.
I need to leave the ship.
Reinforcements have arrived. I should talk to them.
Captain Rana ran toward the boat to attack the commander. I must find her.
I told Kralald that I would search Kynesgrove for any sign of Captain Alhana and the missing soldiers.
Captain Alhana and the missing soldiers are barricaded inside the Keeper's house. I should talk to them.

Captain Alhana thinks the Keepers of the shrine may still be alive. She wants me to eliminate witches and bewitched soldiers to find clues. She also mentioned that I should talk to a less hostile witch by the lake to the east of the Keepers' house.
I gathered the clues to the Keepers' fate: a hymn book, a soldier's journal, and the strange ramblings of the witch Leifnar. I should return to Captain Alhana and tell her what I found.
I need to find a way to get into the other locked house in Kynesgrove. I should examine the house.
Now that I'm inside the house, I should search for anything that might tell me what happened to the Keepers.
Alhana followed me into the house. I should let her know what I discovered.
I should speak with Merric about what happened in the Halls of Submission.
It seems <<Az:1>> were a huge success. I should return to <<2>> and let him know.
Haraldar asked me to check out the meadery and make sure the place was safe before him and his brothers follow me.
I'm inside the meadery. I need to locate the recipe book and some fragrant herbs so Haraldar's brother can start making mead again.
I woke up after sampling one of the new meads. Now that Voljar's Meadery is back in business, I hope Haraldar feels he honored his wife's memory. I should talk to him.

The Snowpeak brothers now have access to the meadery. Once I turn over the recipe book and the ingredients, they should be able to start making mead again. I should talk to Haraldar and see what other help he needs.
Yraldar thinks the short-tempered Kazok will be angry enough to challenge me if I kill more of his troops on my way to his camp behind the barn.
I need to defeat <<1>>. He's the leader of the Stormfist soldiers that killed the Voljar family.
With the leader of this band of Stormfists dead, Haraldar's wife has been avenged and the meadery should be safe now. I should talk to Yraldar.
I need to find Sees-All-Colors. I must explore the Halls of Submission and find where she's gone.
We've found Colors. I need to confront her, and see what she has to say for herself.
<<1>> revealed herself as a servant of Molag Bal and a traitor. I need to kill her and escape Coldharbour. Before I can do that, I need to sever her connection to Molag Bal.
I think I see an exit nearby.
I've told <<1>> I would test his theory. I'm supposed to throw <<z:2>> at the Covenant to see if netch bulls will attack the soldiers.
I found Trynhild. I should speak with her and see if she knows where to find Captain Rana.

Roruld asked me to get rid of the giant that's frightening the bees east of the meadery. He suggested I kick a beehive to use the bees against the giant. He even splashed me with something to make the bees leave me alone.
I killed the giant that was frightening the bees and collected its toe. I should bring the giant's toe to Roruld back at the meadery.
<<1>> claims to be a servant of Meridia. She told me that she had no choice but to kill <<2>>. I must decide what to do with her.
Jofnir appeared after Aelif's death. I should speak to him about what's happened here.
On my way to help Rana at the docks, I found a wounded Argonian named <<1>>. I should speak with him.
I've made my choice. I'm going to help defend <<1>> with <<2>>. I should speak to him.
I must decide whether to help Darj at the fort or Rana at the docks. Once I've made my choice, there won't be time to change my mind before the Covenant attacks.
I must go to the watchtower just past the village of Dhalmora. Then I can tell the troops there to light signal fires.
The Pact troops at the watchtower are dead. I'll have to figure out for myself how to light the signal fires.
Davon's Watch will only look for fires of a specific color. From what I've read in the ledger, I can find a new supply of <<z:1>> at the nearby fort.
Fort Zeren's quartermaster is fresh out of <<z:1>>. She thinks a fresh shipment came in at the nearby dockyards. I'll need to go to the dockyards to get what I need.
Hanmaer Furmender, one of the refugees from Lower Yorgrim, asked me to collect wolf pelts. She can use them to make blankets to keep the survivors warm.
I collected the wolf pelts that Hanmaer requested. I should bring them to her at the fishing camp.
I have what I need to light the fires. <<1>> led me to a secret path through the hill. It should put me behind Covenant lines.
Yraldar wants <<1>>'s head on a pike. That should dishearten the remaining Stormfists and keep them away from the meadery. He wants me to do the honors.
The book the cultists left behind described a ritual space inside the old tomb. I should find a way inside.
The contract scroll I read outside the mine mentioned fire traps in a tomb. I'll keep my eyes open.
I found a portal to a realm of Oblivion. To close it, I need to pass through it.
I should make sure Rana isn't badly wounded.
I should leave the way I came in.
I should kill the necromancers in Haynote Cave.
I killed several Shadowed Path necromancers. I should return to Vlastarus and tell <<1>>.
I must head out into the courtyard and prepare for battle.

<<1>> asked me to grab a barrel of appleblossom honey from the barn. He also asked me to keep an eye out for his twin brother, Bjoruld. He's supposed to make a delivery to Windhelm, but no one has seen him lately.
I collected the appleblossom honey from the barn. I should bring it to Roruld so he can make more mead.
<<1>> has been crafting some new flavors of mead. He wants me to try his latest concoction.
I should speak with <<1>> in Davon's Watch. Then I'll verify they've received word that Covenant forces are on the move.
I found Captain Alhana and the missing soldiers. They locked themselves inside the Keeper's house. I need to convince them to let me in.
Captain Alhana asked me to put her bewitched soldiers out of their misery. I should bring back their blessed amulets to prove I'm not a witch.
I collected amulets from bewitched soldiers, as Captain Alhana asked. I should return to the Keeper's house and give them to her.
I should head through the gate to Davon's Watch and speak with <<1>>.
I should kill <<1>>.
I killed <<1>>. I should return to Vlastarus and let <<2>> know.
I killed the Spider Daedra known as the Whisperer. Now I need to speak with Guardian Sud-Hareem.
Time to kill the traitorous Khajiit.
Bala searched the tombs to the north, but she was unable to find Eanen's name. She asked me to look to the west.
I should help restore Voljar's Meadery. Fens asked me to speak to his older brother, Haraldar. He's by the farmhouse.
I should find Eiraki Frostwind in the fishing camp east of the bridge to Windhelm and see what I can do to help the people of Lower Yorgrim.
I've killed <<1>>. I should enter the trapdoor and return to <<2>>.
I collected a handful of Kyne's Breath flowers. I should return to the Keeper's house to deliver them to Fresgil.
I can find Kyne's Breath throughout the grove. It grows abundantly near the rune stones that decorate the grounds.
I collected a handful of Kyne's Breath flowers. I should return to the Keeper's house to deliver them to Fresgil.
I killed Ormi. Without her leadership, the rest of the corrupted Keepers will eventually slip away. I need to find Fresgil and tell her what happened.
Something's wrong with Captain Alhana. I should check on her.
I need to tell Fresgil and the remaining members of Captain Alhana's brigade what happened to their commander. I also need to tell them how the Keepers became Daedric witches.
We can't take any chances. Ormi must die. I should look for her at Kyne's shrine up on the hill.
I killed Ormi. Without her leadership, the rest of the corrupted Keepers will eventually slip away. I need to find Fresgil and tell her what happened.
Sahun doesn't want to get involved. I'm on my own. I should return to Kynesgrove and put an end to Ormi once and for all.
Sahun is praying. I should wait and see what happens.
Keeper Ormi has restored the soldiers. I can find them in the Keeper's house.
Kyne has forgiven the Keepers. She's restored Ormi and banished the Daedric influence. Now I should speak to the restored Keeper Ormi.
I need to find Ormi's son, Sahun. He was last seen frequenting the Cold Moon Inn in Windhelm. If I can show Ormi that one of her sons is still alive, maybe she'll remove the curse from Kynesgrove.
Praxin and his squad have succumbed to the whispers and turned against me. I must defend myself.
Mera Stormcloak, thane of Windhelm and commander of the Windhelm Guard, wants to speak to me. I can find her in front of the Palace of Ysgramor.
I entered the Cold Moon Inn as Thane Mera requested. I should look around for anything out of the ordinary, especially in the rooms the Stormfist clan occupy upstairs.

I found the journal of one of the Stormfists, Leimar the Raven, in the Cold Moon Inn. It listed the locations of caches hidden throughout the city. I should search the caches and see what they contain.
I recovered a number of notes and weapons from caches hidden throughout Windhelm, as well as a journal that ties these things to the Stormfist clan. Thane Mera will want to see these.
The footrace starts along the western wall of Windhelm. I need to speak to Lenning the Hawk, the race organizer, to enter the event.
Lenning the Hawk has directed me, as the last racer to arrive, to light the starting flare. As soon as I ignite the flare, the race begins.
The race has begun! I should stop reading my journal and run to the next tower.
The race continues! I should stop reading my journal and run to the next tower.
The race continues! I should stop reading my journal and run to the next tower!
The race continues! I should stop reading my journal and run to the next tower!
The race continues! I should stop reading my journal and run to the next tower. Or I can stop to help another racer who has been injured and is lying beside the track.
I won the race. I should speak with Lenning the Hawk.
I abandoned the race to help Hadring. Unfortunately, he didn't make it. He provided me with useful information before he expired, though. I should speak with Lenning the Hawk.
The race has ended and Thane Mera has asked to speak with me. I should meet her outside the palace.
Someone killed Hadring during the race. I should speak to Thane Mera and let her know what happened.
The assassin was seen leaving Windhelm, heading south. I should travel south, out of the city, and investigate.
Thane Mera has something more to say before I proceed. I should talk to her.
I found a camp to the south. Stormfist clan Nords and Orcs occupy the camp. Not a good combination. I need to punish these criminals and bring back any evidence I find to Thane Mera.
I've been appointed as a Justice Carl of Windhelm. I can use this newfound authority to get answers out of any witnesses who may have seen what happened during the race.
I retrieved a Stormfist Brigade emblem and orders signed by someone named Fildgor Orcthane that call for the death of King Jorunn. I should bring these to Thane Mera, back in Windhelm.
Thane Mera fears that Fildgor's Stormfists plan to assassinate the King at the final contest of the Konunleikar. She wants me to enter the Hall of Trials to protect King Jorunn.
I entered the Hall of Trials. I need to reach the arena and hurry to King Jorunn's side.
The Stormfist clan is attacking King Jorunn and his guards. I need to help them.
With the help of King Jorunn and his guards, I defeated the Stormfist assassins. Now I should speak to Jorunn the Skald-King.
Fildgor's Stormfist assassins have been defeated and King Jorunn is safe. He asked me to tell Thane Mera that he's fine. I should go talk to her in front of the palace.
I have been asked to report to <<1>>. I should speak with her there as soon as possible.
<<1>> gave me the <<z:2>> I need to warn Davon's Watch. She wants to show me a secret path to the signal fires.
<<1>> showed me a passageway that leads to the signal fires.
I need to make my way through this passage and get to the signal fires.
I need to find the captive soldiers in Fort Morvunskar and set them free.
I need to meet Lieutenant Koruni and the other soldiers at the barracks near the center of Fort Morvunskar.
Lieutenant Koruni and her soldiers have begun their assault on the barracks. I should help them.

A Nord warlord, Halskar, commands the Stormfist invaders from inside the barracks. I should defeat him and search the area for his orders. We need to find out what the Stormfists want with Fort Morvunskar.
A spirit appeared when I took Halskar's possessions from the strongbox. They included orders and relics from the crypts beneath the fort. I should speak to the spirit.

I spoke to the spirit of Queen Nurnhilde. She asked me to return the relics to the tombs beneath the fort. Along with these relics, I recovered Halskar's orders. I should give the orders to Lieutenant Koruni before I go meet the ghost.
The fires are lit. Hopefully, Davon's Watch will have time to react. I should return to Dhalmora and inform someone in charge of the good news.
<<1>> and <<2>> disagree on what to do with the army haunting Starved Plain. <<3>> asked me to start by talking to <<1>>, to hear his plan.
I've decided to enslave the spectral army. I must speak to <<1>> about what I must do next.
I've decided to help the spectral army move on to Aetherius. I must speak to <<1>> about my next step.
Denskar and Littrek are under attack. I should go to their aid.
I must stand with Denskar and Littrek and make sure they survive.
Denskar and Littrek have the situation well in hand. Denskar wants me to check on his wife, Aera, who has apparently come to join the men at the fort.

Thane Mera told me a number of suspicious injuries and deaths have occurred since the start of the Konunleikar. She suspects members of the Stormfist clan might be involved. She asked me to investigate their rooms at the Cold Moon Inn.
The dead are rising here. I need to find the necromancer responsible and deal with him.
Now that I've killed Atirion, I should return to <<1>> to tell her the news.
I promised Bishalus I would look for Gena. I should search the trail leading away from the docks.
I found Gena. A rabid nix-hound attacked her, but the hound she had befriended helped her escape. Gena is returning to Bishalus. She's asked me to kill the rabid nix-hound.
I've slain the rabid nix-hound. I should return to the two friends at the docks.
I should search the graveyard and nearby cave to discover what's causing the dead to rise.
<<1>> asked me to head northeast of Vlastarus to kill it.
Now that <<1>> is dead, I should let <<2>> know.
The race continues! I should stop reading my journal and run to the next tower.
The race continues! I should stop reading my journal and run to the next tower.
The race continues! I should stop reading my journal and run to the next tower.
The race continues! I should stop reading my journal and run to the finish line.
Jurana asked me to travel to <<1>> to see if I can recover any stolen items.
I recovered several items from <<1>>. I should bring them back to <<2>> in <<3>>.
Prince Irnskar wants to speak with me. I can find him on the battlements above the east gate.

I need to prove to the Pact leaders that Prince Irnskar is fully committed to the Ebonheart Pact. To do so, I need to charge General Noramil's dagger in Stormfist blood and bring the head of the Stormfist commander to Eyes-of-Steel.
I can report my success to General Yeveth Noramil and Eyes-of-Steel. That should improve their relationships with Prince Irnskar.

Prince Irnskar asked me to talk to the Dark Elf general, Yeveth Noramil, and the Argonian commander, Eyes-of-Steel. I need to determine if there's a way to reassure them of his commitment to the Pact.
I should report to Prince Irnskar and tell him what I did to improve relations with General Yeveth Noramil and Eyes-of-Steel.
I should leave the fort and head through the gate to Davon's Watch, so I can speak with <<1>>.
Ula-Reen asked me to light the watchfires at the south and east gates. I need to light the torch she gave me first, though. That campfire over there should do the trick.
I need to light the watchfires near the south and east gates to Jorunn's Stand. <<1>> says it keeps the Stormfist troops from sneaking too close to the walls of the fort.
I should let Ula-Reen know that the watchfires are lit.
Ula-Reen discovered that the Orcthane is setting up additional camps to the south. Spymaster Ramorgol leads these efforts and must be eliminated. One of her scouts will accompany me.
Shaman Moramat is next on Ula-Reen's hit list. I need to bring her down and recover any orders she might be carrying.
I eliminated the Orcthane's spymaster and shaman and retrieved their orders. I should report back to Captain Ula-Reen and let her know her security issues have been dealt with.
I've been directed to the keep, where Darj is conferring with Fort Zeren's soldiers. I should speak with him there.
Keeper Ormi has restored the soldiers. I should return to the Keeper's house and speak to Captain Alhana.
I lost the race. I should speak with Lenning the Hawk.
The race has ended and Thane Mera wants to speak with me. I should meet her outside the palace.
<<1>> asked me to kill some Rock Bone Goblins, to stop them from attacking the town.
I killed some Rock Bone Goblins. I should let <<1>> know.
The race continues! I should stop reading my journal and run to the next tower.
I need to enter the royal tomb and return these relics to their proper resting places.
I'm inside the royal tombs beneath Fort Morvunskar. I should make my way to the first burial chamber and see if I can determine where to return the relics.
I need to return the old Nord cup to the appropriate altar in the first burial chamber. I should ask Queen Nurnhilde if she has any advice.
With the old Nord cup returned to its proper resting place, I should locate the next burial chamber.
The Truth of the North, a book of Nord proverbs, was damaged when the Stormfists plundered it. I need to recover the missing page and return the restored book to the pedestal.
With the book of Nord proverbs returned to its proper resting place, I should locate the final burial chamberâ€”Queen Nurnhilde's tomb.
I made my way to Queen Nurnhilde's burial chamber. I see her standing by her stone coffin and she seems upset. I should speak to her.

Fildgor and the Stormfist invaders stole Queen Nurnhilde's body from her coffin. They also took her crown, the legendary Crown of Freydis. I should track their path through the tunnel they used to access the tomb.
Fildgor Orcthane has left an Orc champion named Shukul gro-Agluk behind to hinder my pursuit. I must defeat the Orc before I can continue the chase.
After I learned of Fort Morvunskar's liberation, the spirit of Queen Nurnhilde appeared again. I should speak to her.
I should travel to the bandit camp in the towers west of Vlastarus and recover the banner.
I burned the banner. I should return to <<1>> in Vlastarus to let her know.
I recovered the banner. <<1>> didn't mention that it features an Aldmeri symbol. I can return it to him or just burn it here, in a nearby campfire.
I recovered <<1>>'s banner. I should return it to him in <<2>>.
Reachmen have begun pouring into the courtyard, trying to extinguish the blaze. I must defend the fire!
I burned Talmo's banner. I should return and let Paints-the-Sky know.
<<1>> asked me to put <<2>> to rest.
I killed <<1>>. I need to return to Vlastarus and let <<2>> know.
I should speak to Valeric and discuss Imhey's situation.

General Vereth Noramil demands a blood contract with Prince Irnskar. He wants me to charge his magic dagger, Viper's Strike, in the blood of any Stormfists I slay. That would seal the agreement. I should see what Eyes-of-Steel has to say.

The philosophical Eyes-of-Steel asks a lot of questions. To prove Prince Irnskar's commitment to the Pact, she wants me to bring her the Stormfist Commander's head. I should see what General Yeveth Noramil has to say.
I should speak with <<1>> to get my final instructions.
I've collected the five <<m:1>> and need to bring them back to <<2>>.
Prince Irnskar suggested that I speak to Thane Harvald first.
King Jorunn seemed tired, but he asked me to reassure Harvald and let the thane know that Jorunn's still running the kingdom.
Now that the war council has concluded, the Skald-King wants to speak to me.
Fildgor escaped with Queen Nurnhilde's body and the Crown of Freydis, but I was able to defeat his Orc champion. I should return to Fort Morvunskar and tell Captain Hamar what happened.
I should talk to <<1>>. She'll give me further instructions.
I should use the transit network to travel to the Northern Morrowind Gate.
I've defeated the wispmother, but if she reforms, I'll need to slay her again to seal her remains.
I need to kill Supernal Dreamer cultists and collect <<m:1>>.
<<1>> believes the Vanguard is blackmailing the grandmaster. He asked me to search their makeshift barracks for information.
I found Imhey, and she seems to be arguing with a strange man. I should find out what's going on.
I gathered the bloodfiend dust. Now I should find Valeric's manor and see if he can actually help Imhey.
I'm inside Valeric's manor. I need to find Valeric and see how Imhey is doing.
I need to speak with <<1>> to learn more about siege weapons.
I defeated the hostile creatures. I should speak to Sena Aralor to learn more about what's going on here.
<<1>> asked me to travel there and use a special crystal to absorb the flame atronachs' essences and lessen the danger to Vlastarus.
I've collected the flame atronach essences. Time to return to <<1>> in <<2>>.
<<1>> wants me to collect fruit and grain for the harvest offering to the Bad Man.
I need to place the harvest offerings on the altar.
<<1>> looks like he's waiting to speak to me.
I only need to throw dirt into the fire to complete the ritual.
The sacrificial fire engulfed me and I was transported into a series of strange tunnels. I think I'm underneath the tree. The tunnels are littered with scavengers and the dead.
I found a woman named <<1>>, trapped by the living roots. She says I can free her by burning the roots with a harvested <<2>>.
<<1>> is free of the roots. I should speak to her and find out just what's going on here.
<<1>> has a plan to escape from the root tunnels, but first she needs me to weaken the roots by setting fire to tendril clusters.
<<1>> is waiting for me to return with good news. I should speak to her.
The Bad Man has been destroyed. I should tell <<1>>.
The Argonian scout has additional orders from Ula-Reen. I should talk to him.
Poachers at Silverscale Pond should have some that I can steal.
I stole several silver scales from the poachers. I should bring them back to <<1>>.
The note says a contact will meet me at the bar.

I should talk to Thane Oda Wolf-Sister's housecarl, Jaema. She can tell me where to find Thane Oda and how to best approach her about joining the council. Jaema was last seen at the camp's front gate.

Thane Oda is somewhere in the forest with her beloved wolves. Her housecarl suggested that I eat a canis cap mushroom to mask my scent from the wolves. They grow on logs outside the fort. Or I could fight the wolves, but killing them might upset Oda.
Thane Jeggi Gap-Tooth is the last thane I need to speak to before the war council commences. I should find him at the camp.
Thane Jeggi will only attend the war council if I get him some mead.
I collected a few bottles of Voljar's mead. I should deliver it to Thane Jeggi.
Now that I've extended invitations to all of the thanes, I should attend the war council at the healers' tent.
I should listen to the thanes and Pact leaders discuss the Stormfist situation.
I need to get out of here and report to Seyne. I must get out of the tomb.
I've sanctified the priest's body and discovered the presence of a Breton necromancer. Why was a Breton in Bleakrock? I should search the barrow for clues.
The only way to get Thane Harvald to work with Prince Irnskar is to get King Jorunn involved. He wants me to deliver a dispatch to the Skald-King, who's still resting at the healers' tent.
I need to free <<1>> from the Supernal Dreamer cult's cage.
I fought my way through the wolves to find Thane Oda. I should speak to her.
Tanval has opened a portal which I can use in order to witness Balreth's attack against the Covenant forces.
The antivenom kit should be easy to use. I need to collect snake venom to combine with the kit in order to make antivenom doses.
Fildgor and his Stormfist allies have stolen Queen Nurnhilde's body and the Crown of Freydis. I should try to catch up to them before they get away.
<<1>> told me of a Khajiiti slave working in the upper ring. She might be able to sell me the disguise I need.
The rune I found suggests the Frozen Man is a powerful mage.
I found a journal belonging to someone named "Brimlor." This might be the Frozen Man's true name.
Aspera Giant-Friend gave me a horn. I need to use the horn at a nearby cave to summon a giant ally.
Now that I have a giant ally, I should be able to use its strength to knock the Stormfist scouts from the trees. Then I can kill the scouts and collect any orders they may have in their possession.
I defeated the Stormfist scouts and collected a variety of information about their current missions and procedures. I should talk to Aspera at the camp to the west and let her know what I found out.
I've decided to take on the Vanguard directly. I should search their camp for any information about where the grandmaster's son might be.
Now that the war council has concluded, the Skald-King wants to speak to me.
I need to find the scout General Noramil mentioned. He said his name was Snowhunter. If I go north and east, I should run into him.
<<1>> said I should find <<2>> and see what he knows about the grandmaster's son.
I've rescued the stories of the Green Lady and the Silvenar from a corrupting force known as <<c:1>>.\n\nI should inform the spinners that their story has been put right again.
<<1>> told me about the spinners' stories and the power behind them.\n\nUnfortunately, one of the spinners is not working to the interests of the Bosmer people, and he wants my help to stop them.
A Khajiit bard asked for help re-writing a story in the spinners' temple. She said I should speak to <<1>> and learn more about it.

Spinner Indraseth vanished right after she declared the Green Lady unfit for the Silvenar. Something's happened to turn this spinner against her people.\n\nI should find where she's gone and follow her.
I've entered an unearthly cave system within Valeguard. I need to find a way to put the story of the Silvenar back to rights, so the spinners can continue to bless the Bosmer people.
I met the original Silvenar in the story-cave and managed to protect him from an untimely end. I need to find Spinner Indraseth and put a stop to her meddling before she can wreak anymore havoc.
After defeating a corrupted Silvenar, Spinner Indraseth appeared, but she was not the same. I should speak to her and find out what happened to her.
Spinner Indraseth explained that there's a corrupting influence on the story, and it's spreading. She's asked me to find a way to save the story of the Green Lady as I did to the Silvenar.
I've tracked down the corrupting influence in the spinners' story - a creature calling himself <<c:1>>. He's holding the Green Lady's story hostage, and I need to stop him.
I've recovered both the Green Lady and the Silvenar's stories from the corrupting influence of <<1>>. I should find <<1>> outside of the story-cave and ask her if all is well.
I've rescued the stories of the Green Lady and the Silvenar from a corrupting force known as <<c:1>>. <<2>> asked me to return to the <<3>> in Valeguard to finish the story.
I've drawn the attention of Spinner Indraseth, the one who's changed the story about the Silvenar and the Green Lady.\n\nI need to find a way to stop her from changing the spinners' story.
I gathered the ceremonial gems from the undead conjurers. Now I should take the gems to Finvir.
The conjurers from <<1>>'s cabal now roam the tunnels as undead creatures, clutching gems from the summoning ceremony. If these gems are brought to <<1>>, he will prevent the Dremora's return.
<<1>> is dead. The Coral Heart floats before me. I must retrieve it.
<<1>> is back in the village. I should talk to Treethane Nilara and let her know <<2>> and <<1>> are safe.
<<1>> is grateful for my help, though I was unable to save her life. I should see what her assistants plan to do next.
The altars are cleansed and the array appears to be destroyed. The <<1>> is still here. I should speak to it.
Aspera asked me to enter the fort. She wants me to free the mammoths and open the gates for the giants. A giant near the natural wall to the west is ready to help me. I just have to give him a poke.
The giant helped me get inside the fortress. Now I need to head south to free the mammoths, and then unlock the north and south gates for the giants.
Aspera wants me to enter the arena and blow the horn to challenge the warlord who commands this legion of Stormfists, Lob the Cleaver.
I freed the mammoths and opened the gates. Now the Stormfist soldiers have their hands full. I should head to the arena to find Warlord Lob and blow the signal horn.
Somehow, Aspera reached the arena before I did. She wants to speak with me.

I entered the arena. There are a lot of Orcs around, but I don't see their leader, Lob the Cleaver. I should sound the horn to signal the giants and challenge Lob to battle. Then all I have to do is survive the challenge.
Aspera Giant-Friend is waiting for me outside the arena. I should talk to her.
I should talk to the royal workers' overseer, Berj Stoneheart, and see if it's all right with him if I attend the celebration.
Lothgar asked me to recover his sword and shield. They were taken by the creatures that injured him. He'd like to have them with him when he dies.
I recovered the old soldier's sword and shield. I should return them to Lothgar Steady-Hand while he still lives.

Valasha's diary spoke of her "sacrifice." She created a primatic crystal that could empower a dangerous weapon. The items were hidden in the depths of <<1>>. We should continue exploring and see if we can retrieve them.
Now that I've recovered the items, I should speak to Sees-All-Colors.
I should explore the ancient ruins of <<1>> with <<2>>.
The Bad Man's hold on the glen has weakened. All that remains is to defeat the Bad Man on this plane.

I decided that bear steaks were right for the party. I need to assist the cook, Kalogar. He gave me some of Heggvir's leftovers to use as bait. Just place it on a rock in front of Old Ironclaw the bear's cave. It's northwest of the cooking fires.
I need to get more Flash Powder to get <<1>>
I brought a goat to the cooking area, as Heggvir asked. I should talk to her.
Old Ironclaw appeared more interested in me than in Heggvir's leftovers! I should bring these bear steaks to Kalogar.
Now that the food is cooking, I need to get some mead for the party. I should find Ralduf Wolf-Kin near the storehouse and ask him for the key.
Ralduf is upset that I have to slay a few wolves to find which one swallowed the storehouse key. He's apparently very fond of wolves.
Now that I have the key to the storehouse, I can get mead for the celebration.
I've got the mead. Time to celebrate with the royal road workers. I'll join the revelers in the Mead Hall and give the mead to Berj.
A traveling bard is visiting Cragwallow. The party has started and I should ask him to play a song.
Valding the Bard said he would be happy to play. I should listen to his song.
I need to find <<1>> and find out what can be done to stop the Worm Cult.
<<1>> needs me to burn the slain spriggans before the Worm Cult can use their heartwood in their necromantic rituals.
To protect the Silvenar, I need to use the plants to stop the predators within Valeguard.
I should search the area for the journals mentioned in the Z'en priest's journal I found.
I should tell <<1>> that I've burned the spriggans' corpses, keeping their heartwood out of the hands of the Worm Cult.
I need to find out what <<Ac:1>> does and why <<2>> wanted me to get it.
I followed the trail and found <<1>>. I should see if he has uncovered any clues.
We know where <<1>> is being held. <<2>> and I should enter the cave and kill <<3>>.

<<1>> asked me to charge <<Ac:2>> with the energy of one of the spirits in Ouze.\n\nI'll need to defeat the guardian of Ouze, a spirit named <<3>>, and collect the energy he expels. He should be near the southernmost altar in Ouze.
I should tell <<1>> that <<2>> and the chief's son are dead. He's probably waiting near the Drublog side of the valley.
Valeric says he needs bloodfiend dust to save Imhey. I should kill a few of the creatures and gather their dust.
I should speak to Valeric and discuss Imhey's situation.
I found Kireth Vanos deep within the Mzulft ruins. She's hiding in an alcove. I should speak with her.
Even though I defeated the guardian of Ouze, he's not gone. He wants to talk to me. About what, I have no idea.
According to <<1>>, the Drublog attacked the town while I was dealing with the shaman. He asked if I could look for survivors and see if any of them know the whereabouts of his daughter.
I agreed with Raynor, who wants to bring the soul gem lore to the Mages Guild. Kireth and Raynor will finally get recognized for their efforts, but Kireth isn't happy. I should talk to her.

I agreed with Kireth, who wants to use the orb to record the ancient Dwemer maps. With the maps, she believes that she and her brother can become the premiere experts on Dwemer lore.\n\nShe was pleased, but Raynor less so. I should console him.
<<1>> didn't seem to hold a grudge against me for draining part of his spiritual essence. However, he did say I need to get back to <<2>> quickly.
The spinner's corpse and her spirit are gone. I need to figure out who's taken her, and to where.
I should talk to Valeric and find out what he plans to do next.
I should speak to Jaruk to learn how I can help save the hunters.
I should find the hunters' camp. I need to splash Jaruk's smelly liquid on the hunters after I weaken them a bit.
I decided to side with Valeric. I need to find the hunters, weaken them, and then splash them with Jaruk's smelly liquid.
I decided to accept Majorn's invitation and listen to his side of the story. I can find Majorn in the other manor house.
The scent of the hunters has been masked. I should return to Valeric to let him know.
I decided to side with Majorn. I should use the rune he gave me to take control of a bloodfiend.
It's time to attack Majorn. I need to rendezvous with Rala at Majorn's manor and find a way into the crypt.
I destroyed Majorn the Ancient. I should return to Valeric and let him know what happened.
The hunters are dead. I should return to Majorn and tell him that I did what he requested.
I decided to side with Majorn and agreed to destroy his son, Valeric. I need to enter the crypt below the manor house and find Valeric in order to destroy him.
I destroyed Valeric, just as Majorn requested. I should return to Majorn and let him know what happened.
I should talk to Majorn and claim my reward.
Raynor sent me into the ruins to find his sister, Kireth. He suggested I follow the pages of her journal to find her.
Curator Nicholas is performing the ceremony. I should wait for him to finish.
I need to search Ouze for any clues to <<1>>'s whereabouts.
The Worm Cult appears to have taken <<1>>'s body to a nearby cave. It lies somewhere along the ridge line in Ouze.
I met <<1>> and <<2>> at the cave's entrance. Perhaps they have information that will help me locate <<3>>.
I should head back to the Keep to let people know that the curse is broken.
I need to enter the cave and defeat the Worm Cult's powerful creation, using <<Ac:1>>.
High Kinlord Rilis has been imprisoned and control of the Cells has been returned to the Keepers. I must speak with Keeper Cirion.
I destroyed <<1>> and freed her spirit. Now I need to get out of the cave before the remaining Worm Cult can overwhelm me. Once outside, I should find <<2>>'s spirit.
A scout from the pass offered to lead me to his commanding officer. I should follow him.
I found Rala. She's succumbed to bloodlust. I need to talk to her and see if I can calm her down.
I had to kill Rala. I found the key to the crypt on her body. Now I need to enter the crypt and confront Majorn.
I entered the crypt. I need to find Majorn and put an end to his evil once and for all.
I managed to calm Rala and get the key to the crypt. Now I need to enter the crypt and confront Majorn.
I entered the crypt. I need to find Majorn and put an end to his evil once and for all.
I destroyed Majorn the Ancient. I should return to Valeric and let him know what happened.
I should talk to Valeric and find out what he plans to do next.
Rala succumbed to the bloodlust. She's in a rage and I need to stop her. Then I can get into the crypt.
I should kill High Kinlord Rilis before he does the same to me.
In order to begin the tour, I should go to the shrine of the Green Lady at the center of Deepwoods and talk with <<1>>.
An Oathbreaker spirit of Ouze is trapped in a <<1>>. I need to find out what I need to do to free it from its prison.
The trapped spirit wants me to slay the necromancers and their skeletal servants to rescue the spirits of Ouze.

I saw the shrine of the Green Lady and heard its history. <<1>> says the next place to see is at the waterfall outside the village.\n\nWe need to be cautious, as there are still werewolves and Houndsmen around.
I've rescued some of the spirits of Ouze. Now I need to cleanse the defiled altars before the Worm Cult can recover and start all over again.
Warlord Halskar was guarding a strongbox. I should search it and see what it contains.
I decided to side with Majorn. Now, with a bloodfiend to aid me, I need to find the hunters and kill them before Valeric recruits them to his cause.
I've found <<1>>, and he seems mostly unharmed. I should talk to him and get him untied.
A Wood Elf named <<1>> needs to find the rest of her performing troupe before she can retreat to a safer locale. She's asked me to find them and ensure their safety.
I found the performers and told them to head to the forge. I should meet <<1>> and see if they arrived.

The last of <<1>>'s performers is still missing. She believes he is being held by the Steel Shrikes in one of the boarded up buildings.\n\nHer plan to smoke out the Shrikes is unconventional, but she thinks it will work.
The area is ablaze, thanks to a few well-placed fires. Unfortunately, "Sal" never appeared. I should head to the docks and ask <<1>> if she has other ideas for locating her performer.
The area is ablaze, thanks to a few well-placed fires. Unfortunately, "Sal" never appeared. I should speak with <<1>> about other ideas for locating her performer.

<<1>> found out where the Shrikes are holding Sal, but he'll be a lot harder to reach than the other performers were. She's asked for my help once again as he's in an area surrounded by Shrike encampments.
I've found <<1>>, and he seems mostly unharmed. I should talk to him and get him untied.
I need to wait on Merric. He should be just a moment.
I need to wait on Merric. He should be just a moment.
I need to wait on Merric. He should be just a moment.
The Steel Shrikes' ship is taken. I should speak to <<1>> and see when she plans to set sail.
<<1>> doesn't want to leave anyone behind. He's asked me to rescue the senche-tiger while he plans a way to take the Steel Shrike's ship.
When I released the senche from his bonds, I heard <<1>> call out from nearby. I should find her and speak with her.
<<1>>'s going along with <<2>>'s plan. It's up to me to get the hold key so the performers can secretly take over the Steel Shrikes' ship.
I've obtained the hold key to the Steel Shrikes' ship. I should bring it to <<1>>.
<<1>>'s asked me to take out the Steel Shrikes' captain. It sounds like I can get help from <<2>> once I engage the captain.
The Steel Shrikes' ship is taken. I should speak to <<1>> and see when she plans to set sail.
The Three Old Gods showed me visions that suggest the Dreamwalker is in trouble. I should speak to the High Priest and see if there's anything I can do to help.
I need to speak to a monk named Jadvar, inside the cave, to gain access to the Skald-King and the Dreamwalker.
I gathered the necessary component and brought the Dreamwalker to Mistwatch. I need to enter the portal and go to King Jorunn's side.
I should speak to the Ternion High Priest and find out how the Skald-King is doing.
While the Dreamwalker explores the King's unnatural slumber, I should pray to the totems of the Three Old Gods. If they hear my prayers, they might show me what's going on in the Dreamstride.
Thane Mera intends to sow chaos in the Stormfist camp to slow them down and give King Jorunn's army time to arrive. She wants me to set fire to the Stormfist supply wagons.
In the Skuldafn tombs, Queen Nurnhilde appeared before me. Her spirit form appears weak. She seems to want to speak to me.

I sent the signal to King Jorunn's forces. I don't have time to wait for them to arrive, however. I need to stop Fildgor from stealing the Queen's spirit. The way to the central dragonshrine appears to be through the doors at the top of the stairs.
I was too late to save the spinner, but she managed to hide a magical item nearby before she died of her wounds.\n\nI need to retrieve it before the Worm Cult can find it.
To reach Fildgor, I need to climb to Skuldafn's peak and step into the column of light to enter the realm of the dead.
Fildgor Orcthane must not be allowed to complete his dark rituals. I must defeat him.
Fildgor has surrendered and Nurnhilde is at peace. I should return to Skuldafn's peak via the pillar of light.
I defeated Fildgor Orcthane in battle. Do I show mercy or exact revenge? I should speak to him before I decide.
The Great Moot of the Ebonheart Pact commences. I should witness the proceedings.
The Ebonheart Pact is sealed. High-King Jorunn asked me to return to Jorunn's Stand and let Prince Irnskar know what happened here.
The Ebonheart Pact is sealed. High-King Jorunn asked me to return to Jorunn's Stand and let Prince Irnskar know what happened here.
The Great Moot of the Ebonheart Pact commences. I should witness the proceedings.
Fildgor must face the King's judgment. I should speak with King Jorunn.
I killed Fildgor. I should speak with King Jorunn.
Fildgor is dead and Nurnhilde is at peace. I should return to Skuldafn's peak via the pillar of light.
King Jorunn will execute Fildgor himself. I should witness the traitor's death.

Selgaard Wood-Hewer asked me to make sure his brother, cousin, and wife are all right. He thinks they've barricaded themselves in the logging cabins along Bonestrewn Crest. With luck, the draugr haven't gotten to them yet.
I checked the houses along Bonestrewn Crest. I should tell Selgaard that only his wife, Jakild, survived the draugr assault.
Selgaard explained that the draugr appeared after a group of mysterious travelers headed into Bonestrewn Barrow. He thinks they may be part of the Daggerfall Covenant. I should follow them.
The exit out of Bonestrewn Barrow led me back to Bonestrewn Crest. I should find Selgaard and his wife at their cabin and tell them what happened.

<<1>> said <<2>> is a skilled archer, but hasn't returned from her hunt. Houndsmen have appeared, and are likely to blame. I should search <<3>> for signs of battle and see if I can meet up with the search party.
With <<1>> dead, this pack of Houndsmen should be much less organized and easier to defend against. I should see if <<2>> and <<3>> are ready to go back to the village.
<<1>> captured a Steel Shrike. I should disguise myself as one of the raiders.
The captain should have the key to the hold. I should look for the biggest tent in the camp.
I should search the captain's tent for the key to the hold.
I found the body of a Covenant soldier. There's a journal beside him that I should read.
Henri was part of an expedition of Covenant troops on a mission to Eastmarch. His journal indicates they entered the barrow to set up a camp. I should find this camp.
While reading the journal of a Covenant soldier, the journal's undead owner attacked me. I need to defeat the creature before I can move on.
I found the Covenant camp and spotted another journal. I should read it.
The bodies in front of Bonestrewn Barrow are definitely Covenant soldiers. I should enter the crypt and find out what they're doing in there.
I entered Bonestrewn Barrow in search of the Daggerfall Covenant expedition. I should explore the crypt until I locate them.
I found a key in Ophelia's journal. It should open the door that leads deeper into the barrow.
Inside the third chamber, I encountered a Covenant soldier locked in a cage. I should find out what he knows.
Owen claims he locked himself in the cage to protect himself from a necromancer named Valcent. He asked me to pull the left switch to set him free. He also warned me not to pull the right switch.
The switch opened the door to the final chamber. I should enter the final chamber and confront the necromancer.
I hear Valcent up ahead in the final chamber. He's performing a dark ritual. I should stop him before he completes it.
I defeated Valcent. I should look around for an exit out of here.
<<1>> asked me to find the <<z:2>> possessed by the Sea Vipers, and meet her at the entrance to the ruins.
Now that I've recovered the <<z:1>> from the Sea Vipers, I should meet <<2>> at the entrance to the ruins.
With the puzzle solved, I can enter the stormwarden sanctuary.
I should return the <<z:1>> to the leader of the stormwardens.
<<1>> met me outside the entrance to the ruins, but was too injured to continue.  She asked me to return the <<z:2>> to the stormwardens.
I need to recover the <<mz:1>> from nearby <<mz:2>> drawn by the Sphere of Storms.
I've recovered the <<mz:1>> needed to power up the <<2>>. I need to place them in the receptacles in the main chamber of <<3>>.
With the <<mz:1>> placed I should leave <<2>> before the stormwardens seal the exits.
Now that the stormwardens have sealed Ilayas Ruins, I should find <<1>> and tell her what happened.
The Dreamwalker is about to enter King Jorunn's slumber. I should watch and see what happens.
The Three Old Gods showed me visions that suggest the Dreamwalker is in trouble. I should speak to the High Priest and see if there's anything I can do to help.
Jorunn the Skald-King is awake. I should speak to him.
The farm's matron is apparently hiding inside the barn. I should find her and speak with her.
I can use <<c:1>>'s portal to teleport out, or I can fight my way through my enemies. Either way, I need to meet him outside of Jathsogur.
The first trial requires strength. I should pray to one of the three totems for guidance. Perhaps High Priest Esling can offer some advice before I choose.
It appears the King's spirit has been fractured, broken into three parts. I must run the gauntlet of Jorunn's nightmare and set his spirit shard free.
