It appears the King's spirit has been fractured, broken into three parts. I must run the gauntlet of Jorunn's nightmare and set his spirit shard free.
It appears the King's spirit has been fractured, broken into three parts. I must run the gauntlet of Jorunn's nightmare and set his spirit shard free.
I set a shard of King Jorunn's fractured spirit free. I should leave this dark dream and talk to High Priest Esling.
The King's spirit has been fractured, broken into three parts. One of those shards waits for me inside this dream. I should speak to him.
The King's spirit has been fractured, broken into three parts. One of those shards waits for me inside this dream. I should speak to him.
The King's spirit has been fractured, broken into three parts. One of those shards waits for me inside this dream. I should speak to him.
I set the second shard of King Jorunn's fractured spirit free. I should leave this dark dream and talk to High Priest Esling.
Stormy-Eyes is up ahead and he appears to be injured. I should speak to him and find out what's going on.
Stormy-Eyes is up ahead and he appears to be injured. I should speak to him and find out what's going on.
Stormy-Eyes is up ahead and he appears to be injured. I should speak to him and find out what's going on.
King Jorunn's fractured spirit has been freed and made whole again. I should speak to him before exiting his dream.

Queen Nurnhilde appeared and explained Fildgor's plans. He wants to steal her spirit and prove that he's the rightful king. I should go through the portal and meet King Jorunn back in the waking world.
King Jorunn is awake. I should speak to him.

Eitaki Snowmead wants to arm the miners with weapons taken from the Stormfist soldiers. Along the way, she'd also like me to free some of the miners. In particular, she wants to know that her siblings, Tridi and Nedrek, are safe.
I need to find Jomund, give him the weapons I collected, and let him know the miners are ready to take back Lost Knife. He should be just up ahead.
I need to find Jomund, give him the weapons I collected, and let him know the miners are ready to take back Lost Knife. He should be just up ahead.
According to <<c:1>>'s Psijic projection, two of his retinue were captured as well and may be able to help me, but I need to find and free them first.
I need to challenge the giant chieftain to combat. Only by proving the farm's strength can I keep Gjakil and his family safe. The captain suggests I beat the nearby drum to call out the chieftain.
Gjakil, wounded but unbroken, stands outside the cave. <<1>> said he might know what to do about the impending giant attack. I should speak with him.
According to <<1>>, the Drublog used a <<2>> to drain the Silvenar's energy. I need to locate that book and use it to try to stop the ritual.
<<1>> asked me to return the <<z:2>> to the stormwardens. I need to find the entrance to the stormwarden's sanctuary.
The stormwarden sanctuary is sealed by a puzzle. I'll need to solve it to gain entry.
Jomund asked me to retrieve notes from an urn atop the scaffolding in the chamber ahead. If Magister Osanne has found the ore sample, she'll probably have it near her.
The weapons I provided allowed the miners to drive off the Orcthane's troops. Lost Knife Cave Mine is once again free. I should talk to Jomund and hand over the ore samples.
We have the ritual book, but according to <<1>> we need a runestone, too. She believes it's at a small, Daedric shrine inside the encampment.
We need to get under cover. The southern lodge is near the center of Jathsogur; we can hide in there.
The second trial requires quickness. I should pray to one of the three totems for guidance. Perhaps High Priest Esling can offer some advice before I choose.

I destroyed the burial urns chaining Hakra to the cavern. But the Worm Cultists already have her fully under their control. If I can defeat her ensorceled spirit, Hakra will finally be free of both the cultists and this cavern.
Hakra's spirit is no longer bound to her tomb or to the Worm Cult. She is free, after all these years. I must talk to her, outside the cavern.
<<1>> has told me about the Ritual of Unbinding and the runestone. Perhaps <<2>> has some idea what we should do now that we have both of them.
It looks like <<1>> caught a Maormer on the ship and is interrogating him. I should see what he's learned about the captain.
The Reachmen have apparently raised the spirit of an ancient giant named Sinmur. I need to get out of the mine as soon as possible and warn the Pact.

Now that we're under cover, I can read the ritual book if I want, but I must talk to the ambassadors. The book and the runestone hold the key to saving the Silvenar, but I need to know what to do with them.
I rescued <<1>> and a number of her crew from their Maormer captors. I should see if the captain requires any more assistance.
I need to stay close to the fires as I navigate this dream. Otherwise, the cold will sap my strength. I must run the gauntlet of Jorunn's nightmare and set the shard of his spirit free.
I need to stay close to the fires as I navigate this dream. Otherwise, the cold will sap my strength. I must run the gauntlet of Jorunn's nightmare and set the shard of his spirit free.
I need to stay close to the fires as I navigate this dream. Otherwise, the cold will sap my strength. I must run the gauntlet of Jorunn's nightmare and set the shard of his spirit free.
All the Maormer sailboats have been burned. I should meet <<1>> at her favorite overlook near her ship's wreck.
A survivor of the attack asked me to rescue the remaining crew members from their Maormer captors. They've been taken to camps along the beach.
I rescued the crew members, but the first mate and captain weren't among them. They must still be held nearby. I need to find them.
I need to find the <<1>> in the ship's hold and destroy it, so the Maormer don't learn about the Thalmor shipping routes.
I destroyed the <<1>>, keeping it out of Maormer hands for good. I should see if <<2>> has located the captain while I've been belowdecks.
I've released <<1>>. I should speak with him.
I've been asked to destroy the Worm Cult's Animus Geodes. I need to free the souls of the innocent.
I must use the <<1>> to sacrifice one of these two brave ambassadors. But which one?
I chose to sacrifice <<1>>. I hope <<2>> will still help me.
I chose to sacrifice <<1>>. I hope <<2>> will still help me.
Grandfather Treva is trapped within one final Animus Geode within the cave. I should release him from this cruel imprisonment.
I should rouse the mammoths by dousing them with the <<c:1>>. I'll need to defend myself until they're calm enough to return to their pen.
With the Daedra dealt with, I should talk to <<1>>.
I've slain <<1>>, the apparent leader of a Worm Cult cell in Riften. However, another cultist escaped with a shard of Wuuthrad. <<2>> will need to know of these events.
Jomund asked me to gather a few more ore samples from the western excavation. He thinks the trolls are attracted to the mysterious metal.
I recovered the hidden research notes and retrieved the ore sample from Magister Osanne. I should find Jomund and let him know what happened.
The <<1>> transformed into the <<2>> when imbued with the sacrifice's energy. I hope it's enough to disrupt the binding stones.
When I entered Yiri's home, I found <<1>> standing over a dead Worm Cultist! I must ask her what's going on.
The Worm Cult seek a shard of Wuuthrad in Riften. <<1>> said to speak with her commanding officer once I learned what was going on. Perhaps he can help.
Andrin, the commander of the Pact forces, has no soldiers to spare for an investigation. He seemed not to believe me. He said I was free to look into the matter if I wanted.
Andrin suggested I speak to the homeless, who suffer most from the undead. They might have useful information.
I've discovered that the drowned undead are coming from the sewers beneath Riften.

Andrin suggested I speak to the homeless, who suffer most from the undead.\n\nA zombie came out of a nearby well while I was speaking to the homeless. I should kill it and search the corpse for further clules.
I'm following a trail of clues across Riften. It should ultimately lead me to the source of the zombies.
I'm following a trail of clues across Riften. It should ultimately lead me to the source of the zombies.
I'm following a trail of clues across Riften. It should ultimately lead me to the source of the zombies.
The Worm Cult already has the shard of Wuuthrad. When I approached, a Worm Cult necromancer mocked me, then ordered the leader of the local cult cell to eliminate me.
The third trial requires perception and observation. I should pray to one of the totems for guidance, one last time. Perhaps High Priest Esling can offer some advice before I choose.
<<1>>'s projected voice told me to head up the hill to the large fortress and defeat whomever I find there.
<<1>>'s Psijic projection appeared again. It ran downstairs, beckoning me to follow.
I need to follow <<1>> up the hill to the giant's encampment.
Someone is attempting to make off with the brew. I need to put a stop to it.
The King's spirit has been fractured, and the final part remains a prisoner within his own dreams. I need to find it and set it free before it's too late.
The King's spirit has been fractured, and the final part remains a prisoner within his own dreams. I need to find it and set it free before it's too late.
The King's spirit has been fractured, and the final part remains a prisoner within his own dreams. I need to find it and set it free before it's too late.
<<1>> says someone broke into the brewery. I should speak with him.
I've pieced together parts of Bloodtoil Valley's history from these journals and delivered them to <<1>>.
I should head down the hill near Vulkwasten village to find thunderbugs and their maggots. I may need to dig through the thunderbugs' nests to find their maggots.
<<1>> asked me to meet him near Cold Cave when I was finished gathering the thunderbugs and maggots. Its entrance is on the hillside below the village.
I should return to <<1>> and let him know Cold Cave is safe once more.
I'm following Vigrod to Fallowstone Hall to help retake it from the Reachmen.
I've made my way to Fallowstone Hall. I should report in to <<1>>.
I must rally any survivors and meet with <<1>> at the steps of the Hall.
The bonds drained much of <<c:1>>'s strength. He needs time to recover, and  I'll have to fend off our attackers, including their leader, <<2>>.
Our enemies have been defeated and <<1>> is dead, but can <<c:2>> escape? I must talk to him and find out.

Nedrek thinks that the Orcthane may have sent someone to investigate this ore.  They spotted a camp down the road. If it is someone sent by the Orcthane, I should remove the threat and destroy his orders.
Jomund asked me to take the ore to an alchemist named Aleeto in Fort Amol.
While Aleeto studies the unusual ore, she asked me to bring her the Varla Stone tincture from the other side of the shop.
I found the tincture. I should give it to Aleeto.
Aleeto finished her experiment. I should ask her what she learned about the mysterious ore.
Aleeto is an alchemist with an interest in crystals and metals. I should see if she can tell me anything about this unusual ore.
<<1>> told me that <<2>> ran further into the hills near <<3>>. Hopefully, she'll know where to find <<4>>.
Thallik Wormfather is dead, but he merged his spirit with the ghost giant Sinmur and shattered the legendary axe Wuuthrad. I should talk to Jorunn about what has transpired.
I've used up my supply of bandages, I should speak to <<1>>.
I must seek out the four portals the Worm Cult has opened to Coldharbour. Closing the portals will stop the legions of Daedra coming through.
Aleeto wants me to retrieve a book on metallurgy she left near the river. It might shed light on the mysterious metal.
Valdur has offered to summon the spirit of one of the Five Hundred Companions to fight at my side. I only have to let him know which warrior I want.
I closed the portals to Coldharbour and the spirit of Valdur appeared. He says they've found the cult's leader, Thallik Wormfather, and I should come to the central ruins.
Thallik Wormfather escaped through a portal to the cult's base at Arcwind Point. Valdur says Captain Hrosta has gone after him. I should go through the portal and try to catch up.
I found the book Aleeto left outside. I should return it to her.
<<1>> shouted word that the Reachmen's leader, Chieftain Frostfang, is cornered in the Fallowstone undervault.
I need to meet <<1>> at the entrance of the vault.
Aleeto is going to conduct some kind of experiment on the ore. I should stand back and watch this time.
Nedrek asked me to keep an eye out for a courier with a message for Fildgor Orcthane.
I located the courier and intercepted the letter she carried. Tridi is nearby. I should give the letter to her.
Osanne's letter to Fildgor will be destroyed. Hopefully, the miners of Lost Knife Cave won't have any more trouble with Fildgor and the Stormfists.
Thallik Wormfather has the legendary axe Wuuthrad in the lower ruins at Arcwind Point. I must find him and kill him to retrieve Wuuthrad and end the Worm Cult threat.
Thallik Wormfather is performing some dark ritual with the legendary axe Wuuthrad in the lower ruins at Arcwind Point. I must kill him to retrieve Wuuthrad and end the Worm Cult threat.

Thallik Wormfather is dead, but he merged his spirit with the ghost giant Sinmur and shattered the legendary axe Wuuthrad. All that remains is the axe's haft. I should collect the haft and take it back to Honrich Tower.
Thallik Wormfather is dead, but he merged his spirit with the ghost giant Sinmur and shattered the legendary axe Wuuthrad. I should take Wuuthrad's haft through the portal back to Honrich Tower.
The eldest of the spinners, <<1>>, officiated over the ceremony. I should speak with her.
<<1>> has been defeated and the minstrels are now free to practice in peace.\n\nIf only they can agree on their song list.
<<1>> told me more about the Worm Cult's intentions - to use her soul to corrupt all of the matrons of Treehenge.\n\nI should inform <<2>> immediately.
<<1>> asked me to seek out the hengekeeper in Treehenge's roots. I should find her and see if she knows what's going on.
I found <<1>>. She wants me to wake Treehenge's matrons to defend themselves against the Worm Cult. She would have done it herself, but the creatures within have become hostile.

I must take the <<mz:1>> into the city, but on the way, I have to defeat the Guardian of Silvenar, a huge creature protecting the outer bridge. Defeating it will give the Silvenar an opportunity to project his essence inside the barrier.

The Silvenar believes the bonds holding the three Spinners can be unlocked, but only if I learn how they were bound. The only people who can tell me are the Houndsmen Bewitchers. I need to interrogate them.
The Silvenar is using the silver shards charged with the spinners' energy to break down the barrier, but he needs me to get inside <<Ac:1>> and challenge the Hound.
I must defeat the Hound in battle if I'm going to free Silvenar. But it looks like I'll need to fight the Green Lady first. The Silvenar said he'd come help as soon as he can.
The Green Lady's demeanor has changed! Only moments ago, we were trying to kill each other. Now, she looks as if she's awakened from some sort of trance. I need to talk to her.
<<1>> cannot find a way past the main barricade, and can't fight through the haunted crypts herself.
There is what appears to be a back entrance into the camp, but the door is locked. <<1>> will wait by the door while I find a way to open it.
The door utilizes a puzzle lock. I need to determine the correct sequence of the axe, shield, and sword symbols to open it.
The entrance into the camp is unlocked.
I need to head to <<1>> and do what I can to protect Valdur.

The Houndsmen, corrupted servants of the Hound, possess <<mz:1>> that may be the key to opening the city to the Silvenar. I need to collect some from the Houndsmen patroling the ravine beneath the town.
The spirit <<1>> seems to be free. I should speak with him.
I should use bandages to heal any injured soldiers I encounter in the area.
<<1>> asked me to find the spirit of <<2>>. He suggested I present offerings at the nearby burial sites, that her spirit might still linger nearby.
I rallied the survivors I found. I need to meet with <<1>> at the Hall.
The Thalmor striker and I must search the cave. We'll need to kill <<1>> to free the captain.
Having defeated <<1>>, I must free the captain from the pull of the <<z:2>>.
Now that I've re-energized the sphere, I shoud leave the ruins before I get sealed in. The traitor, <<1>>, stands in my way.
Now that I've dealt with the traitor, I should leave the ruins and find <<1>>.
Jomund asked me to meet him outside of Lost Knife Cave after I gathered more ore samples. I should go speak to him.
I should ask <<1>> what's next.
<<1>> asked me to check on relics in the vault, especially Wuuthrad.
I saved a few villagers, but was unable to locate <<1>>. I should tell <<2>>.
I destroyed the <<z:1>> the Maormer Arch-Wizard used to drain the captain's memories. I should talk to her to see if she is all right.
Though she's no longer suffering from the Maormer's torture, the captain needs time to regain her strength. I must lead her out of the cave, where <<1>> and the remaining crew should be waiting.

Stormfist agents are using Daedric alchemy to create exact duplicates of people in Fort Amol. Marla's dead body is on the bed, and I just killed another Marla who's lying on the floor. I should report to Guard Hloenor and tell her what's going on.
I've cut the heart free of a Worm Cultist. I should bring it to Belron at the Pact encampment.

Rigurt asked me to pick up the order of pickled fish from Lower Yorgrim, the shipment of mead from Voljar's Meadery, and his very important Dark Elf cultural garb from his missing assistant who should be near the Windhelm Bank.
I have the various items for the party that Rigurt wanted. I should bring them to him back in Windhelm.
We met the Pact dignitaries. They thought Rigurt was a jester. I wonder how he thinks things turned out. I should talk to him.
It appears the camp has a cook and a chef. Kalogar cooks juicy bear steaks. Heggvir seems more refined and wants to make a savory goat stew. I need to decide which meal is best for the party.

I decided that goat stew was the way to go. I need to assist the chef, Heggvir, by securing a goat for her cook pot. She gave me an herb to entice the goat. After I feed and pet it, the goat should follow me back to Heggvir.
I need to find Commander Yjarnn and see if he'll tell me what's going on at Fort Amol.
I need to find Commander Yjarnn's missing guard, Thod. He was last seen near the King's tents, drinking with the Prince's entourage.
I found the missing guard, but he won't wake up. His condition could be tied to the strange Argonian beverage he was drinking. I should return to the bridge and tell Commander Yjarnn what I found.
Lord Vurlop thinks that Commander Yjarnn has been acting strangely and he suggested that I follow the commander and see what he might be up to.

Stormfist agents are using Daedric alchemy to create exact duplicates of people in Fort Amol. Marla's dead body is on the bed, and I just killed another Marla who's lying on the floor. I should report to Hloenor and tell her what's going on.

The key to unlocking Silvenar lies with the three spinners. I need to take <<Amz:1>> to them, but I don't know where they are. If I interrogate Houndsmen Bewitchers or talk to loyal townsfolk, they can tell me where to look.

Rigurt asked me to meet him near the docks in the eastern part of Windhelm. We're going to greet important Ebonheart Pact dignitaries. He wants me to wear the Dunmer cultural garb to show our respect to the Dark Elves.
The Ebonheart Pact dignitaries have arrived. Unfortunately, Rigurt appears to be exceedingly drunk. I should watch what happens.
<<1>> looks uneasy.
<<1>> is concerned that she hasn't found her husband. It's possible someone in the camp may know where he is.
<<1>> should be told whether or not I think it's safe for her to stay here.
The Maormer boats are scattered along <<1>>'s various beaches. Right now, I only need burn the sailboats. According to <<2>>, they'll take care of the rowboats later.
The taskmasters are the leaders of these thug interlopers. They must be dealt with.
The deed has been recovered and will be returned.
<<1>>'s inside a cave not far from the camp where <<2>> was held. He sent a striker, who should be able to help me rescue the captain, ahead to meet me inside the cave.
I should speak to the boatmaster in Alten Corimont to arrange travel to Skyrim.
I made the trip to Skyrim. Now I should speak with Vicecanon Heita-Meen.
I must protect Tervur while we make our way into the mine.
Commander Yjarnn and Marla just had a very strange meeting. There might be something hidden in Marla's house. I should investigate and see what's in there.
Tervur had one last task to do.
Saved Soldier
I convinced the Argonians and the Dark Elves to return to Prince Irnskar's meeting. I should inform Thane Harvald and see how he wants to proceed.
The Worm Cult captured a Wood Elf named Arithiel, who freed some of her companions before being caught herself. She may be in one of the nearby camps in <<1>>.
I've prevented the Worm Cult's ritual, which pleased Boethiah, but sacrificed Arithiel.\n\nArithiel's spirit appeared outside the shrine's exit. I should talk with her to see what she wants.
I've figured out the trap's puzzle. Khanni's freed spirit appeared beside the tomb. I should speak to it.

The thane has sent her court mage and closest advisor to investigate the attempted assassination. She's asked me to join in the effort. Golun, the mage, is at the Guild Hall. Borodin, the advisor, is at the Inn.
I should speak with Thane Fjora to learn more about the attempt on her life.
Sergeant Aera wants to know how the investigation is going. I should talk to her.
Sergeant Aera, worrying that the local people may have missed something, wants me to investigate Betar-Nes's home. It's just to the south of the thane's hall.
I found an unusual document in the house. I should return to the thane's Hall and report this.
Golun has apparently been killed. I should speak to Aera outside the thane's hall to learn more.
Aera informed me that she and her soldiers found Golun dead in the hall library. I should investigate.
I used the glowing orb, and an image of Golun appeared before me! I should talk to him.

Golun's research indicates the Worm Cult hopes to use ancient spirits to empower the ghost giant Sinmur. He found evidence their lair is in the crypt beneath Nimalten. I should investigate the fireplace to see if I can gain access.
Borodin is here in the crypt! I should hear what he has to say.
The cult is attempting to take control of Nimalten! Borodin has been set the task of keeping me distracted. It's time Borodin met his end.
I should speak to Fjora.
I must find the thane. I hope she's still alive.
Aera Earth-Turner, my old friend, was behind the attack on Nimalten. She tried to kill the thane. I must leave the thane's hall and find Aera.
I must chase after Aera.
Aera is inside the crypt. I must confront her about her betrayal.
Aera is dead. I should speak with the thane in her throne room.
I rescued Arithiel, who may have an idea of what the Worm Cult plans for Abamath. I must collect the <<mz:1>> to unlock the entrance into the Ayleid ruin.
I need to speak to the delegates in the Argonian and Dark Elf camps and find a way to convince them to return to the Prince's meeting.
Golun was stabbed to death. He managed to crawl across the room, holding some kind of glowing sphere. I should investigate this glass sphere.
Scout Anglith delivered <<Ac:1>>, just in time. I should attend the wedding.
I've made it inside the mine. I should find <<1>>.
I found the four <<mz:1>>. I must now place two in the sconces near the Ayleid door to unlock the entrance to the Abamath's ruins.
I should seek out Jorunn and find out how I can help.
I unlocked the door to Abamath by placing the <<mz:1>> in the sconces. I should check with Arithiel about our plan.
I should present myself to Thane Unnvald in his manor.
Thane Unnvald was extremely suspicious of my arrival. His Housecarl, Thorulf, has just arrived.
<<1>> interrupted the Thane's paranoid tirade. He would like to speak to me.
<<1>> reported that the undead have begun another attack. I should speak to Hallfrida.
I've set free all the miners I could find. I should find Foreman Gandis and tell him the good news.
I must place the last two <<mz:1>> in their sconces at either end of the ruins' main chamber to access Mauloch's sanctum. Arithiel will meet me at its entrance deep within the ruins.
I've delivered the book to Shandi, the Khajiiti bard. I should see what she thinks of it.
I've gathered the unusual materials. I should bring them to Farandor, who should be waiting for me outside the insect grove.
Farandor needs some unusual materials to capture his tale. He's asked me to get blood from the hoarvors within Valeguard, and flesh from some creature called "Old Tusk."
Farandor said I could "lure" the words by coaxing them out with the hoarvor blood. I'll have to wait and see exactly what he means.
The words were attracted to me, as Farandor said, quite literally. Now that they've been captured on Old Tusk's flesh, I need to seal them at a fire pit in Valeguard.
The "book" is complete, and Farandor asked me to deliver it to a waiting bard.
One of the women in the hall has asked me to speak to her outside.
Thorulf keeps his room locked. Sirkidur may have a key, but Hallfrida doesn't know how to get it.

<<1>>, the grandaughter of Thane Unnvald, fears <<2>> has turned against her family. She's asked me to investigate his quarters. If I find anything, I should bring it to her on the fort's upper floor.
Housecarl Thorulf has intervened with the Thane on my behalf. He warned me that I would be watched while I'm at Fullhelm. I've been dismissed, and should leave the throne room.
I unlocked the door by placing the two <<mz:1>> in their sconces. I should enter the shrine of Mauloch and stop the Worm Cult's ritual.

An energy barrier blocks the way into the sanctum, where the Worm Cult is preparing a ritual to summon Mauloch. Arithiel noticed something on the pedestal near the sanctum's entrance. I should examine the pedestal more closely.
A soul is required to shatter the <<1>> and clear the path into the shrine. Boethiah says Arithiel is a traitor, but I should talk to Arithiel before I decide to sacrifice her to this stone.

As a former Worm Cultist, Arithiel was forced to murder her own people, but seeks to atone for her crimes. I must decide who should die, Arithiel or perhaps another, in order to clear the entrance to the sanctum and stop the ritual.
I sacrificed Arithiel's soul to the <<1>>. With Boethiah's Blessing, I must kill the summoners in the Shrine of Mauloch, before they can create a portal to Mauloch's realm.
I've prevented the Worm Cult's ritual, and spared Arithiel's life. I should talk with her to see what she plans to do now.
Arithiel is summoning a flame atronach to help me stop the ritual. I need to kill the summoners in the Shrine of Mauloch, before they can create a portal to Mauloch's realm.
<<1>> has asked me to travel to Riften and speak with <<2>>.
I should locate <<1>> in Stormhold, located in northern Shadowfen just south of Deshaan.
It seems Tervur is not all he pretended to be. I must retrieve the deed from him.
<<1>>'s soul has been sealed within Treehenge. I should speak to her to see if she has recovered from this ordeal.

The matron of the spriggans said the cultists have all but exterminated the spriggans tending the roots of Treehenge.\n\nThe matron said a seed would allow the former Green Lady to root. It lies underground, where I first came in.
<<1>>'s soul has been stolen away by the Worm Cult before I could seal it within the seed. I must recover it before they can sever it completely from Treehenge.
Though I recovered <<1>>'s soul, the ordeal has severely weakened her. Lara and the matrons hope to restore her strength. I should wait to see if their efforts succeed.
<<1>>'s soul has been sealed within Treehenge. I should speak to her to see if she has recovered from this ordeal.
Though I've recovered <<1>>'s soul, it has been weakened severely. If it's to survive, I'll need to find a way to mend it before it's too late.
Prince Irnskar and his troops are downstairs. I should let him know what happened.
I should head to the keep in Fort Amol. Lord Vurlop will follow me.
Lord Vurlop led me into a trap. Naryu Virian showed up just in time to help me. I should ask her what's going on.
I need to enter the keep's courtyard and find a way into the Jarl's manor. Maybe one of the Stormfist troops is carrying a key.
I found the key on one of the Stormfist soldiers. I should be able to enter the Jarl's manor now.
It looks like Naryu found her own way into the Jarl's manor. But I see only one guard. Where are the rest of King Jorunn's soldiers? I should talk to Naryu and see what she found out.
The King and his war council must be behind one of the locked doors in the Jarl's manor. I need to search the manor for a way to unlock the doors.
The note said there's trouble at the mine in Lost Knife Cave. I should find the note's author, Eitaki Snowmead.
Now that I have the key to the safe room, I should go inside and see if I can find King Jorunn and the Pact ambassadors.
The illusionist Dhalen has taken the form of King Jorunn. The real King and the ambassadors must be behind the other locked door, upstairs. I need to find Dhalen and put an end to this charade.
Dhalen and his duplicates are dead. I should enter the vault and check on the Ebonheart Pact leaders.
I need to head out of town and find the bags of silk the bandit leader stole.
I should return to Nimalten with the bag of silk. I'll need to decide who gets the silk. Or indeed, if I should just destroy the silk by throwing it into the fireplace at the inn.
I've decided to give the silk to Enthis. I should give him the good news.
I've decided to give the silk to Turil.
I ran into Naryu when I emerged from the vault. I should speak to her.
Prince Irnskar and his troops are downstairs. I should let him know what happened.
The King is dying. I need to leave the vault and find someone to help him.
I need to let <<1>> know that the ancient axe Wuuthrad is missing.
I need to accompany <<1>> to the Shrine of <<2>>.
I helped Skald Svari become Sage of the Companions.
<<1>> has asked me to meet her at Fallowstone Hall.
Now that I've awakened the matrons, I should enter the grove's center and speak to them.
The matrons say the Worm Cult is plotting to destroy Treehenge with poison and take <<1>>. I should warn her.
<<1>> said the altar in the nearby grove could be used to draw <<2>> from the cultists. She urged me to collect the nearby <<m:3>> and <<m:4>> and use them to cleanse the altar.
<<1>> believes the shard of Wuuthrad that Thorulf gave him was somehow cursed - as soon as he gave it to me his fears of the Jarls passed. He'd like to speak to me again.

The garrison is holding the keep, but the undead must be pushed back on all quarters. I need to raise banners at four tactically important points around the fort. This will signal the troops to attack and hold that area.
While I was defeating the undead attack, something went wrong at the keep - the storage house is on fire! I should return quickly to see what can be done.
<<1>> is just outside the burning shed. She'll know what's going on.
The undead tunneled into an underground storage space beneath the fort. I need to enter the area and defeat the invaders.
I've defeated the invaders. I should exit the storage shed as soon as possible - just in case Sjarakki hasn't manged to get the fires put out.
The invaders are defeated. I should exit the storage shed as soon as possible to see why Lady Hallfrida is calling for me.
There is enough time to either save Thane Unnvald or make Thorulf pay for his actions. I can't do both.
While I spoke to Thane Unnvald, he was afflicted by an intense head pain. I should speak to him again.
Hallfrida, now the Thane of Fullhelm, is waiting to speak with me in the manor hall.
I have to find <<1>> and get her out of here before something terrible happens!
With the Hagravens taken care of, I should make sure Tovisa can get home before I leave the area.
Tovisa let herself get captured to infiltrate the camp. I need to look around the camp for information. She gave me a Reachman outfit as a disguise.
I've discovered that the Reachmen here worship a coven of Hagravens. I should go tell Tovisa.
I should find Oda Wolf-Sister and give her Koruni's letter.
I should explore Bleakrock Island and look for people who may need help.
I met Darj, a hunter, at Skyshroud Barrow. He came here to investigate reports of undead in the area.
I met Rolunda at the entrance to Orkey's Hollow. Her brother is missing, and may be inside.
I met Seyne at Hozzin's Folly. She's investigating a group of bandits that have taken over the mine.
I met Seyne at Hozzin's Folly. She's investigating a group of bandits that have taken over the mine.
<<1>> said to get into the mystics' sanctum, find out what I can, and steal a key to the mine.
<<1>> and the others are gone. I need to ask Gnarled-Root what happened.
<<1>> has been taken into the mine! I have to get inside before something terrible happens to her.
Now that I accounted for all the lost companions, I should return to <<1>>.
I should find <<1>>.
I should enter the portal to explore the ancient ruins of <<1>> with <<2>>. I need to look for clues that explain what Doshia was looking for.
I must enter the mine and locate the foreman. He may know why the Reachmen are here.
Missing pages hold the key to a puzzle inside Taarengrav, one the Worm Cult must be kept from opening. I must collect lost notes and save any surviving delvers.
I've pieced together what notes I could find about the ruin. I should head below and look for Kireth's apprentice, Daneras.
Now that I've spoken to the spirit, I need to find the puzzle mentioned in the notes.
Vigrod heard that Fallowstone Hall has been overrun and he's asked for my help. I can follow him or meet him there.
Now that I've gathered the reagents, I should use them at the altar beside the stream to free <<1>> from the Worm Cult.
I cleansed the altar, which allowed Finoriell's soul to materialize. I should speak to her to let her know what's going on.
The cultists are destroying the spriggans who tend and protect the roots of Treehenge. I need to stop them before it's too late.
A voice from the spriggans asked me to speak with it. I should find it and see what it wants to tell me.
I've recovered the seed from the roots of Treehenge. This, combined with the fresh power of <<1>>'s soul, may fortify Treehenge against the Worm Cult's attacks.
I have to find <<1>> and get her out of here.
I need to kill the twin Hagravens and collect their heads.
Now I have to kill the matriarch.
I've done what I came for in the mine. Time to get out and see how Tovisa's doing.
With the Hagravens dead, I should tell Tovisa that it's over.
With the delver notes in-hand, I should be able to make my way through this door puzzle.
I've come upon a Worm Cult ritual. They're doing something vile to the spirit that's been speaking to me since I entered the ruin. I need to stop them.
<<1>>, the leader of the refugees, claims <<2>>'s husband contracted the plague and had to be abandoned in the crypts.
Thorulf is dead, but Thane Unnvald has certainly killed himself by now. I should make sure Hallfrida is all right.
I should return to the Keeper's house to speak with Captain Alhana. We need to determine our next steps against the Keeper and her witches.
I met the ghostly image of a bard named <<1>>. She thinks her mentor, the <<2>>, can set things right. I should seek her out at the site of Engling's performance.
I saw the Reach shamans perform a dark ritual. I should examine the altar they used.
An energy barrier blocks the way into the sanctum, where the Worm Cult is preparing a ritual to summon Mauloch. I should ask Arithiel for guidance.
I've been asked to report to Aelif as soon as possible.
I must figure out the puzzle trapping Khanni's soul. She said words can solve the puzzle, starting with the poem about the Warrior.
I successfully unlocked the Warrior and the Mage. The final puzzle remaining is the Thief.
I successfully unlocked the Warrior. I will work my way around the tomb's base and unlock the Mage next.
I should meet King Jorunn and Prince Irnskar at Jorunn's Stand.
I have been asked to report to <<1>> at the Guildhall.  I should talk to her as soon as possible.
While Tervur is checking the damage, I must ensure his safety.
I have been asked to report to Sees-All-Colors again. I should make my way to her.
Merric wants Aelif and me to lead the investigation into Jofnir's death. He's instructed me to speak to her nearby.
I should head to <<1>>.
I've reached <<1>>. An Argonian named <<2>> is crouched outside the cave. I should speak to him.
I should head to <<1>> and see what has Valdur so worried.
Now that I've reached <<1>> I should speak to <<2>>.
I should speak to <<1>>.
With Sinmur defeated, I should speak to <<1>> to make sure all is well.
I should find someone who'll return these amulets to the families of the fallen.
I should choose a companion to help me fight through the Worm Cultists ahead.\n\n<<1>> suggested I seek the council of <<2>>, <<3>>, and <<4>>.
Now I need to enter <<1>>.
I must find and destroy the Reaper Orb that is sealing the gate ahead.
With the Reaper Orb destroyed and gate unbarred, it's time to enter the mountain pass.
The Reaper Orb is destroyed, but the way is barred by the Necrosis Orb. I must destroy it to advance.
Hloenor Chill-Owl said she saw Commander Yjarnn and Thod walk toward the Guard House. That's odd, since I found Thod asleep by the river. I should locate the Commander and find out what's going on.
I should use the hoarvor blood on the walls of Indraseth's chambers.
The Maormer kept the first mate in a cage, but I've freed him from his prison. He may know where to find the captain.
I should collect amulets from fallen Ebonheart Pact soldiers in <<1>>.
The raid was a success, at least for the Baandari. I should let <<1>> know what occurred.
<<1>> worries the Gold Coast mercenaries will be getting new orders soon. He wants me to intercept them before they get to the Gold Coast, so he can know what to expect.

<<1>> believes I can deliver a fake message to the captain of the Gold Coast mercenaries while wearing the uniform of the late courier. He hopes to goad their captain into attacking nearby werewolves.
The letter contained exactly what <<1>> expected to see. He's already made a plan, and wants to relay it to me in a more private venue.
I've intercepted the message meant to reach the Gold Coast mercenaries. Now to bring it to <<1>> while the mercenaries continue to await its arrival.
The captain did not direct the werewolf attack herself, but sent several of her commanders instead. If I can take them out and frame the werewolves, her forces will be severely weakened.
The raid was a success, at least for the Baandari. I should let <<1>> know what occurred.

The only remaining officer in Velyn Harbor wants to form a militia to repel the invaders, but the civilians are hiding in the Trade Hall and the Mages Guild. I need to rally them and rendezvous at the Fighters Guild.
I rescued a number of civilians and sent them toward the Fighters Guild to meet up with <<1>>. I need to follow suit and find out what needs to be done next.

<<1>> wants me to clear Velyn Harbor's upper gate so a runner can get through and warn Deepwoods. Once I've killed any Drublog at the gate, I should blow the signal horn to alert the runner that the way is safe.
The runner is off to Deepwoods. <<1>> planned to take back one of the burnt-out buildings and use it as a forward headquarters. I should find it and inform the lieutenant of my success.
I located <<1>>'s headquarters. I should tell him the runner is safely headed to Deepwoods.
<<1>> is free, and the Gold Coast is leaderless. It's only a matter of time before they break apart and, hopefully, wander back to Colovia. I should speak to <<1>> about this matter.
<<1>> wants me to talk to other traders to get their support. He plans to use what gold he can gather to buy off the remaining mercenaries still loyal and not incapacitated by our plotting.
Though many of the Gold Coast mercenaries died in the battle with the werewolves, plenty more are still prepared for battle.\n\n<<1>> wants me to drug their drink to reduce their effectiveness.
<<1>>'s sent me to meet his assistant, and finish the plan we've set in motion.
I've convinced the other traders of the urgency of this matter. I should find <<1>> and tell him of my success.
I've added the powder to the Gold Coast's kegs. I should speak with <<1>> to see what he plans to do with this advantage.
Armed with the payments from the various merchants, I've been sent to parley with the remaining Colovian mercenary leaders.
<<1>>'s patience has no doubt run out by this point. I should find and confront her, before she kills <<2>>.
<<1>> is free, and the Gold Coast is leaderless. It's only a matter of time before they break apart and, hopefully, wander back to Colovia. I should speak to <<1>> about this matter.
<<1>> killed <<2>>. I should find him in the town hall and avenge the lieutenant's death.
The town hall is one of the few buildings left unscathed by the invasion. I should kill <<1>> and avenge <<2>>'s death.
Now that I've killed <<1>>, I should meet <<2>> by the bridge.
<<1>> needs to get the militia in position so they can attack the invaders. She asked me to enter the warehouse district and burn the invaders' supplies.
<<1>> needs to get the militia in position so they can attack the invaders. She'll order the militia to attack once I burn enough of the invaders' supplies.
I burned the invaders' supplies. I should head to the docks and find <<1>>. If the attack went well, she'll be somewhere near the lighthouse.
<<1>> trapped the Ra Gada captain in the lighthouse. She asked me to follow him inside and put an end to him.
I should defeat the Ra Gada captain. Without him to lead the invaders, the invasion force should crumble.
I slew the Ra Gada captain. I should inform <<1>>.
Talking to the captain was a waste of time, but now I know what happened, and why <<1>> had such a low opinion of her. I'd better talk to the sergeant again.
Mera Stormcloak must keep Windhelm and King Jorunn safe, so she asked me to report to Captain Hamar and ascertain the situation at Fort Morvunskar.
The invader lieutenant is dead. I'll return to <<1>> and see what he thinks of the situation.
He's very anxious about the tools of his trade, lost in the initial Drublog attack. He said the Drublog took them, but they could be stashed somewhere in the residential area.
<<1>> insists someone broke into the brewery's upper room, where the finished beverages are kept. I should take a look.
<<1>> recently arrived from Riften, and his soldiers are tending Veldrana's wounds. I should see what he's doing here.
I found a bit of moldy straw on the zombie that attacked the homeless. This suggests searching the stable outside the east gate of Riften.
I found a lump of pig iron on the zombie killed at the stables. The only source of pig iron in Riften is the smithy west of Riften's main market square.
The zombie I slew outside the smithy was carrying a rotten salmon. Salmon are usually caught on the docks on the west side of Riften.
You should never see this.
The lamia queen is defeated. I must speak with the Sister of Floods.
The Worm Cult expedition made camp at the Dragon Cult temple ruin on the peak of Forelhost. I need to head up the mountain to learn what happened to the shard of Wuuthrad.
I found the frozen corpse of the cult leader reaching for a grimoire in the snow. Perhaps I can find a clue within it.
The old grimoire found near the cult leader's corpse bears the title "Practical Necromancy". A cracked leather strap marks a page. I should read it to learn the cult's plan.
I collected vampire blood and secured the aid of the Dreamwalker. Now I should go to the camp of the Ternion monks and seek their assistance.

The necromantic ritual bookmarked in the grimoire discusses "Summoning, Binding, and Questioning Spirits of Aetherius." If I perform the ritual, I can summon the cult leader to tell me where the Wuuthrad shard is.
I have all the reagents mentioned in the grimoire. I should use them to summon the leader's spirit from within his ritual circle, and then I should speak to the spirit.
Nordahl must have prepared a summoning circle somewhere on the peak. I must find it.
I should use the Animus Geode and then speak to Nordahl's spirit.
I should look for Grida at the apothecary in Darkwater Crossing, a town near Fort Amol.
Grida left a note in the ransacked apothecary. I should read it.

Grida's note included a recipe for Darkwater Crossing's bath salts. I need to kills trolls for their fat, get claws from mudcrabs, and barter for daril. Maybe I'll run into Grida while I collect these items.
I collected items for the recipe, but there's still no sign of Grida. Perhaps she's at the mill she mentioned in the note. I need to go there and grind the ingredients, anyway.
I decided to give Dralof the bath salts. He's a big Nord and he knows the risks.
As I ground the bath salts ingredients, Grida appeared. She was some kind of undead creature. I wonder if the bath salts had anything to do with her condition? I should speak to Dralof about this.
I decided not to give the bath salts to Dralof. They're dangerous and I don't want to see Dralof and his friends get hurt. Now it looks like Frera Dagger-Lost wants to talk to me.
I've learned from Nordahl that the entrance to Forelhost proper is sealed by a puzzle. I need to work out the proper order of images on the stones before the doors.
Some Daedra escaped through a portal, but their master left something behind. It may contain a clue as to where they took <<1>>'s brew.
<<1>> will want to know what's happened. Maybe he has an idea where the Daedra might have gone, or why they're here in the first place.
<<1>> thinks the Daedra may have fled to Balding Hill, where they may be preparing to burn the rotmeth. I should go there prepared for a fight.
I've learned that the three runestones must all be set to different images.
I've learned that the center runestone is a Snake.
I've learned that the right runestone must be set to an image of a carving with plumage, or feathers.
Haraldar also asked me to collect some rare spices from the storeroom on the meadery's upper floor.
I've unsealed the gates of <<1>>. I can now enter the ruins to search for the <<2>>.
Haraldar asked me to help his brother Roruld, the new master mead crafter. He's having some kind of trouble that involves bees and giants.
The creature that took the <<1>> is somewhere in these ruins. I should explore until I find it.
I've defeated <<1>>, the ancient Dragon Priest. After it died, the <<2>> appeared on the altar. I must collect it.
I should repeat the ritual I used to summon Nordahl at the necromantic circle to summon the Dragon Priest.
I've recovered the <<1>>. I should leave the peak and return to Veldrana to make sure she's all right.
I can use the <<1>> to summon the spirit of <<2>>. Though he can't move from the place I summon him, he will answer any question I ask.
<<1>> knows more about where this message will arrive. I should talk to him.
I should put on the disguise so the captain will speak with me.
I need to collect the blood of a vampire to bolster the King's life force. Thane Oda suggests I seek out vampires in Wittestadr.
I need to help solve the problem in Wittestadr before the vampires will aid me.
I decided to aid the Argonian Dreamwalker. He wants my assistance before he'll help me save King Jorunn.
<<1>> took the most fervent civilians with him to search for his missing captain, who he believes is still alive. I should speak with him right away.
The correspondence may have arrived in the camp already. I should search for any sign of it.
The ritual seems to have worked. I should speak to Stormy-Eyes.
I found the body of Imwyn's sister. She carried a note talking about Imwyn's daughter.  However, the Sigil wasn't on her body.
I should speak with Aerana once more, to talk once more about her mother's Sigil.
Stormy-Eyes, who appears to be some kind of healer, has asked me to gather materials for a healing ritual. I need to collect the wings of torchbugs and find the key to Stormy-Eyes's house.
I found the key to Stormy-Eyes's house. I need to enter the house and find his satchel.
I found a looter inside Stormy-Eyes's house. I should confront him and see what he's doing in here.
The looter claimed it was his house, but when I confronted him he ran off. I should follow him.
I fought the Redguard wizard and gravely injured him. He fled before I could finish him off. I need to find him.
I recovered the reagents and collected the torchbug wings needed for the healing ritual. I should return to the cave and turn them over to Stormy-Eyes.
I gave Stormy-Eyes what he needed to perform the healing ritual. Now all I can do is watch and wait.
The ritual seems to have worked. I should speak to Stormy-Eyes.
I should talk to <<1>> at the Mages Guild.
Imwyn asked me to find her sister, Awyn. Awyn fled south with the Sigil, trying to keep it out of Stormfist hands.
I need to talk to <<1>> as soon as I can.
Teldur told me that several villagers are still trapped by the guards or fires. I can get water from the well to put out the fires.
I rescued the townspeople trapped in Silsailen. Now I should speak with Elenwen at the barn outside of town.
Hadmal is gone. He couldn't bear to destroy his family again, so he left that to me. He also left me his most prized possession. I should recover his journal and open the chest.
I should see if I can find any other books about Vaermina and return them to the library.
I helped the vampires of Wittestadr. Now I can ask for some blood to save the King.
I helped Stormy-Eyes. Now I can ask him to help me save the King.
In order to help save the King, I need to gather the blood of a vampire as well as the help of one known as a Dreamwalker.
I must fight through the Worm Cultists barring the way to Sinmur.
Now I need to enter Trolhetta Summit.
<<1>>'s taken <<2>> into a protective custody beneath the docks, where she'd been found after the invasion. I should talk to the captain there.
I'm through the Worm Cultists. Now to kill Sinmur.
I should speak with <<1>>. If the militia's attack went well, she'll be somewhere near the lighthouse.
I didn't have to kill any wolves, so that should please Thane Oda. She has a strong attachment to the wolves. Now I should find her and speak to her about the war council.
<<1>> brought down the barrier blocking the doorway to Ragnthar, I should enter the Dwarven ruins and meet her inside.
Now that I've entered Ragnthar, I should search the Dwarven ruins for evidence of what Sees-All-Colors was up to.
After I took the insignia, the strange noise I heard must have been the activation of a trap. Dwarven automatons appeared shortly after. I must survive their attack.
The Queen prepares for her rituals within Tanzelwil. I should seek her out.
I have defended the priestesses as they performed the rituals. I should tell the Queen that they have completed their tasks.
I won the contest! I should talk to Steady-Hand to collect my reward.
I need to break through the Maormer beachhead and find <<1>>.
I should speak to <<1>>.
Telenger has asked me to seek out <<1>> among the sprawling ruins of <<2>>.
I should find the two runes Andewen spoke of in the outer ruins of Ezduiin.
Now that I have the items, I should return to Andewen. She said she'd meet me at the entrance to the undercroft, which is at the center of the ruins.
I should enter the <<1>> undercroft.

Uricantar, a former student of Telenger's, is behind the appearance of the spirits. He now tries to channel the spiritual energy of Andewen's researchers to open a portal to Aetherius. I must free the researchers to stop himâ€”one way or another.
This is it. I need to find Uricantar and put a stop to his madness.
I need to take the Mallari-Mora from Uricantarâ€”by any means necessary.
Now that I've recovered the artifact, I should return it to Telenger the Artificer at the main camp.
I should speak to Telenger.
<<1>> gave me a magical crystal. I need to engage the spirits of Ezduiin in combat, weaken them, and then focus my will through the crystal. This should send the spirits back to Aetherius.
A powerful spirit appeared and asked me to speak with him. I'm to meet with him at the entrance to a vault on the edge of the ruins.
I've chosen four tiles, I should attempt to retrieve the relic within the chest. If I'm wrong, I will need to be quick to avoid the puzzle's defenses.
I should speak to <<1>> now that she's finished her spell.
I must find the remaining Nereid Sisters.
I should speak to Telenger at the main camp.
I need to rescue the few remaining survivors of <<1>>'s patrol.
I rescued the remaining members of <<1>>'s patrol. I need to talk to her to figure out what's going at the lighthouse.
The lighthouse is blocked by a magic barrier. I need to get a rune from the Maormer spellcasters to gain access.
I need to go up the lighthouse and destroy the lighthouse beacon to halt the Maormer invasion.
The Queen wants me to defend the priestesses as they perform the ancient rituals.
<<1>> is dead. I should return to Elenwen and break the news to her.
I should speak to Tendil once more and see what he has planned.
I should make haste for Tanzelwil and speak to someone in the Queen's entourage.
Queen Ayrenn and I need to enter the crypts. I should speak with her first, to learn more about what we might face.
I should follow the Queen into the ancestral chambers.
The traitor Norion appeared and attacked the Queen! I must protect her.
The Queen and I have defeated Norion. Now she can complete her ritual. I should stand back and observe Her Majesty in action.
Queen Ayrenn completed the ritual at Tanzelwil. I should meet her outside the tombs.
I have destroyed the last Corruption Stone at Tanzelwil. I should confer with Priestess Langwe.
There's a hunting bow by the river. I need to get the bow and equip it to compete in this hunting contest.
I can talk to Steady-Hand to start the competition, or I can speak to Vurila for some advice before I begin.
I need to kill a number of rabbits or snag the speedy Golden Jack with the hunting bow before time runs out.
Vurila gave me some fiery arrows. I should talk to Steady-Hand to start the contest.
I must defeat the lamia queen.
I need to kill a number of rabbits or snag the speedy Golden Jack with the hunting bow before time runs out.
Time ran out. I lost. Maybe if I speak to Steady-Hand I can try again.
Time ran out. I lost. Maybe if I speak to Steady-Hand I can try again.
The Queen was attacked by a malicious spirit. I should speak with her.

Sonya asked me to recover the remains of her three daughters. Her husband scattered the remains somewhere in Eastmarch. I should read the page from his journal. Maybe it has a clue as to where I should start looking.
I collected the remains of Sonya's three daughters. I should return to the lost spirit and give them to her.

Sonya's husband Hadmal believes his wife's spirit has gone to the ruins south of Jorunn's Stand. He thinks she's performing a ritual to sacrifice their daughters' spirits to Molag Bal. I have to stop her.
I destroyed Sonya and the monster she created. But Hadmal never arrived. I should find Hadmal and tell him what happened to his family.
Centurion Gjakil has asked I travel to the town of Nimalten, to warn the thane of the Worm Cult plot. I should speak to a guard when I reach town.
I need to find the corpses and burn them.
The villager corpses have been disposed of. I should return to Weynon Priory and let <<1>> know.

I found the remains of Sonya's first daughter, as well as another page from her husband's journal. I should read it and see if it provides a clue as to where to search for the remains of the second daughter.
I found the remains of Sonya's second daughter and another page from her husband's journal. I should read it and see if it provides a clue as to where to look for the remains of the third daughter.
I've been asked to talk to Dajaheel at the Pact's forward encampment.
I need to stop Teldur and rescue the Canonreeve. They were last seen entering the manor.
It was <<1>> who betrayed the town. He has to pay for this.
Now that I'm at Trolhetta Summit, I should talk to King Jorunn.
Stral is dead, and the Reachmen attack on the Rift blunted. I should get out of the ruins and regroup with the remaining Pact soldiers.
<<1>> asked me to kill ten Black Dagger bandits in <<2>>.
I killed some Black Daggers in <<1>> and should return to <<2>> in <<3>>.
I've retrieved Bonebane, proving Thorulf a liar and a traitor. I should inform <<1>>.
<<1>> just ran in. I should listen to what she has to say.
I should also speak to Aera while I'm in the Thane's Hall.
Something's wrong about all this. Sonya's spirit hinted at dark tasks and darker rituals. I need to find her husband and learn more about what happened. Perhaps the letter on the ground will help.
The Black Daggers are camped on an island west of Weynon Priory. I should travel there and recover the Claw of Akatosh.
I recovered the claw. I should bring it to <<1>> at Weynon Priory.
I've destroyed the ivory carvings and attracted the attention of the mammoth spirits. There's no telling if they understand, but perhaps <<1>> has more insight into their reaction.
Before she was killed by the Worm Cult's poison, <<1>> asked for my help in recovering the ivory they took.
The ivory has been placed, and the fire is ready. I need to add the ceremonial knife now. The fire should be hot enough to destroy the ivory and the knife in order to free the mammoth spirits.

<<1>> has been tracking the actions of the Worm Cult, and wants to stop them before they destroy the sanctity of the shrine.\n\nHe's asked me to retrieve one of their ceremonial carving knives, in order to appease the mammoth spirits.
<<1>> mentioned another Altmer in the area, whom she was doing research for. I should seek him out.
I've taken the ceremonial knife. To begin its destruction, I'll need to place the tusks I retrieved earlier into the fire pit near <<1>>.
<<1>> is dead. I need to talk to <<2>>.
We're done here. I should leave <<1>>.
Priestess Langwe provided me with an Altmer Holy Symbol to use on the mysterious stone.
The Altmer Holy Symbol destroyed the mysterious stone. I should speak with Priestess Langwe to discuss our strategy for destroying the remaining stones.
Priestess Langwe has asked me to seek out and destroy the mysterious Corruption Stones located throughout Tanzelwil.
<<1>> told me of a puzzle that protects the powerful spell lattice inside the vault. I can solve the puzzle by selecting the correct four tiles.
I've decided it's safe for <<1>> to stay in the camp.
I've decided it is not safe for <<1>> to stay in the camp.
<<1>> was banished from the camp for refusing to match the depravity of the other survivors. Even in the end he believed the others could be reasoned with. I should confront <<2>>.
I should tell <<1>> of her husband's fate.
It is done. The food supply is destroyed. Now to see if <<1>> will listen to reason.
I should tell <<1>> of her husband's fate.
<<1>> was banished from the camp for refusing to match the depravity of the other survivors. Even in the end he believed the others could be reasoned with. I should confront <<2>>.
It is done. The food supply is destroyed. Now to see if <<1>> will listen to reason.
<<1>> set up his own camp in a small tomb, but became infected himself. His journal might have more evidence.
Their food supply is kept in a small tomb on the western side of the camp. Now to burn it.
The food supply should be nearby, likely attached to the main camp.
<<1>> set up his own camp in a small tomb, but became infected himself.
<<1>> is not at the camp. I should look for him further in the crypts.
I found the cellar where the Royal Marines are being held. I should speak to their leader.
I need to recover gear for Captain Tendil and his men.
Andewen and I found a wounded apprentice inside the ruins. I should speak to him.
I need to accompany Andewen as she seeks out her missing team members.
I should go south to the border with Shadowfen.
Now that I possess a <<1>>, I need to use it to destroy the barrier blocking me from entering the South Beacon Lighthouse.
I've destroyed the silk. I should inform Enthis.
I've destroyed the silk. I should inform Turil.
I decided neither merchant deserves the silk, so I destroyed it. Now to decide who gets the bad news.
I should return to the room near the undercroft entrance. I need to tell Andewen my work is done.
I followed Queen Ayrenn into the ancient chambers. I must protect her until she completes the final ritual below.
The minstrels value their instruments as much as their lives! As the werewolves took their  instruments, I'll need to search the small camps used by the Houndsmen and recover them.
The minstrels scattered throughout the ravine below Silvenar. According to Laen they're in hiding. I need to find them and tell them to get to safety at their camp.
The minstrels are supposed to gather at their original camp overlooking the canyon.  I should meet them there.
The minstrels have gathered at their camp. I'll talk to <<1>> and give them back their instruments.
I need to kill <<1>> for the minstrels to be able to play at any of the celebrations.
<<1>> believes the key to unraveling this magical corruption lies with Keeper Vildras, the guardian of the reliquary. I should enter the reliquary and seek him out.
<<1>> isn't talking. Perhaps <<2>> can help me understand the young woman.
Bonohild says herbal tea is Yiri's favorite drink. It could be hard to come by in Riften. She let me know a Khajiit trader named J'darzi might have some.
I have acquired some herbal tea. I should see if it coaxes Yiri out of her fugue state.

The Worm Cult seeks a shard of Wuuthrad in Riften. Yiri must know something about their plans to retrieve it, but whatever she witnessed has rendered her unable to speak.\n\nI need to find a way to draw her out of her terrified state.
I slew Thallik Wormfather, but Wuuthrad was shattered and it seems Thallik merged his spirit with the ghost giant Sinmur. I should speak to Hakra. She may know more about what just happened.
We made it to the final chamber. We must enter the chamber and face whatever awaits the Queen.
Priestess Langwe located one last Corruption Stone. I should use the Altmer Holy Symbol to destroy it.
I should seek out Priestess Langwe and inform her that I've destroyed the Corruption Stones.
Now that I've awakened the matrons, I should enter the grove's center and speak to them.
The wedding attendees have arrived. It seems Scout Anglith is here to deliver <<Ac:1>>. I should wait for her to pass it along.
The entertainers have resumed their roles and taken their appropriate places. <<1>> should be able to escape now.
Lucius's note said the supplies are hidden at the top of the tower. I should look for them up there.
Now that I have the supplies, I should return to Weynon Priory and give them to <<1>>.
I should search <<1>> for any sign of <<2>>.

Unfortunately, the entertainers died. Sings-with-Drink gave me a concoction to raise the ghosts of the entertainers so that they can resume their work. That should provide the distraction he needs to escape.
I found an injured Ebonheart Pact scout. She may know something about the Worm Cult or the shard of Wuuthrad.
<<1>> told me the cultists have the shard, but she doesn't know where they went. She's freezing to death, and requires a fire to survive. I need to collect kindling to light it.
I should light a fire to keep <<1>> from freezing. Then, we can discuss the Worm Cult.
I should search the mountain for any clues to the shard's whereabouts. Make sure I don't freeze to death while I'm up here.
The wounded soldier said Aera was headed toward the water. I must find her.
I should speak to the wounded guard.
I should enter the ancient crypt.
The Dragon Priest is nowhere to be found, but a large necromantic altar exists on top of the shrine. Perhaps using this altar will summon it.
<<1>>'s been taken captive by <<2>>. The captain's asked to speak with me at her tent on the hillside beyond the tradepost's gate.
<<1>> has asked me to travel there and destroy it.
The lich is gone. I should return to Weynon Priory and inform <<1>>.
The barrier to Vox's cave has been broken. I should enter and see what awaits.
Only the third of Hakra's burial urns remains. When I destroy that one, her spirit should finally be free of this cavern.
I've restored Molla's hunting party to its proper shapes and sizes. I should find her in the village and speak with her again.
I spared Arithiel's life and used the <<1>> on a Cultist. I should talk to <<2>> about what to do next.
Mael asked me to travel there and poison the Black Dagger food supplies.
I've poisoned the food. I should return to Weynon Priory and inform <<1>>.
I need to look for a researcher named Charadin and rescue him from the Worm Cult. Nila asked me collect equipment from the Worm Cultists as well.
I unlocked the door to Abamath by placing the <<mz:1>> in the sconces. I should enter Abamath and place the final two.
I must speak with Investigator Lienne.
I need to collect a bottle of kindlepitch from Tildur's stash and some fire salts from the Maormer ship.
I need to talk to <<1>> to find out the next step of the plan.
The Marines are being held in a cellar nearby. I should seek them out.
I should talk to <<1>> outside.
Uricantar must be stopped. I need to enter the inner sanctum and get the Mallari-Mora.
Uricantar has begun taunting me through a magical projection. I should speak to him.
I need to get to <<1>> and kill Minwe.
Time to return to <<1>> and inform <<2>> of my success.
I should seek out Daljari, Widulf, and Iroda to complete their challenges.
A bard ran into Geirmund's Hall screaming of giants. I should speak to her.
I completed the three challenges. I should speak to the Thane.
I should locate and kill the necromancer Garron, who was working with Investigator Irnand before betraying his group and ambushing Irnand's team.
I should speak to the Thane at Geirmund's Hall.
I should speak to both the entertainers and the mercenaries to figure out the best fit for each.
I should speak to both the entertainers and the mercenaries to figure out the best fit for each.
Elenwen has asked that I speak to Teldur about rescuing the remaining villagers.
I should speak with Investigator Lienne.
I should search the sewers to find the Pellingare twins, Varaine and Allene Pellingare, nobles who are building an army with which they plan to take over the city of Wayrest.
I've found Allene Pellingare. I should defeat her before she does the same to me.
My first challenge seems pretty simple: fight someone. Shouldn't be too hard.
I've done it. I defeated the champion. I should speak to Daljari.
I've been given my first riddle by Iroda. I need to find the answer on the island, place it in the sack she provided, then return to her.
The answer to the third riddle is "Map." I should return to Iroda to finish my Trial.
I ran the path of flame and can't see any more spirit fires. Widulf met me on the road. So I suppose I'm done? I should talk to him.
The bards and I made it to safety. Time to check in with Vofknir one more time.
To win the contest, I need to drink ten mugs of mead quickly. I was told that food would help me drink more without getting sick.
I've survived the drinking contest and should speak to Eirfa.
I've done it. I should talk to Eirfa.
I should talk to Captain Viveka now.
Once I locate the spies, I need to make them drink from Sanguine's goblet. Then they'll be bound to the party and no longer a threat to the Pact.
The spies have been dealt with. <<1>> should be informed.
Now that the wards are destroyed, I should seek out Razum-dar. He's somewhere in the city.
I should find Battlereeve Urcelmo in Firsthold and offer to help.
I should enter the Mages Guild and speak to Sinien. Urcelmo told me she has a plan to destroy the wards and take down the barrier that surrounds the castle.
I need to find the two wards that create the barrier around the city and use the talisman on them. This will allow Sinien and her group of battlemages to destroy it from afar.
I should speak to <<1>>.
I need to report back to Daljari, tell her how I did.
I need to tackle one of the champions festing around the island. This will be a challenge.
I need to hunt down four flame atronachs to help keep the citizens of Chorrol safe.
I eliminated four flame atronachs. I should let <<1>> know.
I recovered <<1>>'s specialized tools. He said he'd meet me somewhere in the warehouse district near the docks to retrieve them.

It seems <<1>> was hired to kill someone in Velyn Harbor by the very people that attacked it, but they betrayed him. Now he wants me to "send a message" to his former employers by slaying one of them.
I should enter the Oblivion portals and find the sigil stones that power each one. Once I find a stone, I will need to destroy it in order to close that portal for good.
I've closed the portals. I should speak to <<1>>.
I should enter the castle.
I should enter the portal to the Refuge of Dread.
I should defeat High Kinlady Estre and end this madness.
Now that High Kinlady Estre has been defeated, I can close her last remaining portal.
I must follow the Nereids to the lamia queen's chamber.
I've found Nordahl's summoning circle with candles prepared. I must light them in the proper order.
With the candles lit, I must now place the nightshade in the proper spot, and place a piece of animal hide with Nordahl's name on it.
I delivered the salve to the villagers of Phaer. I should report back to Hendil now.
I need to find the ambush site and trigger the attack.
I triggered the Black Dagger ambush and survived. I should return to Chorrol and talk to Lliae.
I should speak to Razum-dar and let him know what happened.
I have Widulf's mead, and I'm ready to run the path of fire. Time to drink his brew.
I have to reach the next spirit fire!
I have to reach the next spirit fire!
I have to reach the next spirit fire!
I have to reach the next spirit fire!
I have to reach the next spirit fire!
I have to reach the next spirit fire!
I have to reach the next spirit fire!
I have to reach the next spirit fire!
I have to reach the next spirit fire!
I have to reach the next spirit fire!
I have to reach the next spirit fire!
I have to reach the next spirit fire!
I told Netanwe about Hendil's madness. I should speak to her one final time.
I've been attacked by Wayrest noble Varaine Pellingare. I should defeat him before he does the same to me.
I need to search Bar-Neeus's tent and report back to Sarisa with my findings.
When I confessed all to Bar-Neeus, he was unshaken by the plot. In fact, he asked me to deliver a gift to the Rothalen family.
Now that I destroyed the lighthouse beacon, I should use the teleport scroll to return to Skylight Beach.
Hendil is using a barn near the edge of town as a hospice. If I'm going to help him out, I'll need to find him there.
The alchemist Hendil uses salloweed sap to create a treatment, a salve. He's asked me to gather new supplies, as both he and his assistant are needed in the barn.
I gathered the salloweed for Hendil. I need to take it back to him at the makeshift hospital.
Hendil and Amuur are still very busy. The alchemist has asked me to deliver salve to three villagers of Phaer.
Lob and his lieutenants have been defeated. I should leave the Cradlecrush arena.
Maybe I should speak with Bar-Neeus while I'm in his tent.
Sarisa wants me to plant illegal goods in Bar-Neeus's tent to frame him. Or I could inform Bar-Neeus of her plans.
I should let Sarisa know that Bar-Neeus has been arrested, as she planned.
I planted the illegal goods in Bar-Neeus's chest. Now to tip off Constable Bronorr.
The answer to the first riddle is "Mirror." I need to return to Iroda to give her my answer.
Iroda has given me my second riddle. I need to find the answer on the island.
The answer to the riddle is "Water."  I should head back to Iroda.
One riddle left! I need to track down my answer.
I won the contest! I should talk to Steady-Hand to collect my reward.
<<1>> asked me to speak with Yiri Windtorn. Yiri claims something took her father.
Why would the Worm Cult want to kill Yiri? I should investigate the cultist's body.
I found a scroll on the dead cultist. Reading it may reveal the Worm Cult's plans.
I need to find the supply cache Lliae told me about and drop off the supplies she gave me.
I resupplied Lliae's cache. I should return to Chorrol and let her know.
I have entered Valano Manor and now need to find Teldur.
I returned to <<1>>'s side. I should speak to her one last time.
<<1>> asked me to speak to the patriarch of the trading post, a Khajiit named <<2>>.

Although Jorunn will eventually need my help, it's also vitally important I recover the shards of Wuuthrad scattered through Smokefrost Peaks. I must find as many as I can, then meet Jorunn at Trolhetta.
I defeated Varaine Pellingare, a Wayrest noble who's been building an army in the sewers to take over the city. I should find his sister, Allene Pellingare, and deal with her, as well.
Jacques is bored, but he's recommended two books I should read. I should read them and get back to him.
I read two silly books and talked to No-Name. I should go tell Jacques what I think about all this.
The Thane asked me to join him on the balcony atop the feasting hall.
I need to retrieve Bartleby's cane from the ruffians who stole it from him. They're just down the road from him.
Vofknir wishes to make a speech. I should humor him and listen.
First, I need to find the camp.
I've found one of the bards. I should speak with him.
Logod said he and Jakaral were separated in the confusion of being drunk. I should try to find him.
I have the key; time to release the prisoners.
I need to head to <<1>> and see what's happening in the area.
Now that we're at the Shrine of <<1>>, <<2>> has asked me to pray with her.
Now <<1>> wants to go to the Shrine of <<2>>.
We're at the Shrine of <<1>>. Time to pray with <<2>>.
<<1>> and I have reached the Shrine of <<2>>. Time to pray.
<<1>> now needs to go to the Shrine of <<2>>.
I need to find Captain Viveka in the <<1>> cave.
I need to find Captain Viveka in the <<1>> cave.
I must stop Gullveig's ritual!
I need to follow Captain Viveka into the lich's sanctum.
I should collect the shard of Wuuthrad to prevent the Worm Cult from getting their filthy paws on it again.
<<1>> has asked me to watch her ascend to the position of Sage of Fallowstone Hall.
The Boneshaper clan is besieging Shor's Stone. Aera can't take out both the clan's Clan Matron and the Daggerfall Covenant spy meeting with her. I volunteered to help by killing them both.
The Boneshaper Clan Matron, the Clan Matron's daughter, and the Daggerfall Covenant spy are dead. I should tell Aera.
With Gullveig taken care of, I should release Captain Viveka.
I should wait a moment before speaking with Hendil. This looks serious.
The village is filled with statues and a very distracted mage. Perhaps he knows what happened to these people? I should speak with him.
Something went wrong with the banishing spell and a Flame Atronoch was released from the bear. I should speak to <<1>>.
I learned that <<1>> is responsible for unleashing the Daedra on the local wildlife. I need to enter the cave and kill the Daedric leader that resides there.
I spoke to <<1>>, who claimed that his intentions were noble. I now need to speak to <<2>>.
I need to grab the salve from the workbench in Hendil's hospice.
I entered a place of burning ash and lava. I need to find <<1>> as soon as I can.
<<1>> is under attack by some kind of phantom of her mind. I should go to her aid.
I dispatched the beast that attacked <<1>>. I should speak with her again.
I have a frivolous book of Skald's drinking songs for Mininque. I also read a tome of his "darker" sonnets. He's writing about Daedra, and that's suspicious. I should let her know.
Skald Skullsplitter is a drunken Nord poet. An Altmer admirer asked me to acquire a book from him.
Skald Skullsplitter offered me book of drinking songs left on a nearby table. I should get a copy for Mininque.

<<1>> told me that he turned the villagers to stone. His goal was to protect them from Daedra. He's instructed me to dispel the energies around monoliths in the woods. That should clear the Daedric influence from the area. He hopes.
As the champion of Geirmund's Hall, it's my duty to escort this drunken bard to safety.
<<1>> needs a bear to act as a test subject. The <<2>> he gave me should allow me to befriend one of the posessed creatures.
Something must have happened to this poor villager. Perhaps I can find out more in town?
I captured a bear. <<1>> instructed me to take the bear to his tower in the grove.
I brought the bear to <<1>>'s tower. I should observe as he does his spell.
I uncovered Hendil's journal, which contains information on the source of the plague. I should take it to Velatosse.

Velatosse is very upset that the mercenaries are guarding Hendil's home, as well as the quarantine area. She thinks the alchemist is hiding something. I should sneak past the guards and pick the front lock, or try to find an alternate way in.

Hendil's journal indicates that something is amiss in the quarantine. Velatosse is very upset, as her elder son has now been taken as well. She's asked me to enter the cave and find out what's going on. Just need to figure out how to get in there.
Eifra told me to start by speaking with her sister, Aelm.
This contest has gotten strange. Eirfa says I need to recite a poem for those gathered around the nearby stage. Before I do, I must drink an especially potent ale.
I need to recite Geirmund's Oath, if I can remember it.
I entered a strange world of ice and freezing rain. I should find <<1>> as soon as I can.

<<1>> is delusional. He says he's freezing, but won't leave the cave because he's cold. I need to collect some fire-starting supplies from around the cave. If he was warmer, perhaps he'd listen to reason.
I have the materials I need to start a fire. I should do so. Perhaps then I can talk to <<1>>.
<<1>> seems to be warming up. I should talk to him to see if he's returned to sanity.
I have to collect items around <<1>> that identify the dead.
I've collected some items to identify the dead. Time to go talk to <<1>>.
<<1>> died waiting for me. I'll check to see if he has a personal item.
With all the personal effects collected, I need to bring them to the families in Riften.
Now to deliver the handkerchief to Svein's family.
The captain has run off to rally her troops. Hopefully all of the scheming so far will pay off, and she will find herself without an army.
