I've arrived at the Harborage. I should speak with the Prophet.
The Prophet has asked that I travel to Vulkhel Guard and search for the Worm Cult agent.
The Prophet has asked that I travel to Daggerfall and search for the Worm Cult agent.
The Prophet has asked that I travel to Davon's Watch and search for the Worm Cult agent.
I found an abandoned cellar. It bears investigation.
I found an abandoned cellar. It bears investigation.
I found an abandoned cellar. It bears investigation.
A projection of an important-looking Imperial sorcerer has appeared and doesn't seem to recognize me as a threat. I should see what information I can get from him.
A projection of an important-looking Imperial sorcerer has appeared and doesn't seem to recognize me as a threat. I should see what information I can get from him.
A projection of an important-looking Imperial sorcerer has appeared and doesn't seem to recognize me as a threat. I should see what information I can get from him.
I have the book and information from Abnur Tharn. I should return to the Prophet.
I have the Orb and information from Abnur Tharn. I should return to the Prophet.
I have the book and information from Abnur Tharn. I should return to the Prophet.
I should talk to Lyris.
I gave the enchanted container filled with poison to Marius, who was very grateful. I should speak to him about my reward.
At'avar should be given a chance to live.
I should return <<1>>'s lute to him.
<<1>> asked me to get his lute back. <<2>> should be just down the road.
<<1>> proposed a game of riddles to win back <<2>>'s lute. I should do my best to answer the riddles.
I won the game of riddles and regained <<1>>'s lute. I should return it to him.

<<1>> doesn't even know where to hunt alits, kagoutis, giant wasps or mudcrabs. She wants me to talk to the very person she made the bet with, <<2>>, and get him to tell me what I need to know. She's begged me not to tell him why.
I've chosen to help <<1>> win her bet. I just need to give the ingredients to her.
I've decided to give <<1>> proof his friend is cheating to win their bet. All I need to do is hand over the ingredients.

<<1>> says all these creatures can be found all over Shadowfen, but that they're most populous in the following areas: kagouti in Leafwater, giant wasps and alits in Venomous Fens, and mudcrabs in Reticulated Spine.

I've collected all the cook's ingredients and I need to take them to Hissmir. But I also need to decide: Should I take them to her so she can win her bet, or should I give them to <<1>> and reveal his drunkard friend's plan to cheat him?
Guardian Sud-Hareem asked for help in finding his son, At'avar.
Sud-Hareem has found a survivor from his group. We should find out what she knows.
Mereel was knocked unconscious when the bandits attacked. She doesn't know what happened to At'avar.
Sud-Hareem heard movement in one of the old spider egg sacks. He is investigating before we move on in our search for At'avar.
Faulor claims that At'avar was dragged farther into Spindleclutch by the vampire leader.
The vampire leader has nowhere left to run.
The vampires have all been defeated. But <<1>>'s fate is not certain.
At'avar should be destroyed.
The Orc's journal may explain why he was in the ruins.
The <<1>> appears to have cured <<2>> entirely. I should find out how she feels.
According to his journal, <<1>> sought a cure for his daughter, <<2>>. It describes two possible curesâ€”<<3>> and <<4>>.\n\nHis <<5>> can hold only one elixir at a time. I must choose carefully.
I prepared a dose of <<1>> for <<2>>, despite what her father wished. I won't know if it works until I give it to her in Hissmir.
I prepared a dose of <<1>> for <<2>>, as her father wished for her. I won't know if it works until I give it to her in Hissmir.
While the <<1>> woke <<2>> from her coma, she appears severely weakened. I should find out how she feels.
Centurion Burri has tasked me with finding three of her scouts. They should have reports that will explain why the Colovians have attacked this ruin.
I should pray at the shrines of Jone and Jode in order to cleanse them.
Speaking to the locals has shed some light on where the agent may be located. I should check the homes near the south city gate.
Speaking to the locals has shed some light on where the agent may be located. I should check the old lighthouse.
Speaking to the locals has shed some light on where the agent may be located. I should check the abandoned stable stall in town.
A soldier approached me after I rescued the last patrol. He asked me to meet him by the Lion Guard Redoubt wayshrine, where it's safe to talk. He seemed to have something important to tell me.
The cult is doing strange rituals in the hills.
The cult is raising Breton zombies at Grimfield.
The spirits of dead orcs have risen at Moriseli.
I have returned to the Harborage. I should give the Orb directly to the Prophet.
Lyris wants to speak to me.
The Queen said that the Champion has entered the city to face the Daedric threat. I should find her.
The Fang is charged with Daedric energy. I should use it to close the portal.
I should meet the Champion at the shrine of Lorkhaj as she instructed.
A Dark Anchor fell as I made my way to the shrine of Lorkhaj. I should defeat it before it corrupts the city.
The Champion asked me to check on Esan. I should look near the Mages Guild.
I should see if the mages are safe in the Mages Guild.
A new portal has opened outside the Mages Guild. I should use the Fang on the portal to close it.
Rosalind perished in the town's burial vault. I need to enter the crypt in Westtry and return her blade to her remains. That should call forth her cursed shade.
One of the fallen yet clings to life. What does he know?
I should inform <<1>> of Mallius's fate.
I should inform <<1>> of Mallius's fate.
<<1>> is at peace. The Blessing of Arkay will keep his spirit safe from Daedric corruption. He asked me to bring the urn to <<2>> in <<3>>.
<<1>> blessed me before he died, to keep me safe from Daedra. He asked me to bring the urn to <<2>> in <<3>>.
I should read the broadsheet.
I helped the town of Crosswych.  The Red Rooks extortion has ended. I should speak to  <<1>>.
I've collected the poison gas. I must chose to return the poison to Marius or Rhea.
<<1>> could know how to defeat the Dremora posing as the Bad Man.
Curator Nicolas explained how to perform the ritual to draw the Dremora Lord from the tree. The shalk glands should be sacrificed directly.
The portal is closed. I need to talk to the Champion to see what to do next.
The mages sensed corruption in the Temple District. I should report in with the Champion and find out what to do next.
I defeated the dark anchor. I should talk to the Champion to see if she's all right.
I need to find the Lion Guard soldiers searching for Angof in the northern parts of Glenumbra.
We found the <<1>>. I should talk to <<2>> to see what's next.
I agreed to help locate the <<1>>. According to <<2>>, the route is dangerous, but the rewards greatly outweigh the risk.
I should search the ruins in Bruma for water and bandages.
I've found the supplies <<1>> needs. I should bring them to him.
When I finished collecting the relics, <<1>> showed up. I should tell him to return to the camp.
<<1>> says he and his father were tasked with guarding the reliquaries, not removing the relics from them. The local tree-minders might know more about the relics.
The tree-minders aren't at their camp. I should tell <<1>> about this.
<<1>> thinks there is something strange about his father's behavior, and fears the tree-minder may be in greater danger from the dreugh. He asked me to search <<Amz:2>>.
I found <<1>> in one of the dreugh mud piles. I should find out what happened to her when I get back to her camp.
I got back to the camp too late and found <<1>> was dead, and the relics taken. I should see if there is anything <<2>> can do to help me return them.
<<1>> thinks she can turn the dreugh on the Dominion guards if I can collect something with their scent. I should search the camp for something suitable.
I found a Dominion bedroll, still smelling like its owner. <<1>> needs this to start her ritual at the reliquary within the ruins beside her camp.
<<1>> asked me to place the <<2>> in the reliquary to complete the ritual.
The dreugh seemed enthralled by the scent of the Dominion troops. I should talk to <<1>> before I go in search of <<2>>.
With the dreugh distracting the Dominion troops, it should be much easier to get through their camp. I should search Mudshallow Cave for <<1>> and the missing relics.
I should look for the mushrooms inside <<1>>.
I found the mushrooms Hjorik wanted. I should return to <<1>> and deliver them.
<<1>> asked me to collect relics in the area. According to him, the vicecanons believe they contain magic that could turn the tide of the war against the Dominion.
<<1>> asked me to search for survivors and give each an invisiblity potion to reach the church safely.
I should return to <<1>> to see if the survivors I found made it back.
<<1>> may not like the treasure he received, but he agreed to take <<2>> to Anvil. I should tell <<2>> the good news.
I should seek out and speak to Angrel, the ghost's friend in Vulkhel Guard.
I need to find Imhey, the frightened young woman's missing friend. She should be somewhere toward the center of the hot springs.
<<1>> has been trapped by some magical bond. She urged me to ask <<2>> for guidance to save her.
A spirit appeared after I removed the items from the dead body. She seems to want to talk to me.

A dead woman named Ehtayah has asked me to complete one final pilgrimage to pray for her brother. I need to place the offering pouch at the shrine nearest the monastery, the one marked with the waxing moon symbol.
I left the offering pouch at the waxing moon shrine. Now I need to find the full moon shrine and place Ehtayah's letter there.
I should find <<1>> and give him the heirloom his brother handed me. <<2>> said his brother would understand what it means.
He ordered Captain Kaleen to take me to Glenumbra. Once there, I must deliver Tazgol's petition to join the Daggerfall Covenant to a Sir Lanis.
I must talk to Sir Lanis Shaldon to inform him that the Seamount Orcs are joining the Covenant.
I found a note on a corpse. I should read it.
Lokra really wants to see the world before settling down. I agreed to talk to her family for her.
After talking to Lokra's family, I now see both sides of the argument. I should go back to see Lokra and advise her as best I can.
A dying Colovian soldier is lying at the foot of the vault stairs. Perhaps she might have some information on what's going on down here.
I've arrived in Glenumbra. I need to find Sir Lanis Shaldon and deliver Tazgol's message that the Seamount Orcs will join the Covenant.
I should use the standing stones southeast of Bruma to charge Hjorik's scrolls.
I charged Hjorik's scrolls at the Anga stones. I should return to him in Bruma.
I've made it through the trapped hallways. Just need to find Razum-dar.
Kireth wants me to help her find the key to the Dwemer memory device inside the ruins of Mzulft. I should speak with her when I'm ready to set out.
The tunnels buried in ice are in the eastern portion of the ruins. I should lead Kireth to that area.
We've reached the ice tunnels in Mzulft. I should lead Kireth around and keep her safe while she looks for places to dig for the key.
Kireth found the key that operates the Dwemer memory device. She wants me to accompany her to the vault at the deepest part of the snow-filled ruin.
While Kireth examines the Dwemer memory device, I should read the journal lying nearby.
The research journal mentioned that one of the sacks in the vault contained an intact glass orb. I should search for it.
The memory device has enough power remaining to make one imprint. Besides, we only found one intact orb. Kireth and Raynor disagree on which bit of lore to copy. They want me to help them decide.
I found an intact Dwemer orb just as Raynor entered the vault. I should listen to what he and Kireth have to say about how to use the memory device.
The Dremora reinforcements have been defeated. I should report back to <<1>>.
I need to stop them.
The Mages Guild is barricaded by a magical barrier created by their former leader. I should defeat her in the inn and destroy the Totem sealing the hall.
I've defeated Bayya, the former leader of the local Mages Guild. I should destroy the Totem to unseal the Mages Guild.
When I awoke in the dream, Sirali appeared before me. I should speak to her.
The giant helped me get to the cliffs above the fortress. I should be able to get inside Cradlecrush from here.
I agreed to help Arvild investigate what happened. I'll talk to a few of the survivors and see if they can tell me who or what attacked Cragwallow.
No one seems to have a clear memory of what happened, but they all heard the bard playing before things got bad. The bard, however, is missing.
The bard's missing. Arvild asked me to find him. Maybe he can tell us what happened in Cragwallow. I'll see if I can locate any clues as to where he might be.
The path ends at a cave in the hillside. One of the royal workers hides nearby. I should ask him if he saw the attackers and the bard come this way.
I seem to have blacked out. I need to find out what happened.
Asmalah is dead. I wasn't able to recover Stormy-Eyes's satchel. I should return to the cave and see how Stormy-Eyes wants to proceed.
Stormy-Eyes has decided to go ahead with the healing ritual even though I wasn't able to gather everything he needed. I should wait and see what happens.
The ritual failed. The poor Argonian woman is dead and Stormy-Eyes is wounded, but at least Asmalah paid for what he did. I should speak to Stormy-Eyes to find out what to do next.
The ritual failed. The poor Argonian woman is dead and Stormy-Eyes is wounded, but at least Asmalah paid for what he did. I should speak to Stormy-Eyes to find out what to do next.

Vestrek mentioned that the rieklings holding the bard were strangely excited. He thinks their odd behavior might be related to the attack on Cragwallow. I need to enter the cave and see what I can learn.
I followed the bard's trail into the cave. Now I have to find Valding and figure out why the rieklings  attacked Cragwallow.

Valding inadvertently caused the riekling raid on Cragwallow. He's a liar and a thief, using an enchanted lute to put his audience to sleep and rob them. The sound attracted the rieklings. The lute must be destroyed.
The riekling chieftain should have the key to Valding's cage on him. I should obtain the key.
Valding the Bard turned out to be a common thief. But he promised to return to Cragwallow and explain what happened. The royal workers will decide his fate. At least the enchanted lute was destroyed.
I destroyed the enchanted lute. Now I need to decide what to do about Valding. I can leave him trapped here or free him so he can turn himself over to the royal workers.
I opened the cage and set Valding free. I should lead him to the cave exit.
I decided to leave Valding locked in the cage. His actions caused the deaths of many innocent people.
I left the bard to his fate with the rieklings. His actions led to the deaths of many innocent people. I should let Vestrek know what happened.
I decided to let Valding out of the cage. He agreed to return to Cragwallow to face the judgment of the royal workers.
I left the bard to his fate with the rieklings. His actions led to the deaths of many innocent people. I should let Vestrek know what happened.
I know Valding didn't intend for anyone to get hurt, but he has to take responsibility for what happened. I should talk to him to make sure he understands that.
Lokra, the daughter of Chief Tazgol, is causing trouble. Her family wants to marry her to forge an alliance with another clan. But she wants to see the world first.
I decided to spare Asmalah's life in exchange for information on how to find Stormy-Eyes's reagents. He said he threw them into a nearby ruined house. I should search the area.
To break through the Ironhand ogres' lines and take the tower up above, I have to dodge the boulders and charge the ogres on the ridge.
To signal Clan Murtag to move up and take the ridge, I need to climb the tower and blow Sergeant Olfin's warhorn.
Godrun sent a mining team to collapse the cavern, but they never reported back. If I can find them, I can help them follow through.

I've located one of the mining team members. According to him, I can use one of their pickaxes to destroy the remaining beams in the cavern. He might provide me one, or I go slightly down the hill to find <<1>>'s body and take his.
I need to enter the cavern which the Ironhand Ogres have used as a path into Shinji's Scarp.
I need to help Indaenir question the skulls about the Shade's true motives.
I should follow the Champion to the Two Moons Temple.
I need to talk to one known as the Dreamwalker. Thane Oda suggests I might be able to find him in the nearby village of Darkwater Crossing.
We've seen it through and restored the four lunar altars. I should speak to Rid-Thar again.
I need to speak to Rid-Thar once again, now that I've got the Claw.
I should kill one of each kind of Dremora attacking Bruma.
I killed four different types of Dremora and should return to <<1>>.
I've found the fangs called for in the bounty from this Panreth. I should seek this person out at the Fighters Guild drinking hall in Rawl'kha.
I should kill senche-tigers and collect their fangs.
I should gather both Seeds and Essence from the "Kollopi" Tree to frighten off the Wood Orcs and learn how to petition the Wood Elves' mysterious liege, the "Wilderking."

I planted Kollopi Seeds that will sprout guardians around the Wood Orcs' camp. Now I need to kill the Wood Orc chieftain to ensure the group is driven away to leave the Bramblebreach Wood Elves in peace.
I planted Kollopi Seeds to sprout guardians within the Wood Orcs' camp and I killed their chieftain to drive them away. I should return and speak to the Bramblebreach treethane.
I found orders from Pelidil in the Old Imperial Tunnels suggesting there is a larger force of Veiled Heritance somewhere near Woodhearth. I should bring the orders back to Treethane Fariel.
I should speak to Hermaeus Mora once again at his shrine within Ilmyris in Rootwater Grove.
Rid-Thar warned me a final guardian measure awaited me at the entrance to the reliquary. I'll have to get it to stand down before I can get to the Claw.
I should speak to the Bramblebreach treethane to find out why they're opposed to the Dominion.
I need to find the lockbox and put the supplies in it.
I placed the supplies. I should return and let <<1>> know.

I've been asked to inform King Emeric that, due to the Midnight Union's attack on Pariah Abbey and theft of the Dream Shard, the Spirit Wardens will no longer be able to supply him with protective dreamless potions.
I must activate the wardstones in Rootwater Grove to provide support for the ward ritual.
The Daedra broke out of the shrine before we could finish the ward.  I should return to Orthenir in the center of Rootwater Grove to reseal the Daedra.
Fongoth saw a priest in the middle of Rootwater Grove. I should talk to this priest to find out what's happening.
I need to defeat the Watcher attacking Orthenir in Rootwater Grove before we can finish the ward.
I've found other hunters out in the wilds hunting the same senche-tigers I am. Perhaps I could convince other hunters to give me the fangs they've already found.
Razum-dar has devised a plan to flush out the traitors who are working with Pelidil. I need to speak to Treethane Fariel to get more of the details.

To expose the traitors working with Pelidil, I am to escort Razum-dar disguised as Queen Ayrenn to the Old Imperial Underground, where we're expecting an assassination attempt. I should speak to Razum-dar when I'm ready to go.
The herbs and the scroll case should be somewhere downriver from Arenthia. I should search the riverbanks.
I have Zadala's medicinal herbs and I've recovered the scroll case. Zadala told me I could find her outside of Dune.
I should enter the Wyrd Tree and destroy the <<1>>.
Now that the <<1>> has been destroyed, I should exit the tree and return to <<2>>.
We need to find the Dark Mane. I should explore the temple grounds with the Champions.
I need to find some way to enter the inner chamber at Moonmont.
The Dark Mane has trapped the Champions and attacked me! I must defend myself.

Rid-Thar told me that someone must stay behind beneath Moonmont to hold the Dark Mane in place. I must choose one of the Champions to do this. The Champion that does not hold the Dark Mane will be the next leader of Khajiiti spiritual life.
I selected Shazah to hold the Dark Mane. Khali will be the next Mane. I should speak to her.
I told Eiraki about Skorvild's plan. She believes that her brother has gone insane and she asked me to stop him from performing the ritual.
I defeated Skorvild and stopped the ritual. I should use the ladder to exit the ritual chamber.
Eiraki Frostwind met me in the manor house. I should speak to her and tell her what happened.
Eiraki Frostwind has asked me to burn the remains of the giants as an offering of peace. Maybe that will appease the giants' rage.
With the remains burned, the giants have calmed down. I should return to Eiraki at the fishing village and tell her what happened.

I decided to join Skorvild and go along with his plan. I need to kill the leader of the giants to help bring the rest of the giants in line. I should be able to find him on the hill overlooking the village.

<<1>> mentioned the Dominion took a particular interest in a local named <<2>>. She was last seen near the eastern Ayleid ruins accompanied by two Dominion guards.\n\nI should head there and find her.
I should talk to Orthenir in Rootwater Grove now that the ward is re-established.
She asked me to kill him.
I killed the Shadowed Path Magister. Now to let <<1>> know.
I've entered the Grave. There may be a way to avoid the traps, at least going in.

Laryaril revealed that Pelidil has signed a treaty with the Maormer and plans to attack Seaside Sanctuary. He's also planning to raise Prince Naemon to lead an undead army. I should return to Woodhearth and tell Treethane Fariel what I learned.

To expose the traitors working with Pelidil, I am to escort Razum-dar disguised as Queen Ayrenn to the Old Imperial Underground, where we're expecting a Thalmor officer named Asteril to make an assassination attempt.

To expose the traitors working with Pelidil, I've escorted Razum-dar disguised as Queen Ayrenn to the Old Imperial Underground, where we're expecting a Thalmor officer named Asteril to make an assassination attempt.
I need to pursue the Thalmor officer, Asteril, through the Old Imperial Tunnels and find out what she knows about Pelidil's plans.
I found orders from Vicereeve Pelidil in the Old Imperial Tunnels. I should examine them to see what they might reveal about his plans.
The Stormfists' supply wagons are burning nicely. Now I should light the signal fire to alert Jorunn the Skald-King's troops.
<<1>> tracked the Rellis Lor keystone. It is one of numerous Ayleid chests that have been unearthed at the eastern Ayleid ruins. I should search the chests for the keystone.
I spared Fildgor's life. Nurnhilde has manifested near her body in Sovngarde. I should speak with her.
Fildgor is dead by my hand. Nurnhilde has manifested near her body in Sovngarde. I should speak with her.
I've spread the fire salts all along the river. Now I need to meet with <<1>> east of the Dominion's ship.
The Shadowscales are in place, ready to take back Murkwater. All that's left is to light fire salts, which will destroy the Dominion ship. The Shadowscales have decided that should be my honor.
I'll use the crystal she gave me to search, destroying any I find.
I found several Dremora portals with <<1>>'s crystal. I should let her know.
I've encountered a Wood Elf fishing along the banks of the river. I should ask her if she has seen the scroll case.
I must search for the Vault of Memories within Ilmyris in Rootwater Grove to find the shrine's caretaker.
I should talk to the caretaker Saromir within Ilmyris in Rootwater Grove to determine the source of the unbound Daedra.
I should talk to Hermaeus Mora at his shrine within Ilmyris in Rootwater Grove to learn how to rebind the Daedra.
I must defeat the souls that escaped Hermaeus Mora's shrine within Ilmyris in Rootwater Grove to return their essences to the Daedric binding ritual.
I should talk to Hermaeus Mora at his shrine within Ilmyris in Rootwater Grove to learn the location of the missing Bosmer soul.
After I defeated the giant's leader, Skorvild ran up and started doing something to its body. I should wait until he finishes.
I should speak to Hermaeus Mora once again at his shrine within Ilmyris in Rootwater Grove.
I must confront Saromir within Ilmyris in Rootwater Grove to harvest his soul for the Daedric binding ritual.
We made it inside. Now we need to find the Dark Mane.
The Great Moot of the Ebonheart Pact commences. I should witness the proceedings.
Egolor appears to have been murdered and the scroll coffer taken. I should examine the body.
Egolor has been murdered and the scroll coffer taken. I should ask people in the vicinity if they saw anything.
As expected, the Thalmor officer attempted to assassinate Razum-dar while he was disguised as the queen. Her attack knocked Razum-dar to the ground. I should speak to him to make sure he's all right.
I should wait until the ritual ends before making my way back to the camp to search for <<1>>.
<<1>> asked me to return to <<2>> at the Fighters Guild. She wants me to deliver the Ayleid tome and Prismatic Core to him. She's created another portal I can use to return to the hall.
I found orders from Pelidil in the Old Imperial Tunnels suggesting there is a larger force of Veiled Heritance somewhere near Woodhearth. I should bring the orders back to Razum-dar.
A ghost rose from the warlord's remains, though it does not appear to be Ayleid. I should follow it.

I found the Champion and was given an artifact that she says should close the portals, but first it must be charged with Daedric energy. I need to destroy the Daedra in the residential district to charge the Fang.
A Wood Elf fisherwoman named Estelin told me that her brother, Egolor, found the scroll coffer and took it back to their home in Thizzrini Arena. I should travel to Thizzrini Arena and find him.
Witness
Witness
I've found the Stonefire camp. The scroll case must be here somewhere. I should find it.
I've agreed to help Many-Eyes collect some debts. In exchange she is going to tell me where to find the person who took the scroll coffer.
I've reminded Many-Eyes' debtors that they need to pay up. I should return to Many-Eyes and find out what she knows.

I need to speak to the mysterious "Wilderking." The Bramblebreach treethane will tell me how to petition for an audience if I deal with the Wood Orcs. I must first gather seeds from the Shimmering Tree.
A young High Elf woman addressed me as I approached the Shimmering Tree. I should speak to her.
I should take the diary to the dead man's cousin, Idirfa. I think I can find her at Fort Amol.
I should return the urn to its rightful owner in Windhelm.
I should head to Jorunn's Stand and get my reward from <<1>>.
The vision of the past has ended and I am returned to the Spinner's Cottage. I should speak to Maruin.
The Ebonheart Pact is sealed. High-King Jorunn asked me to return to Jorunn's Stand and let Prince Irnskar know what happened here.
I was given a bucket by the survivors of the abbey, but it is empty. They told me to fill it in the well but warned me that the well is guarded.
The hidden tunnel deposited me in a secluded area within the dragonshrine. I see Thane Mera and more of the King's scouts ahead of me. I should talk to her.
Scout Snowhunter showed me a hidden tunnel that leads to Skuldafn. I should enter the tunnel and meet with the scout's leader, Thane Mera.
I found the lost vicecanons, though they're trapped behind enemy lines. I should speak to <<1>>. She may remember me from Stormhold.
When Dominion soldiers ambushed the regiment, <<1>> lost contact with the other two vicecanons. He asked me to find them behind enemy lines so he could coordinate their rescue.
<<1>> says he can track <<2>> by his scent. I should join him to ensure the Dominion soldiers don't get another chance to kill him.
I found one survivor from <<1>>'s regiment, though he seems mortally wounded. I should learn what he knows about any others from the regiment.
<<1>> seems to be in shock upon seeing the body of his commander. I should speak with him about <<2>>'s mysterious death.
I found <<1>>'s body. I should see what killed him.
Before <<1>>'s soldier died, he told me Dominion troops dragged another soldier away to a nearby altar.\n\nIf I hurry I may be able to save him from the fate of his soldiers-in-arms.

The soldier seemed to be one of <<1>>'s recruits. He died shortly before I found him.\n\nI found a strange vial of liquid. When I touched it I briefly transformed into another person. I should continue searching for the regiment.
I rescued <<1>> from the fate that befell his companions. He fled for the cave containing the vicecanons.\n\nI should follow him and see if he knows of <<2>>'s whereabouts.
I found no sign of <<1>>'s regiment, only a dead soldier near one of the Daedric ruins. I should search the body and see if he was one of <<1>>'s men.
<<1>> suspects the Dominion is preparing another trap, and asked me to stop <<2>> from attempting a rescue. She believes I'll find the regiment nearby.
<<1>> confirmed <<2>> died hours ago. That means a skin-stealer is leading the regiment!
I should find the Champions near the main entrance to Moonmont.
The mad mage of Glister Vale is dead. I should return to <<1>> with the final teleportation scroll and let her know the good knows.
The teleportation scroll I was given can get me out of the Vale right away. I should use it to return.
Thulvald's clerk, Eginir, volunteered to scout around, but he never returned. Thulvald thinks he went to check on the logging cabin. I should try to find him.
I entered the logging cabin and spotted Eginir. I should speak to him and see if he learned anything about what happened here.

Jafelma is convinced that the trolls and spriggans infesting the logging camp were sent by a powerful spriggan matron. If I kill the elder spriggan, the other creatures should wander away and leave the camp in peace.
With the spriggan matron dead, the trolls and spriggans infesting Thulvald's camp should eventually wander away. I should let Thulvald know what happened.
Eginir thinks that the logging chief, Jafelma, is holed up in the other cabin. I should go take a look and see if she's there.
I found Jafelma within the logging chief's lodge. She looks injured, but not too badly. I should speak to her.
I should talk to Laganahk.
Sheogorath has written a speech for Ayrenn, the leader of the Aldmeri Dominion. I should hear what she has to say.
I defeated Blackheart in battle, but with his skull still intact, he is not defeated. I should speak with Shifty Tom.
<<1>> asked me to speak to <<2>> about the Dominion presence in Bogmother. I should find him at his camp beside the main road.
I overheard Commander Yjarnn and Lord Vurlop talking. It was a strange conversation. I should ask Lord Vurlop about what they were discussing.
I discovered the Dominion's theft of a Hist artifact known as the <<1>>. I should speak with <<2>> about the Dominion's intentions with this Hist artifact.
<<1>> believes the Dominion's forces are underground. He asked me to look for an entrance while he brings the remaining vicecanons up to speed.
I must speak with Shifty Tom about obtaining a disguise.
I found the Dominion's secret outpost in the Daedric ruins. I need to stay alertâ€”there's no telling what's in these halls.
I found a captive Dremora in the Dominion's underground lair. She wants me to speak with her. Perhaps she knows the skin-stealer's plans.
If I'm going to put an end to the skin-stealers' plans, I'll need to speak with <<1>>.

<<1>>, an imprisoned Dremora, wants me to break her bonds. In return, she says she will help me defeat the skin-stealers.\n\nI should make my way through the ruins and get to the inner altar. Once I'm there, I can break <<1>>'s bonds.
<<1>>, an imprisoned Dremora, wants me to break her bonds. In return, she says she will help me defeat the skin-stealers.
I chose not to release <<1>>. I'm helping an Argonian named <<2>> instead.\n\nHe said he'd give me information on the Dominion's plans if I freed his friends' souls from enslavement.
I removed the seal on the vault doors. <<1>>'s imposter is inside. It's time to face him and uncover the Dominion's true plans.
I defeated the skin-stealer responsible for <<1>>'s death. I should speak to <<2>> before I leave.
I defeated the skin-stealer responsible for <<1>>'s death. I should speak to <<2>> before I leave.
I discovered the Dominion's theft of an artifact known as the <<1>>. I should speak with <<2>> about the Dominion's intentions with this Hist artifact.
I must reach the inner caves of Blackheart Haven.
I can find a disguise in one of the many clothing baskets lying around the outer Haven.
Sea Hounds will be able to smell the difference between me and the real pirates.
The Hist showed me important events from Hissmir's past, including an ancient method to defend it from invaders. Perhaps <<1>> can interpret this.
I should search around Bruma for them.
I found the missing warriors. They're alive but refuse to return to the manor. I should let <<1>> know.
The necromancers' ritual has been disrupted. Dockmaster Bahir suggested I seek out Watch Captain Zafira now.
I discovered the location of the ritual. I just need to disrupt it to break the spell and the dead will return to the sea.
Dockmaster Bahir says the necromancers are conducting some kind of ritual to call the dead from the sea. If I can find the ritual and disrupt it, the dead will disperse.
It appears Watchman Maujad was killed. I should search the warehouse for the dockmaster.
I should explore the docks to see if I can find any guards.
A watchman ran by me, pursued by an undead sailor. I should speak to the watchman about what is going on.
Guard Hloenor asked me to report my findings to Lord Vurlop, who I'll find at the inn.

Lord Vurlop doesn't want word of this to reach Prince Irnskar. He's afraid that tempers will fly and cause a rift among the alliance. He suggested that I talk to Thane Harvald at the Nord camp and get his advice on this matter.
Ildani said her goods are being held in the customs house on the hill above the docks.
<<1>> fled from the prison ahead of me. I should meet him outside the prison walls.
I see Master Kasan ahead. Perhaps he can tell me where the rest of the crew is.
I'm inside the Veiled Keep. Now to discover the identity of the leader behind the Veil.
Estre is the Veiled Queen! I need to fight my way through the first room and head deeper into the keep.
I defeated the Veiled Heritance soldiers guarding the first room. I should continue deeper into the Veiled Keep.
The ceiling is collapsing around me! I need to deactivate the lock crystals and unlock the second door.
I opened the door into the third room of the Veiled Keep. I need to keep moving.
The treethane says that all I need to do to petition for an audience with the Wilderking is to touch the Petitioning Stone. She's skeptical that he will come, but she says this is the only way.
I touched the Petitioning Stone and the Wilderking appeared. I should speak to him.

The Wilderking doesn't believe we have common enemies. He has asked me to touch the Stone Pillar on the platform above to summon and fight an enemy apparition so that he might see the nature of the Dominion's enemies.
I summoned and defeated an apparition of the late Veiled Heritance member, Advisor Norion. I must speak to the Wilderking to find out if he now recognizes our common enemies.
The Wilderking does not wish to align himself against the Veiled Heritance because one of the group's members is a person of interest to him. To learn this person's identity, I must watch the vision.
The vision revealed that the Veiled Heritance sent Aranias and Andur here to kill the Wilderking, yet he still doesn't consider them enemies. I must speak to him about this.
I collected the requested ingredients. I should speak to Benduin now to see what's next.
Benduin gave me a husk and I can now choose which type of guardian I want to create.
Now that I've created my own guardian, Benduin asked me to lead it over to challenge two of the other guardians.
My guardian defeated two of the other guardians. I should talk to Benduin.
High Kinlord Rilis has been defeated. I should check Keeper Cirion for signs of life.
<<1>> didn't heed his partner's warning. He unsealed the xanmeer and went in. I hope <<2>> can tell me more about what's hidden in these ruins.
<<1>> put together the three puzzle stones to form a Hist key. We can use it to get inside the xanmeer. <<2>> is waiting for help beside a locked entrance to the stone pyramid.

Keeper Cirion has sent me to undo the binding stones that prevent High Kinlord Rilis from materializing in this plane. However, Rilis has corrupted the other Keepers, who will no doubt stand in my way. The first stone is somewhere up ahead.

Keeper Cirion has sent me to undo the binding stones to bring High Kinlord Rilis into this plane of existence where he can be killed. However, Rilis has corrupted the other Keepers, who will no doubt stand in my way. The second stone is up ahead.

Keeper Cirion has sent me to undo the binding stones that prevent High Kinlord Rilis from materializing in this plane. However, Rilis has corrupted the other Keepers, who will no doubt stand in my way. The third stone is up ahead.
Keeper Cirion has sent me to undo the binding stones that prevent High Kinlord Rilis from materializing in this plane. I've undone three of the four stones, and should speak to Keeper Cirion.
Cirion has inserted himself as Rilis' host, binding Rilis to his mortal body. If Rilis is defeated, the High Kinlord will at last truly die.
I freed the subjects of Zuuk, though they weren't living, they were spirits. I should report this information to Drillk.
Drillk spoke of a prophecy revealing the keystone at the castle tower. I need to escort Drillk to his tower where I expect to find the keystone.
I have to decide who should take the Fangs, <<1>> or <<2>>. I'll hear what each of them has to say.
There was a flash of light and now everyone's cowering before the giant, shadowy form of a serpent. It isn't attacking, so I should try to talk to it.
These Shadowscales appeared out of nowhere. I should talk to their leader, <<1>> and find out what they want.
Many-Eyes has told me where to find the Colovian who murdered Egolor and stole the scroll coffer. I should track her down and take the scroll coffer from her.
I heard a voice call out to me from one of the corridors in <<1>>. I should investigate its source.
Raynor asked me to find his sister, Kireth, within the ruins of Mzulft. I should enter the ancient complex and look for her.
I gave <<1>> the Fangs of Sithis. I should talk to her again before she leaves.
I couldn't find the keystone, but an Ayleid ghost appeared near the base where it once sat. I should speak to the ghost to see if she knows the whereabouts of the keystone.
I agreed to help Teegya recover the ruby and guar. Perhaps she has a tip about how to capture the lost guar.
I prayed to the totems of the Three Old Gods and was shown visions of Stormy-Eyes by each. I think the visions are warnings. I should return to High Priest Esling and tell him what I saw.
Lerisa is somewhere in Saintsport.
Jakarn is in the Grave, Headman Bhosek's dungeon.
Neramo is investigating the ruins of Bthzark, west of town.
Rid-Thar has appeared once again, apparently trapping the Dark Mane in place. I should speak to him.
Drillk declared me the captain of his royal army. Now that he has addressed his "subjects," I should speak to Drillk about the keystone.
I survived the ambush to find <<1>> waiting for me. She wants to speak to me again.

After talking to the game dealers, it appears that <<1>> lost all of his gold and tried to borrow more. When he became belligerent, his outburst was reported to <<2>>, the games manager. I should talk to <<2>> again.
I need to talk to <<1>>.
I've decided to humor Halindor by looking in on his friend Gonlas.
I've explained what was happening in her village to Bowenas. I need to talk to her once more.
I could talk to Sees-All-Colors to get a few more details about our mission.
Now that I've entered the inner caves of Blackheart Haven, I should find Shifty Tom.
I must defeat the soul of the Bosmer that Hermaeus Mora killed in lieu of Saromir within Ilmyris in Rootwater Grove to complete the Daedric binding ritual.
<<1>> said he'll take me to see <<2>>. I should follow him.
Fildgor cannot be allowed to live. I am taking it upon myself to end his life.\n\nAll that remains is the killing blow.
Jofnir has appeared in the hall. I should talk to him.
I've come upon Halindor's friend Gonlas, pinned down by some kind of magic. He's asked me to destroy the crystal at the center of the ritual. That might free him.
I need to find Halindor and tell him what I found in Gonlas' house.
Halindor is very concerned about what I found in Gonlas' house. He's asked me to check in on the other people of Greenhill while he looks in on his wife.
I've recovered the Sigil. There's no one left: I should bring it to Imwyn's daughter Aerana in Windhelm.
I should find Atarus within the caves of Blackheart Haven and defeat him for his skull-shaped relic.
Now that I have Atarus's skull, I should give it to Shifty Tom.
I entered the Dominion's vault, a laboratory filled with noxious fumes and the stink of death. I need to destroy the stolen Hist sap, the key to their skin-stealing magic.
I destroyed the vats of Hist sap in the Dominion's vault. The chaos attracted the attention of <<1>>'s imposter. Now is my chance to stop him and end the skin-stealer threat in <<2>>.
I should find <<1>> near the inner altar. He said the leader of the skin-stealers spends most of his time there.
I should wait for Shifty Tom to destroy Atarus's skull before moving on.
I must track down and defeat Saromir within Ilmyris in Rootwater Grove to harvest his soul for the Daedric binding ritual.

Keeper Cirion intends to trap the spirit of Rilis with his body, binding the High Kinlord to the mortal plane. Once done, Rilis can be killed once and for all. I need only to use the last binding stone.
Undead pirates have appeared now that Shifty Tom has destroyed Atarus's skull. I should defeat them.
I defeated the undead pirates that appeared after Shifty Tom destroyed Atarus's Skull. I should speak with Tom now.
I must best Captain Blackheart in combat and take his skull, the source of his undead power.
I found <<1>> in one of the trash piles. I should return it to her. She's near the large xanmeer in the midst of Xal Ithix.
I was told that Indaenir may have a plan for returning the Blackroot clan warriors to their rest. I should speak with Indaenir.

Indaenir believes that other spirits here in Dread Vullain are trying to tell us something through glimmers of the past that he's seen in the area. I should watch these glimmers of the past to find out what can be learned.

It seems the Vullain Villagers poisoned themselves to kill General Malgoth and the Blackroot clan. The general's spirit is compelled to fight now because something has stolen his bow and invoked the Right of Theft. I need to find the Nereid Temple.

Indaenir says the key to returning the Blackroot clan to rest is to find General Malgoth's bow so we can release him from his vows. I need to search for the general's remains inside the Nereid Temple cave.

Indaenir says the key to returning the Blackroot clan to rest is to find General Malgoth's bow so we can release him from his vows. I need to search for the general's remains inside the Nereid Temple cave.

I found General Malgoth's remains, but I was then plunged into the Shadow Wood where the voice of one of Naemon's Servants is taunting me. I must find and confront this Servant to reclaim General Malgoth's bow.
I slew the Servant of Naemon and reclaimed General Malgoth's bow. I should speak to Indaenir about what to do next.

Indaenir says I must return the bow to General Malgoth and invoke the Right of Theft to release him from his vow. I can choose whether to release Malgoth and his warriors and let them rest in peace, or I can command them to fight for our side.
After speaking to General Malgoth, I should now talk to Indaenir and find out what to do next.
After speaking to General Malgoth, I should now talk to Indaenir and find out what to do next.
I should tell Halindor about what I found inside his friends' homes.
The first step in setting King Laloriaran Dynar free requires that I enter the Lightless Oubliette.
I should talk to the projected image of King Laloriaran Dynar and find out if he knows what I need to do to break him out of this prison.
Now that I'm inside the tower, I need to find the crystals of darkness so that I can move them to the prison door.
I placed the three crystals of darkness and unlocked the door to King Laloriaran Dynar's prison. I should enter the oubliette and see what I need to do next.
I need to use the Light of Meridia to ignite the sconces so that I can direct the radiance to destroy the crystal emitters. This should release the Ayleid King from the darkness that binds him.
I released King Laloriaran Dynar from the dark energy that bound him. I should talk to him and make sure he's all right.
The Ayleid King opened a portal to the Hollow City. I should follow him and travel there.
I'm back in the Hollow City. I should locate King Laloriaran Dynar and make sure he arrived safely.
Ezreba was there when Halindor's wife Bowenas was taken. Halindor doesn't know where Bowenas was taken, but Ezreba's home is a good place to start looking.

Azum told me that she's not supposed to talk about guests at the caravan, but the games-runners might not be so tight-lipped. Dulan, Khaba, and Bunul were the games-runners she called out as being my best bets. I should seek one of them out.
The game dealer at the Lizard Races told me that he saw <<1>>, and that he got into a drunken brawl. I should ask some of the other dealers if they saw anything.
The game dealer at the troll fighting arena said that <<1>> lost all his gold and tried to borrow more. When he became belligerent, she reported his outburst to <<2>>. I should talk to <<3>> again.
The spikeball game dealer told me that he saw <<1>>'s men chasing <<2>>. I should talk to another dealer.
I should to bet on the lizard races. The dealer there might know more about <<1>>'s whereabouts.
I should to bet on the troll fights. The dealer there might know more about <<1>>'s whereabouts.
I should compete in Spikeball. The dealer there might know more about <<1>>'s whereabouts.

After talking to the game dealers, it appears that <<1>> lost all of his gold and tried to borrow more. When he became belligerent, his outburst was reported to <<2>>, the games manager. I should talk to <<2>> again.

After talking to the game dealers, it appears that <<1>> lost all of his gold and tried to borrow more. When he became belligerent, his outburst was reported to <<2>>, the games manager. I should talk to <<2>> again.
Bowenas has been trapped in one of these strange rituals inside Ezreba's home. I need to destroy the crystal to free her.
Bowenas is free of the ritual. I should talk to her and see if I can get to the bottom of this.
Near where I saw the second vision, there's an old journal lying on the ground. It might contain more details about what happened here.
I should meet <<1>>'s regiment on the outskirts of the Daedric ruin.
The Aspect of Namira is here, along with some Dremora in strange-looking magical bubbles. I should confront her.
I'm to meet <<1>> at <<2>>. She believes an Argonian keeper will know more about <<A:3>>.
I've found a trapdoor at the back of the temple ruins. Perhaps this is where Ezreba went?
I've found Halindor looking fairly stunned on the ground in the Catacombs. I should speak to him.
I've stumbled on a dark ritual being enacted. It seems as though this is where the dark energy beings originate. I should stop the ritual.
I have the Overseer's key. I should use it to head up to the next level of the Tower of Lies.
While Skordo musters his soldiers, I've made my way to the upper level of the prison to find Captain Eilram.
Captain Eilram won't work with me until I convince him that I'm not a spy or an illusion. He wants me to recover the sword that he dropped while fighting the ogrims.

Eilram and Arakh both seem to be suffering from the terrible effects of this place. I recovered Eilram's sword, so maybe he'll trust me now. I should meet him near Arakh's camp and see if I can help him talk some sense into the other captain.
I should find Captain Eilram and give him his sword.
Captain Arakh is more paranoid than Captain Eilram. She says the voices are making her crazy. She won't even talk to Eilram until someone recovers her helmet from the watchers. I guess I'm elected.
I recovered Captain Arakh's helmet from the watchers. I should return it to her and see if it calms her down enough so that Eilram can talk to her.
The helmet seems to have calmed Captain Arakh. Now Captain Eilram wants to talk to her. I should listen to what they have to say.
The Dremora Lyranth appeared. She claims that we have a common enemy in Ifriz. I should talk to her and see what she has to say.

A Dremora named Ifriz seems to be in charge of this prison. According to Lyranth, the only way to remove the barrier blocking the exit is to kill Ifriz. Of course, she wants him dead, too. She banished the illusions that had been hiding him.
There's another journal lying on the ground near Endarre's bones. Perhaps it will contain clues as to how to continue through the dungeon.
Ezreba is somewhere here in the catacombs. I need to find and talk to her.
I should return to and speak to Unishi.
I should talk to the Groundskeeper to learn more about the Hollow City.
I should speak to the Groundskeeper and see if she has a suggestion on how I should proceed.
<<1>> arrived with reinforcement. They should be able to clear out the remaining Dominion forces. Perhaps she knows where the Dominion took <<A:2>>.
I should help <<1>> buy time until <<2>> returns with reinforcements to drive out the Dominion.
<<1>> asked me to light braziers at the top of two Xanmeers, as well as find <<2>>. I should listen for what the Dominion might be plotting.
I lit the braziers and found <<1>>. I should return to <<2>> and share what I've learned of the Dominion's plans.
<<1>> began the hatching ritual. I should stay alert for Dominion activity until he finishes.
The hatching ritual went horribly wrong. <<1>>'s assistant Ahaht-Ei died during the ritual, and he looks to be in severe pain. I should find out what happened.
<<1>> sacrificed himself to Sithis, buying us time to save the remaining eggs from the Dominion. I should move before the Dominion has a chance to destroy them all.
The keepers' assistants gave their lives to protect the eggs. With their help, I was able to save several. I should return them to <<1>>.
I arrived at the Harborage and should speak with the Prophet.
The Prophet has summoned me to the Harborage. I should go there at once.
The Prophet has opened the way to Coldharbour and the Castle of the Worm. It is time to set out.
Lyris wants to have a word with me.
We need to find a way into the Castle of the Worm. Lyris suggested we find someone who can help.
I can talk to slaves in the town to get information on how to enter the castle safely.
I should make my way up into the keep.
It appears that Abnur Tharn is in the castle somewhere. I should keep an eye out for him as I search for my soul.
Abnur Tharn's projection is here. I should speak to him.
I need to get to Abnur Tharn before the Worm Cult catches on.
Abnur Tharn is nearby. I should speak with him.
Mannimarco has arrived to stop Abnur Tharn from giving me more information. I must defeat the necromancer.
Abnur Tharn clawed his way out of the pit of darkness and his magic allowed me to strike down Mannimarco's projected form. I should speak to Abnur again.
We must escape the castle before Mannimarco can reform and set his entire castle guard upon us.
We fell into a pit beneath the castle. The Prophet should be waiting for us.
We reached the Prophet's portal. I should return to the Harborage.
I learned that the Prophet is actually Varen Aquilarios. He and I need to have words.
I need to finish talking to Varen Aquilarios in the Harborage.
I completed the Trial of Body. Now I should speak to <<1>> and start the Trial of Spirit.
I completed the Trial of Spirit. I should return to <<1>> and let her know about my success.
The Trial of Body requires that I enter the north pyramid and find the Dremora who collect and process the sap that comes from the Hist tree.
To find Pelidil's location, I must confront Asteril, the Thalmor officer who was spying on Pelidil's behalf. I need to speak to Oromin about accompanying me to the Thalmor Residence.
To find Pelidil's location, I must confront Asteril, the Thalmor officer who was spying on Pelidil's behalf. I should search for Asteril at the Thalmor Residence.
It appears as if Pelidil's spy within the Thalmor has been killed. I should examine the body for clues.
Inexplicably, it appears as if Pelidil's spy, Asteril, has been dead for some time. I should speak with Oromin.
Razum-dar found a hidden passage in the Thalmor Residence leading to the Old Imperial Underground. I should investigate.
Beneath the Thalmor Residence, I found a small room that's connected to the Old Imperial Underground. I should look for clues to explain what's going on.

A letter from Pelidil suggests Asteril's sister, Laryaril, was the one who attempted to assassinate Razum-dar when he was disguised as the queen. Laryaril is to meet Pelidil in the Old Imperial Prison. I should go there to confront them.

A letter from Pelidil suggests Asteril's sister, Laryaril, was the one who attempted to assassinate Razum-dar when he was disguised as the queen. Laryaril is to meet Pelidil in the Old Imperial Prison. I need to find them and confront them.

Laryaril revealed that Pelidil has signed a treaty with the Maormer and plans to attack Seaside Sanctuary. He's also planning to raise Prince Naemon to lead an undead army. I should return to Woodhearth and tell Treethane Fariel what I learned.
I should follow Ezreba and question her.
I need to follow the Groundskeeper around the Hollow City and listen to the story she wants to tell me.
I need to follow the Groundskeeper around the Hollow City and listen to the story she wants to tell me.
I need to follow the Groundskeeper around the Hollow City and listen to the story she wants to tell me.
I need to follow the Groundskeeper around the Hollow City and listen to the story she wants to tell me.
I need to follow the Groundskeeper around the Hollow City and listen to the story she wants to tell me.
Sees-All-Colors said the appearance of the Ayleid spirits may be of some importance. I should witness what happens.
Valasha's journal is still intact. Sees-All-Colors believes it may have information we need on our mission.
I defeated the Servant of Naemon and escaped from the Shadow Wood. I should speak to Indaenir.
The Groundskeeper seems to be finished giving me a tour of the Hollow City. I should speak to her.
Ifriz the Unraveler is dead and the barrier blocking the way out should be down now. I should meet the Fighters Guild captains at the bridge and make sure we can get out of here now.
I need to follow the Groundskeeper around the Hollow City and listen to the story she wants to tell me.

King Laloriaran Dynar is imprisoned to the west, beyond the Moonless Walk. Vanus Galerion is trapped somewhere to the east. I should also watch for any of the other missing Fighters Guild and Mages Guild members, or anyone else who can help me.

We destroyed the Great Shackle, but the Planemeld continues. The council of war has decided to assault the Chasm and fight our way to the remaining planar vortex. Only then can we seal the connection and save Nirn from the Planemeld.
I ended the enchantment that was luring people into the mist. I should tell Breduin of my success.
I should talk to Elsenia and see her off safely.
<<1>>, one of <<2>>'s soldiers, arrived in the Dominion camp with news. I should speak to him and find out what it is.
I informed <<1>> of <<2>>'s plans for <<A:3>>. She asked me to search the camp thoroughly while she prepares her troops to assault the ruins.
<<1>> asked me to enter the ruins of <<2>> and find signs of <<3>> so Stormhold's soldiers can stop him.
I freed <<1>>, a Dominion soldier captured by lamias. She fled deeper into the ruins. I should follow and question her about <<2>>. She can't have gone far, and didn't seem up to a fight.
I found a Dominion soldier captured by lamias. She seems willing to talk if I rescue her.
The lamias routed the Dominion in the ruins of <<1>>. I should watch carefully for any opportunity to find <<2>>.
<<1>> hopes to find <<2>> before he escapes Shadowfen. I should search around for anything that can lead to him.
I activated one of <<1>>'s crystals. I should speak to <<2>> and learn how to get to the others.
<<1>>'s aide informed me she went ahead to scout the aftermath of a battle between Dominion soldiers and lamias. I should find her and tell her of <<2>>'s plans for <<A:3>>.
I should talk to <<1>>. I must find a way to unseal the door protecting <<2>>.
<<1>> told me that the seal on the door can be broken by reactivating the crystals within <<2>>. The first one sits in the central room of the ruins.
I know where <<1>> has <<A:2>>. To stop him, I must unseal the door to <<3>>'s Inner Bailey.
To unseal the door protecting <<1>>, I must activate two other crystals. One is through the east wing of the ruins; the other is through the west.
I activated all three crystals in <<1>>, unsealing the door that protects <<2>>. I should head there immediately.
<<1>> met me at the door leading to <<2>>. Before I proceed, I must decide what to do with <<3>>.
I'm ready to proceed to the Inner Bailey and stop <<1>>. Before I go, <<2>> wishes to speak.
The Hist concentrated within <<Ac:1>> could not survive the tortures of <<2>>. The Egg is little more than a shell.\n\nI awoke in a strange room. I should ask <<3>> where we are.
The Hist concentrated within <<Ac:1>> survived the tortures of <<2>>. It suggested that in time it could be whole once more.\n\nI awoke in a strange room. I should ask <<3>> where we are.
After the Hist-brothers left the dream, the Hist sent <<1>> away. It spoke with me and asked me to approach it.
The vicecanon is under some kind of spell, most likely of <<1>>'s doing. I should see if there's anything I can do to break her out of it.
<<1>> fell into some sort of trance when she inspected <<A:2>>. I should speak with <<3>> and see what can be done.
After touching <<A:1>>, I find myself inside a strange place with <<2>>. Maybe she has more insight on what this place is.
I should speak with <<1>> about how to best handle <<A:2>>.
Now that I've unsealed the door protecting <<1>>, I can put an end to his heinous acts.
I defeated <<1>> and put an end to his terror. Now I must safely recover <<A:2>>.
<<1>> believes the Dominion used <<A:2>> to sever the link between <<A:3>> and the Hist. We need to escape before the Dominion finds us and destroys the last of the eggs.
I have entered the Hist's dream with <<1>>. I need to find a way to get rid of the destructive forces within it.
I'm ready to proceed to the Inner Bailey and stop <<1>>. Before I go, <<2>> wishes to speak.
The residents of Longhaven report that people have been disappearing into the fog over the moors. I've been told to talk to Breduin for more information.
Breduin told me that a Dunmer went into the mist recently, and it seemed like he knew something about the strange events on the moors. I should find him.
I finished the Trial of Spirit. Now I should speak to <<1>> and start the Trial of Body.
Mel Adrys is a vampire hunter, who tracked his latest prey to the moors. He suspects an entire lair of vampires is responsible for the strange mist. I should meet him at the lair.
According to the two captains, the nearby crystal is a Light of Meridia. I should take it with me when I leave.
I met Mel Adrys at the vampire lair. I should speak to him.
Mel Adrys has already defeated Gadinas, one of the vampires. Gadinas might know something about the strange mist. I should question him.

Gadinas has told me that a strange veiled person gave the vampires a skull that is creating the enchanted mist that is luring people into the moors and turning them into thralls. I must now decide Gadinas's fate.
I should defeat the three leaders of the vampires before destroying the ritual skull that is creating the mist.
I have defeated the vampire leaders. I should destroy the skull that is creating this mist.
By destroying the ritual skull, I have ended the spell that was turning the people of Longhaven into thralls. I should return to Longhaven.
Valaste has prepared a ritual space to allow Shalidor to do his work. She's asked me to start the ritual by placing the books in the beams of light.
Examining the instructions closely may prove illuminating.

Instructions for the device include a list of ingredients for a poultice to be used on a Hist tree.\n\nCreating one may reveal its purpose. Giant Wasps live nearby and the Dominion is sure to be in possession of the Hist sap I need.
Testing the poultice on a living plant might reveal its purpose without endangering the Hist.
The plant died when I applied the Dominion's poultice. It would likely do the same to a living Hist tree. I should inform a Keeper of the Shell in <<1>>.
<<1>> seemed quite interested in the poultice. I should speak to her further.

It seems the Vullain Villagers poisoned themselves to kill General Malgoth and the Blackroot clan. The general's spirit is compelled to fight now because something has stolen his bow and invoked the Right of Theft. I should speak to Indaenir.
I must assist Orthenir at the altar in Rootwater Grove to finish the ward spell.
I need to find Lady Laurent somewhere within the lower ruins.
Merric ran off after some Daedra that fled the ambush site. I should find him.
I need to wait for Haskill to unlock the door before I can explore Cheesemonger's Hollow any further.
Sheogorath's asked me head into the "Guesthouse" of his Chateau so that I can evict one of this wayward guests. I should enter the Guesthouse.
I've lit the braziers, and need to make my way out of the maze.
The "manse" Sheogorath spoke of is one of the few places I haven't explored yet. Sheogorath wants me to meet his family within, and play with his heirlooms.
Shalidor appeared in a nimbus of light. I should speak to him.
This is it, Shalidor is set to rest Eyevea back to Tamriel. I should watch what he does.

Treeminder Xohaneel has challenged my decision to allow the Hist tree to live. To prove that my choice is the correct choice, I need to defeat the scholars' champion. I should go to the challenge grounds to face the champion.
I must defeat the scholars' champion before they accept my decision.

<<1>> was wounded in the shipwreck. She asked me to help find members of her squad. She believes they may be wounded and encouraged me to keep an eye out for <<2>>, which can be used to treat injuries.
I located <<1>>'s squad-mates. One of them saw <<2>>, who went searching for a cave to provide shelter. I should find the cave and inform him the squad is safe.
I found <<1>> dead within the cave. His body bore signs of a ritual killing by unknown assailants. I should find <<2>> and inform her.
While <<1>> and her squad deal with <<2>>'s body, I should warn some nearby Dominion sailors to keep alert. They're by the only intact ship on the beach.
<<1>> says he'll help <<2>> and her squad once the privateer ship Prowler is fixed. I should see if her squad can help with the repairs.
One ship survived the shipwreck. I spotted someone nearby who looks like he's in charge. I should warn him of <<1>>'s ritual killing.
<<1>> says he'll help <<2>> and her squad once the privateer ship Prowler is fixed. They aren't in the best shape, so I should help move things along.
The Prowler is seaworthy again. I should speak with <<1>> about reinforcements for <<2>>.
The Prowler is seaworthy again. I should speak with <<1>> about reinforcements for <<2>>.
<<1>> said the captured Prowler sailors were being used as sacrifices in some form of Sea Viper weather ritual on <<2>>. I will need a <<z:3>> to free them and stop the ritual.
I captured a <<z:1>> from the Sea Vipers and reached <<2>>. The beached Dominion ship nearby seems to be the source of the Sea Viper ritual.
I stopped the Sea Vipers' weather ritual. I should return to the Prowler and inform <<1>>.
<<1>> said the captured Prowler sailors were being used as sacrifices in some form of Sea Viper weather ritual on <<2>>. I will need a <<z:3>> to free them and stop the ritual.
I captured a <<z:1>> from the Sea Vipers and reached <<2>>. The beached Dominion ship nearby seems to be the source of the Sea Viper ritual.
I stopped the Sea Vipers' weather ritual. I should return to the Prowler and inform <<1>>.
I should return to Hermaeus Mora at his shrine within Ilmyris in Rootwater Grove to finish the Daedric binding ritual.
I should activate the Ayleid crystal containing Saromir's memories within Ilmyris in Rootwater Grove.
I should return to Hermaeus Mora at his shrine within Ilmyris in Rootwater Grove now that I have seen Naemon and Pelidil in Saromir's memories.
I found a cave near <<1>>'s wounded squad-mates. I should see if I can find <<2>> within.
Perhaps before I go I should ask Valaste some more questions about what she's found.
I need to gather dew bugs, thunderbug bellies, and hive seeds. Then I can bring them back to Benduin and see what he's talking about.
I let <<Ac:1>> kill <<2>>.\n\nI should let <<3>> know the ambassador won't trouble her town any longer.
<<1>> gave me a token to hand to <<c:2>>, a diplomatic envoy for the Dominion. This will let <<c:2>> know I can be trusted to assist him in this delicate matter.
The assassin confessed that <<1>> ordered the deaths of <<c:2>> and <<Ac:3>> so they wouldn't be able to stop "the tempest." With such overwhelming evidence, I should confront the ambassador.
I ended the ritual and subdued the assassin. I should ask her what she knows of <<c:1>>'s death.
I followed <<Ac:1>> to an abandoned house and found a Maormer performing a strange ritual! I need to stop the ritual before it kills <<Ac:1>>.
<<A:1>> used the poison to detect the assassin's trail. She ran off faster than I could follow. I should pursue the trail and see if it leads to <<c:2>>'s killer.
Someone murdered <<c:1>>! I should ask <<Ac:2>> if she saw anything.
<<1>> has been unable to review a copy of the treaty. Perhaps speaking with Ambassador <<2>> and Headwoman <<3>> will change their minds.
<<1>> believes <<c:2>> was poisoned with Daedra blood. He asked me to bring a sample to <<Ac:3>>.
I found <<1>> and <<Ac:2>> in the Maormer embassy. I need to decide whether to deliver <<1>> to face <<3>>'s justice or <<Ac:2>>'s vengeance.
Notes taken by the <<1>> guard mentioned some strange occurrences around town. Perhaps investigating could lead me to <<c:2>>'s killer.
<<1>> fled when I revealed the evidence against his people. <<A:2>> gave chase, seeking to avenge <<c:3>>'s death. I should follow and deal with the Maormer threat as I see fit.
I explored all the leads in the <<1>> guard report. I should bring what I found to <<2>> and see what he makes of it.
<<1>> fled when I revealed the evidence against his people. I should speak to <<2>> and see what should be done in the face of this treachery.
Neither <<1>> nor <<2>> would produce a copy of the treaty. <<3>> suggested I speak with <<4>> to see if there's another way to gain access to a copy.
I've located the missing copy of the treaty. I should leave the embassy before anyone grows suspicious of my presence.
I now possess a copy of the treaty. I should bring it to <<1>>.

<<1>> can challenge Ambassador <<2>>'s claims with the copy of the treaty. I should bring it to him immediately. He and the Green Lady are staying at Ladrelas the armorer's house, located above the forge.
<<1>> discovered the Maormer stole <<2>>'s copy of the treaty. He asked me to sneak inside the Maormer embassy and recover the stolen copy.\n\nI can't attack them head on - I'll need to use trickery.
I let <<Ac:1>> kill <<2>>.\n\nI should let <<3>> know the ambassador won't trouble her town any longer.
I should enter the Black Forge and try to find Vanus Galerion. The message suggested I go in through the side door.
Vanus Galerion has been restored and has led me to the Great Shackle. I should speak to him and see what he thinks we need to do next.
We should enter the temple courtyard and see what we can find of <<1>>.
A skeleton spoke to us as we approached the temple courtyard.

The skeleton warned us away, claiming <<1>> is being held inside the temple. <<2>> told me magical wards block the temple entrance. I should look for spider and scorpion emblems marking the wards so she can disrupt them.
<<1>> destroyed the wards blocking entrance to the temple. We need to enter the temple's catacombs to search for her master.
A strange barrier seals the door leading further into the temple. <<1>> thinks the cycle of both moons is key to breaking the seal.
<<1>> fears her master is in grave danger. She urges caution as we proceed to the temple's central ruins.
<<1>> appears to be possessed by a spirit named <<2>>, who plans to raise an undead army. Harming <<2>> would harm <<1>>. To avoid this, <<3>> and I must stop <<2>>'s summoning ritual.
We stopped the summoning ritual, but <<1>> fled with <<2>>'s body. I should chase him while <<3>> recovers from her exertions.

The water crystal once residing in the temple - the "Mourning Stone" - is key to sealing <<1>> back in his tomb. <<2>> thinks the only solution is to seal himself in the tomb, but <<3>> disagrees. I should ask her for her alternative.
I decided to bring <<1>> with me to <<2>>'s tomb. While the spirit is distracted, I will seal them both away forever.
I followed <<1>> into the temple's great hall, which is lined with deadly traps. I should find a way to disable the traps.
<<1>> forced <<2>> out of his body and into a nearby tomb, but the solution seemed temporary. I should speak with <<1>> about making it permanent.
<<1>> volunteered to seal herself in the tomb with <<2>> in place of her master. With little time before the spirit frees itself, I must decide who will be locked away with <<2>> forever.
<<1>> and <<2>> are now sealed in the Tomb of the Waning Moons. I should speak to <<3>> before I depart.
<<1>> and <<2>> are now sealed in the Tomb of the Waning Moons. I should speak to <<3>> before I depart.
The Dark Elf mage I was talking to transformed into a Khajiit. I should talk to him and get more details about their strange malady.

Zur the alchemist can craft a potion to get me past the rubble and into the laboratory, if I collect his notes and a rare tincture. They were scattered around the area when he accidentally blew up a Dwarven machine.
I gathered Zur's materials. I should look for the entrance to the laboratory, where I hope to find him and Gadris.
I should enter the laboratory and give the notes and tincture to Gadris or Zur. I'm not sure which one of the soul-melded mages will be available when I reach them.
I need to wait for Zur to craft a potion that will temporarily reduce my size so that I can squeeze through a hole in the rubble and enter the Vile Laboratory.
Zur completed the potion that will make me small enough to slip through a gap in the rubble and enter the Vile Laboratory. I should talk to the soul-melded mage and get the potion.
The potion turned me into a monkey! Now I can squeeze through the rubble and enter the ancient Dwarven laboratory.
I made it to the metallurgy workshop and reverted back into my normal form. Now I need to find Gadris's notebook.
Gadris listed the items necessary to make the antipiodal rods. I need to gather refined void salts, a crystalline essence matrix, and ebony ore from somewhere in this workshop.
I have the items from Gadris' notes, but he also mentioned a catalyst for the forging process. I should check to see if he left any notes on what this catalyst might be.

According to Gadris' notes, corrupted blood would be the best catalyst for forging the antipodal rods. The experiment chamber should contain corrupted blood created by the Daedra. Some kind of monster guards the chamber, however.
Now that I have the components and the catalyst to forge the antipodal rods, I should look for a furnace in the metallurgy workshop.
Now I need to forge the melted components into the antipodal rods. There must be a weapon anvil around here that I can use.
I forged the antipodal rods for the Dwarven device that the Soul-Meld Mage told me about. I should make my way to the Overseer's workroom and meet up with Gadris or Zur.
I found a strange-looking Dwarven device. This should be the machine that can reverse the soul-meld and set Gadris and Zur free. I should talk to the mage and get any final instructions.
The soul-meld is unraveling. The souls of the two mages have each been drawn to one of the antipodal rods. Now I need to pull one of the levers to save either Zur or Gadris.
I decided to save Gadris. I should talk to him and see if he's recovered from the soul-meld reversal.
I should meet Gadris outside the Vile Laboratory and speak with him.
I decided to save Zur. I should talk to him and see if he's recovered from the soul-meld reversal.
I should meet Zur outside the Vile Laboratory and speak to him.
It was easy enough to recover Zadala's medicinal herbs. I should continue searching the riverbank for the scroll case.
Now that I've reached <<1>>, I should give the supplies list to <<2>>.
I found Kireth Vanos inside the gallery. She seems upset. I should speak to her.
If neither is willing to produce a copy, I should inform <<c:1>>.
I should take a stealthy approach in the warehouse if I hope to catch anyone off-guard.
While in a warehouse, I discovered a Maormer sailor leaving a suspicious letter for an unknown recipient.
I've found a suspicious listing of sales in an apothecary's ledger. It details the sale of a significant amount of Daedra blood to unknown customers.
I found some Sea Viper paraphernalia on the Serpent's Kiss, a Maormer diplomatic ship. This shows a direct connection between the Maormer Embassy and the Sea Vipers in Shattered Shoals.
Lady Clarisse Laurent told me that Telenger the Artificer discovered something important, but she couldn't remember what it was. I need to find Telenger.
Raynor Vanos asked me to find Lady Clarisse Laurent. He's worried about her and figures I have the best chance of resisting the entrapment spell.
Telenger's chamber is empty, but there's a note on the table. I should read the note and see what it says.
I found Telenger the Artificer locked inside a vault on the library's lowest level. I should speak to him.
Telenger the Artificer locked himself inside a vault on the lower level of the library in an attempt to slow the effects of the spell assaulting his mind. I should look for him there.

Telenger the Artificer discovered a portal inside the library vault. There's something powerful and potentially useful on the other side. Telenger has unlocked the vault and asked me to join him inside.
I entered the vault. I should talk to Telenger and see what he wants to do next.
I came across a pedestal that holds a bright crystal of light. I think Telenger was right. I think that is one of the fabled Lights of Meridia.
I stepped through the library vault portal and find myself on a floating rock high above the Library of Dusk. I should investigate the area and find the source of the power Telenger detected.

Telenger the Artificer doesn't trust himself due to the Daedric spell that continues to asault his mind. He wants me to enter the portal and find the source of the power he detected on the other side.
I obtained the Light of Meridia and need to get back to the surface. An image of King Laloriaran Dynar appeared before me and said that he will protect me if I choose to jump off the floating rock.
I returned from the floating rock with a Light of Meridia. I should speak with Telenger the Artificer at their camp outside the library ruins.
Now that Raynor has been freed from the Daedric spell, I should talk to him.
Shalidor pointed out some kind of chest in the corner of the room. I should check it out.
I have the three crystals that were powering portals around Eyevea. By placing them in the sconces out front of the Guildhall I should be able to help Shalidor crack that ward.
In order to use the Wabbajack, I need to equip it.
Inside the Black Forge, I found Vanus Galerion. At least, I found a part of the Great Mage. I should talk to the essence of the mage.

Vanus divided himself into three fragments so that the Daedra couldn't use him to power the Great Shackle. To free the first fragment, Galerion's Health, I need to kill vampires and recover his stolen health.
I freed the mage's essence of health. Now I need to go to the slave quarters and find the essence of stamina.
I made my way to the slave quarters. Now I should find Galerion's essence and see what it has to say.
Aelif followed me through the portal. She's set to lead me to Merric inside the Forge.
Merric appears close to finishing the Prismatic Weapon. I should speak to him.
Aelif believes Jofnir will know where Sees-All-Colors has gone, that they have some kind of connection. I should wait to see if her bet proves correct.
I should follow Merric and Aelif into Oblivion in search of Sees-All-Colors.
I took <<1>> into custody, preventing <<Ac:2>> from taking her revenge.\n\nI should let <<3>> know the ambassador won't trouble her town any longer.
I took <<1>> into custody, preventing <<Ac:2>> from taking her revenge.\n\nI should let <<3>> know the ambassador won't trouble her town any longer.
I should look for Falisa in the Inn in Sentinel.
I found a small amount of moon-sugar in the Maormer embassy. I could use this to put the ambassador's guard to sleep.
I found a love letter written by the ambassador's guard. I should forge a response from his love interest to get him to leave.
Now that I've reached Cropsford, I should inform Bosekus of his brother's death.
Now that I've reached <<1>>, I should find Wardiya.
Now that I'm in Cropsford, I should bring the fertilizer to <<1>>.
Sheogorath told me to take the book. Finally! Time to grab it and move on.
I decided to use the note of debt to collect coin from <<1>>
I broke the barrier leading further into the temple, but <<1>> wants to speak with me before we proceed.
Now that I'm in Cropsford, I should deliver the rag doll to <<1>>.
Dominion scouts have been captured by the Daedra around Moonhenge. I should free them.
