After I found Graccus' tome, I heard the voice of a being called Hermaeus Mora, who revealed that Graccus seeks something called the <<1>>. Hermaeus Mora wishes me to find Graccus somewhere below this cellar.
I found <<1>>. I should defeat him, then deal with the <<2>>.
<<1>> has appeared in place of the <<2>>. I should speak with him.
I found a hole in the cellar that could take me below Graccus' mansion. I should take the drop.
I should escort Apprentice Patraud to convince the Bosmer the Mages Guild expedition means them no harm.
<<1>> asked me to find belongings of three villagers who died in the cellars. With their belongings, she can add their memories to her story of the village, to pass on.
I need to find an item that belonged to <<1>>.
I need to find an item that belonged to <<1>>.
I need to find an item that belonged to <<1>>.
I recovered belongings from each of the deceased villagers. I should bring them to <<1>> at the docks outside the Manse.
I should free <<1>> from her chains.
<<1>> is free. I should talk to her.

Nethrin ran all the way to find me because his third foreman is a relative. His niece Lorwen leads the third team that's apparently found a battle site near the Falinesti Autumn grounds. I should try to find her.
A priest at the Rawl'kha temple says everyone is awaiting me inside. I should follow him into the temple.
Aranias lost her temper with me, but just as quickly became contrite. She told me to meet her at the manor house, but Maruin's appeared within the story. I should talk with him first.
Although Aranias was proud of her ability to sculpt the ground, her parents were less pleased. I should talk to Maruin about this story's significance.
Maurin will show me another piece of Aranias' past. I should watch it and learn what I can about her from its story.
The Veiled Heritance plans to test Aranias, but she's not sure what form it will take. I should eavesdrop on Veiled Heritance party-goers to learn what feat Aranias is expected to perform.
Several conversations mentioned Andur as a rival with Aranias for a place in the Veiled Heritance. Andur's currently outside the manor grounds. I should find him and talk to him.
Andur, standing over a cowering Bosmer, attacked me. I need to defeat him so his plan cannot go forward.
I need to kill the Thane of the Everfull Flagon so that I can free the souls of the trapped villagers. I found a trap door in one of the ruined houses. Maybe it leads to the Thane's lair.
I defeated the Thane. I also found some sort of crystal stone that was clearly enspelledâ€”perhaps it houses the stolen souls. If I destroy it, that might release the souls of the villagers.
I freed the souls of the villagers. I should go back to the Flagon and find Bernt.
I made it back to the Everfull Flagon. I should find Bernt and see what he plans to do next.
Nelhilda decided to forgive her father. She will lead any villagers who wish to leave the Everfull Flagon to the Hollow City.
Apprentice Patraud was killed in a Bosmer attack. I should speak with Warlock Carindon.
The Bosmer are attacking. They must be defeated.
Lyris and I entered the castle cistern. Cadwell is waiting for us. I should speak to him.
Cadwell needs to work on the steam pipes so we can advance through the castle's underworks. I should follow along and look after him.
Cadwell finished tinkering with the pipes. I should talk to him before heading into the keep.
The Daedric portal to Moonhenge is sealed. I should tell Sergeant Galandir of my success.
The Daedric portal to Moonhenge is sealed. I should tell Sergeant Galandir of my success.
The Daedric portal to Moonhenge is sealed. I should tell Sergeant Galandir of my success.
Warlock Carindon wants to attempt contact with the Bosmer again. Together with Evoker Ahainar-jo, I should seek out the Bosmer.
I should search for a soldier named Hazazi who came to speak with the Bramblebreach tribe.
Felari has asked me to speak to her Wood Elf counterpart, a Greenspeaker named Nethrin.
The Bosmer are attacking again. I have no choice but to defeat them.
The Supernal Dreamers used the conjuration boxes to summon a Daedra. Now that it's been revealed, I must kill it.
Nelhilda was understandably upset when she realized that her father had caused the curse that plagued the Everfull Flagon and caused the loss of her husband. I should talk to her.
Nelhilda won't forgive her father for the trouble he caused. She will lead any villagers who wish to join her to the Hollow City. But Bernt will remain here.
With Andur dead, I should free his captive and find out where the Veiled Heritance have taken his wife.
The Veiled Heritance plans to use a Bosmer woman as a target for Aranias' power. I must talk to Maruin to find out what we can do to prevent this senseless murder.
I've collected all of the arms caches and should meet Jilan-dar outside of Toothmaul Gully.
Bramble vines grabbed my legs to slow me down, and Aranias easily won the race. I should ask her whether she had anything to do with the vines.
I need to find usable parts from the atronachs and corpses in the tower.
I found serviceable atronach parts. I can now assemble the creature at the tower summit.
I can now invoke the ritual from the book on the pedestal.
I need to wait for the flesh atronach to complete its task.

Though Dominion forces have nearly retaken Seaside Sanctuary, it seems that Vicereeve Pelidil is on a Maormer ship off-shore. I need to speak to Captain Jimila about setting sail in the Prowler to confront Pelidil.
Check the recent female bodies for any sign of Zariya's remains.
Evoker Ahainar-jo has been killed in a second attack by the Bosmer of Selene's Web. I should speak to Warlock Carindon for instructions.
Carindon has instructed me to move deeper into the forest to see what I can find while the Guild Mages interrogate a captive Bosmer. I should further investigate Selene's Web.
A skilled Khajiiti hunter has attacked me. I have no choice but to defeat him.
I've defeated Longclaw, a Khajiiti hunter loyal to the mysterious "Selene." I should speak with Journeyman Mirondil.
Journeyman Mirondil and I have agreed to look for the mysterious Selene that both the mages' captive Bosmer and the Khajiit I defeated remarked about.
Darius requested that Zariya's remains be consecrated with funerary oils, which marks the restoration of her honor in the eyes of the gods.
I recovered the gemstones proving Zariya's innocence and I consecrated her remains.\n\nNow I must return and give the ring and gems to Darius.
Now that I destroyed the Necromantic Focuses, I must enter the lighthouse and disrupt Alasan's ritual to prevent him from using the Ansei Ward to become a lich.
Mirondil and I have found a doorway of vines and foliage. I should speak to Warlock Carindon.
The Willowgrove townsperson I spoke to directed me to speak with Ranneth, the village's Treethane.
Pircalmo is increasingly desperate and was more than willing to accept my help. He's headed back to his camp above town, and has asked me to pick up some ritual components for him.
I've found Pircalmo's camp, which has papers strewn everywhere. I should search through the papers for something useful.
Pircalmo is casting the ritual. I should ensure that it works properly.
I collected the ritual components and should speak to Pircalmo, in the forest overlooking the town.

Pircalmo's ritual has gone wrong once again. To complete it, he says he needs some cores from the atronachs that are the source of the problem. He's asked me to collect a core from each type of atronach.
Something appears to have gone wrong with the ritual. I need to speak to Pircalmo.
The rod Pircalmo lent me has lead me to a cave, secluded within the forest.
Pircalmo is still maintaining the spell. I should talk to him, now that I have the cores he needs.
There appears to be some kind of argument between Pircalmo and Ranneth. I should see what's going on.

Ranneth is concerned that Pircalmo might force her hand, and break the contract the two of them have entered into. She recommended I look through Pircalmo's camp for anything that might shed more light on what's going on.
I collected the necessary atronach cores and should return to Pircalmo.
Pircalmo's lent me an enchanted rod that should allow me to pinpoint the source of the magical disruption. Pircalmo is running to ensure Alanya's safety. I should hurry and find out what's happening.

Barbas, the talking dog, is the companion of Clavicus Vile. He informed me that the altar is a long-forgotten altar to Clavicus Vile. He wants me to smash it so that he can be free, and the town can be safe.
The atronachs are docile, and the forest is rapidly healing. The town is all gathered around an altar. I should stop Ranneth before she kills Alanya.
Pircalmo is free, Alanya is safe, and Ranneth has apologized to both of them. I should speak with her.
While the Guild Mages attempt to bypass the barrier blocking them from entering Selene's Sanctum, I should try to find another way in.
The Guild Mages have been attacked by an unknown assailant. I should return to the vine barrier to help them.
Warlock Carindon appears to be hurt. I should speak with him.
Carindon has been injured. The task to face Selene has been left to me.
I should try to find <<1>> and return her lute.
The first order of business is to free hostages the enemy is holding and to kill their commanders. I should talk to Razum-dar to decide how to divide up the tasks.
I need to rescue the hostages while Razum-dar weakens the Maormer forces. Meratille, Bashshi-ra, and Ulmion are being held in the buildings around the sanctuary.
I need to take out the commanders to weaken the Maormer forces while Razum-dar frees the hostages.
I've passed through Serpent's Grotto and found a small camp of Dominion soldiers camped outside the sanctuary. I should speak with Major Cirenwe to see what is going on.
I should travel to <<1>>.
I should travel to <<1>>.

I shattered the Ward and disrupted Alasan's ritual. To stop the necromancer, I must restore the Ansei Ward by gathering goat's milk to honor Morwha, earth from the grave of a warrior to honor Zeht, and the Desert Wind to honor Tava.
With the ingredients needed to honor the gods, I must now take the parts of the shattered Ansei Ward and reforge the blade.
I succeeded in reforging the blade of the Ansei Ward. I must place it on the Ansei Shrine to restore its power and the Ansei's strength.
I placed the reforged Ansei Ward on the shrine, and Alasan confronted me. Ansei Maja appeared. I should watch to see what happens.
By reforging the blade of the Ansei Ward, I restored Ansei Maja's power and he was able to defeat the dark spirit Alasan had become. I should speak with Ansei Maja.
I smashed the altar at Barbas' request. I should return to town and tell Ranneth about this discovery.
The Lunar Champion ran after a projection of her sister. I should follow her.
The Lunar Champion is ready to enter the Den of Lorkhaj. I should follow her in there.
Inside the Den of Lorkhaj, the Lunar Champion started to walk toward the center of the plane. I should follow her.
Captain One-Eye wants me to use the key to open the tunnel that leads to the Coral Tower.
With the path cleared, I'm free to make my way to the Coral Tower.
The Lost Fleet Admiral appeared on the balcony over the entrance to the Coral Tower. It appears he has something to say. I should listen to him.
I found the Coral Tower and should now enter.
I defeated the Admiral and retrieved his Crown of Bones. I should find Captain One-Eye and see how the rest of her plan turned out.
Captain One-Eye asked me to get the Crown of Bones from the Admiral. Meanwhile she will be searching for other undead "relatives" from Alten Corimont.
I agreed to give Captain One-Eye the Crown of Bones. It's evil, but perhaps she can control it.
I refused to give Captain One-Eye the Crown of Bones. I should talk to her and see how she's taking my decision.
I found <<1>>. I should return the pendant to him.
Dralnas asked me to destroy the <<1>> before it consumes his soul. The gem should be somewhere deeper within the cave complex.
I destroyed the Anguish Gem. Now I should return to <<1>> and let him know.
I rescued Stibbons from the tower. I should meet him at the wayshrine to the east and make sure he's all right.
I should find the tower where <<1>> is being held captive and rescue him. Along the way, I might find additional notes he's dropped from the tower.
Some of the miners survived. I should find everyone I can.
Galbenel asked me to find her former boss, Kuna, and tell her everything that happened at the mine. She should be in Rawl'kha.
I think I've found all of the survivors in Kuna's Delve. I lead the miners out of the mine.
I need to defeat the skeletons in the area and find a good set of bones for <<1>>.
<<1>> is whole again. I should speak to him.
I should follow the trail of fire to search for the pair.
The Wilderking has appeared on the path. I should speak with him.
The Wilderking has appeared in my path. I should speak with him.

The Wilderking says he's dying and that Aranias is destined to replace him. He believes she will have a change of heart and I will need to help her fight Andur. I should follow them into the Throne Tunnels.

The Wilderking says he's dying and that Aranias is destined to replace him. He believes she will have a change of heart and I will need to help her fight Andur. I should follow them through the Throne Tunnels.
The Wilderking says he's dying and that Aranias is destined to replace him. I finally caught up and discovered that she's turned against Andur but needs my help to defeat him.
The Wilderking says he's dying and that Aranias is destined to replace him. Aranias has indeed had a change of heart and now seeks to stop Andur. I need to follow her and help her defeat him.

The Wilderking says he's dying and that Aranias is destined to replace him. Aranias has indeed had a change of heart and now seeks to stop Andur. I need to find them and help her defend the Wilderking.

The Wilderking says he's dying and that Aranias is destined to replace him. Aranias has indeed had a change of heart and now defends the Wilderking from Andur's wrath. I must defeat Andur to save them both.
Andur is defeated and Aranias has taken the weakened Wilderking to the tower. I should join them there.
I should speak to the Wilderking.
The Wilderking is gone, and Aranias has assumed the mantle and become the Wilderqueen. I should speak to her.
I chose to skip the training. I need to get <<1>>'s permission to go straight to battle.

Pelidil has raised Prince Naemon from the dead, but I don't have time to worry about that right now. I need to light the beacon at the top of the lighthouse to signal Major Cirenwe to launch the attack.
Dominion soldiers have launched a full-scale attack against the Maormer and Veiled Heritance forces at Seaside Sanctuary. I should join the battle and reconnect with Major Cirenwe.
I should go talk to <<1>> at the Elder Scroll temple of Mnem.
I should search the deck of the 'Covenant's Pride' for the designs left behind by the workers.
I should speak with Jeromec Lemal.
I should return the ship designs to Jeromec Lemal.
Graccus' journal claimed he was led to treasure by a mysterious tome he found in his cellar. I should find a way into the cellar myself.
I should search the deck of the 'Ranser's Regret' for the designs left behind by the workers.
The designs for the 'Belle of Balfiera' seem to be missing, but there is a suspicious looking dark elf nearby. I should speak with Llasi Omoren.
I should search the deck of the 'Belle of Balfiera' for the designs left behind by the workers.
I should return the ship designs to Jeromec Lemal.
I should use a door to get back into the Eastern Elsweyr gate.
When I discovered Zariya's remains, her spirit appeared. I should speak with the spirit.
I've agreed to recover the gemstones that will prove Zariya's innocence. \n\nThe gems should be in the rotting corpses of her brother Thadret, Hillid the Swordsman, and Islaif the Highwayman.
Ranneth may have some idea of where I can find these ritual components.
I've gathered the bones. I should set them down so <<1>> can assemble himself.
I found the bones, now I should return.
Indaenir says he might know a way to determine what the Shade's true motivations are. I should meet him outside.
Mane Akkhuz-ri is suspicious of what the Shade's true motivations might be. He wants to speak to Indaenir about the matter. I should listen.
While the other two miners fled, Galbenel has stayed behind to speak to me. I should do so.
King Dynar and Vanus have convened a council of war within the Chapel of Light. They're waiting for me to join them. I should head inside and figure out our plan of attack.
Ranneth suggested I speak to Sarolion Sells-All, a local merchant, for information on getting chitin.
Sarolion said he'd be willing to just give me some chitin if I'll speak to the town gossip, a woman named Malesse.
I've informed Malesse about Sarolion's situation, and she seemed to immediately regret her actions. I should tell the merchant.
I must defend the Lunar Champion and put down any who attack her.
I should wait while the Lunar Champion confronts her dead sister.
The Two Moons Path is complete. I should enter the portal and return to Dune.
Ayrenn and some of the other most important people in the Dominion are gathered at the temple. I could speak to them about this momentous occasion.
I found a way to delve under the Graccus' mansion cellar. I should search for Graccus and the <<1>>.
I can talk to Firamo and Miniel to learn more about siege engines.
There's a book near the ritual circle. Perhaps it contains some clues as to how to shut it down.

I found a note addressed to Pircalmo, from Telenger. It details a ritual, as well as casting some doubt on Pircalmo's spellcasting prowess. Pircalmo has come up behind me while I was reading it. I should speak with him.
I succeeded in reforging the blade of the Ansei Ward. I must place it on the Ansei Shrine to restore its power and the Ansei's strength.
There actually are bandits here! I'll have to defeat them and learn where they're coming from.

The Wilderking says he's dying and that Aranias is destined to replace him. He believes she will have a change of heart and I will need to help her fight Andur. I should follow the trail of fire to catch up to them.
The Wilderking says that he will soon die and that Aranias must accept the responsibility to take his place. I should climb the tower and speak to her.
I should talk to the Lunar Champion before we go into the Den of Lorkhaj.
The Wilderking says he's dying and that Aranias is destined to replace him. Aranias has indeed had a change of heart and now seeks to stop Andur. I need to follow her and help her defeat him.
<<1>> asked me to duel and defeat his students.
I must seek out <<1>> in the southeast circle of <<2>> to continue the rite.
I should find <<1>> - she waits for me at the entrance. There I will take the last step in the rite of Leki's Blade.
<<1>> told me that I must drink from <<Ac:2>> at <<3>>. With luck, I will obtain a vision while in a dream-state.
<<1>> asked me to recover <<2>>, <<3>>, and <<4>>. I will find these while dreaming in <<5>>.
<<1>> asked me to keep my eyes open, as she fears the students at <<2>> are in some kind of danger. I must train as a student would, starting with <<3>> in the forge.
I've solved the first riddle posed by <<1>>. I must listen carefully to the next story and choose my answer well.
I've solved the second riddle posed by <<1>>. I must listen carefully to the next story and choose my answer well.
The third riddle <<1>> told me requires that I speak to residents of <<2>>.
<<1>> has died by her own hand. <<2>> left in disgust, and now only <<3>> remains. I should speak to her and find out what she plans to do next.
I obtained the three armaments in the dream, and hold them in my thoughts. I should pray at each of their shrines before entering the master's chambers.
I've prayed at the shrines and obtained their wisdom. Now I must enter the master's chambers to receive her blessing.
As I entered the chambers, I saw a strange scene - the master confronting the old master of legend. I should question <<1>> to find out what's going on.

<<1>> confessed the secret she's been hiding from the others - the old master has risen from his grave as a vampire, and turned her. She's asked me to tell the others as she prepares herself for her inevitable death.
<<1>> asked me to go after <<2>> - she said he would flee to his crypt. I should find where that is and follow him.
<<1>> asked me to go after <<2>> - she said he would flee to his crypt. I should follow him and end his unholy life.
I need to return to Leki's Blade and find <<1>>.
<<1>> has died by her own hand. <<2>> left in disgust, and now only <<3>> remains. I should speak to her and find out what she plans to do next.
I found <<1>> at the old master's gravesite, awaiting judgment. I should speak to <<2>> and find out what's been decided.
<<1>> has been spared, but is exiled from the school. <<2>> left in disgust, and now only <<3>> remains. I should speak to him and find out what he plans to do next.
<<1>> has been spared, but is exiled from the school. <<2>> left in disgust, and now only <<3>> remains. I should speak to him and find out what he plans to do next.
The steward told me of one of the master's sayings: "We do not choose when we rest. To give up the hard road is to bring suffering to the next traveler."
I've learned that <<1>> hated enchantments of any purpose.
<<1>>'s last battle was with a group of bandits.
One of the disciples said I needed to talk to <<1>> in order to begin the rites of Leki's Blade.
I emerged from the vision quest with the Champions. I should speak to the lunar priest again.
Kauzanabi-jo will now complete the Sacrament of the First Step. I should watch Shazah and Khali's final cleansing.

<<1>> asked me to start my training by picking up munitions from the Southern Morrowind gate. I should use the Transitus Shrine to travel there. Or I can skip training by talking to Grand Warlord Zimmeron.
I chose to skip the introduction to Cyrodiil. I should talk to <<1>> to confirm.
Now that I'm at the Southern Morrowind gate, I should pick up munitions from <<1>>.
I should use the Transitus Shrine to return to the Northern Morrowind gate, then find Adalmor at the siege range south of the gate.
I found Cadwell, one of the Soul Shriven that helped me escape the Slave Pits. I should speak with him.
I must go to the castle cistern and meet Cadwell.
Check Graccus' private quarters for the key to the cellar.
I should return to <<1>> once I'm finished practicing with siege weapons.
<<1>> has given me a practice siege repair kit to use on a siege weapon on the firing range.
I should speak with Looks-Forward and Lirtis to learn more about siege weapons.
I should further speak to Ranneth to get more details about the mage she hired to help.
I should talk to <<1>> at the Elder Scroll temple of Chim.
I should speak with <<1>> to learn more.
I should use the doors to return to the Northern Morrowind gate.
Inside the cave, I encountered signs of Daedric influence and â€¦ a talking dog. I should see what the dog wants.
We destroyed the Great Shackle, but Cadwell claims the Planemeld hasn't been completely defeated yet. I should talk to Vanus Galerion and see what he thinks about the situation.
We destroyed the Great Shackle, but Cadwell claims the Planemeld hasn't been completely defeated yet. I should talk to Vanus Galerion and see what he thinks about the situation.
We destroyed the Great Shackle, but Cadwell claims the Planemeld hasn't been completely defeated yet. I should talk to Vanus Galerion and see what he thinks about the situation.
We destroyed the Great Shackle, but Cadwell claims the Planemeld hasn't been completely defeated yet. I should talk to Vanus Galerion and see what he thinks about the situation.
The Great Shackle is destroyed! But Cadwell informed us that the threat of the Planemeld isn't over yet. I should follow Vanus through the portal to the Hollow City.
Shazah's father appeared to her and spoke to her about her relationship with Khali. He instructed us to pray at the three lunar shrines to learn more about his past.
Khali's mother appeared to her and spoke of her relationship with Shazah. She instructed us to pray at the three lunar shrines to learn more about her past.
I defeated the Silvenar. I should talk to the Green Lady to ensure her safety.
I saved the Queen, but she left the room. I should speak with her outside.
The Silvenar turned into a werewolf! I must defeat him and defend the Green Lady against his wrath.
Urcelmo chased the Queen into an antechamber of her domain. I should follow her in there and save her from his treachery.
Something is happening to the Silvenar. I should wait to see how it resolves itself.
I should follow Urcelmo to the site of Queen Ayrenn's last stand.
I should talk with the Green Lady and Silvenar to ensure they are all right.
I came upon the scene of Battlereeve Urcelmo fighting and defeating Razum-dar in battle. I should talk to Raz to make sure he's all right.
I should follow the Silvenar and the Green Lady and defend them from the feral Wood Elves.
Cariel told me to find Razum-dar, somewhere up the hill. I should look for him.
A figure lies on the path ahead of us, obviously wounded. I should speak to him and try to determine what's going on.
Cariel kneels on the ground in front of us. I should speak to her.
The vision ran up the path and into a spinning portal. Obviously, I'm meant to follow.
The second vision ran up the path and into a spinning portal. Obviously, I'm meant to follow.
We entered a mystical plane of existence. I should talk to the Lunar Champion to see where she would like to go next.
The corruption is coming from the trees, so Indaenir suggests we activate the Standing Stones which once protected the people from the aggression of the forest.
We activated the Standing Stones, but then Indaenir realized that the corruption is emanating from the Den of the Eldest. We should go to the Eldest Den.
We've reached the entrance to the Eldest Den. I should speak to Indaenir about what to expect inside.
To stop the spread of the blight, I must kill the corrupted Eldest and remove its heart. Indaenir might be able to use it to grow a replacement for the Eldest.
When I extracted the Eldest's heart, I was pulled into the realm of the Shadow Wood. I should speak with Indaenir about what to do next.
Indaenir believes we can purge some of the corruption from the trees by killing the corrupted tree spirits within the Shadow Wood.
I've slain the corrupted tree spirits and now I should find Indaenir.
I must kill the Servant of Naemon to escape from the Shadow Wood and to stop the spread of the blight.

<<1>> asked me to start my training by picking up munitions from the Northern High Rock gate. I should use the Transitus Shrine to travel there. Or I can skip training by talking to Grand Warlord Dortene.
I decided to skip the introduction to Cyrodiil. I should talk to <<1>> to confirm.
I should speak to <<1>> to pick up the munitions.
I should use the Transitus Shrine to return to the Southern High Rock gate, then find Bugbesh at the siege range north of the gate.
The Champion is ready to walk the Two Moons Path. Together we must enter the Temple of the Dance to begin the journey.
Rid-Thar-ri'Datta has appeared at the foot of the stairs within the Temple of the Dance. He means to talk to us.
Rid-Thar-ri'Datta told us we need to reflect on the past of the Khajiiti people before we move on. I need to use the crystals to align each of the lunar reflectors in order to see these visions.
The moons have shown me visions through each reflector. I should adjust the crystal to activate the last one in order to make the moon light shine down upon the temple.
We witnessed the scenes in the Temple of the Dance. We are now ready to venture through the portal and continue on the Two Moons Path.
I squeezed through the rubble and entered the Vile Laboratory. Now I have to find the metallurgy workshop.
I should return to <<1>> once I'm finished practicing with siege weapons.
Jaleel and Marc can tell me more about siege engines, if I'm interested.
<<1>> has given me a practice repair kit that can be used on a siege weapon here.
I found a strange crystal attached to the device. I should take the crystal.
Gadris thinks that the powerful crystal attached to the device is one of the legendary Lights of Meridia. I should take the crystal.
I should go talk to Yseline at the Elder Scroll temple of Alma Ruma.
Yseline advised me to speak with <<1>> to learn more.

By reforging the blade of the Ansei Ward, I restored Ansei Maja's power and he was able to defeat the dark spirit Alasan had become. I should now take the restored Ansei Ward to Prince Azah for safekeeping.
I should talk to <<1>> and make sure he's all right.
I should enter the Manor of Revelry and find Stibbons.
Now that I'm inside the Manor of Revelry, I should find <<1>> and speak with him.
Stibbons asked me to introduce myself to the lovely sisters of the manor and then meet him at the banquet tables.
I'm inside the manor house. Now I need to find <<1>>.
Fatahala knows a way out of the manor, but Stibbons won't leave until he retrieves his lady's jewels. I should speak to <<1>>.
We stopped the Planemeld and saved Nirn, but at what cost? King Dynar lies dying before me. I should speak to him before it's too late.
King Dynar is briefing me on the final orders for my mission. I should listen to what he has to say.
I need to speak to Hahnin and Gabrielle to receive their briefings on the Fighters Guild and Mages Guild battle plans.
I need to decide which soldier to take with me to close the reinforcement portal and open the way into the Labyrinth for the rest of our forces.
I need to fight my way to the portal where Molag Bal can call in reinforcements.
The Guardian of the Gate stands in the way of my efforts to close the reinforcement portal. I need to defeat her to finish the first phase of my mission.
I need to close the portal to prevent Molag Bal from sending more troops in to stop us.
Now that the reinforcement portal has been closed, I need to go to the Labyrinth and open the way into Molag Bal's inner sanctum.
I unlocked the way into the Labyrinth and then Vanus Galerion opened a portal behind me. I should speak to him before I enter the door.
I should enter the Labyrinth and locate the portal to the planar vortex.
I should speak to Gabrielle and see if she has any advice on how I should proceed through the Labyrinth.
I need to figure out how to operate the devices that open the door on the other side of this room.
I used the device and opened the door to the next area of the Labyrinth. I should proceed through the door and continue my search for the planar vortex.
A dark chamber stands before me. I need to find a way to get across it if I want to advance through the Labyrinth.
I should follow Gabrielle across the bridge.
I need to continue deeper into the Labyrinth if I'm going to locate the planar vortex.
The door locked behind us as soon as Gabrielle and I entered this chamber. We need to find a way to proceed deeper into the Labyrinth.
Only Gabrielle and I made it into the next area before the door sealed behind us. But then a portal opened and Vanus Galerion appeared. I should talk to him.
Vanus tells me the portal to the planar vortex is close by. I need to find it so we can stop the Planemeld.
As soon as I defeated the portal guardian, the mysterious Groundskeeper from the Hollow City appeared. I should talk to her.
I promised Stibbons I'd recover Lady Laurent's stolen jewels.
I recovered Lady Laurent's stolen jewels. Now I should make my way to the pools and find Stibbons at the entrance to the secret tunnel.
We survived the trek through the secret tunnel. Now I should leave the Manor of Revelry and meet Stibbons outside.
I should return to the exterior of the Temple of the Dance and confer with the Lunar Champion.
I should confer with the Lunar Champion outside the Temple of the Dance.
I should return to the exterior of the Temple of the Dance.
Indaenir suggested I heal the ruptures while I have the opportunity.
After speaking to General Malgoth, I should now talk to Indaenir and find out what to do next.
After speaking to General Malgoth, I should now talk to Indaenir and find out what to do next.
The priestess told me to make for the city of Rawl'kha. I need to find a member of the lunar clergy called Hadam-do at the temple there.
I must free the four hostages and send them to join the army on the outskirts of the city.
I must speak with Captain Rawan and ask him to send Shiri, the scholar's apprentice, back to Bergama.
After defeating the undead, Merric is worried about Aelif. We should find her outside the Forge.
<<1>> needs me to speak with <<2>>. She refuses to talk with him. I need to cajole her into telling me what she wants in a bridegroom.
I must find Prince Azah somewhere in the town of Tava's Blessing.
The Priestess said that only Jone and Jode can determine if I'm the Moon Hallowed. I need to pray at the altar in the clearing to have them weigh in.
When I healed the last rupture, the spirit of Elphirion appeared to me. Perhaps I should speak with her.
I selected a companion to accompany me on my initial foray into Molag Bal's inner domain. I should tell King Dynar that I'm ready to go.
<<1>>, father of the bride, asked me to pull together his daughter's dowry.
<<1>> told the bride's father to put the dowry at the end of the entrance tunnel, where prospective grooms can inspect it before the wedding.
Now that the dowry's in place, I should return to <<1>> and  let him know it's time to send for the groom candidates.
Sheogorath and his assistant Haskill await me inside the Hall. I should confront him and tell him to leave.

Sheogorath has made me a tempting offer. He says that I can choose to have Valaste stay, or go with him. If she stays, he'll cure her insanity. If she goes, he'll give me a tome of power worth several skyshards. I should choose what to do.
I forced Captain Ethrel's squad to let me stay behind and cast the spell to destroy Coldhabour's Moonhenge. I need to cast the Scroll of Sigilic Annihilation from the center of the ruin.

The Scroll of Sigilic Annihilation's magic is disintegrating Coldharbour's Moonhenge around me.  The stress opened a tear back to Tamriel on the far end of the island. I should enter it to escape to Tamriel.
The Daedric portal in Moonhenge is sealed. I should tell Sergeant Galandir of my success.
The Daedric portal in Moonhenge is sealed. I should tell Sergeant Galandir of my success.
The bandits suddenly became hostile and attacked me. I should find out what happened to <<1>>. Maybe he'll know what's going on.
A small Daedric creature told me to go to the Davon's Watch Mages Guild. It must be one of Tharn's servants.
I arrived at the Mages Guild. I should speak with Abnur Tharn.
Abnur Tharn has asked me to travel to a place called the Wormroot Depths in Grahtwood, which he believes to be a place that Mannimarco keeps a cache of secret information.
Abnur Tharn has asked me to travel to a place called Knife Ear Grotto in Deshaan, which he believes to be a place that Mannimarco keeps a cache of secret information.
Abnur Tharn has asked me to travel to a place called Norvulk Ruins in Stormhaven, which he believes to be a place that Mannimarco keeps a cache of secret information.
I read all of the books. I should talk with Abnur Tharn again and see what he has to say.
I should finish up my business with Varen Aquilarios.
<<1>> is being held captive by the bandits. I need to find the keys at <<2>>'s tent to free him.
We need to get to the Hectahame Grotto.
It seems the Shade has somehow blocked our path. I should speak to Indaenir about what to do next.

I need to search the branches of Hectahame for three keystones to unseal the door into the Valenheart. Each time I recover a keystone, I need to place it in one of the pedestals before searching for the next.
Now that I've placed all the keystones, Indaenir should be able to unseal the door that leads to the Heart of Valenwood.
I should follow Indaenir into the Valenheart to confront the Shade of Naemon.
I need to kill the Shade of Naemon to get the Staff of Magnus.
The Shade is defeated and I've recovered the Staff of Magnus. I should speak to Indaenir.
Indaenir is going to attempt to heal the Heart of Valenwood.
Indaenir died attempting to heal the Valenheart. Mane Akkhuz-ri has arrived. I should speak to him.
While speaking to Mane Akkhuz-ri, something started to happen around Indaenir's body. I should wait and see what happens.
Indaenir was brought back from death. I should speak to him.
To rebind the sea serpent, I need to follow Priestess Sendel out to the Binding Pool and defeat the Maormer mage who seeks to free the serpent.
<<1>> arrived on the guardhouse balcony, and seems pleased that the harpies are no longer angered against the town. I should see what she thinks the future holds for Kozanset.

After talking to several people around Kozanset, the problem is still not clear to me. Either the harpies are just nuisances, or the mercenaries are extorting the citizens.\n\nI should ask the town magistrate about these issues.
I've collected <<Azm:1>> from the rooftops. I should bring them to <<2>> as she asked.
Mercenaries seem to protect the town for pay. I can talk to some of the people around town to hear their opinions about the seriousness of the harpy problem.
I've learned that the Gold Coast mercenaries are extorting the people of Kozanset for protection. I should let <<1>> know she was right.
<<1>> approached me and asked me to talk further with her. I should see what she wants.
I found <<1>> in a harpy nest some distance away from Kozanset. I should talk to her and make sure she's all right.
I've entered <<1>>'s  house. She bade me come talk to her in privacy about the town's harpy problems.
<<1>> asked me to recover <<Azm:2>> from the rooftops of houses in Kozanset. How they got there is a mystery, but it's undoubtably one of the reasons why the harpies are so angry.
As I entered the town hall, I interrupted a heated discussion between someone named <<1>> and <<2>>.\n\nI should ask him what happened.
<<1>> said she'd seen the mercenaries frequenting the warehouse on the edge of town. I might be able to eavesdrop on their workings there.
I arrived at <<1>>'s house to find her missing, and her father waiting for me. I should talk to him to find out what's going on.
I've rallied several townsfolk to Leja's cause. Now we can confront <<1>> and run her out of town.
I've rallied several townsfolk to Leja's cause. I should talk to <<1>> outside the guardhouse and find out what she plans next.
<<1>> asked me to investigate the old guard house where the mercenaries used to stay. She thinks they were using something to anger the harpies and keep the town under attack.

I found a harpy corpse in the guardhouse, one that looked much larger than any of the others. Perhaps this is what the harpies gathering on the balcony wanted.\n\nLeja asked me to meet her on the balcony after I've searched the guardhouse.
I agreed to meet <<1>> at Daggerfall's Rosy Lion Inn for my initiation into the Undaunted.
Now that I have the Light of Meridia, I should find the exit door and leave this Vile Laboratory.
Now that I have the crystal, I should find the exit door and leave this Vile Laboratory.
The marriage arranger is looking for help. I should go talk to him in the bandits' camp.
<<1>> asked me to direct survivors from the attack on <<2>> to safety.
I need to reach the defenders at the gate to <<1>>.
<<1>> believes the Maormer attack on <<2>> is more than it seems and asked for my aid in stopping their plans. I should decide whether the marine or the wizard should come with to aid me.
I should enter <<1>> and look for signs of what the Maormer plan.
The Maormer attack ravaged <<1>>. I should explore and see if I can find any indication of what they're doing, and why.

The clues I've found lead me to an old smuggler's den in some caves on the northern edge of <<1>>. The entrance to the Wind Tunnels is blocked, but there is a secret entrance somewhere near the cliffs. I should find this secret way in.
I discovered the author of the notes in the Wind Tunnels. I previously met <<1>> at <<Az:2>>. I should find out what he's doing in <<3>>.

<<1>> says he's adapted a Maormer waterstone to drain the energy being collected by their Storm Totems. He hasn't been able to make it work but seems to believe I can. I need to try it on the totems in his cave.
I was able to use the lodestone to drain a <<1>>. I should speak with <<2>> to see if it worked as expected.
I drained the <<1>>. I should talk to <<2>> and find out what he's learned of the Maormer ritual.
In order to stop the Maormer ritual, I must drain the <<1>>s within the Wind Tunnels.
I need to bring the charged lodestone to the Maormer ritual site. I can use it to disrupt the horns used to bind the "<<z:1>>," which <<2>> says will foil the Maormer plans.
I released the <<1>> and stopped the Maormer plan. <<2>> showed up and urged me away from the ritual site. I should follow him back to <<3>>.
It seems the Maormer attack has been thwarted. I should speak with <<1>> and see how he knew to find me.
Captain Jimila is preparing the Prowler to sail after Vicereeve Pelidil.
The Prowler has caught up with the Maormer ship bearing Vicereeve Pelidil, and a battle has begun at sea. I need to go above decks and help in the fight.
A massive sea serpent is attacking the boat! The serpent is too powerful for normal attacksâ€”I must use the ship's ballista to wound it.
A massive sea serpent is attacking the boat! The serpent is too powerful for normal attacksâ€”I must use the ship's ballistae to kill it.
The serpent is dead, but now the Maormer mages have opened portals. They are boarding the ship.
We've repelled the boarders. Now, I should use the Maormer portal to board their ship and kill Vicereeve Pelidil.
Vicereeve Pelidil is dead. I should use the portal on the Maormer ship to return to the Prowler and Captain Jimila. We can then sail back to Seaside Sanctuary.
We've returned to port. I should speak to Captain Jimila.
I have recovered the gemstones proving Zariya's innocence. I should speak with her spirit again.
Forthor removed the axe's curse. I should talk to him one more time.
<<1>> asked me not to kill her father during our honor duel, but merely knock the wind from his sails.
<<1>> was surprisingly sympathetic to the Argonians' situation. I should speak with her further about what she needs done.
<<1>> asked me to discover why the tribe's leaders refuse to speak with her. If they cannot, she might need to recommend the tribe be exiledâ€”something she doesn't want to do.
The tribe's leaders will soon meet to discuss their thoughts on the Dominion barricades. <<1>> invited me to attend.
The tribe's leaders will soon  meet to discuss their thoughts on the Dominion barricades. I should listen to what they have to say.
<<1>>, one of the Argonian leaders, murdered <<2>> and fled the tribal meeting. I should speak with <<3>>, the remaining Argonian leader of <<c:4>>.

<<1>> believes <<2>>'s hunters may try to attack the Dominion soldiers. In order to protect the tribe, I should search the beaches for hunters with the help of <<3>>, a trained guar. <<1>> said I should kill any hunters I find.
I killed <<1>>'s hunters in the beach camps. I should meet with <<2>> at the sea cave near <<c:3>>.
<<1>> is attempting to use <<2>> and her wamasu children to attack the Dominion soldiers. I need to kill <<1>> and <<2>>.
I've defeated <<1>> and stopped her plans. I should return to the village in <<c:2>>.
I've defeated <<1>> and stopped her plans. I should speak with <<2>> in <<c:3>>.
<<1>> has arrived to decide the fate of the Argonian tribe. <<2>> fears she'll exile the tribe if she hears of <<3>>'s violence, and requested I keep it from her. I need to decide what to tell <<1>>.
The magistrate's daughter, <<1>>, said the Gold Coast mercenaries are taking advantage of the town, and possibly making the harpy problem worse. She's asked me to help her.
The leader of the Gold Coast mercenaries, <<1>>, confronted both <<2>> and I about meddling with the mercenary's affairs. I need to continue my conversation with <<2>>.
<<1>> blames me for his daughter's disappearance, since I'd been helping her with the harpies. I should see if I can find out what happened to her.
I've rescued <<1>> from the fake harpy attack orchestrated by the mercenaries. She's asked me to find her father and let him know the full extent of the mercenaries' deeds in Kozanset.
I've rescued <<1>> from the fake harpy attack orchestrated by the mercenaries. She's asked me to find her father and let him know the full extent of the mercenaries' deeds in Kozanset.

<<1>> arrived just after I talked to her father and egged the mercenary leader. Now her plan is to get the townsfolk to stand up against the mercenaries.\n\nI should go around the town and see who's willing to do so.
<<1>>'s alive, but in a surly mood. Now I must head to the camp's entrance to meet with <<2>>. Hopefully, she's freed <<3>> and got him out alive.
I decided to make <<1>> take  the cursed sword. I'll need to talk with <<2>> and explain what happened.
Though the sword may be cursed, I decided to give it to <<1>> to take with him to Cyrodiil.
I found the ancient sword in the ruins on the shore. Angry spirits will attempt to take it from me, and I must defeat them.
I have defeated the vengeful spirits. I should speak to Azei about the sword.
I could speak to Shalidor to get his viewpoint on my choice.
I could speak to Valaste and see what she wants me to do. If she can understand me.
Hopefully, members of the Saltwalker Militia know something about these bandits, or at least why they didn't come forward during the beating. I should head to the militia's camp to find out.
I've chosen to allow Sheogorath to take Valaste with him to the Shivering Isles. I should speak to him again to receive my reward.
After defeating Haskill Shalidor burst his way into the Guildhall. I should watch the confrontation between the Arch-Mage and Sheogorath.
From what I can tell, <<1>> is the real authority here. Maybe he can help me understand what's going on.
I must learn what drove <<1>> to a life of crime.
I've learned all I can about what happened to <<1>>. I should return to <<2>>.
Thonoras begged me to track Pariel into a set of caves beneath the Falinesti Spring Site. He said she knows his scent, and thus only one she does not know can get close to her.
Pariel has taken on the form of a massive bear! I must subdue her without killing her. Thonoras asked me to leave that task to him.
After I subdued Pariel, she fled deeper into the cave, wounded. I must track her down.
Thonoras has caught up with us, but Pariel is still a bear. I should see what he wants to do about this.

Thonoras deceived me. He never planned to kill his wife. Instead, he plans to give himself to the Wild Hunt and join her as a beast.\n\nI can leave him to this ritual, or convince him to kill his wife and follow the Green Pact.
Thonoras has decided to join his wife as a wild beast. I should leave him to complete his prayer to Hircine.
Thonoras has kept to the Green Pact and killed the monster that was once his wife. I should leave him to his grief.
Thonoras left his pack behind for me in exchange for my help. I must search it to claim my reward.
Thonoras left his pack behind for me in exchange for my help. I must search it to claim my reward.
Pariel fled into a cave beneath the Falinesti Spring Site. I must start my search for her there.

<<1>> claims the Worm Cultists are using his bones to assemble a skeletal army. I should help look for his bones. Some of his bones may be in the Worm Cult camps, while others might be incorporated in the risen dead.
I recovered <<1>>'s bones. I should be able to reassemble him in <<Ac:2>>.
<<1>> says we'll find clues about the Worm Cult's plans in the largest dig site.
<<1>>, a much larger talking skull, informed us that the Worm Cult was asking questions about "the roots." I should see if <<2>> knows what they're after.
<<1>> thinks the Worm Cult plans to kill the great tree at the center of <<Ac:2>> in order to raise an army of giant skeletons. He wants to enlist <<3>>'s aid.
<<1>> seemed upset that I pieced <<2>> back together, but understands the Worm Cult threat to the Barrowbough. She gave me <<3>> so I could enter the great tree.
The Worm Cult is already inside the Barrowbough! With luck, they haven't made it too far inside.
Sounding the horn opened the heart of the Barrowbough. I should enter before the Worm Cult can follow.
It is time to meet whatever lies beneath <<1>>.
With <<1>> defeated, the Worm Cult attack was repelled. I should speak with <<2>> to see what's next for the peculiar residents of the Barrowbough.
With <<1>> defeated, the Worm Cult attack was repelled. I should speak with <<2>> before he heads off to his exile.
<<1>> and the other old bones awoke. However, they're very angry with <<2>>. He wants me to speak with <<1>> so they understand the Worm Cult threat.
With <<1>> defeated, the Worm Cult attack was repelled. I should speak with <<2>> to see what's next for the peculiar residents of the Barrowbough.
A strong set of vines leads from the upper reaches of the cave to its lower chamber. It looks like it will hold my weight if I choose to climb it.
The Wilderking says that he will soon die and that Aranias must accept the responsibility to take his place. I should speak to her.
The Wilderking is dying and Aranias has accepted that she must take his place. She's asked me to place the Wilderking's crown at the top of the tower to allow for her transformation.
I should continue my conversation with <<1>>.
Lady Moyaltha told me that the Imperials are coming through an old smuggling tunnel beneath Magnifico Khorshad's manor. I found the manor. Now I should confront Magnifico Khorshad.

With Lyranth now in charge of the Citadel, we have safe passage to the Labyrinth and the Endless Stair beyond. And I have the key that gets us inside. I should speak to Vanus Galerion and see how he and King Dynar want to proceed.

While the Fighters Guild troops use the secret passageways to enter the Fighters Guild hall, I need to find the ward key and deactivate the wards that seal the hall. But first, I'll need to find my own way into the city.
Ranneth also recommended that Pircalmo's wife Alanya might have some details on what I should look for.
Now that the wards are down and the fighters are here, I should talk to <<1>> and find out what I need to do next.
I recovered the Fighters Guild Ward Key. Now I should use it to deactivate the wards and open the guild hall door.
While the Fighters Guild battles the Dremora, I need to go to the upper city and locate the Mages Guild portal stones.
Raz probably knows more about the situation here. I should speak to him.
In order to activate the portal in the Mages Guild Hall, I need to collect the scattered portal stones.
Now that I collected the portal stones, I should enter the Mages Guild Hall.
Once I set the portal stones back in place, the mages should be able to activate the guild hall portal.
<<1>>, the first Mane, has appeared to us. I should speak to him.
<<1>> said he would grant me a blessing which will let me pass through the barriers unharmed.
Now that the Mages Guild Hall portal has been activated and the mages have teleported through, I should talk to <<1>>.
Once I found the sword, <<1>>'s spirit appeared. I should talk with him and learn why he's revealed the sword to me.
I decided to back Rollin in his goal to become an apprentice. I should speak to him once more.
I need find the entrance to the pyramid so I can confront the leader of the citadel and obtain the key to the Labyrinth.
I reached the entrance to the pyramid, but others have arrived before me, including the Dremora, Lyranth. I should talk to her.
Now that Lyranth opened the door, I should enter Valkynaz Seris' stronghold and confront the commander of the Citadel.
I entered the pyramid stronghold of Valkynaz Seris. Now I need to find the Valkynaz and end this.
I need to speak to Queen Ayrenn and let her know what happened.
I should tell <<1>> of her husband's fate.\n\nI told her to escape the crypts. I should leave the crypts to find her.
I should tell <<1>> of her husband's fate.\n\nI told her to escape the crypts. I should leave the crypts to find her.
I found items belonging to Severus Tappo's victims. I should try to find their relatives.
I returned items to family members of Tappo's victims. Several mentioned they paid a hunter named Thaellin. \n\nI should try to find her on the northeastern shore of Lake Rumare.
I should return the victims' belongings to their relatives.
I must speak with Gilraen again.
I've found the font of darkness allowed the Dro-m'Athra into the fort. Time to seal it up.
The fastest way to the sanctuary is through Serpent's Grotto. That's where I need to go.
I've reached Serpent's Grotto. The path to the sanctuary can't be far. I should head there as soon as I can.
Vanus Galerion has been restored and made whole. He wants me to follow him into the Great Shackle.
I reassembled <<1>>. I should see if he knows anything about the Worm Cult's plans for <<Ac:2>>.
I completed the task that An-Jeen Sakka put before me. Now I should leave the pyramid and return to him.
<<1>> has arrived with reinforcements. I should speak to her.
With the ritual disrupted, Khali seems confident she can destroy the focusing crystal. I should wait to see what happens.
I need to help Stibbons make it through this secret tunnel so we can escape from the Manor of Revelry.
I should wait for Queen Ayrenn to finish speaking to Indaenir.
Cariel told me that Gavo would be coming from the direction of the district's gate. I can watch out the tower to see him coming.
The Hollow City is the perfect staging point for our assault. As I rescue the missing Fighters Guild and Mages Guild members, I should send them here.
Talia says that she and Prince Azah were attacked by Shiri, the final leader of the Withered Hand. Talia will join me to help find and rescue the prince.
Talia says that she and Prince Azah were attacked by Shiri, the final leader of the Withered Hand. Talia has joined me to help find and rescue the prince.
I need to find Prince Azah and rescue him from the Withered Hand.
Prince Azah says Shiri took Ansei Maja's Ward into the next room and performed some kind of ritual. I need to enter the room and recover the Ward.
I rescued Prince Azah and recovered Ansei Maja's Ward. Now I need to find Throne Keeper Farvad and Ansei Radan's Ward.
I rescued Prince Azah and recovered Ansei Maja's Ward. Now I need to find Throne Keeper Farvad and Ansei Radan's Ward.
Throne Keeper Farvad says that Ansei Radan's Ward has been corrupted. I must protect him while he performs a cleansing ritual.
We rescued Prince Azah and Throne Keeper Farvard and recovered two of the Ansei Wards. Now we must stop Shiri. Farvad told me to meet him at the central tomb of the necropolis.
We rescued Prince Azah and Throne Keeper Farvard and recovered two of the Ansei Wards. Now we must stop Shiri. I should speak to Farvad at the central tomb of the necropolis.
I must enter the central tomb to stop Shiri and recover the final Ansei Ward.
I must stop Shiri and recover the final Ansei Ward.
Now that I recovered the final Ansei Ward, I need to leave the tomb and return to Sentinel where the Ansei Wards can be restored to safekeeping.
Ansei Halelah has opened a portal to take us back to Sentinel. I need to speak with her before entering the portal.
I stopped Ranneth from killing Alanya. She informed me that Pircalmo is being held in her home.
I freed Pircalmo from Ranneth's locked home and should return outside to check on Alanya.
I stumbled across a discussion between Pircalmo, Ranneth, and Alanya, and should see what they have to say before speaking to Ranneth.
To help the Bosmer, I should clear the northern and southern fronts of their battle against the Daedra.
I need to find the home of Shiri's cousin, Nahirah, in Satakalaam.
It seems Shiri's cousin, Nahirah, has been killed. I should read her journal to see if there's any mention of Shiri.
Khali suggested we head back and speak to Shazah.
We've capped off the source of the Dro-m'Athra. I need to talk to Shazah.
We capped off the source of the Dro-m'Athra. I need to talk to Khali.
I've been directed to speak to Tholbor. He'll help me begin my Summoner Division trials.
I've been directed to speak to Zara. She'll help me begin my Swordmaster Division trials.
I've been directed to speak to Malarel. She'll help me begin my Sorcerer Division trials.
<<1>> told me she doesn't want to be married and to talk to her father if I want to help <<2>>.
The stronghold is clear, and Valkynaz Seris is dead. I should find the key to the Labyrinth. We'll need that key to enter Molag Bal's inner sanctum. Perhaps the key is in the Valkynaz's chest.
<<1>> is at her father's tent, and doesn't appear ready to attack me like the rest of the bandits. Maybe she knows what's going on.
<<1>> wants me to distract the camp and her father while she steals the keys and frees <<2>>. Her father is at the top of Sep's Spine, through the upper tunnel.
I have defeated the Daedra at both the northern and southern fronts of the battle. I should return to the central barricade and speak to Gilraen.
I've defeated the Daedra attacking the central barricade. I should speak to Gilraen.
Gilraen has tasked me with confronting and defeating the leader of the Dagon Cell that has attacked her home.
I've defeated the wispmother. I should let Elaldor know.
I should speak with Merric about what happened in the Halls of Submission.
If I'm going to question <<1>>, I need to find a way to wake him up.
<<1>> won't speak with me unless I prove I'm a warrior. She wants me to duel one of her hunters.
I have returned to the Fighters Guild in my alliance's capital. I should seek out Vanus Galerion and speak to him there.
I arrived in Coldharbour, but I seem to be on my own. Well, except for that strange man over there. I need to speak to Cadwell.
Vanus Galerion has arrived at the Mages Guild. I should speak with him.
<<1>> is out of his cocoon captivity only to find out that <<2>> passed by him some time ago. We should go deeper into the mines to look for her.
I heard a muffled yell. I should find the source and see if it's from one of the prospectors I was sent to find.
The Daedra promised to keep the pair safe together in her nest. Though this means the two won't have their freedom, they will be together.\n\nIt's time for me to leave the mine.
The Daedra admitted holding <<1>> hostage, and has demanded one of us feed her spiders before she allows us to enter her nest.
The Daedra has granted us entry into her lair. I should find out what's become of <<1>>.
The Daedra granted us entry into her lair. I should enter and find out what's become of <<1>>.
At the bottom of the mines, I found the creature most likely responsible for <<1>>'s capture - a spider daedra! It doesn't seem hostile - I should see if I can talk to it.
<<1>> exchanged himself for <<2>>'s freedom. Now we're outside the mine, I need to see how she feels about what's happened.
<<1>> asked me to look for the last two prospectors who entered the mines.
It seems the Daedra has ensorcelled <<1>>. I'll need to find a way to get her out of the Daedra's clutches using my wits.
The Daedra promised to keep the pair safe together in her nest. Though this means the two won't have their freedom, they will be together. I should tell <<1>> their fate.
<<1>> exchanged himself for <<2>> to have her freedom. Though it means he will be under the thrall of the Daedra, <<2>> is free.
Elaldor wants me to defeat the wispmother that killed his hunting band and haunts the marshes nearby.
Throne Keeper Farvad believes Shiri is trying to raise her father, Suturah, from the dead. I must choose who will accompany me into the final tomb to fight Shiri.
As soon as my friends unseal the door to the final tomb, we can enter the tomb and stop Shiri from raising her father.
Aldolin is dead. I should return to Sorderion and claim the bounty.
After stepping through this tiresome performance, Sheogorath has given me the go-ahead to collect the book. I should grab it and get out of here.
I collected the key that opens the way to the Labyrinth. Now I should exit the pyramid and find Vanus Galerion.
I should talk to the Lunar Champion in Dune.
Stibbons went into the manor house. I need to go in there and rescue him.
I defeated the senche, and Hircine appeared and congratulated me on a successful hunt. I should return to Haras with the pelt.
I can obtain a racing lizard from <<1>> near the race track outside Bergama.
In order to enter the lizard races, I need to get a lizard from <<1>>, <<2>> in Sentinel, or <<3>> in Bergama.
I should ask  <<1>> about my racing lizard, who lost at the race track outside Bergama.
I turned over <<1>> to <<2>> with proof of his scheme. I should see if there is a reward for bringing him in.
I must find the corpse of a Hound hunter in an alcove to the west of Hectahame to begin tracking the pale senche.
I must follow the pale senche's trail in the wilderness between Hectahame, Dread Vullain, and Moonhenge. I can see the signs of its passing by crouching low to the ground and looking around.
I found the pale senche at a cliff south of Moonhenge.  I must kill it and collect its hide to bring back to Haras.
I should travel there as soon as I can.
Erinel insisted on staying with the Falinesti Faithful, rather than returning to her betrothed. I should return to Laurosse and let him know.
I should play the flute Laurosse gave me and listen for its twin, so that I can locate Erinel.
The flute Laurosse gave me will reveal its twin, and that's where I'll find Erinel, his betrothed.
I freed Erinel and convinced her to return to Laurosse. I should tell him the good news.
I found Erinel, bound as a captive. I should talk to her and see if I can free her.
Egannor said his friends Halalin, Fanrel, and Nielas are still in the Wood Orc camp. I must find and free them, if they are still alive.
I freed all the Faithful who survived. Fanrel asked me to meet her at the entrance to the Orc fort.

Fanrel wants vengeance on the orcs who captured, tortured, and killed her friends. The first step is to kill Chief Gorzesh's family. She insists he must share her pain. I can either help her exact vengeance or return to Egannor and leave.
Fanrel is consumed by vengeance. I've decided not to help her kill Warchief Gorzesh's family. I should return to Egannor and make sure the others made it out.
Fanrel wants to make sure Chief Gorzesh experiences the pain she felt watching her friends tortured and murdered. She has tasked me with killing Gorzesh's son, Roog, and his Hearth-Wife, Grashla.
I killed Roog and Grashla and collected their heads. I must meet Fanrel back at the entrance to the Orc fort.

Fanrel plans to lure Chief Gorzesh to an ancient Bosmer site by tricking him into thinking he can save his family. I must go there and mount the heads of Gorzesh's dead family on stakes in preparation for his arrival.
I must mount the heads of Chief Gorzesh's dead family members on pikes at the ritual site. Fanrel told me this blood sacrifice will summon "the ancient strength of Y'ffre."
When Warchief Gorzesh arrives, I must kill him.
Chief Gorzesh and his family are dead. Fanrel has her revenge.
I should speak to Bodring at Driladan Pass.
I should speak to Nara at Dread Vullain.
I should speak to Girin at Verrant Morass.
<<1>> told me one of her sailors escaped from Sea Vipers performing some form of ritual magic. She suspects they were the ones who murdered <<2>>. I should speak with <<3>>, the sailor.
<<1>> told me one of her sailors escaped from Sea Vipers performing some form of ritual magic. She suspects they were the ones who murdered <<2>>. I should speak with <<3>>, the sailor.
With Molag Grunda defeated and the Chasm under our control, I should find my way out of this place and meet up with the others.
I've made it out of the Greenhill Catacombs with Ezreba in tow. I should find Bowenas and explain what happened.
Erinel's bound like a captive, but claims she's merely being tested for a Wood Elf rite. She can either remain where she is, or return to her betrothed, Laurosse.
Now that the mages have been released from their cells, I should talk to <<1>>.
One of the captured mages said that the key to the cages is on the table. I should find the key.
I should head to where <<1>> believes <<2>> is being held.
Hald and Hilka are free. I should head to the rally point.
Hilka and Fjar are free. I should head to the rally point.
Hald and Fjar are free. I should head to the rally point.
<<1>> is inside an abandoned building. I need to untie her and get her out of here.
I should practice with each type of siege weapon while I'm here.
I've defeated several ghostly attackers, and must now take the blade to <<1>>.
The rescue was a trap! I need to fight my way out of here.
It looks like there was no kidnapped daughter after all, and that <<1>> set me up. I should look for evidence to prove his involvement with the bandits.
I found proof <<1>> sent many travelers such as myself into bandit ambushes. I should confront him immediately.
I confronted <<1>> about working with the bandits. He offered me money to let him go. I should decide whether to take him up on his offer or bring him to the local guard captain for justice.
I must find Aldolin and defeat him in order to claim the bounty.
I've collected the coin from Manthir. I should take it to Cold-Eyes.
I managed to retrieve the bundle of silks Kunira wants. I should deliver them to her and collect my pay.
I managed to get Nivrilin's companions free of the camp. I should meet her in Longhaven.
Manthir claims his neighbor Farwen stole the coin he'd planned to use to pay back the Khajiit. I should talk to her and see if I can get it back.
The Bosmer who owes the debt, Manthir, lives near the market square in Woodhearth. I should go and talk to him to see if he'll pay the debt.
Sumiril asked me to read the book and tell him his story.
The words of the book flew up, off the page. To continue reading, I must catch them.
I should read the next passage of the book.
To continue reading, I should follow the words.
I should read the next passage of the book.
To continue reading, I should follow the words.
I should read the next passage of the book.
To continue reading, I should follow the words.
I should read the next passage of the book.
I should follow the words.
I should read the next passage of the book.
I should speak to Sumiril.
I should speak to Sumiril.
I should speak to Sumiril.
I should ask around Marbruk and deduce the identity of the Artisan.
I returned to Cinnar with the stolen items. I should tell him what happened.
I've found <<1>>, but she doesn't seem to be aware of my presence. I should see if she will respond to me.
Nivrilin, too injured to go after her companions, asked me to rescue them. The three I'm looking for are Nineclaws, Draulduin, and Zavierry. They're all being held in the Argonian camp.
Now that I destroyed the Necromantic Focuses, I must enter the lighthouse and disrupt Alasan's ritual to prevent him from using the Ansei Ward to become a lich.
Paints-the-Sky wishes to speak with me about something. I should see what she wants.
I should leave the tavern.
I need to kill Sahdina, Maleel's general, to gather her essence.
I need to kill Rashtoma, Maleel's general, to gather her essence.
I destroyed Sahdina. Now to gather her essence.
I destroyed Rashomta. Now to gather her essence.
I need to enter the Overseer's atelier and find the crystal that was used to power the Dwarven device.
I need to place the crystal into the Dwarven device to provide the power necessary to separate the mages' souls.
I should start by reading Cinnar's notes.
I need to wait for Vanus Galerion to open the portal to Stirk.
I need to enter Vanus Galerion's portal to travel to Stirk.
I arrived on the island of Stirk. Now I need to talk to Vanus Galerion.
I need to use Murk-Watcher's charm to lure out Ripplestrike. Then I should kill it and take its heart.
Rollin wants me to find those relics for him. He said my first step should be to talk to the man that served him drinks last night, the bartender at the Waxing Crescent Inn. I should head inside.
The bartender, Duzal-ja, told me that Rollin was speaking with a mage last night. I should look for this Darius at the Rawl'kha guild hall.
I found the hall. Now to speak to this Darius about one of Rollin's relics.
The mage, Darius, wants me to collect up the wisps he accidentally released from Rollin's urn. He said I should just need to get near the wisps and point his crystal.
I did as the mage asked and captured a number of wisps. I should speak to him again at the guild hall.
Darius said I can take the urn and gave me a clue as to who to speak to next. I should grab it and move on.
Darius said a Khajiiti girl named Khuzi took the final relic from Rollin. I should look for her in the Rawl'kha marketplace.
I found Khuzi right where Darius said I would. Time to question her about the necklace Rollin gave her.
The Khajiit named Khuzi told me she sold Rollin's necklace to a merchant. Atrius the merchant is heading for Hadran's Caravan. Perhaps if I hurry I can catch up to him.

Atrius the merchant was attacked by a pack of werewolves on the road. He was very angry, but said they likely made for the Weeping Wind cave. It's east of Willowgrove, southeast of where I found Atrius.
I made it inside the Weeping Wind cave. I need to find the last relic for Rollin, the claw necklace â€¦ apparently a legitimate relic of Hircine worship.
Ansei Radan told me to take back the Ansei Ward and use it to trap Alasan's spirit. I need to pick up the sword from the altar.
I need to use the Ansei Ward on Alasan to trap his spirit.
On the way out of the mine, Haidar's spirit attacked me. I should defeat the wrathful spirit so that it does not come after Samsi or myself.
I made it inside the Waxing Crescent Inn. Duzal-ja is behind the counter and should be able to help me discover where those relics went. I should speak to him.

Duzal-ja, the bartender at the Waxing Crescent, won't tell me what I want to know unless I run an errand for him. He's asked me to retrieve from pies from Shasirba, a merchant near the edge of Rawl'kha.
I have the meat pies. I should return to Duzal-ja.
I have Haidar's supply pack. I should exit the mine before it becomes too unstable.
By the Bosmer tradition of the Right of Theft, Manthir can get his coin back if he gives in to Farwen's demand for a boon. I'll go with Farwen and have her make her demand of Manthir.
Now that Manthir has agreed to marry Farwen, he'll have his coin back and can pay his debt. I should talk to him and collect it.
Orthoron said he'd speak with me again at Arenthia. I should find him there.
The moon priestess Saifa is being very coy. I should speak to her again to see what she wants me to do.
The Lunar Champions were awaiting my arrival at Moonmont. I should talk to Khali about my encounter with the lunar priest.
<<1>> wants me to sacrifice myself to power her spell to reach Tamriel. She wants me to leap off the overlook.

I have all three relics Rollin was looking for. I could return them to him, or go looking for this "Meldil" that he was so afraid of. I'm sure Telenger's assistant would be interested in why I have these relics.
I decided to tell Meldil the truth about what Rollin did. I should speak to the apprentice once more.
I've been asked to investigate some of the strange occurrences on <<1>>.

Kunira-daro wants the items she was supposed to receive, even if it means she has to take them. She offered me payment if I'll sneak on board the Sea Hawk vessel and steal the silks that belong to her.
Gabrielle opened the exit. I need to follow her into the next area.
Talia is at the entrance to the Motalion Necropolis. I should speak with her.
Molag Bal has thrown yet another guardian in my path. I need to defeat this creature to reach the portal to the planar vortex.
General Thoda says I should find the necropolis and assist Prince Azah.
The Daedra promised to keep the pair safe together in her nest. Though this means the two won't have their freedom, they will be together.
Though <<1>> will be under the thrall of the Daedra, <<2>> is free. I should speak to her outside the mine.
I should head for the portal now.

The woman in question is the magistrate's daughter, <<1>>. She said the Gold Coast mercenaries are taking advantage of the town, and possibly making the harpy problem worse. She's asked me to help her.
In order to stop the Planemeld and save Nirn, I need to enter the portal that leads to the planar vortex.
I've entered the planar vortex, the one remaining link in Molag Bal's insidious Planemeld. I need to destroy the Dark Anchors before we can disrupt the vortex.
Well, that makes a certain amount of sense. The Groundskeeper is Meridia! She wants to talk to me before we proceed.
As long as the Dark Anchors bind the two realms together, we won't be able to disrupt the planar vortex. I need to destroy the remaining Anchors.
The Dark Anchors have been destroyed and the vortex has become unstable. I need to find the focal point and place the Light of Meridia.
Molag Bal's most powerful minions stand before me. I need to defeat them before I can unleash the cleansing power of the Light of Meridia.
And now Molag Bal himself has confronted us. Meridia's shield provides some protection, but we need to give Vanus and Gabrielle the time they need to ready the Light of Meridia.
It appears that we succeeded. The Planemeld has been defeated, and it looks like I'm still alive. I should speak to Meridia and ask her what happened.
Now that I have the Light of Meridia, I should use the portal and get out of here.
My allies have entered the planar vortex. Meridia has given me time to speak to them before I let her know I'm ready to continue.
Darius requested that Zariya's remains be consecrated with funerary oils, which marks the restoration of her honor in the eyes of the gods.
I consecrated Zariya's remains, and now I must return her ring to Darius.
I need to lead Vanus Galerion to the summit point, where the meeting of the alliance leaders will take place.
The alliance leaders are arriving. I should listen to what they have to say.
I need to convince the three alliance leaders to agree to allow the Fighters Guild and the Mages Guild to bear the brunt of the assault on Coldharbour. I should talk to each of them in turn.
I spoke to the alliance leaders. They seem willing to allow they Guilds to take the fight to Molag Bal, but still they hesitate. I should let Vanus Galerion know where things stand.

Molag Bal has opened unstable rifts to the island and sent creatures to assassinate the three alliance leaders. I need to defeat Molag Bal's minions, protect the leaders, and close the unstable rifts.
I closed the unstable rifts and saved the three alliance leaders. Now I should talk to Vanus Galerion.

The alliance leaders have given the Guilds their blessings. It's time to finally take the battle to Molag Bal! I need to follow Vanus Galerion into the portal valley so we can make the final preparations.

With the permission of the kings and queen of the three alliances, the Mages Guild and the Fighters Guild have gathered in the portal valley to open a path to Coldharbour. I should talk to Vanus and make sure we're ready to go.
The invasion of Coldharbour has begun! I need to enter the portal to reach Molag Bal's realm.
Search nearby hag dens.
I've decided to tell Kala the truth, and she took it very well. I should speak to her again.
I've decided to lie to Kala to spare her feelings, but she doesn't seem to be taking it well. I should speak to her again.

I must follow the wasp's trail in the wilderness northwest of Greenheart to find it.  Radreth told me I can see the signs of its passing by crouching down and looking carefully.

I need to light the braziers at three shrines in the village of Brackenleaf. The shrines are the Snake, Tiger, and Wolf.

I spoke with Brackenleaf and he agreed to let me take his trials. If I pass his trials, then I will be accepted as a Briar. But first, I must choose which spirit of the hunt best represents me.

After killing my prey I spoke to the spriggan that appeared before me. She stated that Brackenleaf was pleased but now I need to confront my predator. I need to light the Snake brazier at the edge of the forest to draw out my predator.

After killing my prey I spoke to the spriggan that appeared before me. She stated that Brackenleaf was pleased but now I need to confront my predator. I need to light the Wolf brazier at the edge of the forest to draw out my predator.

After killing my prey I spoke to the spriggan that appeared before me. She stated that Brackenleaf was pleased but now I need to confront my predator. I need to light the Tiger brazier at the edge of the forest to draw out my predator.

The only "treasure" in <<Ac:1>> is a stockpile of Imperial war supplies. I found little sign of the Albatross crew in <<Ac:2>>. <<3>> must have moved them elsewhere.\n\n<<4>> seems incredibly agitated. I should see what's wrong with him.
I should find Giran in the fishing village outside Northpoint and return his wife's journal to him.

I decided not to tell Giran what really happened to his wife. Thinking she's dead at least spares his feelings.

I need to wait for Vanus Galerion to open the portal to Coldharbour.
The abbey is burning and Sai Sahan has run ahead to search for Kasura. I should follow and help find Kasura.
Stibbons seems to have become very friendly with the sisters of the manor. I should talk to <<1>> and find out more about these pools.
I used the cleansing reagents and everything has changed. I should talk to <<1>> and find out what happened.
