<<1>> spotted a barrel of <<2>> nearby. I should get some vials so I can distract the mutineers with fire.
I need to gather <<z:1>> to help the Shornhelm Guard troops taking refuge in the old tower. The supplies should be in the carts abandoned along the roads around Hinault Farm.
I gathered the healing supplies. Now I should take them to <<1>> over by the old tower.
We rescued Prince Azah and Throne Keeper Farvard and recovered two of the Ansei Wards. Now we must stop Shiri. I should follow Farvad out of the ward chamber.

<<1>> confided her pregnancy to me. She recently found out, and has yet to tell her husband. She asked me to convince <<2>> to return to the Wilderking's realm with the rest of the village.\n\n <<2>> remains at <<A:3>> to begin his duty as caretaker.
Lieutenant Fairfax has given me permission to enter the tower. Now I should enter the tower and  give the healing supplies to Heloise.
Now that I have a trained lizard, I should bring it near workers about the camps and see if the lizard reacts. Once he does, I may need to subdue the culprit in order to get them to talk.
<<1>>, Jahi and Almur's father, was the one who contaminated the johads. With his death, it now falls to one of the them to determine the fate of the family business.

The desert beetles have never been as aggressive as they are now. Unless the rain catchers are reclaimed, Sentinel may experience a critical shortage of water. \n\nJahi's asked me to investigate the johads for anything suspicious.
Almur believes that the bottle I found is what's contaminated the johads. He's asked me to taste the waters and see if there's anything detectable within.
The johads all show signs of contamination. I should bring the bottle I found to Jahi and let her know what I've found.
I should search the worker camps for signs of foul play.
Jahi said the bottle may belong to Almur's wife, who is tending their father in the house near the johads. I should bring the bottle to her and see what she has to say.
Unless the rain catchers are reclaimed, Sentinel may experience a critical shortage of water. I should locate the person in charge - a woman named Jahi. She can tell me what is going on.

Ohama insists she had nothing to do with the johad's contamination. She believes one of the workers must have stolen the bottle from her.\n\n<<1>> sells trained lizards. Ohama believes I could use one to find the culprit.
Jahi and Almur's father's gone missing from the house where Ohama was tending him. I should tell Almur what I've discovered.
Whoever took Almur's father must be responsible for the johad's contamination. I can use the lizard I bought previously to follow the culprit's trail and stop them for good.
I've convinced the pair that Almur should take responsibility for the johads after his father's death. I should find out what he has planned for the family business.
I've convinced the pair that Jahi should take responsibility for the johads after her father's death. I should find out what she has planned for the family business.

I located the boat in which Montclair's soldiers loaded the Tear of Anurraame. Now I just need to find the relic itself.
I should go to the Mages Guild in Shornhelm and bring the Tear of Anurraame to Magister Wulfdis.
I arrived at the Mages Guild in Shornhelm. I should find Magister Wulfdis and give him the Tear of Anurraame.
With <<1>> dead, the remaining Wood Orcs will need to regroup. I need to get back to Shrouded Hollow to tell <<2>> and the others.
The cultists are all dead and the portals closed. I should talk to Kasura.
I should look for the first of the Keepers Cirion spoke of.
I should look for Keeper Areldur.
A Daedric Titan attacked the Abbey of Blades and killed many of Kasura's students. I must destroy the Titan.
Under the protection of Kasura, the Ring of Stendarr's Mercy has remained hidden in the nearby crypt. I should find the hidden entrance to the Ancestral Crypt atop the nearby steps.
The Ring of Stendarr's Mercy should be in a chest at the far end of the Ancestral Crypt. I should find the chest and take the ring.
I have the Ring of Stendarr's Mercy. I should talk to Sai Sahan.

I discovered the journal of one of Baron Montclair's lieutenants. It seems Montclair's soldiers already found the Tear of Anurraame and are loading it into a boat they plan to sail to Wayrest. I need to find that boat.

According to <<1>>, all the workers involved were paid off anonymously to contaminate the johads. The orders were dropped off in the house. I should search for any evidence of the identity of the culprit.
I have the skull of the wise scholar, the devoted mayor's Badge of Office, and the staff of the brave mage. Now I should go to the ruined chapel and enter the crypts.
I need to place the focus items on the altar to draw out the abomination Reezal-Jul created. Then I can destroy the creature and set the spirits of Crestshade free.

I should make my way to the town of Crestshade and see what's going on there.

Mayor Gette asked me to talk to two other spirits: Mage Tharlas and Scholar Jonne. If I find items of personal significance to these three spirits, they can use them to focus their energy and lure out the abomination that wears their flesh.

The <<1>> wants to escape the reach of <<2>>. Whether or not I believe him, an ancient necromancer waking in the middle of <<3>> is a serious problem. I should enter <<Az:4>> and see what I can do to prevent <<2>> from waking.
I entered <<Az:1>>. I should speak with the <<2>> about how to prevent <<3>> from waking.

<<1>> is kept asleep by a ward upon his <<z:2>>, but the ward is failing. To reinforce it I will need four relics scattered throughout <<Ac:3>>. The Pale Sentinel will help me by distracting undead servants I mark with <<Az:4>>.
I've recovered what I'll need to reinforce the ward on <<1>>'s <<z:2>>. I need to decipher the method using Vastarie's journal.
Despite reinforcing the ward, <<1>> forced his spirit through and captured <<Ac:2>>! He demanded I speak with him.

<<1>> doesn't seem interested in disturbing the living, but he claimed to be performing a delicate ritual. Then he took <<Ac:2>> away in arcane shackles. I should find out exactly what he's planning to do.
<<1>> was angry with me for pursuing him. He ordered his son <<2>> to stop me. I should defeat this abomination if I hope to pursue <<1>> further into the ruin.
I defeated <<1>>'s "son," <<2>>. I should pursue <<1>> into <<Az:3>>.
I don't know what <<1>> plans, but the <<2>> seems to be in agony. If I hope to stop this, I should speak with <<1>>.
It seems <<Ac:1>> is the spirit of <<2>>'s dead son, <<3>>. The necromancer wants me to permanently bind the spirit to its flesh husk. If I do so, he pledges to forever remain within his home.
I reunited <<1>>'s spirit with his body. I should speak with <<2>> about putting his shades to rest.
I turned <<Az:1>> against <<2>>, forcing his spirit to slumber inside his body. I should speak with <<3>>.
<<1>> will allow <<2>> to stand with the old bones as they defend the Barrowbough.
<<1>> will allow <<2>> to stand with the old bones as they defend the Barrowbough, but afterward he must return to his exile in the world above.
<<1>> has returned to his bones beneath the Barrowbough. I should join <<2>> and the other old bones as they defend against the Worm Cult invaders.
To start the diplomatic process, Vanus Galerion will teleport us to talk to one of the alliance leaders. I should enter the portal.
I followed Vanus Galerion to another alliance's capital. I should wait for him to introduce me to this alliance's leader.
Vanus Galerion has introduced me to an opposing alliance leader. I can speak with the leader now.
Vanus has prepared a portal for us to travel to the second alliance leader. I should follow him into the portal.
I followed Vanus Galerion to another alliance's capital. I should wait for him to introduce me to this alliance's leader.
Vanus Galerion has introduced me to another opposing alliance leader. I can speak with the leader now.
Vanus has prepared a portal for us to return home. I should follow him into the portal.
Varen Aquilarios has beckoned me to the Harborage. I should go there and speak with him.
I made it to the Harborage. I should speak with Varen Aquilarios.
Varen is ready to open the portal to the Halls of Torment. But before I go, I should choose which companion will accompany me on the journey.
Varen opened the portal to the Halls of Torment. I should venture in and save Sai Sahan.
I should search the cave for any signs of what happened to the sapling.
I should speak with <<1>> to learn about missions.
I should speak with <<1>> to hear of his missions.
I entered the Halls of Torment with my companion. I should explore this place and see where Sai is being held.
I found a shade of Abnur Tharn mocking Sai Sahan. I should defeat this shade and get to Sai.
I defeated the shade of Abnur Tharn, but Sai was swallowed into a dark void. I should talk to my companion to determine what our next move should be.
I should continue to explore the Halls of Torment in search of Sai Sahan.
This diplomatic mission is complete. I should speak with Vanus Galerion and find out what he suggests I do next.
All three alliance leaders have agreed to meet on Stirk. I should speak to Vanus Galerion.
<<1>> told me to talk to <<2>> to learn about missions vital to the Covenant.
I should speak with <<1>> to learn about his missions.
The mage Merethrin's Research Notes appear to be sitting on a table in the Mages Guild. I should read the notes to find out what happened.

Merethrin's research notes reveal that the curse apparently happened because of his attempt to cast an enchantment in the cave to extend his life. I should retrieve Elemental Dust from Merethrin's House to reverse the curse.
I found a tree spirit bound within the cave. I should speak to the spirit and find out what it knows.

Merethrin's research notes reveal that the curse apparently happened because of his attempt to cast an enchantment in the cave to extend his life. I should retrieve Elemental Dust from Merethrin's House to reverse the curse.

The Tree Spirit told me that it was cursed by some foul magic cast by the mage Merethrin who apparently is the being trapped within the sapling. The spirit said there might be clues to what Merethrin did in the Mages Guild in Shornhelm.
I should take the Elemental Dust back to the cave and use to reverse the curse that bound the tree spirit and trapped Merethrin within the sapling.
I found a shade of Lyris Titanborn trying to seduce Sai Sahan. She created a defensive shield around Sai. I should find a way to remove that barrier.
I removed the shield around the shade of Lyris. Now I need to defeat her before I can get to Sai.
I defeated the shade of Lyris, but once again Sai was swallowed into a dark void. I should talk to my companion to assess the situation.
I should continue to explore the Halls of Torment in search of Sai Sahan.
I defeated the atronachs torturing Sai, but the Duchess of Anguishâ€”Sai's primary tormentorâ€”appeared. I should defeat her and end Sai's torment.
I freed Sai Sahan. Now I should talk to him to ensure his safety.
After speaking with Sai, the Prophet appeared and opened a portal to the Harborage. I should return to the Harborage and check in with the Prophet.
I returned to the Harborage with Sai Sahan. I should speak to Varen Aquilarios to see I need to do next.
A projection of Varen Aquilarios appeared to me when I arrived in town. I should listen to him and hear what he wants.
I've chosen my companion for the journey. I should wait for Varen to open the portal.
I need to speak to Razum-dar in the Skywatch Mages Guild. Then I can start working with Vanus Galerion.
Vanus Galerion should arrive soon. I should wait here until I can speak with him.
I've rescued the other guards. Now I should meet Watchman Maujad and the dockmaster in the warehouse.
I should go to Woodhearth and see if I can find the journal's owner.
I should find Mercano and talk to him.
The Orcs are all dead or missing. I should return the axe to Forthor.
I've reached Marbruk. I should look for Forthor and return his axe.
Forthor promised to remove the curse from the axe for me. I must wait for him to do this.
I defeated <<1>>. I should speak with "Slicer" of the Ungodly.
I should tell the Tree Spirit that I can now reverse the curse.
I should use the Elemental Dust to destroy the crystals and reverse the curse.
I reversed the curse and it appears that the sapling is now dead. Merethrin's spirit is standing nearby. I should speak to the spirit and let him know that he has been released.
I should wait for the Keepers to bind High Kinlord Rilis.
I told Glaras of my vision journey. I have one final task before I am fully accepted as one of Brackenleaf's Briars. I must pray at the shrine where I first learned of the Snake.
I told Glaras of my vision journey. I have one final task before I am fully accepted as one of Brackenleaf's Briars. I must pray at the shrine where I first learned of the Wolf.
I told Glaras of my vision journey. I have one final task before I am fully accepted as one of Brackenleaf's Briars. I must pray at the shrine where I first learned of the Tiger.
Hidden
Hidden
Hidden
Hidden
I agreed with Erunor that he should stay behind and fulfill his oath to guard the Fading Tree. I should return to Laniriel and tell her.
I need to travel to the Harborage.
I need to talk to Varen Aquilarios before we get underway.
Varen Aquilarios has opened a portal to Coldharbour. I should enter it.
Abnur Tharn wants to talk to me.
Molag Bal's most powerful minions stand between us and the gates of Heart's Griefâ€”the fortress of the God of Schemes. We must battle our way inside.
The interior of Molag Bal's fortress seems completely abandoned. We should have a look around.
We found Mannimarco's tortured soul. I should speak to him and learn what he knows.
We've gotten all we need from Mannimarco. It's time to continue on and face the God of Schemes.
I may release Mannimarco if I wish, or leave him to his fate.
Abnur Tharn needs to talk to me about the ritual.
I must choose the sacrifice that will empower the Amulet of Kings.
With the sacrifice chosen, the ritual is underway.
My companion has been sacrificed to empower me for the task ahead.
I am filled with the power of the Divines! With this righteous, nigh-infinite power, I can challenge Molag Bal and force him to relinquish his grasp upon the world!
The battle is ended and I have reclaimed that which is most precious to me. The power of the Amulet is expended and it is time to leave.
The God of Schemes withers in defeat, a testament to my awesome power. My soul is ripped from his grasp and awaits my touch.
Molag Bal is no longer a foe, it seems, and the future is darker still. I must return to the Harborage.
Our victory is bittersweet. Molag Bal's Planemeld was stopped and I have reclaimed my soul, but there are darker things on the horizon. I should talk to my companions.
I should finish up my business with Cadwell.
I should finish up my business with Cadwell.
I should finish up my business with Cadwell.
General Dathieu and I killed the undead form of King Ranser. I should speak to General Dathieu's ghost to find out if the curse was truly lifted.
The scholar and I discovered a skull in the central tower. The scholar thinks it might be King Ranser's, but I'm not so sure. I should examine it.
I found another bone buried in the sand. The dog ran off again, and I should follow. Hopefully, she'll lead me to the skull.
It seems that I have been transported into a vision of the past by the spirit of General Dathieu. I should speak with the general to find out what's going on.

Within the vision of the past, the Orcs of Wrothgar have breached the walls, but King Ranser refuses to surrender. As a last ditch attempt at victory, I'm to pour magical packets into the brazier in the four towers.

Within the vision of the past, I poured the magical packets into the braziers and nothing happened. General Dathieu wants me to report this to the king, in the hope that he will realize that surrender is the only option.

Within the vision of the past, King Ranser insists that the magical packets worked as intended. He is now ordering his soldiers to charge the Orcs' ranks. He wants me to tell General Dathieu to make preparations.

Within the vision of the past, General Dathieu killed King Ranser, but the king rose as an undead warrior. He killed General Dathieu and scattered his bones. Back in the present, I should speak to Scholar Cantier.
I gathered the bones of General Dathieu and he returned as an undead warrior. He now goes to face King Ranser once again. I should join him and help end the curse.
I need to gather <<z:1>> to help the Shornhelm Guard soldiers taking refuge in the old tower. The supplies should be in the carts abandoned along the roads around Hinault Farm.
I gathered the healing supplies. Now I should bring them to <<1>> at the old tower.
None of the mages survived, but the note also mentioned someone called Lucretia was looking for them. She might be in Longhaven, so I should look for her there.

The note suggests a small group of mages came here to retrieve an artifact. I should look inside the cave and see if any of them survived. If not, I could still retrieve their signet rings and let someone in the guild know of their deaths.
The unfortunate adventurer collected two ingredients, but died searching for the third. I should start by picking up the ingredients they already collected.
One ingredient remains: <<1>>. I may find it deeper in Barrow Trench.
I have all three ingredients. I must deliver them to <<1>> in Woodhearth to collect my reward.
<<1>> is somewhere in Woodhearth. I should check the tavern first.
I need to speak to Copper Dariah in the Daggerfall Mages Guild. Then I can start working with Vanus Galerion.
I need to speak to Thrush in the Mournhold Mages Guild. Then I can start working with Vanus Galerion.
I must decide Fadeel's fate. Either set him free, or deliver him to the authorities.
I decided to let Fadeel go.
I must take Fadeel to the authorities so that he can face justice.
I decided to turn Fadeel in to the authorities.
I need to find and confront Fadeel back in Kozanset.
I need to deliver Fadeel to Constable Ebarah.
I should visit Driladan Pass, Verrant Morass, and Dread Vullain and try to cleanse those areas.
Indaenir and I have cleansed much of the corruption in Greenshade, and I must now go to join him at Hectahame, where he fears we may have to confront the Shade of Prince Naemon.
Queen Ayrenn herself has come to Hectahame. I should speak with her before I go any further.
Jofnir has appeared in the hall. I should talk to him.
Jofnir has appeared in the hall. I should talk to him.
Jofnir has appeared in the hall. I should talk to him.
I should speak with Merric about what happened in the Halls of Submission.
I should speak with Merric about what happened in the Halls of Submission.
I should speak with Merric about what happened in the Halls of Submission.
I should speak with Merric about what happened in the Halls of Submission.
I should speak with Merric about what happened in the Halls of Submission.
I should speak with Merric about what happened in the Halls of Submission.
I should speak with Merric about what happened in the Halls of Submission.
I should speak with Merric about what happened in the Halls of Submission.
I should speak with Merric about what happened in the Halls of Submission.
I unlocked the gateway to this realm's Moonhenge.  I should enter the portal and find the sigil stone so that I can close the portal to Tamriel.
I found a note next to the corpse of the unfortunate mage. I should see if it sheds some light on what brought guildmembers here.
With Uwafa dead, I can take the ansei ward from the dais in the Sanctum.
I've delivered the letter claiming credit for Clan Morkul. I should speak with Maaga again.
I've delivered the letter claiming credit for Clan Agluk. I should speak with Maaga again.

Apparently, each leader drafted a letter to claim credit for his clan. I should find the historian, Maaga, in Evermore and choose which letter to deliver, assigning credit to Clan Agluk or Clan Morkul.
I found a Dominion soldier at the entrance to Woodhearth. I should speak to him to find out if there's been any Veiled Heritance activity here.
I should travel to Woodhearth and investigate to see if there's been any Veiled Heritance activity there.
The <<1>>â€”<<2>>â€”wants nothing more than to be free of <<3>>. Perhaps I should speak with him.

The Daedric Prince Azura spoke to me! She told me of <<1>>, a wizard who long ago attempted to enter the sealed ruins and recover <<2>>. I should search the <<3>> for the method she used to gain entry.
Upon returning the <<1>> to <<2>>, the Daedric Prince seemed pleased. I should speak with her while I am able.

It looks like two of the bandits' leaders may have killed each other over this issue. I found a letter from Thorzhul to Maaga claiming credit for Clan Agluk. There's another letter I should examine nearby.

It looks like two of the bandits' leaders may have killed each other over this issue. I found a letter from Borzugh to Maaga claiming credit for Clan Morkul. There's another letter I should examine nearby.
I shredded this portion of the veil and the double doors ahead appear clear of any blockage. I need to open those doors and enter the next section of the ruins.

We made it out of the Lorkrata ruins with an ancient Ayleid text that may hold the answers we need to eventually defeat Baron Montclair. In the meantime, I should talk to Verandis and see how he wants to proceed.
The Daedric portal in Moonhenge is sealed. I should tell Sergeant Galandir of my success.
The Daedric portal in Moonhenge is sealed. I should tell Sergeant Galandir of my success.
The Daedric portal in Moonhenge is sealed. I should tell Sergeant Galandir of my success.
According to Kerbol, Draven's death was unfortunate, but necessary, to save the town and its people.
While he awaits permission to enter the village, <<1>> said the guard by the town's entrance could allow me in to speak with its mayor.
I've found Draven in the town's guest house. I should speak to him about what's going on in this place.
I've got permission to enter the town. I should see what's so special about this place by speaking to its mayor, <<1>>.
There's a crowd in the village center, and the mayor is part of it. I should ask her about Renoit's husband, Draven.
Though Draven seems all right, Renoit is convinced the town holds a secret. I should do some investigating of my own to see if he's right.
I stopped the ritual, though there was an unexpected twist - Draven tunrned into a werewolf. I should ask Kerbol what's going on.
Kerbol's admitted the villagers' disease is lycanthropy. Disrupting Draven's ritual upset their control, which could turn all villagers into beasts. I need to tell Renoit what happened.
Kerbol's prepared the initiation ritual for Draven to join him forever with the village. I need to get to the ritual site and see what exactly is going to happen, and put a stop to it.
Kerbol said to meet her in the town square whether or not I've encountered Draven on the hillside.

Kerbol asked me to help find Draven as it might still be possible to complete his initiation. Left incomplete, he will go mad and perhaps affect the other villagers. When I find him, I need to subdue him.
After directing Renoit to bring Draven to the town hall, Kerbol asked me to join her there. I'm not sure what will happen now, to either Draven or the village.
I must speak to Draven, even though he's obviously weakened from our fight. He needs to know what went wrong, and how we can save him.
Draven has decided against joining the town, which puts Kerbol's spell in jeopardy. I should speak to her about what she plans to do next.
Now that Draven is within reach, I must kill him before he hurts anyone in his werewolf form.
Draven's incomplete link to the village puts everyone at risk. Kerbol wants me to lure him to the shrine at the top of the hill as the only way to sever his connection with the town is to kill him.
The deed is done. I should talk to Kerbol and find out what this means for the town.
Adusa thinks she spotted survivors heading toward the barn. She wants me to meet her there.
I defeated the vampire commander. Unfortunately, he turned out to be the missing constable, Maldred. I should meet Adusa outside of town and tell her what happened.
I defeated the Duchess of Anguish, but Sai still remains bound. I should free him from his bondage.
Kerbol assured me that Draven was well taken care of. I should see for myself - he's staying in a guest cottage nearby.

Within the vision of the past, General Dathieu believes King Ranser has gone mad. I'm to find Captain Taern and convince her to stand down or recover a sleep scroll to use to knock her and the King's Guards out.
Within the vision of the past, I have stopped the King's Guard from charging into the Orcs' ranks. I should now go and watch as General Dathieu confronts King Ranser.
I've given the items for <<1>>. He said it would take only moments to determine if any of these objects are the source of the poison.
Aelif and Merric have gone ahead to the place Jofnir has identified as the Halls of Submission. Merric completed the Prismatic Weapon before he left; I should take it from the anvil.

Queen Arzhela is still grieving and has dedicated herself to helping the wounded and homeless. She believes Duke Renchant is better suited to manage the city's defenses, and she asked me to report my findings to him.

Queen Arzhela is still grieving and believes Duke Renchant is better suited to manage the city's defenses. She asked me to report my findings to him. I must let him finish his conversation with Captain Hjurrun first.

Queen Arzhela is still grieving and has dedicated herself to helping the wounded and homeless. She believes Duke Renchant is better suited to manage the city's defenses, and she asked me to report my findings to him.
Adusa made it to the barn before me. She's having a heated conversation with one of Moira's Hope's survivors. I should listen to their exchange.
The villagers have a secret all right, and at least part of it involves lycanthropy. No one could give me a straight answer. I should let Renoit know his concerns are real.
The queen's handmaiden laid any doubts to rest. It seems Duke Renchant is planning to hand the city over to Imperial control. Glarikha asked me to find proof so we can present it to the queen.

I reported my suspicious findings to Duke Renchant, but he has his own plan for saving the city. One of the clues I found points to a ship in the harbor known as the Bjoulsae Queen. I should investigate the ship.

Duke Renchant is planning to hand Evermore over to Imperial control. The Bjoulsae Queen brought Imperial spies into the city. I need to follow the ship's captain and find out what else they're planning.

The queen's handmaiden laid any doubts to rest. It seems Duke Renchant is planning to hand the city over to Imperial control. I found Imperial Orders proving this on board the Bjoulsae Queen. I should meet Glarikha on the docks.

Duke Renchant is planning to hand Evermore over to Imperial control. Imperial spies are already in the city, preparing to seize control. I need to inform the queen. Her handmaiden, Glarikha, hopes this will convince her to take action.
The hold of the Bjoulsae Queen is locked. I must find a way to get the key from the captain or her crew.
I've found the key to the hold of the Bjoulsae Queen.
Captain Janeve asked me to locate one of the refugees, Jonah Marose. He claimed he could sense <<1>> before he ran off. I need to find him and his mother and bring them back to the camp.
I found Jonah Marose in a ruined tower, but we were immediately attacked by vampires. I need to defend the tower before I can talk to Jonah.

Jonah is obviously nervous and afraid, and his mother doesn't appear to be at all well. He's convinced that he has some kind of connection to <<1>>, and he refuses to endanger Camp Tamrith. I should return and tell Captain Janeve about this.
Countess Tamrith asked me to help treat the wounded soldiers while I ask them if they saw what happened to Captain Janeve during the vampire attack on the camp.
From talking to the House Tamrith guards, it sounds like Captain Janeve headed west, toward the river. She may have been chasing <<1>>. I should try to catch up to her.
While looking for Captain Janeve, I came across Darien Gautier. He appears to be injured. I should talk to him and find out what happened.
Darien said that Captain Janeve was dragged into a nearby cave by Reezal-Jul and his vampires. I need to find the entrance to that cave.
I need to enter the cave and find <<1>>'s lair. If I hurry, maybe I can save Captain Janeve.

I agreed with Captain Janeve. Just like Verandis and Gwendis, she deserves a chance to overcome and control the monster inside her. She deserves to live. Now I should head outside and find Darien and the others.
Gluineth will now follow me to the cave's exit.
Gluineth took off on her own when we reached the exit to the cave. She said I should meet her on the Evermore docks for my reward.
I should use the door lever to open Gluineth's cell door.
The survivor doesn't seem to completely trust Adusa. I should talk to her and find out what she thinks we should do next.
Adusa decided to remain at the barn and protect the survivors. She asked me to head out and see if I could round up any other survivors and lead them back to the barn.
Hidden; Talk to Thibierry
Molag Bal's audience chamber is near. The only way out is through that chamber.
I should inspect the fortifications at Murcien's Hamlet to make sure they are reasonably intact while Theo checks on <<1>>.
Squire Theo called for my help. He mentioned that he would be at <<1>>'s home checking on <<2>>. I should look for him there.
<<1>> asked me to search <<2>>'s home to see what has happened to Sir Etienne. I should look around for clues.
<<1>> has been put to death for her actions. I should speak to Squire Theo to find out what will happen next to Murcien's Hamlet.
Merric wants to speak to me again once more before I leave the Earth Forge.
I should return to <<1>> at <<2>>'s house. I've been gone long enough, and he may be in danger himself.
When confronted about her Reachman son, <<1>> refused to treat <<2>>, allowing him to die. Now her fate must be decided.
<<1>>'s son <<2>> has come to her defense. I must defeat him before she can be brought to justice for allowing <<3>> to die.
<<1>> will stand trial in Evermore for her actions. I should speak to Squire Theo to find out what will happen next to Murcien's Hamlet.
<<1>> approached me in <<2>>. He seemed to know more about my situation than I do. I should speak with him.

I reported my suspicious findings to Duke Renchant, but he was evasive. One of the clues points to a ship in the harbor known as the Bjoulsae Queen. I found the queen's handmaiden bound in the ship's hold. I should find out what happened.
The queen's handmaiden and the former guard captain are dead, but another one of these mysterious crows is here. I should speak to it and hear what it has to say.
I've collected the the materials for Daifa's trick. I need to deliver them to her so she can prepare the Riddle Box. She told me she'd be waiting for me in the Subtle Knife camp.
Queen Arzhela asked me to travel to Northglen and speak to Sergeant Antieve about helping to turn the tide of battle in our favor.
I should speak to Queen Arzhela about Uela's threats.
Duke Renchant maintained that he was doing the right thing by handing the city over to Imperial control. I have decided that Renchant should be put in the stocks. I should meet Queen Arzhela outside.
Duke Renchant maintained that he was doing the right thing by handing the city over to Imperial control. I have decided that Renchant should be put in the stocks. I should meet Queen Arzhela outside.
The queen and I are going to confront Duke Renchant and determine what his fate will be for trying to hand the city over to Imperial control.
Duke Renchant maintained that he was doing the right thing by handing the city over to Imperial control, but I decided that the punishment for his treason had to be death.

Duke Renchant maintained that he was doing the right thing by handing the city over to Imperial control, but I decided the penalty for his treason had to be death. I should meet the queen outside the keep.
<<1>>'s notes referred to a tablet. She spoke the name "<<2>>" before it to summon a Daedra which helped her gain entry to <<3>>.
<<1>>, a Daedra who long ago helped <<2>> gain entry to <<3>>, said I will need an <<z:4>>. I should follow <<1>> to where they are stored if I wish to retrace <<2>>'s footsteps.
<<1>> said the <<z:2>> must be filled with Daedric souls before I can enter <<3>>. I should use it to capture <<4>> and <<5>> lurking among the surface ruins.
I filled <<Az:1>> with Daedric souls. I should use it to empower <<Ac:2>>, just outside the entrance to <<3>>.
After I empowered <<Ac:1>>, <<2>> used its energy to unseal the ruins. I can now begin my search for <<3>>.
<<1>> is still alive! It seems she was long ago betrayed by <<2>> and left for dead. I should help <<1>> defeat the Daedra, who seems to have turned on me as well.
<<1>> is alive! When confronted by her, <<2>> attacked. When she seemed near defeat, she fled into <<3>> with <<1>> in hot pursuit. I should follow them and see what can be done.

<<1>>'s torment tears a hole in the world between <<2>> and <<3>>. Once we find the portal, <<4>> and I will need to pass through. From there we can seal it, ending the threat it poses to to the world.
<<1>> said two <<m:2>> bind <<3>>. I should shatter them to break her bonds.
I destroyed <<1>>'s magical shackles. I should retrieve her bones from the altar in order to end her torment and close the portal to <<2>>.
Removing <<1>> from the altar closed the portal, but now <<2>> and I are trapped in <<3>>. I should speak with <<2>> and see if she has any ideas about how we can escape.
In order to escape <<1>>, <<2>> opened a portal using <<3>>'s connection to the Daedra's summoning tablet.\n\nI should return <<4>> to <<5>>.
Hidden; Talk to Thibierry
Lorwen seemed to think that the bandits could be found in an old ruin called Claw's Strike. It's in the southern part of the region. I should head there now.
I rescued <<1>>. I should talk to him about his ordeal.
I should recover the Memory Stone from Ulbazar's sepulcher.
I should seek out the Redguard scholar Madaima and return Makela Leki's Memory Stone to her.
Now that Kerbol is dead, I need to find where Renoit and Draven have gone.
I should talk to Renoit and see what he and Draven will do, now that Kerbol can no longer heal Draven.
Kerbol's spell enslaved the villagers, and threatens to change Draven into his werewolf form forever. In order to break her spell, I must rescue Draven from Kerbol herself.
Renoit told me about an area above the town which Kerbol's protected from outsiders. Something there might contain her spell over the village. If I destroy it, we might be able to rescue Draven.
I've promised to find a way to help Draven escape from the village and Kerbol's spell. I should talk to Renoit to see if he has any ideas.
I found Sai Sahan in a room as he is physically tortured by atronachs. I should defeat them.
I've collected alibis from all the unafflicted citizens of <<1>> regarding where they were before the attacks and should consult with <<2>>.
I need to speak with the leader of the Brackenleaf's Briars, Glaras.
I have the relics from all three dig sites. I should return to Felari.
Adusa thinks she spotted survivors heading toward the barn. She wants me to meet her there.
Hidden; Talk to Celeste
Hidden; Talk to Celeste
I have successfully retrieved the Amulet of Kings. I should speak with Varen Aquilarios and let him know what happened.
I defeated <<1>>, and thus ended the attacks against <<2>>. I should return to <<3>> and let her know what happened.
Kerbol has a secret passage to a much higher altar, overlooking the whole town. I should find out what she does here.
I should visit the fortifications on the west side.
I should put the fire out at the fortifications now that I have a bucket of water.
I should visit the fortifications on the east side.
I should look nearby the fortifications for some water to put the fire out with.
I brought the survivors I was able to find back to the barn. Now I should talk to Adusa and see how she wants to proceed.
I think I need to collect General Dathiue's scattered bones to end the curse of Traitor's Tor. I should search the ruins and find them.
I entered the house on top of the hill. Now I need to find the vampire commander and destroy him.
The party is in full swing and Aniel was very pleased. I should enjoy the party before heading back to Thormar and Reaper's March.
I should speak with <<1>>, a <<2>> resident who offered to help find missing Dominion scouts.
<<1>> believes <<2>> was driven mad by the Daedric Prince <<3>>. She insisted on helping locate the missing Dominion scouts. We should search for them in the town.
<<1>> thinks she can restore the Dominion scouts from bears to their true form. I need to distract the bears while she reverses the magic.
I found one of the missing scouts, who said the "mayor" of <<1>> somehow turned his companions into bears. I should speak with <<2>> about what can be done about this.
With the Dominion scouts saved, <<1>> believes she can breach the cathedral where the mayor has barricaded himself. We should go to her basement laboratory and recover the scroll.
<<1>>'s basement laboratory was sealed by a powerful electrical storm. Perhaps <<1>> knows what can be done to stop this storm.
<<1>> believes the electrical storm was conjured by someone in <<2>>. A nearby Colovian tower is one of the tallest structures in town. I should head there and see if it's the storm's source.
I found the man responsible for conjuring the electrical storm in <<1>>. I should speak with him to see if I can make him stop.
After dealing with <<1>>, the electrical storm has vanished entirely. I should head to <<2>>'s basement laboratory. There we can collect the scroll needed to breach the cathedral.
I collected the scroll from <<1>>'s laboratory. I should use it to breach the cathedral so we can confront the mayor.
We entered the cathedral. <<1>> seems to recognize the "mayor" and hopes to talk some sense into him.

It seems <<1>> inhabited <<2>>'s body the entire time we traveled through <<3>>. I awoke in some kind of jail cell, accompanied by a very weary <<2>>. I should speak with her and try to make sense of what happened.
<<1>> appeared outside of the jail cell. He won't stop staring at me. I should speak with him.
<<1>>, the Daedric Prince of Madness, wants me to kill <<2>>. If I do so, he promised to leave <<3>>. I should look for a way out of these catacombs.
<<1>> is toying with me. He raised a drawbridge leading back to the cathedral. I need to find the lever that lowers the bridge so I can proceed.
The path to the cathedral is open. I should make my way there and confront <<1>>.
I must kill <<1>>. Once he dies, <<2>> promised to leave <<3>> forever.
I told <<1>> the only way I'll allow him to live is if he convinces <<2>> to bring him along when he leaves. I should see how the Daedric Prince responds.
I killed <<1>>. If <<2>> keeps his word, he will leave <<3>>. However, it seems the Daedric Prince wants to speak with me before he departs.
<<1>> sent <<2>> to the Shivering Isles. It seems the Daedric Prince wants to speak with me before he departs.
I've been directed to speak with the Treethane of Karthdar to get details on what's happening. He and the rest of the town are holed up in a nearby cave.
I should speak with <<1>>, the person in charge of the Dominion forces at <<2>>.
We made our way down into the ruined chambers beneath the Lorkrata Hills. I should talk to Verandis and see how he wants to proceed.
Verandis is concerned about something ahead. I should talk to him.
Verandis has rushed ahead through the large, double doors. I should follow him.
Verandis finished examining the ancient book and collected it from the pedestal. I should talk to him and ask him if that was what we were looking for.

We located an ancient Ayleid tome that contains information about the Lightless Remnant. Verandis needs to study the archaic writing. In the meantime, I should try to find another tear so we can get out from under Lleraya's veil.
Verandis asked me to search for a way to open the trap door in the west tower. I should look around and see what I can find.

We need to explore these ruins to find the Ayleid artifact that Verandis seeks. To navigate through the illusory veil, Verandis needs me to manipulate the tears that he can't affect due to Lleraya's spell.

Lleraya has placed an illusory veil over the ruins. It changes the topography and makes us see only what she wants us to see. Verandis believes the spell was specifically designed to hinder him. I should examine the tear and see if I can affect it.
Varen has beckoned me to the Harborage. I should go there and speak to him.
I should talk to Varen in the Harborage to find out what I need to do next.
I should talk to Sai Sahan, who can inform me more about our quest to retrieve the Amulet of Kings.
We are ready to venture to Sancre Tor. I should enter Varen's portal and join Lyris and Sai on our quest to retrieve the Amulet of Kings.
I ventured to Sancre Tor with Sai Sahan, Lyris Titanborn, and Abnur Tharn. We must explore the crypts and halls in order to find the Amulet of Kings.
I should speak with Sai Sahan to see what we should do next.
I should kill any Black Dagger bandits I encounter in Cyrodiil.
I've fulfilled the contract to kill Black Dagger bandits. I should return to <<1>>.
I should seek out and kill any Gray Vipers I find in my travels here.
I killed my share of Gray Vipers. I should return to <<1>>.
It requires me to kill members of the Shadowed Path cult.
I fulfilled the Shadowed Path contract. I should return to <<1>>.
I should kill Goblins wherever I find them.
I achieved my quota of Goblins. I should return to <<1>>.
It calls for me to kill Black Dagger bandits, wherever I find them.
I completed the contract against the Black Daggers. I should return to <<1>>.
The guild has asked me to hunt down members of the Gray Viper gang.
I've fulfilled the terms of the Gray Viper contract. I should return to <<1>>.
It calls for me to kill members of the Shadowed Path cult.
I've completed my mission to kill Shadowed Path cultists. I should return to <<1>>.
My targets are Goblins, wherever I find them.
I've killed my quota of Goblins. I should return to <<1>>.
My targets are Black Dagger bandits. I should kill any I encounter.
I killed my quota of Black Daggers. I should return to <<1>>.
The guild wants me to kill Gray Viper bandits wherever I find them.
The contract has been fulfilled. I should return to <<1>> at the Northern High Rock gate.
I've been asked to kill Shadowed Path cultists who are preying on the citizens of Cyrodiil.
My contract against the Shadowed Path has been fulfilled. I should return to <<1>>.
The guild wishes me to kill any Goblins I meet.
I've reached my quota of Goblins. I should return to <<1>>.
A projection of Varen appeared to me when I arrived in town. I should listen to him and hear what he wants.
I need to find a tear so we can get past this portion of the illusory veil.

When <<1>> neared defeat, she fled into the ruins only to be stopped by <<2>>, who now holds the beast in place with magical bonds. I should speak with <<2>> and find out exactly what happened so long ago.
Adusa wants me to go to the house on top of the hill and cause a distraction so that she can lead the surviving townsfolk to safety.
A vision of Mannimarco has appeared to thwart and taunt us.
Hidden; Talk to Corwyn
Hidden; Talk to Corwyn
A projection of Varen Aquilarios appeared to me when I arrived in town. I should talk to him and see what he wants.
Princess Elara has become the new Viridian Sentinel. I should speak to her and make sure she's all right.
One of the wyrd on the outskirts of the Viridian Woods said someone called the "Viridian Sentinel" is looking for aid to save the princess of Evermore's life.
After examining the princess, a man came up behind me. I should speak to him.
I've found the altar where the wyrd sister said the Viridian Sentinel was caring for the princess. She's lying atop it - I should see if there are any signs of life.
Stenwick used the last of his energy to make a magical salve for the princess. He's asked me to apply it and see if it works.
The salve Stenwick made seemed to work. I should speak to the princess and see how she's feeling.
Now that I've charged the Viridian Sentinel's amulet, I should bring it back to him. He said he'd be at his hut with Princess Elara.
The man who spoke to me was the Viridian Sentinel. He's still trying to heal the princess and has asked me to gather energy from the nearby fairy rings.
After Princess Elara woke, the wyrd I spoke to before arrived in Stenwick's hut to speak to us.
The wyrd left with a foreboding message, and seemed to be displeased at Stenwick's intervention with the princess. I should ask Stenwick about it.

Stenwick asked me to find something called the "Voice of the Forest," an ancient spriggan that lives in the Viridian Woods.\n\nThe spriggans I kill may release a spark that will lead me to the Voice itself. If I see such a spark, I need to follow it.
Now that I have the spriggan bud, I should take it to <<1>> at the wyrd camp within the Viridian Woods. Stenwick said the wyrd would know what to do with it.
The wyrd did not seem pleased that I brought the bud to them with the princess. I should see what exactly their concerns are.
The Sentinel told me to request a spriggan bud from the Voice of the Forest. I'll need to follow its instructions to obtain one.
The wyrd and the princess are at odds, with Stenwick trying to complete the princess' recovery. It would be good to figure out what their concerns are and see if they are baseless or not.
After the initial confrontation with the wyrd, I finally obtained their blessing. I still need to do something with the spriggan bud. I should speak to Princess Elara and ask what she thinks.
The princess asked me to take the bud to Stenwick and explain what happened with the wyrd. I should get to him as soon as I can.
I found Stenwick at his hut, and he seems to be ill. I need to speak with him to find out what's wrong.
Stenwick died right before my eyes, his energy drained from healing the princess. He asked me to gather what was left of him in his amulet.
I need to take the Viridian Sentinel's essence to the altar at the lake and wait for Princess Elara.
The princess told me to meet her at the lake altar with Stenwick. He may have died, but I have his essence within his old amulet.
Princess Elara wants to complete what Stenwick started - granting her the power of the Viridan Sentinel to save her life. She's asked me to help her complete the ritual to take on his mantle.
Princess Elara has become the new Viridian Sentinel. I should speak to her and make sure she's all right.
Princess Elara has failed to become the new Viridian Sentinel, and the power has dissipated into the Viridan Woods. It won't be long before Elara succumbs to her old wounds.
Princess Elara has failed to become the new Viridian Sentinel, and the power has dissipated into the Viridan Woods. It won't be long before Elara succumbs to her old wounds.
Princess Elara is performing the ritual to become the Viridian Sentinel. Doing so will subjugate the forest to her power.
I should wait for <<1>> to consider the evidence I presented.
My evidence spoke for itself and <<1>> was convinced of <<2>>'s guilt. I must now bring him to the judgment chamber. I should speak with him about his fate.
We must continue through Sancre Tor in order to reach the Inner Chamber.
I've found the Guardian's Eye, but Tharayya, fearing that it might be fragile, wants to examine it before taking it from its pedestal.
A gamut of undead have awakened and are attacking. I should flee the Guardian's Orbit before I am overcome.
I scouted Arrius Mine and should now return to the Scouting mission board.
<<1>> told me Sorion was supposed to play at <<2>>, but the guards there wouldn't let her inside town.
I found a note Sorion wrote to an innkeeper in <<1>>. It seems he left to stay with a woman in a place north of <<2>> called "Sweetbreeze Cottage." I should look for him there.
I found a suspicious hatch beneath the bed in Sweetbreeze Cottage. I should look around the immediate area to see if I can find the key.
I found the key to the hatch in some clothes drying outside the cottage. I should use it on the hatch to see what's in the basement.
I've discovered a veritable dungeon of horrors beneath the cottage. There's a skeleton holding a lute, set up on a macabre stage. I should take a closer look.
I told <<1>> the truth about Sorion's death. I should see if she has anything else to say.
I couldn't tell <<1>> the truth about Sorion's death. I should see if she has anything else to say.
Sorion is dead. I should inform <<1>>.
Aniel wants me to serve the bar patrons. I need to get behind the bar and grab the <<1>>.
<<1>> revealed herself to be a servant of Molag Bal. Now that I've determined the Daedra's fate, I should speak with <<2>> about what we can do to find <<3>>.
I should speak to Priestess Marcella.
Mannimarco has summoned the dead to thwart us. We must defeat them to continue.
We overcame the undead that were raised to thwart us. We should continue to the Inner Courtyard.
Sai appears to need a moment before we move on. I should speak with him in order to ensure he is well.
I should wait for <<1>> to consider the evidence I presented.
My evidence spoke for itself and <<1>> was convinced of <<2>>' guilt. I must now bring him to the judgment chamber. I should speak with him about his fate.
My evidence spoke for itself and <<1>> was convinced of <<2>>'s guilt. I must now bring her to the judgment chamber. I should speak with her about her fate.
I should wait for <<1>> to consider the evidence I presented.
We must go to the Dragonguard Tomb in order to pray at the shrine.
The shrine is on the other side of the room. We must make our way through these tombs to get there.
We prayed at the first shrine. Now we must make our way to the Reman Vault and perform a similar task there.
We must pray at the second shrine before we can open the vault doors, but a chasm with an open drawbridge blocks our path. If we can find a way across the chasm, we can pray at the shrine.
Mannimarco has raised the dead once more. We must defeat them to continue.
We defeated the undead in the Vault Antechamber. Now we must enter the Vault of Kings to retrieve the amulet.
Mannimarco attacked us in the Vault of Kings. We should defeat him once and for all.
We have defeated Mannimarco and sent him screaming into Oblivion. I should retrieve the Amulet of Kings as soon as possible.
I have the Amulet of Kings. I should return to the Harborage and report to Varen.
I successfully collected the Amulet of Kings. I should report to Varen Aquilarios.
I ran into Cadwell again. The strange fellow suggested I head across the bridge and find a place called the Hollow City.
I entered Shadowfate Cavern. Now I need to confront the evil Argonian, <<1>>, and destroy him before anyone else in Rivenspire is forced to suffer his blood-curse.
Reachmen have taken over the lighthouse south of Evermore, but Guard Captain Hjurrun has ordered the guards to hold back. I've agreed to attack the Reachmen and bring their leader's head.
I should bring the Reachmen leader's head to Captain Hjurrun.
Guard Captain Hjurrun appreciated my assistance in retrieving the Reachmen leader's head. He suggested I go to the castle's keep and speak to Duke Renchant at my leisure.
A young Orc woman has accosted me on the steps leading into the keep. I should speak to her and find out what she wants.
The handmaiden asked me to report my findings to Queen Arzhela at St. Pelin's Chapel.
Renoit's entered the guest house, demanding answers about the cure. I'll find out what more he needs, since Draven appears content enough.
Paldeen is examining the tablet.
I brought the guilty to the judgment chamber, and shall now watch his fate.
I have brought the guilty to the judgment chamber, and shall now watch his fate.
I have brought the guilty to the judgment chamber, and shall now watch her fate.
I should talk to the Lunar Champion to determine our next steps.
I should travel to Evermore and look for King Fahara'jad's informant at the stables.
I need to find the King and help him decide who should rule Shornhelm before war breaks out.
I need to defeat <<1>> to retrieve Gasteau's soul.
I've defeated <<1>>, and freed Gasteau's soul. I should speak with him.
<<1>> won't leave unless I free <<2>>. I should find Saryne and release him from imprisonment.
I have freed <<1>>. I should speak with him.
Bowenas has asked that I speak to people around town. With their input, I'll be better prepared to make a decision about Ezreba's fate.
Verandis has ordered the troops to remain here and guard the rear, and he wants me to deliver these orders to Countess Tamrith and Baron Dorell.
As I was heading to meet Verandis, a number of Ayleid spirits appeared before me. One has blocked my way and wants to speak to me. I should see what she has to say.

Baron Dorell and Countess Tamrith refuse to stay behind. They're gathering their troops and preparing to ascend the Doomcrag. I should meet Verandis and let him know that they decided not to follow his orders.
The Ayleid spirit warned me that if we destroy the Lightless Remnant, we'll unleash the blood-curse throughout the land. I need to catch up with Verandis and talk to him about this.
Verandis and Gwendis have entered the Doomcrag to confront Baron Montclair. I should follow them inside.
We've entered the Doomcrag. I need to be ready. I'm sure that Montclair will try something before we get very far.
Montclair turned our own troops against us and then teleported Gwendis, Tamrith, and Dorell away. I need to talk to Verandis so that we can rescue them.
I need to talk to Verandis and find out what we need to do to free Gwendis and the others.
I need to protect Verandis while he works to dispel the blood ward that imprisons Gwendis and the others. He also asked me to find a way to destroy the statues that are powering the ward.
Verandis needs to make some kind of preparations so that we can ultimately defeat Montclair. I should go upstairs and keep Montclair busy until Verandis is ready to join me.
Baron Montclair waits inside the relic chamber. It's time to finally confront him.
I defeated Montclair and now the Remnant is cracking and spilling its power into the world. I need to talk to Verandis and find out how we stop this.
Darien told me that Gwendis isn't doing too well. I should speak to her and let her know what happened to Verandis.
I should find and release <<1>> from imprisonment.
I have freed <<1>>. I should speak with her.
I can leave the Vaults of Madness once I defeat the <<1>>. I should find him.
We prayed at both shrines. Now we must return to the Vault Antechamber.
I should search the area and see if I can determine what happened to the Fighters Guild members who recently occupied the place.
I should talk to the Lunar Champion in Dune.
The ceremony has begun. I should watch the Lunar Champion become the new Mane.
<<1>> seems very concerned with <<2>>'s plans. I should speak with him and learn why.
<<1>> thinks <<2>> is after <<3>>, a powerful but dangerous relic. He hopes local welkynd stones will reveal what the soldiers know about <<3>>.
The welkynd stones revealed the presence of a vault beneath <<Ac:1>>. I should speak with <<2>> about this.
<<1>> thinks we'll need help to find <<2>> before <<3>>. We should talk to <<4>>.
<<1>> was last seen heading down into the dig site. I should enter the dig site and search the caves.
I should search the excavated caves for signs of <<1>>.
A strange frost creature appeared in one of the caves! She appears to be an enemy of the frost trolls. I should speak with her.

The frost creature was created by <<1>>, the woman I saw in the welkynd stone visions! She will lead me to <<2>> if I help her escape from her prison. I should speak with her face-to-face in the vault.
<<1>> opened the way to her vault, a combination prison and palace. I should speak with her about <<2>>.
<<1>> needs me to get <<2>> before <<3>> does. She can't leave her prison, but can send her frost construct to help me against the vault's guardians.
I hold <<1>>. I should return to <<2>>'s prison and see what must be done to free her.
I should place <<1>> on the brazier to break the curse upon <<2>>.
I should speak with <<1>> to see if the curse is truly broken.
I found <<1>>.  I should deliver <<2>> to him so it can be properly contained.
In order to escape <<1>>, <<2>> opened a portal using a connection to her own phylactery. Doing so meant she was unable to return with me.\n\nI should return <<3>> to <<4>>.
Upon returning the <<1>> to <<2>>, the Daedric Prince seemed pleased. I should speak with her while I am able.
I should bring the book Vindication for the Dragon Break back to Gahgdar.
Duke Renchant maintained that he was doing the right thing by handing the city over to Imperial control. I have suggested the queen decide his fate.
Duke Renchant maintained that he was doing the right thing by handing the city over to Imperial control, but the queen killed him for his crimes. I should meet the queen outside the keep.
Duke Renchant maintained that he was doing the right thing by handing the city over to Imperial control. I have decided that Renchant should be put in the stocks.

As distrustful as they may be, the wyresses are willing to accept my help. Wyress Rashan should return from scouting the Reachmen's camp momentarily. I should talk to her about destroying the totems that prevent the wyrd from using their magic.
As distrustful as they may be, the wyresses are willing to accept my help. Wyress Rashan has joined me as a wolf and we must burn the totems that prevent the wyrd from using their magic.
I have succeeded in destroying the totems preventing the wyrd from using their nature magic. I should speak to Wyress Rashan to ask if it worked.
I have succeeded in destroying the totems preventing the wyrd from using their nature magic, and a familiar crow has appeared. I should speak to the crow and hear what it has to say.

I destroyed the totems preventing the wyrd magic, and the Hagraven Uela again spoke through a crow. She says her location is a secret 'only a crow would know.' I should meet Wyress Rashan at the old tower to discuss next steps.
Wyress Rashan and I have entered the nature realm. I should speak to the crows' spirits here and find out if they know how to reach Uela's lair.
After speaking to crows' spirits in the nature realm, Wyress Rashan and I know how to get past Uela's wards. We must first find the entrance to her lair in the island tower.

After speaking to crows' spirits in the nature realm, Wyress Rashan and I have found the entrance to Uela's lair. Rashan has returned to the physical realm to break the wards on the door. Once she's done, I should enter the island tower.

After speaking to crows' spirits in the nature realm, Wyress Rashan and I have found the entrance to Uela's lair. Rashan has returned to the physical realm to break the wards on the door. Once she's done, I should enter the island tower.
I have reached Uela's lair. I must kill the Hagraven and bring her heart back to Wyress Rashan.

After speaking to crows' spirits in the nature realm, Wyress Rashan and I know how to get past Uela's wards, and we've found the door to her lair in the island tower. I should speak to Wyress Rashan now.
Uela is dead and the wyresses have performed a ritual to cleanse the forest. I should speak with Wyress Rashan to say goodbye.
I should recover the book Vindication for the Dragon Break and bring it back to Gahgdar.
I should look for the witch, Lady Edwyge, deeper in the Rubble Butte ruins.
Reachmen are attacking the fortifications on the west side. I should keep them from breaking through the defenses.
I should look for the witch, Lady Edwyge, deeper in the Rubble Butte ruins.
I should look at Edwyge's notes on the ritual she and the other witches were trying to perform.
I recovered the Emerald Chalice. Now I should find a way out of <<1>> so I can return the relic to Lady Laurent.
I'm inside Malofar's inner sanctum. I should find the Emerald Chalice and take it while I can.
The protective barrier of ice has fallen. Now I can enter Malofar's inner sanctum and continue the search for the Emerald Chalice.
Now that I've collected the three runestones, I should place them in their proper locations so that I can open the barrier that protects the inner sanctum.
The hireling's note said that three runestones are needed to open the barrier of iceâ€”a whale, an eagle, and a snake. I can collect them from altars throughout the cavern.
I warned Lady Laurent about the dangers of the Emerald Chalice and asked her to help the Goblin. I should give her the cup now.
I found the body of one of Lady Laurent's hirelings. It looks like he wrote something before he died. I should read the note.
I have arrived at Murcien's Hamlet to find Squire Theo Rocque in charge. He's asked me to wait a moment while he speaks with one of the village elders.
Squire Theo Rocque is speaking to a village elder by the name of <<1>>. I should let them finish speaking.
Squire Theo Rocque is done speaking with <<1>> and I should speak with him.
Lavinia is dead. I should find Cariel and Kazirra and speak to them.
Some of Kazirra's resistance fighters have captured a Colovian, who seems to have surrendered. I could speak to him.
Duke Renchant maintained that he was doing the right thing by handing the city over to Imperial control, but the queen killed him for his crimes. I should meet the queen outside the keep.
<<1>> thinks we'll need help to find <<2>> before <<3>>. We should talk to <<4>> in the Falinesti Faithful camp.
<<1>> was last seen heading down into the dig site. I should enter the dig site and look for the northern cave.
I've entered the series of caves known as <<1>>. Now I should search the caves and see if I can find any signs of the hirelings Lady Laurent sent in here.
I should search the northern cave for signs of <<1>>.
Talks between Queen Arzhela and Imperial Magus-General broke down and fighting broke out. Only a handful of us managed to escape back to Evermore. I should speak with the queen.
Kasura has been injured and the town is still threatened by several Daedric Sigils. I should destroy the Sigils to hopefully prevent further attacks.
I've been directed to speak to Sergeant Antieve at the west gate to ask how I can help the guards defend the city.
I appear to have been dragged to Meridia's realm of Oblivion. She and Molag Bal exchanged words, and now she stands nearby. I should speak to her.
Mannimarco found us in the crypt. His minions must not overrun the crypt and gain the Ring of Stendarr's Mercy!
I have the Ring of Stendarr's Mercy. I should talk to Kasura and see if she'll return to the Harborage with us.
I lowered the drawbridge leading to the cathedral. I should make my way there so I can confront <<1>>.
I must fight Free Will, <<1>>'s friend. If I destroy it, he'll lower the second drawbridge.
<<1>> raised a second drawbridge. I should find the lever that lowers the bridge.
The survivors are taking stock of what happened.
Lady Laurent has asked me to enter <<1>> in search of the stolen Mages Guild relic and the missing hirelings she sent in earlier to find it.

Imperial Magus-General Septima Tharn has requested a parley with Queen Arzhela. I will be joining representatives from the Mages and Fighters Guilds to ensure the queen's protection. I should speak with Gabrielle and Darien before we go.
I should return to Queen Arzhela and tell her that Uela is dead.

Imperial Magus-General Septima Tharn has requested a parley with Queen Arzhela. I will be joining representatives from the Mages and Fighters Guilds to ensure the queen's protection. I should enter the portal to the parley site.

Imperial Magus-General Septima Tharn has requested a parley with Queen Arzhela. I should follow the representatives from the Mages Guild to take up a strategic position to oversee security for the parley.
Queen Arzhela is meeting to parley with Imperial Magus-General Septima Tharn. Along with representatives from the Mages Guild, I should watch the parley and be on alert for anything suspicious.
Talks between Queen Arzhela and Imperial Magus-General took a turn for the worse, and now fighting has broken out. Gabrielle is opening a portal so we can get down to where the queen is.
Talks between Queen Arzhela and Imperial Magus-General took a turn for the worse, and now fighting has broken out. Gabrielle is opening a portal so we can escape.
Talks between Queen Arzhela and Imperial Magus-General took a turn for the worse, and now fighting has broken out. Gabrielle opened a portal so we can escape.
Talks between Queen Arzhela and Imperial Magus-General took a turn for the worse, and now Imperial troops are attacking. I must coordinate and target the mages' spells to defend the queen below.
<<1>> raised a second drawbridge. I should speak with him and see if I can convince him let me pass.
We returned to the Harborage. Lyris and the Prophet are commiserating.
<<1>> gave me a token and told me to bring it to an organization known as the Hollow Moon. I should go to the ruined temple and see what it's for.
I agreed to speak to the guard pursuing <<1>>.
<<1>> may need my help with an issue at Redfur Trading Post.
Key in hand, I should enter the depths of Anahbi's Tomb.
My first barrier is a series of deadly traps designed to keep thieves and graverobbers out of Anahbi's Tomb.
With the Gauntlet defeated, I must unlock the reliquary that holds Anahbi's treasure.\n\nPerhaps the statues are the key.
With the reliquary unlocked, I should recover Anahbi's treasure.
Anahbi's treasure is a large gem set in an elaborate necklace. I should return to the surface and inform <<1>> of my success.
<<1>> has already gone to meet with <<2>>, leader of the Redfur trading costers. I should deliver the treasure safely into his keeping.
When I gave him the treasure, <<1>> offered me my choice of reward. When I asked for gold and glory, he said I would receive it. I should speak with him and collect my reward.
Tampering with the altar summoned Malubeth the Scourger.
I found Gorvyn Dran's cousin at the Serk. I should talk to her and deliver the letter.
We are in the Vault of Kings. I must use the Ring of Stendarr to open the vault door.
Sai has asked for me to wait for him so he can catch his breath.
I should wait for Varen to open a portal to Sancre Tor.
Now that I've searched <<1>>'s home, I should speak with <<2>>.
Kasura has been injured. I should listen to what she knows about the attack.
Sir Etienne has been murdered. I should investigate <<1>>'s home for clues.
Medya's no longer in her home. I should speak to Medya's apprentice, <<1>>. He's on the docks with the others.
I need to search the Hamlet for Medya as she may be in danger, just as Sir Etienne was. \n\nI should search inside the homes for her or for any clues which might help me find her.
A letter inside one of the homes indicated that Medya goes to a specific site at night, but that nobody knows what she does there. I should look for her there.
A strange-looking Goblin in Breton clothing seems to be waiting for me outside Malofar's inner sanctum. I think it wants to talk to me.
The Goblin claims to be a Breton and wants me to follow him. He says he knows the way out of these caves.
I followed the strange Goblin. He wants to talk to me again. I should see what he wants to tell me.
The strange Goblin was one of Lady Laurent's hirelings. He led me to a way out of the cave. I should leave now and return to Lady Laurent's camp.
Both Stenwick and Elara say killing spriggans will reveal the location of the Voice of the Forest.

I reported my suspicious findings to Duke Renchant, but he was evasive and unhelpful. One of the clues points to a ship in the harbor known as the Bjoulsae Queen. I should investigate the ship's hold.
I have killed the Hagraven Uela, freeing the crows she enslaved. Now I must bring her heart back to Wyress Rashan outside the tower.
Uela is dead and the wyresses now wish to use her heart in a ritual to cleanse the forest. Once they've begun the ritual, I should throw Uela's heart into the ritual circle.
The amulet is clearly magical, but I can't discern its purpose. I should look around the area for clues regarding this person's demise.
I convinced <<1>> to destroy the amulet, ending its threat forever.
The queen asked me to speak with <<1>> about quelling the unrest in <<2>>. I should be able to find him in his throne room.
<<1>> has driven <<2>> mad. If I'm going to recover it, I must defeat her.
I need to make my way through the vault's traps and guardians to locate the resting place of <<1>>. If I alert her to do so, <<2>>'s construct can freeze them in place.
<<1>> fought me after <<2>> drove her mad. I should retrieve it from her corpse.

I found a journal describing how the dead man obtained the amulet near <<1>>. The journal mentioned the previous owner of the amulet was from there. I should head to <<1>> Cemetery and see what I can find.
I should find <<1>> in <<2>> and book passage to <<3>>.
I found a journal mentioning the previous owner of the amulet. I should search for his tombstone in <<1>> and see if I can learn anything.
I found a gravestone for Lesahanar, one of the amulet's previous owners. <<1>>, his widow, approached me while I was at his grave. I should see if she knows more about the amulet.
<<1>> directed me to <<2>>, where I might find the jeweler who crafted this amulet. I should travel there before the amulet begins to influence me, as it did to her late husband.
I should search <<1>> for the jeweler who made the amulet. If I can't find him, I should ask merchants around <<1>> for directions.

I found <<1>>, the amulet's creator. When I told him what happened, he seemed distraught it had harmed so many people. I should decide whether to let him punish himself or encourage him to destroy the amulet.
I convinced <<1>> to wear the amulet, as a just punishment for the deaths he caused.
The captain of the Albatross can tell me more about the mutiny than <<1>>, her wounded crewman. I should speak with her.
Uela is dead and the wyresses now wish to use her heart in a ritual to cleanse the forest. Once they've begun the ritual, I should throw Uela's heart into the ritual circle.
The Voice of the Forest refused my request for a bud from her branches, but will surrender one if I helped sprout some of her spriggan children from the troll dens.
Only one spriggan remains in the area, and Wyress Shannia says she is poisoned and will transform into a lurcher if something isn't done.
I must gather pure heartwood from the lurchers to prevent the transformation and heal the spriggan.
I must bring this pure heartwood to Shannia so she can prevent the transformation and heal the spriggan.
I must apply Shannia's pure heartwood poultice to prevent a transformation and heal the spriggan.
I applied the pure heartwood poultice and the last spriggan seems to be recovering. I should speak to <<1>> to see if there's anything else I can do.
Though the last spriggan is recovering, many were killed. To avenge them, <<1>> asked me to destroy the transformation altar and kill the witchman who has been turning the spriggans into lurchers.
Though the last spriggan is recovering, many were killed. To avenge them, I've destroyed the transformation altar, and I now must kill the witchman who's been turning the spriggans into lurchers.
I destroyed the transformation altar and defeated the witchman responsible for the lurcher creations. I need to return to Wyress Shannia, and let her know.
I destroyed the transformation altar and defeated the witchman responsible for the lurcher creations. I need to return to Wyress Shannia, and let her know.
The Imperial hold a bandit named <<1>> near the mine. I need to find a way to set her free.
<<1>> is being held prisoner in the camp. I should speak to her to see if she knows where the key to her manacles is being kept.

<<1>> asked me to enter the mine to find the conscripted Foreman, a man named Connor. He will be able to take the key and free the miners.\n\n<<1>> will meanwhile search for <<2>>, the Imperial who commands the Seventh Legion at <<3>>.
I should see whether Snaruga and Rahannal made it back to the other side of the camp, and let them know that Panthius Varro is dead.
<<1>> sent me to find his missing scouts. He told me to search for Hatmi and Isabeth in the chapel, north of the Evermore encampment.
I found an injured woman inside the chapel. I should speak to her and find out if she's one of Gaercroft's scouts.
<<1>> said <<2>> was heading toward a wyress camp just beyond the chapel. Hopefully, I can catch up to her there.
Now that I've arrived at the wyrd camp, I should speak to one of the wyresses there, and see if <<1>> is here.
I should find <<1>> within the ruins and speak to her about <<2>>.
<<1>> said she had one last attempt at curing <<2>>. She wants me to watch as she tries it.
The spell didn't work, and <<1>> died. I should speak to <<2>> about what happened.
I agreed to go into the fields and destroy the Reachmen's markers with the rune <<1>> gave me.
Now that I've destroyed the markers, I need to seek out the Dark Witness leader, <<1>>. If Isabeth left to search houses too, perhaps I'll find him in one as well.
With the markers and seed stores destroyed and <<1>> defeated, I can return to the Evermore camp. Hopefully, <<2>> is already there.
<<1>> called out to her father, <<2>> as we arrived. I should wait until they've finished talking.
<<1>> exposed the seed within <<2>> and wants her executed. I should speak to <<2>> about the situation.
I should speak to <<1>> about the alliance with the Glenmoril Wyrd.
I've burned the Imperial raiders' boats. I should return to Knight Commander Cheryline.
I have found the key and should return to <<1>> and free her.
I need to locate Squire Theo at the docks to learn how I can help the village.

<<1>> suggested that I should destroy the Seventh Legion's stockpile of coal at the farthest end of the mine.\n\nIt will serve as a distraction for the miners to escape and also hinder the Seventh Legion's efforts at the mine.
I should defeat the guards rushing to extinguish the fire, giving <<1>> more time to find the Imperials' leader.
I should find <<1>> and see if I can assist him. It sounded like he was in trouble.
I should kill Panthius Varro for what he's done to the prisoners here.
I should talk to Knight Commander Cheryline and see how I can help.
Knight Commander Cheryline has asked me to press the advantage by burning the Imperial boats on the shore of the lake.
Silver Paws revealed that he doesn't have the polutices, but he had sent Baandari herbalists to the lake to gather supplies to make them. They haven't returned though, so I should go look for them.
We've defeated the Imperial raiders. I should speak to Knight Commander Cheryline.
Knight Commander Cheryline needs healing poultices, and she thinks the Baandari have some. She asked me to talk to Silver-Paws, the leader of the Baandari Traders, about getting some poultices.
Silver-Paws says he'll trade healing poultices for some of the knights' bows. I should talk to Knight Commander Cheryline to see if she'll make the trade.
Silver-Paws is going to give me the healing poultices for the Knights of Saint Pelin. I should talk to him.
Knight Commander Cheryline is willing to trade the Alessian bows to the Baandari in exchange for poultices. I need to pick up the bows from the chest and take them to Silver-Paws.
I can help her finish the ritual or make sure she fails. Doing the latter would ensure her death, but would free the forest.

I rescued the Baandari herbalists and learned that Imperial raiders were seen coming this way in boats. Deepswimmer has gone back to warn everyone at Martyr's Crossing. I should return and speak to Knight Commander Cheryline.
Knight Commander Cheryline asked me to help defend the northeast entrance to Martyr's Crossing against the Imperial raiders.
I've recovered <<1>> and freed <<2>>. I should deliver the relic to <<3>> so it can be properly contained.
Countess Tamrith is meeting with the other nobles in the Shornhelm chapel. I should go there and talk to her.
I should speak with Countess Eselde Tamrith and offer my assistance.

Countess Tamrith has asked me to eliminate the traitors who helped Montclair take control of the upper city. She also wants me to find evidence that may shed light on Montclair's unusually aggressive behavior.

I dealt with the traitors and discovered that Baron Montclair isn't in Shornhelm. He's left his general, Reezal-Jul, to oversee the occupation. They plan to bring in more reinforcements through the Fevered Mews. I should let Baron Dorell know.
I found a key on one of the guards, so now I need to free the nobles from their cages.
<<1>> ran to get a weapon, but said she'd meet <<2>> and I at the eastern entrance to the mine.
Reezal-Jul escaped after opening a portal for his reinforcements to arrive through. I must defeat the reinforcements and find a way to stop more from coming through the portal before it's too late.

With the help of Verandis Ravenwatch, I stopped reinforcements from coming in through the Fevered Mews. Shornhelm should now be be safe. I should speak to Verandis before reporting back to the house leaders.

Verandis believes that the upper city is back in the control of Countess Tamrith and Baron Dorell. He said I should find them in Shornhelm Castle, along with High King Emeric, and tell them what transpired in the Fevered Mews.
Now that Shornhelm is safe, I should talk to High King Emeric and figure out what happens next.
The dream-walk through Verandis's memory of the Doomcrag has come to an end. I should find Verandis and speak to him.
I decided not to warn Lady Laurent about the cup's magic. I should give her the Emerald Chalice now.
I should give the Emerald Chalice to Lady Laurent, but I need to decide if I want to warn her about its magic or not.
I should speak with Enthoras about this opportunity.

I rescued the Baandari herbalists and learned that Imperial raiders were seen coming this way in boats. A Baandari scout just reported that they're about to attack even now. I should speak to Knight Commander Cheryline.
I promised that I would deliver a letter to Gorvyn Dran's cousin. Let her know he's all right and that he made it into Stonefalls. I should be able to find her at the Serk.
The prince is dead and put to rest. I should talk to Dame Valyrie and find out what she plans to do next.
The prince appears to have been resurrected. The knight at his side says it's a miracle. I should speak with the prince.
