The alchemist <<1>>, who'd devised the wine the bandits stole, said <<2>>'s housecarl <<3>> is interested in <<4>>.  I should discuss what I found with him.
I should travel to <<1>> in <<2>>.
<<1>> described <<2>> as a "quiet little town," but nothing could be further from the truth. I should find someone in charge and discover what exactly is happening.
The wine seems to encourage one to want more of it with every taste. I should consult with an alchemist in <<1>> to figure out its purpose. I'll probably find an alchemist in the Mages Guild.
I drank the wine until I blacked out, and woke up in <<1>>.  I should talk to <<2>> to find out what happened.
<<1>> mentioned that <<2>>'s housecarl <<3>> wishes to speak with me after my drunken escapade.
Now that the necromancer is dealt with, I should return to Ivarstead and let Brendar know.
With the Green Lady off to confront the Hound in the town of Silvenar, I should search around <<1>> for any sign of <<c:2>> or his capture.
With the Green Lady off to confront the Hound in the town of Silvenar, I should search around <<1>> for any sign of <<c:2>> or his capture.
<<1>> took my diamond and directed me to the graveyard behind the Fighters Guild in <<2>>. Fresh flowers on the cairn indicate my payment is inside.
I found a sheaf of notes near the campfire.  Perhaps they will provide clues.

A group of bandits hid here after a heist, and judging from the skeletons, the beasts killed them. The author of the notes mentioned hiding a diamond in his false tooth. Perhaps his skeleton is still here.
I should speak to a deputy in Koeglin Village.
Though I've already recaptured the lighthouse, I should give the plans to Deputy Luric.
Varen has been spoken with. I should say my farewells to Lyris.
Cadwell wanted to speak with me.
Lyris has been spoken with. I should say my farewells to Sai Sahan.
Cadwell wants to speak with me.
Sai Sahan has been spoken with. I should say my farewells to Varen Aquilarios.
Cadwell wants to speak with me.
Malma asked me to search for her brother, Brendar. He's somewhere inside the barrow.
I should hunt down this necromancer Brendar spoke of and put an end to his crimes.
Nyronie interrupted my conversation with Linnae. I should listen to see what she has to say.
I defeated <<1>>, returning the power she stole from <<Ac:2>>. I should inform <<3>> as soon as I can.
I recovered the diamond. From the note, I should take it to <<1>>, a fence in <<2>>.
I should speak to <<1>> and find out what to do now.

To enter the Chamber of Passage and rescue King Emeric from Imperial Magus-General Septima Tharn, I need the blessing of heroes' spirits. To earn Frandar Hunding's blessing, I must collect scrolls and restore them to pedestals in his burial chamber.
Septima Tharn stabbed King Emeric and then vanished. The king appears to be wounded, perhaps mortally. I should speak to him.
I must reach Riften and speak to the brothers.
I must find and free Nathon.
I must free Israk and then help him free his brother Nathon.
I should travel to Rivenspire and find someone who can help me better understand the nature of the conflict between the noble houses.
Now that <<1>> is dead, I should help the Countess find <<2>>.
Countess Tamrith is torn, but she believes that her sister should die rather than become a vampire. I should talk to Captain Janeve and see what she thinks before I make a decision.

I agreed with Countess Tamrith that Captain Janeve should die. It's better than letting her turn into a monster. While the Countess takes care of her sister, I should head outside and find Darien. He'll want to know what happened in here.
The Five Companions are assembling for the ritual.
Bumnog asked me to look for the Remly brothers, who set out to set traps for the harpies and have yet to return.
I've found one of the Remly brothers. He appears to be caught in a trap. I should find a way to free him.
I've freed Balin from his trap. I'd better ask him where I can find his brother.
I told <<1>> the truth about Bumnog, and the Remly brothers. It doesn't look as though they'll be paid for the job.
I need to drink from the Basin of Suffering to learn about Lamae Bal, the mother of all vampires.
I need to drink from the Basin of Loss to continue learning about Lamae Bal, the mother of all vampires.
We found <<1>>. Now <<2>> wants to speak to me.
I found Darien. I should talk to him and let him know what happened inside Reezal-Jul's cave.
Balin's asked me to go find his brother. He also wants me to set the remaining traps at the scent lures his brother deployed.
Hidden; Destroy Trap & Free Armel
I've found the brothers and helped them with their task on the cliffs. I should return to the Vale, to speak to the brothers and Bumnog.
The harpy hunters are getting a tongue lashing from the village elder. I should listen.
The Remly brothers, still covered in their scent lure, have attracted a flock of harpies to the village. I should follow them to protect them while they wash the scent off.
The Remly brothers are washing off the scent lure in the pond. I should protect them while they clean themselves.
Verandis wants me to follow him. I may as well see what he wants to show me.
Verandis wants me to examine his memories. He thinks I may be able to see something that he missed. All I need to do is drink the potion on the table. I should drink the potion and see what happens.
Bumnog asked me to lie about their prowess to cover for them so they can get paid. The village's elder will want to know how the crew did.\n\nI can lie to protect them, or tell <<1>> the truth.
I lied to <<1>>, saying the crew worked alone. I should talk to Bumnog and find out what's next for them.

Scholar Cantier wants to know what happened in the final moments of the battle, here where King Ranser made his last stand against the Orcs of Wrothgar. I agreed to escort him to the central tower to look for answers.
I should see if the gem Handre mentioned is still hidden on his body.
I found the gem. Now I should attempt to locate Master Ozalan in Hoarfrost Downs and carry out Handre's wish.
With luck, Master Ozalan is still interested in trading Fadeel for the gem.
Before I entered the camp within the cavern, Bumnog signaled that he wants to talk with me at its entrance.
I should inform <<1>> that the Aldmeri Dominion is aware of the murders.
As promised, I've turned Althen over to the Ring of Daggers in Hoarfrost Downs. I need to speak to Marisette.
The Remly brothers washed the scent off, and we managed to kill all the attacking harpies. I should return to the campsite in the caves.
I should make my way there.
I need to make my way to the Fevered Mews so that I can free the captured nobles and stop Reezal-Jul from bringing in more reinforcements.
Marisette told me that one of Althen's friends came here to help him but was killed by a troll. She suggested I check to see if he was carrying a clue to Althen's hiding place.
The letter I found revealed that Althen is hiding inside the central crypt in the barrows. I should go search for him there.

Althen has sealed himself inside the main crypt in Sanguine Barrows. He wants me to have mercy and help him escape from the Ring of Daggers. To that end, he asked me to read a letter in his pack, which he mistakenly dropped.

Now that I know about Althen's attempts to atone for his crimes, he's told me how to get into his hiding place. Now that I have the keys, I should activate the levers that will open the door into the crypt.
The door leading into the crypt should be unsealed. I should go inside and confront Althen.
I finally found Althen himself. I should speak to him.

Althen has asked me to show mercy, but he's agreed to let me decide his fate. I can either lead him to Hoarfrost Downs and turn him in to Marisette, or I can lead him to the other side of the barrows and set him free.
I decided to lead Althen to the edge of Sanguine Barrows and set him free. I should speak to him once more to say goodbye.
I agreed to find <<1>>. If he still lives, I may be able to help save <<Ac:2>>.
I should speak with Scholar Cantier at the southeast entrance to the ruins to learn more.
The letter I found in Althen's backpack reveals that he has gone to great lengths to try to atone for the atrocities he committed during the war. I need to return to him and tell him I read it.
Now that I know about Althen's attempts to atone for his crimes, he's told me how to get into his hiding place. I must first find the keys to two levers that will open the door.
I killed Gavendien and recovered the stolen jewels. I should return to Constable Agazu and give her the jewels.
I agreed to track Gavendien down and kill him for the crimes he committed in Fell's Run.
I should talk to people around town and try to gather any clues as to what they might be hiding.
I should speak to Martin Dathieu to find out why he doesn't want to enlist in the guard. Perhaps I can discover clues that might help me convince him to join up.
I should speak to some of the people around town to learn more about the case against Martin and his relationshop with his family. Then I should return to Martin and try to convince him to enlist.
I convinced Martin to enlist. I should speak to Captain Thayer and let her know.
I convinced Martin to enlist. I should speak to Captain Thayer and let her know.
I convinced Martin to enlist. I should speak to Captain Thayer and let her know.
I convinced Martin to enlist. I should speak to Captain Thayer and let her know.
I should talk to Shuga and see what it will take to get her to enlist in the guard.
Shuga made a deal with me. If I can defeat her boyfriend, she'll enlist in the Shornhelm Guard. Her boyfriend, Goveled, can apparently be found on the road that leads south out of Hoarfrost Downs.
Shuga's agreed to enlist in the Shornhelm Guard. I should go and tell Captain Thayer.
I found a note from Bailiff Sagabar to Constable Gavendien referring to hostages being held at an unknown location. I should find Agazu in the inn and show her the note.
Before I leave Wayrest, Emeric asked for help with a personal matter. I'm to speak to Captain Ernele and ensure that the guillotine is being dismantled efficiently and thoroughly.
I need to head to the hills northeast of Shornhelm to meet up with Verandis Ravenwatch.
Khalisah gave me the necklace for Julien to give Guendeline, but I also learned that she is in love with Julien. I should speak with him about what to do next.
Now that he knows of Khalisah's true feelings, Julien has decided that she is a better choice than Guendeline. I need to return the necklace to Khalisah and tell her of Julien's feelings.
I collected stolen gems from the Bitterhand Bandits. Now I should take the gems to Khalisah, who can make a necklace for Julien to give Guendeline.
Julien has asked me to give the necklace to Guendeline on his behalf in the hope that it will win her heart.
Julien decided that a necklace is the best way to win Guendeline's heart. I agreed to go into the Bitterhand Bandits' camp and collect stolen gems from the bandits for the necklace.
I should speak to Julien and learn what it will take to convince him to enlist in the Shornhelm Guard.
The woman occupying Julien's thoughts is Guendeline Ascenge. I should speak to Guendeline and find out how Julien can win her heart.
I should ask around town to learn more about Guendeline's tastes and then I should speak with Julien and advise him on how to win her heart.
I've promised Julien that I'll retrieve some Dunlain Daisies so that we can give them to Guendeline and win her heart.
I've collected the Dunlain Daisies and I should now give them to Guendeline on Julien's behalf.
Julien has agreed to enlist. I should speak with Captain Thayer and tell her that he will be along shortly.

Julien and I have decided that a poem would be the best way to win Guendeline's heart. I should speak with people around town to see if I can get some options. Then I should return to Julien and tell him what to do.
Julien has agreed to enlist. I should speak with Captain Thayer and tell her that he will be along shortly.
Julien has agreed to enlist. I should speak with Captain Thayer and tell her that he will be along shortly.
I should watch Julien recite the poem to Guendeline.
Julien has agreed to enlist. I should speak with Captain Thayer and tell her that he will be along shortly.
One of the "Imperials" managed to let slip that they have hidden Lyris's armor. I should see if I can find it.
I found a key that should open the trap door in the west tower. I should meet Verandis and enter the chambers beneath the ruins.
I need to find Skordo, who has taken a small group and secured a vantage point outside the city. Once I locate him, I can help carry out their plan to liberate Northpoint.
<<1>> took me from the docks of Vulkhel Guard to <<2>>. I should look for <<3>> at <<4>>.
I gave Guendeline the daisies, but she was not appreciative, and now she wants nothing to do with Julien. I should give him the bad news and see if I can't still convince him to enlist.
I appear to be getting the last bit of information from the speaking stones. I should wait until everything plays out and is revealed.
I followed Verandis to an ornate book pedestal. I should give him a moment to examine the ancient tome resting upon it.
The poem didn't work, and Guendeline wants nothing more to do with Julien. I should speak with him and see if I still might convince him to enlist.
Montclair triggered ancient wards and awakened Ayleid defenders within the ruins. I need to find a way to reach the first portal chamber so I can open a path for our troops to ascend.
We've gathered at the base of the Doomcrag and are ready to make our final assault against Baron Montclair. I should speak to Verandis and see if he has any final words before we begin.
Guendeline liked the poem and professed her love to Julien. I should speak to Julien about his promise to enlist.
Orders from Gavendien reveal that the hostages are being held at an old mill north of town. I should share this information with Constable Agazu.
Guendeline really likes the necklace and now professes her love for Julien. I should tell Julien and remind him of his promise to enlist.
Khalisah is extremely moved to learn that Julien returns her feelings. She wants to hear it from him, though. I should let Julien know.
Julien has agreed to enlist. I should speak with Captain Thayer and tell her that he will be along shortly.
Julien has agreed to enlist. I should speak with Captain Thayer and tell her that he will be along shortly.
Julien has agreed to enlist. I should speak with Captain Thayer and tell her that he will be along shortly.
I defeated Shuga's boyfriend, Goveled. I should return to tell Shuga what happened and make sure she fulfills her promise to enlist in the Shornhelm Guard.
I restored the Warrior's Apex Stone, but the Serpent told me that he has trapped the Warrior in a mortal form. I should tell the Star-Gazer researcher what I've learned.
Baron Dorell is dealing with his son, Ellic. When he's finished, I should talk to the Baron and let him know what Verandis told me.
Adusa wants to make our stand against the assassins inside the castle. I should follow her.
I've been asked to help find the missing knights and recover the holy relics.
I opened the second portal. Baron Dorell was the first one through. I should speak to him.
I found Beryn's friend. I should head back to their camp to see how <<1>> is doing.
I killed Gavendien. Now I should recover the stolen jewels.
A second portal chamber is supposed to be located higher up, on the third level of the pass. I need to make my way there and open the second portal.
I opened the first portal and Verandis has emerged from it. Now I should speak to Verandis and see what he wants me to do next.
<<1>> has elected to leave the <<2>>, while <<3>> has resolved to stay. <<4>> wants to speak with me before I go.
With no other leads to go on, the manor house seems like a good place to begin our search.
In the chambers of the Baroness, we found a journal indicating she was most concerned about their servant, <<1>>. A search of the servant's quarters may prove enlightening.
<<1>> indicates an affair was going on between her and <<2>>. What's more, it suggests that the Baroness hid something in the windmill not far from the estate.
Hidden away in a toolbox, we found a key to the manor undercroft. Perhaps we will find what we are searching for, there.
A thorough search of the Undercroft may be the only way to uncover what happened here.
I located a ritual book detailing the process of opening a portal to somewhere called the Deadlands.
I managed to affect a change in the atmosphere surrounding the Daedric gateway in the center of the Undercroft. I should continue experimenting with the basins to see what I can accomplish.
Further success in my attempts to activate the gateway! These basins are the key.
I managed to activate the Daedric portal. If the tome is correct, it should lead to somewhere known as the Deadlands.
We found <<1>> and <<2>> on the other side of the portal, evidently unharmed.
<<1>> will accompany on my search for the Baron and Baroness Edrald.
The Edrald family has been safely returned to their estate. I should speak with <<1>> and see if there is anything else I can do.
Both <<1>> and <<2>> have decided to leave <<3>> to seek their fortune in the world abroad.\n\n<<4>> wants to speak with me before I go.
Both <<1>> and <<2>> have elected to stay at the <<3>>. <<4>> wants to speak with me before I go.
<<1>> has elected to leave the <<2>>, while <<3>> has resolved to stay.\n\n<<4>> wants to speak with me before I go.
The Thief told me I should visit the Lord, Lady, and Steed Mundus Stones in Craglorn to imbue the amulet with their power.
<<1>> may know where I can find the rest of her family.
I will need to ignite the coal stockpile to destroy it.
Adusa headed into the manor house to confront Rohlbert Montclair. I should follow her.
Adusa and I have defeated Rohlbert Montclair. I should leave the manor house and meet Adusa outside.
I need to find Baron Dorell outside the city of Northpoint and offer whatever help I can.

Touching the Mundus Stones gave me visions of the Thief, who told me that the Warrior had gone mad because the Serpent's followers have poisoned his Apex Mundus Stone. I need to reach the inner ruins of Kardala and restore the Warrior's Apex Stone.
I've reached the Ruins of Kardala beneath the temple. I should search for the chamber that houses the Warrior's Apex Stone.
After making it through the sealed door, I found the Warrior's Apex Stone. I should be able to use the blessings of the Lord, the Lady, and the Steed to restore the Apex Stone.
I've skimmed the journal I found. Perhaps giving it a deeper read would reveal more of Nedras' story.
I need to reach each checkpoint and then cross the finish line in time, without falling off of my horse!
Before I begin the race, I should speak with one of the priests to learn the rules.
I wasn't able to complete the race. I should speak to one of the priests to try again.
I need to reach the first checkpoint. The Priests of Kynareth have cast brightly colored beacons along the path for me to follow.
Once I'm ready, the Priest will begin a countdown to begin the race.
I felt sorry for <<1>>. I decided to give her some gold and say it was from her brother. She seems very grateful.
In order to begin the race, I should go to the starting line and get on my mount.
With the Edrald family safe, I must see about destroying the <<1>> to ensure this portal remains forever sealed.
<<1>> has decided to remain with the Edrald family. <<2>> wants to speak with me before I leave.
<<1>> has decided to leave the <<2>>. <<3>> wants to speak with me before I leave.
The book seemed to indicate the basins are the key to activating the gate. A note scrawled in the margin said that the fire basin is the one to start with first.
I need to go to the Shrouded Pass and meet up with Count Verandis Ravenwatch.
I should use the portal to Shornhelm and seek out High King Emeric.
Julien has agreed to enlist. I should speak with Captain Thayer and tell her that he will be along shortly.
Julien has agreed to enlist. I should speak with Captain Thayer and tell her that he will be along shortly.
Julien has agreed to enlist. I should speak with Captain Thayer and tell her that he will be along shortly.
Julien has agreed to enlist. I should speak with Captain Thayer and tell her that he will be along shortly.
Julien has agreed to enlist. I should speak with Captain Thayer and tell her that he will be along shortly.
Julien has agreed to enlist. I should speak with Captain Thayer and tell her that he will be along shortly.
Julien has agreed to enlist. I should speak with Captain Thayer and tell her that he will be along shortly.
As I searched the bodies, a vision of a Dremora woman appeared and threatened Merric. Aelif seemed very suprised. I should speak to her.
Aelif ordered me back to the Guildhall, to report to Sees-All-Colors. I should return and tell her what I've seen.
I destroyed the crystals and reversed the curse. I should return to the sapling to see what happened.
By removing their Matron, as well as a Covenant spy working with her, I'll weaken the Reachmen's grip.
Now that the Reachmen's Matron and her Covenant accomplice are dead, I should return to Shor's Stone and tell <<1>>.
<<1>> has hidden a disguise in his cot. I can use it to slip past the Pact and Heritance guards. I should take the disguise and put it on.
The Herald begged me to aid Craglorn against these threats. He has prepared a horse and carriage to take me there. I should board the cart when I'm ready to travel to Craglorn.
I learned that the Star-Gazers could be found in the observatory which overlooks Belkarth. Maybe I can find Hara there.
I found Hara in the Star-Gazer's headquarters in Belkarth. She may be able to tell me more about events in Craglorn, as well as the Star-Gazers.
Hara asked me to join the Star-Gazers and aid her in unraveling the problems facing Craglorn. I must agree to help her before we can proceed.
I agreed to join the Order of Star-Gazers and aid Craglorn. I must now undergo their initiation ritual.
I have been accepted as a Star-Gazer. I must complete my initiation by speaking to Hara.
Holgunn One-Eye asked me to go to Pinepeak Cavern and make sure Lieutenant Slonn is all right.
<<1>> asked that I seek out <<2>> in Taarengrav.
<<1>> asked that I seek out <<2>> at Honrich Tower.
<<1>> asked me to seek out <<2>> at <<3>>.
I should return to Dathlyn outside of Softloam Cavern to let her know the portal has been closed.
I should find the portal deep within Softloam Cavern. Dathlyn said I'd need to destroy the two crystals that sustain it in order to close it.
Hjagir asked me to help her find information about the Goblin retreat from their caverns. I should search Hightide Hollow for information on what drove the beastmen out.
A set of orders from the Daggers were deep inside Hightide Hollow. They should allow the Pact soldiers to stop the Covenant's plan. I should take these orders to Hjagir.
Caalorne says the Argonians retreated to a cave on the hill with his wares. I should be able to find the potions there.
I have Caalorne's potions. I should return them to him.
Sees-Many-Paths thinks the best way to get word to her egg-sister is via the soldiers at Fort Virak. Someone there can get word to Walks-in-Ash, wherever she is.
Onuja said I should travel to Davon's Watch on the northeastern end of Stonefalls and speak to Holgunn. He said they can use my help against the Daggerfall Covenant.
I need to get to Davon's Watch and report to Holgunn. Virmar told me I can find the city on the eastern shore of Stonefalls.
I should go to Vivec's Antlers and report to the soldiers there.
The duchess asked me to speak with Thoda, the commander of the Redguards outside Alcaire Castle. To get his attention, she suggested I fight some of his soldiers to prove my mettle.
The Pact officers at Ash Mountain may need my help with their ritual.
I found Stands-In-Still-Water, but he was dead. I managed to recover a dagger from his body. I should find Shuldrashi at the farm she mentioned she was traveling to near Kragenmoor.
Shuldrashi asked me to search north of Ash Mountain for her hunting partner. If I find Stands-In-Still-Water, I should tell him she's gone to a farm near Kragenmoor.
Parquier thinks the Hagraven headed toward the lighthouse where he and his wife live. She may still have the mace with her. I should head in that direction and see what I find.
I didn't find a Hagraven, but I met Parquier's wife. <<1>> thinks her husband lost the mace and his shoes somewhere along the river. I'll look for the <<2>> there.
<<1>> said he would meet me at the lighthouse after his head stopped spinning. I should locate him and let him know I found the mace. And maybe even his shoes.
I found Parquier's missing mace and his missing shoes. I should talk to him so I can return them to him.
Countess Tamrith's priest needs help to perform the appropriate rituals to sanctify the dead. I should find him near the front of the camp.
I should seek out <<1>> and see what's going on.
I should speak with a Murtag clan officer at the encampment.
I agreed to deal with Lleraya's remaining vampires for Blademaster Qariar. He's given me the locations where he thinks they're hiding. I need to go to each location and take out each vampire.
I cleared the last of the vampires from the three houses they were hiding in. Now I should return to Blademaster Qariar and let him know that Northpoint is relatively safe now.
I should find Brother Doumant at Pariah Abbey and give him Oorga's offering.
I should speak to the Prophet.
I cleared the last of the vampires from the three houses they were hiding in. Now I should return to Blademaster Qariar and let him know that Northpoint is relatively safe now.
I entered the Hall of Trials. I need to reach the arena and hurry to King Jorunn's side.
Among the officer's belongings, I found a map to a Lion Guard outpost south of the graveyard. His commander will want to know his fate.
I've collected the shard-keys. Now I must enter Angof's Sanctum.
I need to find the one in Vivec's trial who is guilty of the murder. To do that, I'll have to talk to everyone to find out exactly what happened.
The trial of Sotha Sil involves repairing constructs and then destroying them. I should examine the Arbiter of Perfection and its surroundings to get started.
I dealt with the mammoths. I should return to <<1>> and inform him.
The <<1>> is pronouncing its judgment. I should wait to see the outcome.
It appears that Edouard Celd is the Montclair informant. I should gather whatever information I can about Celd and his connection to House Montclair.
I set off the signal. I should wait for Walks-in-Ash to arrive.
I unlocked to way to the Mooring. Vanus and I need to go there to destroy the Great Shackle.
<<1>> said to get into the mystics' sanctum, find out what I can, and steal a key to the mine.
I'll need to seek out a member of the Vulkhel Watch to turn over sealed message.
There might be a hidden entrance around back of the manor that could get me inside.
I've found the hidden entrance to Valano Manor. I should use it to get inside.
I protected Vanus Galerion while he weakened the Great Shackle. I should watch the Shackle fall.
<<1>> wants me to help her find her brother, the town consul Dethisam. She thinks he may have gone to check on the afflicted townsfolk before he disappeared.
I need to find Aerona Berendas and make sure she made it out of the quarantine safely. I'll check to see if she's with her uncle.
Firtorel, the bard at the Queen's camp, suggested I find a guard to report to once I reached Vulkhel Guard.
I should start by reading Nidras's letters to learn the names of his victims.
I should talk to <<1>> in the Mages Guild to follow up on the staff's disappearance.
The Light of Meridia is ready to be unleashed on the Planar Vortex. I must activate it before it's too late!
I need to find the one in Vivec's trial who is guilty of the murder. To do that, I'll have to talk to everyone to find out exactly what happened.
I need to find the one in Vivec's trial who is guilty of the murder. To do that, I'll have to talk to everyone to find out exactly what happened.

We've talked to a few townsfolk and witnessed the effects of the Llodos plague firsthand, but we're no closer to finding Dethisam. Aerona is growing increasingly anxious about her brother. I should talk to her.
The Maulborn attacked us, but I found the old graveyard key. Now we can enter the Maulborn quarantine and find out what they're hiding in there.
We're inside the Maulborn quarantine. I should see what I can discover about the Maulborn's activities here.
I should plant the Kollopi Seeds around the Wood Orcs' camp. The seeds will sprout into guardians that will help drive the Wood Orcs away.
I've destroyed the Hollow Watchman and the Bosmer should now be safe to settle here. I should speak to Indanas.

Erold told me about an amulet of the ancient Nedic high priests that allows the bearer to access the chamber where the Apex Stone rests. I need to travel to the Dwemer ruin of Mtharnaz to find this amulet.
I've agreed to find the Bosmer leader, Indanas, and help fight against the Hollow.
I agreed to lead Indanas to the large holes from which the Hollow are coming forth. I will protect her while she collapses the holes, and hopefully this will slow the Hollow down.
After closing several of the holes from which the Hollow were coming, Indanas suggested we go to the Clan Holdfast.
I accompanied Indanas to the Clan Holdfast, where one of the Hollow has appeared. I should listen to what he has to say.
One of the Hollow appeared in the Clan Holdfast and warned the Bosmer that they must leave before retreating through a hole in the ground. Indanas went after him. I should go after her.
The Hollow Watchman has subdued Indanas. I should speak to him about the clan's desire to settle here.

The Hollow Watchman says that settling here is forbidden because it would harm Valenwood, but Indanas insists that her clan will fight for this land. I must choose whether to side with the Bosmer refugees or the Hollow Watchman.
I defeated the clan leader and those Bosmer determined to settle on these forbidden grounds. I should speak with the Hollow Watchman.
The only way to stop the Hollow from attacking the Bosmer is to destroy the Hollow Watchman. I'll need to find him first, and then destroy him.
I've destroyed the Hollow Watchman and the Bosmer should now be safe to settle here. I should return to the Clan Holdfast and speak to Indanas.

I've decided that the Hollow Watchman is right. The Bosmer refugees have to move on. Indanas has returned to hold a vote to see if her people will leave or stay and fight. I should return to the Clan Holdfast and see what happened.
I've decided that the Hollow Watchman is right. The Bosmer refugees have to move on. I've returned to the Clan Holdfast, and it appears Indanas remains determined. I have no choice but to fight her.
I defeated the clan leader and those Bosmer determined to settle on these forbidden grounds. I should leave the Clan Holdfast.
I defeated the clan leader and those Bosmer determined to settle on these forbidden grounds. I should speak with the Hollow Watchman.
My dream-walk through the memories of Verandis Ravenwatch continues. In this memory, I need to accompany Baron Montclair to the top of the Doomcrag to find the Ayleid relic.

My dream-walk through the memories of Verandis Ravenwatch continues. We've entered the lower level of the Doomcrag and activated some type of ancient defenseâ€”animated skeletons. We must defeat them before we can proceed.
My dream-walk through the memories of Verandis Ravenwatch continues. In this memory, I need to accompany Baron Montclair to the top of the Doomcrag to find the Ayleid relic.

My dream-walk through the memories of Verandis Ravenwatch continues. We've entered the second level of the Doomcrag and activated some type of ancient defenseâ€”a bone colossus. We must defeat the creature before we can proceed.
My dream-walk through the memories of Verandis Ravenwatch continues. In this memory, I need to accompany Baron Montclair to the top of the Doomcrag to find the Ayleid relic.
I might be able to get a key off one of the guards. That would let me inside the manor.
I've found a key to Valano Manor. I should use it to get inside.
I should see the village and find out what's going on. It's hidden from view within a cave.
I entered the cave. I should find someone at the village itself who can tell me how it came to exist.
The village will choose their next caretaker at the Fading Tree. They've invited me to watch as the name is selected.
I decided to let <<1>> go through with his plan. I need to convince Aerona to let him go and get to safety.

The Maulborn are producing the Llodos plague in one of the deeper chambers, but the chamber directly ahead of me is filled with plague husks. I need to find a way through there so I can reach the production facilities.

I need to destroy the Maulborn production facility. I should destroy any research I find, as well as the stockpiles of Llodos plague that have already been produced. And if Nostrum Breva is present, I should eliminate her.
I destroyed the Maulborn production facilities. Now I should get out of the quarantine and make sure Aerona escaped safely.
I need to find Aerona Berendas and make sure she made it out of the quarantine safely. I'll check to see if she's with her uncle.
I need to find Aerona Berendas and make sure she made it out of the quarantine safely. I'll check to see if she's with her uncle.
Nilyne asked me to enter the quarantine and gather a few samples of the Maulborn curative for her.
I collected a number of bottles of the Maulborn curative. Now I should take them to Nilyne Hlor so she can determine what was used to create the elixir.
A priestess of Mara told me of the troubles facing the holy site of Torinaan. She asked me to speak with the head of her order, an Aldarch named Colaste.
Arithiel is summoning a flame atronach to help me stop the ritual. I need to kill the summoners in the Shrine of Mauloch, before they can create a portal to Mauloch's realm.
I sacrificed Arithiel's soul to the <<1>>. With Boethiah's Blessing, I must kill the summoners in the Shrine of Mauloch, before they can create a portal to Mauloch's realm.

There are specific supplies that Nilyne needs to help the afflicted. Kyne's Heart healing herbs, which the innkeeper might have. Sour milk tea, which Grell Flan was fond of drinking. And dragon scale mushrooms, which Sorel Tedas had a taste for.
I gathered the ingredients Nilyne asked for, I should return to Ornis' house and deliver these to the alchemist.
I should talk to Aerona and make sure she's handling the situation all right.
Aerona wants me to help the alchemist Nilyne. I should talk to her.
My journey through Verandis's memories continues. I entered the relic chamber and Baron Montclair has begun the ritual to heal Leia, I should observe what happens.

My journey through Verandis's memories continues. I entered the relic chamber and Baron Montclair has begun the ritual to heal Leia, I must lend my power to the ritual by touching the Lightless Remnant.
My journey through Verandis's memories continues. Baron Montclair progresses through the ritual to heal Leia. I should observe what happens.
I should enter the Temple to the Divines and find Mane Akkhuz-ri.
I mixed the ingredients together. I should bring the concoction to Nilyne.
I should wait while Nilyne gives the potion to the afflicted patient.
Nilyne wants us to leave the house so her patient can rest and let the potion work its magic. I should head outside and talk to Aerona.
The Thief suddenly appeared before me after Tarish-Zi was vanquished. I should speak with her.
I should meet Titus at Buried Sands. He claims there's something we'll need from there before we can proceed.
I met up with Titus at Buried Sands. He says there is an ancient burial chamber somewhere inside that we need to find.
I helped Titus Valerius find the burial chamber. I should see what he has to say about it.

In order to retrieve the other two royal seals, we need to find out where the other members of Tarish-Zi's royal guard were buried. To do so, Titus suggests we head for Rahni'Za, a monk's school which houses a grand library.
I reached Rahni'Za, the School of Warriors. The library should be here somewhere.
We located the library. I should look around and see if I can help Titus find the book that will tell us where the royal guards were laid to rest.

We discovered the locations of the tombs of the other two members of Tarish-Zi's royal guardâ€”Tahmin and Riza. While Titus prepares for our attack on the royal crypt, I must track down the remaining royal seals.
I have the royal seals we need to enter Tarish-Zi's royal crypt. I should head there and meet with Titus.
With the door open before us, all that remains is to enter the crypt and confront Tarish-Zi.
Tarish-Zi stands before us. Defeating him is the only way to diminish the threat of his army of Anka-Ra.

The Veiled Heritance of Aranias' past will use her insecurity to bring her into their fold. Maruin instructed me to view other scenes of Aranias' story to give me a better picture of her fall.\n\nThe next story is at the top of the lighthouse.

The Veiled Heritance of Aranias' past will use her insecurity to bring her into their fold. Maruin instructed me to view other scenes of Aranias' story to give me a better picture of her fall.\n\nI need to find the story in the manor's great hall.
The young High Elf scholar Aranias said her guardian Andur had scouted out the Wood Orcs' camp and might have some good advice if I care to ask.
I should deliver this book to a Stargazer in Belkarth.
I agreed to assist Valeric. I should do as he asked.
I agreed to assist Majorn. I should do as he asked.
I should travel to Greenheart and attempt to catch up with the pair.
I helped the vampires of Wittestadr. Now I can ask for some blood to save the King.
I have the reagents, but still need to collect torchbug wings for the healing ritual.
I should speak to Curinure to confirm my interest in joining the Mages Guild.
I should find out what I can about the Mages Guild, and decide if the Guild is for me.
Titus Valerius offered to help me stop the Anka-Ra if I free him from his binds.
I wasn't able to locate the reagents. Hopefully torchbug wings will be enough.
I should travel to Bramblebreach.
I found a Bosmer near the entrance to Bramblebreach. I should speak to her and offer my assistance.
I should speak to Aicessar to confirm my interest in joining the Fighters Guild.
I should find out what I can about the Fighters Guild, and decide if the Guild is for me.
I should find out what I can about the Mages Guild, and decide if the Guild is for me.
I should speak to Rudrasa to confirm my interest in joining the Mages Guild.
I should stop and see what Bumnog wants to talk about.
Claudie's ghost has appeared nearby. I should speak to her.
I should find out what I can about the Fighters Guild, and decide if the Guild is for me.
I should speak to Hilan to confirm my interest in joining the Fighters Guild.
I should find out what I can about the Mages Guild, and decide if the Guild is for me.
I should speak to Nemarc to confirm my interest in joining the Mages Guild.
I should find out what I can about the Fighters Guild, and decide if the Guild is for me.
I should speak to Basile to confirm my interest in joining the Fighters Guild.
Stral's Graveborn are performing a necromantic ritual within the ruins. I must defeat them and put an end to their ritual.
I need to travel to the giant, ruined statue known as the Weeping Giant.
I need to climb toward the top of Weeeping Giant and look for Azura's Shrine.
I decided to find a cultist who could be sacrificed instead of Muzgu. I need to collect a Scroll of Dream Trapping and then use it to trap a cultist in his dream state and bind him to my will.
I met Count Verandis Ravenwatch when I entered the Fevered Mews. He says he's here to help me. I'll take him at his word and try to find a way to set the captured nobles free.
I retrieved the amulet Erold sent me after, and now a mysterious celestial figure resembling a thief has appeared. I should hear what she has to say.
I spoke with <<1>>. She says I should meet her in <<2>> when I'm ready to leave for <<3>>.
With the help of Verandis Ravenwatch, I freed the captured nobles. Now I need to stop Reezal-Jul from gaining reinforcements by confronting him in the ruins farther inside the Fevered Mews.
A note in the alley indicated that the Duke commanded Captain Hjurrun to come after me. As soon as I read it, the Captain ambushed me. I must defeat him.
I've broken into the arena in <<1>>, where the Drublog have entrapped <<c:2>>. She is now free, but the Hound has returned. I should make sure she can get away before he can recapture her.
I can either enter the Blood Matron's crypt and become a vampire or seek a priest of Arkay for the cure.
A werewolf has bitten me. If I step into Hircine's realm and prove myself worthy, I can become a werewolf.\n\nIf I wish to be cured, I can instead seek out a priest in the city.
Hermaeus Mora revealed secret information concerning the origins of the Anka-Ra, but he refuses to reveal more unless I bring him an offering. I should ask Ibrula what he means.
Hartmin was disappointed to discover that the flowers no longer grow here. He asked me to look for Nereid's Smile flowers nearby and if possible, to collect seeds for him to sow in the grove.
I've collected seeds from the Nereid's Smile flowers. I should bring them back to Hartmin.
I've collected seeds from the Nereid's Smile flowers. I should give them to Hartmin.
I defeated Shada. I should return to Sali'ma and tell him of my success.
I should enter Shada's Tear and find the leader of the researchers, Sali'ma.
The Thief suddenly appeared before me after Tarish-Zi was vanquished. I should speak with her.
Hendare wants me to take the stolen items to Cinnar, who has been investigating the thefts. Cinnar is on the city tier with the entertainment pavilion.
I agreed to meet <<1>> at Rosy Lion Inn in Daggerfall for my initiation into the Undaunted.
Though <<1>> told me a little about the village, he said I can find out more about <<A:2>> from its current caretaker, <<3>>.
<<1>> wants to initiate me into the Undaunted.
I should stay for my initiation into the Undaunted.
I agreed to meet <<1>> at the Salted Wings Tavern in Vulkhel Guard for my initiation into the Undaunted.

Aerona says that her brother gave the Maulborn a key to the old graveyard when they first arrived. She's seen the Maulborn using the back gate, so our best chance for finding the key and getting into the quarantine is to head over to the back gate.
I should speak with Erold at the Star-Gazer observatory.
I defeated Abelazar of the Scaled Court. I should return to the entrance of Rahni'Za to let Fada at-Glina know that things have been resolved.

I need to complete three trialsâ€”Arena, Air, and Martial Knowledgeâ€”before I can access the final trial and find the betrayer. The students carried books that described the trials, as well as Sands of True Sight I need for one of the trials.
The three trials are complete. Now I need to find my way into the final trial through the library and defeat Abelazar the betrayer.
I agreed to meet <<1>> at the Fish Stink in Davon's Watch for my initiation into the Undaunted.
<<1>> will perform the initiation rite for entry into the Undaunted. I must be present for the ritual.
I found the seals to activate the beams and open the temple door. Now I should go to the center of the ruin and enter the temple.
The council of war has begun. I should hear what everyone has to say.
I should speak to Razum-dar to find out what he's learned about Pelidil's plans.
I have entered the Hist's dream with <<1>>. I need to find a way to get rid of the destructive forces within it.
I have to find <<1>> and get her out of here before something terrible happens!
I have explored Hel Ra Citadel in its entirety and  defeated the ancient army that occupied it, as well as its leader, the powerful Celestial Warrior.
You have been defeated by the Warrior. Return to Kailstig the Axe.

I've met a Nord named Kailstig whose Undaunted allies have disappeared inside Hel Ra Citadel. Kailstig believes that a formidable foe lies in wait inside. I should explore the Citadel and defeat whatever opponents present themselves.

The first trial of Rahni'Za involves gaining entrance to the school. If the flames of the braziers are not lit, I'll need to defeat gargoyles in order to light the flames and gain entrance to the school.
On entering Rahni'Za, I encountered the spirit of a former initiate. I should speak to him and see if he has any other information about the trials.
Abelazar the betrayer has been defeated. The spirit of the school's master has appeared before me. I should speak to him.
<<1>> approached me. I should speak with her about <<2>>.
With the hostages and freed and Maormer commanders dealt with, I must head to the lighthouse and light the beacon as a signal to Major Cirenwe to launch the full-scale attack.

Just inside the lighthouse I found several dead Thalmor and signs that some kind of dark ritual was conducted here. One of the Thalmor appears to have survived. I should speak to him to find out what happened.
Vox has trapped many souls in her quest for power. I should see if I can rescue them from Vox.
I should speak with Scout Catannie at Driladan Pass to see how I can help.
Too much time has passed, and the treethane fears the worst. I should try to find them before any more of Tanglehaven's citizens are lost.
I found a pile of burned bodies in the Drublog camp. I should search them and see if they are what remains of the Tanglehaven militia.
I should talk to the leader of the researchers, Sali'ma, about the strange things that have been happening in the ruins.
Sali'ma believes that the waters are being corrupted by Nereids in the crypt and city wings of Shada's Tear. I should explore those wings and find a way to stop the corruption.
With Faolchu dead and the Lion Guard in Camlorn, my job here is mostly done. I should talk to Captain Darien Gautier before I leave.
Ibrula believes that the Daedric Prince of Knowledge, Hermaeus Mora, possesses secret knowledge about how to defeat the Celestials. I should approach his statue and speak to him.
Rid-Thar says I should leave the old ruin and return the Claw to Azahrr, the lunar priestess.
When I underwent the Star-Gazers' ritual, I was transported to an otherworldly realm! A strange woman has appeared before me. Perhaps she can tell me what's going on.

The woman claimed to be the constellation of the Thief. She asked me to aid her and the Star-Gazers in resisting the Serpent, a powerful being known as a Celestial. Though I must return to Tamriel, I shouldn't reveal this encounter to others.
The Windridge Caves are not far from here. I should make my way there and see if anything interesting remains.
I arrived at the Mages Guild. I should speak with Abnur Tharn.
I arrived at the Mages Guild. I should speak with Abnur Tharn.
Belron has asked me to place the heart inside the dead Cultist.
Vanus Galerion has appeared to me and urgently requests to speak with me. I should see what he has to say.
Shalidor has asked for a moment to prepare casting the memory charm.
Shalidor has asked for a moment to prepare casting the memory charm.
I should speak to the Arch-Mage again so that he can cast the memory charm on me.
I wandered off before Vanus could begin casting the portal to Stirk. He'd probably like it if I returned.
I need to retrieve the crown from Fildgor's body so it can be returned to the rightful king.
The temple door is sealed. I should look for a way to activate the beams that open the temple door.
I killed Merdyndril, the creator of the Llodos plague. Unfortunately, Diiril and his soldiers are dead, too. I need to let House Hlaalu know what I found.
To get to Urcelmo, I'll need to get to the city of Firsthold. It's far to the north in Auridon.
Before I enter Firsthold, I should speak with the guard controlling the front gate.
According to Cadwell, I must activate two flywheels before I can enter the gatehouse. I should look for the first flywheel on the north side of the Chasm and activate it.
According to Cadwell, I must activate two flywheels before I can enter the gatehouse. I should look for the second flywheel on the south side of the Chasm and activate it.
I activated the flywheels. Now I must unlock the gatehouse.
The priestess told me to seek a soldier named Englor at the gate to the fort. He should be able to set me on my path.
The alchemist who created the Llodos Plague has taken control of the Obsidian Gorge. I should head there and offer my assistance to Commander Renli.
The alchemist who created the Llodos Plague has taken control of the Obsidian Gorge. I should head there and offer my assistance to Commander Renli.
I should find a member of the lunar clergy in Rawl'kha to speak with.
Thalinfar said I should find a Wood Elf named Englor at Fort Grimwatch.
I have lost my courier disguise. I should retrieve a new one.
I've found the Gold Coast Captain's tent. I should speak with her.
The dark Queen of Abagarlas stands between Ostarand and the Mortuum Vivicus. I should slay her to end her ritual.
I defeated <<1>> and silenced the threat on the upper floors of the Aetherian Archive. I should return to Mighty Mordra and her Undaunted.
I entered General Godrun's dreams. Now I must find and defeat the Omen.
I entered General Godrun's dreams. Now I must find and defeat the Omen.
I entered General Godrun's dreams. Now I must find and defeat the Omen.

I've learned that the Aetherian Archive, an ancient, sealed tower in Craglorn, has opened its doors for the first time in years. Mighty Mordra and her Undaunted intended to climb it, but it appears I get to brave its dangers, first.
You have been defeated by <<1>>. Return to <<2>>.
I left <<1>> to explore <<2>>. Perhaps I should keep an eye out for <<3>>.
I entered the temple. Ibrula wishes to speak to me. I should hear what she has to say.
Blivisi's brother Gendyn runs the forge at Artisans Craftworks. She asked me to deliver a letter to <<1>> in Mournhold to determine the status of her order.
The priest told me about three runestones placed around the barrow. I need to collect them.
I should use the Transitus Shrine to travel to the Eastern Elsweyr gate.
I can find <<1>> at the siege range. Alternately, if I wish to skip training, I should go speak with <<2>>.
A Lion Guard scout suggested I should find Provost Piper and offer him my help against the Red Rook Bandits.
I'm inside the temple. Now I should find Hermaeus Mora's shrine. Ibrula says it's located in the deepest part of the temple.
I should seek out Elfriede at Honrich Tower and see how I can be of assistance.
I should use the Transitus Shrine to travel to the Northern Morrowind gate.
I can find <<1>> at the siege range. Alternately, if I wish to skip training, I should go speak with <<2>>.
I freed Nahlia. Ralai has joined us. I should talk to her.
I need to find the mad researchers so I can save Nahlia.
I should use the Transitus Shrine to travel to the Southern High Rock gate.
I can find <<1>> at the siege range. Alternately, if I wish to skip training, I should go speak with <<2>>.
I should let Grahla know what I discovered during my visit to the past.
I somehow altered time by rescuing Alana. Now her descendant leads the Mages Guild's efforts at Glenumbra Moors.
I should go to the Glenumbra Moors and speak to the mages researching Faolchu there. Maybe they've discovered how the werewolf lord was originally killed.
I should go to the Glenumbra Moors and speak to the mages researching Faolchu there. Maybe they've discovered how the werewolf lord was originally killed.
Verrik is dead and King Casimir is safe. I should speak to King Casimir.
I should read the scroll on the altar and use the prayer wheel to unlock the door deeper into the city wing.
I unlocked the door. I should follow Ralai deeper into the city wing to find Nahlia.
I should find Nahlia and free her.
I freed Nahlia. I should talk to her and see what she learned about the mad researchers.
I defeated Yamanu-ko. I should tell Minerva what happened.
I should enter the Elinhir sewers and find Minerva Lauzon.
I entered the sewers. Now I should find Minerva Lauzon.
I found Minerva Lauzon. Now I should talk to her.

Minerva told me that the Arch-Mage Yamanu-ko is responsible for the devastation in Elinhir. She is in the Apex Tower, which is being warded by her apprentices in the surrounding towers. I should go to the towers and destroy the wards.
I need to destroy the wards protecting the Apex Tower.
Sara cast a barrier spell on the core to stabilize it. I should take her portal out of the staff and meet her outside.
I destroyed the wards. I should meet Minerva at the base of the Apex Tower and talk to her.
I made it to the base of the Apex Tower. I should wait while Minerva dispels the ward.
The ward has been taken care of. Now I should enter the Apex Tower and locate Yamanu-ko.
I should defeat Yamanu-ko and end the threat to Elinhir.
<<1>> must bring down the barrier blocking the doorway to Ragnthar.
I found a strange gem in the Dwarven ruin of Mtharnaz. I should bring it to Hermaeus Mora at the Seeker's Archive.
I found a Dwemer lexicon in the ruins of Rkhardahrk. I should take it to Hermaeus Mora in the Seeker's Archive.
I found a stone with unusual letters carved into it in Zalgaz's Den. I should bring the rubbing of the letters to Hermaeus Mora in the Seeker's Archive.
I must defeat the Triad.
I need to return to the Star-Gazer Observatory and speak with Hara once more to see what we need to do next.

The Thief told me about a sorcerer named Kelmen Locke, who may know something about the atronachs. He was captured by dangerous mercenaries who plan to turn him over to the Serpent. They are holding him in Haddock's Market.
I found Kelmen Locke being held by Greycloak mercenaries at Haddock's Market. I should talk to him about taking control of the atronachs.
Kelmen Locke has given me a gem that will allow me to bind three of the monarch atronachs. He believes they will be able to tell us how the Celestial Serpent gained control of the atronachs.
The monarchs confirmed that there is a fourth atronach, created by the Serpent. I should talk to Kelmen Locke about this news.
The Serpent has created an atronach that draws on the powers of the other three. I should find and defeat the monarch air atronach, created by the Serpent.
I defeated the Serpent's monarch air atronach. I should speak to Kelmen Locke.
I defeated and bound the monarch atronachs. I should meet Kelmen Locke at the summoning site.
I should use the foci at the ritual site to consult with the monarch atronachs about the Serpent's plans.

Sara needs the staff's magicka to power a spell to gain access to its core. We should gather three types of infusions from staff shards scattered in the Spellscar. Only one person can hold each type of infusion.
We have given Sara the three infusions she needs. She can now open the staff.
Sara opened a portal to the core of the staff. I should follow her inside and help her stabilize it.
I entered the core of the staff with Sara, and am now in a magical vortex populated by floating staff shards. We should make our way to the core on the far side of the vortex.

Sara needs to disconnect the crystals from the core so she can cast a barrier spell to contain its growth. However, I need to protect her from the core's magical feedback as she disconnects the crystals.

Before he left, Nhalan gave me a book that he believes contains a way to reverse the effects of the water in its early stages. I should go back to the researchers' camp and see if anyone can use it to help the afflicted researchers.
I found a portal within the Crypt of Hearts, likely the source of the Daedric invasion plaguing Alanwe and her students. I should seek Nerien'eth out beyond it, and defeat him.

Titus Valerius was familiar with the name Reinhold's Retreat, and even told me that the ruin lies beneath the city of Belkarth. I need to meet Titus and Kelmen at the lake just south of Belkarth to see if we can work out a way to get inside.
I met up with Titus and Kelmen at the lake. I should see what Kelmen has to say about figuring out a way inside this ruin.
Kelmen senses some sort of residual energy emanating from specific parts of the ruins. He suggested I look around and see if I can work out a way to manipulate the stones to reveal a passage inside.
We managed to work out the riddle of the guidestones and unlock the pathway into Reinhold's Retreat just below the surface of the lake. I should head inside and see what Hara wanted us to find here.

We entered Reinhold's Retreat, the mysterious ruin Hara mentioned before she disappeared. I don't know exactly what Hara wanted me to find here, but I should search for anything that might provide a clue.

The Scaled Court infiltrated Reinhold's Retreat before we arrived and are present in great number. I discovered one of their leaders deep within the ruin. I should put a stop to whatever it is she plans to do.

I located the Thief's Apex Stone. It's under attack by the magic of the Serpent's Corruption. Not only that, but Hara appears to be captive, along with the stone. I need to stop whatever is happening here and save Hara before it's too late.

Madleena mentioned the Thief's Apex Stone when she attacked us. Kelmen believes it's possible the stone has been hidden here all this time, which suggests the Scaled Court are here to corrupt it. I should find the stone and stop them.
After successfully thwarting the Serpent's attempts to take the Apex Stone, I discovered that Hara was the Celestial Thief all along. I should speak with her to see what she has to say.

Nhalan told me that he opposed the bargain the Nedes made with Shada and was punished for it. His spirit can't rest until Zal'ik, the general who made the deal with Shada, is slain. I should try to find Zal'ik.
I saw a vision of Zal'ik creating a barrier in the crypt to keep the Yokudan invaders out. The barrier is defended by a flesh atronach. I should defeat the flesh atronach.
I defeated the flesh atronach that protected Zal'ik's barrier. I should speak to Nhalan before proceeding deeper into the Burial Grounds.
Nhalan told me to find Zal'ik and defeat him in order to release Nhalan from his imprisonment.
I found Zal'ik within the crypt. I should find a way to awaken Zal'ik and defeat him.
I defeated Zal'ik. I should speak to Nhalan and determine if there is anything else I need to do.
I should talk to Nhalan to learn more about him and the curse.
I defeated the Nereids that were corrupting the waters in the city and crypt wings of Shada's Tear. I should return to the research camp.
I should talk to Sali'ma about ending the corruption in Shada's Tear.
Sali'ma believes that the leader of the Nereids, Shada, is the ultimate source of the corruption. He believes she is in the third wing of the city. I should go there and find Shada.
I should listen as Kelmen Locke talks to the summoned monarchs.
Sali'ma believes that the leader of the Nereids, Shada, is the ultimate source of the corruption. He believes she is in the third wing of the city. I should go there and find Shada.
I found Shada. I should defeat her and end the corruption of Shada's Tear for good.

An unseen force seems to have attacked and abducted Hara, who cryptically mentioned something called Reinhold's Retreat before she vanished. I should speak to Titus and see if he knows anything about it.
I've defeated the Daedra guarding the Oblivion Gate. I should enter it, and help Fingaenion find his wife.
I should look for Gilraen now that I've entered Oblivion.
Fingaenion believes destroying the Sigil Stone will return us, and all others who stepped through, to Tamriel.
I've defeated Valkyn Skoria and destroyed the Sigil Stone that imprisoned me and the others in Oblivion. I should speak to Fingaenion.
I should talk to Sara Benele to learn more about the Mage's Staff.
With the braziers lit, I must now defeat the guardian outside in order to enter the school.
I completed the Trial of Fire. I should now be able to enter the school of Rahni'Za.
I reunited the aspects of the Mage with the Lost One. It's now up to them to resist the Serpent's corruption. I should tell Star-Gazer Trilion what happened.
The Mage's aspect gave me a relic called the Seeker's Sight, but the gems that power it have been scattered across Craglorn. I need to gather these gems to power the relic.
I should talk to Ahlora about the Seeker's Sight.
Now that the Seeker's Sight is whole, I need to find magical anomaly points in Craglorn and defeat the guardians to charge the gems.
I recovered the gems that power the Seeker's Sight. I should meet with the aspects of the Mage at the winery near Belkarth to determine what I need to do next.
Now that I've charged the Seeker's Sight, I should meet the Mage's aspects at the Star-Gazers' Observatory.
I entered the Star-Gazers' Observatory and spotted Hara with the aspects of the Mage. I should talk to her and let her know what I've done.
I should place the Seeker's Sight in the star map and observe what happens.
Nazdura told me that Hara wants to speak to me in her quarters on the upper level of the Star-Gazer's Observatory. I should make my way there.
The Seeker's Sight has shown us where we can find other aspects of the Celestial Mage. I should talk to Ahlora about our next steps.
I need to locate the other aspects of the Celestial Mage.
Now that I've gathered other aspects of the Celestial Mage, I should meet Valla and Ahlora at the winery outside of Belkarth.
I arrived at the winery. I should talk to Valla.
Valla told me that the Lost One abides near the Mage's Apex Stone, beneath the city of Elinhir. I can reach the Mage's Apex Stone through the city's sewers.
The Overfiend is defeated, and Lyranth has directed me to attack a "flesh sculptor." His laboratory is somewhere up ahead.
Though I defeated the Flesh Sculptor, a few of his constructs remained in the Warden's possession. I should slay the Flesh Abomination the Warden has sent against me.
I've gotten past the Warden's traps, and according to Lyranth, the Warden himself should be somewhere up ahead. I should seek him out and slay him.
I should speak to <<1>>.
The Seeker's Sight can help me locate the Mage's Apex Stone within these sewers. I should use it to find my way.
I arrived at the Mage's Apex Stone. Now I must defeat the Lost One so that the Mage can be made whole.
I should talk to the High Elf and see what she has to say.
Someone in Craglorn may have a better idea where I can find Hara and the Star-Gazers.
Maormer boarders are assaulting the deck of the Prowler. I need to defeat the boarders to keep the ship secure.
The moon priestess Saifa is being very coy. I should speak to her again to see what she wants me to do.
I should talk to the Thief to learn where to find Kelmen Locke.
I should enter the Crossroad Tavern in Belkarth and seek out these strange High Elves the Star-Gazer told me about.
I located the High Elves, but they're talking to another Star-Gazer. I should wait to speak to the High Elves after they finish talking.
The High Elves claim to be aspects of the Celestial Mage. They have offered to show me what happened to them. I should watch and learn.
I witnessed events as they transpired between the Serpent and the Celestial Mage. I should talk to Valla and find out what it all means.
To gather energy from the shards, we must kill all the monsters surrounding them. Then one person must draw out the shard's energy using Sara's crystal.
Federic found a journal in Dulkhi's quarters. Perhaps it will shed some light on what happened here.
I have collected a Flame infusion. My allies must collect Frost and Storm infusions.
I have collected a Frost infusion. My allies must collect Flame and Storm infusions.
I have collected a Storm infusion. My allies must collect Flame and Frost infusions.
The Flame infusion I carried vanished when I left the Spellscar. I must enter it again to get the infusion back.
The Ice infusion I carried vanished when I left the Spellscar. I must enter it again to get the infusion back.
The Storm infusion I carried vanished when I left the Spellscar. I must enter it again to get the infusion back.
I should investigate the room at the far end of Nerien'eth's study. Alanwe hopes to find and confront the lich, here.
I have explored Hel Ra Citadel in its entirety and  defeated the ancient army that occupied it, as well as its leader, the powerful Celestial Warrior.
I defeated <<1>> and silenced the threat on the upper floors of the Aetherian Archive. I should return to Mighty Mordra and her Undaunted.
I need to find someone on board the ship to take me to Stros M'Kai and find <<1>>.
I dealt with Safa's traitorous acolytes as she asked. Now they won't be able to lend their power to the Scaled Court. I should return to Dragonstar and inform Safa that the deed is done.
If I want to meet <<1>> on <<2>> I should speak with <<3>>, the boatswain in Vulkhel Guard. She should be able to take me there.
A man in Davon's Watch suggested someone named Rana was recruiting assistance for a place called Bleakrock. <<1>> at the docks might take me there.
I need to reach the defenders at the gate to <<1>>.
I need to reach the defenders at the gate to <<1>>.
I agreed to track down and slay Safa's three traitorous acolytes and stop them from serving the Scaled Court. I should be able to find them at Scaled Court enclaves throughout the region.
I've defeated the Celestial Serpent and returned him to his prison within the Apex Stone. The Scaled Court of Sanctum Ophidia has been scattered. I should speak with Atildel.
The caravan master, Scattered-Leaves, believes his abducted guards were taken into the Valley of Scars. I should search for them there.
The leader of this band of Iron Orcs, a cruel taskmaster called Gulzog the Butcher, fed the captured caravan guards to his trolls. I need to make him pay for this outrage.
I defeated Gulzog the Butcher and gathered the personal belongings of some of the captured guards. I should return to Scattered-Leaves and let him know what happened to the guards.
I burned the Scaled Court standards and mounted Agganor's helmet on a pike. I should return to Lashburr and let him know that I avenged him.
I need to gather some personal effects from the remains of the guards so that Scattered-Leaves can give them to their families to remember them by.
I spoke with the entities within the Hist's dream. I should check with <<1>> to see if she's learned anything new.
Everyone who has taken on the dangers of the Sanctum Ophidia have been defeated. Though the Scaled Court controls the caves, I must enter the Sanctum and slay the Serpent.
I've defeated the Celestial Serpent and returned him to his prison within the Apex Stone. The Scaled Court of Sanctum Ophidia has been scattered. I should speak to Turuk.
I've been defeated by the forces of the Celestial Serpent in Sanctum Ophidia. I need to report to Turuk Redclaws.
I met a tortured spirit named Alanwe at the Crypt of Hearts. I have agreed to help her defeat the lich Nerien'eth, who torments her. Alanwe believes that we may find the lich in his study up ahead.

Alanwe has determined that the ritual site where Nerien'eth summoned the Daedra years ago must be nearby, and that his most recent attack must have originated from there. If we can locate the ritual site, it's likely the lich will be close.
Now that Nerien'eth has been defeated, I should speak to Alanwe.
I defeated Arnoth and set back the Scaled Court's plans in Skyreach Hold. I should go to Dragonstar and let Nendirume know what transpired in there.

I discovered that a Scaled Court exarch, Arnoth, is experimenting with nirncrux to make himself more powerful. What started as a test to assist the Scaled Court's leader, Regent Cassipia, is now just a power grab by Arnoth. I need to stop him.

I've met a Nord named Kailstig whose Undaunted allies have disappeared inside Hel Ra Citadel. Kailstig believes that a formidable foe lies in wait inside. I should explore the Citadel and defeat whatever opponents present themselves.

I've learned that the Aetherian Archive, an ancient, sealed tower in Craglorn, has opened its doors for the first time in years. Mighty Mordra and her Undaunted intended to climb it, but it looks like I'm going to get the chance, first.
I entered the hidden tunnel and spotted more of the King's scouts. I should make my way to the other end of the tunnel so I can meet with Thane Mera.
I made it to the other end of the hidden tunnel. I should exit the hidden tunnel and look for Thane Mera.
I must now mount Agganor's helmet on a pike so that the old shaman can know vengeance.
Shaman Lashburr wants me to find the standards of the Scaled Court throughout the valley and burn them to ash.
I entered Fearfangs Cavern and met up with Regent Cassipia. The place is crawling with Scaled Court cultists! We need to find the scorpion matron so we can kill her and destroy her nests.
I killed the scorpion matron and destroyed her nests. Now I should talk to Regent Cassipia and see what our next move is.

The Scaled Court has created a new kind of monsterâ€”the mantikora. They developed a progenitor that can be used to spawn more of the monsters. I need to meet Regent Cassipia at the Serpent's Nest and locate the progenitor's lair.
I met Regent Cassipia in the Serpent's Nest. Now I need to escort her to the primordial spawning pools where the progenitor mantikora makes its lair.
I accompanied Regent Cassipia to the progenitor mantikora's lair. Now we have to destroy the beast and the Scaled Court members guarding it so that no additional mantikoras can be created.

I defeated the progenitor mantikora, freed the prisoners, and crippled the Scaled Court's ability to make any more of these hybrid monsters. I should talk to Regent Cassipia and make sure we're done here.
I should meet Little Leaf in Ilthag's Undertower. The entrance is in the ruined tower atop the nearby hill.

I met up with Little Leaf in Ilthag's Undertower. She tried to convince someone named Ilthag Ironblood to stop training trolls for the Scaled Court's army, but he wouldn't listen to reason. Now she wants me to step in.
To further disrupt the Iron Orcs' ability to build a troll army, I need to find the Valley of Scars. I should head out and meet Little Leaf there.

Now that I've reached the Valley of Scars, I need to locate and kill Runescriber Kulth and Armorer Uthik. The runescriber works on the west side of the valley, while the armorer's forge is located on the east side.
Now that I'm inside the Exarch's Stronghold, I need to locate Braadoth's throne room. Little Leaf says it's deep inside the complex.
Exarch Braadoth is dead and the process the Iron Orcs were using to empower the trolls has been disabled. I should meet Little Leaf outside and make sure she's all right.

The first component used in the alchemical process to create the mantikoras comes from the scorpion matron and her nests, deep in the cave called Fearfangs. I need to enter the cave and meet Regent Cassipia inside.
I need to enter Skyreach Hold and find out what the Scaled Court is up to in there.
I entered the wamasu den and slayed the wamasu eggbearer. I should find Regent Cassipia near the town of Dragonstar and let her know that I accomplished the task she sent me to do.
Now that I'm inside the ruins of Skyreach Hold, I should explore and learn more about what the Scaled Court is doing here.
I put an end to Exarch Arnoth's schemes. I should exit these ruins and head for Dragonstar.
Now that I've burned the Scaled Court standards, Lashburr wants me to find the vile shaman Agganor, kill him, and take his helmet.

I agreed to enter Skyreach Catacombs to try to discover the source of the dark force that has disturbed the dead.
I entered Skyreach Catacombs. Crusader Dalamar believes the source of the darkness that disturbs the dead's rest can be found in the Lower Catacombs. I need to find my way there.

I defeated the Gravelord and the Fallen Kings. That seems to have unlocked the door leading to the Lower Catacombs. Now I can descend into the depths and find the source of the darkness that haunts these ruins.
If the source of the darkness permeating these catacombs truly is the legendary necromancer Virmaril, I need to run a gauntlet of undead to reach him.
To reach Virmaril the Betrayer, I need to defeat these spirits to disrupt the soul ward that seals the door.
I reached Virmaril the Betrayer. He keeps talking about taking my soul. I have to confront him and defeat him.

Ilthag Ironblood won't be training any more trolls. I should talk to Little Leaf now and see what else we have to do to stop the Iron Orcs from building an army of super-powered trolls.

I entered the Loth'Na Caverns and caught up with the Thief. She plans to sneak ahead and meet me at the top of the rise. I should follow after her.

Now that I'm inside Skyreach Temple, I need to find Regent Cassipia and stop her before she transforms into the Exalted Viper.
Now that the Exalted Viper has been defeated and we're back in Belkarth, I should talk to the Thief.

The ritual worked. It showed us Regent Cassipia, the apparent source of the magical disturbance. She killed Kelmen when he tried to stop her. I should talk to the Thief and see what she has to say about all this.
I emerged from the ruins of Skyreach Pinnacle. I should speak to Mederic Vyger and make sure the prison wards have truly been restored.

We accomplished what Mederic set out to do and restored the wards that seal the summoning circles. Now I should find Mederic outside and discuss what transpired in here.
