I learned the recipe for roast pig. I should return to <<1>> and ask him what comes next.
To be truly Undaunted, I must explore the isle of Blackheart Haven and destroy Atarus, the Roost Mother, and Captain Blackheart.
I've cleared Blackheart Haven. I should find Glirion the Redbeard in my alliance's capital city.
Glirion the Redbeard is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
Glirion the Redbeard is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
To be truly Undaunted, I must survive the Blessed Crucible. I must defeat the members of the Pack, the Beast Master's menagerie, and the famed Lava Queen.
Glirion presented me with another challenge: invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle and slay the Lava Queen in her empowered state.
I've survived the Blessed Crucible. I should find Glirion the Redbeard in my alliance's capital city.
Glirion the Redbeard is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
Glirion the Redbeard is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
To be truly Undaunted, I must explore Selene's Web and destroy Foulhide, Longclaw, and Selene herself.
Glirion presented me with another challenge: invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle and slay Selene in her empowered state.
I've cleared the grove called Selene's Web. I should find Glirion the Redbeard in my alliance's capital city.
Glirion the Redbeard is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
Glirion the Redbeard is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
To be truly Undaunted, I must explore the Vaults of Madness and destroy Ulguna Soul-Reaver, Grothdarr, Iskra the Omen, and the Mad Architect.
Glirion presented me with another challenge: invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle and slay the Mad Architect in his empowered state.
I've cleared the maze called the Vaults of Madness. I should find Glirion the Redbeard in my alliance's capital city.
Glirion the Redbeard is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
Glirion the Redbeard is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
I should speak with her and find out what she wants me to do.

<<1>> wants me to return with raw jute. I should search the area she mentioned. If I don't find enough raw jute, I should search grassy areas.\n\nAlternatively, I could ask a friend for help or purchase some from a guild store.
<<1>> asked me to return with jute. I can refine raw jute into jute at a clothing station. \n\nAlternatively, I could ask a friend for help or purchase some from a guild store.

I need to craft and deliver simple homespun gloves to <<1>>. I must bring five jute and one <<2>> style material to a clothing station before I can create the gloves.\n\nIf I can't find a <<2>> style material, I can purchase one from any clothier.
I should speak with <<1>> and let her know I have refined enough jute.
I should speak with <<1>> and let her know I have enough raw jute.
<<1>> is satisfied with my skill as a clothier. I should speak with her to become certified. Once certified, I will be able to fulfill clothier crafting writs.
<<1>> is already familiar with my reputation as a clothier. I should speak with her to become certified. Once certified, I will be able to fulfill clothier crafting writs.
Maj is waiting to speak to me one more time.
Maj wants me to speak to Glirion the Redbeard. She says he'll be able to tell me more about the pledge.
I need to travel to six prayer markers located within Craglorn's most dangerous caves and tombs to learn the six virtues.
I completed Ranev's pilgrimage. I should return to the Gray Menhir to determine if I have found favor with the Stars.
I need to travel to the Gray Menhir, located to the southwest of Dragonstar, and prepare for my pilgrimage.

<<1>> wants me to find runes of potency, aspect, and essence. I should search the area he mentioned. If I don't find enough, I should search ancient ruins.\n\nAlternatively, I could ask a friend for help or purchase some from a guild store.
I should speak with him and find out what he wants me to do.
It seems <<1>> is already familiar with my reputation as an enchanter. I should speak with him to become certified. Once certified, I will be able to fulfill enchanting crafting writs.

I should go to an enchanting station and create a glyph. In order to do so, I will need at least one rune of potency, one of essence, and one of aspect.\nOnce I have created the glyph, I should take it to <<1>>.
I should speak with <<1>> and let him know I found runes of potency, essence, and aspect.
I should speak with him and find out what he wants me to do.

<<1>> wants me to find a solvent and reagents to make a potion. I should search the nearby area he mentioned. If I don't find enough, I should search the wilderness.\n\nAlternatively, I could ask a friend for help or purchase some from a guild store.
I should speak with <<1>> and let him know I found a solvent and some reagents.

I should go to an alchemy station and combine a solvent (such as natural water) with two different reagents. In order to create a potion, the reagents must have matching traits (such as columbine and mountain flower).\nThen, I should speak to <<1>>.
It seems <<1>> is already familiar with my reputation as an alchemist. I should speak with him to become certified. Once certified, I will be able to fulfill alchemy crafting writs.
I created a potion. I should speak with <<1>> to become certified. Once certified, I will be able to fulfill alchemy crafting writs.
I should enter the cave and see if I can find Kireth Vanos somewhere in the ruins of Zthenganaz.
Kireth asked me to collect the power core guarded by the Dwarven centurion known as the Ztheng Guardian. Apparently, Raynor can use the power core to create one of his arcane devices.
I acquired the power core that was protected by the Ztheng Guardian. I should meet Raynor at the ruin's main entrance, give him the core, and make sure Kireth made it out of the ruins safely.
It seems High-King Emeric's <<z:1>> was killed. I should inform <<2>> in Orsinium.
I defeated the scorpion matron. Now to burn her nests.
I need to get inside Frostbreak Fortress and find the two squads of Orc soldiers Siege Commander Dulph sent in to distract the harpies and destroy the source of the briarheart warriors.
I need to clear a path to the two towers with clear lines of sight to the harpy aeries. Then Eveli can mark the targets with a flaming arrow so that the catapults can destroy the aeries.

Alinon the Alchemist claims that the source of the briarheart warriors is a large plant or tree. But before we can destroy the source, we need to weaken its defenses by burning the corrupted saplings scattered throughout the fortress.
To put an end to the briarheart warriors, I need to use Alinon's elixir to destroy the tree that is the source of the briarhearts.
I should exit the fortress and make sure that Eveli and Alinon the Alchemist are all right.
I should talk to Alinon the Alchemist and make sure the source of the briarhearts was really destroyed.
I created a glyph. I should speak with <<1>> to become certified. Once certified, I will be able to fulfill enchanting crafting writs.
Now that the harpy aeries have been destroyed, I should look for the alchemist and the squad escorting him. They should be trying to find a way into the fortress.
I found the alchemist and his soldier escort. I should talk to the alchemist and find out how he wants to proceed.
I can't seem to make the bird totem work. Maybe someone at the Mages Guild in Orsinium can help me figure out how to reverse the Birdsong's curse.
Deechee-Noo performed the ritual and thinks it was successful. I should talk to her to make sure.
I told Fedar the truth about the whistle. I should speak to him to collect my reward.
There's an Argonian in the Mages Guild named Deechee-Noo. I should ask if she knows how to reverse the bird totem's curse.
Deechee-Noo asked me to collect a few items so she can perform a ritual that will reverse the bird totem's curse.
I should speak with <<1>> and let her know I created an iron dagger.
I need to deconstruct the iron dagger I made for <<1>>. I can do so at a blacksmithing station.\n\n<<1>> said I could deconstruct something else if I wanted to keep the dagger.
I found <<1>>, the expedition's leader. Before he died, he said there was a terrible threat within these ruins. I should examine his notes.
I decided to leave <<1>> to his fate. I should tell Glurbasha what happened.
I decided to kill <<1>>. I should return to <<2>> and let her know what happened.

According to <<1>>'s notes, three pressure valves direct vast amounts of heat and power to a locked central chamber. He believed it was for some nefarious purpose. I should find and close these valves.
<<1>> suspected there was a great threat within the Tonal Auditorium. With the pressure valves closed, I should explore the central chamber.
I should look for the durzog lair and find the beast-master's whistle.
I found the whistle. I should test its beast-taming powers on the durzogs in Nikolvara's Kennel.
When I used the whistle, the durzogs became agitated and attacked me. I should find Fedar and decide what to tell him about the true nature of the whistle.
I lied to Fedar about the whistle. I should speak to him to collect my reward.

With the armorer and runescriber dealt with, Little Leaf wants to confront the chief of the Iron Orcs, Exarch Braadoth. She says that his abode is deep within the cave system known as the Exarch's Stronghold, in the northern reaches of the valley.
I should speak with <<1>> and let her know I created Homespun Gloves.
I need to deconstruct the Homespun Gloves I made for <<1>>. I can do so at a clothing station.\n\n<<1>> said I could deconstruct something else if I wanted to keep the Homespun Gloves.
I should speak with <<1>> and let her know I created a maple bow.
I need to deconstruct the maple bow I made for <<1>>. I can do so at a woodworking station.\n\n<<1>> said I could deconstruct something else if I wanted to keep the bow.
I gathered the items Deechee-Noo requested. I should bring them back to her so she can perform the ritual to reverse the bird totem's curse.
I suggested that the Tumnosh clan petition the king and ask him what to do with the Dwarven constructs. I should talk to Forge-Wife Kharza and complete the deal.

Neramo brought some of the Dwarven machines out of the ruins as some sort of gift to make up for the trouble he caused, but the Orcs want to destroy them and him, I should talk to Kharza and try to make this right.
I suggested that the Tumnosh clan exile Neramo and send him and the Dwarven constructs away. I should talk to Forge-Wife Kharza and complete the deal.
I should search the ruins for evidence of what was done to the Orcs.
I should speak with <<1>> about the evidence I found in the ruins.
I should go down into Graystone Quarry to see if I can find out what happened there and check on the quarry workers.
I found the hunt-wife's daughter, Shabon. She said that the High Elf went to investigate the central structure. I should go in there and locate him.
Neramo believes a control center operates the Dwarven constructs and that it's located somewhere in the ruin. I should look for the control center.
I found the Dwarven control center and so did Neramo. I should talk to him.

I need to strike the kinetic resonators to rotate the rings and adjust the lenses until they align with the emitters. That should unlock the Orb of Illumination and open the way to the construct control room.
I found several disturbing things which seem related to strange experiments and rituals performed on the <<1>> Orcs. I should bring them to <<2>>.
I should make my way to Frostbreak Fortress to meet with King Kurog. I need to tell him that the stolen supplies are being held there.
I arrived at the siege camp outside Frostbreak Fortress. I should find King Kurog and speak to him.
King Kurog wants me to lead the way as we search Frostbreak Fortress and seek out the stolen supplies and the Winterborn warlord, Urfon Ice-Heart.
I should help King Kurog kill the Winterborn warlord, Urfon Ice-Heart.
The meeting didn't go as King Kurog planned. I should talk to him.
I have explored Hel Ra Citadel in its entirety and  defeated the ancient army that occupied it, as well as its leader, the powerful Celestial Warrior.
I defeated <<1>> and silenced the threat on the upper floors of the Aetherian Archive. I should return to Mighty Mordra and her Undaunted.

I've learned that the Aetherian Archive, an ancient, sealed tower in Craglorn, has opened its doors for the first time in years. Mighty Mordra and her Undaunted intended to climb it, but it looks like I'm going to get the chance, first.

I've met a Nord named Kailstig whose Undaunted allies have disappeared inside Hel Ra Citadel. Kailstig believes that a formidable foe lies in wait inside. I should explore the Citadel and defeat whatever opponents present themselves.
I should find Kraala's bird totem and see if I can use it to transform the birds back into people.
Dirdre asked me to recover the sacred banner of the Order of the Silver Dawn from the depths of the Argent Mine. She had to leave it behind when she fled the attack by the Magnar Pack werewolves.
I recovered the sacred banner of the Order of the Silver Dawn. I should return it to Dirdre.
I should search the ruin for <<1>>, the leader of this expedition. <<2>> thinks he might still be alive.
<<1>> is the new chief of Shatul. I should inform <<2>>.
It seems the pressure valves had something to do with a massive Dwarven construct! I should defeat this <<1>>.

"<<1>>" is really <<2>>, the exiled daughter of <<3>>. She posed as <<1>> so she could be named a contender, and wants to be the new chief of Shatul. She asked me to tell her grandmother <<4>> that she is headed to the Bloody Knoll to fight <<5>>.
<<1>> asked me to inform <<2>> that he is a contender for chief. He will oppose <<3>> in the Bloody Knoll.
According to <<1>>, Shatul will have a difficult time accepting <<2>> or <<3>> as chief. She asked me to slip a flawed blade to the weakest contender.
I placed the flawed blade. I should hide and see who is victorious.
<<1>> is the new chief of Shatul. I should inform <<2>>.
As the new chief. I should inform <<1>>.
I've defeated the Celestial Serpent and returned him to his prison within the Apex Stone. The Scaled Court of Sanctum Ophidia has been scattered. I should speak with Atildel.

The dying archivist asked me to gather blood from all of the archivists that were killed by the Vosh Rakh, starting with her own. According to her, I'll need the blood to gain access to the sanctuary where the sacred words are stored.

I gathered the blood of the fallen archivists and the Hooded Orc provided me with a book that should help me find the path to the sanctuary where the sacred words are stored. He said the path begins in Malacath's shrine in Fharun Keep.
Azrath asked me to deliver the scroll containing the sacred words of Malacath to someone named Kroma. I should find her in a house marked with Malacath's light in Orsinium's residential district.
The Empress Regent has revealed herself as the Xivkyn Sovereign <<1>>. I should defeat her and reclaim the Elder Scroll she took.
I should speak to <<1>>.
To become chief of Shatul, I need to kill the victor in the Bloody Knoll.
I am the new chief of Shatul. I should inform <<1>>.
Shatul has a new chief. I should speak with <<1>> about what I witnessed in the Bloody Knoll.
I defeated <<1>>, which was controlled by a person connected with Rkindaleft itself. I should speak with him about his intentions.
According to Lyranth, an opponent called the Gravelight Sentry is the only thing standing between me and the Daedric Warden running this prison. I should defeat it and move on.
Ulsha confirmed that Chief Bazrag was being attacked by the Vosh Rakh at the same time as the temple was under assault in Orsinium. She has agreed to investigate the event as long as I do the same.
There's a way to the moot through the temple. I should talk to Chief Bazrag and figure out our next move.
According to Lyranth, I'll have to defeat <<1>> in order to reach the inner halls of the Imperial City Prison.
According to Lyranth, the way out lies ahead, past the final cell block.
I must help the Twilight Cantor Adara'hai cleanse the temple and banish the dro-m'Athra back to the void.
I have pushed back the dro-m'Athra and defeated their leader, Rakkhat, the Fang of Lorkhaj. I should speak with Adara'hai about what comes next.
I have pushed back the dro-m'Athra and defeated their leader, Rakkhat, the Fang of Lorkhaj. I should speak with Adara'hai about what comes next.
I have pushed back the dro-m'Athra and defeated their leader, Rakkhat, the Fang of Lorkhaj. I should speak with Adara'hai about what comes next.
I must help the Twilight Cantor Adara'hai cleanse the temple and banish the dro-m'Athra back to the void.
I must help the Twilight Cantor Adara'hai cleanse the temple and banish the dro-m'Athra back to the void.
According to Sister Terran, the Elder Scroll is up ahead in the Lower Elder Scrolls Library. I should clear the way for her to retrieve the Scroll.
Clivia is on her way to the top of the Tower. I should pursue and stop her.
The Empress Regent has summoned a powerful atronach to stop my approach. I must defeat it to move on.
Clivia's guards have attacked, and are preventing me from following the Empress Regent to reclaim the Elder Scroll. I should defeat them and pursue Clivia Tharn.

I am in a vision of the past. An Elven necromancer killed and raised my father, King Xakhwan. Though he knew the consequences, my brother struck my father down and now faces exile. I should leave the castle.
I should talk to <<1>> if I want to be certified as a blacksmith, clothier, or woodworker.
I should talk to <<1>> if I want to be certified as a provisioner, enchanter, or alchemist.
I should take the sword from its resting place.
This is the Covenant End.
This is the Dominion End.
This is the Pact End.
<<1>> is going over the details of their plan to draw out the vampire lord. I should stay nearby and listen closely.

The Throne Keeper says that when we activate the temple's defenses, Tu'whacca will send his "Breath" to help cleanse the temple. I must light the sacred braziers at the cardinal points on the temple grounds.
According to Sister Arminus, the Elder Scroll is located in the library of White-Gold Tower up ahead. We'll have to fight through the Imperial Throne Room to get there.
A powerful Daedra bars the way to the Tower's Library. I should defeat it to move on.
I should return to Moonhenge before the portal is closed forever.
I should return to Moonhenge before the portal is closed forever.
I should return to Moonhenge before the portal is closed forever.
I must enter the dungeon City of Ash in Greenshade. To be truly Undaunted I must destroy Horvantud the Fire Maw, the Ash Titan, and Valkyn Skoria.
I've cleared the City of Ash. I should find Glirion the Redbeard in my alliance's capital city.
Glirion the Redbeard is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
Glirion the Redbeard is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
Glirion the Redbeard challenged me to the test of the Frigid Tomeâ€”which means I have to read the book, and then defeat Valkyn Skoria.
I have agreed to enter the Imperial City Prison in Imperial City. To be truly Undaunted I must destroy Ibomez the Flesh Sculptor, the Flesh Abomination, and Lord Warden Dusk.
I've cleared the Imperial City Prison. I should find <<1>> in my alliance's capital city.
This time, <<1>> has challenged me to read the Warden's Tome, and then defeat the Lord Warden.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
Though Sister Terran managed to retrieve the Elder Scroll, Clivia Tharn has taken it and fled deeper into White-Gold Tower. I need to find Clivia.
This writ is from a trade consortium, merchants passing goods across the face of Nirn. I accepted a task to create a pair of Homespun Shoes, a Hat, and a Sash to complete my contract.
This writ is from the Fighters Guild, seeking help in their fight against the Daedra. I accepted  a task to create a Spidersilk Hat, a pair of Shoes, and a Sash to complete my contract.
This writ is from a group of "independent merchants," trading coin for supplies. I accepted a task to create an Ebonthread Hat, a pair of Shoes, and a Sash to complete my contract.
This writ is from a group trying to defend people displaced by fighting across Nirn. I accepted a task to create a pair of Cotton Shoes, a Hat, and a Sash to complete my contract.
This writ is from the military, seeking to keep the troops in Cyrodiil outfitted. I accepted a task to create a pair of Linen Shoes, a Hat, and a Sash to complete my contract.

This writ is from an arm of the Mages Guild. They seek to supply and arm their efforts in the Daedric realm of Coldharbour. I accepted a task to create a pair of Kresh Shoes, a Hat, and a Sash to complete my contract.

Maj wants me to speak to Glirion the Redbeard. She says he'll be able to tell me more about the pledge.
Maj's letter indicated I need to sign the Tome of the Undaunted to signal my intent. To take and complete Pledges, I must show that I'm ready for whatever comes.
To begin taking pledges, I'll need to reach the Undaunted Enclave. Maj al-Ragath's directions are pointing me to an area south of the Thalmor Embassy in Elden Root.
To begin taking pledges, I'll need to reach the Undaunted Enclave. Maj al-Ragath's directions are pointing me to the edge of town, just outside of Wayrest's western gate.
To begin taking pledges, I'll need to reach the Undaunted Enclave. Maj al-Ragath's directions are pointing me to an area near Mournhold's south gate, just off the trail into the city.
I should search for Almalexia outside the Tribunal Temple.
My first goal should be taking over the Goblin tribe. I need to kill their chief and take his head.
I have the Goblin chief's head. Once I mount it on a spike for the whole tribe to see, they'll revere me as their new leader.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
I have agreed to enter the White-Gold Tower. To be truly Undaunted I must destroy the Adjudicator, the Planar Inhibitor, and the Xivkyn Sovereign Molag Kena.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
I've cleared the White-Gold Tower. I should find <<1>> in my alliance's capital city.
<<1>> presented me with another challenge: read the Obelisk Tome and defeat Molag Kena.
Matthew suggested I search the alleys of Daggerfall's trade district for clues about the brutal murders of the city's poor. After searching the South Alley, I should search the West Alley next.
I need to clear the spiders out of the caves, so Praxin can purge the infestation with fire. I also need to keep an eye out for Guardian Sud-Hareem.
I need to clear the spiders out of the caves, so Praxin can purge the infestation with fire. I also need to keep an eye out for Guardian Sud-Hareem.
I need to clear the spiders out of the caves, so Praxin can purge the infestation with fire. I also need to keep an eye out for Guardian Sud-Hareem.
The whisperer seems to have the power to control minds. I need to find it and destroy it while my mind is still my own.
There's not much in the shack. Most likely whatever Rhavil was doing, the evidence is on his desk.
There was a zombie in the battlefield that used to be a Covenant soldier.
I awoke in some kind of prison cell. I should try to find a way out.
A woman named Lyris broke open my cell for me to escape. If I'm to survive I better arm myself.
Lyris seems to know her way around this prison. I should follow her.
We've been stopped by a prison guardâ€”a Dremora. I need to defeat him to pass.
With the guard defeated, Lyris and I can make our way out of this prison.
Another Dremora guard stands in my way. I must defeat him, and any others who bar the path.
We've defeated the guards, and now we can finally escape. I should let Lyris take the lead.
Lyris wants to speak to me before we move on. I should see what she has to say.
Lyris is on her way to rescue the Prophet, and needs my help. I should follow her.
Another Dremora stands in our way, but this one looks much more formidable. We'll have to defeat him like the others.
Lyris is on her way to rescue The Prophet, and needs my help. I should follow her.
Cadwell told us of another way into the Prophet's cell, but it's filled with traps and creatures. We should enter the Undercroft.
The door to the Prophet's cell is sealed. I should see if Lyris has any idea on what we should do next.
The Sentinel is destroyed. We should make for the entrance to the Prophet's cell.
Lyris said the Coldharbour Sentinels are allowing Molag Bal to watch over the Wailing Prison directly. If we are to escape Coldharbour, we will need to blind him by destroying one of the Sentinels.
The spell is complete! I should make my way to the portal.
The Prophet has begun summoning something to lift us to the portal above. I should wait for him to complete the spell.
The Undercroft reeks of death. We should carefully make our way through and enter the Prophet's cell.
We've found the Prophet, but he's within some kind of magical prison. I should see if Lyris knows how to get him out.
The Prophet said we'll need a Skyshard in order to return to Tamriel and attune my corporeal form to Nirn. I should collect the Skyshard.
We made it to the Anchor Mooring. I should talk to the Prophet.
Lyris knows someone named Cadwell who might know a different way into the Prophet's cell. We should find him and see what he knows.
The Prophet and I must fight our way past the guardian and through to the Mooring's base if we're to escape.
We've made our way to the Dark Anchor. The Prophet and I will need to reach the base of the Anchor Mooring.
The Prophet knows of a Daedric Anchor we can use to return to Tamriel. We should leave this place.
The Prophet is free, but Lyris is now trapped in the cell. I should talk to the Prophet and find out what's next.
We've entered the cell. The Prophet should be in here somewhere.
The way to Tamriel is open! I must enter the rift to escape!
I've emerged from the rift in an unfamiliar place. The Prophet is nearby, but his form is indistinct and translucent. I should speak with him.
Lyris must switch places with the Prophet in order to free him. Her efforts will catch the attention of more guards, no doubt.
The pinions on either side of the ritual circle seem to be activated. I should see if I can manipulate them to complete the ritual.
Lyris has to trade places with the Prophet in order to free him. I should wait for her to complete the exchange.
A Worm Cult assassin jumped me at Betar-Nes's house.
I must mount the twin Hagraven heads to draw out the matriarch.
I need to go to the old Nord barrow and check on the treasure hunter named Narsis Dren. I should look for him in the barrow at the top of the hill.
Narsis Dren believes we can find a way to return the draugr to their rest in the barrow's main burial chamber. He wants me to lead the way as we search for it.
Inside the antechamber, we found a large, impressive door that must lead to the main burial chamber. Maybe Narsis Dren has an idea about how we can open it. I should talk to him.
We have the broken puzzle pieces. Now we need to solve the puzzle lock to open the doors to the main burial chamber. Perhaps Narsis Dren has an idea about how we should proceed.

Narsis Dren thinks that we need to solve a puzzle lock to open the door to the main burial chamber. But three of the stone panels are broken. We need to find the missing pieces of the panels before we can attempt to solve the puzzle.
I should follow Narsis Dren through the door and speak to him on the other side.
Now that we entered the ancient tomb, we should see if we can find a way to end the draugr dilemma.
Narsis Dren led me to the treasure vault, which was likely his goal all along. I should speak to him.

So all of this was Narsis Dren's fault. Still, we were able to defeat the Dragon priest and the draugr should start to settle down now. I should return to Mazgroth's clan and make sure everything is all right.
I should return to the village and let Mazgroth know what Narsis Dren did. He may have caused the draugr problem, but at least he helped me fix it in the end.
I convinced Narsis to offer the Orcs some gold for the trouble he caused them. I should let Mazgorth know that the draugr won't be bothering them any longer.
I should talk to Narsis Dren and convince him to tell the Orcs the truth about Exile's Barrow.
I should tell Mazgroth the truth about what occurred in the Exile's Barrow.
I should talk to Rigurt and give him the things he needs to prepare a romantic evening for Ambassador Lazdutha.

Rigurt wants me to collect food that Orcs consider seductive so that he can prepare a romantic meal for Ambassador Lazdutha. He has given me Nordic equivalents to trade for Orc cheese and Orc ale. He also wants Orc poetry and perfumeâ€”just in case.
<<1>> is very worried for her daughter. I agreed to look for <<2>> in <<3>>. I should travel there.
According to <<1>>, her daughter is somewhere in <<2>>. I should search for <<3>>.
<<1>> and I found our way into Morkuldin. I should explore the lost home of the Morkul clan.
I discovered a great forge, and what seems to be the Hand of Morkul. Unfortunately, it is trapped within the forge itself. I should speak with <<1>> and see if she has any ideas on how to release it.
<<1>> asked me to rekindle Morkuldin's great forge. She thinks that doing so will release the Hand of Morkul. I should activate the blast furnace and the bellows.
I rekindled Morkuldin's great forge. I should return to <<1>>.
I convinced <<1>> to return the Hand of Morkul to her clan. I should meet her at Morkul Stronghold.
I should meet <<1>> in Morkul Stronghold. She said she would wait for my arrival to address her clan about the Hand of Morkul's fate.
Morkul clan seemed content with <<1>>'s explanation. I should speak with her before they depart.
Morkul clan seemed content with <<1>>'s explanation. I should speak with her before they depart.
I collected the items Rigurt needs to prepare a romantic dinner for Ambassador Lazdutha, the Orc he wants to woo. I should return to Morkul Clanhold and give him the items.

Meram offered to buy the amulet from me in the hope that she can sell it for a profit to someone interested in the legend of Thukhozod. But Khoruzoth's mother would likely want it to remember her son by. I need to decide what to do with the amulet.
Stibbons said I should talk to Lady Laurent. He thinks she needs help completing this particular expedition. She should be coming down the trail any moment now. I should head up there and meet her.
I need to climb the mountain named Sorrow and locate Torug's shrine. Lady Laurent also asked me to place trail markers for the rest of the expedition to follow.
Now that Kharsthun translated the ancient Orcish inscriptions I found, I should talk to Lady Laurent and see what she thinks.
Lady Laurent wants me to ascend to Sorrow's peak and retrieve the enchanted bracer known as the Armlet of Torug.
I recovered the Armlet of Torug, but I'm starting to feel a little light-headed. I should return to the relative safety of the shrine as quickly as I can.

I recovered the Armlet of Torug from Sorrow's summit. In my absence, Lady Laurent and Kharsthun's disagreement seems to have grown. Now I need to decide who to give this ancient treasure to. I should talk to both of them before I make my decision.
It appears that the Armlet of Torug turned Stibbons into a block of ice. I should talk to Lady Laurent about this.
It appears that the Armlet of Torug turned Stibbons into a block of ice. I should talk to Lady Laurent about this.
I should look for a researcher who's interested in ancient Nord curiosities and see if they want the relics I found.
I should talk to Berrice and find out what she plans to do with the Nord relics I gave to her.
Berrice said I should look her up at the museum in Orsinium. If the relics I provided her with turn out to have any historical value, she promised me a reward.
I agreed to help Meram and Bardun complete their contract. I should check inside the ruins for the missing Orc, Khoruzoth.

I should search the wrecked ships for the ambassador, Lady Sovelle, or any other survivors. I can also speak to survivors in the camp to see if they have any useful information about what happened out there.
I found Lady Sovelle's bodyguard, Skordo the Knife. Now I need to locate the ambassador.
While searching for any sign of Lady Sovelle, Skordo and I ran into Holbert and Lord Ethian. I should talk to Ethian and find out if he has any news.
Lord Ethian ran off. He thinks his wife might be at the nearby signal tower. I should follow after him and make sure he doesn't get into any trouble.
I caught up to Lord Ethian on top of the signal tower. I should talk to him.

Lord Ethian admitted that his father wanted to sabotage the ambassador's mission. But he also claims that there was no plan for anyone to get hurt and that he doesn't know where Sovelle is. We should return to Skordo and Holbert.
Holbert the first mate explained that Skordo spotted an old smuggler's cave and went to investigate. He thinks that Captain Henrisa and the ambassador may be there. I should go and meet him.
I rescued Lady Sovelle and she left the smuggler's cave to check on her wounded husband. I should catch up with her and see if there's anything else I can do.
I killed Henrisa and found Lady Sovelle. I should talk to her and set her free.
I found First Mate Holbert in one of the wrecked ships. Now I need to look for the ambassador and her bodyguard.
I successfully calibrated the Orb of Illumination and unlocked the chest. I should talk to Neramo to see what he found inside.
Neramo can now prevent the Dwarven constructs from attacking the quarry. I should go back to the surface and let the Orcs know that it's safe to return to work.
I found <<1>> in <<2>>, but she seems wounded. I should speak with her.

<<1>> seeks Morkuldin, the ancient home of her clan, which holds a relic known as the Hand of Morkul. I should help her search for the hidden entrance. She believes the nearby statues are clues to finding Morkuldin.
We're inside Frostbreak Fortress. Alinon wants us to look around and see if we notice any unusual plants or flowers. He thinks there must be something to lead us to the source of the briarhearts.
It looks like Alinon found something important. I should talk to him and find out what he discovered.
Alinon has disappeared. I need to find him in order to finish our mission.
I found Alinon. I should talk to him and find out how he got into this predicament.
Eveli Sharp-Arrow has arrived. Maybe she can rescue Alinon while I recover his missing alchemy bag and the elixir to destroy the source of the briarheart. I should talk to her.
King Kurog wants to speak to me about problems that require a personal approach.
King Kurog's shield-wives entered the tavern to give him a report concerning an attack inside the city. I should listen to what they have to say.
Forge-Mother Alga thinks the attack on the Trinimac temple might be a trap. She wants to discuss a different approach to this problem. I should talk to her.

Fanatics have taken control of the Trinimac temple in Orsinium and are holding hostages. Forge-Mother Alga thinks it's a trap for King Kurog. She asked me to go to the temple in his place and rescue the hostages.
I see that King Kurog's soldiers have taken up a position outside the temple. I should talk to the captain and see what the situation is.
The fanatics have barred the temple's main entrance from the inside. I need to find another way to get inside. The captain suggested their might be a back entrance. I should search around for that.

<<1>> no longer poses a threat to Rkindaleft. With his plans in ruins, he asked me to end his suffering. I must decide whether to close the final pressure valve and kill him, or return to <<2>> and leave him to his fate.
Eveli is calling me over near the temple. She might know something that could help me gain access to the Temple.
I have the key that unlocks the door to the rectory. Now I need to get inside and set the captured priests free.
Inside the rectory, I found the captured priests. I need to save Priest Uugus so I can ask him about High Priestess Solgra.
High Priestess Solgra went to defend the temple sanctuary. I need to find her and make sure the fanatics don't hurt her.
I found High Priestess Solgra, but one of the fanatics has threatened to kill her. I need to save her.
I rescued High Priestess Solgra. I should talk to her and see what she can tell me about the attack on the temple.
High Priestess Solgra suspects Chief Bazrag is behind the attack on the temple. I need to get the news to the forge-mother as soon as possible.
High Priestess Solgra suspects Chief Bazrag is behind the attack on the temple. I need to get the news to the forge-mother as soon as possible.
I need to survive the challenge of Seht's Balcony.
I should enter the next arena, The Spiral Shadows.
I need to survive this challenge, The Spiral Shadows.
I should enter the next arena, The Rink of Frozen Blood.
I need to survive this challenge, The Rink of Frozen Blood.
I should speak to <<1>>.
I decided to let Kharsthun keep the Armlet at Torug's shrine. I should let Lady Laurent know about my decision.
I decided to let Lady Laurent take the relic to the museum. I should talk to her and find out what we need to do next.
Orgotha asked me to find Murukh and the hunters who went after the Riekrs and their captives. She thinks they may have headed toward the cave in the cliffside.
Murukh asked me to find the hunters, Avreg and Zhasim. They followed the Riekrs toward the cave in the cliffside.
Avreg said that his brother Zhasim was still looking for the Orc captives deeper within the cave. I should try to find him before he gets into too much trouble.
Zhasim won't leave until he finds his cat, so I should continue to look for the other hunters.
The totem is beside the Riekr chief's throne. I should grab the totem so I can give it to Orgotha.
Now that I have the Riekr chief's totem, I should find Zubesha and set her free.
I found the missing hunters and collected the Riekr chief's totem. Now I should meet the Orc hunting party and give the totem to Orgotha.
I told High Priestess Solgra about the traitor and the location of the stolen supplies. Now I need to see if she can direct me to Forge-Mother Alga.
I should enter the next arena, Seht's Balcony.
The group of Orc peasants I rescued said that there was another group of peasants hiding in the cave near the waterfall. I should go rescue them as well.
The Orcs in the cave were frozen by the warlord Ice-Heart. Chief Bazrag is attempting to recover the stolen supplies, though. I should look around and try to help him pick up the trail.
I recovered the helm. I should give it to <<1>>.
I should search <<1>> for the helm. <<2>> last saw it in the possession of the ogre chief.
The pack contained a medallion etched with two moons that appears to be the work of a Khajiit crafter. I should show it to Zhasim
Zhasim thinks the prayer wheel may reveal something about the medallion we found. There might be a hint around here to help us solve the puzzle.
Zhasim ran deeper into the ruins to look for more clues about his past. I should look for him.
Zhasim found his mother's remains. I should speak to him and make sure he's all right.
I should enter the next arena, The Drome of Toxic Shock.
I need to survive this challenge, The Drome of Toxic Shock.

<<1>> discovered a terrible truth. The Hand of Morkul was long ago locked away by her clan because it was the centerpiece of a bloodforgeâ€”a terrible device that fused living captives into weapons and armor. I should speak with her.
I convinced <<1>> to hide the Hand of Morkul from her clan. I should meet her at Morkul Stronghold.
I should meet <<1>> in Morkul Stronghold. She said she would wait for my arrival to address her clan about the Hand of Morkul's fate.
Urfon Ice-Heart is dead. I should speak to King Kurog before we leave the fortress.
King Kurog asked me to meet him at Scarp Keep the next time I'm back in Orsinium.
I returned to the keep to find some kind of meeting taking place. I should speak to Forge-Mother Alga as soon as an opportunity presents itself.
King Kurog has arrived. I should listen to what he has to say.
The meeting didn't go as King Kurog planned. I should talk to him.
I found the missing hunters and collected the Riekr chief's totem. Now I should meet the Orc hunting party and give the totem to Orgotha.

I reached the shrine. According to the book, "The shrine in Fharun Keep hides the path to the sanctuary. Only a gift of life's most precious fluid, freely given by the holy curators, will reveal the way." I need to figure out what this means.
I'm inside the hidden sanctuary beneath Fharun Stronghold. I should figure out how to retrieve the sacred words of Malacath as the dying archivist requested.
Offering the blood of the archivists appears to have activated some ancient mechanism. I need to find the passage that leads to the hidden sanctuary.
After I retrieved the scroll containing the sacred words of Malacath, Azrath appeared again. I should talk to him.
A hooded Orc has appeared claiming to offer aid with my task. I should talk to him and see what he wants.
I found a scroll inside the coffer. I should talk to Zhasim about the contents of the scroll.
After we solved the prayer wheel puzzle, a coffer appeared. I should examine the coffer and see what's inside.
Another coffer appeared when we solved the riddle of the poem. I should see if it contains another scroll.
I should talk to Zhasim about the contents of the second scroll.
I should find Chief Bazrag and show him the note I found that talked about the stolen supplies.
I should go to the keep and let them know what I found out. Besides, the letter I received said I should present myself to Forge-Mother Alga when I arrive in Orsinium.
I see a Priestess of Trinimac welcoming adventurers to Orsinium. I should speak to her and see if she can direct me to Forge-Mother Alga.
Zhasim's mother used simple spells and children's puzzles to leave messages for him. I should help him find and solve the next puzzle.
A third coffer appeared when we solved the moons puzzle. I should check to see if it contains another scroll.
I found another scroll inside the coffer. I should talk to Zhasim about the contents of the third scroll.
Zhasim ran ahead again, still looking for his cat and hoping to find another note from his mother. I should keep an eye out for him.
