I tasted the "cup of wrath." I should let <<1>> know what I thought of it.
The clan chiefs have all agreed to attend King Kurog's Great Moot. I should talk to King Kurog.
I should talk to King Kurog to find out more about what he wants me to do to facilitate his Great Moot.
The clans I need to aid include Tumnosh, Morkul, and Shatul. Once I help them in the king's name, Kurog believes their chiefs will be obligated to attend the Great Moot.
The clan chiefs have all agreed to attend the Great Moot. I should report back to King Kurog at his cornerclub in Orsinium and give him the news.
I should speak with <<1>> about the tomb.
Eveli said the High Priestess wants to talk to me. I should go to the Temple of Ire in Orsinium and find out what this is all about.

High Priestess Solgra received news that one of the clan chiefs was taken captive by Trinimac extremists known as the Vosh Rakh. She asked me to go to Fharun Stronghold, meet up with Eveli, and find a way to rescue the chief.
<<1>> believes they found the tomb of <<2>>, a great Orc hero who died at the siege of Old Orsinium. I said I would speak with <<3>> about her objections to his theory.
A pair of burial urns should unlock the tomb doors. It seems I must find and drink from a pair of memorial pools to release the urns. I should search for the pools in the catacombs near the tomb.
I should place both burial urns to unlock the tomb doors.
I found Eveli at Fharun Stronghold. I should talk to her and see if she's learned anything that can aid us in this situation.
Eveli discovered that there's a large prison of some sort somewhere within Fharun Stronghold. I need to look around and see if I can determine the location of the prison without raising the alarm.
I discovered that the prison is hidden beneath Fharun Stronghold. I should meet Eveli behind the great hall and exchange information before we attempt to get inside.
Eveli secured the rope and dropped it into the well. I should climb down and see if I can locate the clan chief that the cult has taken prisoner.
I should enter the next arena, The Igneous Cistern.
I need to survive this challenge, The Igneous Cistern.
I agreed to aid Razasha and rescue Shaldagan and the other Orcs that were taken captive by the Vosh Rakh. I should enter the nearby ruins and look for the kidnapped travelers.
I freed Thorkh, one of the unwilling recruits brought to Paragon's Remembrance. According to Glothun's list I still need to find Shaldagan, Morushna, Batasha, and the two mages, Unsulag and Garhar.
I set all of the captured Orcs free. Now I need to safely lead them out of the ruins of Paragon's Remembrance.
I led the rescued Orcs, including Shaldagan, out of the ruins of Paragon's Remembrance. Now I should exit the ruins and talk to Razasha to make sure everyone is all right.
I need to search the underground prison and find the Orc chief taken captive by the Vosh Rakh.
Chief Bazrag is the prisoner? I should talk to him and find out what's going on here.
I need to escort Chief Bazrag safely out of the prison and back to High Priestess Solgra. Then maybe we can figure out what's really going on here.
There's a captive in a cage near Glothun the Recruiter. I should set him free.
I should talk to Kireth and find out more about the construct that Raynor tinkered with.

The nearby wreckage appears to be the result of Raynor's latest experimentâ€”a reactivated Dwarven sphere. If I use the lightning prod that Kireth gave me, I might be able to track the sphere by its energy discharges.
The lightning prod revealed after-images of the sphere and showed me which direction it headed in. I should follow the trail and see if it leads me to Raynor.
The sphere's energy trail led me to Raynor Vanos. I should talk to him and find out what happened after Kireth was knocked unconscious.
I finally caught up to the runaway Dwarven sphere. Raynor said I should use the lightning prod to siphon off some of the sphere's excess energy.
Just as I drove off the runaway sphere, Kireth and Raynor arrived. I think Kireth wants to talk to me. I should speak with her.
The lightning prod revealed another after-image. If I follow it, I should be able to find the runaway Dwarven sphere.
I finally caught up with the runaway Dwarven sphere at a camp of Reachmen raiders. I need to deal with the raiders and use the lightning prod on the sphere.
After defeating the Reachmen, the Dwarven sphere took off again. I should follow it.

Now that the Dwarven sphere has stopped rolling around, I should talk to Kireth and Raynor. Kireth wants to destroy it, but Raynor wants to repair it. I should see what they both have to say before we decide what to do with the construct.

I agreed with Raynor and let him fix the Dwarven sphere. It looks like he fixed it all right, but then it rolled off into the wilderness and Raynor went after it. I should talk to Kireth and see what she wants to do now.
I agreed with Kireth that the Dwarven sphere needed to be destroyed. I should talk to her to make sure the task was accomplished.
I escorted Chief Bazrag out of the Fharun prison. I should talk to him and see if I can figure out what's really going on here.
I should enter the next arena, Seht's Flywheel.
I need to survive this challenge, Seht's Flywheel.
I need to survive this challenge, Vale of the Surreal.
I should enter the next arena, Vale of the Surreal.
I was drawn into a memory of past events, prior to the destruction of Old Orsinium. It seems I walk in the shoes of Tamahl, one of <<1>>'s followers. I should speak with him and see what I can learn.
I collected a burial urn filled with the ashes of Tamahl, one of <<1>>'s followers. I should search the catacombs for another memorial pool to find the second burial urn.
I was drawn into another memory of past events, prior Old Orsinium's fall. Now I walk in the boots of Arakaul, one of <<1>>'s followers. I should speak with him and see what I can learn.
I collected both burial urns: one of Arakaul, an Orc lieutenant of <<1>>, and the other of Tamahl, the Redguard disciple of <<2>>. I should bring them to <<3>>.

I was drawn into a memory of past events, prior to the destruction of Old Orsinium. It seems I walk in the boots of Arakaul, one of <<1>>'s followers. I should speak with him and see what I can learn.
I collected a burial urn filled with the ashes of Arakaul, one of <<1>>'s followers. I should search the catacombs for another memorial pool to find the second burial urn.
I was drawn into another memory of past events, prior Old Orsinium's fall. Now I walk in the shoes of Tamahl, one of <<1>>'s followers. I should speak with him and see what I can learn.
Eveli arrived and helped defuse the situation before Chief Bazrag did something rash. I should talk to her and decide what we ought to do with the chief.
I need to talk to Eveli and explain what happened to Talviah. She also needs to know what I learned from Forge-Mother Alga.
I unlocked the tomb doors. I should enter with <<1>> and <<2>>.

<<1>> asked me to find evidence of this Daedric connection. She suggested searching <<2>>'s tent, as well as the giant camp where <<3>> was struck. I should also ask <<4>> if he noticed anything suspicious the night before the chief was wounded.

I found a copy of <<1>> in <<2>>'s tent, as well as <<3>> in the giant camp where <<4>> was wounded. <<5>> and <<6>> heard her moving around the night before the chief was wounded. I should see what <<2>> has to say about this.
<<1>> has demanded <<2>> pay the blood price for causing <<3>>'s death and named me her champion in the matter. I should speak with <<2>> about <<1>>'s demands.
With my help, <<1>> agreed to pay the blood price to <<2>>. I should speak with <<2>> to make sure the grudge is settled.
I convinced <<1>> that <<2>> was not to blame for <<3>>'s death. I should speak with her and see if she is willing to end her grudge.
I extracted the blood price from <<1>> through honorable combat. I should speak with <<2>> to make sure the grudge is settled.
It seems they were both right. This is the tomb of <<1>> and <<2>>â€”supposedly, two mortal enemies. I should look for an explanation of why this is possible.

I was drawn into another memory of past events, during the fall of Old Orsinium. I walk in the boots of <<1>>, a Knight of the Dragon who learned <<2>> planned to interfere with the duel of <<3>> and <<4>>. I should warn <<5>>, quickly!

I was drawn into another memory of past events, during the fall of Old Orsinium. I walk in the boots of <<1>>, a Knight of the Dragon who arrived to late to stop <<2>>'s betrayal. <<3>> and <<4>> are dead. <<5>> is woundedâ€”I should speak with him.

I was drawn into another memory of past events, during the fall of Old Orsinium. I walk in the boots of <<1>>, a Knight of the Dragon. <<2>> asked me to pursue and confront <<3>> for the murder of <<4>> and <<5>>.
This tomb is the resting place of both <<1>> and <<2>>. I should inform <<3>> of what I experienced.
I tasted the "brain pocket." I should let <<1>> know what I thought of it.
I tasted the "ventricle pie." I should let <<1>> know what I thought of it.
I tasted the smoked bear's head. I should let <<1>> know what I thought of it.
I eliminated the Proselytizer and her lieutenants. Now I need to find the back way out of here so that I can lead the freed captives to safety.
I was drawn into another memory of past events, during the fall of Old Orsinium. I walk in the boots of <<1>>, a Knight of the Dragon. <<2>> is dead. I should inform <<3>>.
I must kill Worm Cultists to find a Daedric Brand and a key to the chapel.
<<1>> asked me to bring her <<z:2>> and <<az:3>>.
I have the ingredients <<1>> requested. I should bring them to her.
I brought <<1>> what she wanted. I should speak with her.
The well might lead to the underground prison, but I need to find a rope or something we can use to climb down. I should search the buildings and see what I can find.
I found some rope. Now I should meet up with Eveli so that we can climb down into the well and search for a way into the underground prison.
I should enter the chapel to use the Daedric Brand and discover what the Worm Cult is doing with the exhumed skeletons.

Now that I have a Daedric Brand and access to the chapel, I must brand a skeleton. The skeleton should recite its orders, revealing why it is digging in the Memorial District and what it hopes to find.
I should tell the Drake of Blades about what I discovered in the chapel.

The map that the Drake of Blades found indicates that the Worm Cult's skeletal minions are digging beneath the crematorium. I should collect concentrated kindlepitch from Xivkyn Soulbranders. I may be able to cause a cave in with the right amount.
I must use the concentrated kindlepitch to destroy the Worm Cult's secret dig site. This should cripple their attempt to find the Dragonfire Cathedral.

I've destroyed the site where Molag Bal's skeletons were searching for something called the "Dragonfire Cathedral." Their digging operation is crippled. I should return to the alliance base and speak with the Drake of Blades about our next move.
I returned the mug to <<1>>. I should speak with him about releasing <<2>>.
I should search for the stolen goods. The journal said they were located just north of <<1>>, at the intersection of "aqueduct legs, narrow tree, gray serpent."
Shield-wife Razbela brought me a message from King Kurog. He wants me to appear before him at the keep in Orsinium. I should go and see what he wants.
I should decide what to do with this hideous mug. I could speak with <<1>> about what I dug up. However, <<2>>'s journal mentioned a buyer. If I wanted, I could sell the mug to <<3>>.
A messenger brought me a letter. He said he received it from a Wood Elf. I should open my Inventory and read the letter.

Eveli's message is in some sort of code. She told the messenger that the letter itself wasn't important, that what really matters is the beginning of every thought. I wonder if that's a clue to help me decipher the message?

The innkeeper's daughter directed me to a hidden passage in the lower storage area of the Greedy Gut. She said it would lead to a secret room where Eveli and Solgra are waiting for me. I should go and meet them there.
<<1>> agreed to give me a cut of her loot from the sale of the hideous mug. I should meet her in the Greedy Gut to settle up.
<<1>> wants me to turn over the hideous mug. I should speak with <<2>> to determine her fate. However, <<3>>'s journal mentioned a buyer. If I wanted, I could sell the mug to <<4>>.
I entered the secret area and heard Eveli, Solgra, and Bazrag talking in the room above. I should go up there and talk to High Priestess Solgra.
High-Priestess Solgra explained her position. The Vosh Rakh are the real threat and they have to be contained. I should talk to Eveli and see if I can make her understand what's at stake here.
I need to meet up with Eveli and the scouts at the ruins of Paragon's Remembrance.
I returned the mug to <<1>>. I should speak with him about a reward.
I rendezvoused with Eveli and the scouts, Talviah and Flies-in-Wind. I should talk to Eveli and find out what they've learned about the area around Paragon's Remembrance.

I need to find a way to disguise ourselves as a Vosh Rakh cultist so that Eveli, the scouts, and I can gain entry to the ruins. Eveli suggested I follow the group that went west toward the echatere mating grounds.
With the amulet I found, I should be able to enter the ruins of Paragon's Remembrance undetected.
<<1>> asked me to bring her <<mz:2>>, some <<z:3>>, and <<z:4>>.
I have the ingredients <<1>> requested. I should bring them to her.
I brought <<1>> what she wanted. I should speak with her.
I'm disguised as a Vosh Rakh cultist and I'm inside the ruins of Paragon's Remembrance. Now I should find Eveli and the scouts and see what we can learn about the cult's plans.
Talviah and I have our disguises. Now to head into the Chambers of Loyalty and see what the high-ranking cultists are meeting about.
The Worm Cult has been using the exhumed skeletons to excavate something called the Dragonfire Cathedral. I should meet up with the Drake of Blades in the Undertaker's Office to plan our next move.
I entered the Chambers of Loyalty. I need to find out what the high-ranking Vosh Rakh are meeting about. Then I should rendezvous with Talviah and compare notes.
I need to complete the trials in order to learn what the Vosh Rakh are planning for Orsinium. Apparently, I can read the scrolls and select one of Trinimac's blessings to aid me.
<<1>> asked me to bring her <<z:2>>, some <<z:3>>, and an <<z:4>>.
I have the ingredients <<1>> requested. I should bring them to her.
I brought <<1>> what she wanted. I should speak with her.
Kireth and Raynor want me to use the lightning prod again so that I can follow the runaway sphere. They'll catch up with me after they help the Orcs that the sphere attacked.
I should use the lightning prod again so that I can continue to track the runaway Dwarven sphere.
The lightning prod revealed another after-image. If I follow it, I should be able to find the runaway Dwarven sphere.
I should use the lightning prod again so that I can continue to track the runaway Dwarven sphere.
The lightning prod revealed another after-image. If I follow it, I should be able to find the runaway Dwarven sphere.
I should use the lightning prod again so that I can continue to track the runaway Dwarven sphere.
I should use the lightning prod again so that I can continue to track the runaway Dwarven sphere.
The lightning prod revealed after-images of the runaway Dwarven sphere. I should follow the images and try to find the overcharged construct.
<<1>> asked me to bring her some <<mz:2>>, <<mz:3>>, and <<z:4>>. <<1>> also wants me to collect a <<z:5>> from <<6>>, the bear that broke into and ate one of her food shipments.
I have the ingredients <<1>> requested. I should bring them to her.
I brought <<1>> what she wanted. I should speak with her.
<<1>> agreed to purchase the hideous mug. I should speak with her about my cut.

The Vosh Rakh council seems to know who I am. They want me to kill Talviah to prove my devotion to Trinimac. If I do that, they'll tell me the information I came here to uncover. So, should I kill my ally or attack the Vosh Rakh?
I learned the Vosh Rakh's plan to eliminate the chiefs at the moot and blame High Priestess Solgra from Forge-Mother Alga. I should rendezvous with Eveli and Flies-in-Wind to let them know.
I need to leave the Chambers of Loyalty and find Eveli and Flies-In-Wind. Chief Bazrag and Eveli are in danger, and the Vosh Rakh plan to kill the clan chiefs at the moot.
I should talk to Eveli and let her know what we uncovered before I head back to Orsinium to warn about the upcoming attack on the moot.
King Kurog has discovered that Eveli Sharp-Arrow is trying to get Chief Bazrag to High-Priestess Solgra safely. I should try to find Eveli and warn her that the king is looking for her.
It seems High-King Emeric's <<z:1>> was killed. I should inform <<2>> in Orsinium.
I should search the ruins for clues to the <<z:1>>'s fate.
Curator Umutha says that another relic, <<1>>, lies somewhere near Sorrow, a mountain to the north of Orsinium. I should go there and try to find it.
I found <<1>>. Now I should return to <<2>> and donate the relic to the House of Orsimer Glories.
Now that the helm is in its proper place, I can talk to <<1>> and find out what else is planned for the museum.
Curator Umutha asked me to place Uzdabikh's Helm in its display on the lower level of the museum.
I've acquired the concentrated kindlepitch. I should make my way to the crematorium to meet up with the Drake of Blades.
I found a notice from the House of Orsimer Glories. I should talk to the curator of the museum and find out more about the relics they're looking for.
Now that I set the captive free, I should talk to him and see what he can tell me about this place.
I dealt with some Vosh Rakh fanatics disguised as Orsimer soldiers and recovered the key to the Greedy Gut inn. Now I should enter the inn and find Chief Bazrag and Eveli.

I freed as many of the cult's captives as I could. I should eliminate the leader of the cultists here in Paragon's Remembrance, Azhnura the Proselytizer. That should curtail the Vosh Rakh's recruitment efforts in Wrothgar.
I found Chief Bazrag and Eveli inside the inn. I should talk to the chief and compare notes.
I must travel to the Imperial Arena, enter the Daedra's bloody martial contest, and defeat all comers.
After I slaughtered the Daedra in the Imperial Arena, a threadbare figure appeared outside the arena and called to me.\n\nThis may be The Rat. I should follow him.
I've discovered The Rat's hideout, a small room beneath the Imperial Arena. I should see what he has to say about Molag Bal's plans for Imperial City.

The Rat told me that Molag Bal somehow plans to "erase" the Dragonfires, which prevent Daedric invasions so long as an emperor descended from Saint Alessia holds the throne. He suggested I bring this news to the Drake of Blades in the sewers.
I told the Drake of Blades about The Rat's claims that Molag Bal has a way to extinguish the Dragonfires forever, even if a new emperor is crowned. We should plan our next move.
King Kurog didn't want to talk in front of the clan chiefs. He asked me to meet him in the dining hall on the lower level of the keep to continue our conversation.
I've slaughtered all Daedra in the Imperial Arena. Perhaps this will catch The Rat's attention. I should wait to be contacted.
Forge-Mother Alga attacked me. I'm not completely certain what happened after that, but I seem to be somewhere safe with Chief Bazrag. I should talk to him.
I led the rescued Orcs out of Paragon's Remembrance. I should talk to Razasha and make sure everyone's all right.
I led the rescued Orcs, including Shaldagan, out of the ruins of Paragon's Remembrance. Now I should exit the ruins and talk to Razasha to make sure everyone is all right.
I recovered the key to the Greedy Gut inn. Now I should enter the inn and find Chief Bazrag and Eveli.
I agreed to extract the blood price from <<1>> through honorable combat. I should meet her by the river.
<<1>> claims she had nothing to do with <<2>>'s death. I should speak with <<3>> and see what she thinks of <<3>>'s explanations.
<<1>> refused to pay the blood price to <<2>>, but chose exile to prevent further animosity in Shatul. I should speak with <<2>> to make sure the grudge is settled.
I managed to get inside the inn, but everyone's gone except the messenger who gave me Eveli's note. I should talk to him and find out what happened.
Owayine claimed that King Kurog ordered the attack on the inn. I should go to the keep and find out what happened to Chief Bazrag and Eveli Sharp-Arrow.
Alga attacked me, but it appears that one of Kurog's shield-wives came to me rescue. I should speak to her to find out what's going on.
The tomb is supposed to be somewhere inside Coldwind's ancient den. It may be protected from intruders.
The ancient shade beckons me. I should talk to him.
King Torug's shade wants me to learn about Wrothgar's past by placing ceremonial objects in the offering bowls situated around this room.
I witnessed a reenactment of Torug uniting with Coldwind. I can take the snow bear's skull now.
Back at the House of Orsimer Glories, the curator waits for me to bring her the Skull of Coldwind.
I need to get to the moot before Kurog and Alga eliminate the chiefs. There's a path in the throne room. I just need to get past the Vosh Rakh soldiers to utilize it.
Chief Bazrag and Eveli are being held in the cells beneath the keep. I need to find them and set them free before I try to get to the moot.
All of the paths to the moot have been sealed, except for the one through the temple. I need to find Chief Bazrag and let him know.
There's a way to the moot through the temple. I should talk to Chief Bazrag and figure out our next move.
The Drake of Blades told me that we must attack the Temple of the One now to prevent Egnatius from being killed. I should make my way there and rescue him from his Daedric captors.
Egnatius appears to have escaped the Temple of the One alive. I should track him down in the southwest corner of the district and speak to him.

Egnatius informed me that Molag Bal's servants are looking for information on a scroll he found just prior to the invasion. A scroll that only he can read. I should tell the Drake of Blades what I learned.
I decided to sell the amulet to Meram. I should talk to her and complete the deal.
I decided to track down Khoruzoth's mother, Yazoga, to give her his amulet and tell her what happened to her son.
I found Khoruzoth but unfortunately he was dead. I took an amulet he was wearing that bore his name so it can be returned to his mother. I should take it to Meram and let her know what I found.
Chief Bazrag has one more task for me to do before I leave Wrothgar. I should talk to him and find out what he needs.
I need to get to the temple and protect High Priestess Solgra from Kurog's Vosh Rakh soldiers.
I'm in the temple but all I see are a few priests. I should ask them where High Priestess Solgra is so I can get to her before Kurog's soldiers.
I should return to the temple and check on Eveli Sharp-Arrow.
To get to the moot, I need to find the tunnels hidden beneath the library in the Temple of Ire.
The priests explained that the soldiers chased High Priestess Solgra upstairs and out of the temple. I need to catch up with them before something terrible happens.
I dealt with the Vosh Rakh soldiers sent by King Kurog to attack High Priestess Solgra. I should talk to her and make sure she's all right.
We've reached a large cave beneath Imperial City containing the Dragonfire Cathedral. I must follow the Drake of Blades, Father Egnatius, and Captain Caudex inside to perform the ritual.
We've reached a large cave beneath Imperial City containing the Dragonfire Cathedral. I must follow The Drake of Blades, Father Egnatius, and Captain Caudex inside to perform the ritual.
Captain Caudex set up siege weapons to allow me to defend Dragonfire Cathedral's barricades against invading Daedra. I must hold them off long enough for Father Egnatius to complete the ritual.
Daedra are assaulting the Dragonfire Cathedral from all sides. I must defend the barricades with the ballista while also fighting off Daedra who try to stop me.
The Daedra have smashed the barricades and forced their way into the Dragonfire Cathedral. I must defend the Sublime Brazier at all costs.
The Daedra are defeated and Father Egnatius has completed the ritual to imbue The Drake of Blades with Akatosh's power. I must witness the ritual's completion.

The Drake of Blades has been transformed into the Sublime Brazier's immortal guardian. She wields the power of Akatosh, and will live forever, but cannot leave the Dragonfire Cathedral. I should see if she has any last words before we part.

The Drake of Blades has become Akatosh's immortal guardian. She will remain in the Dragonfire Cathedral, defending the Sublime Brazier from any who would seek to destroy it for all time. I should speak with Father Egnatius back in the Alliance base.

The Drake of Blades has decided to become the Sublime Brazier's immortal guardian. We must go to the Dragonfire Cathedral, buried deep beneath Imperial City, and perform a ritual to complete the Drake's transformation.

Father Egnatius has begun the ritual to imbue The Drake of Blades with Akatosh's power, but the Dragonfire Cathedral is under assault by the forces of Molag Bal. I must hold them off until Egnatius completes the ritual.
Lord Ethian was wounded trying to confront Captain Henrisa. I should follow the captain into the smuggler's cave and avenge Lord Ethian. If Lady Sovelle is inside, perhaps I can help her as well.
Daedra will soon assault the doors of the garrison. I must defend the doors from all attackers.

Captain Caudex gave me an ancient scroll. According to him, it has the power to make people immortal and may even bestow prophetic dreams. He had a dream that I would deliver this scroll to the Drake of Blades.
The priests explained that the soldiers chased High Priestess Solgra and Eveli upstairs and out of the temple. I need to catch up with them before something terrible happens.
I dealt with the Vosh Rakh soldiers sent by King Kurog to attack High Priestess Solgra. I should talk to her and make sure she's all right.
My allies have been attacked by the king's soldiers. I need to find the attackers and make them pay for what they've done.
My allies have been attacked by the king's soldiers. I need to find the attackers and make them pay for what they've done.
I defeated the last of the Vosh Rakh sent to kill the high priestess. Now I should confront the assassin who's cowering on the platform above.
I defeated the last of the Vosh Rakh sent to kill the high priestess. Now I should confront the assassin who's cowering on the platform above.
I should return to the temple and check on High Priestess Solgra.

We're in the temple library, looking for the secret passage that will take us to the tunnels beneath the city and eventually to the moot. I should investigate the library for any clues to the passage's location.
I found the secret passage that leads to the tunnels. Now I need to get to the moot and stop Kurog before he has the clan chiefs assassinated.
Kurog has begun his attack against the clan chiefs. I need to get inside and rescue as many of the chiefs as possible.
The chiefs are safe. Now I have to deal with King Kurog and Forge-Mother Alga.
King Kurog and Forge-Mother Alga are dead. I should talk to Chief Bazrag and see what he wants to do next.
I met Skordo outside an old smuggler's cave. I should talk to him and see what he found out.

<<1>> believes they found the tomb of <<2>>, a great Redguard hero who also died at the siege of Old Orsinium. She thinks the key to opening the tomb can be found in the nearby catacombs. I should search for the entrance to the catacombs.
<<1>> thinks the key to opening the tomb can be found in the nearby catacombs. I should examine the monument stone near the catacomb entrance.
When I awoke from the memory of Tamahl and <<1>>, the waters parted to reveal a hidden alcove. I should collect <<Cz:2>>.
When I awoke from the memory of Arakaul and <<1>>, the waters parted to reveal a hidden alcove. I should collect <<Cz:2>>.
When I awoke from the memory of Arakaul and <<1>>, the waters parted to reveal a hidden alcove. I should collect <<Cz:2>>.
When I awoke from the memory of Tamahl and <<1>>, the waters parted to reveal a hidden alcove. I should collect <<Cz:2>>.

I was drawn into a memory of past events, prior to the destruction of Old Orsinium. It seems I walk in the shoes of Tamahl, one of <<1>>'s followers. Now that I've learned what I could, I should find a way to awaken from this memory.

I was drawn into a memory of past events, prior to the destruction of Old Orsinium. It seems I walk in the boots of Arakaul, one of <<1>>'s followers. Now that I've learned what I could, I should find a way to awaken from this memory.

I was drawn into another memory of past events, prior Old Orsinium's fall. Now I walk in the boots of Arakaul, one of <<1>>'s followers. I've learned what I could, so I should find a way to awaken from this memory.

I was drawn into another memory of past events, prior Old Orsinium's fall. Now I walk in the shoes of Tamahl, one of <<1>>'s followers. I've learned what I could, so I should find a way to awaken from this memory.
I agreed to try to find the gold pendant that Youss lost when he fled from the wrecked ships. I'll see if I can locate it among the wreckage of the frozen fleet.
I found a pendant while exploring the wrecked ships. I should bring it back to Youss and determine if it's the one he lost.
Youss claims that the pendant belongs to him and that Azeeda is lying just to punish him for rejecting her advances. I decided that Youss is telling the truth and will turn the pendant over to him.
A woman claims the pendant belongs to her. I should try to determine who the piece of jewelry actually belongs to before I turn it over to either of them.
The relic belongs with the Malacath faithful. I should speak with <<1>> about my reward.
I must decide what to do with the <<1>>. I could return it to the Malacath faithful in Orsinium, rededicate it at the statue of Malacath, or destroy it for good in the forges behind the statue.
The relic must be rededicated. I should pray in the shadow of Malacath's statue.

The Drake of Blades told me that Egnatius is likely being held prisoner near one of the Temple District's shrines. I should proceed to these shrines and free any captives I find. One of them may be the priest we seek.

I freed several priests from the Daedra, but Engatius was not among them. One of the priests indicated that the Daedra took Egnatius to the Temple of the One. I should reunite with the Drake of Blades and tell her what I've learned.
One of the other survivors wants to talk to me. I should see what she wants before I return the pendant to Youss.

Azeeda claims that the pendant belongs to her and that Youss is lying so that he can sell the pendant and make some gold. I decided that Azeeda is telling the truth and will turn the pendant over to her.
I must travel to the Ebonheart Pact base in the Imperial City and meet with the commanding officer, General Nesh-Tan, for a briefing.
Lady Laurent asked me to head up the mountain and present myself to Kharsthun, her liaison from the House of Orsimer Glories.
<<1>> believes the <<2>> is in the recently uncovered catacombs of Honor's Rest. I should head there and search for the relic.
When I entered the catacombs near Honor's Rest, one of the Winterborn approached me. He wants to speak, and apparently doesn't want his fellow tribesman to hear. I should see what he has to say.
The Drake of Blades whispered for me to meet her nearby. I should go speak to her.
I should conclude my conversation with the Drake of Blades.
Now that we completed the Gauntlet, I need to find the Vosh Rakh council so they can tell me about "the sacred" mission.
After I killed Talviah, Forge-Mother Alga appeared as a vision in the council chamber. I should talk to her and find out what the Vosh Rakh are actually planning.
While Lady Laurent and Kharsthun argue, I should talk to Stibbons and see what this is all about.
I should enter the next arena, The Vault of Umbrage.
I need to survive this challenge, The Vault of Umbrage.
I should enter the next arena, The Theater of Despair.
I need to survive this challenge, The Theater of Despair.
I should draw the Dragonguard Seal on a wall in the Elven Gardens District. This should alert the Drake of Blades' contact, and draw him to the meet.
I should speak with Captain Regilus, the Drake's contact in Legion Zero.
I need to find some scrap metal to make the false key. Any Legionary or Xivkyn might have some.
I must find Captain Regilus again, this time in the Groundskeeper's Storehouse on the northwestern wall.
I should finish my business with the Drake of Blades.
The scout urged me to head to the garrison at the center of the Nobles District. Once inside, I should seek out Captain Caudex to learn how they have resisted the Daedric onslaught for so long.
We've pushed back the Daedric invaders assaulting the garrison. Now that I've proven myself an ally, Captain Caudex may tell me more about how he and his soldiers have held out for so long.
Now that I collected the three vases, I need to place them in the correct order on the pedestals near the small, tranquil pool.
I must rescue the Chief Archivist before the Daedra put him to the sword. He may know more about this book.

The Chief Archivist told me that he masked the contents of this book with a spell before the Daedra got to it. Unfortunately, they are now unwittingly burning the ciphers that can decode it. I must find them before they can be burned.
The Daedra keep the book locked away in a strongbox near the central pavilion.
I should finish talking with the Drake of Blades.
I have decoded the book titled, "The Sublime Brazier." I should take it back to the Drake of Blades and see if she can make sense of its contents.
I should inform <<1>> that I placed all of his auricular geodes.
I need to kill Xivkyn  in the Memorial District to empower <<1>>'s auricular geodes.
I empowered <<1>>'s auricular geodes. Now I need to place them in undead laborers in the Memorial District.
I placed all of <<1>>'s auricular geodes. I should meet him at my base of operations in the Imperial Sewers.
I've found a handful of survivors, though there are undoubtedly more. I should return to Valga.
I need to rescue a handful of Imperial citizens. They can be found throughout the Arena District.
<<1>> wants me to recover the <<2>> so this tribe will no longer be a pawn to the whims of Malacath. He suggested I search the Honor's Rest catacombs, near the grave goods.
I found the <<1>> near some grave goods. I should retrieve it before the Winterborn can.
Now that I have the <<1>>, I should return to <<2>> and see what can be done with it.
I destroyed the relic. <<1>> seems incredibly relieved. I should speak with him.
<<1>> doesn't want his tribe to recover the relic. I should talk to him and find out why.
I must travel to the Daggerfall Covenant base in the Imperial City and meet with the commanding officer, General Aklash, for a briefing.
The Drake of Blades whispered for me to meet her nearby. I should go speak with her.
I should conclude my conversation with the Drake of Blades.
I arrived back at the keep. I should talk to Chief Bazrag and find out if he's decided what to do now that the king is dead.
I need to find the key that opens the Daedric strongbox.
Chief Bazrag asked me to meet him back at the keep. I should leave the moot and return to the keep.
Bazrag has been named king of Orsinium. I should speak to him before I leave.
Chief Bazrag asked me to deliver these letters to our allies and a few of his old friends, inviting them to attend Kurog's funeral.
I've cast the ritual on the artifacts I could find in the Temple District. I should return to <<1>> in my Alliance base and let her know.
<<1>> knows a ritual that can protect an object for a time. I'll need to find <<a:2>> and collect <<m:3>> from the Daedra around the district.
Now that I've gathered the components, I should find the brazier <<1>> mentioned and burn them to make an ash.
I've obtained <<A:1>> from the brazier. Now I need to find the casks of consecrated oil <<2>> spoke of and use it on them.
I've cast the ritual on the casks of consecrated oil. I should return to <<1>> in my Alliance base and let her know that the task is complete.
Now that I have all of the spell ciphers, I need to find the Chief Archivist. He said he would meet me in the nearby Archives.
The Chief Archivist has begun to cast the translation spell. I need to add the ciphers to the ritual.
I recovered the helm. I should give it to <<1>>.
I must travel to the Aldmeri Dominion base in the Imperial City and meet with the commanding officer, General Nedras, for a briefing.
The Drake of Blades whispered for me to meet her nearby. I should go speak with her.
I should conclude my conversation with the Drake of Blades.
I gathered some "materials" for <<1>>'s artwork. I should deliver what I found to him in Orsinium.
I should return to the Drake and inform her of what transpired.
I delivered all of Chief Bazrag's invitations. Now I should go to the King's Cornerclub and pick up a bottle of Kurog's favorite ale.
I'm in the King's Cornerclub. Now I need to speak to the barkeep and get a bottle of Kurog's favorite ale for the ceremony.
It's time for me to attend King Kurog's funeral. I should return to the keep and look for Chief Bazrag on the castle overlook.
Chief Bazrag has tasks for me to accomplish throughout the ceremony. I should listen carefully to what he has to say.
Bazrag has been named king of the Orsimer. I should go to the keep and speak to him before I leave.
I've gathered some Imperial records from the Arboretum. I should bring them to <<1>> in the Alliance base.
I should talk to Chief Bazrag before the funeral ceremony begins.
I've gathered some records from the Arboretum. I should bring them to <<1>> in the Alliance base.
<<1>> seems a little shaken after his cart crashed. He wants me to find his partners, who he fears went over the cliff with his cart. I'll search near the wreckage and see if I can find them.

According to <<1>>, harpies carried off the third merchant and took her high up into the rocks. To make matters worse, <<2>>, was carrying the merchant's permit that gave the trio permission to buy and sell in Orsinium. I should try to find them.
I found the corpse of the third merchant. I need to search and see if I can find the <<1>>.
I've recovered the merchants' Trade Writ but not their lost friendâ€”she was killed by the harpies. I need to take the <<1>> back to <<2>> on the road to Orsinium.

<<1>> believes the archivists have fled to the outskirts of the district. \n\nHe told me that I must stop the Flame Atronachs and Daedroth from indiscriminately burning the city's histories and records. Some of the Dremora may be carrying them as well.
I've seriously disrupted Legion Zero's attempts to build a new fleet of siege engines. I should travel to my Alliance's base and let <<1>> know what I've accomplished.
I've seriously disrupted Legion Zero's attempts to build a new fleet of siege engines. I should travel to my Alliance's base and let <<1>> know what I've accomplished.
Kharsthun explained that some members of their expedition may have survived. He wants me to head farther up the mountain and look for any survivors while I also try to find the shrine of Torug.
Kharsthun wants me to search for the remaining stanzas in Torug's epitaph while I also look for his shrine. He thinks the complete epitaph might lead us to the location of the Armlet of Torug.

I discovered the missing members of Lady Laurent's expedition. It appears that none of them survived. One member appears to have made a rubbing of some sort. I should talk to Kharsthun and see if he knows what it means.
I've acquired enough scrap metal to craft the false key. I need to travel to the western forge. Once there, I must use the key mold to create the fake key that we will switch for the real one.
In order to make the key look worn, I need to treat it with acid. Regilus said there should be some in the Daedric laboratory on the north side of the district.
Captain Regilus is going to distract the guardian of the key while I perform the switch.
I have the real key. I need to find Captain Regilus back in the sewer hideout.
Doranar asked me to acquire authentic ogre "artistic materials" for his piece. He suggested I try the nearby ogre den in <<1>>.
<<1>> told me of a great forge being used to create more siege engines for Molag Bal. I should find some tar. I can use it to ruin the forge and slow down production.
Legion Zero is producing more and more ballistae to continue the bombardment of Imperial City and lands beyond. <<1>> asked if I could cut down on their numbers by setting the unused ones ablaze.
Now that I have the tar <<1>> spoke of, I should go to the great forge and dump it on their coals to ruin their engine-building operation.
I've finished resetting Brihana's traps and slaying Legion Zero soldiers. I should look for her in my Alliance base.
I've killed several legionaries and reset Brihana's traps. I should meet with her in the Alliance base to receive my payment.
<<1>> asked me to reset her Ogrim traps and kill any meddlesome Legion Zero soldiers I find.
I have The Rat's message. I must return to the Drake of Blades to finalize our plans for defending the Sublime Brazier.
Before we enter the Dragonfire Cathedral, I must retrieve a message from our unlikely ally, The Rat. According to The Drake of Blades, it may provide some vital information about Molag Bal's plans.
I should take the permit and try to return it to the merchants. Perhaps I can meet them on the road to Orsinium.
I encountered two Daggerfall merchants standing by the side of the road to Orsinium. It's possible they're the ones mentioned in the <<1>>. I should talk to them.
I should speak to Siege Commander Dulph and see what kind of help he needs.
I need to report to Siege Commander Dulph within the siege camp to find out how I can help the Orc soldiers get into Frostbreak Fortress.
I met a survivor from the fleet of ships that smashed upon the ice on Wrothgar's northwestern shore. The survivor asked me to find Lord Ethian at the makeshift camp they set up near the ice.
Curator Umutha asked me to place the Agra Crun, the legendary "blood shield" of the Orcs, in its display on the lower level of the museum.
I placed the "blood shield" on display in the museum. Now I should return to Curator Umutha and find out more about the historic relics the museum is seeking.
Lady Laurent wants me to brave the ogre-infested shrine and find any evidence as to the location of Torug's remains.
I need to escort Alinon the Alchemist into Frostbreak Fortress.
<<1>> wants me to unearth the skull of the ancient snow bear, Coldwind. If I want to recover Coldwind's Skull, I need to head to northern Wrothgar and locate the snow bear's den.
I need to enter the den if I want to find the tomb.
I burned a number of the briarheart saplings and Alinon's plan appears to be working. I should return to Alinon and Eveli and determine our next step.
Someone must be interested in buying the whistle I found at Nikolvara's Kennel. I should go to Orsinium and see if I can locate a buyer.
I need to find Alinon's alchemy bag and the elixir inside so that I can destroy the source of the briarhearts.
I defeated the ancient dragon priest of the barrow. Narsis Dren grabbed something and ran off, yelling about a treasure vault. I should catch up to him.
I met one of the Orcs that accompanied the chief on his aborted rescue mission. He says that hunt-wife Bolgar is still in the quarry, looking for the High Elf and her daughter. I need to find her.
I killed Magnar and collected the werewolf pelts. I should return to Menninia to collect my reward.
I killed Magnar and collected the werewolf pelts. I should return to Menninia to collect my reward.
I must slay the werewolves of Argent Mine to collect their pelts. I must also kill their leader, Magnar Child-Eater.
I killed Magnar and collected the werewolf pelts. I should return to Menninia to collect my reward.
The client, Menninia, might have some additional information on the task. Perhaps I should speak to her.
I must burn the bandits' supplies and kill their leader, Sir Marq Tailas, to fulfill the contract.
I destroyed the bandits' supplies and dealt with their treacherous leader. I should meet Sergeant Oufa in Orsinium to receive my payment.

I met an Orc artisan who claims to have been part of caravan that was attacked by the Vosh Rakh. He says that he and one other member of the caravan escaped, but the rest were taken captive. I should find Razasha and see what she knows.
To aid my Alliance in conquering the Imperial City, I must travel to the Memorial District via the ladder-works to scout and secure a rally point.
The rally point looks secure. I must raise my Alliance's colors to signal the "all clear" to our invading forces.
I was drawn into another memory of past events, during the fall of Old Orsinium. I walk in the boots of <<1>>, a Knight of the Dragon. A wounded Orc has approached me. I should speak with him.
I must retrieve these unusual eggs and slay the hagraven, Kraala Birdsong.
I gather the unusual eggs and killed the hagraven. I should return to <<1>> and collect my reward.
The Wood Elf egg merchant, Nednor, might have some additional information on the task. Perhaps I should speak to him.
Once I enter Wrothgar, I need to find the caravan.
To aid my Alliance in conquering the Imperial City, I must travel to the Arboretum via the ladder-works to scout and secure a rally point.
The rally point looks secure. I must raise my Alliance's colors to signal the "all clear" to our invading forces.
To aid my Alliance in conquering the Imperial City, I must travel to the Arena District via the ladder-works to scout and secure a rally point.
The rally point looks secure. I must raise my Alliance's colors to signal the "all clear" to our invading forces.
I need to use Raynor's mysterious orb to collect data on the mechanical constructs of Zthenganaz. I must also destroy the dreaded Ztheng Guardian.
I destroyed the Guardian and collected data on the Dwarven constructs. I should find Raynor Vanos and collect my reward.
The client, Raynor Vanos, might have some additional information on the task. Perhaps I should speak to him.
To aid my Alliance in conquering the Imperial City, I must travel to the Elven Gardens District via the ladder-works to scout and secure a rally point.
The rally point looks secure. I must raise my Alliance's colors to signal the "all clear" to our invading forces.
To aid my Alliance in conquering the Imperial City, I must travel to the Nobles District via the ladder-works to scout and secure a rally point.
The rally point looks secure. I must raise my Alliance's colors to signal the "all clear" to our invading forces.
To aid my Alliance in conquering the Imperial City, I must travel to the Temple District via the ladder-works to scout and secure a rally point.
The rally point looks secure. I must raise my Alliance's colors to signal the "all clear" to our invading forces.
I need to find Chief Bazrag and help rescue the Orc peasants from the Winterborn marauders.
I must collect some of this special durzog feed and slay the master durzog handler, Nikolvara the Durzog Trainer.
I collected the special durzog feed and killed Nikolvara the Durzog Trainer. I should meet with Arushna to discuss my payment.
The client, Arushna, might have some additional information on the task. Perhaps I should speak to her.
The Phial of Tranquility should allow me to free the spirits trapped in Thukhozod's Sanctum, provided I do enough damage to their undead husks first. I must also kill the necromancer responsible.
I freed many of the spirits trapped in Thukhozod's Sanctum and killed the necromancer, Gorlar the Dark. I should seek out the priest, Thazeg, to discuss my payment.
The Orc priest, Thazeg, might have some additional information on the task. Perhaps I should speak to him.
Hunt-Wife Bolgar asked me to continue searching for her daughter, Shabon. She thinks I'll find her with the High Elf.
I found the hunt-wife's daughter, Shabon. She said that the High Elf went to investigate the central structure. I should go in there and locate him.
Chief Bazrag asked me to try to uncover the traitor and track down the stolen supplies. He suggested I start my search at the inn in Orsinium.
I should ask around in the inn and see if anyone can lead me to the traitor.
I persuaded the Tumnosh clan to utilize the Dwarven constructs to work Graystone Quarry until they can recover from the losses they suffered. I should talk to Forge-Wife Kharza and complete the deal.
There's certainly an odd smell in the air. I should follow the scent and see if it leads me to Gulug.
It seems that a trader who's friendly with a group of Khajiit has recently come into possession of a good deal of gold. He wears a very distinctive fragrance that should help me find him.
I found Gulug in a bath house in Orsinium. I should confront him and find out what he knows about the stolen supplies.
In the brief time <<1>> traveled with <<2>>, she noticed he was obsessive about keeping a journal. She believes the journal will help prove her innocence.
I told High Priestess Solgra where to find the stolen supplies, but I left out Gulug's name as the traitor. Now I need to see if she can direct me to Forge-Mother Alga.
<<1>> has something to say about about the fight with <<2>>. I should speak with him.
<<1>> is avenged. <<2>> and I should return to the chief's tent with the trophy from <<3>>.

<<1>>, one of Shatul's warriors, wants me to help him track down the giant responsible for the chief's injuries. <<1>> thinks this will both pull the clan together and show him as a good candidate to become the new chief.

<<1>>, one of Shatul's warriors, wants me to help him track down the giant responsible for the chief's injuries. <<1>> thinks this will both pull the clan together and show him as a good candidate to become the new chief.

<<1>>, one of Shatul's warriors, wants me to help him track down the giant responsible for the chief's injuries. <<1>> thinks this will both pull the clan together and show him as a good candidate to become the new chief.
<<1>>, <<2>>'s mother, wants to speak with me.
<<1>> sent me to meet <<2>>, one of Shatul's warriors. I should find him near Shatul.
<<1>> needs some help wrangling <<2>>, one of Shatul's prized echatere. Once I wake it, I need to work with <<1>> to guide <<2>> as it hunts for a <<z:3>>.
<<1>> and I guided <<2>> to dig up a <<z:3>>. I should take it.
I should hunt some of Wrothgar's larger animals for their meat. I should also slay the poachers who are disrupting the city's food supply.
I should deliver this meat to Bagrugbesh. She'll also want to hear how I dispatched the poachers.
Bagrugbesh is responsible for the city's food stores. Perhaps I should speak to her.
I must reclaim Cirantille's stolen pages from the ogres of Wrothgar and kill their leader, Mad Urkazbur.
The High-Elf book scholar, Cirantille, knows a great deal about these stolen books. Perhaps I should speak to her.
I recovered Cirantille's book and killed Mad Urkazbur. I should return to Orsinium and inform Cirantille of my success.
Any ogre in Wrothgar could be holding some of Cirantille's lost pages. I should kill and loot every ogre I encounter.
I should seek the guidance of Malacath to get me through Hammer's Bypass.
I must honor the clans who built Old Orsinium to unlock Hammer's Bypass. I should light the braziers to learn the founding clans.
The four honored clans who built Old Orsinium are the key to unlocking Hammer's Bypass. I should press the floor panels matching the honored clans.
I should seek the guidance of Malacath to get me through Temper's Fork.
I must curse the clans who caused Old Orsinium's downfall to unlock Temper's Fork. I should light the braziers to learn which clans failed Malacath.
The four cursed clans who caused Old Orsinium's downfall are the key to unlocking Temper's Fork. I should press the floor panels matching the cursed clans.
I must light the great pyre at the heart of Old Orsinium to complete the Rites of Praise and Scorn. <<1>>'s order will try to stop me, as part of the rites.
I lit the great pyre at the heart of Old Orsinium. It seems Malacath, the Daedric Prince of Vengeance, has something to say to me. I should speak with him.
I lit the great pyre at the heart of Old Orsinium. It seems Malacath, the Daedric Prince of Vengeance, has something to say to me. I should speak with him.
I must cleanse the corruption gnawing at the heart of the Wrothgar wilderness using Ushang's totem and destroy the blight's originator, Corintthac the Abomination.
I cleansed the forest's corruption and killed Corintthac. I should return to Ushang to claim my reward.
Ushang the Untamed knows a great deal about this arcane corruption. Perhaps I should speak to him.
I must use Ushang's totems to root out Corintthac's corruption.

I need to light a brazier to begin the "Rites of Praise and Scorn." If the Daedric Prince Malacath deems me worthy, he will supposedly guide me through something called Hammer's Bypass and Temper's Fork.
I need to seek out and disrupt the Worm Cult's bizarre obelisks in order to destroy Zandadunoz the Reborn.
I disrupted the cultists' rituals and defeated Zandadunoz the Reborn. I should return to Orsinium and speak to Lilyameh.

Now that I'm inside the Temple of Ire, I need to avoid the torch-bearer patrols and acquire the key to unlock the rectory where the fanatics are holding the captured priests. The key may be in their commander's possession.
I need to seek out these buried Dwarven mechanisms and destroy the Dwarven Centurion, Nyzchaleft.
I disrupted the Dwarven mechanisms and defeated the construct known as Nyzchaleft. Now I should talk to Birkhu the Bold about my reward.
Apparently, a Khajiit named Birkhu the Bold knows a great deal about these Dwarven machines. Perhaps I should speak with him before I leave.
I must rescue the prisoners and kill the Riekr leader, King-Chief Edu.
Arzorag identified Sonolia Muspidius as a contact. Perhaps I should speak with her before I leave.
I rescued the prisoners and killed King-Chief Edu. I should return to <<1>> and inform her of my success.
High Priestess Solgra suspects Chief Bazrag is behind the attack on the temple. I need to get the news to the forge-mother as soon as possible.
I should go to the King's Cornerclub in Orsinium and report to King Kurog, as requested.
With the <<z:1>> in hand, <<2>> and I should return to Shatul.
I should go to the throne room and speak with King Kurog.
The duel is over. If I wish to become chief of Shatul, I need to kill the victor in the Bloody Knoll.
I've had it up to here with Narsis Dren. It will serve him right if I trap him in a sarcophagus.
I tricked Narsis Dren into a sarcophagus. Now I should close the lid.

I was drawn into another memory of past events, during the fall of Old Orsinium. I walk in the boots of <<1>>, a Knight of the Dragon. Her commander, <<2>>, vowed to honor the dead. I should find a way to awaken from this memory.
<<1>> asked me to bring the <<z:2>> to <<3>>.
While Eveli escorts Chief Bazrag to meet with High Priestess Solgra, I need to find Ulsha outside of Fharun Stronghold. Maybe she can give me proof that Bazrag wasn't involved in the temple attack.
I should talk to <<1>> and find out what's going on here.
I need to search the council chamber and see if I can discover the nature of the Vosh Rakh's plan for disrupting the king's moot.

I need to find a way to get inside the Greedy Gut inn so that I can check on Chief Bazrag and Eveli. I could follow the soldier to the ramparts near the stables, or I could steal a key from the soldier on duty near the King's Cornerclub.
Owayine said that soldiers took Eveli and Chief Bazrag on the king's orders. I should go talk to King Kurog at the keep and find out where they are holding my friends.
Chief Bazrag wants me to go warn King Kurog and try to convince him to postpone the moot while Eveli goes to protect High Priestess Solgra. I should head to the keep and talk to the king.
<<1>> would not listen to reason. Despite the lack of evidence, she is convinced <<2>> is to blame for <<3>>'s death. I should speak with her and see what she intends.
Chief Bazrag arrived at the temple. He wants to speak to me before we go after Kurog.
We need to find a way inside the Fortress.

I received an invitation to Orsinium and have been instructed to visit the Wrothgar ambassador in the city of Daggerfall, Davon's Watch, or Vulkhel Guard. I should speak to the ambassador when I'm ready to go.
I placed my delivery of crafted goods into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest and take my reward.

<<1>> revealed our target is the <<2>>, a treasure held in the frigid <<3>>. When I'm ready, we should take the boat at the docks in Windhelm.

I should search the warehouse office for <<1>>.
I need to steal <<1>> from the office.

Now that we're inside, <<1>>'s warehouse, I should speak with <<2>> about how best to proceed.
<<1>> came to Abah's Landing to find her father. She believes information of his whereabouts is in the manor of <<2>>, a wealthy citizen of Abah's Landing. I should meet <<1>> outside Sulima Mansion.

<<1>> and I should search Sulima Mansion for clues regarding the whereabouts of <<1>>'s father.

The Daedric treasures I'm looking for should be in secure chests within this hideout.
I turned over the goods to Fa'ren-dar. He'll be waiting with my share at <<Ac:1>>.
I have the Daedric treasures! I just need to get them to <<1>> before he meets the buyers.
<<1>> believes her father buried treasure somewhere outside of Abah's Landing. We should search for it.

I received a mysterious letter and an invitation to visit the lighthouse south of Anvil. I should go and find out if this has anything to do with the Dark Brotherhood.
There's someone waiting for me inside the Anvil Lighthouse. I should talk to him.
I should talk to Speaker Terenus and find out more about why I was invited to come here.
To get close to the Imperial noble, I need to find a way to get inside his estate. It's located northwest of Anvil, along the Gold Road.
Quintus Jarol has just finished a meeting with the Provincial Governor of Anvil and the Count of Kvatch. Now that the meeting has broken up, I should finish my mission and kill the noble.
Quintus Jarol is dead. Now I need to find a way out of his estate.
I wonder if the Speaker would be willing to give me any advice if I tried asking.

The Speaker granted my request for advice and told me of an alternate route beneath the walls of the estate. Apparently a tunnel runs from a small hostel called the Withered Rose right to Jarol Estate.

Crafty Lerisa wants me to spread the word of Boethiah in front of initiates of the Society of the Dragon. She thinks if I spout enough heresy, I'll get arrested and show her sister just how bad this Akatosh cult really is.
I guess my efforts have been successful. An officer from the Order of the Hour has come to scold me for blasphemy. I suppose I should talk to her.

I got the attention of an officer of the Order of the Hour, just like Crafty Lerisa wanted. I suppose I need to go along with this nonsense and report to the Chamber of Penance so I can meet the Grand Chanter and reveal his treachery to Josseline.
I arrived in Grand Chanter Surus's private chamber. I need to see what the Grand Chanter decides to do to determine if this Society of the Dragon is as bad as Crafty Lerisa claims.

Josseline and I got to see just how bloodthirsty the Grand Chanter actually is. But before I could deal with him, Crafty Lerisa revealed herself and spirited us out of the chamber. I should talk to her.
Crafty Lerisa suspects that her sister Josseline fled to one of the old Akatosh shrines along Varen's Wall. We decided to split up and search for her among the shrines.
I encountered Lieutenant Mervial while searching for Josseline. This is my chance to deal with her for good.
I found Josseline at one of the old Akatosh shrines. Now I need  to convince her to wait until Crafty Lerisa arrives.
Josseline and Crafty Lerisa have a lot to talk about. I should ask Crafty Lerisa if she needs anything else from me before I leave them to it.
I turned over the goods to Fa'ren-dar. He'll be waiting with my share at <<Ac:1>>.
I should meet <<1>> near the Velmont Mansion in Abah's Landing to find out more about this delicate situation.
Captain Jimila advised me to find Dock Master Qamar's lackeys dicing on Anvil's docks and get them to tell me the location of his hidden stash.
I convinced a Red Sails pirate to reveal the location of Dock Master Qamar's stash. Now I need to retrieve it from its hiding spot.
I found Dock Master Qamar's hidden stash, but I need to pick the lock to access the contents.
I retrieved Dock Master Qamar's private stash. Now I should get the gold back to Captain Jimila.
I slipped Captain Jimila the Dock Master's stolen gold. Now to see how she deals with Qamar.
Captain Jimila's plan to pay Qamar with his own gold worked. I should confer with her now that he's gone.

I secured jobs for Kireth and Raynor. They'll be able to earn gold to pay for their passage to Sentinel now. I should find them and deliver the good news.
I told Raynor about the job I secured for him. Now I should tell Kireth about her new job.

We have arrived outside the Temple of Seven Riddles. I should track down Bakhum to see if he found his lost family-member.
Rohefa suggested I could make some easy gold if I talk to her boss, Shalug, at Shark's Teeth Grotto.
I should head to <<Ac:1>> and speak with <<2>> about her plan.
<<1>> plans to return to the al-Danobia family tomb where <<2>> and the rest of the guild perished. She believes <<3>> can help, and asked <<4>> and I to meet him at his shop in Abah's Landing.
<<1>> isn't here, and his shop is in shambles! I should speak with his clerk, <<2>> of his whereabouts.
The Iron Wheel is after <<1>>! In his rush to escape from his shop, he stumbled through a vat of bright green dye. I should find where his trail begins!
There's very little time to find <<1>> before the Iron Wheel catches him. I should follow his trail of bright green footprints as fast as I can!
I found <<1>> before the Iron Wheel did. I should speak with him, quickly.

There's no sign of <<1>>. I can only assume the worst. If I can track him down, perhaps I can free him from the Iron Wheel. Alternatively, I could leave him to his fate. If that's the case, I can tell <<2>> we should leave without him.
Perhaps someone can point me in the direction of <<1>>. I should ask any possible witnesses of his capture.

After exploring further into <<c:1>>, we reached an impassable chasm known as Shinji's Truth. I should see what <<2>> has to say and follow her lead.
<<1>> needs me to watch her back as we walk Malooc's Path. I should stay close to <<1>> until we make it through.
<<1>> and I made it through Malooc's Path. We should recover <<2>>, which will reveal Shinji's Truth.
I should return to Shinji's Truth with <<1>>.
Shinji's Truth is an invisible path that can only be revealed by spreading <<1>> upon it. I should do so and cross.
Now that I've crossed Shinji's Truth, I should enter the al-Danobia treasure vaults.
We awoke an ancient tomb guardian! We must defeat it!
We should search the al-Danobia treasure vaults for <<1>>'s dowry, or clues to its absence.

<<1>>'s dowry is gone, and <<2>>â€”the former guildmasterâ€”may have had something to do with it. I should return to Hew's Bane as soon as I can. From there, I will meet <<3>> at <<2>>'s desert retreat.
<<1>> asked me to meet her at <<2>>'s desert retreat, in the badlands of Hew's Bane.
<<1>> and I should search <<2>>'s desert retreat for any signs of him or <<3>>'s dowry.
<<1>> betrayed the Thieves Guild! <<2>> plans to inform them of his secret deal with the merchant lord, <<3>>. I should meet her at <<Ac:4>>.

Razum-dar and I need to find and kill Captain Jena Apinia to make her pay for her war crimes. She's somewhere in the Ayleid ruins known as Garlas Agea. He also wants us to recover the items she stole from the city of Bravil before she fled.

I should talk to <<1>> in <<Ac:2>>.
I should meet <<1>> at her rooftop retreat.
I should speak with <<1>> in the <<2>>.

I need to use this <<1>> to absorb the energy of the spirits released by the necromancers in <<2>>.
<<1>> has absorbed a fair amount of energy. I can use it now to recharge the seal protecting <<2>>.
I restored the seal protecting <<1>> with the energy from <<2>>. I should return the amulet to the priest and let her know what happened.

<<1>> learned <<2>> was spotted in town. He suspects a local named Bellulor may know more, but has been unable to track him down. I should search for Bellulor in the Shornhelm Outlaws Refuge, in Rivenspire.

<<1>> learned <<2>> was spotted in town. He suspects a local named Bellulor may know more, but has been unable to track him down. I should search for Bellulor in the Stormhold Outlaws Refuge, in Shadowfen.
I should speak with Velsa in her garden.
Someone in the market slipped a folded letter into Velsa's things. She thinks it may be related to her family or that it could be a trap. I should read the letter before I investigate further.

Velsa doesn't remember anything suspicious except for the half-naked Nord who bumped into her. She thinks I can find him in the merchant camp outside the city. I should ask him if he knows anything about the letter.
The half-naked Nord said that he met the Khajiit woman who paid him to deliver the letter to Velsa in Riften. I should travel to the Rift and see if I can find this mysterious Khajiit.
I should ask at the inn and see if anyone knows anything about this mysterious Khajiit.
I entered the servants' quarters. Now I should talk to Narahni and ask her if she sent the letter to Velsa.
Narahni did send the letter to Velsa. I convinced her to come to Abah's Landing to see Velsa in person. I should meet her there.
Now that Narahni is ready, I should lead her through the warehouse and secret passage to Velsa's secluded garden so the old friends can be reunited.
Velsa and Narahni seem to have worked out their past differences. I should speak to Velsa and see if she needs anything else from me.
Velsa and Narahni have found each other again, and in spite of the years they lost, they both appear to be happy. I should talk to Velsa and see if she needs anything else from me.
Apparently, a group of Red Sails pirates is about to be initiated into the Order of the Hour. If I can stop the initiation, I can keep the Order from growing and gaining more recruits.
I should tell Astara what transpired at the Enclave of the Hourglass.
I disrupted the initiation. Now I should look around and try to find the Black Dragon or any information that will give the Brotherhood an advantage against the Order's First Sword.
I entered the Enclave of the Hourglass and walked in on a meeting between one of the Red Sails captains and an officer of the Order of the Hour. I should put an end to their negotiations.
<<1>> went to <<2>>'s shop. I should speak with her there.
The Warden's Office in No Shira Prison has <<1>>'s transfer orders which should reveal her location.
<<1>> is the new chief of Shatul. I should inform <<2>>.
I need to meet Count Carolus south of Kvatch, in the ruins of Dasek Moor so that he can fulfill his obligation and tell us about the Black Dragon.
I agreed to help Naryu complete her contract and then take credit for the crime. I should ask her to tell me more about her target and find out if she has a plan for sneaking into Castle Kvatch.
I need to reach the room where Dathus Ildrim is hiding and open a secret passage. This will allow Naryu to covertly enter the castle, dispatch her target, and leave without being spotted.
Dathus is fast asleep. I need to open the secret passage so Naryu can enter his room and dispatch him.
Naryu has arrived to dispatch Dathus Ildrim. I should stand back and let her complete her contract without interference.

Naryu allowed Dathus to call for the Castle Kvatch sentinels before she killed him. To fulfill my part of the bargain, I need to leave by the main entrance and make sure someone spots me so I can take credit for assassinating Dathus.
I made sure I was seen leaving Castle Kvatch so that I'm sure to be blamed for the assassination of the Dark Elf noble. I should meet Naryu at the inn and wrap up our business arrangement.
Naryu confirmed that no one spotted her leaving the castle. Her secret is safe, thanks to my help. I should find out what she plans to do next.

I convinced Walks-Softly to leave Anais with the pirates to teach her a lesson. I should go back to the Thieves Den and meet up with Walks-Softly so that we can put this despicable business behind us.

I need to meet Walks-Softly in a warehouse near the docks to find out about the solution he's come up with for dealing with his old friend, Anais Velmont.
I should watch Walks-Softly as he interacts with Anais Velmont so I can see what he's planning to do.

It appears that Walks-Softly has kidnapped Anais and asked for a ransom to be paid. I'm not sure how this teaches her the lesson that Walks-Softly keeps talking about. I should speak to him and find out what he's actually thinking.
Walks-Softly wants to keep Anais's family from looking for her while he teaches her a lesson. He asked me to plant these letters he forged in the Velmont Mansion to explain her absence.
Walks-Softly requested that I meet him back in the Thieves Den after I delivered the forged letters to the Velmont Mansion.

Walks-Softly left me another message. This one indicates that pirates have taken Anais Velmont captive and spirited her to Shark's Teeth Grotto. I should head to the grotto and help Walks-Softly rescue his old friend.
I acquired the gems without disturbing the traps strewn about the hideout. <<1>> is waiting to lead me back to <<Ac:2>> from here.
I secured the gems, but left traces of my activity along the way. <<1>> is waiting to lead me back to <<Ac:2>> from here. We should get going while the going is still good.
I arrived to find Walks-Softly talking with Anais Velmont. I should listen to their exchange.
Walks-Softly located Anais in the pirate hide-out in Shark's Teeth Grotto. I should find out how he wants to proceed.

I convinced Walks-Softly to rescue Anais from the pirates and escort her safely back to her estate. I should go back to the Thieves Den and meet up with Walks-Softly so that we can put this despicable business behind us.
I should go and talk to Narahni and see what she needs.
I should examine the letter Narahni received from Faradan. It might shed more light on her son Tashmin's predicament.
Faradan's letter mentioned that a young Breton woman was seen with Tashmin just before he was captured. I should try to find her.

According to Tashmin's friend, the two Dark Elves that captured him have tied him up and left him near the docks while they search for other unfortunates they can turn into slaves. I should search near the docks and see if I can find Tash.
I need to get the arrest writ with Tashmin's name on it from the Dark Elf bounty hunter. I'll need to sneak up on him and pick his pocket before his partner returns.
I recovered the arrest writ from the bounty hunter. Now I should untie Tashmin and set him free.
Tashmin ran off. I should meet him at the location he mentioned before he left me at the docks.
Now that Tashmin is free, I should return to the Thieves Den in Abah's Landing and let Narahni know that he's all right.
Tashmin is ready to be reunited with his mother. I should take him to see her now.

Faradan's letter says that bounty hunters in Skywatch captured Narahni's son, Tashmin. A young Breton woman was seen with Tashmin just before he was captured. I should travel to Auridon and see if I can pick up their trail.
