I need to create the item specified by my contract.
I've finished the task, and now just need to hand it off to receive my pay.
I need to create the item specified by my contract.
I've finished the task, and now just need to hand it off to receive my pay.
I visited all the locations Gilan marked on my map and stored his memories in the memory stone. I should return it to Gilan.
Gilan seems drained by the experience of reliving his past. He asked me to invite his children, Neria and Mils, to speak with him about the memory stone and their mother.
I managed to convince the guard to let me into Tel Aruhn. I should make my way to Magister Gothren's chambers.
I witnessed an argument between Gilan and his son, Mils. If I speak to Mils, perhaps he can shed some light on what he and his father were arguing about.

Mils seems to resent his father and has no interest in sharing the details of their relationship. However, he directed me to his sister, Neria, who works at the Balmora stables. She may be more willing to speak to me about Gilan.

Councilor Eris asked me to investigate the disappearance of his daughter, Veya. He suggested I start by talking to Captain Brivan before I try to track down some of her friends around the town of Balmora.
I've finished the task, and now just need to hand it off to receive my pay.
I need to create the item specified by my contract.
I need to create the item specified by my contract.
I've finished the task, and now just need to hand it off to receive my pay.
I need to create the item specified by my contract.
I've finished the task, and now just need to hand it off to receive my pay.
Mils refuses to speak to his father. Perhaps Neria can convince him otherwise.
I need to create the items specified by my contract.
I've finished the task, and now just need to hand it off to receive my pay.

I've finished the task, and now just need to hand it off to receive my pay.
Now that Chodala has been defeated, I should gather up the staff called Sunna'rah.
***Seryn and I need to trigger the Tonal Inverter to stop Sunna'rah from draining Vivec!
I collected the Blessing Stone. Now I need to return to Canon Llevule and Lord Vivec.
I need to travel to the road outside Seyda Neen and locate Canon Valasa and the wounded Buoyant Armiger.
I should travel to Vvardenfell, in Morrowind, and locate Canon Llevule of the Tribunal outside the town of Seyda Neen.
An Argonian named Gray-Skies encouraged me to talk to Savarak myself. I'll pay this new magistrate a visit.

I found an assortment of documents in Savarak's manse: a letter to Savarak from House Hlaalu, a shipping notice directing Black Snails to Selvil Island, and a note pertaining to a secret meeting. I should share my discoveries with Llayne.

Llayne and I hatched a plan to squeeze information out of one of Savarak's coconspirators, Nerandas. I must travel to the wharf outside Vos and impersonate one of Savarak's henchmen. Nerandas might just share some important information with me.
Gray-Skies told me that the Black Snails took Mendwendel to a hideout south of Tel Mora. Hopefully Mendwendel left some kind of trail I can follow.
Elfbetta asked me to enter the Dreloth Ancestral Tomb and check on Narsis Dren. He's been gone for a long time and she's starting to get worried.

Narsis has been observing a creature in the next chamber, watching its shadow and waiting for it to make its move. He wants me to slip into the chamber and see what the creature's true intentions are before we explore the rest of the tomb.
Narsis wants me to help him explore the Dreloth Ancestral Tomb.
Narsis seems disappointed that we didn't find anything significant down here. I should talk to him.
Elfbetta said that Narsis went to the Veloth Ancestral Tomb, clear across Vvardenfell. It's on the western coast, just south of Gnisis. I should head there and see if Narsis needs any more help.

Narsis made a significant discovery and ran off, telling me to talk to his assistant back outside the Dreloth tomb. Unfortunately, he also accidentally called forth a monster and left me to deal with it. Thanks, Narsis!
I should follow Narsis Dren and listen to what he has to say.

Cherishes-Water refuses to tell me what she knows unless I bring her Findun's Special Blend for her pond. I can gather some where the sea tide meets the swamp water, or I can buy it from Findun's Goods in Seyda Neen.
I obtained some of Findun's Special Blend.  I should pour it into Cherishes-Water's pond so she'll tell me what she saw the night of the shipwreck.
Daynillo Rethul said I should speak to her twin at Tel Fyr if I'm interested in joining her master's expedition into the rift.
There is a boat on the Vivec City docks that can take me to Tel Fyr.
I have the essence of a powerful spirit. Now I need to get it back to Theyo and the ward.
The spirit dissipated, along with the ward,  but it also told us where Galgalah is holding Farwen. I should speak to Theyo about what we learned.
I defeated Galgalah, but his spirit fled into Farwen's body. She fled in a delirious panic. I need to catch her.

Galgalah inhabits Farwen's body, but I refused to sacrifice her to destroy him. I have to hope she can resist his control. Her companions are glad to see her alive in any case. I should speak to Theyo.
Galgalah inhabits Farwen's body, but I refused to sacrifice her to destroy him. I have to hope she can resist his control. The other ghost hunters will be glad to see her regardless.

My contact can be found in the city of Wayrest.

My contact can be found in the city of Mournhold.
Marshal Hlaren and her confederates have gathered in the Inanius Egg Mine for a secret meeting. I must infiltrate the mine, find the confiscated evidence, and track down the corrupt marshal.
The Scarlet Judge fears that Marshal Hlaren's Iron Hounds will wreak havoc on Suran if we move too quickly. I must raid the mercenaries' camp to sow discord and confusion in the ranks.
Gilan seems drained by the experience of reliving his past. He asked me to invite his children, Neria and Mils, to speak with him about the memory stone and their mother.
I finished dealing with Ferhara and her Warclaws just as Captain Brivan walked in. I need to tell him what's going on before Veya arrives.
The portal didn't return me to Vivec City. Instead, I appear to be inside some sort of Daedric shrine. And Clavicus Vile just addressed me. I guess I should talk to him.
Barilzar suggests that I use a small portion of Vivec's energy to distract Clavicus Vile so that he can pull me out of this place. I should use Sunna'rah on Vile's statue.
Kizmar distracted the guards long enough for me to enter Tel Aruhn. I should make my way to Magister Gothren's chambers.
Lord Vivec has called me forth. I should present myself and talk to him.
Vivec asked me to retrieve the Archcanon's Signet from Tarvus's office in the Hall of Wisdom.
Vivec told me to meet him at the city's central canton, near the statue erected in his honor, after I retrieved the Archcanon's Signet.
I should talk to Vivec and let him know I found the signet so that he can continue his ceremony with the assembled crowd.
Overseer Shiralas gave me the Blessing Stones Vivec needed and helped protect the cantons during the disaster. I should reach into the sack and give her her reward.
Barilzar taught me about the transfer of divine energy and helped me get into the Clockwork City. I should reach into the sack and find his reward.
Without Canon Llevule, I never would have come to Vivec's aid. I should reach into the sack and see what reward Vivec has decided to bestow upon him.
Gothren's new Mouth, Arith Sendrul, arrived shortly after I did. I should talk to him. He might have more information on Sun-in-Shadow's whereabouts.
Someone ransacked Sun-in-Shadow's home. I should investigate.
Someone ransacked Sun-in-Shadow's home. I should investigate.
Theyo instructed me to meet his team at an Ashlander camp in the northern reaches of Vvardenfell. We'll gather supplies and information there before heading to the site of the haunting.
The ghost hunters are no where to be found, but Lord Thanlen, the one who hired them, is here. I should speak to him and find out what's going on.
I witnessed the Ashlanders confronting Lord Thanlen about Valenvaryon. I may want to speak to them myself before I carry on.
Lothnarth gave me a key to the Dwarven ruin, Mzanchend. I must search the ruins to find a few Dwarven parts to help me unlock Otheri's Dwarven Prism and technical documents for my Nord companion.
I entered Mzanchend. Now I just need to find the parts to unlock Otheri's Dwarven Prism and some technical documents for Lothnarth.
I collected the Dwarven parts and technical documents my Nord companion requested. I should return to Lothnarth and deliver the logbook I found.
Barilzar has projected an image of himself into this strange place. I should talk to him.
The hooded figure said an unnamed benefactor needed to speak to me about a matter concerning the fate of the world. I can find the benefactor in Vulkhel Guard.
I discovered ample evidence of Marshal Hlaren's corruption. I should take my findings to the Scarlet Judge at Ules Manor.
A hooded figure wishes to speak to me. I should see what the hooded figure wants.
I have been approached by a hooded figure who wished to speak to me, but I had other things to attend to. I should find them and see what they wanted from me.
A woman named Lyris broke open my cell for me to escape. If I'm to survive I better arm myself.
Edryno asked me to deliver the mushrooms to Divayth Fyr's Mouth, <<1>>, on her behalf. I'll find him in Sadrith Mora.
I've delivered the mushrooms to <<1>>. I must speak to him to collect my payment.
I was ambushed by the mercenary I met in the Sadrith Mora Inn. She gave me the wrong location for the camp. I should look around see if there's anything that will help me locate Bothumel.
Vivec City's navigator can give me a ride to Sadrith Mora.
The hooded figure said an unnamed benefactor needed to speak to me about a matter concerning the fate of the world. I can find the benefactor in Davon's Watch.
The hooded figure said an unnamed benefactor needed to speak to me about a matter concerning the fate of the world. I can find the benefactor in Daggerfall.
I reached Ald'ruhn and located Seryn. It looks like she was expecting me. I should talk to her.
Stibbons must have dropped items as he fled. If I follow the trail of items, I should find Stibbons.
Stibbons must have dropped items as he fled. If I follow the trail of items, I should find Stibbons.
Another of the mages hired by Lady Laurent is with Stibbons. I should talk to this mage and try to learn more about what's happening at these ruins.
The mage ranted about spiders and ran off. I should follow her and see where she's going.
The mage entered the ruins, but there appears to be a magical barrier that I can't pass through. I should return to Stibbons and use the signal wand to summon Lady Laurent.
Now that I have the tonal inverter, I should ask Barilzar how it works.
I should find Unel Darano and speak to him for more information.
I should find Unel Darano and speak to him for more information.
I should speak to Zanammu in Ald'ruhn to learn how to best build a relationship with the Ashlanders.
Lady Laurent appears to have found something. I should talk to her to learn more.
Captain Naros has accepted that the monster in the mine was the culprit, exonerating the Ashlanders. I should let Ibaal know that our plan worked.
I should travel to <<1>> in Vivec City to tell her of Dubdil Alar's death. She'll also have my reward.
I have slain 20 enemy Wardens. I should return to the Bounty board at the Eastern Elsweyr gate to claim my reward.
I should seek out and kill enemy Wardens.
I should seek out and kill enemy Wardens.
I have slain 20 enemy Wardens. I should return to the bounty board at the Northern Morrowind gate to claim my reward.
I should seek out and kill enemy Wardens.
I have slain 20 enemy Wardens. I should return to the Bounty board at the Southern High Rock gate to claim my reward.
I worked out a deal with Brelan, and having held up my end, he has obligingly unlocked the correspondence box and is turning a blind eye to my taking the needed information.
I acquired some gear from the slavers. I should equip the hear in case I run into any trouble.
I participated in the ritual part of the holiday. Now I should speak to <<1>> and see what's next.
I met <<1>>, a priest of Saint Alessia from the Imperial City. She wants to tell me about what they are celebrating and why. I should speak to her.

<<1>> told me a bit about the holiday celebrating a pivotal battle of Pelinal Whitestrake against the Ayleids. She said the next step would be to symbolically follow his footsteps by coating my head with blood.
I should look for priests somewhere in the gate garrison of my alliance or any battleground camp and ask what this holiday is about.
I arrived in Nchuleftingth. Now I should seek out Neramo's bodyguard and assistant, Vimy Lacroix.
I rescued Seythen Rendo from a roost of troublesome winged twilights. He ran on ahead, toward Vos. I should catch up to him and make sure he makes it home.
I defeated Wakener Maras, but had to kill Nevena after she attacked me alongside him. I can see a diary nearby that they were attempting to burn. I should collect it for Tythis.
It might be worth talking to Ralasa to learn more about her motivations for obstructing Sun-and-Shadow's promotion.
I found the "stolen goods." Most of it was escaping Khajiit slaves who had paid the bandits to help them get away from Telvanni lands.
Someone ransacked Sun-in-Shadow's home. I should investigate.
I need to create the item specified by my contract.
I've finished the task, and now just need to hand it off to receive my pay.
I need to create the item specified by my contract.

My contact can be found in the city of Mournhold.
I've escaped from the collapsing mine with the unique dwarven prism that Magister Gothren wanted. I should bring it to Tel Aruhn.
I returned safely to Tel Mora. I should talk to Mistress Dratha.
Veya's mentor is somewhere inside the Ashurnibibi Ruins. I need to track her down and find her.
I should enter the Hall of Wisdom and go to Archcanon Tarvus's office. Then I can learn more about what the Archcanon has planned.
If I'd like to know more about the great Dunmer houses, their tomes of history may offer clues.
Magister Therana has agreed to provide a Writ of Sponsorship for Sun-in-Shadow.
Eoki might know more about which farmers are willing to sell. I could also make inquiries on my own.
Theyo has asked that I seek out Farwen, the magic user of the group. She's looking to set up wards of protection around them in the area, and may need my help finishing her task.
I should travel to the Mages Guild hall in Mournhold. Perhaps I can learn more from Skaldir himself.
As soon as I arrived in the Mournhold guild hall, Skaldir's shadow came to life and stabbed him to death. A Nord woman arrived shortly thereafter, demanding answers. I should talk to her.

Three of Skaldir's associates are in danger. According to Bonafryd, Adeber is studying in Shornhelm, Rivenspire. Wenridil can be found in the city of Marbruk, Greenshade. And Neelo resides in Stormhold, Shadowfen. I must warn these mages.
A projection of a High Elf woman has appeared. I should speak to her.

Lilatha, a Psijic mage, believes she can discover the location of the Daedric artifact, but she needs two powerful objects to do so. I can find the Anuic Lantern in Khenarthi's Roost, and the Liminal Lens in Craglorn's Howling Sepulchers.
Bonafryd admitted that she's been following me. Now she wants to accompany me in Lilatha's boat. I must decide whether or not to bring her along.
I've found Lilatha's enchanted boat. Hopefully it will take me to her current location.
I must find Skaldir's associate, Adeber.
According to one of the mages in the Shornhelm guild hall, Adeber just leftâ€”seeking some peace and quiet in a courtyard behind the building. I should go to warn him.
I arrived too late. Adeber is dead. His notebook, however, remains intact. I should see what he knows about the Daedric artifact.
I must find Skaldir's associate, Wenridil.
Wenridil's shadow attacked, but failed to land a killing blow. I must defeat this monstrosity before it completes its mission.
I defeated Wenridil's shadowâ€”now I must find its owner. She's probably hiding out in the nearby Mages Guild hall.
I must find Skaldir's associate, Neelo.
Neelo, fearing for his life, has barricaded himself behind a series of magical wards. I must convince him to lower them so we can talk about what he should do next.
Neelo finally lowered his wards. I should ask him what he knows about the Daedric artifact.
Neelo is too scared to lower his wards, but did mention a sister, Xarei. Perhaps if I find Xarei and convince her I'm a friend, she can convince Neelo.
Neelo is too scared to lower his wards, but did mention a sister, Xarei. Perhaps if I find Xarei and convince her I'm a friend, she can convince Neelo.
Xarei agreed to talk to Neelo for me. I must take her to his hiding place.
I arrived on a gloomy island off the coast of Auridon. I should search for Lilatha.
Lilatha's shadow came to life. It no doubt seeks to kill her. I must defeat this creature to defend Lilatha and the Obscuros.
It appears that my former ally, Bonafryd, is responsible for the shadow murders. I must defeat her and the shadow if Lilatha and I plan to make it out of this ruin alive.
Lilatha and I managed to defeat Bonafryd and her shadowy minion. Now that Lilatha is safe, I should reassemble the Obscuros device.
I reassembled the Obscuros. Now we can activate it and see if it shows us the location of the Daedric artifact.
The Obscuros showed us several images of the Clockwork City. I should talk to Lilatha to see if she can elaborate on what we've witnessed.
Lilatha believes that the mysterious Daedric artifact we've been seeking is somewhere inside the Clockwork City. We should discuss our next move.
I told Lilatha about my adventures in the Clockwork City, and the Daedric plot brewing there. We should discuss our next move.
I told Lilatha that I thwarted Nocturnal's plot in the Clockwork City, but she seems convinced that there are more Daedric horrors yet to come. I should talk to her about what comes next.
I gave Librarian Bradyn the rubbing. Now I should talk to him and ask what happens next.
Narsis seems disappointed that we didn't find anything significant down here. I should talk to him.
The Bursar of Tributes requested I acquire pieces of ornate armor from Clockwork City and beyond to add to the Blackfeather Court's collection of glittering and gleaming objects.
I collected ornate pieces of armor for the Blackfeather Court. I should bring them to the Bursar of Tributes and claim my reward.
Provost Varuni asked me to find Chancellor Gascone. She seems confident that I'll find him in his rectory in the west wing of the Clockwork Basilica.
I told Varuni about Gascone's death. I should speak to her to gain my reward.
I discovered a Nocturnal Shrike in Chancellor Gascone's office. She seemed to be looking for something. I also found a farewell memorandum penned by Gascone. I should tell Varuni about all I've seen.
Varuni urged me to find Proctor Luciana. The battlemage might be able to help me find Gascone. She should be just outside the Clockwork Basilica.
Artificer Dalomar lent me his prized tracker, a nix-hound fabricant called Snuffler. I should let Snuffler smell Gascone's note to help it pick up the scent.
The nix-hound fabricant, Snuffler, picked up Gascone's scent. I should follow it.
Vimy asked me to look for her compatriots, who are scattered through the ruins. I should start by finding <<1>>.
I rescued <<1>>. I should keep looking for additional survivors.
I rescued <<1>>. I should keep looking for additional survivors.
I found Lilatha outside an ancient ruin on Dranil Kir. I should follow her inside.
Snuffler picked up Gascone's scent once again. I should follow it.
I must find the Anuic Lantern.
It looks like someone took the Anuic Lantern before I arrived. I should look for any clues that might lead me to the item.
It appears that bandits raided the shipwreck ahead of me, then turned on each other. I found a note on a dead bandit pointing to Hazak's Hollow. Hopefully the Anuic Lantern is still there.
I collected the items Lilatha requested, now I must find the boat she promised. It should be moored somewhere just outside Vulkhel Guard.
A Dragon Priest in the Howling Sepulchers probably guards the Liminal Lens. I must defeat this undead abomination and take the lens for Lilatha.
Bonafryd appeared as soon as I arrived at Lilatha's boat. I should talk to her to figure out what this is about.
The Obscuros is working! The device appears to be showing us the location of the Daedric artifact.
Wenridil confessed that the loss of her shadow has weakened her in some way. Nonetheless, she offered me her notes as a token of appreciation. I should go collect them from the planter nearby.
Neelo offered me his notes on the Daedric artifact. I should collect them before I leave Stormhold.
I should speak to the Mages Guild adept who directed me to Adeber's corpse. He'll no doubt want to arrange a proper burial.
I found the bandit's hideout in Hazak's Hollow. Now I must find the stolen Anuic Lantern.
Terari and I performed the experiment to transfer Sovor's soul into the factotum and free Bolin's spirit. It appears that the procedure was a success. I should speak to Terari about the results.
I found signs that Terari and her failed experiment are in the area. I should concentrate my efforts on a more thorough search of the area.
I have located <<1>> in a derelict laboratory. I should speak to her about Sovor's request.

Sovor told me that searching for Terari's failed experiment may be the best means of finding her. He's provided me with the Apostle's best guess as to where it might be. I should search the area for signs of the experiment and Terari.

Terari revealed that her experiment was an attempt to save her lover's life by installing his soul in a factotum. She was successful, but the process drove him mad. I agreed to destroy it and retrieve the black soul gem holding Bolin's soul.
I destroyed the factotum housing the black soul gem containing Bolin's soul. I should extract it from the wreckage and return to Terari.
I retrieved the black soul gem containing Bolin's soul from the wreckage of his machine body. I should bring it to Terari as soon as possible.
It appears Sovor has convinced Terari to perform her experiment once again and she's preparing another factotum for his procedure. She'll want to know that I have Bolin's black soul gem.

Terari is going to attempt to transfer Sovor's soul into a factotum and release Bolin from the black soul gem. I have agreed to assist in case things spin out of control again. I should initiate the procedure once I'm prepared.
I have all the resources. I should deliver them to <<1>>.
I should harvest sources of water and see if I can find <<z:1>>. I also need to collect <<z:2>> in the Halls of Regulation.
Talk to <<1>> for more information
I have all the resources. I should deliver them to <<1>>.
I should harvest sources of ore within Clockwork City and see if I can find <<z:1>>. I also need to collect <<z:2>> in the Mechanical Fundament.
I have all the resources. I should deliver them to <<1>>.
I should harvest sources of cloth within Clockwork City and see if I can find <<z:1>>. I also need to collect lodestone parts in the Mnemonic Planisphere.
I have all the resources. I should deliver them to <<1>>.
I should harvest sources of wood within Clockwork City and see if I can find <<z:1>>. I also need to collect <<z:2>> in the Reactor District.
I have all the resources. I should deliver them to <<1>>.
I should harvest runestones in Clockwork City to see if I can find <<z:1>>. I'll also need to collect runelights in a mysterious realm.
I have all the resources. I should deliver them to <<1>>.
I should harvest sources of  alchemy plants in Clockwork City and see if I can find herbalist's satchels. I'll also need to collect <<z:1>> in the Everwound Wellspring.
I destroyed the shadow array and freed the trapped souls. Now I should find Adjunct Daro, return the perception tabulator, and tell him what happened to Acolyte Variah.
I came across some unusual scarecrows while searching the Shadow Cleft. I should use the perception tabulator on them and see what happens.
We successfully navigated the Evergloam and found our route to the Cogitum Centralis. I should talk to Luciana about our next move.
I should talk to Sotha Sil to claim my reward.
I should search Gascone's office for clues. He might have left something behind that explains where he went.
I need to talk to former Chancellor Gascone to see if he knows how the Whispering Shadows cultists are moving through the city. We may be able to use their own methods against them.

I learned that Whispering Shadows cultists use portals called Gloaming Gates to navigate the city in secret. Luciana and I could use these gates to reach the Cogitum Centralisâ€”and Sotha Sil. I should inform Luciana.
Luciana and I decided to split up and explore separate Gloaming Gates. I must travel to the eastern reaches of the Radius to find one of these gates.
I must seek out the legendary Dark Elf mage, Divayth Fyr, in the Mournhold Tribunal Temple.
Divayth told me that the entrance to Clockwork City waits just ahead. I should delve deeper into the cavern.
I discovered an ornate clockwork globe, housing a miniature Clockwork City. I should use the device to enter Sotha Sil's realm.
Divayth Fyr and I arrived in a remote, underground section of the Clockwork City. Divayth Fyr seems concerned. I should stand ready to defend against any attack.

Divayth Fyr's shadow suddenly came to life and attacked its owner. It did not strike a mortal blow, but Divayth is clearly weakened. I must pursue this shadowy attacker deeper into the clockwork underground.
Divayth's treacherous shadow led us into a room guarded by clockwork factotums. I must defeat them to clear the way forward.
Defeating the factotums appears to have opened a door to the next section of the clockwork underground. I must continue my search for Divayth's shadow.
In his weakened state, Divayth Fyr cannot safely bypass the clockwork underground's defenses. I must move ahead and find a way to shut down the traps so he can travel safely through the halls.
I should find a trap release switch and throw it. It might disable the first array of traps.
I should find a second trap release switch and throw it. Hopefully it will deactivate any additional traps.
A slightly stronger Divayth Fyr arrived shortly after I disabled the final traps. We have to keep moving forward. His shadow must be nearby.
We finally caught up to Divayth's Shadow. Now we must defeat it so Divayth Fyr can reclaim his lost power.
With Divayth's help, I beat the treacherous shadow into submission. I must defend Divayth as he attempts to recover his power.
A fully restored Divayth Fyr defeated the last of the factotums, allowing us to escape the Pneumatic Forge. We should make our way to the surface.
We finally reached the surface of the Clockwork City! Divayth Fyr suggested we take the road to the Brass Fortressâ€”Sotha Sil's seat of power. I should make my way there.
An imposing clockwork mage confronted us outside the gates to the Brass Fortress. She made it clear that she disapproves of Divayth's presence. I should try to defuse the situation.

Protor Luciana Pullo, leader of the Clockwork Apostles, told me that all newcomers to the Brass Fortress must be sponsored before they can gain full access. Perhaps Divayth Fyr can act as my sponsor. I should speak with him.
Divayth Fyr may be able to sponsor me for Brass Fortress access. I should speak with him outside the gates.
Sherizar, a Clockwork Apostle initiate who hopes to be selected as this year's apprentice, asked me to accompany her to the entrance to the Wellspring.
Lector Naril selected Sherizar to be this year's apprentice and invited the rest of us to come inside. I should enter the Everwound Wellspring and talk to him.
Lector Naril wants to show off the wonders of this oasis. I should follow him.
Lector Naril finished his tour and noticed that Sherizar has wandered off. I should talk to him.
Lector Naril wants me to find Sherizar and bring her back so he can get her started on her new duties here in the Everwound Wellspring.
I found Sherizar in one of the Wellspring's fungal workshops. I should talk to her and see what she's up to.
Sherizar asked me to help her get past the factotums so she can talk to her old friend, Chirrhari, who also currently serves as one of Lector Naril's apprentices.

Chirrhari suggested we bring a few samples of her fungi to another apprentice named Idrono. It might help endear us to him and get him to answer Sherizar's questions. But she stressed that we only bring him the safe mushrooms.
We gathered the safe mushroom samples as Chirrhari requested. Now we need to deliver them to Apprentice Idrono.

Idrono suggested that Apprentice Ohtowen might know more about the apprentices selected since Gathal's death. To reach her, we need to traverse the sunless garden and defeat the fabricants that feast upon the dead plants.
We need to cross the Sunless Garden to talk to Apprentice Ohtowen. Apprentice Idrono warned us to watch out for the fabricants that invaded his garden as we pass through that area.
Ohtowen suggested there might be evidence of the other apprentices in Lector Naril's private workshop. A broken vent is our best way to reach the restricted area.
We entered Lector Naril's restricted area. Sherizar suggested we examine his notes to see if he makes any mention of the apprentices that appear to be unaccounted for.

Lector Naril's notes indicate that the Wellspring is fueled by the life force of the missing apprentices. I should follow Sherizar into the Simulated Sunlight Atelier and see what she thinks about all this.
I have to stop Lector Naril's mad plan to sacrifice Sherizar and myself in order to fuel the simulated sunlight that keeps the plants alive.
I defeated Lector Naril. Now I should talk to Sherizar and decide what to do with the simulated sunlight inductor.
I advised Sherizar to call for volunteers to sacrifice themselves to keep the inductor running and the Wellspring producing food.
I advised Sherizar to shut down the inductor. No amount of food is worth sacrificing vibrant, healthy lives.
An alarm sounded in the Machine District. I should meet Luciana back at the Clockwork Basilica to figure out what is going on.

Odd, talking crows took up residence in the Brass Fortress while I hunted Gascone. I need to learn more about their motives and habits. I should ask someone in the city if they know more. The Chancel of Transaction might be a good place to start.
Divayth revealed a secret door behind the waterfall that leads to a cavern deep beneath Mournhold. We must navigate this cave network to find the Clockwork City entrance.

I entered the Gloaming Gate and found myself in the Evergloamâ€”the realm of the Daedric Prince, Nocturnal. I need to look for other portals that might lead me to my destination: the Cogitum Centralis.
An imposing Nocturnal Shrike, Nightmaiden Viriana, captured Luciana. I must defeat this Daedric creature to free my companion.
I defeated Nightmaiden Viriana. I should follow Luciana through the nearby Gloaming Gate. Hopefully this one leads back to the Clockwork City.
When I'm ready to begin my investigation, I should enter the mysterious portal.
Now that I'm inside the Shadow Cleft, I should look around for Acolyte Variah and try to determine the nature of this place.
Acolyte Variah asked me to destroy the shadow array that keeps her and the other souls trapped within the scarecrows. I should locate it and destroy it to deal a blow to Night Sister Kamira.
The people of Clockwork City have started to gather outside the Basilica. Some appear panicked. I should talk to Luciana about how to proceed from here.
I have agreed to do battle in the Bloodroot Forge. To be truly Undaunted I must destroy <<1>>, <<2>>, and the Earthgore Amalgam.
I defeated the Dreadhorn clan who occupied the Bloodroot Forge. I should find <<1>> in my alliance's capital city.
<<1>> presented me with another challenge: read the Scroll of Glorious Battle and slay the Earthgore Amalgam.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
I have agreed to do battle in Falkreath Hold. To be truly Undaunted I must destroy the <<1>>, <<2>>, and <<3>>.
I defeated all the threats to the citizens of Falkreath Hold. I should find <<1>> in my alliance's capital city.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> presented me with another challenge: defy the conquering minotaur warlord, Domihaus, by sounding the Jarl's warhorn before slaying him.

Proctor Luciana has no forces to lend. Fortunately, she has another resource that might be of useâ€”an artificer named Dalomar. She insists that he might have something to aid me in my search. I should talk to him.
I decided to join Divayth Fyr on his expedition to the Clockwork City. Our journey begins at the waterfall just north of Mournhold.
I can use this opportunity to ask Divayth Fyr some questions about our trip to the Clockwork City.
Gascone claims to have the information I need, but he wants a favor in return. I either need to help him retrieve a mysterious contract, or convince him to tell me now.
Snuffler tracked Gascone's scent to the main gate of the Brass Fortress. I must follow the fabricant out into the Clockwork wildsâ€”also known as the Radius.

According to the Nords, a distraught Gascone ran past them not long ago, tracking oil behind him. The oil masks his scent from Snuffler, but the footprints should be easy to follow. I must keep pursuing the fleeing chancellor.
Snuffler led me to a pair of Nords outside the fortress. I should talk to them to see if they know anything about Gascone's whereabouts.

Chancellor Gascone needs me to travel to the Mechanical Fundament to retrieve a Daedric contract. He indicated that an especially dangerous Skaafin carries the document. I must defeat this Skaafin and take the contract back to Gascone.
I retrieved Chancellor Gascone's contract from the Skaafin. I should deliver it to him.
I can use this opportunity to ask Divayth Fyr some questions about our trip to the Clockwork City.
I found a wounded cultist in the ravine.  I should see if she will tell me anything about Gascone's whereabouts.
Gascone's tracks led to a body and a note. I should read this note to see if it contains any clues.
According to the cultist, Gascone fled west along the ravine to a place called the Ventral Terminus. I should head that way to continue my search.

I found a narrow canyon leading to the Ventral Terminus. I should investigate this approach. If I can find some evidence of Gascone's passage, Snuffler might be able to pick up the chancellor's scent again.
Snuffler led me to a locked door. I heard Gascone's voice coming from the door as soon as we arrived. I should talk to him.
A panicked Gascone barricaded himself behind a massive door and refuses to come out. I must find another way into this mysterious facilityâ€”the Ventral Terminus.
I found a second door into the Ventral Terminus. I should go inside to continue my search for Gascone.
I entered the Ventral Terminus, but Gascone is nowhere in sight. I must explore this facility and to find the chancellor.
I successfully filled and charged an animo core. I should remove it from its filling bracket.
I activated the Imperfect and, as expected, it smashed its way forward. I should follow the machine to make sure it makes it all the way to our destination.
I successfuly used the giant clockwork automaton to smash my way to a different part of the Terminus. Gascone must be around here somewhere. I should find and confront him.
I elected to kill the treacherous Chancellor Gascone. I should return to Varuni and tell her what happened.
Gascone yielded and left the Terminus. I must talk to him and decide his fate.
I decided to spare Chancellor Gascone. I should return to Varuni and tell tell her all that's transpired.
I told Varuni about my encounter with Gascone. I should talk to her to claim my reward.
Luciana and I must pursue the Shadow of Sotha Sil into the mysterious Cogitum Centralis.

The Cogitum's automated security system rotated the central bridge, making it impassable. Luciana believes she can override the lock, but she needs more power. I must find two nearby power terminals and activate them.
A peculiar factotum appeared, calling itself Aios. Perhaps I should speak with it to see what it knows.
I should follow Luciana deeper into the Cogitum Centralis.
Otherworldly shadows block our way forward, and Luciana's magic is spent. We have to find another way through.
I should follow Amili into the Mnemonic Planisphere to learn more about the situation.
I need to collect errant stars in order to return them to the Planisphere's sky. I should search the halls surrounding the Planisphere to find them.
I've collected the errant stars needed. I should return them to the Astronomer so he can place them back into the Planisphere's sky.
Something went wrong with returning the stars. I should speak to Amili to find out more.
The primary stars have been corrupted. I need to head to the three viewing platforms and use the calibration guides to show each star its place in the Planisphere's sky.
I've returned all of the corrupted stars to their proper places in the Planisphere's sky. I should speak to Amili to find out what to do next.
I should watch the stolen memory.
Amili has made her choice to become the Astronomer, sacrificing her memories to do so. I should speak to her.

I found a massive clockwork automaton called an Imperfect. This gigantic machine might be capable of smashing through the stone wall that separates me from Gascone. I need to activate it first. To begin, I must open and align the nearby flow valves.
A peculiar factotum appeared, calling itself Aios. Perhaps I should speak with it to see what it knows.
Kireth asked me to check on her brother, Raynor, in the ravine surrounding the Brass Fortress. The firepot spiders lurking down there sound particularly dangerous. Raynor might need my help.

Raynor intends to drain a valuable substance from nearby Firepot Spiders. Unfortunately, they tend to explode when disturbed. Raynor created a device to suppress this behavior. I must disable the spiders so he can drain the liquid.
Raynor and I successfully obtained the firepot spider oil. Now I must deliver it to Varuni Arvel. I'll find her office in the Clockwork Basilica.
Neramo arrived in Varuni's office ahead of me. It looks like he already has a plan for our next move. I should speak to him.

Neramo co-opted a small clockwork automaton known as a skeevaton. We can use this creature to retrieve vital information from the Brass Fortress' Depository Documatis. I should meet Neramo outside the building to activate it.
I am remotely controlling Neramo's co-opted skeevaton, and must navigate it through a maze of pipes called the serviflume. The tunnels should lead into the Depository Documatis.
I directed the skeevaton into the Depository Documatis. Now I must search the building for the evidence Varuni requested.
I found Neramo outside the Depository Documatis. I should speak with him.
While Neramo and I searched the Depository Documatis, Kireth has been conducting her own investigation on Varuni's behalf. I should see if she needs any help.

Kireth suspects that one of the city constables, Baldan,  is sponsoring newcomers in exchange for bribes. She asked me to record her conversation with him. I should get into position in the storage loft.
I must observe Kireth's conversation with Constable Baldan and archive their words on the memory stone she provided.
Constable Baldan's henchmen knocked out and abducted Kireth! I need to see if I can get into the building where she was knocked out and save her.
The door to Constable Baldan's office is locked, but I found Raynor. I should inform him of Kireth's abduction and send him for help.
Raynor suggested I talk to the residents of Slag Townâ€”a slum in the Brass Fortress. They might have an idea of where the constables would take Kireth.

An Argonian named Leaps-Over-Thistle promised to find out where Baldan's thugs took Kireth if I bring her an animo core harvested from a Verminous Fabricant. I can find one of these beasts outside the gates of the Brass Fortress.
I retrieved the animo core Leaps-Over-Thistle requested. I should go back to Slag Town and deliver it to her.
I discovered that the constables often throw undesirables into the Mechanical Fundamentâ€”a network of tunnels beneath the Brass Fortress. I must descend into the Fundament to find Kireth.
I must find Kireth in the Mechanical Fundament.
Kireth believes we are very close to finding Lankin. We should keep looking.
Kireth and I found Lankin. We must all exit the Mechanical Fundament as soon as possible.

Raynor succeeded in finding help. Proctor Luciana, Varuni Arvel, Constable Baldan, and others were waiting for us when we emerged from the lower sections of the Fundament. I should tell Luciana about Baldan's illegal activities.
In a strange turn of events, Varuni demanded that Luciana turn Constable Baldan over to her. I should speak to her to make sure Baldan faces justice.
Neramo followed me to the Clockwork Registrar. I should speak to him about his plans.
An appreciative Varuni finally agreed to sponsor me, Neramo, Kireth, and Raynor for citizenship in the Brass Fortress. I must report to the Clockwork Registrar to make it official.
Neramo followed me to the clockwork registrar. I should speak to him about his plans.
Luciana and I discovered lights capable of dissolving the Daedric shadows. We can use them to clear the way to Sotha Sil's central chamber: the Throne Aligned.
We found the Shadow of Sotha Sil preparing to kill and replace the real Sotha Sil. We must defeat this creature and save the true Clockwork God.
Nocturnal's fury encroaches from all sides! I need to turn the Skeleton Key and wake Sotha Sil before it's too late.
I managed to wake Sotha Sil just in time. He used his divine power to cast out Nocturnal, then teleported all of us back to the Brass Fortress. It looks like Sotha Sil wants to talk to me.
Luciana seems gravely wounded. Perhaps I should talk to her.
I must restore power to the central rotor so I can realign the bridge leading deeper into the Cogitum.
I found Kireth, alive and unharmed, but she refuses to leave. Apparently, Baldan threw another newcomer into the Fundament before herâ€”a Khajiit named Lankin. We must find him before we escape.
Constable Drados told me that a lot of the loudest crows gather around a tree near the Clockwork Basilica. I should go talk to them.
I should ask around in the Chancel of Transaction. Hopefully someone there knows something.
I saw the crows accosting a city constable. I should talk to him.
The stolen memory has revealed that Orvas willingly gave his memories to Sotha Sil to become the Astronomer. I should speak to Amili about what just happened.
Amili has refused to give up her memories and has left the Planisphere. I should speak to the Astronomer.
I should talk to <<1>>.
Tilelle's schematics show that both the Vapor Manifold and Distillation Initiator are in need of repair. I should collect replacement parts, including a <<1>>  and <<2>>, to fix these machines.
I should enter the Regulation Chamber.
I should secure the Regulation Chamber by disabling the guardian factotum. I'll then need to collect a <<1>>  in order to allow Tilelle to repair the <<2>>.
I should help Tilelle repair the <<1>>.

The Knave of Rooks told me that in order to get an audience with the Duke of Crows, I'd need a well-respected escort. He suggested the Knight of Marrow. This Knight should be somewhere near a waterfall in the Brass Fortress.
I found the Knight of Marrow. I should talk to him.
I gathered the mushrooms and stole Salas's notes, as Brengolin asked. I should give them to him next time I'm in Slag Town.
I have the "Root Liqueur" Brengolin asked for. I should bring it to him in Slag Town.

Maurice Ouren confessed that he counterfeited the Root Liqueur. He will need Wellspring Hooch from the Catalog of Rote Duplication and Port Hunding Reserve from Port Hunding in Stros M'kai to recreate the concoction.
I must follow the Knight of Marrow into the Machine District. I must watch him recite his poem before we can move on to my audience with the Duke of Crows.
Brengolin offered his prepared meals to his friends, and asked me to speak to him so that he can give me something as well.

Brengolin requested I acquire the flank of some wild fabricants, which will likely require some hunting, and some hand-raised nix-hound meat from Bratheru Daram's larder. With or without his permission.
I should speak to Divayth about his plans to discover the source of Sotha Sil's new and peculiar behavior.

Divayth wants me to conduct quiet inquiries in the Clockwork Basilica. He seems convinced that the various aides who work there will know more about Sotha Sil's recent behavior. I should talk to as many as I can find.
I collected a number of complaints about Sotha Sil's bizarre and annoying behavior. I should inform Divayth Fyr.
Divayth Fyr wants me to find out why Sotha Sil ordered the lights removed from the loqutorium, and perhaps construct a light of our own. I'll need Neramo's help.
I agreed to enter the Mechanical Fundament to look for clues. According to the aides, the factotums may have discarded some of the lamps there. Perhaps Neramo can determine what makes them so unique.
It seems that Neramo has discerned the unique lamps' function. I should talk to him.
Neramo believes he can build a lamp just like the broken ones we found in the Fundament, but he needs a number of very specific components. I must buy, barter, or hunt fabricants for those parts.
I collected all the parts Neramo requested. I should deliver these components so he can complete our unique lamp. I can find him in the Hall of Refined Techniques.
Neramo and Raynor should complete work on the lamp soon. In the meantime, I should make my way to the Clockwork Basilica and inform Divayth Fyr of our progress.
Kireth arrived with the completed lamp, but she seems concerned. I should talk to her.

I must make my way to the balcony that overlooks the loqutorium and place our unique light in a place where it can shine down on the stage below. Unfortunately, the upper floors are crawling with guards. I must be cautious.
I placed the lamp on the balcony. I should inform Divayth Fyr.
When Sotha Sil steps out on stage and begins his lecture, I must activate the lamp and observe the results.
I revealed Sotha Sil as an imposter! Apparently, a malevolent shadow took his place. It fled into Sotha Sil's private rectory. I must track it down and defeat it before it gets away.
I defeated the Shadow of Sotha Sil. I should speak to Divayth Fyr and see if he has any thoughts on what just occurred.
A very concerned Divayth Fyr encouraged me to talk to Varuni Arvel. I should speak with her.
Varuni is very concerned about the future of Clockwork City. I should talk to her to see how she'd like to proceed.
I must turn the Skeleton Key to finish unlocking Sotha Sil from his throne.
Now that the Knight has finished wooing Lady Blightwing, he should introduce me to his liege, the Duke of Crows.
I should talk to Sotha Sil to claim my reward.
The Duke of Crows agreed to give me the key if I help defeat his enemies, the Exarchs of Dross. I should begin by scattering the crows surrounding the Duke's position.
I scattered the Exarchs gathered around the Duke's position. I should discuss our next move with the Knight of Marrow.
The Knight of Marrow wants me to destroy something called "The Motionless Guardian." I should find and destroy this mysterious foe.
I defeated the guardian scarecrow. I should return to Blackfeather Castle. Hopefully the Duke of Crows will honor our agreement.
There may be an easier way to return to the castleâ€”a series of elevated platforms stretch back through the Machine District. If I want to save time, I should use them.
I should talk to the Duke of Crows. Hopefully he'll tell me the location of the key.
The Duke of Crows needs me to help him with a scheme to frighten the Exarch's leader, The Queen of Chaff. I should follow him into the Incarnatorium.
Amili has decided to give up her memories and become the new Astronomer. I should stay with her as the process is performed.
Amili has decided to leave the Planisphere and retain her memories. I should stay with her as she tells the Astronomer.
I must talk to the Duke of Crows about his plot to get rid of the Queen of Chaff.
The Queen of Chaff and her entourage entered the Incarnatorium. I should hide and listen to the Duke and the Queen's negotiation.
The Duke of Crows gave me the signal to throw a switch. I should pull one of these levers and see what happens.
Sotha Sil asked me to find Divayth Fyr and then meet him at the Elegiac Replication.
I told Divayth Fyr to meet Sotha Sil in the Elegiac Replication. I should go there myself.
Sotha Sil appears to have something to say to Divayth Fyr. I should let this exchange play out.
The Clockwork God, Sotha Sil, wants to talk to me. I should see what he has to say.
The Duke of Crows gave me the signal to throw another switch. I should pull one of these levers and see what happens.
The Duke of Crows gave me the signal to throw another switch. I should pull one of these levers and see what happens.
The Duke gave me the final signal. I should pull one last lever and see what happens.
I helped the Duke scare off the Queen of Chaff, but the key remains just out of reachâ€”locked behind a door. I must make my way through the Incanartorium to claim the key.
I have the key in sight. I should take it.
The Shadow of Sotha Sil stole the key and unleashed a terrifying Wraith-of-Crows. I must defeat this otherworldly creature.
I defeated the Wraith-of-Crows. I should find the Duke of Crows and discuss our next move.

Brengolin has asked me to harvest some rare mushrooms from the Halls of Regulation, but he also needs me to acquire the secret techniques used to prepare them from an uncooperative shroommonger named Salas Ramothran.
Brengolin's friend, Maurice, suggested I might find where more Root Liqueur can be found by asking around at the Brass Fortress Guild Traders.
Maurice Ouren suspiciously called me over to speak away from prying eyes and ears. I should hear what he has to say.
I should talk to Tilelle to learn of our next task.
I have the Wellspring Hooch and Port Hunding Reserve that Maurice Ouren needs to brew his counterfeit Root Liqueur. I should return it to him in Slag Town.
I discovered a menagerie of skeletal beasts on display, but their unseen master reanimated them to bar my path. I need to destroy them before Yisareh and I can investigate further.
I destroyed the undead menagerie, but Yisareh seemed puzzled as to why the necromancers would be studying animal bones. She asked me to press onward while she digs into their research.

Yisareh was able to speak to Caluurion's spirit after I defeated him. He has no love for the necromancer who bound him to his will and agreed to help us if we free his allies as well. Now I have to find them.
I killed Orryn the Black and destroyed his Bone Dragon, putting an end to the threat he and his cult posed to Tamriel. I should speak to <<1>> about our success.

The master of the necromancer cult has more than mindless undead at his disposal. He commanded a lich named Caluurion to kill me and now I must destroy him or risk finding myself an undead thrall as well.
Yisareh said that a magical barrier is preventing her from delving deeper into Fang Lair. I need to find and disrupt it.
The barrier is being maintained by Lizabet Charnus, a powerful necromancer in the service of this cult's unseen master. Defeating her should bring down the barrier blocking our path.

I brought down the barrier preventing our passage into Fang Lair. Yisareh asked me to take the lead and seek out an area where the necromancers practice their craft. Their research may provide some insight into their motives.
I found a pair of powerful undead I believe to be Caluurion's allies. To free them from their unwilling service to the necromancers I will have to destroy them.
I freed Ulfnor and Sabina from Orryn's control. They confirmed that the necromancers intend to reanimate the Dragon. I must find Orryn and prevent him from completing his ritual.
I found Orryn the Black in the Dragon's old roost, but I was too late to prevent him from completing his reanimation of its bones. I must destroy the Bone Dragon and deal with Orryn once and for all.
We've entered the temple. We'll need to climb up <<1>> in order to stop the cultists from spreading this plague across Tamriel.
A wrathful giantess blocks our path. We'll need to defeat her in order to advance.
We've found the cult's leader. We should defeat him in order to stop the cult from spreading their plague.
We've stopped the cultists from spreading their plague. I should speak to <<1>> in order to claim my reward.
We've defeated the giantess. We'll need to continue to climb <<1>> in order to find a way to stop the cultists from spreading their plague.
Jorvuld's companions are trapped on the other side of a broken bridge. We should make our way through the ogre infested caverns in order to rescue them.
Our way forward is blocked by two of the ogres' leaders, <<1>> and <<2>>. We'll need to defeat them in order to advance.
A powerful gargoyle guards the temple's entrance. We'll need to defeat it if we wish to gain entrance.
We've discovered that the cult is actually being led by Zaan the Scalecaller, the Dragon Priest from whom this mountain was named. We'll have to climb even further in order to defeat her.
We've found the Dragon Priest at the very top of the Scalecaller Peak. We must defeat her in order to stop the cult's plague from ravishing Tamriel.
I gave Maurice the Wellspring Hooch and Port Hunding Reserve. Now he's working on creating another batch of his counterfeit Root Liqueur. Once it's ready, Maurice will provide it to me.
I procured all the cuts of meat that Brengolin requested. I should return to him in Slag Town.
I gave the Knight of Marrow a poem to recite to his love, Lady Blightwing. I should meet with him outside the gate to the Machine District.
I arrived at the gate leading to the Machine District. Luciana and a few of her soldiers are here too. I should talk to Luciana to find out what they're doing here.
I should speak to Aicessar to confirm my interest in joining the Fighters Guild.
Luciana probably has something to say about all this. Perhaps I should talk to her.
Luciana probably has some thoughts on this. I might want to speak to her.
I should speak to Curinure to confirm my interest in joining the Mages Guild.
I should seek Associate Zanon in his workshop to inquire about the task.
The factotum's head contains a repeated message stating where to find its Integral of Memory. I should go to the Mnemonic Planisphere to find the missing component.
I should bring the Integral of Memory back to Associate Zanon.
Associate Zanon has given me the honors of installing the Integral of Memory. I should do so.
I've spoken to the Precursor and have learned that the rest of the factotum's memory is contained in its other missing parts. I should speak to Associate Zanon about this development.
Proctor Luciana ordered one of the factotums, the Clockwork Clinician, to extract information from Gascone's brain. I should see if any of the information it recovered proves useful.

The Clockwork Clinician told me that I can't "talk" to Gascone until I retrieve a component called a tok-plug. Apparently skeevatons often steal these plugs and hide them in piles on the east side of the Fortress. I should go have a look.
I'm semi-confident that I acquired a tok-plug. I should return to the Clockwork Basilica and give it to the Clockwork Clinician.
The Clockwork Clinician informed me that Gascone's corpse is prepared for interrogation. I should talk to it.
The Bursar of Tributes requested I scavenge carapaces, foul hides, and Daedra husks that he can add to the Blackfeather Court's collection of fleshy bits.
I scavenged bits of carcasses for the Blackfeather Court. I should bring them to the Bursar of Tributes and collect my reward.
The Bursar of Tributes requested I scavenge elemental essence, supple roots, and ectoplasm to help feed the Blackfeather Court.
I scavenged the items that the Bursar of Tributes requested. I should bring them to him and claim my reward.
The Bursar of Tributes requested I steal utensils, drinkware, dishes, and cookware from those people who refuse to provide tribute to the Blackfeather Court.
I gathered cookware and dishes as the Bursar of Tributes requested. Now I should return to him and claim my reward.
I installed the Integral of Memory. I should see how the factotum head responds.
I rescued Novice Oscard and gathered his research notes. Now I should leave the Shadow Cleft and return to Adjunct Daro at the Grand Depository.
I should enter the portal to the Shadow Cleft and look for the lost apostle, Novice Oscard, and his research notes.
Adjunct Daro can tell me about Novice Oscard if I'm interested in learning more.

We found the lost treasure. Kamid claims that the treasureâ€”crates of spicesâ€”is extremely valuable in the Clockwork City since nothing organic grows here. He wants me to meet him back in Slagtown for my reward.
I should seek out Lector Trivura in the Mechanical Fundament and convince her to come evaluate the Precursor.
I should meet Lector Trivura in Zanon's Workshop and view her evaluation.
Lector Trivura has agreed to evaluate the Precursor. I should speak to Associate Zanon and let him know.
I should head to the Sanctuary of Verification in order to defeat the Imperfect and collect the sequence plaques.
I should return to the Brass Fortress to collect my reward from the Clockwork Facilitator.
I should return to the Brass Fortress to collect my reward from the Clockwork Facilitator.
I should travel to Exarchs' Egress in order to defeat the Daedric creatures and the Wraith-of-Crows.
Palbatan asked me to go to the Outlaws Refuge in Slag Town and talk to Kamid. He wants me to find out what the young man is planning and see if I can help him and keep him safe.
I need to find Raynor somewhere in the Clockwork City. Kireth asked me to not mention that she sent me, but I don't know how I feel about lying to Raynor.
I agreed to help Raynor conduct his research of the Clockwork City. He wants to investigate the Resonant Sphere, the Vale of Tiers, and the Broken Clock Tower.
I should talk to Raynor so we can finalize our conclusions concerning the sites we explored.
I convinced Raynor to apologize to his sister Kireth. He wants me to talk to her and make sure she isn't too angry with him before he makes his apology.
I convinced Raynor to stand up for himself. He wants me to talk to Kireth first before he tells his sister what he thinks of her for berating him after the shadow affair.
Kamid plans to find the Grand Prognosticator and destroy it to show his people that they can determine their own fates. He asked me to meet him at the Vale of Tiers.
I rescued Evoker Tadari and found the missing perception tabulator. Now I should leave the Shadow Cleft and return to Adjunct Daro.
I should enter the Shadow Cleft and locate Evoker Tadari and the missing perception tabulator the apostles provided her with.
I could ask Adjunct Daro at the Grand Depository for more information before I enter the portal.
I found Initiate Favar's body. There was nothing I could do for him, but I was able to complete his analysis of the Shadow Cleft. I should return to the Grand Depository and let Adjunct Daro know.
I agreed to enter the Shadow Cleft, locate the missing apostle, and use the perception tabulator to perform additional research on the dark realm.
I could ask Adjunct Daro in the Grand Depository for more information before I enter the portal.
Kamid wants to activate the Grand Prognosticator so he can prove that it lies. To do that, he asked me to descend into the Vale of Tiers and acquire a working animo core from a roaming factotum.
I've successfully oiled the ventilation fan. I should return to the Brass Fortress to claim my reward.
I should travel to the Halls of Regulation and find saturated oil. I'll need to defeat repair factotums in order to do so.
I can talk to <<1>> for more information
Kamid's mother's journal mentions a passphrase, "Magus commands you." I should see if I can find the factotum analyst she was looking for and use the passphrase.
Kamid mentioned that his mother perished in the Vale during the last pilgrimage. I should keep an eye out for any signs of her that I can bring back for the young man.
I should return to Justiciar Farowel with the coral crab eggs I collected, and to let her know that the Queen of the Reef is dead.
Justiciar Farowel instructed me to take several samples from the region where the Queen of the Reef dwells and deal with her accordingly if she has become a threat.
I killed Caanerin and penned its spirit within its ancestral grove. I should return to <<1>>.
I can find Caanerin's ancestral glade between Russafeld and Tor-Hame-Khard.
I killed B'Korgen the Sea Sload and destroyed the patches of coral the creature corrupted. Now I should return to Justiciar Farowel and claim my reward.
I need to head for Welenkin Cove, west of Alinor, and destroy any patches of tainted coral I come upon. Then I need to kill the Sea Sload alchemist that calls itself B'Korgen.
The gryphons nest on the northeast shore of the Isle. I should travel there and kill the creatures, as well as collect their feathers.
I've gathered the feathers and dealt with the gryphons Haeliata and Nagravia. I should return to <<1>> in Alinor.
I have been tasked with killing Graveld and retrieving Scrolls of Oath from the fallen Justiciars.
I killed <<1>>. I should return to <<2>> and let her know.
I can find Keelsplitter in the bay near Sea Keep. The logs likely washed up on the shore nearby.
I killed Keelsplitter and recovered the missing ships' logs. I should return to <<1>>.
I should head to the Humidity Chamber in order to oil the ventilation fan.
I've successfully replaced the water filters. I should return to the Brass Fortress to claim my reward.
I should travel to the Halls of Regulation and find water filters. I'll need to defeat repair factotums in order to do so.
I can talk to <<1>> for more information
I should head to the Purification Chamber in order to replace the water filters.
I successfully replaced the brass commutators. I should return to the Brass Fortress to claim my reward.
I should travel to the Halls of Regulation and find brass commutators. I'll need to defeat repair factotums in order to do so.
I can talk to <<1>> for more information
I should head to the Regulation Chamber in order to replace the brass commutators.
Bratheru Daram might be willing to part with his nix hound meat for a price. I should see if he's willing to sell.
Kamid asked me to insert the animo core into the machine to power up the factotum. Then he can ask it to reveal his fortune.
I have reached the gates of the Brass Fortress and must escort Divayth Fyr inside.

The Knave of Rooks agreed to give me information in exchange for one of Constable Drados's belongingsâ€”a "silver treasure." I must ask Drados for this item, or steal it from his bunk in the Cloisters.
I secured the crows' "silver treasure." I should bring it to the Knave of Rooks as tribute.
Neramo told me that Kireth and Raynor might need my help to acquire a gift for our potential sponsor, Varuni Arvel. I should talk to Kireth outside the gates of the Brass Fortress.
I acquired a working animo core. I should return to Kamid and see if we can use it to activate the Grand Prognosticator.

The Grand Prognosticator provided a fortune to Kamid that matches the ones given to all the pilgrims from Slag Town. It couldn't furnish me with a fortune, however. I should talk to Kamid and see what he thinks.
Kamid plans to recover a lost treasure to change his fate. We need to return to the Brass Fortress and find Palbatan, who Kamid believes knows the secret for locating the treasure.
Now that I'm back in the Brass Fortress, I should locate Palbatan and see what he can tell Kamid and me about the lost treasure of the Radius.
I recovered the treasure. Now to turn it over to Kamid.

We found the lost treasure. Kamid claims that the treasureâ€”crates of spicesâ€”is extremely valuable in the Clockwork City since nothing organic grows here. He wants me to meet him back in Slagtown for my reward.

Alienist Llandras believes he can no longer contain the power of the Saints and accepted my offer of assistance. I must defeat their mechanical forms so that the black soul gems housing their souls may be recovered.

Alienist Llandras believes he can no longer contain the power of the Saints and accepted my offer of assistance. I must defeat their mechanical forms so that the black soul gems housing their souls may be recovered.

Alienist Llandras believes he can no longer contain the power of the Saints and accepted my offer of assistance. I must defeat their mechanical forms so that the black soul gems housing their souls may be recovered.
I recovered fragments of the Saints' halos in the aftermath of our battle. I should take them to Alienist Llandras.
I recovered fragments of the Saints' halos in the aftermath of our battle. I should take them to Alienist Llandras.
I recovered fragments of the Saints' halos in the aftermath of our battle. I should take them to Alienist Llandras.
I have disabled the Saints' mechanical bodies and neutralized the threat they posed to Clockwork City. I should inform Alienist Llandras.
I have disabled the Saints' mechanical bodies and neutralized the threat they posed to Clockwork City. I should inform Alienist Llandras.
I have disabled the Saints' mechanical bodies and neutralized the threat they posed to Clockwork City. I should inform Alienist Llandras.
I found Kireth, alive and unharmed, but she refuses to leave. Apparently, Baldan threw another newcomer into the Fundament before herâ€”a Khajiit named Lankin. We must find him before we escape.
I found Kireth, alive and unharmed, but she refuses to leave. Apparently, Baldan threw another newcomer into the Fundament before herâ€”a Khajiit named Lankin. We must find him before we escape.
I found Kireth, alive and unharmed, but she refuses to leave. Apparently, Baldan threw another newcomer into the Fundament before herâ€”a Khajiit named Lankin. We must find him before we escape.
Palbatan provided us with the location of the wrecked caravan where Kamid hopes to recover a lost treasure. We just need to get past the fabricant called Gear Grinder and search the area.

The lost treasure of the Radius consists of valuable spices that Kamid can sell for a small fortune in a metallic desert like Clockwork City. He asked me to meet him back in Slag Town to settle our accounts.
My skeevaton infiltration of the Depository Documatis was a success! I guided the skeevaton out of the building. I should meet Neramo at the building's exit.
Luciana and I must pursue the Shadow of Sotha Sil into the mysterious Cogitum Centralis.
In order to activate the Imperfect, I need to slide the animo core into its charging socket.
It appears that the Imperfect ran out of fuel. I must find another animo core to get it moving again.
In order to reactivate the Imperfect, I need to slide the animo core into its charging socket.

An Orcish sword remains upright in the sand, even after all this time. This may be the heirloom sword of Dulza's clan, Morkul of Fell's Run. If I bring it to one of her descendants in Rivenspire, they may reward me.
I located a descendant of Dulza. I should speak with him about his ancestor and the sword I found.
I met Dulza's nephew, Ghakorz gro-Morkul. He's grateful I returned his clan's ancestral sword. I should discuss a reward with him.
I found Orinol's cousin, Brelenel. I should deliver the news of his death and discuss the matter of his dog with her.
I found Orinol's cousin, Brelenel, and delivered the news of her cousin's death. I should discuss the matter of his dog with her.
I've found Frynga in Slag Town. I should speak to her about the inactive brassilisk I collected.
I've found Frynga. I should return the brassilisk to her and discuss a reward.
I found one sequence plaque so far. If I follow the road, there may be more ahead. If I find more sequence plaques and return them, perhaps I'll receive a reward.
I found sequence plaques CCHW-04 and CCHW-03. This suggests two plaques remain. I should keep looking.
I found sequence plaques CCHW-04, CCHW-03, and CCHW-02. This suggests only one plaque remains. I should keep looking.
I found all four sequence plaques. Now I should return these plaques to the Clockwork Registrar in the Brass Fortress to receive my reward.
The Clockwork Registrar confirmed that it wants these sequence plaques. I should ask if there's a reward for returning them.
I must search the city Archivox and ask for some suggestions on what poem might work for the Knight of Marrow.

Razum-dar tasked me with asking questions around Shimmerene to gauge the mood of the locals and the newcomers in regards to the Queen's decree. I should talk to Raz and see if he has a suggestion on where I should begin.

Razum-dar asked me to attend a meeting at Kinlady Avinisse's mansion. He wants me to speak to her to determine what she knows about the happenings in the monastery. He provided me with an invitation and set of elegant clothes to get me inside.
Kinlady Avinisse left her guests and went into her mansion. I should head inside and speak to her.
Kinlady Avinisse seemed genuinely surprised to hear that the newcomers were being killed beneath the monastery. I should report to Razum-dar outside the mansion and let him know what I learned here.
Now that I'm inside the monastery, I should look around and try to find out what's happened to the newcomers and other non-High Elves that have been sequestered.

Razum-dar asked me to take a look around the Monastery of Serene Harmony in Shimmerene to determine what's happening with the sequestered newcomers. I just need to wait for Raz to distract the sentry before I can slip inside.
I should talk to the Ritemaster and see what I can do to help.
I should activate the nearby switches. Perhaps they can break through the shadows blocking our passage.
I should activate the nearby switches. Perhaps they can break through the shadows blocking our passage.
Vanus's enchanted boat deposited me near to where the Oracle dwells. The Oracle should be nearby. I should try to find her.
There's a wyress inside the dwelling, but she isn't the Oracle. I should talk to her.
A wyress thinks that Marieve may have sought shelter in an old wyrd site inside the Mines of Khuras. I should use Vanus's enchanted boat to travel there.

I tracked Oracle Marieve to the old wyrd site inside the Mines of Khuras, but she isn't here. She left a cryptic note for Vanus. I should use the medallion of summoning he provided and call him here. Maybe he'll notice something I missed.
I should talk to Vanus Galerion and find out what happens to the Oracle now.
The medallion of summoning brought Vanus to my location. I should show him the Oracle's note and see what he thinks.
Vanus believes the Oracle left a secret message in this cave and the key to unlocking it requires finding elemental items with some connection to air, earth, and water.

According to Gascone, a wall of solid rock stands between us. If I want to find the chancellor, I'll need to come up with a way to break through this stone wall. Perhaps something in this room can help.
Raynor collected enough firepot oil to satisfy our potential sponsor, Varuni. I must collect the oil from him before returning to the Brass Fortress.

This writ is from the Orsinium Civic Renewal and Vengeance Committee, needing more supplies but wishing to not shame their alchemists. I've been tasked with creating an Essence of Ravage Health and acquiring Alkahest to complete my contract.
I've placed my delivery of crafted goods into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest and take my reward.

This writ is from the Orsinium Civic Renewal and Vengeance Committee, needing more supplies but wishing to not shame their alchemists. I've been tasked with creating an Essence of Stamina and acquiring Mudcrab Chitin to complete my contract.
I've placed my delivery of crafted goods into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest and take my reward.

This writ is from the Orsinium Civic Renewal and Vengeance Committee, needing more supplies but wishing to not shame their alchemists. I've been tasked with creating an Essence of Magicka and acquiring some Imp Stool to complete my contract.
I've placed my delivery of crafted goods into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest and take my reward.

This writ is from the Orsinium Civic Renewal and Vengeance Committee, needing more supplies but wishing to not shame their alchemists. I've been tasked with creating an Essence of Health and acquiring some Nirnroot to complete my contract.
I've placed my delivery of crafted goods into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest and take my reward.

This writ is from the Orsinium Civic Renewal and Vengeance Committee, needing more supplies but wishing to not shame their alchemists. I've been tasked with creating a Drain Health Poison IX and acquiring Lorkhan's Tears to complete my contract.
I've placed my delivery of crafted goods into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest and take my reward.

This writ is from the Orsinium Civic Renewal and Vengeance Committee, needing more supplies but wishing to not shame their alchemists. I've been tasked with creating a Damage Stamina Poison IX and acquiring Spider Eggs to complete my contract.
I've placed my delivery of crafted goods into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest and take my reward.

This writ is from the Orsinium Civic Renewal and Vengeance Committee, needing more supplies but wishing to not shame their alchemists. I've been tasked with creating a Damage Magicka Poison IX and acquiring Violet Coprinus to complete my contract.
I've placed my delivery of crafted goods into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest and take my reward.

This writ is from the Orsinium Civic Renewal and Vengeance Committee, needing more supplies but wishing to not shame their alchemists. I've been tasked with creating a Damage Health Poison IX and acquiring Nightshade to complete my contract.
I've placed my delivery of crafted goods into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest and take my reward.
I should place the items that represent the elements of air, water, and earth in the proper ritual bowls. Vanus believes that will reveal a message from Oracle Marieve.
When I placed the items in the correct ritual bowls, a projection of Oracle Marieve appeared. I should talk to her.
Oracle Marieve thinks she's being taken to an Aldmeri ruin in Auridon called Bewan. I should go to Bewan and attempt to rescue her.
Sea Elves overrun the ruins of Bewan. I need to get past them and find Oracle Marieve somewhere deeper within the ruins.
They forced the Oracle through a portal. I should enter the portal and follow her.
The Oracle appears trapped by some sort of Daedric magic and connected to the strange portal behind her. I should talk to her.
I need to defeat the weavers, break the binding pinions, and destroy the center fulcrum to set the Oracle free.
Marieve is free. She has enough energy to open a portal. We should leave Mephala's realm before the energy fades.
I should talk to Oracle Marieve in Skywatch and make sure she's all right.
An alarm sounded in the Machine District. I should meet Luciana back at the Clockwork Basilica to figure out what is going on.
The Shadow snatched the Skeleton Key right out from under me. I should inform Luciana of all that's happened.
The Duke seems pleased that we were able to drive out the Exarchs of Dross. I should talk to him.
The Bursar of Tributes requested I steal cosmetics and grooming supplies from people who insulted the Blackfeather Court.
I gathered cosmetic and grooming supplies as the Bursar of Tributes requested. Now I should return to him and claim my reward.
The Bursar of Tributes requested I steal trinkets of leisure for the Blackfeather Court to play with.
I gathered toys and games as the Bursar of Tributes requested. Now I should return to him and claim my reward.
I retrieved the Morkul family sword. If I bring it to Rivenspire and return the sword to one of Dulza's descendants in Fell's Run, they may reward me.
Orinol mentioned that his cousin Brelenel lives in Cormount. If I travel to Cormount and find Brelenel, I can ask her to take care of Jona for Orinol.
The brassilisk ran out of power beneath a pipeline leading to the Brass Fortress. It most likely used that pipeline to travel to this location. Frynga must be somewhere in the fortress.
I might want to check on Luciana before I start my search for Divayth Fyr. I should be able to find her in her retreat, inside the basilica.
I gave Brengolin the meat he requested and he rushed off to begin preparing a meal. He invited me to join him in Slag Town to see the fruits of my labor.
We found the Shadow of Sotha Sil preparing to kill and replace the real Sotha Sil. We must defeat this creature and save the true Clockwork God.
I encountered a High Elf who clearly isn't one of the Aldarch's monks. I should talk to her and find out what she's doing in the monastery.

Valsirenn claims she's trying to find a friend who might have been caught up in the sequestering. She feels there's more going on than simple politics and suggested we explore the monastery undercroft together.
Valsirenn suggested I find Razum-dar at the local inn and let him know what we discovered beneath the Monastery of Serene Harmony.
I met Valsirenn outside the Coral Forest, but there's no sign of Razum-dar as of yet. We should enter the Coral Forest and start searching for the Kinlady and the Aldarch.
We saw Aldarch Tilcalar threaten the Kinlady before she fled. Valsirenn pursued the Kinlady. I should go after the Aldarch.
Now that I dealt with the Aldarch and the abyssal pearl, I should locate Valsirenn and the Kinlady.
Now I need to find Razum-dar, let him know what happened in the Coral Forest and see what he plans to do with Kinlady Avinisse.

Valsirenn invited me to come to Artaeum and help her explain events in Shimmerene to the Psijic Order's Ritemaster. She attuned me to a portal that will transport me to the hidden island. I should use the portal at the first opportunity.
I arrived on Artaeum and there's a tower in the distance. That's probably where I'll find Valsirenn and the Ritemaster.
