The prisoners have been subjected to ghastly acts for some unknown purpose. They say that Faidur was taken to the Saviors, but I won't reach them without Arillas's keys. I need to find them, quickly.
The Ritemaster suggested I try to burn the barrier of webbing so we can enter the central rotunda.
Now that I have freed Faidur and the other prisoners we'll need to escape the underground before the Saviors' followers attempt to capture or kill us.
I should talk to Battlereeve Tanerline to find out more about the missing group of adventurers and the Sea Sload incursion.
The Battlereeve asked me to go to the Karnwasten caves to locate the mage Cainar and his companions. I need to find out what they learned.
I need to either get the key to unlock the chains that bind Grog, or I can pick the lock. Either way, I need to get him out of those chains.
I unlocked the chains and set Grog free. Now I should talk to him and find out what he's learned about the Sea Sload.
To find information on the other Sloads in Summerset, I should meet with Miriya. Her expedition was last seen southwest of Alinor.
The marines accompanying Miriya retreated down the coast after they were ambushed by the yaghra. I need to find them and their mage, Indirim, who assembled a report about the Sea Sload's geysers.
I found a page from Indirim's report on the Sea Sload threat. I need to continue to search the coastline and find the rest of the report.
I should talk to Battlereeve Tanerline about the Sea Sload threat we uncovered.
Leythen managed to get the gate open. Now we just have to get behind it before his magic fades.
Leythen wasn't able to get through the gate before it closed. I should talk to him.

Chef Donolon will make me a special Jubilee Cake, but I need to bring him the ingredients he needs to prepare a fresh one. I need to gather or buy bananas, flour, and honey and bring them back to the chef.
It looks like Chef Donolon has completed my cake. I should talk to him so I can claim it.
Many ingredients can be purchased from local vendors.
I can collect my cake by finding the baker and his bakery barge in the ports of Vulkhel Guard, Davon's Watch, and the Harbor District of Daggerfall.
I gave Chef Donolon the ingredients he requested. Now I just need to wait for him to complete my Jubilee Cake.
When I locate an abyssal geyser, I need to defeat its guardians, destroy the abyssal pearl, and shut down the geyser. I need to destroy at least one geyser to disrupt the Sea Sload threat.
I destroyed an abyssal geysers. I should return to Battlereeve Tanerline and let her know I disrupted the plans of the Sea Sload cabal.
A clearly mad student of the Illumination Academy mentioned that an Elf named Erudil tried to talk some sense into her. I should find Erudil and talk to him.
Cainar's associate Grog has been captured and left as a gift for the Sea Sload. I need to find him before anything awful happens.
I should talk to High Examiner Lorne.
I should bring the reassembled report to Battlereeve Tanerline in Alinor.
Lorne indicated that I should search for more clues in the grape-fields surrounding the murder scene. I should have a look around.
The young Wood Elf's dress is spattered with blood, but I found no lacerations on her body. It's possible that she injured her assailant. I should search for more clues.
I found a bloody sack. I should see if it contains any vital evidence.
I found a bloody sickle in the discarded sack. I should take it back to Lorne and tell her all that I've seen.
I arrived in a place that looks similar to the basement of Cey-Tarn Keep, yet twisted and wrong. Silurie and Hyircil have split up to search for Lindafwe, leaving me one final avenue to explore.
I defeated Soravil. I should return to Lorne to see if she's all right and inform her that Soravil is dealt with.
After I activated the message stone, a projection of Vanus Galerion appeared before me. I should speak to the mage's projection.
I should return to Cainar and show him the captain's journal. It contains some interesting information concerning the Sea Sload.

Grog suggested that the smugglers' captain keeps a journal in which she recorded information concerning her dealings with the Karnwasten Sea Sload. I should look for it near their shanty above the bay.
Erudil thinks that if we break the enchantment on his friends, they might be able to come up with a broader and more effective solution. I should follow him.
We encountered one of Erudil's classmatesâ€”a Wood Elf named Glardir. I should ask Erudil about her and how she fits into all this.
I should escort Grog back to Cainar so we can tell him what we know.
I discovered Selynia's persona: The Brave Little Scrib. I should talk to her again. Maybe I can use this information to help break the enchantment.
I should talk to Cainar and tell him what Grog learned in Karnwasten.
<<1>> can deputize me so I can take on contract work for the Divine Prosecution. I should speak to her.
I should speak to <<1>> in order to be deputized as a contract agent for the Divine Prosecution.
Selynia mentioned that the key to her identity is nearby. I should sift through these books to find some clues.
I have the Dawnbreaker in my possession. The only thing left is to climb the tower and confront Nocturnal once and for all.
Nocturnal has once again sent her champion against me. I need to defeat her.
I need to put a stop to Nocturnal and use the Dawnbreaker on the tower crystal when the time is right.
I rescued Selynia from the Illuminus's enchantment. I should return to Erudil so we can plot our next move.
I broke the enchantment on Tanelwen. I should return to Erudil and give him the news.
I broke the enchantment on Pavo. I should return to Erudil and give him the news.
I should talk to Vanus Galerion and let him know that the Oracle is safe now.
I should talk to Vanus Galerion and find out what happens to the Oracle now.
Tanelwen insists she's some kind of investigator. I should read some of the books nearby to determine her adopted persona.
I found a book detailing the adventures of a fictional detective, Investigator Vale. This must be Tanelwen's persona. Now that I know who she is, I should talk to her again.
Nocturnal is weakened. I need to use the Dawnbreaker on the crystal called Transparent Law before she can recover.
I should talk to the two accused scholars: Hunrand and Maya.
Hunrand and Maya's testimony implicates a third party. The real thief may be in the bushes nearby. I should investigate.
I found a guilty-looking dog sitting near a half-eaten pie. This is clearly the culprit. I should take the half-eaten pie as evidence.

Nocturnal has been banished. The Transparent Law crystal has been restored, and for now, it seems the threat has ended. Valsirenn has been able to get into the tower though, so I should speak to her and find out what's happening.
I should take the half-eaten pie back to Tanelwen and prove her wrong. Hopefully that will break the Illuminus enchantment.
I must use the map Josajeh provided and the Augur of the Obscure to find the time breaches on Summerset Isle. Activating a Psijic Seal near a breach should repair the veil and close the gap.
I sealed the time breaches that appeared on Summerset Isle. I must return to <<1>> on Artaeum and update him on my progress.
Loremaster Celarus urged me to speak with his apprentice, <<1>>. I should meet with her in the Athenaeum.
New text has appeared in the Illuminus. I should discuss this new development with Erudil.
Pavo has taken on the persona of some sort of beggar. I should look through the nearby books to see if I can determine his false identity.
It seems that Pavo has taken on the role of the Beggar Prince. I can use this information to my advantage when I talk to him again.
In "lifting the curse," I've broken the Beggar Prince's central character trait. I should talk to Pavo again to see if this freed him from the Illuminus's enchantment.
The Ritemaster believes that Leythen might be able to tell us how to find a priest of Meridia. I should talk to him. He's on the island of Artaeum, talking to Valsirenn.
I defeated the Illuminated One. Now, I must place the book back on the shelf to break the enchantment once and for all.
There's a prisoner in a cage down here. I should talk to her and set her free.

Vivienne asked me to speak to Emile and convince him to recant his murder confession. Though she does not know why he would falsely confess, she is convinced he did not kill Haladan, the Sapiarch who was murdered.
Valsirenn cast some sort of spell and the pearl disappeared. I should exit the great hall and talk to her.
I must travel to the tavern in Alinor to meet with Justiciar Tanorian's associate, Esulo.
Talerion appeared at Mother's Den with questions. Since I met him earlier, he might listen to what I have to say. The evidence I collected will prove Mirulon was behind this.
Mirulon might have some evidence that could exonerate Arathel. I should take a look around to see what I can find.

Elise sabotaged the containment measures for the inner paddocks, setting the indriks loose and forcing Vinelore to flee, but Talomar was wounded during her escape. Elise is tending to Talomar, I should speak to her about him.
Talomar is no longer in the Conservatory. Elise suspects he's  taken off after Lotus himself and we can head after him to the inner paddocks by heading through the Conservatory. We should find him.

I promised Talomar that I would find Lotus and bring her to safety. She's being held somewhere in the inner paddocks, but with the indriks and Vinelore on the loose mounting a rescue will be dangerous.
SU-GB5 Item Target
According to Khavid, Kinlady Helenaere has been captured by the Maormer. I should stop her execution by defeating Admiral Viscarne.
Now that we defeated the mind traps, I should talk to Oriandra and make sure the danger is over.
The ransom note mentioned a fence named Ghrum, who Manacar knows. I should go to the Alinor Outlaw's Refuge and ask the Orc about the Blackbirds.
Alamar believes his wine bottles were dropped throughout the surrounding wineries. I should search the nearby arbors.
I found the wine bottles. I should talk to Alamar and claim my reward.
I've read the note, and discovered that Nafarion wished to give Felawen a pendant to remember him by. I should retrieve the pendant.
I should talk to <<1>>.
I found <<1>>. I should speak to her about what happened to Nafarion.
I've collected Nafarion's pendant. I should find Felawen and deliver it to her. She'll be in Lillandril.
I found a High Elf corpse. I should read the note next to his body to find out what happened.
Ghrum told us that we could find the Blackbirds in King's Haven Pass. I should chase down the Blackbirds while Manacar sets up an ambush at the far end of the pass.
I found a broken cart in King's Haven Pass. I should search the cart for any clues as to what happened here.
I found a broken cart in King's Haven Pass with a locket nearby it. There are no bodies or signs of survivors. I should meet up with Manacar and see if Tableau and the Blackbirds escaped.

The Saviors intend to use Faidur to revive themselves, condemning him to their sad state. I can't let them use him like that. There is a strange stone at the center of their ritual. I need to destroy it.

Faidur asked me to help him search the manor for anything that might tell us about the history of the place. I am not sure there will be much left untouched by the elements, but I will keep an eye out regardless.

Calawende suggested I search Galidor's ledger to find out what dealings he had with Emile. The ledger is magically warded, but I can make it readable by learning and reciting a passphrase. Perhaps I'll find some clues in Galidor's room.

Oriandra suggested that Leythen could help translate the ancient words, since he was the Psijic Order's language expert before he left to join the Court of Bedlam. I should talk to Leythen in Valsirenn's study.
There is a badly weathered statue in the foyer that appears to be of the head of the household. Faidur will want to hear about this.

Faidur was intrigued by the possibility that his family has ties to nobility, but it only makes the mystery of their disappearance from history all the more strange. Faidur wants to continue searching for clues.
I found a journal belonging to one of Faidur's ancestors. I should show it to him.
I've completed the tasks Kinlady Helenaere asked of me. I should meet with her and Khavid in Sunhold's merchant district.

Faidur believes the journal I found comes from the time of the Thrassian Plague, possibly explaining why the town disappeared. He suggested we continue our search of the remaining upstairs rooms for more clues.
I freed the captive squatters. The one named Henrigg wishes to speak to me.
Now that I have found the Saviors, I could take this opportunity to learn more about them.
Destroying the stone freed Faidur from its influence and appeared to kill the Saviors. I should see if Faidur is all right.
The first adventurer Oriandra asked me to set free is a mage called Cainar. She thinks he can help us rescue the others once he's released from his mind trap.
Cainar wants samples of the spell particles for his research. I need to find some for him before he will agree to leave. They should be nearby.
I have the spell particles Cainar asked for. I should bring them to him.
It appears that Grog resisted the mind trap on his own, but he's still unconscious. I need to find a way to wake him up. I should look around for something that will help in that regard.
I found a bucket of water. That should do the trick. I just need to toss it on Grog to wake him up.
Now I need to find the adventurer named Miriya. She must be somewhere deeper in the ruins.
I found Miriya, but the mind trap that has her in its grip has progressed to an almost inescapable point. Oriandra says that her sense of self is breaking apart. I need to find a way to help her.
Oriandra thinks that the items she's leaving behind might be the key to helping her remember herself. I should see if there are any other items I need to collect as I follow her path.
I collected a number of items that seem to be important to Miriya. I should give them to her and try to convince her to wake up now.
After Oriandra pulled us out of Miriya's mindscape, something happened. I need to return to Oriandra and make sure everything is all right.
K'Tora left a trap that attacked Oriandra's mind. Cainar reestablished the mind link so I can enter the mind trap and rescue her. I need to hurry.
Next I need to search for an Orc warrior called Grog. He should be in the ruins somewhere nearby.
Leythen has reestablished his connection to the rune. I should talk to him.

Nubani revealed that Renzir's a smuggler, and she worries he's addicted to the lifestyle and will never settle down. She asked me to dump Renzir's goods in order to force him to retire, which I agreed to do so. I should dump the goods.
I delivered Roguzog's challenge to Lirendel's second. The duel will commence soon. I should go talk to <<1>> and make sure he's prepared.
Lirendel and his second have finally arrived at the ruins. I should issue the formal challenge to <<1>>.
Lirendel has finally accepted Roguzog's challenge. Time to find out how this duel will pan out.

Ulliceta said there are library pedestals in this ruin which may react to the Eye of Remembrance, revealing the secrets of why this vault was sealed away. I should search for the first library pedestal and defeat any undead in my way.

When I used the Eye of Remembrance near the pedestal, I witnessed a memory of Vanus Galerion and Mannimarco. I can feel the eye drawing me deeper in the ruins. There must be more pedestals to find. I should keep looking.
The Eye of Remembrance draws me deeper in the ruin. The next library pedestal is close. I must find it.

The pull of the Eye is stronger than ever. It feels like it is consciously directing me now, to what may be the memory that finally reveals why this library was sealed. I should see if I can find the fourth library pedestal.
I found Talomar being held at arrowpoint by Conservator Vinelore. I should confront her about what we discovered about the experiments.
Vinafwe suspects a Wood Elf named Eslion is responsible for her problems and requested that I search her defaced arrangements for evidence tying him to the crimes.
I discovered a long abandoned gardening tool that has seen recent use, but I will need more than that to prove Eslion is responsible. I need to search some of Vinafwe's other arrangements.
I found an animal hide bag still containing seeds not native to Summerset. It's a good step toward identifying Eslion as the vandal, but I should search the remaining arrangement as well.
Stranglers erupted from the ground while I was searching one of Vinafwe's plots. They are too dangerous to leave behind. I should kill them off.
A Wood Elf called out to me after I dealt with the stranglers in Vinafwe's arrangement. I should see what he has to say.

I found Eslion, who admits he's been planting foreign plants in Vinafwe's arrangements, but claims the stranglers are an accident. He asked me to help poison them to correct his mistake and provided me with a mixture to pour into local water sources.
I added the poison Eslion concocted to the local water sources, which should end the strangler threat. Now I should inform Vinafwe about what I discovered.
It appears Eslion's apologies fell on deaf ears, as I found him in the custody of the Divine Prosecution at Vinafwe's home. I should talk to him about his predicament.
Eslion believes he's going to be arrested and thrown in jail for his actions and has begged me to speak to the Divine Prosecution on his behalf. I need to decide what to tell them.
Regardless of Eslion's intentions, what he did was illegal and harmful. He has to face the consequences for what he did. I need to tell <<1>> that Eslion is guilty.
Despite his culpability, I decided that Eslion's attempt to fix his mistake deserves leniency. I should ask <<1>> to consider that when rendering his judgment.
Before I decide what to tell the Divine Prosecution about what happened here, I may want to consider Vinafwe's stance on the issue.
I found Lotus cowering in a cage not far from where I fought Vinelore. I should use the ward breaker Elise gave me to free her.
While Valsirenn attempts to reach the Sea Sload, I need to destroy the abyssal pearls before they attract more of those yaghra creatures.
Andewen's note told me to follow her. I should activate the stone in order to do so.
I've activated the stone in order to open the doorway. A mysterious voice spoke to me about the past. I should enter the doorway to seek out Andewen.
Fletch has arrived in the clearing, and has struck Andewen with an arrow. I should listen to what he has to say.
Andewen has been gravely wounded by Fletch. I should speak to her.
I've found Andewen being attacked by a Daedra. I should protect her by defeating the Daedra.
Andewen found a High Elf severely wounded. I should help bandage his wounds while Andewen heals him.
I escaped from the mind trap. I should speak to Oriandra now.
I should speak to Felarian to learn what I must first do to create a ring.
<<1>> is already familiar with my skill in crafting jewelry. I should speak with him to become certified. Once certified, I will be able to fulfill jewelry crafting writs.
Felarian wants me to return with pewter dust. I should search the outskirts of the city for pewter seams to harvest.

Felarian asked me to return with pewter ounces. I can refine pewter dust into pewter ounces at a jewelry crafting station. Alternatively, I could ask a friend for help or purchase some from a guild store.
I should speak to Felarian and let him know I have enough pewter dust.
I should speak with Felarian and let him know I have enough pewter ounces.
I need to craft and deliver a pewter ring to Felarian. I should go to a jewelry crafting station in order to do so.
I should speak with Felarian and let him know I created a ring.
I need to deconstruct the ring I made for Felarian. I can do so at a jewelry crafting station.\n\nFelarian said I could deconstruct something else if I wanted to keep the ring.
Felarian is satisfied with my skill as a jewelry crafter. I should speak with him to become certified. Once certified, I will be able to fulfill jewelry crafting writs.
I found a lab report that confirms dangerous experiments are being conducted on the indriks here. Elise will want to see what I found.
It appears that Glardir has taken refuge in the Academy Stacks. I must pursue her.
The Stacks are in a state of magical chaos. Perhaps the archivist can help shed some light on the situation.

The archivist was clearly affected by the enchantment, but he still managed to give me good advice. I must dispel the Illuminus's hostile illusions by closing the book they sprung from and filing it away in the stacks.
I dispelled the forest illusions. I should delve deeper into the archives and dispel any other illusions I find.
I managed to dispel the Imperial illusions. I should delve deeper into the archives and banish any other illusions I find.
I should look for the source of these hostile illusionsâ€”an enchanted book.
I found the ensorceled book. I should file it away on the correct bookshelf to dispel the illusions.
I found Miranrel's companions. I should return to her and collect my reward.
I should look for Miranrel's companions within the gryphon nesting grounds.
I need to meet the Ritemaster in Ceporah Tower's main gallery and talk to him there.

Now that I have the Psijic Map of Summerset and the Psijic Seals, I need to track down the final itemâ€”the Augur of the Obscure. According to Josajeh, I'll find it somewhere along the coast of Wasten Coraldale.
I discovered the talkative Augur of the Obscure hidden in a chest. I should talk to it.
I should reclaim the Augur. It seems to have an odd and unpredictable personality, but it promised to help me track down these time breaches.
I must go speak with Loremaster Celarus's apprentice, Josajeh, in the Athenaeum. She should be able to direct me to the objects I need to complete my task.

Clavicus Vile placed a key in the upper portion of the ruins. He says the Psijics can use the key to get me to Vile's Oblivion realm, and from there he can grant me access to the Crystal Tower. I should go and find the key.
I acquired the key to Clavicus Vile's realm. Now Valsirenn has appeared to me as a projection. She seems upset. I should talk to her.
I returned Eustasia safely to <<1>>, but she will want to hear about her late husband's fate. I should speak to her.
Kinlady Ilunsare told me that her husband, Durell, chased after their dog, Eustasia, who ran off into the wilderness. They were headed north the last time she saw them.
I found Eustasia and Durell. Unfortunately, Durell has met an untimely end. I should calm Eustasia and retrieve something from the body for Kinlady Ilunsare to identify.
I should talk to Josajeh before I set out.
Josajeh furnished me with a new map, more Psijic Seals, and the Augur of the Obscure. I must set out for the Iliac Bay and seal these time breaches.
I sealed all the time breaches around the Iliac Bay. I should return to Artaeum and inform Josajeh of my success.
I should talk to Josajeh before I set out.

I must explore the lands of Eastmarch, The Rift, and Stonefalls. My map should help narrow the search. Once I arrive at the X, I must use the Augur to find the breach and the Psijic Seals to close it.
I successfully sealed all the time breaches in Eastmarch, The Rift, and Stonefalls. I should return to Loremaster Celarus. Josajeh said he'd like to speak with me.
I must talk to Loremaster Celarus to complete my task.
I've defeated the Hedge Maze Guardian. I should enter the Moon Hunter Bailey in order to make my way further in the keep.
Mylenne Moon-Caller, by order of Vykosa herself, has blocked my path. I should defeat this massive werewolf if I wish to proceed.
The Archivist wishes to stop me from getting to Vykosa. I should defeat him in order to move on.
I should speak to <<1>> in <<2>>.
I've defeated Mylenne Moon-Caller in a harrowing battle. I must make my way within the confines of the keep if I'm to defeat Vykosa.
While Adonatus frees his fellow prisoners, I must keep the guards distracted. I should start making my way through the prison.
The head guard of the prison, Jailer Melitus, blocks my way into the keep. I should defeat him.
The keep's hedge maze lies ahead, a garden covered in all manner of dangerous creatures. I should make my way through the hedge maze in order to proceed into Moon Hunter Keep.
Vykosa awaits me atop the Moon Hunter Overlook. I should make my way to her.
I've finally come upon Vykosa, leader of the Moon Hunter Pack. I should defeat her.
I agreed to make my way through the dangers of Moon Hunter Keep. To be truly Undaunted I must defeat <<1>>,  the <<2>>, <<3>>, <<4>>, and finally <<5>>.
I defeated the werewolf pack of Moon Hunter Keep. I should find <<1>> in my alliance's capital city.
<<1>> presented me with another challenge: read the Scroll of Glorious Battle and slay Vykosa the Ascendant.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
With the spriggan defeated, I can continue the Great Hunt with Hanu. I should explore the Wispwood and see if I can pick up the indrik's trail.
The indrik Tarcyr has killed a group of Nords and now uses their corpse to protect itself. I must defeat these thralls if I'm to hunt down the indrik.
I've finally found the indrik and am ready to conclude the Great Hunt. I must defeat it if I'm to collect its heart.
I should speak to <<1>> in <<2>>.
Now that I've defeated Tarcyr's thralls, it's time to hunt down the creature itself. I should follow the wisp that Hanu's father gave us in order to find the indrik.
Hircine's Great Hunt has begun. I should explore Bloodscent Pass and attempt to find the indrik.
A group of murderous wyrd sisters block my path. I'll need to defeat them if I hope to continue the Great Hunt.
I've become trapped in a hole with a powerful spriggan. I must defeat it if I'm to continue the Great Hunt.
I have defeated Tarcyr and Hanu has collected the creature's heart. I should accompany her to Hircine.
Hircine has refused to give Balorgh a boon, since he did not kill the indrik. Balorgh has sworn to kill the ones who did hunt the indrik, my companions and I. I should defend myself.
I have agreed to fight my way through the March of Sacrifices. To be truly Undaunted I must defeat the Wyrd Sisters, <<1>>, Tarcyr's Thralls, <<2>>, and finally <<3>>.
I've successfully fought my way through Hircine's March of Sacrifices.\n\nI should find <<1>> in my alliance's capital city.
<<1>> presented me with another challenge: destroy the Moon Hunter Pack Banner and kill the enraged Balorgh
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
Pandermalion and I were able to navigate the whirlpool's currents and reach the ruin's interior. Now that we're here I should speak to him about our next objective.
I should travel to Alinor in Summerset and speak to Felande about the inn room located within the Golden Gryphon.
Felande has offered me a free inn room at the Golden Gryphon in Alinor. I should speak to her to learn more about the offer.
I've agreed to become Felande's newest tenant. I should speak to her to finalize the deal.
I should talk to Loremaster Celarus before I set out for Deshaan and Shadowfen.
I must explore the lands of Shadowfen and Deshaan to find and seal these breaches in time.
I sealed the time breaches north of Black Marsh. I should return to Josajeh and share the good news.
I should go speak with Loremaster Celarus. Hopefully he knows the locations of the four remaining staff fragments.
Igeke's treasure map can be used to locate Gjadil's chest. I should look at the map and travel to the marked location.
I found Gjadil's treasure chest. I should return it to Igeke Rat-Bite and collect my reward.

I must travel to the Cloudrest Aerie in order to confront Z'Maja and save the fallen Welkynars. Powerful shadow warriors protect the Sload. With each shadow defeated, Z'Maja will become easier to battle.
I have killed <<1>> and saved <<2>>. I should speak with <<3>> about what comes next.
I have killed <<1>> and saved <<2>>. I should speak with <<3>> about what comes next.
I have killed <<1>> and saved <<2>>. I should speak with <<3>> about what comes next.
I've discovered the remaining chain of Z'Maja's amulet after defeating her. This may be useful to the Welkynars.
I've discovered Z'Maja's amulet after defeating her, though it's severely damaged. This may be useful to the Welkynars.
I should offer the recovered artifact to <<1>>.
I should offer the recovered artifact to <<1>>.
I should offer the recovered artifact to <<1>>.
I should speak to  Vandoril's mother, <<1>>. I'll find her in the city of Cloudrest.
There is a cart that can take me to Cloudrest.
Castire appears to be wrestling with what to do now that the mutiny against her has been quelled. I should speak to Castire about her plans.
Castire has decided to return to her people, leaving Pandermalion with his own. I should talk to him about what will come next for him.
I need to return to my own time to stop Andewen from ever traveling back to the past. I should activate the Southern stone in order to travel back to the present.
I've collected the indrik heart. I should meet Tableau and Manacar at the sinkhole outside of Rellenthil.
Celarus would like me to talk to Josajeh before I set out. I can find her in the Athenaeum.
I must travel to Valenwood and use the Psijic Seals to close the time breaches that appeared there.
I successfully sealed all the time breaches in Grahtwood, Greenshade, and Malabal Tor. I should return to Josajeh to inform her of my success.
I should talk to Josajeh to receive my reward.
I should talk to Josajeh and collect the tools I need to seal these breaches.
I should travel to Rivenspire and seal any time breaches I find there.
I sealed all the time breaches in Rivenspire. I should return to Loremaster Celarus and inform him of my success.
I should speak with Loremaster Celarus so I can collect my reward.
I agreed to help Talomar search for his indrik, Lotus. We should look around the grounds for any sign of her.
I agreed to help Talomar search for his indrik, Lotus. We should look around the grounds for any sign of her.
I came across a dead mammoth that appears to have bashed its own brains out toppling an enclosure wall. I should speak to Talomar about this discovery.
The feed left in Lotus's enclosure is discolored and smells strangely. I should take some to Talomar and see what he thinks.
Talomar and I found signs that the animals might have been exposed to tainted feed, which could explain their aggression. We haven't found any sign of Lotus, however, and should continue our search.
I should talk to Josajeh. She can give me the equipment I need, and she probably has a lot to say about our current situation.
I must explore the land of Craglorn and seal any time breaches I find.
As soon as I sealed the final time breach in Craglorn, Loremaster Celarus appeared. He urged me to return to Artaeum at once. I should hurry back and find out what's happened.
I should talk to Loremaster Celarus to receive my reward.
Elise suggested we might find more useful evidence upstairs.
Pandermalion is waiting at the ruins underneath Sea Keep. I should speak to him about our plan to infiltrate the fortress.
I have volunteered to help Pandermalion, Sea Keep's displaced commander, stop the Sea Mage conjuring the storm. He asked me to join him at the ruins beneath the keep when I'm ready to begin.
Loremaster Celarus indicated I should talk to Josajeh before I set out.
I should travel to the four locations Loremaster Celarus mentioned and find the Staff fragments hidden there.
I collected all four staff fragments. I should return to Artaeum and deliver them to Loremaster Celarus.
I collected all four staff fragments and delivered them to Loremaster Celarus. I should talk to him to receive my reward.
Sotha Sil wants me to speak to him when I'm ready to start the assault on the Crystal Tower.

Pandermalion told me that there are several Magicka Fonts that channel power to the battlements from the Aldmer ruins below. If we seal those fonts, we may cut the Sea Mage off from his main source of power.
We have unbarred the gate to the battlements, leaving nothing standing between us and Urlsar, the Sea Mage. I need to reach the battlements and put a stop to his storm.

Castire confirmed that the Maormer are planning to destroy Sea Keep and that their Sea Mage is on the battlements gathering a storm with the power to do so. Pandermalion seems to have an idea of how we might thwart their plans.
I should equip the weapon so that I'm ready for anything.
This artifact vault is surprisingly free of Nocturnal's shadow creatures. But I also don't see a way to continue our journey to the top of the tower. I need to find an exit.
I should talk to Loremaster Celarus. He might be able to share some more useful information.
I should travel to the four locations Loremaster Celarus mentioned and find the staff fragments hidden there.
I collected all four staff fragments. I should return to Artaeum and deliver them to Loremaster Celarus.
I should talk to Loremaster Celarus to receive my reward.
Henrigg told me Faidur is trapped in the crypts with the Saviors. I need to find him and rescue him before it is too late.
According to Loremaster Celarus, his apprentice probably went to a mine called Divad's Chagrin. I should travel to this mine to look for Josajeh.
I found a gaping time breach that Josajeh likely used as a portal. I should follow her through it to see where (or when) it leads.
I found Josajeh in a bizarre alternative version of the Imperial Throne room! I must stop her ritual before it spins completely out of control.
I turned back the tide of converging time-lines and freed Josajeh from the staff's violent influence. Now that the threat has passed, I should talk to her.
Now that I've settled my business with the Augur, I should return to Loremaster Celarus.
I chose to free the Augur. I should deliver the oddity to Josajeh.
The Augur of the Obscure's fate rests in my hands. I must choose whether to return it to the Psijic Vault, or give it to Josajeh for safekeeping.
I chose to return the Augur to the Psijic Vault. I should make my way there and place the Augur where it belongs.
Josajeh agreed to take the Augur. I should inform the Psijic Relicmaster of my choice.
I should talk to Loremaster Celarus to receive my final reward.
I returned the Augur to the vault. Now, I should catch up with Josajeh before she leaves the island.
Arillas is livid about me killing his Saviors. He's blocked off our escape route. We'll have to go through him to make our escape from the ruins of Corgrad.
Castire seems unsettled by our confrontation with one of her former crew members. I should find out what's bothering her.
We found the body of one of Pandermalion's comrades in one of the gate towers. He seems shaken up by the discovery. I should speak to him.
Josajeh transcribed a map of Summerset that details the approximate locations of the time breaches I need to seal. I should take it.
Josajeh agreed to respect the Psijics' decision for her future. I should return to Artaeum to see how this plays out.

I spoke to the heir to the lands Ruliel's people are squatting on, Faidur, and he denies any knowledge of the disappearances. He claims he only recently arrived to explore his lost family holdings. We agreed to search the ruins together.
I should talk to Loremaster Celarus to receive my final reward.
I informed the Relicmaster that the Augur was leaving. Now, I should catch up with Josajeh before she leaves the island.
Talomar seemed to know the keeper I rescued, Elise. He can probably tell me more about her.
I discovered the talkative Augur of the Obscure hidden in a chest. I should talk to it.
I agreed to work with Alchemy to absorb the spell cast by Rinyde, revealing my identity but protecting the others. I should listen to my cue to start my audition.
I decided to let Rinyde cast her spell and reveal the performers auditioning for the House of Reveries. I should watch the audition.
I decided to let Rinyde cast her spell and reveal the performers auditioning for the House of Reveries. I should wait for Grand Maestro Forte to start the audition.
I should take a look at the map Josajeh transcribed. Familiarizing myself with it might help later.

Faidur and I were able to enter a buried manor through a broken window. The place is in total ruin and there's no sign of the missing people yet. I should confer with Faidur about what we're looking for here.
I should travel to Russafeld and speak with the Elves investigating this murder.
It appears Razum-dar and Oriandra have summoned those who I've helped from across Summerset to vouch for me. I should listen as they make their case.
Now that everyone has vouched for me, I need to speak to the Sapiarch and see if she'll reconsider getting additional help to protect the Crystal Tower.
I managed to convince the Sapiarchs to accept help protecting the Crystal Tower, but Valsirenn still has something to tell me. I should speak to her.
Valsirenn has informed me that the Psijic Order will be leaving Summerset. Now that I've said goodbye, I should go to the throne room and speak to Razum-dar.
This might be the area where I'll find the stone inscribed with the ancient language. I should use the rune so Leythen can assist me.
I should try to find Captain Telomure and learn what happened.
A High Elf told me that a Khajiit named Razum-dar is up ahead and might need some help. I should find him and talk to him.
Celinar told me about a High Elf named Esterdel who was also searching for Brengas and Niralin. He may have more information about the situation. He should be near Archon's Grove.
Oriandra told me that the Ritemaster wants to see me in his study in Ceporah Tower on Artaeum. I should go there and talk to him.
I should return to the Dreaming Cave and talk to the Ritemaster about the memory he recovered.
Curtaros and I heavily damaged a Sea Elf ship. I should use this chance to make my escape from Wasten Coraldale.
Now that the Queen has decreed the island of the High Elves as open for trade and travel, I should go to Summerset. A boat leaves regularly from most major cities.
The Ritemaster has requested my assistance at Ceporah Tower on the island of Artaeum. I should go and see what he wants.
I should go to Ceporah Tower on Artaeum and talk to Valsirenn.
Something terrible happened to the Crystal Tower. I need to get to the gatehouse and see how the Sapiarchs' ritual is coming along.
Valsirenn wishes to ensure the Crystal Tower stays protected now that we've saved it. She's requested I speak to her in the Dreaming Cave to discuss her plans.
Nocturnal's earl is willing to talk. I should follow Leythen's advice and try to get her to reveal her master's plans.
The Augur senses a time breach nearby. I must use its sight to locate the time breach.
I must enter Ceporah Tower to speak with Celarus about everything that happened with Josajeh.
The Augur asked to speak with me privately before I return to Loremaster Celarus. I should take it to the Athenaeum and find out what it wants.
I placed the Augur on a table in Ceporah Tower's Athenaeum so we can speak at length.
I gave the Augur a hearing. Perhaps I will ask it a question or two before we set out.
Valsirenn is attempting to open a portal back to the Dreaming Cave. We have to survive long enough for her to succeed.
We need to find a Meridia cultist. Valsirenn has an idea. I should speak to her.
With Silurie's help, I defeated the Insatiable and saved Lindafwe. We should leave the lair and plan our next move.
Mannimarco's sealed room likely contain horrors I have yet to discover. I should tread carefully as I search.
I should travel to Traitor's Vault to speak with Ulliceta.
When I locate an abyssal geyser, I need to defeat its guardians, destroy the abyssal pearl, and shut down the geyser. I need to destroy at least three geysers to disrupt the Sea Sload threat.
I destroyed an abyssal geyser. I should return to Battlereeve Tanerline and let her know I disrupted the plans of the Sea Sload cabal.
Oriandra has asked that I take the notes on this ancient language to Leythen. Showing them to him might convince Leythen to help us.
Talomar is skeptical, but I convinced him to investigate the Conservatory. He says I might find a key on the body of one of Vinelore's rangers.
Niralin was forcibly turned into a werewolf and requested I end her suffering. I agreed to this last request. I should kill her now.
The Psijic Order has marked the possible location of time breaches in Summerset on the map Josajeh gave me. I should look at the map so I know where to start my journey.
Before heading to the Dreaming Cave, I should speak to my companions around the island. This might be my last chance to speak to them before we assault the Crystal Tower.
An escaping vagrant told me Ruliel and some others are still waiting for the missing to return and told me where I could find their camp. I should speak to Ruliel about the disappearances.
A member of the Psijic Order asked me to speak to Relicmaster Glenadir about some missing relics. I'll find him in the old Psijics College on Artaeum.
Igeke has offered me a map in order to locate Gjadil's treasure map. I should collect it.
I gathered the parts to repair the ballista. I need to bring them back to Darien so he can put the siege engine into working order.
Razum-dar served the Queen's justice and executed the traitor Nedoril. I should speak to him about this.
I should go back to Artaeum and speak to the Ritemaster about what Valsirenn and I found in Rellenthil.
I should review the map of Time Breaches around the Iliac Bay and plan my route.
I should review the map of Time Breaches in Stonefalls, Eastmarch, and The Rift to plan my route.
I should review the map of Time Breaches in Valenwood and plan my route.
I should review the map of Time Breaches in Shadowfen and Deshaan and plan my route.
I should review the map of Time Breaches in Rivenspire and plan my route.
I should review the map of Time Breaches in Craglorn and plan my route.

Sapiarch Imedril succumbed to the spider poison coursing through his body. I have his Resolute Diamond and the Dawnstar Gem. Now I should leave these ruins before Mephala's servants decide to try another attack.
Now that I have helped conquer three keeps for the Pact, I should return to the Conquest mission board.
I need to create the item specified by my contract.
I've finished the task, and now just need to hand it off to receive my pay.
My contact can be found in the city of Elden Root.
My contact can be found in the city of Wayrest.
My contact can be found in the city of Mournhold.

I've placed my delivery of crafted goods into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest and take my reward.

This writ is from the Fighters Guild, seeking help in their fight against the Daedra. I've been tasked with creating an Electrum Ring and an Electrum Necklace to complete my contract.
This writ is from a group defending people displaced by fighting across Nirn. I've been tasked with creating a Silver Ring and a Silver Necklace to complete my contract.

I should join with other warriors to launch an attack.
I have retaken the castles Bloodmayne, Black Boot, and Faregy.  I should return to the Conquest mission board.
I should talk to Concordia Mercius and see if she can help me determine what Margus Derius is trying to accomplish.

This writ is from a group of "independent merchants", trading coin for supplies. I've been tasked with creating two Platinum Necklaces to complete my contract.
This writ is from the Fighters Guild, seeking help in their fight against the Daedra. I've been tasked with creating two Electrum Necklaces to complete my contract.
This writ is from a group defending people displaced by fighting across Nirn. I've been tasked with creating two Silver Necklaces to complete my contract.
I've placed my delivery of crafted goods into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest and take my reward.
I've placed my delivery of crafted goods into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest and take my reward.
I've placed my delivery of crafted goods into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest and take my reward.
This writ is from a trade consortium, merchants passing goods across Nirn. I've been tasked with creating three Pewter Rings to complete my contract.
I've placed my delivery of crafted goods into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest and take my reward.
This writ is from the military, seeking to keep the troops in Cyrodiil outfitted. I've been tasked with creating three Copper Rings to complete my contract.
I've placed my delivery of crafted goods into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest and take my reward.
This writ is from a group of "independent merchants", trading coin for supplies. I've been tasked with creating three Platinum Rings to complete my contract.
This writ is from the Fighters Guild, seeking help in their fight against the Daedra. I've been tasked with creating three Electrum Rings to complete my contract.
This writ is from a group defending people displaced by fighting across Nirn. I've been tasked with creating three Silver Rings complete my contract.
I've placed my delivery of crafted goods into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest and take my reward.
I've placed my delivery of crafted goods into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest and take my reward.
I've placed my delivery of crafted goods into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest and take my reward.
With the wyrd sisters defeated, I can continue my hunt for the indrik. I should move further in Bloodscent Pass.
I've killed the indrik. I should collect its heart for Manacar.
I should speak to <<1>> in <<2>>.
I've defeated Vykosa and saved Moon Hunter Keep from her vicious pack. I should speak to Adonatus Varian in order to receive my reward.
Justiciar Avanaire fled deep into the ruins. I should find her and put a stop to her plan.
I should go to Bok-Xul to retrieve the stolen grave-stakes and kill the necromancer, Baxilt-Gah.
I killed the necromancer of Bok-Xul and returned the stolen grave-stakes. Now I should return to Bolu and claim my reward.
I should go to the Echoing Hollow to gather nightbloom vines for Bolu. While I'm there, I should also kill the Hollow's guardian, <<1>>.
I gathered nightbloom vines and killed <<1>>. I should return to Bolu and claim my reward.
Now that I retrieved the stolen grave-stakes, I should look for places in the swamp where rot gas spews into the air. That's where I need to plant the grave-stakes in order to set things right.
I should go to the Echoing Hollow to gather Argonian antiquities for Bolu. While I'm there, I should also kill the Hollow's guardian, Walks-Like-Thunder.
I gathered Argonian antiquities and killed Walks-Like-Thunder. I should return to Bolu and claim my reward.
I should go to Bok-Xul and burn the corrupted heart-roots of the carnivorous plants. While I'm there, I should also kill the necromancer, Baxilt-Gah.
I killed the necromancer of Bok-Xul and burned the corrupted heart-roots. Now I should return to Bolu and claim my reward.
I need to go to Bok-Xul to kill the necromancer and to recover the bones of the Dead-Water warriors killed in battle against Baxilt-Gah.
I killed the necromancer of Bok-Xul and recovered the bones of the dead Naga-Kur warriors. Now I should return to Bolu and claim my reward.
I should go to the Echoing Hollow and enter the ruins there so I can find and burn the Blackguards' supply caches. While I'm there, I should also kill the Hollow's guardian, Walks-Like-Thunder.
I burned the Blackguards' supply caches and killed Walks-Like-Thunder. I should return to Bolu and claim my reward.

<<1>> asked me to go to the nearby Outlaws Refuge to talk to a black marketeer, an information broker, and a smuggler to see what I can learn about an unscrupulous competitor of Cyrodilic Collections named Margus Derius.

I need to talk to a smuggler, a black marketeer, and an information broker that deals in stolen antiquities in the Outlaws Refuge to learn more about Cyrodilic Collections' competition, Margus Derius.
<<1>> asked me to go to the Sunless Hollow to try to recover the Argonian antiquities that Margus Derius and the Blackguards have acquired.
The leaflet said to meet <<1>> in Vulkhel Guard, Davon's Watch, or Daggerfall.
Xode, one of the escaped captives, has begged me to enter the Teeth of Sithis and rescue any surviving captives I find.
Xode believes Shuxaltsei's blood rite will hold terrible consequences for the world if it is completed. He asked me to destroy her sacrificial altars before confronting her myself.
With the sacrificial altars destroyed, Shuxaltsei's ritual has been foiled, but the high priestess still poses a terrible threat. Xode asked me to put an end to her tyranny, once and for all.
I destroyed Shuxaltsei, putting an end to the blood sacrifices for good. Xode will want to know that the worst of the threat is beyond him.
Now that I'm inside the Sunless Hollow, I need to find any Argonian antiquities that Margus and the Blackguards have hidden here.
I helped Dradeiva learn the truth about the fate of the Lost Legion and the role her ancestor played in that event. I should ask her if we accomplished enough to clear her family's name.

I should help Dradeiva explore Tsofeer Cavern and look for evidence that the Lost Legion or her egg-relative who served as their scout passed through these caves. I should also keep an eye out for signs of the Wuju-Ka.

Dradeiva believes that the dagger we found can be used to perform a ritual that will bind the voriplasm to the caverns and keep it from spreading throughout Murkmire. We just need to locate the sacred altar.
We found the ritual dagger and the sacred altar. Now I should talk to Dradeiva and find out what we should do next.
Dradeiva thinks that if I slay the large voriplasm in the next cave, that will weaken the source of the Wuju-Ka and make it more susceptible to the rite of binding.
I killed the Wuju-Ka. Now I need to meet Dradeiva at the sacred brazier and help her complete the rite of binding that will trap the Wuju-Ka in these caverns.
I should return to Concordia Mercius and show her these Argonian antiquities I recovered from the Sunless Hollow.

Concordia thinks that there's something significant about the two antiquities I recovered in the Sunless Hollow. She wants me to return to the nearby Outlaws Refuge and consult with one of the experts who helped us earlier.

Urzashi thinks that Margus Derius is on the trail of something that the antiquities he's been collecting are leading him to. With nothing else to go on, she suggested that the Blackguard who killed Eshundir might have left some clues.
Jee-Lar arrived. I should let him know what I found out.
Jee-Lar arranged for our transportation to Shadowfen. Now to locate the Chid-Moska Ruins and get inside.
The Blackguards are searching for something inside the Chid-Moska Ruins. I need to find out what they're up to and put a stop to it.
The Blackguards have uncovered an Argonian nightmare idol. I need to retrieve the idol and take it back to Concordia Mercius.
Find Wolfsbane
Find Belladonna Berries
I should talk to Xukas and see what the Bright-Throat tribe knows about the Remnant of Argon.
I should listen to Shuvu as he asks the Hist about the Remnant.
It seems that the Hist spoke directly to Xukas. I should talk to him and find out if he heard anything interesting about the Remnant of Argon.
Famia called out to me from nearby. I should go talk to her.
Kassandra believes I may learn more about the Remnant of Argon from the Dead-Water tribe. I should go to the Dead-Water Village and see if Jaxsik-Orrn can help me.
I found Jaxsik-Orrn in Dead-Water Village. I should talk to her about the Blackguards' plans to use her tribe's relics to find the Remnant of Argon.
Jaxsik-Orrn plans to hunt down Blackguards in the Dead-Water's tribal hunting grounds. She wants me to join her. Hopefully, we'll learn more about the Blackguards' plan in the process.
I found Jaxsik-Orrn in the hunting grounds outside Dead-Water Village. I should talk to her.
Jaxsik-Orrn wants me to help her recover grave-stakes stolen by the Blackguards. Additionally, she wants me to destroy several devices keeping the bog-blights from attacking the Blackguards.
Now that the fumers are destroyed and the grave-stakes are recovered, Jaxsik-Orrn wants to explore the Blackguards' central camp. I should meet her there.
I found Jaxsik-Orrn standing over two bodies. I should talk to her and see if she learned anything from them.

According to Jaxsik-Orrn, we might be able learn more about the Remnant of Argon from carvings on the grave-stake of a legendary Naga, Etra of the Many Spears. I need to kill Etra to claim his grave-stake.
I killed Etra of the Many Spears. I should take his grave-stake.
I should take Etra's grave-stake to Jaxsik-Orrn. Hopefully she can help me translate it. I can probably find her in the grave-singer's lodge in Dead-Water Village.
Famia has solved the riddle and believes we should travel to Swallowed Grove. Now that the clues have been pieced together, I should talk to Kassandra about what happens next.
Something terrible has occurred in the Outlaws Refuge! I should see if <<1>> can tell me what happened.
Famia is working with Xukas and Jaxsik-Orrn to determine the meaning of the riddles. I should tell her everything I learned so far.
I need to find <<1>> down by the water and see if he can direct me to local Argonians who may have knowledge of the Golden Skull of Beela-Kaar.
<<1>> asked me to interview the Argonians on the list he provided while he talks to a few others. We need to see if the Blackguards approached them so we can figure out what Margus plans to do next.

I spoke to all of the Argonians on my list and found out that Margus is looking for a place called Norg-Tzel to perform a ritual that will reveal the location of the cursed skull. I should  return to <<1>> and compare notes.

Jee-Lar learned that three Blackguards carry pieces of a map that, once combined, show the location of where their expedition ship is moored. I need to recover two of the map pieces while Jee-Lar goes after the third.
I should return to Concordia's camp outside Stormhold and see if she can make sense of these map pieces I found.
Concordia assembled a map from the pieces that Jee-Lar and I recovered. It should help me locate the Blackguard expedition ship that's somewhere in the southern region of Shadowfen.
I located the Blackguards' expedition ship. Now I need to find Jee-Lar and discuss our next move with him.
I need to sneak aboard the Blackguards' ship and convince the pilot to take us to the forbidden island, Norg-Tzel.
I need to explore the island and find Margus Derius. I should also look around and see if I can determine what the Blackguards are up to.
Jee-Lar thinks that Margus Derius has entered the xanmeer to perform the ritual that will unleash the power of the cursed skull. I should enter the xanmeer and find him.
I can hear Margus Derius. He's definitely started the ritual. I need to reach him.
I entered the ritual chamber. Now I need to put an end to Margus's ritual.
Now that I stopped Margus Derius and retrieved the Golden Skull of Beela-Kaar, I should return to the boat and leave this forbidden island.
I should give the Golden Skull of Beela-Kaar to Concordia and Cyrodilic Collections for safekeeping.
I have killed <<1>> and saved <<2>>. I should speak with <<3>> about what comes next.
I should travel to Summerset to begin my search for the time breaches.
Kassandra's bodyguard, Whiptail, told me that his employer wishes to speak to me. I should visit her office in the Cyrodilic Collections headquarters and hear what she has to say.
Jaxsik-Orrn said it would be up to Famia and me to retrieve the Remnant. I should speak with her.
We arrived back in Root-Whisper Village with the Remnant. I should talk to Famia about our next steps.
It's time to perform the ritual to free the spirits from the Remnant of Argon. I should take the Remnant to the tree. Jaxsik-Orrn is waiting for me there.

Jaxsik-Orrn told me that the Blackguards are escorting Kassandra through the Deepmire on her way to the Remnant. If we want to protect the relic from Kassandra, we need to pursue her through this forbidding swamp.
My companions and I entered a vast ruin called Xul-Thuxisâ€”the Snake-Means-Death City. I should look for clues that might lead me to Kassandra.
Kassandra makes her way to the Remnant while her bodyguard, Whiptail, has Famia. We should continue to pursue Kassandra while watching for an opportunity to rescue Famia.
I killed the vile Whiptail and rescued Famia. I should follow her out of this place.
We discovered a beautiful valley and the ruins of an old Argonian settlement, with a leafless Hist at the center. Jaxsik-Orrn rushed forward to see it. I should talk to her about what comes next.
I should talk to the expedition's leader, Famia Mercius, at the docks in Lilmoth.
According to Famia, the other members of her expedition are already assembling near Lilmoth's western gate. I should go there and meet my fellow explorers.
A member of Famia's team flagged me down as I approached the gate. I should talk to her and see what she has to say.

The Khajiit called Zadaza has been on a number of expeditions with Famia and implied this journey may be very dangerous. I can ask her more about Famia, Murkmire, and prior expeditions, or tell her I'm ready for the expedition to begin.
Famia arrived at the gathering area. I should speak with her before we start our expedition.

Before we set out for the xanmeer, Famia needs to meet up with some of her associates out in the swamp. Apparently, they hold vakka stones that can help us enter the xanmeer. I should accompany her and make sure she doesn't come to harm.
Famia and I arrived at the hut, but Xukas has not arrived yet. I should take a look around to see if I can find any sign of Famia's associates, Eshraf and Dinia, while we wait.
After searching the hut, a colorful Argonian named Xukas approached. I should speak to him.
Famia indicated that she'd like to hang back and talk to Xukas about her missing explorers. I should make my way to the xanmeer. Famia should meet me there soon.
Famia used the vakka stones we collected to open the door to the xanmeer. Now we can enter the ancient Argonian temple to seek out the Kajin-Jat Crystal and other treasures.
We entered the Ixtaxh Xanmeer. The temple almost certainly bristles with traps. We should be cautious.
Famia and I inadvertently triggered a trap that dumped us into a hidden vault beneath the entrance chamber. We should take stock and come up with a plan for escape.
The trap scattered our party throughout the xanmeer. I should explore the temple with Famia and look for the other explorers. But first I need to pick the lock before we can leave this room.
Famia and I managed to escape the collapsed chamber. Now we can begin our search for the other members of our party.

I discovered an ancient drawbridge. Unfortunately, there is no obvious way to lower it. In order to progress, I need to decipher the clues embedded in the bridge mechanism. Once I solve the puzzle, the bridge should lower.
I solved the puzzle and lowered the drawbridge. I should resume my search for the missing explorers.

I found Kirstaleth, but she's in serious dangerâ€”stranded on a small ledge overlooking a yawning chasm. Famia suggested gathering a sturdy plant called flint vine. We can use the vine to make a ladder.
I gathered a bundle of flint vine growing in the xanmeer. I should return to Famia and wind the vines into a ladder so we can rescue Kirstaleth.
I should keep watch while Kirstaleth climbs to safety.
Varo Hosidias, the party's warrior, is still missing. Kirstaleth said she heard shouting from deeper in the xanmeer. Famia and I should go investigate.
We found Varo, but he appears too injured to move. Giant spiders approach from every side. I should leap to the Imperial's defense.
The giant spiders are preparing to devour Varo. I need to drive back the waves of these beasts until they give up or I kill them all.
We finally reunited with Zadaza. She said the Kajin-Jat Crystal is nearby, and urged me to follow her.
We found a large room with strange masonry. Zadaza urged me to drop down into this peculiar pit and open the door to the next room.
Dropping into the pit triggered a series of flame traps. Luckily, Zadaza was able to disable the traps and open the door. I should enter the treasure vault to see what's inside.
Famia arrived ahead of us, having found another secret door that bypassed the furnace. I should follow her into the treasure vault. The Kajin-Jat Crystal is finally within reach.
Famia took the Kajin-Jat Crystal from its resting place and triggered a bizarre ooze trap. I need to kill this abomination before it devours my companions.
The xanmeer is filling with poison gas! My companions and I must escape before we succumb to the noxious fumes.
Xukas led the expedition to a safe room, but it could fill with gas at any moment. We must escape the xanmeer quickly!
We escaped from the xanmeer. I should speak to Xukas about his reasons for aiding us.
I should speak to Famia outside the xanmeer about my payment and what happened during our expedition.
Famia implied that she wants to hire me for another job. She asked me to meet her back in Lilmoth to discuss the opportunity.
Famia complimented me for my work in the xanmeer and implied she wants to hire me for another job. I should talk to her.

Concordia assembled a map from the pieces that Jee-Lar and I recovered. With the map and the information I received from the Argonian slaves, I should be able to find the Blackguard expedition ship along the river near Deep Graves.
As such, Varo Hosidias has requested that I retrieve stone tablets from a temple known as the Teeth of Sithis.
I recovered ancient tablets from the Teeth of Sithis. I should bring it to Varo Hosidias back in Lilmoth.
Varo Hosidias mentioned a local, named Solni, with knowledge of the Teeth of Sithis. I should speak to her before I head there.
I recovered the items from the Tsofeer Cavern. Now I should return to Varo Hosidias and claim my payment.
I should go to Tsofeer Cavern and locate the items that Varo wants for Tia Doran. In addition, I can talk to Tia at the Mages Guild if I have any questions.
Now that we reached the island, we need to look around and find Margus and the Blackguards.

Tharayya sent her crew for the gem and they informed me that she also needs an equilibrium sphere for the repairs she is working on. The skeevaton seemed to respond to this and took off. I should see where it leads me.

The skeevaton lead me to a Dwarven construct that could have an equilibrium sphere. Unfortunately, it is still operational and appears to function as some sort of protector of this place. I will need to disable it before I can claim the part.
With the help of the skeevaton, we were able to locate suitable parts for Tharayya's repairs. We should return to her.
I defeated the Stonekeeper construct and disabled the remaining traps. Nothing stands between the Wrathstone and us now. I should speak to <<1>> about what we have found.

Tharayya needs one more part before she can attempt to use the construct to open the vault door. Her skeevaton took off down a corridor, presumably in search of the shock conveyors she's asked for. I should follow it.
Tharaya warned me that the ice caverns ahead are dangerous and asked me to lead the way to the Dwemer vault.
The Goblins have an ice troll guarding the entrance to the Dwemer ruins. I will need to deal with it before Tharayya's crew can safely pass.
The construct's Soul Gem was plundered by a Goblin warchief who doesn't seem inclined to return it. I will have to defeat him to reclaim the gem.
Tharayya is working to install the parts we recovered and enact her plan to open the vault. I should wait for her to finish.

I eliminated the Dwarven Sentries, but there is still a lightning field barring us from reaching the Wrathstone. Tharayya has a plan to shut it down and has asked that I help guide her skeevatons as they work in the guts of the Dwarven vault.
To complete my pledge, I must thwart the defenses of the Vault of Mhuvnak and claim the Wrathstone.
I succeeded in reaching the heart of Frostvault, overcoming everything that stood in my way.\n\nI should find <<1>> in my alliance's capital city.
<<1>> presented me with another challenge: use the Veracity Verifier when fighting the Stonekeeper.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
Tharayya and I have found the buried Ayleid city of Garlas Malatar. We should explore the ruins in search of another path to the surface.

I entered a room containing a magical dark orb. The guardian that caused the cave in earlier has sealed me in with the orb and Daedric warriors are emerging from it. Tharayya believes destroying the orb will set me free.
The guardian who has been hounding us since Tharayya took the artifact revealed himself to be an Ayleid king blessed by Meridia herself. I must defeat him to escape with the artifact.
I destroyed the guardian of Garlas Malatar and found a path out of the Ayleid ruins. I should speak to <<1>> outside <<2>>.

Destroying the dark orb stopped the Daedra and opened the way forward. The path forward leads us through the <<1>>, so I should expect more servants of Meridia will attempt to take the artifact from us as we pass through.
Tharayya believes the Imperials who built the fort above Garlas Malatar found the artifact before calamity befell them. We should search the ruins of the fort for it.
The fort's large storeroom has become the lair of a monstrous Daedra that seems to be feasting on anything and everything. I must kill the Scavenging Maw to continue my search.

An unnatural permafrost blocks our passage. Its source is an Ayleid woman lamenting the sacrifice of her people. She's determined not to let us take the artifact. I must kill the Weeping Woman if we are to escape.
I received a note from Tharayya informing me of another expedition on the Gold Coast. I should meet her at the ruins of Garlas Malatar.
I defeated the Ayleid ruler who was guarding Garlas Malatar. Tharayya thinks she feels a breeze passing through the ruins that should lead us to the surface. I should follow it.

It appears that killing the Ayleid guardian's mortal form didn't bring an end to his life. King Narilmor has become the avatar of Meridia's power and will stop at nothing to reclaim the artifact. I will have to defeat him to escape.
I need to complete the Depths of Malatar.
I defeated my foes in the Depths of Malatar.\n\nI should find <<1>> in my alliance's capital city.
<<1>> presented me with another challenge: burn the Dictates of the Lady of Light when fighting the Symphony of Blades.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
I should go to Tsofeer Cavern and gather pieces of Imperial armor from the First Era for Varo to give to Tia Doran. In addition, I can talk to Tia at the Mages Guild if I have any questions.
I recovered the armor from the Tsofeer Cavern. Now I should return to Varo Hosidias and claim my payment.
Beel-Ranu suggested that I start by talking to Kishi's egg-sire, Bhoki. His home is inside Dead-Water Village, on the western side of the Hist.
Raj-Kaal Seelan made Kishi the new war-teacher. I should congratulate Kishi on his new position in the Dead-Water tribe.
Bhoki doesn't appear to be at home. I should look around and see if I can discover a clue as to where I might find him.

I should use this verse to find Bhoki: "Stand before the blue flame at the top of the stair, then turn to gaze upon our Hist so fair, walk straight into its beguiling trance, and find what you seek beneath its protective branch."
I followed the clues in the verse and found Bhoki sitting beneath the hollow of the Hist. I should talk to him.
I found and freed a couple of survivors, but they are the only survivors I found.  I should meet Xode at the top of the western xanmeer as planned.
Kishi was taken to the ruins at the north end of the village to die. I need to find him and rescue him before a wild animal devours him.
It sounds like Famia's friend, Xukas, is approaching. I should see what he wants.
I should track down the reagents Mindileth needs to create her anti-venom: gloom morel, barbleberries, and the venom of Scuttle Pit spiders.
I gave Mindileth the contents of my stomach to create the anti-venom. I should talk to Jee-Lar about payment for the services I provided.
I rescued Kishi. I should talk to him and tell him what his egg-sire wants him to do now.
I gathered the various reagents for Mindileth's anti-venom. I should deliver the items to her.
My guts are on fire! I need to make my way to the nearby cauldron and throw up into it.

I should return to Concordia and share the information I received from contacts in the Outlaws Refuge with her. Namely, Margus Derius is working with the Blackguards and has hidden a number of Argonian relics in a place called the Sunless Hollow.

Kishi plans to continue to oppose Mewah-Jez, the tribe's war-teacher. He claims that her teaching methods have led to the deaths of at least six seasons of the tribe's novices. I should return to Bhoki and talk to him.

We found a sealed vault door that Tharayya believes she can bypass with the help of a giant Dwemer construct we discovered. She deployed a skeevaton to help me locate its missing Soul Gem. I should follow it.
Mindileth insisted that I drink the noxious slurry she created. Bottoms up?
I should post handbills and dance in costume outside the Salted Wings in Vulkhel Guard, the Flaming Nix in Mournhold, and the Screaming Mermaid in Stros M'Kai
I completed my final dance. I should return to Jee-Lar to claim my payment.
Tamira Dobar gave me the bug repellent candles. I should deliver them to Jee-Lar.
I should gather superior dreugh wax and ash basil leaves. I can find both in Stonefalls.
I gathered the materials for making the bug repellent candles. I should bring them to Tamira Dobar in Davon's Watch.
Tamira wanted to test the effectiveness of the candle and unleashed a swarm of bugs on me! I should light the candle and make sure it works as intended.

I decided that Haxara and her child should remain with the Bright-Throats. They need the care of a peaceful tribe to recover from the trauma they experienced. I should say my goodbyes to Tree-Minder Pavu, she will want to thank me for my help.
There seems to be some sort of commotion in town. I should speak to Tree-Minder Pavu and see what's going on.
The herbs I found in the egg-tenders' quarters are suspicious, but not enough to form any conclusions about. Iskenaaz suggested we head to the uxith, the nest, to check on the eggs.

I found more of the dragonthorn plants among an empty nest. The egg-tenders claim that the eggs were unwell and returned to the Hist. Both seemed agitated at the idea that something is wrong with the clutch. I should speak to Iskenaaz about this.
Tsadeesi, one of the Bright-Throats, asked me to give word to Tree-Minder Pavu that she will arrive soon with needed supplies. I should head to Bright-Throat Village and speak with the tree-minder.

The egg-tenders are acting oddly, but my only real lead is some suspicious dragonthorn plants found at the uxith and the egg-tenders' quarters. Iskenaaz says the tribe cultivates it at a dry glade nearby. We should head there to see what we can find.
Another sick Argonian, like the one brought to Bright-Throat Village, stumbled into the glade and died as Iskenaaz and I were talking. I should examine it.
Iskenaaz believes that the creatures are being sent by the Veeskhleel to poison his tribe and Hist. He suggests we try to follow the creature's trail back to its origin and root out the Veeskhleel.
Iskenaaz and I were able to follow the shed scales back to a swampy, foul-smelling cavern. We should head inside and see what lurks within.

Haxara is inconsolable. She claims that the creatures are her children. That seems unlikely, but the room reeks of alchemical odors. We should look around for clues about what the Veeskhleel are doing in here.

We found the body of an Argonian in the drying hut at the glade. He possessed a note instructing him to kill Haxara. I also found her journal. This is proof she's been helping steal eggs. I should show Iskenaaz what I found.

Iskenaaz left to warn his tribe about what we discovered in this cavern, but Haxara insists on staying while I deal with the Veeskhleel and their creations. She said we may be able to follow the poison fumes given off by her children to locate them.
Haxara is hanging on by a thread, but she insists that she has to see this through. We need to find Ree-Nakal and the last experiment she's hatching to end this once and for all.
Ree-Nakal is dead along with almost all her experiments. Haxara has found one remaining child that appears to be healthy and docile. I should speak to her about this discovery.
Haxara begged me not to kill the last of her children and I see no reason to do so. She wants to take the girl back to the Bright-Throat Village. I should head back there as well.
The arrival of Haxara and her strange child has stirred up a commotion for the tree-minder. She's called for quiet and invited me to speak with her.

Tree-Minder Pavu will defer to my judgment concerning what should be done about Haxara and her child. Iskenaaz and Haxara seem to have more to say on the matter. I could hear them out, or give Pavu my decision based on what I already know.
Famia believes the riddle points to a cavern upriver, known as the Swallowed Grove. I should make my way there.
Jaxsik-Orrn and Xukas suggested we split up to cover more ground. Famia and I should search the cavern for any sign of the Remnant of Argon.
Kassandra has offered the use of her boat in travelling to the caves.
I should make my way through the rest of the Swallowed Grove. Our destination should be just within reach.
The party reconvened outside an ancient Argonian ritual chamber, inside the Swallowed Grove. I should enter the chamber and see how it relates to the Remnant of Argon.
Xukas and Jaxsik entered the Dreaming Nest and began performing a dream-wallow ceremony based on the riddle we uncovered. I should watch and see what happens.
My mind is reeling! A tangle of roots parted to reveal an ancient mural. I should see what I can learn from it.

In touching the mural, my consciousness was transported to a distant, dreamy marsh. And my body has taken on the aspect of an unfamiliar Argonian. I should explore the marsh. Perhaps I'll find some sign of the Remnant here.
Kloxu and the rest of the Argonian hunting party tasked me with killing Fat Gixthi, a wamasu they drew out of hiding. I should defeat the beast to continue the vision.
One of the members of Kloxu's hunting party has gone missing. Perhaps in finding him, I'll learn more about why I'm here.
I encountered a party of Ayleid soldiers in my vision before being sent back to the Dreaming Nest. A new mural appearedâ€”one depicting an Argonian village. I should investigate it.

The dream-wallow sent me to the scarred ruins of an Argonian villageâ€”once again, in the form of Mateem. An Argonian war-chief named Raj-Kaal Druxith wishes to speak to me. I should see what he has to say.
The Argonian war-chief, Raj-Kaal Druxith, tasked me with gathering four members of the sap-speaker's "sacred clutch." I should find these four Argonians, and send them to the center of town.
I found the four Argonians. I should return to the center of the village to see if Raj-Kaal Druxith needs anything else.
My vision of the besieged village ended and I returned to the Dreaming Nest. Soon after, a new mural has appeared, showing the image of a Hist Tree. I should investigate it.
The dream-wallow took me to a strange cavern. I should investigate this mysterious passage.
I found a sap-speaker and other surviving members of the tribe in the caverns beneath a Hist Tree. Ayleid soldiers will attack any minute. I should listen to Sap-Speaker Kuzei.
The tribal elders, led by Sap-Speaker Kuzei, are creating the Remnant of Argon. I must protect the sap-speaker from the Ayleid forces until she completes the ritual.
Sap-Speaker Kuzei has offered me her staff, claiming that it is the key to finding the Remnant of Argon. I should take the staff.
After emerging from the vision, Kassandra quickly betrayed the party and stole the staff in order to claim the Remnant of Argon for herself. I should speak to Xukas about what to do next.
I gathered both the meat and the salt that Jee-Lar requested. I should deliver these items to him so I can collect my reward.
I must stalk the hills and forests of The Rift to find mammoth meat for Jee-Lar.
I gathered the meat Jee-Lar requested. I should meet with the salt-maker, Hervod, to acquire some curing salt.
Hervod invited me to drink with him. I can either grease his palm for the salt so I can be on my way, or accept his hospitality and stay for a drink.
I caught up to Hervod's level of inebriation. I should talk to him.
An Argonian called me by an unfamiliar nameâ€”Mateem. He urged me to meet a hunting party. I should find the hunters' encampment.
Priestess Hodyette is currently at her camp in the mountains of Eastmarch. I should go there and implore her to help the expedition.
I found Priestess Hodyette's camp. I should talk to her and see if she will agree to help the expedition.
Priestess Hodyette requested that I scream into the wind in order to commune with Kyne, absorbing her energy within a rune. In order to do this I must find several scenic vistas around Eastmarch.
I successfully communed with Kyne and absorbed her energy within the rune. I should return to Priestess Hodyette's camp and talk to her.
Priestess Hodyette has agreed to give a weather prediction to Cyrodilic Collections. I should return to Jee-Lar and tell him the good news.
Jee-Lar told me that a trapper named Arlowe Viducia has copper-tongued skinks on hand. I should seek him out in the Redguard city of Sentinel.
The copper-tongued skink escaped! Arlowe insists that venom sacs from the assassin beetles and giant scorpions of Alik'r will lure the lizard back out of hiding. I should acquire three of these sacs.
I acquired the venom sacs. I should place them at the location Arlowe marked on the map.
I lured the toxin-sniffing skink out with the venom sac. Now I just need to catch it.
I caught the copper-tongued skink. I should deliver it to Jee-Lar.
