I agreed to drink with Hervod. I should grab his spare mug and help myself to his mead.
I placed the sacred candles in the cave as requested. Now I should return to Varo Hosidias and claim my payment
I should go to the cavern and place the sacred Argonian candles beside the remains of any Imperials I find. If I have any questions, I can talk to Tia Doran at the Mages Guild.
The bug repellent candle seems to work. I should talk to Tamira Dobar.
Nesh-Deeka asked me to talk to a few people around town who have dealt with Captain Jimila in the past. He wants to learn enough about the Captain to make a good impression.
I spoke to a few of the people in Lilmoth who have worked with Captain Jimila in the past. Now I should talk to Nesh-Deeka and let him know what I found out.
Nesh-Deeka suggested I start by gathering the moss-foot croakers from the marsh east of Lilmoth. If I need additional information, I can refer to the written instructions he provided me with.
Next I need to find a ruby hopper. They like to sun themselves on stones near water around Lilmoth.
To catch the next frog on the list, the indigo tree frog, I need to locate a grove of trees where they have congregated.
I found a grove of trees housing the indigo tree frogs. Now I need to gather fleshflies to use as a lure to get the frogs out of the trees.
I gathered fleshflies. Now I need to release the flies beneath the trees to lure the tree frogs down so I can capture a few of them.
The indigo tree frogs have descended from the trees to feast on the flies. I should grab a few of them before they hop away.

To attract the elusive sun-blessed toad, I need to gather ingredients to make an odoriferous musk that will trick them into emerging from their mud pit. I need to find the following plants: stench sedge, salt rush, and joymallow.
I gathered the ingredients. Now I need to mix them together to create the pungent toad musk.
I created enough toad musk to attract the sun-blessed toads. Now I need to locate a toad mud pit and see if it contains any of the yellow toads.
According to Nesh-Deeka's instructions, I need to pour the musk onto myself to attract the attention of the sun-blessed toads.
Now that I'm drenched in the musk, I need to turn the crank of the croak-wheel to simulate the sound of a frisky toad. Between the smell and the sound, it should attract a sun-blessed toad.
The combination of sound and smell lured a sun-blessed toad out of the mud pit. I need to catch it for the vossa-satl.
I gathered all of the frogs Nesh-Deeka asked for. I should return to Lilmoth and talk to him.
I gave the frogs I gathered to Nesh-Deeka. Now I should follow him into his shop and see how the vossa-satl works.
I should stay out of the way while Nesh-Deeka tunes the vossa-satl.
I need to find Captain Jimila at the Lilmoth tavern, give her the vossa-satl, and then attempt to convince her to agree to a deal to export them for Nesh-Deeka.
Captain Jimila agreed to take five of the vossa-satls and see how they sell. I should inform Nesh-Deeka that he has a deal.
I successfully protected Sap-Speaker Kuzei, allowing her to finish creating the Remnant of Argon. I should speak to her to learn more about what I just witnessed.
Kassandra has requested a meeting with me. I should travel to her office in Lilmoth and see what she wishes to discuss.
Balorgh has killed Hanu and stolen the indrik heart in order to win Hircine's boon. I should hunt him down and prevent this from happening.
Nesh-Deeka seems happy with the way the instrument sounds. He wants me to take it so I can present it to Captain Jimila.
We caught up to Kassandra, and my companions set off in pursuit. Unfortunately, Famia is still in danger. I need to find her and save her from the gruesome fate that Whiptail has planned.

Famia and Kassandra were relieved to hear that Xukas and I are making progress toward finding the missing explorers. I should meet up with Xukas outside Bright-Throat Village so we can continue our investigation.
Famia wants to speak to me. I should visit her office in Lilmoth as soon as I can.
Xukas arranged a meeting with a Dead-Water representative just outside Bright-Throat Village. I should head to the meeting place.
Jaxsik-Orrn, a Dead-Water warrior, arrived to meet us. I should attempt to negotiate with her.
Our meeting with Jaxsik-Orrn was very brief. She told us the Dead-Water tribe would hunt the Blackguards alone, and urged us to leave. Maybe Xukas can provide some insight. I should talk to him.
Xukas believes Jaxsik-Orrn is stalking one of the Blackguards. We should track her to find out what she's planning.
Xukas believes Jaxsik-Orrn is stalking one of the Blackguards. We should track her to find out what she's planning.
Xukas believes Jaxsik-Orrn is stalking one of the Blackguards. We should track her to find out what she's planning.
We found Jaxsik-Orrn observing a Blackguard caravan. I should talk to her to learn her intentions.
Blackguard mercenaries abducted Dead-Water Nagas as well as Famia's explorers. I should help Jaxsik-Orrn burn the Blackguard's wagons, destroy their supply crates, and free all the prisoners.
I finished demolishing the Blackguard caravan and freeing the captives. I should rejoin Jaxsik-Orrn and Xukas.
Jaxsik-Orrn captured a Blackguard who was trying to escape. Xukas seems to be holding her at bay. I should speak to Jaxsik-Orrn to see if she learned anything.
Jaxsik-Orrn wants to execute the Blackguard captive. However, the woman surrendered voluntarily and presents no threat. I should see what Xukas thinks about the situation.
Xukas believes it would be better to release the woman, Hostia, so she can warn the Blackguards not to attack the Dead-Water tribe again. I should interrogate Hostia and find out what she knows.

The Blackguards are abducting and interrogating explorers and local Nagasâ€”looking for information on something called the Remnant of Argon. Now that I know the truth, I can encourage Jaxsik-Orrn to execute Hostia or let Xukas free her.
I allowed Xukas to release Hostia, against Jaxsik-Orrn's wishes. Perhaps Xukas can tell me more about this Remnant of Argon.
Xukas and Jaxsik-Orrn agree on one thing: the Remnant of Argon must not fall into the wrong hands. I should return to Famia and tell her what I learned.
Famia was pleased that I rescued her explorers, and urged me to speak to her benefactor, Kassandra. I should see what kind of offer Kassandra has for me.
Kassandra wants to both reward me for the help I've given Cyrodilic Collections so far, and offer me another job to perform. I should collect my payment and learn what she wants of me.
Kassandra wants to both reward me for the help I've given Cyrodilic Collections so far, and offer me another job to perform. I should collect my payment and learn what she wants me to do next.
The ritual consumed Margus Derius, but I still have to stop it. Jar-Lee suggests that I need to disengage each cylinder to deactivate the flow of energy.
Now I need to disengage the second ritual cylinder.
Now I need to disengage the third ritual cylinder.
Now I need to disengage the fourth ritual cylinder and that should end the flow of energy and stop the ritual.
Disengaging the ritual cylinders unlocked a door at the back of the chamber and revealed the hiding place of the cursed skull. I need to defeat the final guardian before I can claim the relic.
I allowed Jaxsik-Orrn to execute Hostia, against Xukas's wishes. Perhaps Jaxsik-Orrn can tell me more about this Remnant of Argon.
I need to go into the swamp and use the fire stones on the tamed vine-tongues. Bhoki says that the plants will lead me to Kishi's hidden camp.
I located Kishi's hidden camp. Now I should talk to him and let him know that Bhoki has been taken prisoner by Mewah-Jez.
I need to enter the Vakka-Bok Xanmeer with Famia and try to catch up to Kassandra before it's too late.
I found a massive Ayleid gate. According to Famia, we need a power source to activate it. I should search the cavern for a suitable welkynd stone.
I found a welkynd stone. I should take it back to the Ayleid gate and place it in the sconce nearby. With any luck, the gate will activate.
The welkynd stone allowed us to open the massive Ayleid gate. We should see what awaits us on the other side.

Kassandra used the Kajin-Jat Crystal to escape through a mysterious Ayleid gateway that draws its power from the Argonian vakka stones. The gate deactivated as soon as she left. I should discuss our options with Famia.
While Famia watches over the gate, I need to go find a vakka stone that can activate the Ayleid gate.

I found an intact vakka stone hidden in a maze of Ayleid laboratories. I should take it back to Famia. Hopefully it will activate the Ayleid gate and allow us to pass through to the next leg of our journey.
The vakka stone activated the mysterious Ayleid gate. I must pass through it to continue pursuing Kassandra.
I caught sight of Kassandra, who seems intent on stopping Famia and I from going any farther. I need to make my way to the Remnant, even if it means going through her.
Kassandra fled deeper into the cavernâ€”perhaps to the final Remnant chamber. I need to follow her.
Kassandra touched the Remnant of Argonâ€”resulting in an explosion of vines, and the emergence of a miregaunt with her inside. I must defeat Kassandra, and the creature she occupies.
I was forced to kill Kassandra, but Famia managed to retrieve the Remnant of Argon without any ill effects. We should take the relic back to the surface.

Kishi wants to mentor me and help me walk the Path of the Lily to prove that Bhoki's techniques are superior to Mewah-Jez's approach. To do this, we need to obtain permission from the tribe's war-chief, Raj-Kaal Seelan.
Raj-Kaal Seelan has agreed to let me walk the Path of the Lily. I should meet Kishi at the entrance so we can begin the rite of passage.
Before we enter the Path of the Lily, I need to speak to Kishi and see what I'll need to know before we begin.

The first challenge of the Path of the Lily is to get past the quicksand and ignite the first signal totem. Kishi suggests I utilize his bow and arrows to make use of the tamed vine-tongues along the way.
I recovered the Argonian nightmare idol that the Blackguards found in the Chid-Moska Ruins. I need to go to Stormhold and find Concordia's camp so I can tell her all about what we discovered.
There's Concordia's camp. I should go and talk to her and show her this idol I found in the ruins.
Kishi and I need to talk to Raj-Kaal Seelan and convince him to allow me to take the Dead-Water rite of passage and walk the Path of the Lily.
I volunteered to brave the dangers of the temple and recover some of the ritual objects being kept there, before they are plundered.
Varo Hosidias mentioned a local, named Solni, with knowledge of the Teeth of Sithis. I should speak to her before I head there.
I recovered several ritual objects from the temple. I should deliver them to Varo Hosidias and collect my pay.

I decided that Haxara and her child don't belong among the Bright-Throats. They have been exiled and will have to make a new life for themselves elsewhere. I should say my goodbyes to Tree-Minder Pavu, she will want to thank me for my help.
I agreed to search the xanmeers and gather whatever specimens I could find.
I collected some old remains from the Teeth of Sithis. I should bring them to Varo Hosidias and collect my pay.
Varo Hosidias mentioned a local, named Solni, with knowledge of the Teeth of Sithis. I should speak to her before I head there.
The Hedge Maze Guardian blocks my way. I should defeat it if I wish to proceed further into Moon Hunter Keep.
Famia asked me to find Xukas. I should talk to him and urge him to join Famia beneath the Hist.
I delivered the message to Xukas and Jaxsik-Orrn. Now I should return to Famia beneath the Hist tree.
Famia urged us to touch the Remnant of Argon. She believes that this will allow us to help the Argonian spirits trapped inside it.
My companions and I touched the Remnant of Argon and found ourselves magically transported inside it. I should take a look around with Xukas and Jaxsik-Orrn.
A spirit that resembles the Sap-Speaker I saw in my dream-wallow vision wants to speak to me. I should see what she has to say.
The spirits need a guide to leave the Remnant of Argon safely. The Sap-Speaker claims Xukas and Jaxsik-Orrn are both suited for this task. Now I need to help them decide which one will stay behind.
I chose to let Xukas stay behind to guide the spirits safely back to the Hist. Now Jaxsik-Orrn and I need to leave the Remnant.
I chose to let Jaxsik-Orrn stay behind to guide the spirits safely back to the Hist. Now Xukas and I need to leave the Remnant.
I woke up back in the village. Famia is here. I should talk to her about what happened.
I woke up back in the village. Famia is here. I should talk to her about what happened.
It's time to perform the ritual to free the spirits from the Remnant of Argon. I should take the Remnant to the tree. Xukas is waiting for me there.
I followed Kishi to a safe location. Now I should talk to him so he can advise me about the next challenge along the Path.
I should use everything I learned to overcome the Path of the Lily's final guardian, Deroh-Zah.
I defeated the guardian of the sacred lily. Now I should take the flower and complete the rite of passage.
I gathered the sacred lily and completed the rite of passage. Now I should return to the war-chief and present the flower to him.
Raj-Kaal Seelan decided to make Kishi the new war-teacher and return to the methods used by Bhoki for training the novice warriors. I should go and tell Kishi the news.
Now that I'm back in Shadowfen, I should return to Concordia's camp outside Stormhold. I need to tell her what happened at Norg-Tzel.
I need to find Jaxsik-Orrn and urge her to join Xukas and Famia beneath the Hist tree. She should be meeting with members of her tribe somewhere in the village.
Haxara tried to reason with the tortured creatures, but they responded only by attacking us. I was forced to kill them. I should check on Haxara. That couldn't have been easy for her.

I found a page from a journal written by an officer of the Imperial Ninth Legion. It mentions Dradeiva's ancestor and suggests that something happened to the Legion in this cavern. I should search for more clues as to the fate of the Lost Legion.
I should talk to Kassandra about the clues I found regarding the Remnant of Argon. I can probably find both her and Famia in the Cyrodilic Collections headquarters.
Famia complimented me for my work in the xanmeer and implied she wants to hire me for another job. I should talk to her.
Famia complimented me for my work in the xanmeer and implied she wants to hire me for another job. I should talk to her.
Famia complimented me for my work in the xanmeer and implied she wants to hire me for another job. I should talk to her.
I cleared the way into the Dwemer ruins and Tharayya's crew has arrived safely. I should follow them inside and see what awaits us within.
We were able to collect the parts Tharayya requested. We should deliver them to her and check on her progress with the repairs.
I need to survive the challenge of the Derelict Prison Yard.
I should enter the next arena, the Mess Hall of Misery.
I need to survive this challenge, the Mess Hall of Misery.
I should enter the next arena, the Vampire's Pen.
I need to survive this challenge, the Vampire's Pen.
I should speak to <<1>>.
I'll find my first foes in the Derelict Prison Yard. I should head there.
I should enter the next arena, the Hall of Beasts.
I need to survive this challenge, the Hall of Beasts.
I should enter the next arena, Drakeeh's Cage.
I need to survive this challenge, Drakeeh's Cage.
I killed the miregaunt. I should collect the calendar tablet within its stomach.
I've successfully slotted the tablet into the calendar. I should tell Jekka-Wass Vozei.
I have the calendar tablet. I should slot it back into the calendar.
I need to find the ruby hopper I frightened off. Nesh-Deeka's note suggests I can find it hiding by the big tree at the center of Lilmoth.
Jekka-Wass Vozei was able to solve the first riddle, describing a miregaunt which lurks near Blackrose Prison. I should kill the hist guardian and take the calendar tablet.
I found Jaxsik-Orrn in the Deepmire, surrounded by Blackguard corpses. I should speak with her.
Jaxsik-Orrn already pursues Kassandra into the perilous Deepmire. I might be able to catch up to her if I hurry.
Tharayya's plan to blast open the vault using the Dwemer construct was a success, but Dwarven sentries stand ready to repel any attempt to claim the Wrathstone. I must destroy them.
I found the sacrificial chamber where Whiptail is holding Famia. In order to free her, I'll have to deal with Whiptail.
I should talk to Nesh-Deeka and ask him if he knows where I can find Captain Jimila.
I should ask Nisswo Paraxeeh how to prepare for the ritual. I'll find him in the Bright-Throat Village.
The ritual has been completed. I should speak to Jekka-Wass Vozei about my reward.
I've successfully slotted the tablet into the calendar. I should tell Jekka-Wass Vozei.
Now that we completed the rite of binding, I should head outside and talk to Dradeiva.
Famia and I found Xukas and Jaxsik-Orrn in the next hall, but Jaxsik-Orrn seems disoriented. I should talk to Xukas about what happened.
Jaxsik-Orrn insists a dreaming Hist is near. She wants us to find it. I should head outside.
I read the note, and believe that it was written by an Argonian named <<1>>. I should search the abandoned pack as well.
I found <<1>>. I should speak to him about a reward.
I found <<1>>. I should speak to him about the frog totem and romantic poem.
I gathered the frog totem and romantic poem. I should find <<1>> and return their lost items. According to the poem, I'm likely to find them in Lilmoth.
I should read the note in order to find out more about the owner of this lost pack.
Overseer Shiralas gave me a whistle and told me to use it to summon their pet, Drooler. She said if I pet Drooler and tell him he's a good boy, he'll lead me to Varona.
Drooler led me right to Varona. I should speak to her and see what happened.
Drooler appeared as soon as I blew the whistle. I should pet Drooler and tell him he's a good boy so he will lead me to Varona.
Drooler wants me to follow him. Maybe he'll lead me to Varona.

Pavu says the Hist tells her that the tribe's latest clutch of eggs is in peril, but the egg-tenders have not spoken of any troubles. She has asked me to discreetly look into matters with the help of her assistant, Iskenaaz.
Eavesdrop on Whiptail
The misshapen creature was missing most of its scales. They come off at the slightest touch. It likely lost a lot of them trekking through the swamp. I should see what Iskenaaz thinks of all this.

The skeevaton lead me to a scrap pile the Goblins have accumulated. Unfortunately, their shaman and his ice atronach are busy picking through the loot. I'll need to deal with them before we can search for the shock conveyors.

I need to gather mud from where swamp meets sea, a flower that grows from a grave, and wood from a tree that has crumbled stone. Nisswo Paraxeeh has marked the locations of these three items on my map.

In a twist of fate, Sulahkeesh decided that neither party was worthy of the saltrice farm. When their hands touched, the combined oils created an explosion and both were killed. I should speak to Sulahkeesh about what I just witnessed.
My first step is to talk to Sulahkeesh, a former Shadowscale. I'll find her in the Lilmoth inn.
Sulahkeesh asked me to investigate the claims of Nurhei and Paheiza to see if they have merit. I should also feel free to search for secrets they might be keeping.
I spoke to both parties, and heard the basic details of the dispute. I should investigate Keema-Ru's saltrice farm for further details.
I gathered new information about this case, including incriminating letters between Paheiza and Nurhei. I should present Sulahkeesh with this information.
Sulahkeesh has decided that both parties must meet to negotiate. However, I must first gather Bog Willow Bark and a Perfumed Snapper in order to make two distinct oils.
I collected both oils. Now I need to give them to Nurhei and Paheiza so they can rub the oils on their scales. I should also let them know where to go to negotiate.
Both parties have agreed to meet. I should attend the negotiation and see how everything plays out.
In order to reach Kishi's hidden camp, I need to grab a bag of fire stones to help me travel to his location.
I have returned the ingredients. I should help Jekka-Wass Vozei with the ritual.
I have the ingredients. I should return to the Xinchei-Konu and give the items to Jekka-Wass Vozei.
We found Haxara with more of the deceased aberrations. She seems distraught. I should speak to her and try to make sense of what's going on here.
The box was last seen being carried away by a hackwing. Hands-That-Heal believes it can be found in a nearby nest.
I've buried the branch beneath the Bright-Throat's Hist Tree. I should speak to Hands-That-Heal about my reward.

Though I couldn't find the wooden box within the hackwing's nest, I did find several signs of a hunting party. Perhaps Hands-That-Heal will know more about this hunting party and where I could find them.
I should check <<1>>'s storehouse for any secrets.
<<1>> mentioned her sister had a grave-stake within Lilmoth. I should check it just to see if anything is unusual.
Dajaleen told me to seek out Milzus in Bright-Throat Village. She discovered a recent victim and may know something that will help me track down the killer.

Guhcin was able to tell me that the Skin Taker is a woman, pale, and a descendant of Man. He regrets that he was not able to pursue or track her, but gave me the location of the encounter in the hope that I have better luck.
I reached the location where Guhcin encountered the Skin Taker. It looks like the killer left some things behind in their haste. I should look around for clues that could lead me to her.
While examining evidence where Guhcin encountered the Skin Taker, I heard someone cry out in pain nearby. With a killer about I should find the source of the cry as quickly as I can.
I found a dying Blackguard caught in an Argonian trap. Guhcin said the Skin Taker was dressed as a Blackguard. I should question him before he succumbs to his injuries.

The Skin Taker is Hostia Asellus, the Blackguard slaver I spared when Jaxsik wanted to kill her. That incident seems to have escalated Hostia's grudge against Argonians to new heights. I have to stop her before she can kill again.

The Skin Taker is Julitta Asellus, daughter of the Blackguard slaver I let Jaxsik execute for abducting Dead-Water tribe members. These killings are her vengeance on the Murkmire tribes. I have to stop her before she can kill again.
I found Hostia in her hideout near the Dead-Water tribe's village. She made it clear she will not surrender without a fight.
I found Julitta in her hideout near the Dead-Water tribe's village. She made it clear she will not surrender without a fight.
Hostia left me no choice but to kill her to put an end to the Skin Taker murders. It looks like she kept a journal that might shed some light on her horrific actions.
The Skin Taker is dead and the evidence of her motives is in hand. I should return to Dead-Water Village and see if Dejaleen arrived safely.

Dajaleen regrets that my act of mercy allowed for this tragedy to unfold, but she's hopeful that these events have brought the Bright-Throats and Dead-Water tribes closer together. My work here is finished. I should say goodbye to Dajaleen.
I spoke to Xukas and Jaxsik-Orrn. Now it's up to me to choose who will guide the souls back to the Hist. Either Xukas or Jaxsik-Orrn must stay behind to save the souls of this ancient tribe.
I've found the Root-House tribe's campsite. I should speak to one of their members and find out if they've seen Hands-That-Heal's wooden box.
Tem-Tei has the wooden box, but won't part with it for free. If I'm to be given the box, I must enter the Blackguard's campsite and steal back her hunting bow.
Now that I've collected the hunting bow, I should talk to Tem-Tei about the wooden box.
Tem-Tei has agreed to give me the branch within the wooden box. I should collect it so it can be returned to Hands-That-Heal.
Hands-That-Heal has identified the hunting party as being part of the Root-House people. I should seek their campsite and see if they found the wooden box.
I've found Hands-That-Heal in the Bright-Throat Village. I should give him the branch.
Hands-That-Heal has requested that I bury the branch beneath the Bright-Throat Village Hist Tree. He believes this may help him one day be reunited with his village's people.
Now that I found the branch, I should meet up with Hands-that-Heal and return it to him. He should be in Bright-Throat Village by now.
I'll need to collect several pieces of Argonian ruins for the monument. I can find these ruins in the Teeth of Sithis, Tsofeer Cavern, and the Tomb of Many Spears.
I've helped create and then destroy a monument to Sithis. I should speak to Nisswo Uaxal about my reward.
I could ask for more information.
I've collected the ruin pieces needed to create the monument. I should return to Nisswo Uaxal.
Nisswo Uaxal has urged me to destroy the monument that he has just created. I should do so.
Nisswo Uaxal needs a hammer to complete his monument. I can find one in the nearby storage shed.
We ignited the first signal totem. I should talk to Kishi and learn about the next challenge.
The next part of the Path requires me to get past poisonous plants. I can use Kishi's arrow to direct him to help me overcome the plants. During this challenge, I have to ignite two signal totems.
I completed the second challenge of the Path of the Lily. I should follow Kishi to a safe location so we can talk.
I've collected the hammer. I should return to Nisswo Uaxal.

Milzus didn't have much new information to offer, but she told me that another Argonian, a Dead-Water hunter named Sulosya, found one of the other victims. She suggested he may be more helpful, and said I could find him at Alten Meerhleel.

I learned a bit more about the Skin Taker's methods from Sulosya, but he also provided another lead. One of his Dead-Water tribesmen encountered the Skin Taker and chased the killer off. I should speak to Guhcin at the Dead-Water Village.
The thief left a book of riddles at the scene of the crime, describing the location of every tablet. I should collect the book to help my search.
I should take the grave-stake.
I should find the grave-singer mentioned in the note. It sounds like she's somewhere near Bright-Throat Village.
Grave-Singer Xaleez asked me to place the grave-stake in a glade north of Bright-Throat Village. I should head there now and plant the grave-stake.
I placed the grave-stake in the glade, causing a small tree to appear. I should let Grave-Singer Xaleez know that I completed my task.
<<1>> asked me to capture four swamp jellies of assorted colors with a net she provided. She suggested I should be able to locate the vocal ones by sound.
I captured four swamp jellies of different colors as requested. I should deliver them to <<1>>.
Lady Laurent asked me to find the hand-mirror that her manservant lost in the nearby swamp.
I found Lady Laurent's hand-mirror. Now she wants me to help Stibbons extract himself from the mud.
I helped Stibbons extract himself from the mud. Now I should talk to Lady Laurent and see if there's anything else I can do to help.
Now that I have the renewal charm, I should meet Lady Laurent in the Renewal Lodge north of the Bright-Throat Village.
Lady Laurent asked me to convince <<1>> to allow her to observe the ritual of renewal.
Stibbons entered the lodge to take part in the ritual of renewal. I should wait with Lady Laurent until he returns.
I should check with Lady Laurent and see if she knows how to restore Stibbons to his non-egg self.
I should focus on the prayer-stone Chime-Maker Shuvu gave me and witness this rite of the chimes.
I've collected the aloe. I should travel back to Tuwul in Root-Whisper Village in order to collect my reward.
I should head into Vakka-Bok Xanmeer and collect the aloe.
I could ask for more information.
I've collected the mushrooms. I should travel back to Tuwul in Root-Whisper Village in order to collect my reward.
I should head to the Blight Bog Sump in order to collect the mushrooms.
I could ask for more information.
Jaxsik-Orrn reluctantly agreed to work with meâ€”just long enough to deal with the Blackguards. I can ask her more questions about what we're up against, or begin my assault on the caravan.
Lady Laurent asked me to accompany Stibbons to the Swallowed Grove to confront Many-Whispers and try to acquire a renewal charm.
Many-Whispers agreed to trade a renewal charm if I bring him a key. I can find the key on the body of his associate somewhere in the Swallowed Grove.
I recovered the key. Now I should return to Many-Whispers and trade it for the renewal charm that Lady Laurent has been looking for.
Lady Laurent volunteered Stibbons to take part in the ritual. I need to help him prepare by aligning his blood, bile, and mind in the prescribed fashion.
Now that Stibbons has finished the preparations for the ritual, I should return to the Renewal Lodge and meet him and Lady Laurent there.
I found two of the missing envoys, and collected a ring from a third envoy who was already dead. I should return to Tuwul and collect my reward.
I should search the Blackguard Caravan and see if I can find the lost envoys.
I could ask for more information.
I should search Xul-Thuxis for the missing offerings.
I could ask for more information.
I found the missing offerings. Now I should speak to Tuwul and claim my reward.
I could ask for more information.
I should travel the swamps of Murkmire and find hackwings to hunt in order to collect their hides.
I could ask for more information.
I've collected the needed hackwing hides. I should travel back to the Root-Whisper Village and collect my reward.
I could ask for more information.
I could ask for more information.
The Skin Taker is dead and the evidence of her motives is in hand. I should return to Dead-Water Village and tell Guhcin of my success.

Guhcin regrets that Jaxsik's act of retribution allowed for this tragedy to unfold, but he believes they might avoid repeating it by learning tolerance from the Bright-Throats. My work here is finished. I should say goodbye to Guhcin.
Julitta left me no choice but to kill her to put an end to the Skin Taker murders. It looks like she kept her mother's journal close at hand. It might shed some light on her horrific actions.
Xukas appears to have found something interesting. I should speak to him.
I found Jaxsik-Orrn. I should talk to her.
Xukas and Jaxsik-Orrn used the reagents they found to create a potent mind-altering smoke. I must breathe it in to begin the dream-wallow.
Kloxu and a number of other Argonians are gathered around a campfire. I should listen to what they have to say. Perhaps I'll learn why I was sent here.
I didn't find anything unusual in the egg-tenders' quarters other than a hidden parcel of a common herb. I should show it to Iskenaaz and see what he thinks.
I convinced all the visiting suitors to rejoin the bonding ritual. I should speak to Bond-Guru Topeth and give him the good news.
I announced the beginning of the ceremony and the bonding ritual is underway at last.
The bonding ritual has concluded and the festivities are underway as the newly bonded prepare for their night ahead. I should give my best to Bond-Guru Topeth before moving on.
Beehuna begrudgingly agreed to join the bonding ritual now that her people's custom has been met. That leaves only the Moss-Skin suitor lacking in attendance. I should speak with them.
I located Deed-Tei's lost seed doll in a haj mota den. I should retrieve it before something else decides to run off with it.
Now that I have the seed-doll, I should bring it to Deed-Tei and convince him to join the bonding ritual.
Now that the Black-Tongues are prepared for the bonding ritual, I should look into what's keeping the Root-House suitor from joining in the ritual.
I have Beehuna's dowry in hand. I should bring it to her and see if she'll agree to participate in the bonding ritual now.
I agreed to help Bond-Guru Topeth with whatever is holding up the suitors long overdue for the bonding ritual. He suggests starting with a visit to the Black-Tongue suitor in the nearby pavilion.

Waku-Mat agreed to serve as replacement suitor if we can create another batch of the Black-Tongue's blessed elixir. He's asked me to find a rare plant called Leviathan Pizzle and provided a sketch to help me identify it. Now I just need to find one.
Now that I recovered the Leviathan Pizzle, I should bring it to Waku-Mat and convince him to take part in the bonding ritual.

Waku-Mat agreed to serve as replacement suitor if we can create another batch of the Black-Tongue's blessed elixir. He's asked me to find a rare plant called Leviathan Pizzle and provided a sketch to help me identify it. I should take the sketch.

Beehuna refuses to join in the bonding ritual until the dowry she claimed is returned to her. She says that the guards took it and gave it to the Bright-Throat store-keeper to hide from her. I should speak to the store-keeper about retrieving it.
Naheesh Oleen's reminder contained a riddle pointing to another hiding spot. I should try to find it.
I solved another of Naheesh Oleen's clues. Unsurprisingly, all I discovered was another note with another hint. I will have to continue my search.
I solved three of Naheesh Olean's riddles, but it's unclear if I'm any closer to retrieving the dowry. I should puzzle out the forth riddle and see where it takes me.

It seems Naheesh Oleen did not expect Beehuna to get this far in her search. He left a note behind for his assistant Cheesh-Nassa, pointing to a crate in the storehouse with a false bottom. I should head there and retrieve the dowry.

A storehouse attendant named Cheesh-Nassa informed me that the store-keeper is away dealing with a personal matter. If I hope to find Beehuna's dowry, I'll have to follow the trail of clues the store-keeper left behind to antagonize her.

The Moss-Skin suitor, Deed-Tei, has declined to participate from the ceremony because he has lost a precious gift made for him by his betrothed. He said a haj mota snatched it out of his hands by the guloo bridge. I should start my search there.
Bond-Guru Topeth was so grateful for my help with the suitors that he's invited me to begin the ceremony. I should signal when I'm ready for the rite to begin.
Xukas suggested I go to the Glade of Chimes and speak with Shuvu, chime-maker of the Bright-Throats.
Xukas believes Chime-Maker Shuvu may know something about the Remnant of Argon. I should speak with him.
Chime-Maker Shuvu can ask the Hist about the Remnant of Argon, but needs a special chime to do so. I can find it in a vault north of the village.
I should find the Remnant Chime and take it back to Bright-Throat Village.
I should return to Bright-Throat Village and ask Shuvu what to do with the Remnant Chime.
Shuvu instructed me to hang the Remnant Chime on one of the Listening-Tree's branches.

Famia informed me that Xukas has been looking for information on the people who went missing from Cyrodilic Collections. He may know something. I should be able to find him at Alten Meerhleel, outside Lilmoth.

Xukas believes that a thuggish mercantile organization called the Dragonstar Caravan Company might have some information on the missing explorers. He needs me to distract one of the company's couriersâ€”an Orc named Lozwugâ€”so he can pickpocket him.
I should make small talk with Lozwug, long enough for Xukas to sneak up behind him and pickpocket the correspondence he carries.
Xukas snatched a piece of correspondence from Lozwug's purse. I should speak to Xukas to find out what he stole and how it will help us find Famia's missing explorers.

According to Xukas, the correspondence he stole from Lozwug contains copious notes on Famiaâ€”information vital to someone planning to kidnap her. Xukas thinks we can find more information in the Dragonstar Caravan Company depot in Lilmoth.
I retrieved a number of interesting items from the Dragonstar Caravan Company depot. I should show them to Xukas and see what he thinks.

I learned that the Blackguards have been kidnapping Famia's friends. Xukas believes that the Dead-Water tribe might know more about the disappearances. He urged me to inform Famia while he sets up a meeting with his Dead-Water friend, Jaxsik-Orrn.
Famia urged me to talk to her primary benefactor, Kassandra. I should introduce myself.
Don't Kill Anyone at the Depot
I told Xukas what happened when I infiltrated the Dragonstar Caravan Company depot. Hopefully the clues I retrieved will help us determine the whereabouts of the missing explorers.
Xukas finally returned from his journey to Lilmoth and the tribal villages. I should speak to him about what comes next.
I learned a clue about the Remnant of Argon. "Smoke of stars to see what once was seen, sunless sap to hear what once was heard." I should tell Kassandra, who is currently in Alten Meerhleel.
Famia urged me to meet Kassandra at some ruins west of Alten Meerhleel. I should go find her.
I found Kassandra and her bodyguard, Whiptail, standing over a body. I should find out what happened.
Kassandra asked me to find clues that her dead contact, Heetzasi, might have dug up regarding the Remnant. I should search the camp.
I found some clues about the Remnant of Argon. I should talk to Kassandra about them.
I should search for the missing kaals.
I stumbled upon a group of Ayleids trying to escape the village. I should cut them down.
I rescued one of the missing kaalsâ€”Kaal Droran. I should urge her to return to the center of the village.
I should talk to Famia to learn our next move.

I found evidence that Ree-Nakal, the Veeskhleel leader, has been experimenting on stolen eggs to try and give them life, resulting in the creatures we've encountered so far. I should let Iskenaaz and Haxara know the ugly truth.
Stibbons transformed into an egg after attending the renewal ritual. I should talk to Lady Laurent and see if she knows what happened.

Famia indicated that her fellow explorers might have returned to a hut they often use as a meeting spot. She also plans to meet a friendly Argonian there named Xukas. I should accompany her to this hut to ensure she doesn't come to harm.
It says I should seek out Bolu in Lilmoth. I should travel there and speak to him.
Bolu told me that he has many Death-Hunts to offer from the Naga-Kur. I should let him know that I'm interested in joining one.
With the Scavenging Maw slain I should be able to continue my exploration of Fort Mistwatch.

Tharayya found the artifact she was searching for in some sort of Imperial shrine beneath the fort. Claiming the artifact alerted some sort of guardian that caused a cave in, trapping us. I should search for a way out.
Leaping down into the caverns below appeared to be our only option. Tharayya insists there must be another exit from Garlas Malatar.
Examine the Crumbled Wall
Zadaza urged me to talk to Xukas about our next move in pursuing Kassandra. I should track him down, outside the Swallowed Grove.
Zadaza asked me to find Famia and discuss our next move in pursuing Kassandra. Famia should be somewhere in the deep swamp.
Zadaza suggested I locate Famia and make sure she's all right. She thinks she may be in the deep swamp.
Xukas appears to have found something interesting. I should follow him.
According to Xukas, Jaxsik-Orrn likely found something interesting. I should seek her out.

Our attempts to overload the Dwarven defenses only managed to activate another countermeasure. A massive construct has emerged to stop our attempts at claiming the Wrathstone. Destroying it is our only option.
Gharesh-ri put Khamira in charge of the defense of Riverhold. I should find her and see what I can do to help.
Khamira sent me to the Greenleaf Farm to convince the farmers to get inside the town before Euraxia's forces arrive. Zamarak asked to tag along to help me.

Khamira wants me to cause mayhem and destruction at the Euraxian supply camps by scaring off their horses and setting fire to their carts. The confusion should also allow Nala-do's soldiers to steal some supplies for the militia.
Captain Nala-do asked me to head to the road south of Riverhold to help Cadwell set traps of his own design. I wonder if these traps will really hinder the approaching Euraxian army?
Cadwell asked me to help him arm the traps he set along the road. I should arm them before the Euraxians arrives. Carefully.
After I armed the traps, Cadwell acted strangely. Well, more strange than usual. It seems like he had another one of his dream-visions. I should talk to him about it.
Abnur Tharn has a plan for how to deal with Euraxia. I should talk to him and find out what it entails.
The council meeting has ended and Khamira wants to talk to me. I should let her know what we found in the Dragonguard sanctuary.
After we found a number of intriguing clues among Euraxia's papers, Abnur Tharn appears to have uncovered something significant. I should talk to him.
Euraxia's final order appears to concern an assassination squad and troops stationed at Sandswirl Manor to the west of the city. I should meet Abnur Tharn on the outskirts of the property.
Tsazii won't abandon their farm while her husband Kinaro and her brother Hursh are still out in the fields. She suggested we might find them hiding in the hills to the west.

We found Tsazii's husband and brother. Unfortunately, Euraxian soldiers killed her brother. Zamarak wants to stay behind to perform last rites. Now I need to return to the farmhouse and convince Tsazii to take her remaining family into town.
Khamira arrived after I finished with the farmers. I should talk to her and see what she wants.
The Battle for Riverhold has begun. I should meet up with my allies and find out what I can to aid the Khajiit defending the town.
Gharesh-ri wants me to find Captain Nala-do and warn her about the necromancer Zumog Phoom before his undead can bolster the Euraxian forces.
The Desert Wind adept, Zamarak, has an idea on how we can disrupt Zumog Phoom's necromantic spell and return the dead to rest. He wants me to meet him at the temple in Riverhold.
Zamarak needs to enter a peaceful, meditative state to memorize the ancient prayer that will activate the Moon Pillars around the town. I need to protect him from the attacking undead.
We need to find the blessed Pillar of the Spring Moon. Then I need to protect Zamarak while he conducts the ancient prayer to activate it.
We need to find the blessed Pillar of the Summer Moon. Then I must protect Zamarak while he conducts the ancient prayer to activate it.
We need to find the blessed Pillar of the Winter Moon. Then I must protect Zamarak while he conducts the ancient prayer to activate it.
The blessed Moon Pillars sanctified the town and took care of the undead problem, but now Dragons have arrived! I should observe what happens and wait for orders.

Kaalgrontiid, Mulaamnir, and a third Dragon flew over the town. The two elder Dragons flew off, but the third Dragon has attacked. I should use the ballista to knock it to the ground so we can kill it.
The ballista worked and the Dragon has been grounded! Now to attack it and kill it before it can once more take to the air.
I should talk to Abnur Tharn before we enter the grounds of the manor.
I need to find a way into the manor house and meet up with Abnur Tharn so we can learn more about Euraxia's final order regarding the Dragonguard.
The courier marked the location where Abnur Tharn is waiting to meet with me on my map. I should head there now.
I agreed to help Tharn acquire this mysterious weapon. I should see what he needs me to do to accomplish that.
The first of the moon-singer storytellers is Azargo Long-Tale. I can find him at the Redfur Trading Post in Grahtwood.
Abnur Tharn arrived just as the moon-singer finished his story. I should talk to him and see if he can make sense of what we heard.

Abnur Tharn believes that the moon-singer's story points to an Ayleid ruin in Grahtwood known as Wormroot Depths. I should enter the ruin and look for the clue the ancient Khajiiti left for us to find.
A puzzle of light and prisms guards the triangulant that will help us decipher the map to the weapon. We need to solve the puzzle to gain the information.
I solved the puzzle and revealed a chest. The triangulant we need should be inside. I should open the chest and take it.
The second of the moon-singer storytellers is Mizbina. I can find her at the Baandari Trading Post in Malabal Tor.
The moon-singer finished her story. I should talk to Abnur Tharn and see if he can make sense of what we heard.

Abnur Tharn believes that the moon-singer's story points to an Ayleid structure in Malabal Tor known as Black Vine Ruins. I should enter the ruin and look for the clue the ancient Khajiiti left for us to find.
Another puzzle of light and prisms guards the triangulant that will help us decipher the map to the weapon. We need to solve the puzzle to gain the information.
I solved the puzzle and revealed a chest. The triangulant we need should be inside. I should open the chest and take it.
Tharn says our final clue will be found by listening to a storyteller in Rawl'kha, in Reaper's March. I should travel there now.
The moon-singer finished her story. I should talk to Abnur Tharn and see if he can make sense of what we heard.
Abnur Tharn believes that the moon-singer's story points to Jode's Light, a ruin here in Reaper's March. I should enter the ruin and look for the clue the ancient Khajiiti left for us to find.
On the way to Jode's Light, a Khajiit stopped me. I should talk to her and see what she wants.
Now that we're inside Jode's Light, I should talk to Abnur Tharn and tell him what Khamira told me about Euraxia Tharn, the Speaker of the Mane, and the ancient weapon.

Regardless of whether I agree with Khamira or not, we need to find the ancient weapon before Euraxia Tharn does. To do that, we need to search Jode's Light and locate the final triangulant that will unlock the map.
Another puzzle of light and prisms guards the final triangulant that will help us decipher the map to the weapon. We need to solve the puzzle to gain the information.
I solved the puzzle and revealed a chest. The triangulant we need should be inside. I should open the chest and take it.
Abnur Tharn opened a portal to his camp north of Cormount in Grahtwood. I should follow Tharn to his camp and see if the triangulants have helped him determine how to decipher the map.
Khamira somehow tracked us to Tharn's camp. I should listen to what she has to say to Abnur Tharn.
Khamira has decided to accompany us to the Halls of Colossus as we search for the ancient weapon. I should talk to Abnur Tharn and find out how he wants to proceed.
I located Prefect Calo. He's locked in a cell. I should talk to him and get him to tell me about the Dragonguard and Euraxia's final order.
I need to find Khamira and warn her about Cadwell's latest vision. He saw Zumog Phoom accompanying the Euraxians as they march toward Riverhold. They're bringing undead to attack the town!
As a sign of good faith, Prefect Calo told me I can find a copy of his report on the Dragonguard in his office upstairs. I should read it and learn what I can.
It seems Prefect Calo was able to extract himself from his cell without my help after all. He wants to speak to me.
I burned the cultists' oil supply, and took their enchanted tool, the Deadland Hammer. I should return to <<1>>  and collect my reward.

I discovered Hadaz's body, and a hastily written letter, describing a Daedric plot that could put all of Elsweyr at risk. I must disrupt the cultists' plans by burning their oil and claiming their enchanted forging tool, the Deadland Hammer.
I freed all the animals from the Bonechime Outpost. I should return to the ranch and speak to Numaia.
I should destroy the Bonechime Gang's poaching camps and recover Numaia's Training Whistle.
It looks like Abnur Tharn sent Zamarak to the Stitches to assist me. I should talk to him.
I tracked the assassination squad to a door to an ancient Akaviri shrine. I should enter the shrine and try to find the so-called last Dragonguard before they kill him.

Khamira was sent by the Speaker of the Mane to determine what Abnur Tharn's plans were regarding the ancient weapon. Khamira wants to help us find it before someone named Euraxia so she can destroy it. I should enter the ruin and consult with Abnur.
I entered the ruins of Cicatrice. I should begin gathering diseased samples from the corpses in this area.
I gathered the samples of diseased corpses. I should return to Iokkas.
I need to enter the oasis caverns and find Iokkas' companions.
I entered the caverns, and the antidote seems to be working. Now I need to search for Iokkas' companions.
I found an Argonian near the entrance of the oasis. I should speak to her and see what's going on.

Lara-Tan told me that there are many Khajiit still in the oasis, but they are too weak to leave. I need to deliver the antidote to them. I should also keep a look out for any research notes I might find.
I found Iokkas. I should tell him that his companions are safe and that I found the research notes.
Upon reading the research, Iokkas believes that a Nereid is spreading the corruption and causing corpses to come to life. In order to heal the oasis, I need to kill this Nereid.
I saved Iokass' companions, found his egg-mother's research, and defeated a corrupt Nereid. I could speak to Iokkas about my reward.
Abnur Tharn wants to know my opinion concerning Khamira's desire to destroy the ancient weapon. I should let him know what I think.
Vazbi asked me to meet her at an aqueduct gate, not far from S'rendarr's Cradle.
I should seek out Vazbi, a young adept who seems intent on resolving the water crisis at S'rendarr's Cradle.
I should examine the aqueduct gate to see if I can discover what's stopped the flow of water to S'rendarr's Cradle.
Vazbi asked me to meet her at a second span of the aqueduct, further along the line.
I should examine the second aqueduct gate. Hopefully, I can discover what stopped the flow of water to S'rendarr's Cradle.
Vazbi seems troubled. I should speak to her about the torn habit we found.
After speaking with Vazbi, she's ready to proceed. We should enter Baan Dar's Litter and continue our search for the injured stranger.

Vazbi caught a glimpse of someone she doesn't recognize, wearing the robes of a S'rendarr's Cradle healer. It may be the stranger we've been tracking. We should try to catch up and ask this person if they know anything about the water crisis.
A group of plague-scarred Khajiit attacked me. I must fight my way through this ambush.
The Stricken's leader, Hulzar, took Vazbi deeper into Baan Dar's Litter. I should pursue them.
I found Silhu-jo, Vazbi's superior, looking for us in Baan Dar's Litter. I should let him know what's happened to Vazbi.
Silhu-jo says he has a plan to free Vazbi from the Stricken. He needs me to escort him to the Baan Dar Spanâ€”the Stricken's main encampment.
Silhu-jo wants to talk to me before we enter the Baan Dar Span. I should see what he wants.
Silhu-jo is appealing to Hulzar and the Stricken to release Vazbi and abandon their plan to destroy the adeptorium. I should catch up.
Hulzar, clearly driven by grief and rage, killed Silhu-jo and fled. I need to kill him before he destroys S'rendarr's Cradle.
I should talk to Vazbi and make sure she's unharmed after being kidnapped by Hulzar.
I should open the sluice gate and return the flow of water to the adeptorium.
I should return to the adeptorium now that the flow of water has been restored.
After all she went through in Baan Dar's Litter, Vazbi is struggling with a crisis of faith. I should see if there's anything I can do to help her.
I convinced Vazbi to remain at S'rendarr's Cradle. I should speak with her to conclude our business.
I convinced Vazbi to leave S'rendarr's Cradle. I should speak with her to conclude our business.
I should search the ancient Akaviri shrine to find any sign of the Dragonguard or the assassination squad.
I should continue looking for this injured stranger in Baan Dar's Litter.

An ancient structure hidden in this cave features a massive door, but it appears to be sealed by some sort of magical barrier. Zamarak thinks the stone pedestal in front of the door might provide a way to open it. I should examine the pedestal.
We heard the assassination squad shouting from deeper within this underground complex. I should search the passages and try to find them.
I heard Captain Saulinia call out from nearby. I need to find her before she reaches the Dragonguard.
I finally caught up to Captain Saulinia, the leader of the Euraxian assassination squad. I need to stop her.
I destroyed the Bonechime Gang's poacher camps and recovered the Training Whistle. I should deliver it to Numaia.
The wounded Dragonguard ran off. I should follow him and find out if he's all right.
Dragonguard Orland gave me his signet ring. He said it would open the Dragonguard Sanctuary. I need to enter the sanctuary and find the Dragonhorn.
Now that the barrier is down, I should enter the sanctuary and claim the Dragonhorn.
Now that I have the Dragonhorn, I should return to Rimmen Palace and report to Khamira and Abnur Tharn.

The Bonechime poachers attacked the ranch while I was raiding their camps in the Prowl. They seized Numaia's animals and dragged them off to their primary encampment. I need to rescue these beasts and kill the poachers' leader, Rahti the Peeler.
Abnur Tharn suggests that a small strike team stands the best chance of getting into the Rimmen Palace to deal with Euraxia. Gharesh-ri might have an idea on how to get inside. I should speak to him.

Euraxia the Usurper Queen has been dethroned. Though reeling from recent events, Khamira has claimed her birthright to lead the Anequine Khajiit. But the necromancers and the Dragons remain to threaten the land. I should talk to Khamira.
Now that I finished with Cadwell, I should head into the palace and go to the throne room to attend the meeting of the war council.

The Betrayer is dead, but not before he started an eclipse that will shortly open the Moon Gate of Anequina and allow the Dragons to reach Jode's Core. I should consult with Khamira about our next course of action.
Iokkas has completed his antidote. I should drink it so that I won't be infected by the toxic gas within the oasis.
The old castellan, Aneshi, cares for a shrine to Khunzar-ri located southeast of Riverhold. I should go to the shrine and try to find him.
If I use Numaia's training whistle, Marmalade will probably help me open the Outpost Gate.
I found Aneshi, the former castellan of Rimmen Palace. I should talk to him and see if he knows a way we can get into the palace without being seen.
Aneshi hid the master key near ruins to the west. I should follow the directions he wrote down and acquire the master key.
Abnur Tharn arranged a chartered wagon and boat to take us to the Halls of Colossus. I should find the wagon outside Cormount in Grahtwood when I'm ready to depart.

The chartered wagon took us to a boat, which took us to a remote stretch of beach along the southern coast of Elsweyr. The ruins of the Halls of Colossus are just ahead. We need to enter the ruins and locate the weapon.
The Halls of Colossus appear ancient and are filled with statuary and ruins. I should help Tharn and Khamira search for some way to get deeper inside.

Captain Calsivius, an Imperial in service to Euraxia Tharn, flooded the chamber with poison gas and sent a horde of undead to attack us. I need to deal with the undead while Abnur Tharn keeps the gas at bay.
With the undead defeated and the gas trap foiled, now we need to solve the puzzle to open the interior door. Only then can we chase after Captain Calsivius and beat him to the weapon.
The door leading into the interior of the Halls of Colossus is open. Now to reach Captain Calsivius and stop him from attaining the weapon before we do.
To continue our pursuit of Captain Calsivius, I need to solve another Khajiiti light puzzle. This one appears more complex than any of the previous puzzles I dealt with.
The door is open. Now to reach Captain Calsivius before he reaches the weapon.
We were wrong. The legend isn't about a weaponâ€”it's about Dragons! I have to stop Captain Calsivius before he unleashes the trapped Dragons.
I killed Captain Calsivius, but the vault is almost open. I need to protect Abnur Tharn while he attempts to stop the process and reseal the vault.
Too late! The vault has opened and the Dragons are escaping! I need to get out of their way.
The Dragons escaped from their ancient prison and there's nothing else to be done here. Tharn opened a portal to take us out of the Halls of Colossus. I should use it.
We returned from the Halls of Colossus, but weren't able to stop the Dragons from escaping their ancient prison. I should speak to Khamira and see what she thinks of the situation.
Khamira is worried about what the Dragons will do now that they are loose in Elsweyr. I should talk to Abnur Tharn and see if he has any ideas on how to rectify the situation.
Abnur Tharn admitted that his half-sister Euraxia tricked him into following the clues and releasing the Dragons into Elsweyr. I should find out if he has a plan for rectifying the situation.
Khamira asked me to talk to Abnur Tharn and see if he knows where I need to go to find the necromancer, Zumog Phoom.
Marmalade plucked the key off the drunken guard and dropped it down for me. I should pick it up.
I have the key to Rahti's Command Post. I should use it to enter the innermost section of the Bonechime Outpost.
I found Numaia's prized senche lion, Milksop. I should set him free.

Abnur Tharn was able to identify the location Cadwell teleported to. It's an ancient crypt in the Scar, not far from the Stitches. I need to head there and meet up with Tharn and the rest of my companions.
Another locked gate lies between me and Numaia's prized senche lion, Milksop. A drunken guard almost certainly holds the key. I should call for Marmalade again. She might be able to help.
The strike force is gathering near the wall just outside Rimmen. Now that I have the master key, I should go and meet them there.
I rendezvoused with Abnur Tharn and the rest of the strike force outside the walls of Rimmen. I should talk to him to find out about our next move.
After Captain Nala-do deals with the Euraxian guarding the gate, I need to enter the south weapons platform and destroy the siege weapons aimed into the city.
Now that the siege weapons have been destroyed, I should rendezvous with the rest of the strike force at the sewer entrance.
The master key that Aneshi provided should open the door to the crypts. From there, we can search the crypts and find a way to enter the palace. Then we can meet up with the rest of the strike force.
I should speak to Captain Nala-do before we head into the sewers to find the door to the crypts.
Zamarak says that the crypt for the royal family has been disturbed. I should investigate.
I should speak to Zamarak and see what he thinks happened to the royal graves.
Now that we're inside the palace, we need to locate Khamira and the other members of the strike force.
Zamarak says that we need to go to the Chapel of the Guiding Moons. From there, we can go through the Great Hall to reach the Royal Chambers.
The necromancer Zumog Phoom trapped us in the chapel with a horde of undead. I need to protect Zamarak while he creates an exit out of here.
Cadwell is free. Now I need to get to the Royal Chambers and confront Euraxia.
The Dragons and the necromancers have deserted Euraxia Tharn. This is our chance to defeat the Usurper Queen and free Rimmen.

Euraxia has been defeated, but at what cost? Captain Nala-do fell in the battle and Khamira had to watch her parents die again. She ordered us to go to the throne room. I should make sure she's all right.
We gathered inside the palace throne room after defeating Euraxia. I should talk to Khamira now.
I should introduce myself to Magnate Feina-Darak and see what information I can find out from her. I can find her in Hakoshae's town square.
While exiting the tomb, Ashur told me to meet him in Hakoshae's town square. I should speak to him and collect my reward.
I need to enter Zumog Phoom's lair and prevent him from reanimating Cadwell the Betrayer.
Zumog Phoom stole energy from Cadwell and has deposited it at various ritual sites throughout his lair. I need to help Cadwell recover that energy.
We found Cadwell inside Zumog Phoom's lair. I should talk to him.
Zamarak will stay behind to guard our rear while Captain Nala-do and I reach the Great Hall. From there, we can enter the Royal Chambers and confront Euraxia.
Abnur Tharn and Khamira entered the palace courtyard to eavesdrop on Euraxia and the Dragon Mulaamnir. I should follow them.
I was told that I can find Tasnasi on the outskirts of the Stitches. I should speak to her about this job she's recruiting for.
Tasnasi asked me to recruit three other people to join her crew: Vole the mechanist at Jubani's Junkshop, Sereyne the mage by the Goiter's Gulp, and Nazdar the adept on the western outskirts of town.
Tasnasi told me that Vole recently did a job for Jubani and said I should find him near Jubani's Junkshop.
Jubani's thugs have taken Vole and are keeping him captive in the junkshop. I need to get inside without stirring up trouble.
I made it inside Jubani's Junkshop. Now I need to find Vole and rescue him from Jubani's thugs.
I freed Vole from his bonds and allowed for his escape. I should talk to Vole outside Jubani's Junkshop and convince him to join Tasnasi's crew.
I found Sereyne passed out near the tavern. I need to find a way to wake her.
Sereyne's not pleased about her rude awakening, but hopefully I can convince her to join Tasnasi's crew.
Sereyne needs me to get her arcane focus, which she pawned to two pawnbrokers, Scipion and Iulius Averno. I can find them in the Goiter's Gulp.
I have Sereyne's arcane focus. I should bring it to her so she'll agree to join Tasnasi's crew.
I should search the Stitches for Nazdar.
I found Nazdar staring off into the canyon. I should talk to him about joining Tasnasi's crew.
Nazdar is preoccupied with the loss of a prized possession of his: a lute gifted to him by a late friend. I agreed to retrieve his lute from where he left it when hostile beasts chased him off.
I found Nazdar's lute. I should bring it to him and see if he's more receptive to joining Tasnasi's crew.
Tasnasi and the rest of her crew are all accounted for. I should speak to her and learn more about the job she's planning.
I should listen while Tasnasi goes over her plan to break into the vault in Meirvale Keep.
Now that everyone has agreed to join Tasnasi's crew, I should meet them at the Bowel, a small cave at the base of Meirvale Keep.
Tasnasi said we can enter Meirvale Keep through the dungeons beneath the fortress. We can climb up into them through the Bowel.
I need to work with Vole to unlock the Dwemer locks sealing off the dungeon, so we can  make our way to the courtyard of Meirvale Keep.
Now that we've made it to the courtyard, Sereyne is responsible for transporting the crew across the open area without being seen. I should wait for her to complete her spell.
Sereyne's spell has gone awry. Nazdar and I have been separated from the group, but Sereyne is trying to communicate through some kind of projection.  I should speak to her to discuss how to proceed.
Sereyne doesn't have the power to attempt to teleport us back to the group. Nazdar and I will need to make our way across Meirvale Keep's courtyard by stealth.
Now that we successfully reunited with the rest of the crew, Nazdar is going to scale the wall of Meirvale Keep and tie off a rope to allow us to follow him into the tower.
I should use the rope ladder Nazdar dropped to enter Meirvale Keep.
We made it inside the keep, but Nazdar suffered some injury from his climb. I should talk to Tasnasi to go over the next step of the plan.
Tasnasi asked Sereyne and I to find the three keys to open Khasda's vault. They should be somewhere within the palace.
I found all of Khasda's vault keys. I should meet Tasnasi at the vault, deeper in the Meirvale Keep palace.
Nazdar and Vole came to find me after hearing that Tasnasi has been captured by Khasda. I need to find her and rescue her before Khasda kills her.
Khasda has ordered his minotaur enforcer, Cud, to dispatch me. I'll need to kill him to save Tasnasi.
Tasnasi has Khasda cornered. I should see what she intends to do with him.
I convinced Tasnasi not to kill Khasda. She's agreed to see that he confesses to his crimes before the Stitches and told me to meet with her and the crew at the Goiter's Gulp tavern.
Tasnasi decided to kill Khasda for his crimes against her and Dashing Dasalzo. She told me to meet her back at her camp outside of the Stitches to conclude our business.
Sereyne told me that Tasnasi wants me to avoid killing any of the guards while I cross the courtyard.
Magnate Feina-Darak has allowed me to join her festival. This might be a good opportunity to investigate her background. I'll need to first speak to Domitia Nasica.
In order to complete the Proof of Reverence, I must place a paper lotus into the river. This will notify my ancestors that I am participating in the festival.
I should talk to Vek-Drassi Secunia in order to start the Proof of Strength.
I should talk to Valoria Marius in order to start the Proof of Wisdom.
Captain Nala-do's spirit is waiting to talk to me. I should speak with her.
I disrupted each of the ritual sites except for the main one. Now I need to stop Zumog Phoom before he completes the ritual.
I need to collect a nearby flower that grows in a senche-lion lair.
I have the flower. I should return to Vek-Drassi Secunia.
I killed Zumog Phoom, but not before he completed his ritual. Now Cadwell the Betrayer has been made whole!
Cadwell the Betrayer opened a portal and disappeared. I should talk to the Cadwell I know and find out why he seems so weak again.
Cadwell faded away, but not before telling me what he knows of the Betrayer's plans. I need to return to Rimmen Palace and tell my companions what's going on.

A priest named Haduras warned of the strange goings on at the temple and requested my help. We crossed paths as he was pursuing another priest, Zargha, chasing a beast's young, and asked me to retrieve him before he's hurt.
I saved Zargha from the terror bird. Haduras will want to know that he's safe.
I saved Zargha from the beast and he was quick to return to the temple, but his rescue piqued the interest of a strange cat who appeared out of thin air. I should speak to this mysterious spectator.
I must solve the riddle by bringing Valoria the correct item.
I have the item. I should return to Valoria Marius.
I need to tell Khamira what happened at Zumog Phoom's lair and what Cadwell told me about the Betrayer's plans.
I found Haduras trying to reason with some priests from his temple who are on some deranged errand of self-harm. I should see if he needs my help.
Mizzik wants to check if Ishu remembers any other details about our investigation. I should head to Ishu's home.

Ishu suggested I speak to Mell the Musical, a singing Wood Elf who tends to stay up late and may have seen something the night of the abduction. I can find her in the northern part of town, near the sand gardens.
I found Mell the Musical in the sand gardens. I should speak to her.
Though Mell didn't see anything the night of the abduction, she has noticed that the gambler Tajirri has been rather suspicious lately. She suggested I search behind the local stables.
I helped Mizzik rescue Zinthia and take down a smuggling operation. I should speak to him about my reward.
Khamira wants us to gather in the royal study so she can show us something.
Khamira has something to tell us. I should listen to what she has to say.
Khamira's pendant identified a location on the map of Elsweyr: The Shadow Dance Ruins. I should talk to her and see if she thinks that was what Cadwell was trying to tell us.

Haduras asked me to head to a nearby campsite emanating the scent of roasted meat in search of a strange iron fork that smells of roast beef, so his fellow priests can't blind themselves with it. I should head there now.
I completed the Three Proofs. I should share what I learned with Ashur.
I should talk to the guard to distract him.
Lyrrsazhi brought me a message. Abnur Tharn and the war council await my presence in K'har Zhab Hall in Riverhold. I should go and see what Abnur Tharn has to say.
Ashur wants to steal a key from a town guard. I need to distract a guard by talking to him.
We think the Betrayer is on his way to the ruins of the Shadow Dance Temple. I need to get there as soon as I can.
I entered the Shadow Dance Ruins. I should talk to Khamira and see if she knows how to proceed.
Khamira opened a path into the depths of the ruined temple. I should follow her.
Ashur was able to steal a key. We should enter the magnate's cellar.
A door in the cellar has a magical barrier. I should look around to see if I can find a way to take it down.
I found an Akaviri fable and four tablets.The tablets look like they can fit in nearby sockets. I should try placing the tablets.
The magical barrier protecting the door is down. I should enter the chamber.
There's a letter inside the chamber. I should read it.
The magnate has found us in her cellar. I should listen to her.
The portal opened by Khamira led to an underground temple. I need to look around and see if I can find any sign of the Betrayer.
I found another temple relic. I need to activate it to help Khamira continue the process of attunement to the Lunar Lattice.

The temple relic started the process of attuning Khamira to the Lunar Lattice. She needs to complete the process in order to stop the Betrayer from moving the moons and opening the way to Jode's Core. I should help her find the remaining relics.
Now that Khamira has been attuned, we need to reach the temple sanctuary and stop the Betrayer from causing the moons to move and form an eclipse.
As soon as I'm ready, I need to enter the temple sanctuary and confront Cadwell the Betrayer.
I reached the temple sanctuary and located Cadwell the Betrayer. Now I have to confront him and end his evil existence.
I killed the Betrayer, but Khamira seems to be having a problem reversing the eclipse. I should talk to her.
I need to watch as Khamira absorbs the energy from the temple relic. She thinks she can use it to restore the power of the Dragonhorn of Anequina.
Khamira wants us to return to Rimmen Palace and gather our forces before we decide what to do about the eclipse that the Betrayer set in motion.
Khamira wants to discuss a plan for confronting the Betrayer before we enter the sanctuary.
The magnate was abducted by an Akaviri spirit. I should speak to Ashur about what just occurred.
I should head inside the Hakoshae tombs in order to find Magnate Feina-Darak.
I need to find the magnate. She should be somewhere inside the tombs.
There's a a guardian spirit blocking the door. I should kill the spirit so I can advance.
I killed the guardian spirit. I should head inside the founder chamber and continue my search for the magnate.
It turns out that the Akaviri spirit is Proconsul Beloren-Kaie. I should speak with him and see what's going on.
It turns out that the magnate is not a descendant of the Potentate. I should talk to her about the proconsul's ultimatum.

The mysterious stranger was a talking cat who seems to be responsible for the strange events at the temple. He's challenged me to join his game and told me that the priests are about to maim themselves. I should try to reach the temple and stop them.
The unusual cat I encountered before was revealed to be the Skooma Cat, another identity of the Daedric Prince of Madness. He has reappeared and wants to talk to me.
It appears that a camp has been set up near the Sleeping Badger. We should proceed cautiously.
I searched the stables and found what appears to be a clue. I should speak to Mizzik and see if he knows more.
I should bring the Akaviri relics to Kiseravi and collect my reward.
I should enter the Tomb of the Serpents and gather the Akaviri relics.
Mizzik deduced that the note I found refers to a rock formation called the Sleeping Badger. I should head south toward the formation with Mizzik.

The Skooma Cat has been toying with the priests of the Two Moons at Tenmar Temple, much to their detriment. He told me that he's been having them jump off the temple and said that the Moon-Bishop is about to take the leap next. I need to stop her.
One of the priests in the courtyard is shouting encouragement to a figure up on the temple's balcony. She may know what's going on.
I spoke to Sizenza, but was interrupted by the Skooma Cat who vanished her. I should try to find out what he's done to her.
I found the anchor, but the Skooma Cat has left a bizarre protector behind to prevent me from reaching it. I'll need to destroy it.
Now that I reached the anchor, the Skooma Cat changed back into Sheogorath to greet me. Some sort of magical barrier surrounds the anchor, so I may have no choice but to speak to the Mad God.
I found skooma and a small golden necklace. I should speak to Mizzik about these new clues.
Mizzik believes that smugglers have abducted Zinthia and that Tajirri may know more. It's likely we'll find Tajirri in the Banished Regrets. I should head there.
A Khajiit has called out to me. I should speak to her and see what she wants.
Rideza warned me to stop my investigation, stating that Ishu's daughter left town years ago. I should let Mizzik know what I was just told.
Mizzik believes that the gambler Tajirri may have more information about Zinthia's abduction. I should search her lodgings while Mizzik distracts her.
I found a mysterious note in Tajirri's home. I should show it to Mizzik.
Mizzik deduced that the note likely describes smuggler caches. I should search for marked barrels or crates to find more clues about the investigation.
Ishu seems baffled as to why smugglers are targeting him and Zinthia. With no new leads, I should head back to Mizzik to further discuss the investigation.
I found Rideza, the Khajiit I met earlier, threatening Mizzik. I should speak to her and see what she wants.
I need to follow Rideza's trail. Hopefully, she'll lead me straight to Zinthia.
Rideza's jelly footprints led me to a trapdoor. I should enter it.
Rideza's smugglers have proven themselves a vicious crew. I should be prepared to defend myself.
It turns out that Rideza was actually Ishu's blood daughter, and stole her father's prize pet Zinthia out of spite. I should speak to Mizzik.
I killed the three master hunters and the gryphon, Quillmane. I should find Sarazi and inform him of my success.
I should track down and kill the gryphon and these reclusive hunters.
Rideza threatened me before quickly vanishing. I should speak to Mizzik about what just happened.
I should find Tahara, the proprietor of the traveling menagerie.
Burtle, the "slavering beast" that escaped from Tahara's menagerie, is loose somewhere in Rimmen. I must find it before it escapes for good.
I found the "monster," Burtle, hiding near the market. Unfortunately, he refuses to budge. I need to find a way to lure him out.
I managed to coax Burtle out of hiding. Now I should lead him back to his owner, Tahara.
If I crouch down, I should be able to find signs of the beast's passage.
Burtle looks hungry. Perhaps I can find some food to lure him out.
We defeated Mulaamnir and stopped Kaalgrontiid from stealing all of the energy stored in Jode's Core by ending the eclipse. I should talk to Khamira about what happens next.

Yushiha was able to protect a Khajiiti traveler from Rakazsa, another vampire of her clan, but fears that others passing through the Weeping Scar won't be so lucky. She asked me to check the traveler's nearby camp.
Rakazsa is dead and the caravanners are rescued. I should talk to Yushiha about what's transpired.
I freed Mazdurr and recovered his amulet of Azurah. I should speak to him about my reward.
I need to find a key to Mazdurr's cage to help him escape. I should also recover his amulet of Azurah, which should be near the bandit's leader, Zayreba Sharpclaw.
Now that I gathered both the key and amulet, I should unlock Mazdurr's cage.
I can kill Daedra anywhere, but concentrations exist at the Brothers of Strife in Stonefalls, Torinaan in Auridon, and the Moonlit Maw in Stormhaven.
I filled all the soul gems Zahari gave me with Daedric souls. I should return to her camp and deliver the filled soul gems.
Tasnasi told me I should be able to find Sereyne in or near the Goiter's Gulp, a tavern in the Stitches.
I found no survivors at the camp, but they left behind journal indicating that they fell behind a caravan headed through the area. I should search for the caravan and warn them about the vampires.
I found the caravan empty except for Rakazsa. It appears he wants to talk. I'll listen, for now.
Khamira asked me to find our companions in Rimmen and tell them the time has come to assemble at the Moon Gate of Anequina. I need to talk to Abnur Tharn, Zamarak, Prefect Calo, and Cadwell.
Now I have to meet up with Khamira and the rest of my companions at the Moon Gate of Anequina, which is located in the southwest portion of the region.
Rakazsa blames his late Clan Mother's pacifist ways for decades of deprivation and suffering. It seemed like he had more to say on the matter, but Yushiha chased him off. I should speak to her.
I found the key to the makeshift kennels the vampires are keeping the caravanners captive in. I should use it to rescue whoever I can find.
I should look for Hadaz inside Darkpool Mine.
I reached the base of the Moon Gate. Gharesh-ri ordered me to report to Prefect Calo. I should talk to Calo and see what he needs me to do.
The Dragons have started their attack! Prefect Calo ordered me to ascend to the Moon Gate and assist Queen Khamira in any way I can.
A Dragon attack just targeted Gharesh-ri! I should talk to Zamarak so we can assess the situation.
Zamarak decided to stay behind to lead the troops. I need to continue to climb toward the Moon Gate and join up with Abnur Tharn and Khamira.
While Khamira tries to close the Moon Gate, I need to fend off the attacking Euraxians.
Khamira wasn't able to close the Moon Gate before the Dragons Mulaamnir and Kaalgrontiid barreled through the portal. Now we need to follow them and stop them from reaching the power at Jode's Core.
Khamira remembers this place from the memories she gained during her attunement. I need to accompany her to Jode's Core and help her figure out a way to stop the Dragons.
The dead are rising all over town. I need to help Captain Nala-do deal with the group Zumog Phoom sent against us.
Kaalgrontiid has begun the process of withdrawing the power from Jode's Core. Before we can deal with him, however, Mulaamnir stands in our way. I need to find a way to defeat Mulaamnir.
