Mulaamnir is dead, but Kaalgrontiid continues to absorb power from Jode's Core. I need to wait for Khamira to complete her ritual in case she requires my help.
Cadwell appeared and opened a portal to take us back to Elsweyr. I should use the portal now.
Cadwell's portal returned us to Rimmen. I should talk to Khamira and make sure she's all right after everything that occurred in the Plane of Jode.
Iraya has returned. I should let her know what happened.

The jewel worked and the museum is filled with the sound of the ancient Khajiiti song. No doubt this will help Iraya and Izanji attract more visitors to the House of Histories. I should check in with Iraya now.
We escaped Star Haven. Ma'jha-dro wants to speak with me.
The spirit told us that an ancient lich called Arum-Khal has awakened beneath the Ashen Scar. I should talk to Vastarie and see if I can help further.

The Moonlight Blade will help me defeat Arum-Khal, but age has weakened the enchantments that the Hidden Moon adepts placed on it. I should ask Vastarie if she can help, while also filling her in on the progress I've made.
We restored Shando-ri's soul and also managed to redeem his fallen brother, Arum-Khal. I should discuss all that's happened with Vastarie.
I freed the caravanners. Now I need to find Rakazsa and put an end to his attacks.
Yushiha could not convince Rakazsa to give up and is convinced he will not stop his bloody hunt until he is dead. She asked me to kill him and put an end to this.
Rakazsa awaits me in his den. I need to kill him to free Yushiha's clan from his influence.
Vastarie believes she can locate the source of the undead corruption if I place three of her descrying stones in the Ashen Scar.
Placing the descrying stones helped Vastarie pinpoint a concentration of necromantic energy in a tomb at the center of the Ashen Scar. I should investigate the place.
I should find Rakhzargo and see what work he has for me.
I should talk to Rakhzargo's mother, Kideya, and see what I can learn about these missing farmhands. I can find her at Sweetwater Farmstead.
Kideya asked me to look for her missing farmhands. She told me to enlist the help of her oldest son, who's lounging around nearby. I should find him.
I found Kideya's son, Razum-dar, lounging nearby. I should talk to him about the missing farmhands.
Raz suggests we search the nearby moon-sugar farm, Fragrant Moons Planation, to see if they're somehow involved in the missing farmhands.
I  should speak to Razaum-dar about our infiltration of Fragrant Moons Plantation.
I need to make my way inside Fragrant Moons Plantation. I should be careful, since they don't tolerate trespassers.
I should search Fragrant Moons Plantation to find out what I can about the missing farmhands.
I should talk to Razum-dar about what we learned at Fragrant Moons Plantation.
Razum-dar wants us to investigate Honey-Breeze Homestead, another of Merryvale's moon-sugar farms. I should head there now.
A monster has attacked Honey-Breeze Homestead, causing the local animals to become aggressive. I should make sure J'dathal is safe and see if he has more information.
The monster that attacked Honey-Breeze Homestead has made its way toward a nearby cave. I should track it down and kill it.
I found the daedroth that's been terrorizing Honey-Breeze Homestead. I should kill it.
I should talk to Razum-dar about what happened at Honey-Breeze Homestead.
Razum-dar wants to investigate the storage cellars of Sweetwater Farmstead. I should meet him there.
Razum-dar suspects there will be signs of theft in his mother's storage cellar. I should start searching.
It seems that a tapestry has been hung up in the cellar without Kideya's knowledge. I should examine it.
I discovered a tunnel that leads directly into Kideya's storage cellar. I should investigate and see where it goes.
The tunnel led to a complex of caverns beneath Merryvale. I should investigate and see if there are any signs of the moon-sugar thieves.
I found a tied-up woman. I should speak to her and see if she has any information about what's going on.
I learned the criminals are a skooma ring run by a mage named Saevus. I should kill him and stop their operation.
I stopped the skooma ring. I should meet Razum-dar back at Sweetwater Farmstead.
I stopped the skooma ring. I should talk to Razum-dar about my reward.
I gathered Marzula-jo's notes and memory stones. I should deliver them to Narama-ko and claim my reward.
I should search the Abode of Ignominy for Marzula-jo's notes and memory stones.
I entered the Plane of Jode. I should talk to Khamira and find out why she didn't want me to use the Dragonhorn.
An evil Khajiiti spirit appeared when I destroyed the orb. I should talk to Vastarie about what just occurred.

We found a body sprawled beside the dark lich's orb. Vastarie intends to conduct a summoning ritual to find out what this dead Khajiit knows. I need to place one of her descrying stones in the center of the tomb so she can begin.
Vastarie's ritual worked and a Khajiiti spirit hovers before us. I should question it.
I need to craft the furnishings specified by my contract.\n\nOnce I've crafted them, I need to deliver them to any writ turn-in site.
I've placed the requested furnishings into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest.
Queen Khamira seems to have one more thing to say to me. I should talk to her.
It appears that the forces that defended the Moon Gate have returned to the city. I should speak to Gharesh-ri, Zamarak, and Prefect Calo and find out what happened after we entered the Moon Gate.
I should find Khamira now and let her know that Gharesh-ri, Zamarak, and Prefect Calo have returned and are mostly unscathed.
Khamira seems ready to attend the coronation ceremony. She asked me to go to the throne room and wait for her to arrive.
The coronation of Khamira has begun. I should observe what happens.
Queen Khamira wants to speak to me. I should approach the throne and talk to her.
I placed the stone. Now I should wait to see what happens.
I must travel to Kulati Mines in Alik'r in order to help train Northern Elsweyr Defense Force recruits to defeat spiders.
I showed a Northern Elsweyr Defense Force recruit how to defeat spiders. I should return to Zahari and see what else she needs.
Khamira asked me to find out what happened to our companions and the soldiers who helped defend the Moon Gate from the Dragons. I should head out of the city and see what I can learn.
I need to craft the furnishing specified by my contract.\n\nOnce I've crafted it, I need to deliver it to any writ turn-in site.
I've placed the requested furnishings into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest.
I must talk to Captain Shideya. She will pair me with a fledgling Khajiit warrior who will observe how I deal with powerful monsters.
I need to craft the furnishings specified by my contract.\n\nOnce I've crafted them, I need to deliver them to any writ turn-in site.
I've placed the requested furnishings into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest.
I need to craft the furnishing specified by my contract.\n\nOnce I've crafted it, I need to deliver it to any writ turn-in site.
I've placed the requested furnishings into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest.
I need to craft the furnishing specified by my contract.\n\nOnce I've crafted it, I need to deliver it to any writ turn-in site.
I've placed the requested furnishings into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest.
I need to craft the furnishing specified by my contract.\n\nOnce I've crafted it, I need to deliver it to any writ turn-in site.
I've placed the requested furnishings into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest.

A Khajiiti loremaster can direct us to the moon-singer storytellers who can recite the secret tales of Khunzar-ri. To secure his help, however, I need to gather dusk mushrooms from the ruin in Auridon, Bewan, to offer as a gift.
Now that I have the dusk mushrooms, I should travel to Dagaril-dro's camp on Auridon's coast and offer them as a gift.

A Khajiiti loremaster can direct us to the moon-singer storytellers who can recite the secret tales of Khunzar-ri. To secure his help, however, I need to gather dusk mushrooms from the Ayleid ruin in Glenumbra, Enduum, to offer as a gift.

A Khajiiti loremaster can direct us to the moon-singer storytellers who can recite the secret tales of Khunzar-ri. To secure his help, however, I need to gather dusk mushrooms from a mine in Stonefalls, Hightide Hollow, to offer as a gift.
Now that I have the dusk mushrooms, I should travel to Dagaril-dro's camp on the Glenumbra coast and offer them as a gift.
Now that I have the dusk mushrooms, I should travel to Dagaril-dro's camp on the coast of Stonefalls and offer them as a gift.

Dagaril-dro accepted the gift of the dusk mushrooms and told me where to find the moon-singer storytellers. I can find them at the Redfur Trading Post, the Baandari Trading Post, and in Rawl'kha. I should let Abnur Tharn know what I learned.

I agreed to play the Skooma Cat's games if he'd release the priests from his madness and he's transported me to a warped reflection of the Two Moons Temple. This may be where the Skooma Cat took Sizenza when she vanished. I should search for her.
I successfully drew the Skooma Cat's attention away from Sizenza. I need to snap her out of her delusion before he loses interest.
Vastarie suggested that we travel to the temple summit and seek out a helpful spirit who can tell us more about Arum-Khal.
A talking cat appeared before me. I should try to speak to it.
Mazza-Mirri wants me to learn some of the teachings of the Order of the Hidden Moon before she'll help us. I need to read the Teaching Stones scattered around the temple summit.
I almost got through to Sizenza, but the Skooma Cat took notice and whisked her away again. I'll have to find her again if I hope to get through to her.
I read the Teaching Stones and learned the Hidden Moon's basic teachings. I should talk to Mazza-Mirri about what this all means.
Mazza-Mirri promised to tell me more about Arum-Khal. She may even know how we can stop him. I should follow her instructions and enter the Temple of the Hidden Moon.
I should listen to what Mazza-Mirri has to tell me about Arum-Khal. It could be the key to stopping this threat.

Mazza-Mirri challenged me to prove my strength of will by fighting summoned dro-m'Athraâ€”evil Khajiiti spirits. If I succeed, she will give me a weapon that can kill Arum-Khal permanently. I should proceed deeper into the temple to face this test.
I passed Mazza-Mirri's test and earned the right to wield the weapon that can kill Arum-Khal. I should follow her into the next room.
A mummified Khajiit sits in a hidden tomb with a sword across his lap. It seems this Moonlight Blade is the weapon I need to destroy Arum-Khal. I should take it.
A spirit appeared when I took the blade. I should see what it has to tell me.
I lured the Skooma Cat away from Sizenza again. I should speak to her before he comes back.
I should talk to the local wildlife ranch's proprietor, Numaia.
I should talk to Mazza-Mirri about her plan to stop Arum-Khal for good.
I should return to Sweetwater Farmstead and discuss what we learned at Fragrant Moons Plantation with Razum-dar.
Sizenza and I emerged back into the real Two Moons Temple, much to Haduras's surprise. It seems like Sheogorath's hold is broken, but I should check on Sizenza to make certain.
Sizena's sanity has returned, along with the rest of the priests, and Sheogorath is nowhere to be seen. I should speak to Sizena about what's next for Two Moons Temple.
I should speak to Shando-ri about recharging the Moonlight Blade.

Vastarie claims that I can strengthen the blade's enchantment by simply wielding it in combat. I need to kill undead in the Ashen Scar and allow the blade to absorb the soul fragments that reanimate them.
Now that the Moonlight Blade shimmers and hums with the power of Azurah, I must meet Shando-ri at the temple's entrance: Azurah's Gate.
Shando-ri stands ready to enact our plan to destroy Arum-Khal. I must use the Moonlight Blade to open Azurah's Gate.
Shando-ri explained that we must destroy the Shades of Arum-Khal that defend his phylacteries. This should permanently sever their ties to this world, and weaken the dark lich.

I defeated Arum-Khal's physical form, but his soul proved too powerful for Shando-ri to defeat alone. Vastarie appeared and told me I still have a chance to defeat Arum-Khal if I use the Moonlight Blade to follow him into his shadowy realm.

Shando-ri assured me we can still win the fight against the Dark Adept. I need to find the Dark Spirit of Arum-Khal in this strange realm and destroy him before he has a chance to fully reconstitute himself.
Vastarie was able to pull me out of the Arum-Khal's realm of darkness, but Shando-ri remained behind. I should talk to Vastarie about what happens next.
I used the Moonlight Blade to create a portal to Arum-Khal's shadow realm. I must pass through this breach to pursue him.
I arrived in an alien realm of perpetual darkness and found a severely weakened Shando-ri. I should speak with him.

Vastarie has an idea that might help us save Shando-ri's soul. I need to raise the Moonlight Blade so she can pull the fragments of Shando-ri's spirit out of Arum-Khal's realm and make them whole again.
Now that Shando-ri and I have destroyed two of Arum-Khal's phylacteries, we can mount our final assault on the dark lich in his tomb.

Abnur Tharn wants me to go to the Scar and find the hidden Akaviri shrine. He said that he'd send someone to meet me in the Stitches. Meanwhile, he's taking Prefect Calo to Rimmen to discuss the possibility of an alliance.
We need to track the assassination squad through the Scar so that we can reach them before they can carry out their order to execute the supposed last surviving member of the Dragonguard.
I destroyed the Dark Spirit of Arum-Khal for good. Now, I need to find a way out of this realm.
Wait For Vastarie
I defeated Arum-Khal's physical form. Now, Shando-ri must destroy the lich's weakened soul.
I entered the tombs. I should search for the magnate.
The Akaviri spirit called out to Ashur in recognition, before vanishing once more with the magnate. I should speak to Ashur about what just occurred.
I placed the paper lotus in the river. I should speak to Domitia Nasica.
Tharn suspected that Cadwell was the source of the surges of power he detected and there he is. I should talk to Cadwell and find out what he's doing here.

Lharahad said that he saw a strange, pale-skinned man with a pot on his head wandering around before I arrived. He said the man headed east. I should try to track him down somewhere to the south and east of Riverhold.
Cadwell says that he dreamed about this particular gravestone and was somehow drawn to this spot. He asked me to examine it and see what I make of the inscription.
I examined the gravestone. It appears to mark the resting place of someone named only as "The Betrayer." I should talk to Cadwell and see if that means anything to him.
Despite his strange dreams, Cadwell agreed to help us deal with the Dragons. I should head to the outpost of the Northern Elsweyr Defense Force to meet up with Abnur Tharn and Khamira now.
Abnur Tharn used his magic to fend off the Dragon attack. I should talk to him and make sure he's all right.
The effort Abnur Tharn expended to fend off the Dragon seems to have left him depleted. He asked me to talk to Khamira and see what I can do to help her.
Khamira asked me to recover sensitive documents from the ruins of the militia's camp. I should search the tents for mail sacks that contain the important documents.
I recovered the documents that Khamira requested. Now I should find Captain Nala-do and deliver the documents to her.
I found Captain Nala-do. She defeated a necromancer and his undead. I should deliver the documents I recovered and speak to her.
Captain Nala-do headed for Riverhold to consult with Gharesh-ri. I should meet Abnur Tharn and Khamira at the south end of the militia camp and see what we need to do next.
Abnur Tharn says that the source of the undead army lies in the mountains to the west. I should go and investigate the area. And if I run into Khamira, I should make sure she's all right.
I encountered Khamira and her soldiers on my way to find the source of the undead army. I should talk to her.
Khamira and her soldiers tracked the Dragon to the same mountain that houses the source of the undead. We've decided to team up to try to deal with both threats.
The source of the undead must be somewhere deep in the mine. I should explore until I find it.
I found the lead necromancer who's been raising the undead army here in the western mountains. I need to defeat the necromancer before she replenishes Euraxia's forces.
Khamira and her soldiers helped me take down the necromancer. I should wait for her to descend from the cliffside to join me.
The Dragon that attacked the Defense Force outpost just incinerated Khamira's soldiers while Khamira herself leaped off the cliff. I need to chase down the Dragon and see if I can deal with it.
The Dragon landed before me and requested that we parley. I might as well talk to it and see what it wants.
The Dragon Mulaamnir gave me a warning to pass along to Abnur Tharn. It wants us both to leave Elsweyr and stay out of its way. I should wait until it leaves before I determine my next move.
Khamira did survive the Dragon attack when she leaped off the cliff. I should talk to her and see what she thinks about my conversation with Mulaamnir.

Mulaamnir warned me and Abnur Tharn to leave Elsweyr or suffer the consequences. The Dragon also intimated that it was in control of Rimmen, calling Euraxia its puppet. I need to return to Riverhold and consult with Abnur Tharn and Gharesh-ri.
Upon arriving in Riverhold, Cadwell called out to me. I should talk to him and see what he has to say.

Cadwell seems to think that the missing head from the grave he saw in his vision might be significant, but that's a problem for later. Right now, Abnur Tharn wants to see me in the Riverhold town hall.
Abnur Tharn suggested a meeting with Queen Euraxia. I should talk to him and convince him that a parley is a good idea.

I couldn't break the Skooma Cat's influence over Sizenza, but I got her to tell me about the anchor she created beneath the Two Moons Temple at his behest. It seems to be the key to all this chaos. I must find it.
With the barrier gone, there's nothing stopping me from destroying the anchor. I should get rid of it before Sheogorath changes his mind.
A Dragon! It's attacking the outpost! I need to get over there.
I found the letter. I should see what it says.
The adepts left a key to my room, so I'm free to leave. I should take the key.
I should look around and try to get my bearings.
A Khajiit outside my door mentioned a letter. I should find it.
Sizenza said the anchor would be under the temple. I need to find it if I hope to break the Skooma Cat's influence on Two Moons Temple.
Someone used the habit Vazbi and I found to dress a wound. It's unclear how it arrived in the wilderness, but Vazbi wants to find the robe's owner and see if they need help.

I arrived at the doors to Rimmen Palace to find Abnur Tharn dealing with Cadwell. It appears Cadwell is having another one of his visions. Tharn asked me to check on him before joining him in the throne room for the war council.
I destroyed the anchor and freed Two Moons from Sheogorath's influence. I should follow Sizenza through the tear in the melded planes before it closes.
Sizenza has escaped Sheogorath's twisted reflection of the Two Moons at Tenmar temple. Now I should too.
We followed a trail of mysterious items to Baan Dar's Litter, a dangerous and thoroughly forbidden canyon. Vazbi wants to talk before proceeding.
The war council is reconvening in the Riverhold town hall. I should go there and join them.
I should head to Riverhold in Northern Elsweyr and see what Abnur Tharn has to say.
I should speak with Khud af-Hadajja and let him know what happened in the doomvault.
I should search the doomvault for any sign of the Daedric device. When I find anything of interest, I should contact Khud with the sending stone.
Now that I picked up the key, I can unlock the door and leave my room. I should open the door.
Grand Adept Ma'jha-dro has come to check on me. I should speak to him.
I should meet Ma'jha-dro in the gardens so that we can start sparring.
I found Ma'jha-dro in the gardens. I should let him know I'm ready to spar.
I need to spar with Ma'jha-dro to determine if I'm fully healed.
We finished sparring and Ma'jha-dro promised to lead me out of Star Haven. I should follow him.
A Dragon is attacking Star Haven. Ma'jha-dro told me there's another path through the catacombs that I can use to escape. I should make my way there.
I need to get through the catacombs and keep an eye out for any adepts I might be able to help.
The Dragon isn't alone. Soldiers and necromancers are also attacking Star Haven, and I found some adepts that are in need of my help. I should save them.
The adepts I rescued might be able to tell me more about what's going on. One seems less shaken by the attack than the others. I should find out what she knows.
Izjadi told me of an old Akaviri Dragonhorn that was once used to combat Dragons. If I can find it, I might be able to ground the Dragon.
I should sound the Dragonhorn and hope it can ground the Dragon so that the adepts can escape.
The horn worked, but the Dragon fell from the sky and crashed into the adeptorium. Ma'jha-dro wishes to check if there's any adepts still trapped inside. I should follow him into the adeptorium.
The Dragon now blocks our path forward. I'll need to battle him if my companions and I are to escape Star Haven Adeptorium.
The Dragon flew off suddenly. I should get out of the adeptorium and escape Star Haven.
I should take Morgane's sending stone. It might allow me to make contact with her partner, Khud af-Hadajja.
I determined what Euraxia's forces were after in the Desert Wind Adeptorium and got the adepts to commit to aid in defense of the town. Now I should find out what I can do to help.

Sizenza, the Moon-Bishop, is trying to reach Khenarthi in the heavens by walking a path into the sky, but this is a delusion put into her head by the Skooma Cat. She'll plummet to her death if I don't try to stop her. I need to reach the balcony.
I reached Sizenza, who is standing on the edge of a temple balcony. I should try to reason with her, so she doesn't fall to her death.
Something is happening to Sizenza. I should observe her carefully.
Abnur Tharn wants me to meet him in Rimmen before we head to the palace to parley with his half-sister, Euraxia.
Abnur Tharn offered to give me a tour of Rimmen so I could understand how Euraxia keeps the Khajiiti in line. I can accompany him or refuse and make my own way to the palace.
I need to accompany Abnur Tharn to Euraxia's throne room inside the palace.
On the way to Euraxia's throne room, the necromancer Zumog Phoom intercepted me. I should see what he has to say.

After a conversation with Queen Euraxia's chief necromancer, Zumog Phoom, I learned that he reanimated Cadwell's original head through necromantic means. Now I need to meet Abnur Tharn in the throne room.
I entered the throne room. Now I need to step forward and wait to be introduced to Euraxia Tharn.
Euraxia dismissed her half-brother Abnur and instead asked to talk to me. I guess it's up to me to present our case and convince Euraxia that the Dragons plan to betray her.
Euraxia never meant to honor the terms of the parley. I need to defend myself and Abnur Tharn before Euraxia's guards overwhelm us.
Abnur Tharn used his magic to teleport us out of the throne room. I should talk to him.
Euraxia's wards stopped Abnur Tharn from teleporting us out of the palace. Instead, we wound up in the sewers beneath it. The effort weakened Tharn. I need to protect him as we make our escape.
I helped Abnur Tharn get out of the sewers beneath Rimmen Palace. I should talk to him about what we learned.

We learned that Euraxia has multiple plans in motion. While Abnur Tharn returns to Riverhold to warn Gharesh-ri of an upcoming attack, I need to go to the Desert Wind Adeptorium and find out what her forces are doing there.
It appears that the main gates to the adeptorium have been sealed. I need to find another way to get inside.
A Khajiiti adept defends the entrance to the adeptorium. I should let him know I'm here to help against Euraxia's forces.
Zamarak held the closing door long enough for me to get into the grand hall, but he's trapped on the other side. It's up to me to rescue the Grand Adept.
A Euraxian battlemage! I need to deal with her before she gets away.
The battlemage's shade was pulled from her dead body and drawn through a nearby door. I should follow her and see what happens.

Zamarak arrived, but we were too late to save the Grand Adept or to keep Zumog Phoom from learning the secret he sent the Euraxians to uncover. Now he knows where to find the rest of the Betrayer's body. I should talk to Zamarak.
The necromancer Zumog Phoom has trapped the shade of the battlemage. I need to watch and see what's happening here.
I got Zamarak to commit the Desert Wind adepts to aid in the defense of Riverhold. Now I should return to town and find Abnur Tharn.
Ma'jha-dro wants to spar to see how well I healed. I should take a training sword from the nearby supply room.
I picked up the training sword. Now I need to equip the weapon before I can use it to spar with Ma'jha-dro.
The Skooma Cat seems to be making Sizenza relive the moment she first exposed herself to his influence. He's preventing me from speaking to her, I should try to distract him.
The Skooma Cat is manipulating Sizenza with another delusion. I'll need to distract him again so I can reach out to her.
I found a strange fork matching the description Haduras gave me. I should let him know I have it in my possession.
Yushiha believes her clan abducted most of the caravanners to feed on later. She instructed me to go on ahead to the Tenarr Zalviit Ossuary that her former clan calls home and mount a rescue.
I found a captive caravanner locked in a makeshift kennel like livestock. She said her captors took the key with them across a nearby bridge. I should follow them and search for it.
I agreed to let Abnur Tharn show me around Rimmen and reveal how Euraxia uses tyranny to enforce order here. I should follow him to each location and see what he has to say.
I found the lost instrument and stolen money. Now I should claim my reward.
I was sent to recover a lost drum.
I could ask for more information.
I discovered caves beneath the adeptorium. I should attempt to find a way into the adeptorium from inside the caves.
Zamarak thinks the Euraxians seek one of the secrets guarded by the Grand Adept. He asked me to follow him inside.
One of J'dathal's laborers, Itzi-da, approached me on a bridge while warning of an attack on the farm. I should speak to him.
J'dathal told me about a monster terrorizing his farm. He asked me to find his three daughters and make sure they're safe.
Iraya believes the first clue suggests one of the missing pieces might be in the Tomb of the Serpents. I should travel there and search for the mural piece.
I found a missing piece of the mural in the Tomb of the Serpents, but when I tried to touch it a spirit appeared. It seems to want to speak with me.
A shadow of the trickster god Rajhin gave me a book of riddles that will help me find the other pieces of the mural. For now, I should collect the piece I already found.
With one of the missing pieces in hand, I should return to Iraya at the House of Histories.
Looks like Iraya is out. I should speak with her brother, Izanji.
Izanji asked me to place the piece I recovered back into the mural frame.
I should examine the mural to see if there's something we missed.
Rajhin has appeared once more. I should see what he has to say.
I reached Sugar-Slinger's den where the Singing Crystal is being kept. I need to sneak my way through and steal it.
I need to place the jewel in the mural and see if that truly completes the Rithana-di-Renada like Rajhin claims.
I acquired the Singing Crystal. I should return to the House of Histories.

I need to accompany Captain Nala-do and Zamarak into the sewer so we can locate the door to the crypts. From there, we can find a way up into the palace and rendezvous with the rest of the strike force.
Now I should meet Captain Nala-do at the north weapons platform so I can destroy the siege weapons stationed there.
I must travel to Cath Bedraud in Glenumbra in order to help train Northern Elsweyr Defense Force recruits to defeat skeletons.
I showed a Northern Elsweyr Defense Force recruit how to defeat skeletons. I should return to Zahari and see what else she needs.
I must talk to Captain Shideya. She will pair me with a fledgling Khajiit warrior who will observe how I deal with powerful monsters.
I must travel to the Stonechewer Goblin Camp in Stormhaven in order to help train Northern Elsweyr Defense Force recruits to defeat Goblins.
I showed a Northern Elsweyr Defense Force recruit how to defeat Goblins. I should return to Zahari and see what else she needs.
I must talk to Captain Shideya. She will pair me with a fledgling Khajiit warrior who will observe how I deal with powerful monsters.
I must travel to Rootwater Grove in Greenshade in order to help train Northern Elsweyr Defense Force recruits to defeat lurchers.
I showed a Northern Elsweyr Defense Force recruit how to defeat lurchers. I should return to Zahari and see what else she needs.
I must talk to Captain Shideya. She will pair me with a fledgling Khajiit warrior who will observe how I deal with powerful monsters.
I must travel to Loriasel in Shadowfen in order to help train Northern Elsweyr Defense Force recruits to defeat lamia.
I showed a Northern Elsweyr Defense Force recruit how to defeat lamia. I should return to Zahari and see what else she needs.
I must talk to Captain Shideya. She will pair me with a fledgling Khajiit warrior who will observe how I deal with powerful monsters.
The door ahead should lead up into Rimmen Palace. We should go in and rendezvous with the rest of the strike force.
Zahari asked me to travel to Stormcrag Crypt, a Nord burial site in Eastmarch, and look for a scroll with information on fighting Dragons in its depths.
I found a scroll with techniques for fighting Dragons. I should return the scroll to Zahari so she can forward such techniques to the Northern Elsweyr Defense Force.
Zahari asked me to travel to Icehammer Vault, a Nord burial site in Eastmarch, and look for a scroll with information on fighting Dragons in its depths.
I found a scroll with techniques for fighting Dragons. I should return the scroll to Zahari so she can forward such techniques to the Northern Elsweyr Defense Force.
Zahari asked me to travel to Shroud Hearth Barrow, a Nord burial site in the Rift, and look for a scroll with information on fighting Dragons in its depths.
I found a scroll with techniques for fighting Dragons. I should return the scroll to Zahari so she can forward such techniques to the Northern Elsweyr Defense Force.
I should talk to <<1>> in Rimmen about what these tasks entail.
<<1>> gave me some valuable information about the various jobs her associates are offering. I should let her know that I'm interested in the work.
I defeated the vampire guardian blocking my way through the temple. I need to continue onward and catch up with Renald.
Renald confronted Nisaazda and forced her to retreat deeper into Moongrave Fane, but not before she commanded a fiery gargoyle to prevent our pursuit.
Renald defeated Grundwulf in combat, but Nisaazda ambushed Renald before he could resolve his feud with his former comrade. It is up to me to stop Grundwulf and Nisaazda now.
Grundwulf and the Dragon are dead and the Hollowfang clan are decimated. I should speak to <<1>> now that the threat has passed.
I defeated Nisaazda's gargoyle. I should join Renald's pursuit into Moonlight's Mausoleum.
Renald asked me to distract the Hollowfangs, by invading their stronghold through a hole in the wall to the west and fighting my way to the temple.
I found an entrance to the temple but the Hollowfang's leader, Nisaazda, animated an enormous stone sentinel from the ruins. I must destroy it to continue inside.
Renald went on ahead to find Grundwulf. He asked me to follow, but a monstrous Khajiit vampire bars my path. I must defeat Dro'zakar to pass.
I should talk to Chevalier Renald at Moongrave Fane.
Nisaazda is dead, but Grundwulf escaped and Renald is gravely wounded. I will have to carry on the pursuit on my own.
I could not stop Grundwulf from drinking Dragon's blood. As Renald feared, he's been overwhelmed by its power and is consumed with insatiable bloodlust. I have no choice but to fight now.
I need to complete Moongrave Fane.
I defeated my foes in Moongrave Fane.\n\nI should find <<1>> in my alliance's capital city.
<<1>> presented me with another challenge: Use the Sangiin Hemo Helot on Grundwulf before engaging him in battle.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
With Selene's help, we fought Maarselok, who retreated. Now we need to find the Dragon again.
The Azureblight Cancroid is oozing it corruption throughout the cavern. We need to destroy it and slow the spread of the blight.
Maarselok is recovering from the last fight in some old ruins. We should try to kill him again.
With Selene's help, we killed Maarselok. I should talk to Allanwen.
We destroyed the Azureblight Cancroid, but we will need to find and defeat Maarselok to truly put an end to the Azure Blight.
The Wood Elf named Gadnalon convinced the mage to help kill the Dragon, but the nature spirit may take more convincing. I need to help by clearing a path to Selene.
Selene said she would help us, but then attacked after Carindon released her. I need to defeat her.
We found Maarselok flying along the side of the mountain. We must destroy him.
Maarselok got away again but suffered a lot of damage. We must pursue him to his lair.
We found Maarselok in his lair. With Selene's help, we should finally kill him.
To complete my pledge, I must destroy the Dragon, Maarselok, within its lair.
I successfully ventured through the corruption to defeat the Dragon, Maarselok, within its lair.\n\nI should find <<1>> in my alliance's capital city.
<<1>> presented me with another challenge: cleanse the Seeds of Corruption before killing Maarselok.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
A great gold Dragon claims to be the god Alkosh and rules over the faithful of Sunspire with two other Dragons. I have been asked to present myself before them.
I defeated the false Alkosh and liberated Sunspire from the Dragons. I should speak to Azin-jo now that he knows the truth.
I defeated the false Alkosh and liberated Sunspire from the Dragons. I should speak to Azin-jo now that he knows the truth.
I defeated the false Alkosh and liberated Sunspire from the Dragons. I should speak to Azin-jo now that he knows the truth.
A great gold Dragon claims to be the god Alkosh and rules over the faithful of Sunspire with two other Dragons. I have been asked to present myself before them.
A great gold Dragon claims to be the god Alkosh and rules over the faithful of Sunspire with two other Dragons. I have been asked to present myself before them.
I took teeth from the false Alkosh after casting him down. I should give them to Azin-jo.
I took teeth from the false Alkosh after casting him down. I should give them to Azin-jo.
I cut out the tongue of the false Alkosh after casting him down. I should give it to Azin-jo.
Natrada said she'd take me to Priestess Shalani at Sunspire, but suggested we assemble a large group before departing.
Natrada told me I could ride her cart to Sunspire. It's waiting in Rimmen.
I found a notice inviting visitors to explore the House of Histories, a museum of Khajiiti culture in Riverhold. I should stop by and speak with the owner, Iraya.
I gathered the Arkay's lash blossom. I should give the flower to Iokkas.
Zumog Phoom has trapped Cadwell inside some kind of necromantic spell. I need to destroy the necromantic glass that focuses the spell in order to free him.
I should speak to <<1>>.
I need to gather the ancestor's burial urn so that I can bring it to Saviwa's family tomb.
I need to bring the burial urn to Saviwa's family tomb, so that his ancestor's spirit can be at peace.

Rajhin told me about the Singing Cyrstal, an enchanted jewel that allows the mural to sing. It's currently in the den of a smuggler called Sugar-Slinger. I should speak to Qa'jahd, who's just north of Riverhold, to travel there.
I need to place Saviwa's ancestor's urn with the others, so that his spirit can be at peace.
I need to talk to Jora-ri to make sure his spirit will be at peace in this tomb.
I need to gather Jora-ri's urn so that we can find the proper tomb.
I need to help Jora-ri find the right tomb within the necropolis.
I need to place Jora-ri's urn to make sure this is where he belongs.
I need to talk to Jora-ri to make sure his spirit can rest at peace in this tomb.
I need to keep searching for Jora-ri's resting place.
I need to help Jora-ri find his final resting place.
I need to explore this tomb to help Jora-ri find his final resting place.
I need to talk to Jora-ri to make sure this is his final resting place.
I need to place Jora-ri's burial urn with the others so that his spirit can be at peace.
Iokkas needs the blossom of the cactus Arkay's lash to complete his antidote. I should look for it.
I should talk to Saviwa to let him know we found Jora-ri's final resting place.
Khamira believes there is one more temple relic to activate to complete her attunement to the Lunar Lattice. I need to help her find it.
Cadwell appeared and seems to be back to his old self. I should talk to him.
I rescued Iokkas' companions and found his egg-mother's research. I should return to the cave entrance and make sure they all made it.
With Mazdurr free, there's no reason to stick around. I should head outside the Tangle.
I defeated the Nereid. I should return to Iokkas' camp and speak to him.
After I killed his bodyguard, Khasda fled. I should untie Tasnasi and make sure she's all right.
Tasnasi wasted no time going after Khasda after I released her. She chased him through his escape tunnel. I should follow her.
I need to find Rideza and confront her about Zinthia's abduction.
I found the ossuary that Yushiha spoke of. I should search for any survivors from the caravan attack and help them.
I disrupted the Daedric summoning rituals taking place in Darkpool Mine. I should inform Nisuzi of my success and claim my reward.
I must disrupt the cultists' Daedric summoning rituals by extinguishing their ritual braziers.
Vazbi found a torn adept's habit at the site of the second aqueduct gate. I should examine it.
I reached the temple where Renald said he'd rendezvous with me. I should dispatch the Hollowfangs occupying Moongrave Fane and search the area.
I defeated the Stonekeeper construct and disabled the remaining traps. Nothing stands between the Wrathstone and us now. I should speak to <<1>> about what we have found.
I destroyed the guardian of Garlas Malatar and found a path out of the Ayleid ruins. I should speak to <<1>> outside <<2>>.
Using the information provided by Battlereeve Tanerline, I should hunt down a Dragon and kill them.
I defeated enough Dragons. I should return to <<1>> and collect my reward.
I should go to K'har Zhab Hall in Riverhold and meet with Abnur Tharn and the war council.
We reached the Greenleaf Farm. Now I should locate the farmer Tsazii and convince her to move her family into the town.
I should talk to Marthine and make sure everyone is all right.
I should gather supplies and information for the flu survivors.
I should enter Orcrest and search for Marthine's belongings to see if they lead me to him.
I should talk to the city's survivors to see if they know where to find Marthine.
The Dragonhorn drove off the Dragons. Now I should talk to Khamira and determine what we need to do next.
I gathered food, water, and healing supplies, as well as information. Now I should bring them to the flu survivors.
I helped the flu survivors. Now I should see if they'll free Marthine.
Zumog Phoom entered the throne room. I should listen to what he has to say to Euraxia.
I should travel to Rimmen in Northern Elsweyr and speak to Felande about the inn room located within the Sugar House.
Felande has offered me a free inn room at the Sugar House in Rimmen. I should speak to her to learn more about the offer.
I've agreed to become Felande's newest tenant. I should speak to her to finalize the deal.
After disrupting a few Euraxian supply camps, Captain Nala-do signaled for me to talk to her. I should go and see what she wants.
I should talk to Marthine to find out exactly what happened.
I should talk to Marthine and make sure everyone is all right.
I should unlock Marthine's cage and set him free.
Sereyne needs me to get her arcane focus, which she pawned to two pawnbrokers, Scipion and Iulius Averno. I can find them in the Goiter's Gulp.
Sereyne told me that Tasnasi wants me to avoid killing any of the guards while I cross the courtyard.
I need to escape Orcrest with Marthine and the flu survivors.
I should talk to Marthine and make sure everyone is all right.
I should locate Abnur Tharn in the royal study and see if he's learned anything about Euraxia's final order.

I need to help Abnur Tharn search through the documents in the royal study to find out whatever we can concerning the Dragons, the necromancers, and the so-called final order issued by Euraxia just before she died.
Abnur Tharn wants me to look for Prefect Calo, who's being held somewhere in the manor house. The prefect should be able to tell us more about the Dragonguard and the final order issued by Euraxia.
Abnur Tharn appeared before me as a magical projection. I should speak with him.
I should explore the cellar and find a way to reach the main floor of the manor house.
The report indicates there might be a surviving member of the Dragonguard hiding in an Akaviri shrine in the Scar. I should find Abnur Tharn and tell him what I discovered.
The Mane's envoy wants to talk to me. I should find out what she wants.
We successfully defended Riverhold from Euraxia's forces. Now I should talk to Abnur Tharn so we can figure out our next move.
I must collect ancient Khajiiti scrolls stored in the Desert Wind Caverns.
I collected the ancient Khajiiti scrolls. I should take them back to Nisuzi so I can claim my reward.
I must search the Abode of Ignominy for three magic trinkets.
I gathered the magic trinkets that Nisuzi requested. I should deliver them to her and claim my reward.
I must hunt down the beasts of Predator Mesa, collect their blood, then smear it on Hircine's altars to gain his approval.
I must kill beasts on Predator Mesa to collect their blood.
I honored Hircine as Nisuzi asked. I should return to her and claim my reward.
I found Abnur Tharn, but it looks like he's getting ready to leave. I should talk to him and deliver the Mane's letter.
The magic yowling-powder Nisuzi gave me should break this minotaur-beckoning enchantment. I must sprinkle a pinch of it on all the affected relics.
I dispelled the magic on the relics, as Nisuzi asked. I should return to Rimmen and claim my reward.
I must search the Tangle to find and harvest Nisuzi's rare Samar Pekoe tea leaves.
I gathered the rare tea that Nisuzi requested. I should deliver it to her and claim my reward.
The throne room is full of people waiting to see Khamira officially become the queen of Anequina. First, though, Gharesh-ri wants to talk to me. I should see what he needs.
Captain Nala-do waits near the palace in Rimmen. I need to meet up with her so we can disable the siege weapons aimed into the city.
According to the journal, the keg belongs to the Wood Elf Melleron. I should gather the keg.
I returned the keg of sweet rotmeth brew to Melleron. I should speak to him about my reward.
I found Melleron. I should speak to him about the keg of sweet rotmeth brew.
I gathered the journal and keg. I should return them to Melleron. According to his journal, I'm likely to find him in the Stitches.
I should read the note in order to find out more about the owner of this lost keg.
Jakarn arrived as I was speaking with Tu'heiba. I should conclude my business with him and see what happens next.
If I want to learn more about the job Jakarn mentioned, I should meet him in Rimmen's tavern, the Sugar Bowl.
Two angry Khajiit emerged from the building that Jakarn leapt out of. If I talk to them, perhaps I can learn more about what's going on.

To recover the Jewel of Baan Dar, we must first free Jakarn's friend, Fez'skar. Unfortunately, he's being held prisoner by a nomadic crime boss named Tu'heiba. I can find Tu'heiba's current location on the bottom of a barrel lid in Rimmen's sewers.

According to the note I found in Rimmen's sewers, Tu'heiba and her retinue recently set camp near Darkpool Mine, a sulfur pit. I should return to the Sugar Bowl and deliver this information to Jakarn.

While I explored the sewers, Jakarn raised enough gold to secure Fez'skar's release. Given Jakarn's strained relationship with Tu'heiba, I need to deliver the payment in his stead. I can find Tu'heiba near Darkpool Mine in southwestern Elsweyr.
Tu'heiba translated the slave trader's ledger. Apparently, the trader sold Fez'skar to a gang of bandits based in the Tangle. I should find Jakarn and let him know what I learned.
Jakarn seems confident we can free Fez'skar from his captors in the Tangle. The first step is finding him.
I found Fez'skar standing on a spike plate. I should speak to him to find out why he hasn't fled.
Fez'skar hasn't told us the location of the Jewel of Baan Dar yet. I can force him to tell us where to find it before I free him, or free him without extorting him for the jewel's location.
After we freed him, Fez'skar knocked me out with some sort of sleeping gas and escaped. I should speak to Jakarn about our next move.

Jakarn revealed that Fez'skar grew up in the Stitchesâ€”a cliff-side settlement overlooking the Scar. He suspects that Fez'skar may have hidden the Jewel of Baan Dar there. He suggested we split up and search the Stitches for Fez'skar.
I found Fez'skar standing on the edge of a platform waving a sword at Jakarn. He seems agitated. I should watch him carefully.
Fez'skar leapt to his death in an attempt to reach the Jewel of Ban Daar on a distant ledge. Now Jakarn looks like he's going to jump, too. I need to convince him that isn't a good idea.
When I reached the Goiter's Gulp, I found Tu'heiba and her thugs waiting for me. I should speak to them to ensure there's no more trouble.
The gambler who accosted Jakarn as he tried to leave chased him out of the Sugar Bowl, obviously enraged. It might be worth asking her about what happened.

Tu'heiba sold Fez'skar to a sulfur-mining labor camp inside Darkpool Mine. Unfortunately, cultists sacked the mine.To locate Fez'skar, I need to find the slave trader's ledger somewhere inside the mine.
I found the slave trader's ledger, but the former owner encoded its contents. I should take the ledger to Tu'heiba to see if she can translate it.

According to Fez'skar, if he shifts his weight, the spike plate will activate and impale him. To free Fez'skar, I must disarm the trap with a special key. The key is in a chest deeper inside the Tangle.
I found the key that can safely disarm the spike plate. I should return to Fez'skar and deliver the good news.
Fez'skar escaped the spike plate without triggering the trap. Now he should lead us to the Jewel of Baan Dar.
I need to steal the ledger from the Goiter's Gulp in the Stitches, an idol from Rimmen, and silk clothing from merchants near the Valenwood Gate.
I stole the offerings for Rajhin. I should bring them to Humble Zaham.
I must disarm the spike plate mechanism using the key before Fez'skar can step off and escape.

I successfully talked Jakarn off the ledge. He isn't going to jump after the jewel now, but seems saddened by the death of his friend. He asked for some time to mourn and suggested I meet him at the Goiter's Gulpâ€”a tavern in the Stitches.
Khamira requested my presence at Rimmen Palace. I should go there and talk to her.
I found Zargha trying to capture "butterflies" inside of a terror bird's nest. He'll be torn apart if I don't intervene.
The Bonechime poachers must have taken the rest of Numaia's beasts inside the outpost. I should gain entry and search inside.
The Bonechime poachers probably caged Numaia's senche lioness, Sugar-Belly, in the outpost somewhere. I need to find and free her.
Empowering the Moonlight Blade requires absorbing the souls of defeated undead.
The Bonechime poachers probably took the rest of Numaia's beasts inside their outpost. I should gain entry and search inside.

Chef Donolon will make me a special Jubilee Cake, but I need to bring him the ingredients he needs to prepare a fresh one. I need to gather or buy bananas, flour, and honey and bring them back to the chef.
It looks like Chef Donolon has completed my cake. I should talk to him so I can claim it.
Many ingredients can be purchased from local vendors.
I can collect my cake by finding the baker and his bakery barge in the ports of Vulkhel Guard, Davon's Watch, and the Harbor District of Daggerfall.
I gave Chef Donolon the ingredients he requested. Now I just need to wait for him to complete my Jubilee Cake.
I brought the final ingredient for Iokkas to create the antidote. I should wait for him to finish making the antidote so I can drink it.
A Khajiit named Lyrrsazhi asked me to meet Abnur Tharn in Riverhold's town hall.
I need to go to the throne room in Rimmen Palace to speak with Khamira.
Cadwell used one of his portals to leap into Zumog Phoom's lair. I should talk to Abnur Tharn and see if he has any idea how we can follow him.
I should travel to Riverhold Marketplace, and retrieve Rigurt's missing package from a cloth merchant named Thadarra.
I should bring Rigurt's mysteriously smelly package to the Stitches, so that he can present it to Canonreeve Juz-do of Alabaster, a representative of Queen Ayrenn.
I should gather honey flowers from Merryvale Moon-Sugar Farms to replace Rigurt's stolen honey.
I should bring the honey flowers to Rigurt at Merryvale Farms, so that he can bake his special sweetbread.
I should find the famous Khajiit sweetmaker, Asaldak, by the Merryvale Farms fountain, and ask him to sample Rigurt's sweetbread.
I should talk to Rigurt at Merryvale Farms to make sure he's finished baking his sweetbread.
I should find the Screaming Mammoths so that they can perform a song for Lady Izza. They were last seen in Valenwood Gate.
I should talk to the Screaming Mammoths' lead bard to find out what happened to them.
I should bring the Screaming Mammoths' instruments to Rigurt back in Rimmen, so that we can play song for Lady Izza.
I should play the traditional Nordic love ballad, "Our Love is like a Troll Skull" to impress Lady Izza.
I should play Skullchucker's drum to start our performance.
I should speak to the true Lady Izza to figure out what's happening.
I should say goodbye to Rigurt after our somewhat successful diplomatic mission.
I should let Iraya know that I found the Singing Crystal.
Thadarra paid a delivery fee to the courier who brought Rigurt's package. I can choose to reimburse Thadarra for the fee, or intimidate her to save my gold.
We found a scarf and moldy moon-sugar in another smuggler's camp. Mizzik wants me to speak to Ishu about these new developments. I should head to his house.
I should gather the Screaming Mammoths' instruments, so that Rigurt and I can play a love ballad for Lady Izza in their absence.
I found the final temple relic. I need to activate it to help Khamira complete the process of attunement to the Lunar Lattice.
I found a strange relic tied to the moons. Khamira says this might be what the Betrayer seeks. I should examine it.
I should speak to Sheogorath to see what he wants to teach me.
Sheogorath has Volendrung, a legendary Daedric artifact belonging to Malacath. I should travel to Cheesemonger's Hollow to use it.
I should take Volendrung from the weapon rack.
I should speak to Sheogorath to learn more about Volendrung.
Sheogorath offered to let me use Volendrung during the Three Banners War in Cyrodiil, but it will cost me my soul. I should speak to him to finish our business.

I defeated enough summoned soldiers and target dummies to satisfy Sheogorath. I can now return Volendrung, continue to destroy soldiers with it, or, if I wait too long without killing, allow the weapon to devour my soul.
Khamira wants me to activate the temple relic in the sanctuary. She believes the power released by the relic can be used to restore the Dragonhorn of Anequina.
I arrived at the Sepulcher of Mischance to find Abnur Tharn waiting outside for me. I should talk to him and find out where Zamarak and Prefect Calo are.
Cadwell seems trapped in one of his visions, seeing through the eyes of Cadwell the Betrayer. I should talk to him and see if I can help him in some way.
I should follow Vastarie into the Ashen Scar. She might be able to provide some more information on what's going on here.
Something seems to be weakening Vastarie. I should talk to her.
I found Vastarie struggling against the power of a glowing, nightmarish orb. I must destroy it!
I found Sizenza in the temple's courtyard reliving some sort of delusion the Skooma Cat is showing her. I should try to snap her out of it.
I need to check the fields around Rimmen and burn all of the wasp nests.
I should tell <<1>> that I burned all of the wasp nests and found his guar.
I should stop the Senche-raht from eating Hadamnargo's guar.
I showed the Skooma Cat a bottle of cream that seemed to pique his interest. I should put some out to tempt him away from Sizenza.
I found something that might be of interest to the Skooma Cat, I should show it to him and see how he reacts.
I arrived at the temple summit. Vastarie senses some kind of spirit lurking here. I should have a look around.
I should pick up the bottle of white wine.
I should find the bottle of red wine.
I should find the bottle of obscure wine.
I found all three bottles of wine. I should bring them to <<1>> in the Stitches and receive the reward.
I should talk to <<1>> and receive my reward.
I killed the pariah and retrieved the scrolls. Now I should claim my reward.
I should kill <<1>> and retrieve the stolen scrolls.
I defeated <<1>> and gathered some mementos from her fallen challengers. I should return to Ri'hirr in Rimmen to claim my reward.
I must kill the <<1>> and gather mementos from her fallen challengers.
I killed Wily Kee'va and rescued the traders' camels. I should return to Ri'hirr and share the good news.
I must kill Wily Kee'va and rescue the camels that she corralled into Talon Gulch.
I could ask for more information.
I found something that might be of interest to the Skooma Cat, I should show it to him and see how he reacts.
The Skooma Cat seemed powerfully fixated on the ball of yarn I brought to him. I should toss it out of the room to lead him away from Sizenza.
Empowering the Moonlight Blade requires absorbing the souls of defeated undead.
Empowering the Moonlight Blade requires absorbing the souls of defeated undead.
Lyrrsazhi brought me a message. She says Khamira wants to see me at Rimmen Palace.

Before I meet Tharn and Khamira at the Defense Force camp, Tharn wants me to investigate the sites of several surges of power he detected. He thinks they might point to someone who could help usâ€”Sir Cadwell. He marked these locations on my map.
While investigating the sites that Tharn marked on my map, I was accosted by someone who followed me. I should talk to him and see if he noticed anything else at the sites.
I should look for <<1>>'s missing guar.
I should find wild game for <<1>> to keep him from eating the guar.
I should bring this wild game to <<1>> so that he doesn't eat the guar.
Dragons are trying to enter the Moon Gate, but Abnur Tharn's magic is holding them at bay. Khamira urged me to use the Dragonhorn. I should sound it and see what happens.
I killed the legendary dro-m'Athra, <<1>>, and returned the funeral urns to their rightful resting place. I should return to <<2>> and claim my reward.
I should kill <<1>> and return the funeral urns to the ruins.
I should return the funeral urns to their resting place.
A Dragon blasted a hole in the rock wall and now Euraxian soldiers are swarming in. I need to defeat the Euraxians and stop the breach.
I stopped the first Euraxian incursion. Now to continue to climb toward the Moon Gate so I can join up with Abnur Tharn and Khamira.
More Euraxian soldiers have breached the wall. I need to stop them from overwhelming us.
I stopped another Euraxian incursion. Now to continue to climb toward the Moon Gate so I can join up with Abnur Tharn and Khamira.
We learned that bandits in the Tangle are holding Fez'skar. Jakarn asked me to meet him there so we can free Fez'skar from captivity.
Jakarn waits outside the Tangle. If I have questions, I can ask them now. If not, I can head straight into the bandit lair.
I caught up to Rakazsa, who was arguing with Yushiha. He was not swayed by her argument and dared us to pursue him. I should speak to Yushiha about what to do next.
I killed Rakazsa and Yushiha instructed me to follow her to where she took the caravanners we rescued. I should meet her there.
I should use Rourken's Rebuke on a Heavy Xivkyn target dummy to satisfy Sheogorath.
I should use Malacath's Vengeance on a Light Xivkyn target dummy to satisfy Sheogorath.
I should use Accursed Charge on a horde of gibbering idiots to satisfy Sheogorath.
I should charge Volendrung by killing gibbering idiots, then use Ruinous Cyclone on the horde to satisfy Sheogorath.
I should defeat a Light Xivkyn Dummy to show Sheogorath that I know how to wield Volendrung.
Pahleena has pointed me towards Iokkas. I should speak to him and learn more about the situation.
In order to save Iokkas' companions, I need to first help him make an antidote. He'll need samples from the diseased corpses that haunt the ruins of Cicatrice. I should enter the ruins.
Mizzik needs a moment to collect our reward. I should meet him back at the Banished Regrets Inn.
Aneshi wrote down directions to where he hid the master key to the palace. I should gather the note and read what it says.
I must kill Na'ruzz the Boneweaver and dig up the cursed charms he's buried in the Bone Pits.
I killed Na'ruzz and dug up his cursed charms, as promised. I should return to Ri'hirr and claim my reward.
I need to kill Akumjhargo and Za'vi, and destroy their hidden cache of contraband goods.
I destroyed the contraband and its owners. I should share the good news with Ri'hirr and claim my reward.
The Mane's envoy asked me to deliver a sealed letter from the Mane to Abnur Tharn. I'll need to find Tharn before I can deliver the letter.
I received a message to report to Khamira at Rimmen Palace. I should go and speak to her.
I must kill Thannar the Graveprowler and use the quieting balm Ri'hirr gave me to settle the restless dead.
I killed Thannar and settled the restless dead. I should return to Ri'hirr to inform him of my success.
Using the information provided by Battlereeve Tanerline, I should hunt down a Dragon and kill them.
I defeated enough Dragons. I should return to <<1>> and collect my reward.
Khamira told me to use the Dragonhorn and direct it at Kaalgrontiid. I should sound it now.
Locate Distractions
Now that I've destroyed the anchor's guardian, I should approach the anchor itself and find out how to destroy it.
I was asked to look for a Khajiit sorcerer near the Abode of Ignominy.
I recovered <<1>>'s belongings from the Ruddy Fang bandits. She told me she'd be waiting for me in Riverhold. I should speak to her.
I should look for <<1>>'s belongings in the Ruddy Fang camp.
I should check on the Khajiit outside of the Akaviri tomb.
I entered the smuggler's lair, a large cavern underneath Riverhold. I should continue to search for Rideza.
I met with Gharesh-ri, Zamarak and Prefect Calo about the battle for the Moon Gate. I should return to the palace in Rimmen and let Khamira know they're all right.
We stopped Selene's attempt to escape. Now we need to track down the Dragon.
I should seek out and kill enemy Necromancers.
I have slain 20 enemy Necromancers. I should return to the bounty board at the Southern High Rock gate to claim my reward.
I should seek out and kill enemy Necromancers.
I have slain 20 enemy Necromancers. I should return to the bounty board at the Northern Morrowind gate to claim my reward.
I have slain 20 enemy Necromancers. I should return to the bounty board at the Eastern Elsweyr gate to claim my reward.
I should seek out and kill enemy Necromancers.
Abnur Tharn and Khamira emerged from the portal. I should talk to Abnur and find out why he brought us all together.

Abnur Tharn believes Kaalgrontiid is preparing to ascend to godhood on an island off Elweyr's southern coast, but powerful magic protects the place. We need to go to the New Moon Fortress and determine how the cultists travel to and from the island.
We entered the New Moon Fortress. I should head for the amphitheater and determine if the cultists possess a method for reaching Kaalgrontiid's island.
While searching for the amphitheater, we heard Kaalgrontiid address his followers. We should attempt to locate the Dragon before he escapes.
We found Kaalgrontiid in the New Moon Fortress. We should confront him.
I should wait while Tharn uses the energized aeonstones to open the portal to Kaalgrontiid's island, Dragonhold.
Abnur Tharn opened the portal to Dragonhold. We need to enter the portal and find a way to lower the island's defenses so that the rest of the Dragonguard can join us there.
The portal that Abnur Tharn opened deposited us in an ancient structure of some sort. I should speak to Tharn and see how he wants us to proceed.
We need to explore these ancient ruins and find a way to lower the aegis, the magical defenses that protect the island of Dragonhold.
We found a tapestry within the ancient ruins and Tharn wants to examine it. I should ask him if his examination yielded any important information.
The Dragon Joorahmaar ordered the cultists to keep feeding the ritual sites. Finding the source of the magic protecting the island needs to wait. The ritual sites must be destroyed.
We need to continue to explore these ancient ruins and find the aegis, the source of the magic that's protecting this island.
I destroyed the ritual sites. Now I need to continue my search for the aegis, the source of the magic that protects Dragonhold.
Abnur Tharn and I attracted the attention of one of Kaalgrontiid's Dragons. I should protect Tharn while he deals with the Dragon Joorahmaar.
Tharn thinks the wounded Dragon will lead us to the aegis, the source of Dragonhold's defenses. We should follow it and see where it leads.
We discovered another tapestry. I should talk to Abnur Tharn and see what he makes of the images it depicts.
Something is happening to Dragonhold. The tremors strike with more regularity and intensity. We need to find the aegis, the source of the island's defenses, and destroy it while we still can.
The wounded Dragon Joorahmaar guards the aegis. I need to deal with the Dragon while Tharn attempts to destroy the aegis and lower the island's defenses. Then we can worry about Kaalgrontiid.

I killed the wounded Dragon while Tharn destroyed the aegis and removed the magic that protected the island. Kaalgrontiid, meanwhile, caused the island to start to rise into the sky. We need to find a way off Dragonhold before it shakes itself apart.
Abnur Tharn created a portal to get me off the island, but he remained behind. Dragonhold has risen into the sky. I need to find Khamira and Sai Sahan and let them know what happened.
Sai Sahan and Khamira seem at a loss for how to get the Dragonguard to the island. I should talk to Sai and see if I can help.
I returned to the Dragonguard Sanctum. I should let Sai Sahan know what happened.
Za'ji showed up after I spoke with Nahfahlaar, curious about our next mission. I should let him know about our task.
Za'ji believes a temple in the village of Black Heights can help us find Yahgrondu. I should meet him there.
Kasura requested that I meet her in one of the nearby cities. I should head there now.

Kasura says I must first activate three glyphs to determine which glyphs in a series will reveal the entrance to the tomb. I should head to the spots she marked on my map and activate these glyphs. I can consult her notes for more information.
Kasura asked me to search a Dragonguard tomb, but the entrance is currently hidden. I should read her notes for more information.
I know which three glyphs will reveal the entrance to the tomb, but I need to determine the proper order to activate them in.
I activated the proper glyphs and revealed the tomb's door. I should enter and search for anything that appears useful.
I found a map to a Dragonguard sanctuary. I should exit the tomb, find Kasura, and let her know what I discovered.
Kasura wants me to accompany her to the Abbey of Blades, located in the Valley of Blades, to present the maps we found to her former student.
I arrived at the Abbey of Blades in the Dragontail Mountains. Kasura wants me to present the maps we found to her former student.

Sai Sahan finished studying one of the maps and now knows the location of the Wind Scour Temple. Its entrance lies within HoonDing's Watch in Alik'r. I can ride the horse Sai provided or make my own way there.

Sai believes the Horn of Ja'darri would help us fight back against the Dragon invasion. The journal states the Dragonhorn may be in Storm Talon Temple. We'll find its entrance within Aphren's Hold in Stormhaven. I should head there next.
Once I lit the braziers in the proper order, a grappling point lifted out of the floor. I can use it to reach the Dragonguard archives.
I made my way to the Dragonguard archives. Now, I must search the tomes to see if there's anything that can help us fight against Dragons.
I need to use my grappling bow to reach the Dragonguard archives. I  should be careful where I grapple to, as there may be only one path forward.
I used the grappling bow to reach the Dragonguard archives. I don't see any relics nearby, but I should try to find more clues about the Horn of Ja'darri.
The journal we found indicates the Dark Water Temple is located south of Windhelm, in Eastmarch. I should travel there and try to find the entrance.
I found the entrance to Dark Water Temple. I should head inside.
Like the other two sanctuaries, there doesn't seem to be an obvious way forward. I should search the bookshelves near the entrance for clues.
I found a letter with a riddle describing a path over the chasm. Meanwhile, Sai Sahan has discovered a grappling point leading to an urn. I should use my grappling bow to reach the urn and search it.
The letter said I should take the dust of "our fallen foe" and "offer it to the altar." I should try using the Dragonbone powder on the altar and see if a pathway is revealed.
The Dragonbone powder revealed an invisible path over the water. If I follow the trail revealed by the powder, I should be able to travel deeper into the sanctuary.
I found the Dark Water Temple's archives, but there's no sign of the Horn of Ja'darri. I should see if I can find any information about the Dragonhorn.

I found another journal written by the Dragonguard commander who long ago sought the Horn of Ja'darri. It says that the horn was stolen by a Dragon, whose lair is in Southern Elsweyr. I should let Sai know this new information.
Sai Sahan wants to return to the Abbey of Blades to plan and check in with Kasura. I should meet him there.
I should let Kasura know what we discovered in the Dragonguard sanctuaries.
Sai Sahan has returned to the Abbey of Blades. I should speak to him about our next step in finding the Horn of Ja'darri.
Clan Mother Tadali is furous with Za'ji and has refused to hear his request. I should speak to her and see if I can convince her to help us find Yahgrondu.
Clan Mother Tadali said she would help if we returned a temple bell that Za'ji stole. I should ask Za'ji what happened to it.
We entered Wind Scour Temple, but its archives appear to be unreachable. I should see what Sai thinks about the situation.
Sai Sahan believes that we must light the braziers in a specific order to reach the archives. I should read the plaques in front of the statues to see if they offer any clues.
The infamous skooma lord, Bahzahar the Bull, has the temple bell. I should locate his hideout in Moonlit Cove and retrieve it.
Bahzahar's hideout is located somewhere in Moonlit Cove. I should search for the hideout's entrance.
The hideout's entrance is locked tight. I should speak to Za'ji about this.
I acquired the key to Bahzahar's hideout. I should head inside and see if I can find the temple bell.
I made my way into Bahzahar's hideout. I should search for the temple bell.
Clan Mother Tadali asked me to return the temple bell to its hook so that it may ring with its counterparts. I should do so.
Something seems to be wrong with the temple bell. I should ask Clan Mother Tadali what the problem is.
The temple bell must be magically cleansed to return it to its proper tune. I should listen to Clan Mother Tadali in order to learn how to cleanse it.
Za'ji interrupted Clan Mother Tadali's explanation, causing her to storm off in a huff. I should talk to Za'ji to see if he knows how to cleanse the temple bell.
Za'ji admits he isn't sure how to cleanse the temple bell, but he's going to improvise. I should see what he does.
Za'ji pressed a pedestal and the small temple bells began to ring in a certain order, causing colorful symbols to light. Perhaps there's something nearby that can help cleanse the tarnished bell.
By hitting the larger bells in the courtyard to match the smaller bells' song, I cleansed the tarnished bell. Clan Mother Tadali has returned. I should speak to her.
Clan Mother Tadali agreed to use the power of the temple bells to find the Dragon Yahgrondu. I should listen to what she says.
Clan Mother Tadali said that Yahgrondu is in a mine. I should search for it.
The quarry is overrun by Dragon cultists. I should enter the mine beneath the cliffs and see if I can find Yahgrondu.
Laatvulon is in the mine, and he's arguing with another Dragon. Is that Yahgrondu? I should head deeper into the mine and see what's happening.
Laatvulon killed Yahgrondu and a mysterious Khajiiti necromancer raised him as an undead Dragon. I must defend myself and defeat the now undead Yahgrondu.

Nahfahlaar can't think of any other Dragons that might be willing to ally with us, so we must fight Laatvulon with the forces we have. I should return to the Dragonguard Sanctum and let Sai Sahan know where we stand.
I know which three glyphs will reveal the entrance to the Dragonguard tomb. I should head to the spot marked on my map now.
I returned to the Dragonguard Sanctum. I should let Sai Sahan know what happened.
The Wall of Life is restored and Vijari has passed on. I should speak to Adara'hai if our exorcism was successful.
Vijari has gone to the Wall of Life, located in a cave beyond the rear of town. Adara'hai asked me to help her find him and assist in any exorcism she needs to perform.
We found Vijari at the Wall of Life, but he is enthralled by some grotesque mural flowing with shadowy energies. Adara'hai told me to try snapping him out of his trance.
Khamira believes that her ancestor, Anequina Sharp-Tongue, wants me to go to Moonlit Cove. Apparently, the answer to our dilemma can be found there.
Sai Sahan asked me to talk to Khamira. He thinks her portal magic may be our only option for reaching Dragonhold, but she's reluctant to try without Abnur Tharn's guidance.
The restored tablet provided a riddle. Apparently the Khajiiti hero Khunzar-ri rests beyond the door. I should open the door and see what awaits us on the other side.
The door opened upon a large, hidden chamber. Could this be the final resting place of the hero Khunzar-ri? I should approach the sarcophagus at the far end of the chamber.
The ghost cat disappeared as I approached the sarcophagus. I should open it and see if what Khamira sent us to find is waiting inside.
The spirit that claims to be the legendary hero Khunzar-ri told me to take one of his claws from his sarcophagus and present it to Khamira.

Khamira opened a portal that she thinks will take us to the Jonelight Path. If she's right, we can reach Dragonhold from there. In case she's wrong, we're leaving the rest of the Dragonguard behind. Just in case.
Khamira's portal took us to the Jonelight Path. We need to walk the path to find where it connects to the floating island of Dragonhold.
We reached Dragonhold. Now to talk to Khamira and determine how we're going to stop Kaalgrontiid from becoming the Dark Aeon.

Nahfahlaar spotted a number of focal points around the island, aeonstones set up specifically to reflect and enhance Kaalgrontiid's power until it builds to a level to ignite his ascension. I need to destroy these focal points.
I destroyed one of Kaalgrontiid's focal points on Dragonhold. I should find and destroy any that still remain.
I destroyed another of Kaalgrontiid's focal points. I should find and destroy any that still remain.
We destroyed the Dark Aeon focal points and stopped the flow of energy to Kaalgrontiid. Now we need to reach the Dragon and make sure he can't complete his ascension.
We found Abnur Tharn. It appears he survived his time alone on the floating island. I should talk to him.

Although we destroyed the focal points, Tharn believes Kaalgrontiid will try to go ahead with his ascension anyway. But if he makes the slightest mistake, he could unleash enough energy to destroy Elsweyr and maybe all of Tamriel. We need to stop him
We reached the center of Dragonhold. Now I have to stop Kaalgrontiid once and for all.
We defeated Kaalgrontiid, but now the island is shaking apart and the aeonstone containing all of the Dark Aeon energy is about to explode. I need to talk to Abnur Tharn about how we stop this.
Khamira opened a portal. We should use it to escape Dragonhold.
I returned to the Dragonguard Sanctum and Sai Sahan wants to talk to me. I should see what he has to say.
When I opened the sarcophagus, a spectral Pahmar appeared. Could that be the spirit of Khunzar-ri? I should talk to him.
Vijari still seems to be in the grip of some dark power. I should ask Adara'hai about what's happening to him.
Sai Sahan and I found the ancient, hidden door in Moonlit Cove. I should speak to him before we open it and see what waits inside.
The door refuses to budge. Sai Sahan thinks the missing tablet pieces might be some sort of key. I should try to find them.
I recovered the tablet fragments. I should return to the hidden door and see if I can repair the broken tablet.
I have all the ingredients Dak'radhi used for his cursed paint. I should ask Adara'hai what she's planning to use them for.
Dak'radhi's memories showed me the ingredients he used to make his cursed paint. Adara'hai asked me to retrieve them and meet her at the Colorworks in Black Heights.

Sai Sahan has prepared horses to take us to the nearest port. From there, a chartered ship will take us to Southern Elsweyr. I should let Sai know when I'm ready to depart or simply use the horse he provided.
We arrived at the dormant volcano that serves as the lair of the Dragon Vahlokzin. We should tread carefully as we search for the Horn of Ja'darri.

The inside of the dormant volcano appears to be an abandoned kwama mine. Whoever formed this mine and imported the kwama is long gone, but a flourishing kwama colony remains. We should continue to search for the Dragonhorn.
Vahlokzin's powerful roars have stirred the kwama into a violent frenzy. I must defeat the kwama swarm to survive.
We need to press on and find the Horn of Ja'darri. Since Vahlokzin uses kwama as a form of defense, we need to keep an eye out for more of the creatures as we make our way toward the summit.
A raised drawbridge blocks our path. I should figure out how to use the nearby pulleys to lower the drawbridge.
A path to the summit stretches ahead, where the Horn of Ja'darri awaits us. We should keep going forward.
Sai Sahan and I must work together in order to defeat the Dragon Vahlokzin.
The Dragon Vahlokzin is dead and we have the Horn of Ja'darri. I should return to the Abbey of Blades, located in the Valley of Blades, and inform Kasura of our success.
I returned to the Abbey of Blades. I should inform Kasura about what we accomplished.
With the Horn of Ja'darri in his possession, Sai Sahan plans to fight back against the Dragons invading Elsweyr. But first, he must plan for what comes next. I should speak to him about that.
I drank the cantor's tonic and can now see a dark energy clinging to Vijari and other things connected to the source of this corruption. I should learn all I can from these residual memories.

The darkness clinging to Vijari comes from his departed father, Dak'radhi, who became a dro-m'Athra in a misguided attempt to save his son from a premature death. I need to get back to Vijari's house and inform Adara'hai.

The darkness clinging to Vijari is coming from his departed father, Dak'radhi, who became dro-m'Athra in a misguided attempt to save his son from a premature death. I should tell Adara'hai what I learned.

Adara'hai plans to have Vijari make his own paint, which she will consecrate, and use it to cleanse the mural at the Wall of Life. She asked me to clear a path for them, and ring the Khenarthic bells to signal it's safe.
I arrived at the Wall of Life and the darkness that permeated the cave has returned. I need to strike a Khenarthic bell to drive it out and signal that it's safe for the others to join me.

Adara'hai's plan is for us to enter the Passage of Dad'na Ghaten to hunt for Dak'radhi while Vijari works to cleanse the Wall of Life. The entrance is to the right of the Wall, obscured by overgrowth.
We found Dak'radhi at the end of the Passage of Dad'na Ghaten. We need to banish him back to the Dark Behind the World.
I destroyed Dak'radhi's body, but it's not enough to banish him from our world. Adara'hai told me to strike the Advent Bell to finish the exorcism.
The grotesque mural is gone and the Wall of Life is restored, but Vijari seems to be nearing the end of his life. He's asked to speak to me.
Sai Sahan has returned to the Abbey of Blades. I should speak to him.
Khamira waits for me on the coast of Southern Elsweyr. I should speak to her.
I told Sai Sahan what I learned about the Order of the New Moon. I should speak to him about my reward.
If the Dragon cult is recruiting in the city, General Renmus should know something about it. I should speak to him.
