The Advent Bell banished the Great Darkness from our world and Dak'radhi along with it. We should return to the Wall of Life and see if Vijari was able to cleanse it as well.
Sai Sahan awaits me in front of the Senchal Palace. I should speak to him.
General Renmus, leader of Senchal's military forces, could get us the boat we need. I should hear how Sai plans to get us a meeting with the general.
We need to meet with General Renmus as soon as possible. To do this, I must bribe his clerk, obtain forged credentials, and delay the merchant who is currently scheduled to meet with him.
I now have the means to meet with General Renmus. I should let Sai know.
General Renmus dismissed Sai Sahan's request. I should speak to the general and see if I can convince him to arrange our passage to the Dragon's island.
General Renmus refused our request, citing his lack of resources during these troubled times. We must find another way to reach the island. I should speak to Sai outside and see if he has any ideas.
Aeliah Renmus, the general's daughter, approached us. I should see what she wants.
Aeliah believes the smuggler Za'ji can help us reach the Dragon's island lair. I can find him and his crew in the outskirts of Senchal.
I found Za'ji and his first mate Caska. I should see if he will agree to sail us to the Dragon's island lair.
Za'ji will sail us to the Dragon's lair if we help him recover his beloved ship, the Perfect Pounce. He believes we'll find the mer who stole it in South Guard Ruins. I should head there now.
Za'ji and Caska can't agree on a course of action for capturing Nartise Merys, the mer who Za'ji believes stole his ship. I should speak to Sai Sahan about our next move.

While Caska and Za'ji sneak around South Guard Ruins and enter from the back, Sai and I will start our search for Nartise at the front. This should allow us to capture Nartise and interrogate him about the Pounce.
Sai smashed the trap door open. Now we can follow Nartise into the tunnel below. I should continue my pursuit.
Za'ji has suspended Nartise with magic. I should see if Nartise knows where we can find the Perfect Pounce.
Nartise revealed that he sold the boat to the slaver Admiral Irathi. Now that the Dark Elf has revealed his betrayal, Za'ji seems to have plans for his former crew member.
Za'ji catapulted Nartise deep into the sea. I should speak to him about what just occurred.
Nartise claimed that the Perfect Pounce is docked nearby. I should speak to Sai Sahan about our next step.
Sai and Za'ji will draw away as many slavers as they can. Meanwhile, Caska and I will secure the Perfect Pounce. I should head to the docks and look for the ship.
Admiral Irathi has locked the ship's wheel with thick chains. I should get rid of the chains and secure the ship until Za'ji and Sai return.
Before we depart for the Dragon's island lair, we need to pick up Za'ji's crew. I should sail the ship to Senchal.
Aeliah has boarded the Perfect Pounce. I should speak to her.
Za'ji's crew is on board and ready to set sail. I should speak to Sai about our departure.
Za'ji's crew is on board and ready to set sail. I should speak to Sai when I'm ready to depart.
We arrived on the back side of the island, on a small beach. There's another ship docked nearby, which means we're likely not the only ones on this island. I should speak to Sai about our next move.
While Sai, Caska, and Aeliah enter the ruins directly, I need to see where a nearby cavern leads. I should head to the cavern now and begin my search for the Dragon.
With my help, Sai and the others safely traversed the ruins. I should speak to him about our next step.

Sai believes the ruins are actually a Dragonguard sanctuary. With that revelation in mind, he's more determined than ever to slay this Dragon. I should follow him to the chamber ahead and search for the Dragon.
Sai and I entered the chamber. We should search for the Dragon and prepare to fight the beast.
The Dragon was unaffected by the Horn of Ja'darri and now wishes to speak with us. Sai wants to keep his guard up in case the beast attacks. I should speak with the Dragon.
The Dragon Nahfahlaar requested an alliance to defeat his brother Laatvulon. I should speak to Sai about this turn of events.
Sai agreed to speak with Nahfahlaar about this alliance, and asked our companions to leave the room. I should see if he needs anything else.
Daini urged me to head to her shelter, south of the wrecked caravan. Once I get there, I should look her brother, Safik.
Sormund agreed to take Daini, Safik, and their friends out of South Guard. I should conclude my business with her.
The man I met indicated that the wrecked caravan might contain some valuables or survivors to rescue. I should  investigate.
I found the Khajiit Lorgren mentioned. I should speak to her.
I arrived at the Daini's shelter to find her brother, Safik, arguing with a cantankerous Nord. I should speak to Safik and find out what's going on.
Daini reunited with Safik, Sormund, and the others at her shelter. I should speak to her about what she wants to do next.
Daini believes that we can find the valuables Sormund wants inside Turo's warehouse. I should go there now.
According to Daini, Turo places his personal goods in marked crates. We should search the crates and try to find something valuable.
Antonia sold out Daini and her friends to Turo, just as she said she would. The crime boss clearly means to do them harm. I should return to Daini's shelter to warn Safik and the others.
Daini's camp is empty. I should talk to her to discuss what happened and what we should do next.
While Daini turns herself in to Turo, I must search a nearby safe house for any sign of her compatriots: Galeneth, Malahbu, and Sormund. Once I rescue them all, I can assist Daini in Turo's fortress.
I found the Nord captain, Sormund, in the bandits' safe house. I should talk to him.
I set all of Daini's friends free. Now I need to make my way to Turo's fortress to rescue the imprisoned siblings.
I entered Turo's fortress. Now I should look for Safik and Daini.
Turo stands between me and my companions. I'll have to kill this criminal overlord to save them.
I found Daini and Safik in a secret cellar. I should set them free.
Daini, Safik, and I reunited with Sormund and the others on the beach. Sormund's ship appears ready to set sail. I should talk to Daini about what happens next.
Sai must present our credentials to the palace guards before we can gain entry. I should wait for him to do so.
Kazahn may know something about Lahini's disappearance. He's likely at the local tavern in Senchal, called the Sweet Breezes Inn. I should head there and find Kazahn.
I should find Sai Sahan and let him know what I learned from Nahfahlaar.
Sai Sahan asked me to speak to Nahfahlaar and find out what happened after we left the island. He also suggested I check in with the rest of the Dragonguard if I have the time.
Khamira requested my presence at Senchal Palace. I should go and see what she wants.
I arrived at Senchal Palace. Now to talk to Khamira and see why she summoned me here.
Khamira is holding a ceremony to honor the Dragonguard. I should attend the ceremony.
Queen Khamira wants to speak with me before she begins the ceremony.
Khamira wants me to offer General Renmus and the Shields of Senchal a position in the Elsweyr Confederacy that she hopes to reform.
Kazahn's companion followed a New Moon cultist to the harbor. I should wait for Ranza to tell us about this encounter.
Ranza's map leads to a house near the harbor. I should locate this house and see if the New Moon cultist is still there.
The attic apartment is empty, but a note was left behind. I should read it.
The note states that the Order of the New Moon is recruiting in the Black Kiergo. I should see if Caska knows anything about this.
Caska agreed to help me get into the Black Kiergo, an underground fighting ring located in the Outlaws Refuge. I should head there now.
To win an audience with the recruiter, I must compete in the Black Kiergo arena and prove my combat skills. I should fight as many enemies as I can. Caska will fight by my side.
I impressed Shirnama with my fighting skills. I should speak to him and see if he will tell me more about the Order of the New Moon.
The New Moon recruiter gave me a pendant that grants entrance into the cult's base of operations, the New Moon Fortress. I should head there now.
A cultist guard protects the New Moon Fortress. I should show her my pendant to gain entrance.

I must complete the Path of the New Moon to prove myself to the cult. The trial master explained that I need to light braziers to open pathways and push the large sliding stones to unlock the door and move forward.
I should talk to Sai at the Dragonguard Sanctum and let him know of my victory.
I should speak to Nahfahlaar and find out what the Dragon plans to do next.
I must open the gate and climb aboard Turo's getaway boat to escape the bandits' fortress.
I found a journal about an artifact called the Horn of Ja'darri in the Dragonguard archives. I should tell Sai what I learned.

I found a second journal written by the Dragonguard commander who sought the Horn of Ja'darri. They believe it can be found in Dark Water Temple in Eastmarch. I should let Sai Sahan know what the journal says.
The courier is dead and the New Moon's correspondence is in hand. I should return to <<1>> with it.
With a few cryptic words and a hasty exit, Nahfahlaar wasn't able to reveal much about the cult's motivation. I should head to Pridehome and meet up with the rest of the Dragonguard.
The cult has already attacked Pridehome, killing many and searching the grounds. I should see if I can find the rest of my companions.
Clan Mother Hizuni may help shed light on the cult's motivation for attacking Pridehome. I should search the area for more clues on her whereabouts.
I found Aeliah tending to an injured Moon-Priest. He may know more about why Pridehome is being attacked. I should speak with him.
The Clan Mother made her way to a temple farther inside the compound. I should speak to Sai Sahan about all that I learned.
The Clan Mother of Pridehome has locked herself in a temple farther in the compound. I should head to the temple with Sai Sahan and see if she can answer our questions.
We reached the temple. I should go inside and search for Clan Mother Hizuni there.
I need to go to Malak's Maw in southwest Deshaan to find and kill the cult's courier. Then I need to bring whatever correspondence they were carrying back to the Dragonguard.
The Clan Mother is mortally wounded, but she might still be able to tell me why the Order of the New Moon has attacked Pridehome. I should speak to her.
Clan Mother Hizuni spoke of a divine mask that the Order of the New Moon seeks. A nearby statue depicts a warrior wearing the mask. I should examine the statue more closely.
The statue depicts a warrior named Ja'darri. Its inscription speaks of a Red Beast and Mask Divine. Could this warrior be connected to Nahfahlaar? I should speak to Sai Sahan about what I discovered.
Sai Sahan suspects that Nahfahlaar is somehow connected to the warrior Ja'darri and the divine mask the cult seeks. I should search for the Dragon so I can question him about the mask.

Nahfahlaar remains cryptic about his connection to Ja'darri and the mask, but he did reveal that Ja'darri's remains were taken to Khenarthi's Breath Temple when she died. I should head there and see what I can learn about the mask.
Clan Mother Tadali already knows about the Clan Mother's death. I should see what she knows about this divine mask.
Clan Mother Tadali told me to go to a nearby statue of a Forgotten Mane surrounded by bells. I should check in with Aeliah first.
Aeliah wants to help me find Yahgrondu. I should meet her at the quarry Nahfahlaar spoke of.
Aeliah is determined to help find the divine mask. I should meet her by the Forgotten Mane statue, southeast of Black Heights.
I found another bell stand, but every bell hanging on it is tarnished. I should press the pedal and see what happens.
The bell stand played a short song and its brightly colored lanterns glowed. I'll need to hit the larger bells in a specific order to cleanse the smaller bells.
The divine mask is in the Halls of the Highmane, but I have to prove myself worthy of the relic first. I should head inside.
Aeliah gave me a Dragonguard grappling bow to help me cross the chasm. I should be able to open the way for her if I can make it across.
The next door is blocked, surrounded by four unlit braziers. It seems this trial is about overcoming darkness. I should search the chamber and see how I can open the door.
Our path is blocked by another trial. I need to figure out the solution so we can move forward and continue our search for the mask.
Clan Mother Tadali appeared just as the bells were cleansed. I should speak to her about what happens next.
The spirit of Ja'darri appeared and warned that only one of us can claim the mask. I should speak to Aeliah about this new development.
The door to the chamber holding the mask has been opened. Now I just need to claim it.
Ra'khajin seeks the mask for himself. I have to defeat him to keep it out of the cult's hands.
I defeated Ra'khajin, Dragon Priest of the Order of the New Moon. Now I should claim the mask.
I found an ancient shield at the location of the grave, I should take it to <<1>> to see if it's useful.
I need to follow it to the burial site in Windridge Cave and retrieve any relics I find.
Nahfahlaar has been on edge lately. Sai Sahan wants me to learn what's wrong with him.
Sai Sahan asked me to investigate the strange portal that appeared in the Dragonguard Sanctum.
We reached the summit of the dormant volcano and found the Horn of Ja'darri. I should take it.
Nishzo's hideout is in a coastal cave north of Senchal. I should find it and see what he knows about the tapestry pieces.
Nishzo is dead, but I should search for clues to the stolen tapestry pieces.
I found Nishzo's piece of the priceless tapestry. I should return it to Bebbia in Senchal.
Bebbia was very thankful for Nishzo's piece of the tapestry. She has hired an artisan to restore the masterpiece once I retrieve the remaining pieces.
I should talk to Bebbia now that the first piece of the tapestry has been placed in the frame.
We found Nartise, but he fled into a tunnel and locked the door behind him. I should wait for Sai to determine a course of action.
A Pahmar guards the entrance to the Black Kiergo. I should speak to him.

Do'mazir doesn't find me worthy of the Black Kiergo, but is eager to see Caska rejoin the fight. If I can convince my companion to enter the competition, we can both enter the arena and find the New Moon recruiter.
Sai Sahan and Abnur Tharn arrived before me, but Tharn doesn't look well. I should talk to Sai.
We think the amphitheater where the cult collects the aeonstone might contain a clue as to how they reach the island, but the entrance we used last time is sealed. We need to find another way inside.
Sai Sahan and I discovered a second entrance into the New Moon Fortress. I should see if it leads to the amphitheater.
I found Nishzo's journal. It's filled with strange riddles that might be clues to the locations of the tapestry pieces. I should search the cave for his piece.
I completed the Path of the New Moon. I should speak to Trial Master Zayri about my next step.
I should untie Skordo the Knife.
The kidnappers who abducted Skordo and the others clearly fled in a hurry. I should inspect the area. With any luck, I'll find some clues that can lead me to Marekki and Tajahir.
Auberic Dufont's house might contain more information about Lady G's mysterious event. Skordo plans to distract Auberic. I should search the residence for clues.
I tied up Skordo. Now, I must take him to Selloe and Lady G.
I should talk to Selloe. Hopefully she takes the bait and accepts Skordo as we planned.
Lady Ghisiliane gave me a token and urged me to travel to the swamps east of Purring Rock to participate in the hunt. I should give the token to a hunt master when I arrive.
I officially entered the hunt. Now I should look for Skordo and his two friends, Tajahir and Marekki.
Tajahir told me that Marekki plans to kill Lady G. Given her size and inexperience, she'll almost certainly be killed. I should hurry to the ruins and make sure she doesn't go through with her plan.
Lady Ghisiliane's despicable games will continue so long as she remains alive. I need to end this before she hurts more innocent people.
Despite Tajahir's death, Skordo and I managed to rescue Marekki and bring an end to Lady Ghisiliane's evil business. I should speak with him about what comes next.
I should talk to Marekki to make sure she's all right.
Despite Tajahir's death, Skordo and I managed to rescue Marekki and bring an end to Lady Ghisiliane's evil business. I should speak with him about what comes next.
Caska called me over. I should speak to her.
The green stone, called aeonstone, absorbs the cultists' vitality. Caska wants to destroy the aeonstone and stop the ritual. I should follow her lead.
Caska is in place. I should destroy the aeonstone.
We interrupted the ritual, but Laatvulon is now aware of our presence. I should meet back up with Caska so we can escape the New Moon Fortress.
Caska and I escaped Laatvulon and his cult. I should speak to Caska.
Sai Sahan needs to know what I learned about the Order of the New Moon. I should return to the Dragonguard Sanctum.
Laatvulon is performing a ritual with the green stone I saw in the mines. I should observe the ritual.
I need to find Za'ji before I can speak to him. He should be in another part of the Dragonguard Sanctum.

Za'ji has confirmed that he is ready to join the Dragonguard and has promised to speak to the rest of his crew. I can take this opportunity to speak to the crew myself or rejoin Sai Sahan in the sanctum's grand hall.
Za'ji agreed to join our Dragonguard. He also agreed to speak to the rest of the crew on our behalf. I should let Sai Sahan know and see how his negotiations with Nahfahlaar are going.
Sai Sahan and Khamira want to regroup at the Dragonguard Sanctum to gather our forces and make plans to assault Dragonhold.
Tharn's portal deposited me on the coast of Southern Elsweyr, where I met up with Khamira and Sai Sahan. I should tell Khamira what happened.
I need to return to the Dragonguard Sanctum and talk to Sai Sahan.
An engraved token of some sort and a scrap of a note may provide clues as to who these kidnappers were. I should talk to Skordo about what I found.
Za'ji leads the smuggler crew that came with us to the island. I should speak to him and see if his crew is willing to join the Dragonguard.
Sai Sahan needs to know what I learned about the Order of the New Moon. I should speak with him.
I found Selloe on the Senchal docks. I should go speak with her.
We managed to overcome the first trial of the Halls of the Highmane. We should continue our search for the mask.
Kasura asked me to acquire the grappling bow from behind the statue near the stables.
Kasura challenged me to light a brazier on top of the training hall roof by using the grappling bow. This will test my skill with the Dragonguard device.
I lit the brazier on the roof of the training hall. I should return to Sai Sahan and see if he's deciphered the maps.
Zurnash gave me the token and a set of fine clothes. I should talk to Skordo about how to proceed.
I obtained the grappling bow. I should speak to Kasura about what to do next.
I made it to Turo's warehouse and Daini arrived shortly thereafter. I should discuss the details of the robbery with her.
Vijari seemed to be chanting something in response to me, though it was cryptic at best. Adara'hai might have some idea what he was babbling about.
With another trial completed, I need to continue searching for the mask.
I acquired the Horn of Ja'darri. I should give it to Sai Sahan.
With another trial passed, Aeliah and I can continue exploring the Halls of the Highmane in search of the mask.
Shazar the Sibilant asked me to drink the sacramental waters from sacred shrines within the cove to purify them.
I purged the skooma tainted water from the cove and myself. I should speak to Shazar and see if there's anything else to this.
Shazar told me I should wade into the shallows and expel the sickness out to sea.
I need to return to the Dragonguard Sanctum and talk to Sai Sahan.
Khamira attempts to access the memories of Anequina she inherited during her attunement at the Shadow Dance Temple. She asked me to watch over her while she does this.
I need to go to the sentry tower northeast of Senchal to check in with General Renmus's soldiers. They might have seen Nahfahlaar and Laatvulon.
With our final fight ahead of us, we need all the help we can get. I should see if General Renmus has received any reports about Nahfahlaar.
Nahfahlaar headed north with Laatvulon and several other Dragons in tow. I should follow after them.
Nahfahlaar was felled by Laatvulon as we arrived at the gates of Doomstone Keep. I should speak with Sai Sahan.
Nahfahlaar fell farther in Doomstone Keep. I should search for him.
I found caverns under Doomstone Keep. If Nahfahlaar did fall, it's likely he ended up there. I should search for him.
The tablet's contents suggests that the mask can be used to light sacred fires and reveal the story of the Dragonguard's battle with the Black Beast. I should find the first flame.
We discovered an ancient tapestry near the first flame. I should look for other fires to light and more tapestries to see what they reveal.

The tapestries told the story of Ja'darri and the Dragonguard battling Laatvulon. They weren't able to kill him, but sealed him beneath Doomstone Keep instead. Obviously, he eventually found a way out. I should go inside and see what I can find.
I found Nahfahlaar, wounded in the sealing chamber. I need to talk to him about what I learned from the tapestries.
Nahfahlaar agreed to help me awaken the power of the mask. I only need to raise it before him.
We took some valuable information from Auberic Dufont's house. I should talk to Skordo to see how he wants to proceed.
I was transported alongside Nahfahlaar to a strange place. Nahfahlaar says it's a trick of the mask. I should explore this realm of Spilled Sand and see what I can discover.
I found the spirit of Ja'darri waiting for me in an oasis within the endless dunes. I should talk to her.
Ja'darri confirmred that a Dragon must awaken the dormant power that lies within the Mask of Alkosh. I need to begin the ritual to unlock its power.
With the Mask of Alkosh empowered, I should return to the surface and take the fight to Laatvulon.
The time has finally come to face Laatvulon. I should meet up with Nahfahlaar before we search for the evil Dragon.
The Order of the New Moon has risen to protect their Dragon god. I need to defeat them before reaching Laatvulon.
More cultists pour into Doomstone Keep. With the power of the mask, I should be able to easily put them down.
With the minions of Laatvulon falling away, the time has come to engage Laatvulon. I should find him.
With the power of the Mask of Alkosh and the aid of my companions, I'm now ready to face Laatvulon and destroy him once and for all.
With Laatvulon defeated and Elsweyr safe from his vile schemes, the time has come to return the Dragonguard Sanctum.
I should speak to Sai Sahan about all that has happened. I can also speak to my companions and see how they fare.
The spirit of Khunzar-ri gave me a claw to present to Khamira. He opened a portal to take us back to the Dragonguard Sanctum. I should use the portal.
While Khamira studies the claw and searches her attuned memories, I should go check on Sai Sahan and make sure the Dragonguard is ready to do its part.
Now that I'm back at the Dragonguard Sanctum, I should find Khamira and present her with Khunzar-ri's claw.
I found a cave system leading down. Sai Sahan must be farther along. I should see if I can find him.
With the mask in hand, I should return to the Dragonguard Sanctum and let Sai Sahan know that I found it.
I have all the ingredients Dak'radhi used for his cursed paint. I should bring them to Adara'hai at the Colorworks.
I should search the bandit caravan wreckage for valuable goods.
I found very little of value, but Daini might be able to do something with it. I should deliver these ruined goods to her.
I agreed to help Zhasim examine his camp for any clues concerning the thieves who robbed him and stole his uncle's gourmet moon-sugar.
I arrived at Zhasim's camp. I should talk to him and get more details about what happened here.
I should search the camp for clues as to who attacked Zhasim and stole his uncle's gourmet moon-sugar.
I found Zhasim's cat, Winks. Zhasim asked her to find his guard, Maezi, and the cat ran off. I guess I should follow the cat and see where she leads us.
Zhasim is sure that his guard, Maezi, is in the smuggler camp. I should look around and see if I can find her.
I found a note detailing what the smugglers plan to do with the stolen gourmet moon-sugar. I should find Zhasim and Maezi and let them know what I learned.

The smuggler's note mentioned two locations where they were going to stash the stolen moon-sugar: an old farm where they distilled skooma and a river drop north of the swamp. I should see if the moon-sugar is still there.
I should bring the moon-sugar I recovered and the note I found to Zhasim and Maezi in Senchal.
The smuggler leader, Punzala, has the last portion of the stolen cargo in her base across the bay from Senchal. I should go there and retrieve the remaining portion of the gourmet moon-sugar.
I recovered the last of the stolen gourmet moon-sugar. I should return to Senchal and give it to Zhasim.
Zhasim made a trade arrangement with merchants in Senchal. I should talk to him about what he plans to do next.
I killed the Hagraven, but her sister, Hiti, escaped. Lyris intends to investigate the ritual in more detail while I carve a path to the coven's leader.
I encountered another witch. This one summoned a flesh atronach to defend her. I should kill this unholy abomination.
Lyris killed a Reachman and proceeded to the next room. Unfortunately, another witch arrived and reanimated her slain servant. I must kill this undead creature.
I stopped the Icereach witches and their storm ritual, I should speak to Lyris to claim my reward.
I managed to kill the flesh atronach, but the witch escaped. Lyris urged me to keep exploring the fortress.
Arvnir, one of the surviving warriors, mentioned that some of his compatriots may still be alive. I should look for them.
While searching for survivors I encountered a giant blocking the path. I should kill it.
Apparently, the Nord hero, Lyris Titanborn, is fighting her way through Icereach as well. She told me to keep moving, but a horrific Hagraven blocks my path. I must kill this monstrosity.
I should find one of the sword-thanes High King Jorunn sent to Icereach and gather more information on this threat.

I killed the Stormborn Revenant, but again, the witch retreated. Lyris insists that we're getting close to the witches' central lairâ€”the likely site of their storm-summoning ritual. I should make my way there.
I found the sisters of the Icereach Coven in the fortress' courtyard. I must kill them to stop their storm-summoning ritual.
I need to complete Icereach.
I defeated foes in Icereach.\n\nI should find <<1>> in my alliance's capital city.
<<1>> presented me with another challenge: Burn the Wicker Pike before killing Mother Ciannait.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
I destroyed the Keeper of the Kiln. I should continue exploring the Unhallowed Grave.
Yet another enormous construct stands in our way. I must destroy this Eternal Aegis to continue my search for the Draugrkin's leader, Kjalnar Tombskald.
A crazed lich stands between me and Kjalnar Tombskald. I must destroy this undead abomination to proceed.
I killed Kjalnar Tombskald and avenged the Pyre Watch. I should speak to Shelaria to receive my reward.
I destroyed the Eternal Aegis. I should continue and explore the Unhallowed Grave.
I agreed to help Shelaria rid the Unhallowed Grave of Draugrkin necromancers and graverobbers. I should explore this cavernous tomb.
I discovered one of the Draugrkin's lieutenants in front of a stone door, blocking my passage forward. I must kill this Nord in order to progress.
I encountered a colossal Grave Guardian. Destroying it may unlock the door that blocks our passage. I should fell this stone creature.
I should talk to Shelaria. Perhaps she can provide more details about what is going on in the Unhallowed Grave.
I am getting close to where the leader, Kjalnar Tombskald is located. I should continue forward.
I found Kjalnar Tombskald at the edge of a deep crevasse, engaged in a dark summoning ritual. I must kill the Draugrkin's leader before anything terrible escapes from the Unhallowed Grave.
I need to complete Unhallowed Grave.
I defeated foes in Unhallowed Grave.\n\nI should find <<1>> in my alliance's capital city.
<<1>> presented me with another challenge: destroy the skull totem before fighting Kjalnar Tombskald.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.

Kasura's former student is Sai Sahan, one-time captain of the emperor's Dragonguard. While he studies the maps we brought him, he wants me to talk to Kasura and study a device known as the grappling bow.
Sai and I discovered ruins covered with grappling points. I should see what he thinks about all this.
We reached the top of the Jonelight Path and Khunzar-ri opened a portal. Dragonhold should be on the other side. We should use the portal.
Nahfahlaar has arrived at the temple. I should speak with him.
Upon reading the letter, a ghostly figure appeared. I should talk to this apparition.

Jano and Honoria agreed to protect the academy from the Knahaten Flu by way of a necromantic ritual, but Honoria left before they could perform it. Jano attempted it alone and failed. I must destroy the totems he corrupted in the process.
I destroyed all of Jano's corrupted totems. I should return to him with Honoria's totem so we can break the curse afflicting the citadel.
Now that I've dispelled the Forsaken Citadel's curse, perhaps Honoria and Jano can reconcile. I should return to Catina and tell her about what transpired.
I should tell Catina about everything I witnessed in the Forsaken Citadel and claim my reward.
To help Catina's dead mother pass on and end Catina's nightmares, I must find a way to enter the ruins of the academy.
Abnur Tharn and Nahfahlaar are going to attempt to contain the Dark Aeon explosion. Meanwhile, the rest of us need to find a way to get off this island before it's too late.
I found Aeliah on the outskirts of the quarry. I should speak to her about our next step.
Sormund suggested that I search for the others in the nearby caves. Hopefully I'll find Galeneth and Malahbu there.
Malahbu called out to me from a nearby cage. I should talk to him.
Malahbu suspects that Turo's lackeys took Galeneth to the Dream-Drownerâ€”Turo's slaving vessel. I should go search the ship while it remains in port.
I found Galeneth on Turo's slaving vessel. I should talk to her.
I defeated the undead Yahgrondu. Nahfahlaar has found his way to the mine. I should speak to him about what happened.
Khamira told me to return to the Dragonguard Sanctum and talk to Sai Sahan. She said she'd meet me there.
Nahfahlaar has arrived. I should ask him about the divine mask the Order of the New Moon seeks.
We entered the Halls of the Highmane only to be stopped by a large chasm. I should talk to Aeliah about what to do next.

Selloe paid off a Khajiit named Zurnash to deliver one of Lady G's invitation tokens to a wealthy merchant in town. He went astray. If I find him and complete the delivery, she said she can arrange for me to meet Lady G.
A trail of empty bottles led us to Zurnash. I should talk to him about his delayed delivery.
Sai Sahan requested that I meet him at the Abbey of Blades. I should head there now.
Selloe promised an introduction to Lady G if I deliver a token to a noble named Auberic Dufont. I should find Skordo and tell him what I learned. I'll find him in Senchal's marketplace.
I must explore the Forsaken Citadel to find these ancient books.
I found the sealed tomes Guybert requested. I should deliver them to him and claim my reward.
I should talk to <<1>> in Senchal about what these tasks entail.
Tsaraba gave me some valuable information about the various jobs her associates are offering. I should let her know that I'm interested in the work.
Aeliah agreed to help me get in to see her father without an appointment. I should meet her in front of Senchal Palace.
The Khenarthic bell cleansed the area for now and Vijari, Ka'ishka, and Adara'hai have joined me at the Wall of Life. I should speak to Adara'hai about what comes next.
The note I found identified someone named Selloe as connected to the kidnappers' plot. Apparently, she frequents Senchal's waterfront. I should go there and try to track her down.
As I entered the ruins, a ghostly voice encouraged me to find a letter nearby. I should find this mysterious missive.
I must kill <<1>> and gather springmint for the healers.
I could ask about springmint's use.
I dispatched <<1>> and gathered the springmint. Now I should claim my reward.
I must kill <<1>> and retrieve the stolen rice sacks.
I could ask about the rogue monk.
I dispatched <<1>> and found some of the stolen rice. Now I should claim my reward.
I should kill the guardian and gather temple dust.
I dispatched the guardian and gathered the needed temple dust. I should collect my reward.
I should kill the guardian and find the scholar's scattered notes.
I could ask about the temple.
I dispatched the guardian and picked up some of the scholar's scattered notes.
I should kill the guardian and gather the arrows.
I could ask about the guardian and its temple.
I dispatched the guardian and found some of the missing arrows. I should collect my reward.
Now that Caska and I have secured the Perfect Pounce, I must wait for Sai and Za'ji to board the ship.
Sai Sahan wants to talk to me. I can find him in the Dragonguard Sanctum.
Sai Sahan is proposing our plan to General Renmus. I should let him speak.
The guards granted us entry into the palace. Now we need to meet with General Renmus.
I need to craft the comestibles specified by my contract. Once I craft them, I need to deliver them to any writ turn-in site.
I placed the requested items into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest.
I need to head to the Barrowbough and kill the <<1>> then take whatever documents he was carrying.
I killed the New Moon's representative in the Bone Orchard. I should return to Dirge Truptor and give him the documents the representative was carrying.
I retrieved a Dragonguard relic from the Corpse Garden. I should return to <<1>> to deliver it.
I need to find the soldier's final resting place, somewhere deep in the Siltreen Sanitary Mortuary, now known as the Corpse Garden, and return with any relics of the Dragonguard I find there.
The guard accepted my pendant and told me to speak to Trial Master Zayri. I should enter the New Moon Fortress.
I need to speak with Trial Master Zayri and see what task she has for me.
I recovered the lost Dragonguard scrolls. I should deliver them to <<1>>.
I need to head to Grahtwood and retrieve the scrolls from the Hall of Might within the Reliquary Ruins.
I should search the citadel ruins for these ensorcelled weapons.
I found the ensorcelled swords in the Forsaken Citadel. I should deliver them to Guybert Flaubert and claim my reward.
I should place these enchanted candles in different areas within the Forsaken Citadel.
I placed some of the candles around the Forsaken Citadel as Guybert Flaubert requested. I should claim my reward.
I need to find the recruiter at the Supernal Dreamers' camp, kill them, and bring back any records they had.
I killed the New Moon recruiter at the Supernal Dreamers' camp. I should return to Dirge Truptor and deliver the manifests the recruiter carried.
Using the information provided by Chizbari the Chipper, I should hunt down a Dragon and kill them.
I killed several Dragons. I should return to Chizbari the Chipper and claim my reward.
Using the information provided by Chizbari the Chipper, I should hunt down a Dragon and kill them.
I killed several Dragons. I should return to Chizbari the Chipper and claim my reward.
I set Daini free. I should speak to her before we flee the fortress.
I must find suitable places for the lilies, then plant them.
I planted lilies in Moonlit Cove as Guybert requested. I should return to Senchal to collect my reward.
I must find and harvest rare Prune Morel Mushrooms in Moonlit Cove.
I gathered some Prune Morel Mushrooms. I should return to the job broker in Senchal and collect my fee.

I should search Moonlit Cove for addicts afflicted by this dangerous new skooma and try to extract their blood for testing. Guybert suggested drawing from those who succumbed to their addiction recently, but blood from living addicts would do.
I gathered fresh blood samples for Guybert's client to analyze. I should return to Senchal to claim my reward.

I acquired a pouch full of jewelsâ€”ample payment for Daini and Safik's berth on Sormund's ship. Unfortunately, someone approaches from another part of the cellar. I should take cover and see who it is.
We found a door leading into the warehouse cellar. With any luck, the valuables we're searching for will be inside.
We found another marked crate in the warehouse cellar. I should search it for valuables.
I need to craft the alchemy item specified by my contract. \nOnce I craft it, I need to deliver it to any writ turn-in site.
I placed the requested item into the crate. All that remains is to sign the manifest.
Winks led us to a smuggler camp. I should talk to Zhasim and see if he thinks these are the thieves who robbed him.
The Passage of Dad'na Ghaten is overflowing with darkness from Namiira's realm and her vile servants. We need to fight our way through and ring the Khenarthic Bells while we search for Dak'radhi.
I set Maezi free. She went to check on Zhasim and asked me to see if I could determine what the smugglers did with the stolen moon-sugar. I should look around the camp.

Vigwenn apparently misplaced the three bottles containing the last of her secret ingredients for her special concoction. I agreed to look for the bottles in exchange for a chance to hear the song of the sand-whales.
I found Vigwenn's missing ingredient bottles, but there isn't much left inside them. I should return them and see if Vigwenn has enough to make another batch of her concoction.
I should hand Tender Claw over to Kishima and find out if there's a reward.
I located Kishima in the southern part of Senchal. I should talk to her.
I should read the note to learn about this cat and where to find his owner.
I should pick up Tender Claw and carry him back to his owner in Senchal.
I found Jano. I should speak with him about how to conduct the ritual.
I killed the giant, Kjarg. I should continue my search for survivors.
The Khenarthic bell's peal drowned out the terrible drumming and broke Vijari out of his trance. Adara'hai is leading him home and asked me to meet them at Vijari's house.

General Renmus confirmed that the Order of the New Moon is recruiting in the city. He believes their latest recruit is Lahini, a missing young Khajiit. I should speak to Lahini's mother Buzinda about her disappearance.
Caska has also completed her initiation trial and wants to talk. I should speak with her.
With Trial Master Zayri no longer watching over us, we can learn more about the Order of the New Moon. I should start my exploration.
The bounty notice said to kill a Dragonâ€”any Dragon! Dragons can be found in either Northern or Southern Elsweyr, Sunspire, or the Lair of Maarselok.
I killed a Dragon and taken a trophy from its body for the bounty. I should turn it in to a bounty-master interested in Dragons.
Tharn used the energy he absorbed to drive off the Dragon Joorahmaar. I should find out if he's all right and see what he thinks we should do next.
Abnur Tharn wants me to approach the aeonstones and allow them to absorb some of my life energy. That should provide the power he needs to activate the portal to Dragonhold.
Kaalgrontiid flew off before we could confront him, but he used a portal to send his cultists to the island. I should speak to Abnur Tharn and see if he can open the portal.
I can acquire pumpkins from any grocer in Tamriel.
The note explained that J'saad has been hearing voices and had a strange stone. I should search his nearby pack and see what's inside.
I should talk to <<1>> and see about a reward.
I found <<1>>. I should speak to her about what happened to J'saad.
I should find Adhimba and give her J'saad's note and the stone. She should be in Black Heights.
I found a dead Khajiit. I should read the note next to his body.
Though Sai Sahan has no idea why the Order of the New Moon would attack Pridehome, Nahfahlaar might have more insight into the cult's motivations. I should speak to him.
I found Za'ji next to a letter written by his mother, Clan Mother Tadali. I should speak to him about the letter.
Khamira emerged from her trance. I should talk to her and see if she knows what this "cavern of the Moon's sacred light' is and if it can help us reach the floating island of Dragonhold.
I found Caska, as well as a note written by the temple's Clan Mother. I should speak to her about the note.
Sai Sahan brought one last bit of news from Khamira. She wants us to find an ancient, hidden door somewhere in Moonlit Cove. I should look around.
I entered Moonlit Cove and met up with Sai Sahan. I should talk to him before we begin our search of the area.
I found the letter. I should read it. Hopefully its contents will give me some sense of what Honoria thinks to accomplish in the Forsaken Citadel.
Khamira ran up and seems to have news. I should talk to her and see if she figured out what to do with Khunzar-ri's claw.
I located each of Nomu's missing friends. I should look for them at Nomu's rendezvous spot and make sure they made it there safely.
Nomu thinks his friends are hiding in the quarry. I should search for Meetza, Falls-with-Grace, and Nasee there.
The bell stand played a short song accompanied by a specific sequence of lights. If I hit the large bells in the same sequence, it should cleanse the smaller bells.
Skordo kept Auberic Dufont talking and I found some more information about Lady G and her exclusive event. I should meet Skordo outside Auberic's home.
I should follow Skordo to the waterfront.
Skordo wants me to offer him to Selloe and Lady G as a gift. Hopefully, this gesture will earn me a place in Lady G's hunting expedition. I need to tie Skordo up before proceeding with the plan.
I delivered all of the herbalist's packages. I should return to Jansen to receive my payment.
I should take the herbalist's product from the chest and make my deliveries.
I need to take the packages containing the herbalist's remedy to the chests marked on my map. I should hurry before they lose their potency.
I arrived at the final location to find a woman caring for someone who appears to be ill. I should speak to her about delivering the herbalist's product.
I delivered all of the herbalist's packages. I should return to Jansen to receive my payment.
I should find Tender Claw's owner, Kishima, in the southern section of Senchal, and return her lost cat.
I should talk to Lady Ghisiliane to see if she will invite me to her hunt.
I found the house on Ranza's map. Now I need to search for the cultist or find clues to his current whereabouts.
I have one final package to deliver to the outskirts of Senchal. I should hurry before the remedy loses its potency.
I found Skordo and a badly injured Tajahir shortly thereafter. Skordo ran off to try to help his other friend Marekki. I should talk to Tajahir.
Marekki "hid" a key to Lady Ghisiliane's private chambers. I should pick it up, even if it is a little slimy.
I killed Lady Ghisiliane. I should meet up with Skordo and Marekki outside of the Hunting Grounds.
Adara'hai thinks Vijari meant we need to ring the Khenarthic bells by the Wall of Life. She's overwhelmed by the terrible drumming in our ears, so it's up to me to strike the bells.
I delivered all of the herbalist's packages. I should return to Jansen to receive my payment.
I spotted another note from the smugglers. I should take it and see what it says.
I brought Janessa back to her sister in Black Heights. I should explain what happened to Juisa.
I found Juisa in Black Heights. I should explain what happened to her sister.
Janessa asked me to take her to her sister, Juisa, in Black Heights since she's in no condition to travel there herself. I should head there soon.
I opened the sack and a confused Alfiq fell out. I should ask them how they ended up in this situation.
I found the west sentry tower surrounded by the Shields of Senchal and Dragonguard. They're celebrating over a Dragon corpse. Looks like Caska arrived ahead of me. I should speak to her.
Caska isn't sure where Nahfahlaar headed next, but thinks that Za'ji up atop the tower may have a better view. I should speak to him.
I need to create the item specified by my contract.
I've finished the task, and now just need to hand it off to receive my pay.
My contact can be found in the city of Elden Root.
My contact can be found in the city of Wayrest.
My contact can be found in the city of Mournhold.
I need to create the item specified by my contract.
I've finished the task, and now just need to hand it off to receive my pay.
My contact can be found in the city of Elden Root.
My contact can be found in the city of Wayrest.
My contact can be found in the city of Mournhold.
I need to create the item specified by my contract.
I've finished the task, and now just need to hand it off to receive my pay.
My contact can be found in the city of Elden Root.
My contact can be found in the city of Wayrest.
My contact can be found in the city of Mournhold.
Sai Sahan and I found a tablet inside the caverns. I should read it.
I read the tablet. I should speak to Sai Sahan about its contents.

Adara'hai said that the connection between Vijari and whatever drew him to that mural is too strong to break by prayer alone. She needs me to drink her cantor's tonic to see their spiritual connection and try to learn more.
Za'ji knows of a key hidden nearby that should open the door to Bahzahar's hideout. I should follow him to the key's location.
Za'ji paused his search for the key and mentioned a missing ladder. I should speak to him.
The key is hidden in an alcove high above, but the ladder leading to the alcove is missing. Luckily, Za'ji has a grappling bow I can use. I should use the grappling bow to get to the key.
The Wall of Life is restored and Vijari has passed on. I should speak to Adara'hai if our exorcism was successful.
Sai Sahan wishes to speak to me about the cult's upcoming attack on Pridehome. I should return to the Dragonguard Sanctum and talk with him.
I killed Turo. Now I just need to find where he's keeping Safik and Daini.
Sai Sahan wishes to talk to me. I should head to the Dragonguard Sanctum and speak with him.
I read <<1>>'s list of the good bits. I should see if there's anything else he needs from me before I go.
I found Lahini in the New Moon Fortress. It appears that she's also trying to complete the Path of the New Moon. I should speak to her.
I agreed to help Lahini complete the trial as well. I need to push the sliding stones onto platforms to unlock the door and light braziers to open barriers that block my path.
I successfully pushed the sliding stone onto a platform and unlocked the door. I should head to the next room.
I should find one of the newly appointed Dragonguard and see if one of them can help me track down Yahgrondu, the Dragon loyal to Nahfahlaar.
<<1>> asked me to get him some Dragon spit and told me I could find it on the bones of some of their recent meals. I should search Dragon attack sites in Elsweyr for any leftovers.
I recovered saliva-covered bones from a Dragon's kill. I should return the bones to <<1>> at the Dragonguard Sanctum.
<<1>> made me a list of useful Dragon parts he wants me to harvest on future hunts. I should look it over.
I am now a member of the Order of the New Moon, but Lahini is still in danger. I should speak to her before continuing my mission.
Now that the citadel is free of corrupted totems, I should toss Honoria's true totem into the fire to dispel the curse completely.
After I placed the locket in the flame, the ghost of Honoria appeared. I should speak with her.
I should try to find this Cantor and see what brought them here.
I found Kazahn drinking with his companions. I should speak to him and see if he knows where Lahini is.
If I want Kazahn to talk, I'll need someone to intimidate him. I should speak to Caska and see if she's up to the task.
I convinced Kazahn to give us more information about Lahini. I should hear what he has to say.
Caska was able to intimidate Kazahn. I should speak to him and see if he's more willing to talk about Lahini's disappearance.
I arrived at the tavern. I should search for Kazahn and speak with him.
Ranza drew a map that will lead us to the New Moon cultist. I should take it.
I told Sai Sahan what I learned about the Order of the New Moon. I should speak to him about my reward.
I destroyed Dak'radhi's body, but it's not enough to banish him from our world. Adara'hai told me to strike the Advent Bell to finish the exorcism.
Sai Sahan wishes to speak with me about reforming the Dragonguard. I should head to the Dragonguard Sanctum and talk to him.
Clan Mother Hizuni may help shed light on the cult's motivation for attacking Pridehome. I should search the area for more clues on her whereabouts.
I drank from all the sacred shrines in Moonlit Cove and absorbed the skooma tainting them. I should talk to Shazar about what comes next.
Jorunn the Skald-King's agent is Lyris Titanborn. She needs my help investigating the Icereach Coven. I should find out more about where we need to go.
The Skald-King's scouts spotted members of the Icereach Coven near the overlook at Boar's Run, in Grahtwood. Lyris asked me to meet her near the overlook, at the Elden Root Temple.
The Skald-King's scouts spotted members of the Icereach Coven near the Shrine of Saint Rilms in Deshaan. I should meet Lyris there.
The Skald-King's scouts spotted members of the Icereach Coven near the lumber mill by the Weeping Giant in Stormhaven. I should meet Lyris there.
I arrived at the meeting place. I should speak to Lyris about how she wants to proceed with the investigation.
I need to use the witch's medallion that the Skald-King's wizards enchanted. It's supposed to lead us to any Icereach Coven activity in the area.
Lyris arrived. I should tell her what I discovered and see if she found anything.
Lyris marked my map with locations provided by the Skald-King's scouts. When I reach these locations, I need to use the Icereach Coven Medallion and see where the magic leads me.
The magic led me to a dead bloodfiend of some sort. I should examine it and see what I can learn.
Lyris marked my map with locations provided by the Skald-King's scouts. When I reach the next location, I should use the Icereach Coven Medallion and see where the magic leads me.
The medallion led me to a broken ritual object that radiates the same magic as that used by the Icereach Coven. It appears to be some sort of totem or pike. I should examine it more closely.
I heard Lyris shout out. I should try to find her.

Lyris dealt with an ambush by the coven and found a note from a merchant in Riften named Goharth Ironbelly. He seems to be working with the witches. We need to go to Riften and get the merchant to lead us to the coven.
Lyris suggested we start our search for the merchant named Goharth Ironbelly in the Withered Tree inn.
No sign of the merchant Goharth Ironbelly yet. I should talk to Lyris and solidify our plan before he arrives.
Lyris expects the merchant Goharth Ironbelly to arrive shortly. I should stand back and try to avoid attracting any attention.

Goharth Ironbelly arrived, had a brief altercation with Lyris, and left the inn. I should discreetly follow him and see if he'll lead us to the Icereach Coven. If I get too close, I might alert him to trouble, so I should keep my distance.
Lyris caught up to me in the Ratway. I should let her know Ironbelly gave me the slip down here.
Goharth Ironbelly entered the Ratway below Riften. I should follow him and see if I can pick up his trail.
A portcullis slammed shut and separated me from Lyris! I should listen to what she has to say.
After the portcullis slammed shut and separated us, Lyris and I had to split up. While she tries to find a way back to me, I should continue to search for Goharth Ironbelly.
I caught up to Goharth Ironbelly and he's meeting with someone. I should listen in and see what I can learn.
Goharth Ironbelly met with someone named Sister Balra, then she murdered him! He dropped a key. I should retrieve the key and try to find a way to reach his body.
I picked up Ironbelly's key. I should try to reach his body and see what other evidence he might have left behind.
Lyris made her way back to me. I should let her know what I found out.
We have a clue as to where we might find the Sister Balra and the Icereach Coven. I should talk to Lyris and tell her what else I learned in the Ratway.
The messenger said that the Skald-King's agent is waiting at the Fighters Guild. I should head there and speak to her.
Sai Sahan wants me to return to the Dragonguard Sanctum and speak with him about his plan for me to infiltrate the Dragon cult.
I returned to the Dragonguard Sanctum. I should talk to Sai Sahan and make sure everyone is all right.
I should try to find the Twilight Cantor and see what brought her here.
Nahfahlaar wants me to recruit another Dragon. I should head back to the Dragonguard Sanctum and speak with him.
I met up with Za'ji and Aeliah in Black Heights. I should head into the temple.
The medallion led me to a number of charred bodies. I should examine one of the corpses and see if I notice anything.
Za'ji and I successfully retrieved the bell from Bahzahar's hideout. I should return it to Khenarthi's Breath Temple.
We stopped the witch's ritual and ended the storm. I should speak with Fennorian about finally getting out of this place.
A voice called for help from somewhere in this cell. I need to look around for the source.
The call for help came from inside a heavy sarcophagus. If I let them out, maybe they can explain what's going on.
The man I pulled from the sarcophagus offered to help me escape. I should hear his plan.
Fennorian claims he needs his flask before we can escape. I need to search around for his belongings.
Now that Fennorian has recovered, I should ask him about how we get out of here.
Fennorian knows the path out of the barrow. I should follow him to the exit.
I should find a weapon to defend against anyone who blocks our escape.
I should equip my weapon so I'm ready in case we're attacked during our escape.
Now that I have a proper weapon, Fennorian and I should continue to make our escape.
An enormous servant of the witches blocks our escape path. Seems like the only way out is through him. I need to dispatch Vitrus the Bloody.
With the guard out of the way, I can leave the prison with Fennorian.
We need to keep moving to reach the barrow's exit.
A giant spider blocks our exit. I need to kill it to continue our escape.
With the giant spider dispatched, we can leave these caves.
Fennorian spotted something on the bridge overhead. We need to hide and listen.
Fennorian wants to follow Matron Urgala and the vampire she was talking to. He thinks they're all connected to the investigation that brought him to Western Skyrim.
A massive storm is forming above the barrow. Fennorian believes answers await us at the storm's source. We need to reach its location.
We need to reach the top of the ruins to understand the nature of this dark storm.
To stop the strange storm, I need to kill Matron Urgala.
Even in Urgala's absence, her storm continues to gain power. I must destroy the witch pike that holds its energy.
Svana requested I return to the Blue Palace to discuss our plans for dealing with the Gray Host and their harrowstorms. I should head there now.
Svana asked me to help Fenn focus on the task at hand. We need his expertise to develop a defense against the harrowstorms. I should talk to him.
Lyris remembered the map we found in Tzinghalis's laboratory. She wants me to place it on the table so we can examine it.
Lyris thinks the map indicates where we can go to acquire the components Fenn needs to devise a defense against the harrowstorms. I should talk to her and see what she suggests.

We need to investigate the Gray Host camps to learn more about the Icereach Coven medallions and acquire refined netherroot brew so Fenn can replicate the enchantment that protects against harrowstorms. We also need to determine their ultimate plan.
I should return to the Blue Palace in Solitude to meet with my companions. We need to discuss what to do with the items and information we uncovered at the Gray Host camps.
I should talk to Fenn about his elixir and see if he thinks it will protect people from the harrowstorms.
Fenn needs Arkay's sacred oil to complete his elixir. I should be able to find some at the Hall of the Dead in Solitude.
I should ask High Priest Ingurt about acquiring some of Arkay's sacred oil for Fenn's elixir.
Swordthane Uthlet took the supply of Arkay's sacred oil to Castle Dour. I should go there and see if I can acquire some for Fennorian.
I obtained a bottle of Arkay's sacred oil. I should bring it to Fennorian in the Blue Palace in Solitude.
Fennorian asked me to add Arkay's sacred oil to his cauldron to complete the elixir.
I should speak to Fennorian about the elixir.
We decided to meet in the Midnight Barrow, located in Blackreach. Once there, we need to locate the Undergrove and test Fenn's elixir.
Lyris and I need to clear a path to the Undergrove so Svana and Fennorian can safely follow after us.
I overheard two Gray Host leaders, Rada al-Saran and Exarch Ulfra, discussing plans involving a massive harrowstorm and Solitude. I should confront them.
Svana ingested Fennorian's elixir and walked into the  harrowstorm. I need to protect her in order to give the elixir time to work.
The harrowstorm has subsided. I should see if Svana is unharmed after drinking Fenn's elixir.
Fenn's elixir worked. We need to return to the Blue Palace in Solitude and let High King Svargrim know we have a way to defend against the harrowstorms.
Svana is making one final attempt to appeal to her father. I should wait for her to finish making her case.
High King Svargrim revealed that he joined forces with the Gray Host! Svana requested a moment to think, so I should check in with Lyris.
Now that we examined a number of tapestries, I should talk to Sai Sahan.
I should speak to Nahfahlaar about the connection we share. I can find him in his chamber in the Dragonguard Sanctum.
I rescued Captain Mavvok and put a stop to Maxten Favrete's plot. I should speak with the captain for a reward.
I need to get this meat to the surviving crew before they succumb to the cold.
I should present the meat I gathered to Bosun Narz so he can give it to the crew.

Bosun Narz told me that a strange beast dragged some of the Silver Cormorant's crew away in the night. The captain and first mate left to track them down and haven't returned. I should see if I can find any sign of them.
I found first mate Drigsen taking refuge in a shipwreck. I should talk to her.
Drigsen says the beast that took her crew mates and captain is actually a large Khajiit. I should track down this Khajiit to find the captain.
The captain doesn't seem to be at the Khajiit's camp. I should search the areas for clues.
I found orders from Maxten Favrete. These instructions mention a stronghold and a place beneath called Verglas Hollow. I should see if the ruins up ahead lead to anything.
A frozen door blocks our path. I must find a way to destroy the ice that prevents us from passing.
Zan'ikh's orders detail the collection of frozen corpses. Maxten may have Captain Mavvok held in a lab somewhere beneath Verglas Hollow.
I found the entrance that leads to Maxten's laboratory. I should explore further.
Maxten uses a strange Frost Focus to harness her magic. I need to destroy it in order to stop her.
I need to gather samples of skin from cursed people and blood from undead wolves. Old Mjolen says she can learn about the curse from these specimens.
I gathered the ingredients. I should deliver them to Old Mjolen.
I should investigate the western farm for details about recent wolf attacks. The survivors reported seeing undead and ghosts.
Freiwen stopped me at the Kjenstag ruins and revealed she is still alive. I should return to Morthal and deliver the news to Lady Ninetha.
Freiwen told me she believes that only her death can end the curse. I should bring the locket she gave me to Lady Ninetha at the Whispering Axe Tavern.
Old Mjolen told me to fill Freiwen's locket with life energy to break the curse. I need to use the locket to capture memories around Morthal.
I obtained memories of Freiwen's life. I should deliver the locket to Old Mjolen.
A strange woman emerged from a sudden ice storm and accused me of following her. I should speak to her and find out who she is.
Lady Ninetha left to find Freiwen at the tree overlooking Morthal. I need to find the tree before the curse kills her.
The ritual broke Freiwen's curse and saved her life. I should talk to Lady Ninetha.
The ritual freed Freiwen and revived Lady Ninetha. I should talk to Ninetha.
Tranya is searching for the pack's missing alchemist, Rasir, who was close to developing a cure. I should help her determine where he was last seen.
I helped save Rasir and the other refugees. I need to speak to Tranya to let her know what happened.
I decided to take the abandoned sack with me. I should see what's inside when I have the chance.
Lyris wants me to lead the way as we explore the Ratway and try to pick up Goharth Ironbelly's trail.
I recovered Fennorian's flask. I should return it to him.
Svana asked me to meet her at the Blue Palace so we can once again try to convince High King Svargrim of the threat posed by the Icereach Coven and their allies.
The meeting between Svana and High King Svargrim didn't go well. I should speak to her.
In light of her father's unwillingness to act, Svana has decided to take matters into her own hands. She asked me to meet her in Morthal where she seeks an audience with Jarl Reddharn.
Svana wants me to tell Jarl Reddharn about the threat from the Icereach Coven and their harrowstorms. I should talk to him.

Jarl Reddharn's soldiers destroyed witch pikes they found around Morthal, but they disappeared after reporting Reachmen activity at the barrow. I agreed to investigate the barrow and find out what happened to the soldiers.
We found a witch pike at the heart of the ritual within Morthal Barrow. We need to destroy it.
I should talk to Jarl Reddharn and let him know what we found at the Morthal Barrow.
Lyris and I destroyed the last witch pike hidden within the Morthal Barrow. We should return to Jarl Reddharn and let him know what we found.
Now that Morthal is safe, I should find out what Svana wants to do next.
Svana wants me to meet her at the Eversnow Inn, which is southeast of the town of Karthwatch.
Svana beat me to the inn, but the place is full of terrified people. I should talk to Svana and find out what's going on.
Karthwatch has been devastated by a harrowstorm. Svana wants to investigate the town and see if there are any survivors, including Jarl Olfwenn. I should go with her.
The coven witch from the barrow appeared. She seems intent on protecting the funeral urn that she calls a gray reliquary. Svana wants me to destroy it.
Svana thinks the gray reliquaries are important to the coven. We should find any others still around the town and destroy them.
We destroyed all of the gray reliquaries we could find. Now we need to check on Jarl Olfwenn and see if she's all right.
Inside the jarl's hall, it appears that a battle took place. Dead villagers and harrowfiends litter the room, but there's one person still alive. I should talk to her.
Magister Fridelja sent Jarl Olfwenn to the cellar when the harrowstorm began. She asked me to go down there and make sure the jarl is all right.
Jarl Olfwenn is dead. Svana requested that I recover the Karthald Crown before returning to the hall above.
While Svana leads Magister Fridelja and the Karthwatch survivors to Solitude, she wants me to return to Solitude and find Lyris before meeting her in the Blue Palace.
Now that I'm back in Solitude, I need to find Lyris and let her know the princess wants to meet with us in the Blue Palace.
Now that Lyris and I are back together, it's time to go to the Blue Palace and meet up with Princess Svana.
I found evidence that suggests there is some truth to the Cormorant's crew claims about a beast roaming this frozen tundra. Perhaps the captain and first mate are close by.
I found evidence that suggests there is some truth to the Cormorant's crew claims about a beast roaming this frozen tundra. Perhaps the captain and first mate are close by.
We arrived in Eastmarch. Lyris says we need to head into the mountains and look for the Grinning Horker inn.
Lyris and I entered the Grinning Horker in Eastmarch. Everything appears quiet. I should talk to Lyris so we can discuss our next move.
Lyris and I need to search the desolate inn and see if we can find anything that points to what the Icereach Coven is planning.
The inn appears to have been abandoned in a hurry, but we found a trail of fresh blood leading to a hatch into the basement. We need to continue our search down there.
We found a secret passage in the Grinning Horker's basement. I should see where it goes and continue to look for the people who were lured here, as well as signs of the coven.
Apparently, the Icereach Coven has taken the people they lured here deeper into the cavern. I should talk to Lyris and let her know we're on the right track.

Lyris thinks this huge cavern is part of Blackreach, an old Nord legend about an underground world that supposedly stretches beneath all of Skyrim. I should take a look around and destroy any witch pikes while I wait for Lyris to catch up with me.

My search of Blackreach turned up witch pikes, coven notes, and more references to the coven's leader, Sister Balra. She might be in the Dwarven ruins in the western portion of this underground expanse. I should search in that area.
I found Lyris. I should tell her what I discovered down here in Blackreach.
Lyris and I need to find the Icereach Coven leader, Sister Balra, and deal with her once and for all. She might be inside a nearby Dwarven ruin.
The ruin was empty except for a wounded sentry from Windhelm. I should talk to him and find out what happened.

With his last dying breath, the wounded sentry admitted to betraying his oath. Sister Balra stabbed him before leaving for Windhelm, where the sentry believes she means to assassinate King Jorunn. I should talk to Lyris.
Lyris suggested we go to Windhelm immediately and make our way to the Palace of Kings. She wants to save Jorunn the Skald-King from the coven witch, Sister Balra.
Now that I arrived in Windhelm, I should make my way to the Palace of Kings with Lyris so that we can warn Jorunn the Skald-King that he's in danger.
Lyris wants me to talk to the housecarl so we can enter the Palace of Kings and find King Jorunn.
The housecarl opened the Palace of Kings for me and Lyris. While the housecarl rallies the guards, we need to go inside and find the Skald-King.
The Icereach Coven and its vampire allies have already infiltrated the palace. We need to find Jorunn the Skald-King and make sure he's all right.
We need to continue our search for Jorunn the Skald-King in the palace dungeons.
Sister Balra appears to be conducting some sort of dark ritual on Jorunn the Skald-King. Lyris and I need to put a stop to this before it's too late.
I defeated Sister Balra and saved King Jorunn. Now I should head to the palace throne room and talk to the Skald-King.
The Skald-King thinks that Western Skyrim might be in danger, but he needs to proceed carefully since they don't recognize his authority. In the meantime, he suggested I talk to Lyris.
Both Lyris and the Skald-King fear that the Icereach Coven has designs on the holds of Western Skyrim. I should talk to Lyris and see how she wants to proceed.
I freed Captain Mavvok from Maxten's clutches. I should talk to him and see how he and his crew are fairing.
I need to go to the Blue Palace in Solitude and talk to Svana.
My companions are discussing options with Swordthane Uthlet. I should listen to what they have to say.
I need to enter Blackreach and find the site of the harrowstorm ritual beneath the city of Solitude.
We reached a point in Blackreach that's approximately underneath the city of Solitude. I should talk to Lyris and see how she wants to proceed.
Two paths lead into Greymoor Keep. I can cross the bridge to the main entrance, or I can sneak inside through a sluice gate on the eastern wall, provided I can acquire a key.
Lyris wants us to split up and explore Greymoor Keep. We need to find the ritual site and disrupt it before the harrowstorm strikes the city above. I'll take Fennorian with me.
Fenn noticed something as we made our way up into Greymoor Keep. I should ask him what he found.
Fenn thinks the entire structure serves the same purpose as the witch pikesâ€”it's a focus for a gigantic harrowstorm! We need to continue exploring the keep to find a way to stop the coming storm.
High King Svargrim and Rada al-Saran are ascending through the tower of Greymoor Keep toward the city of Solitude above. We need to find a way to follow them.
Svargrim is ascending through Greymoor Keep to Solitude, where he plans to unleash the harrowstorm. I need to follow him through the upper levels of Greymoor Keep.
Lyris and I entered a gallery full of stone husks. We need to make it through here before any of these things come to life.
Fennorian needs time to open the way to the keep's upper levels. I should help Lyris and Svana defend his position.
Svana wants me to help her locate her father, High King Svargrim, on the upper levels of Greymoor Keep.
The tunnels ahead should lead up to the surface. I should follow them.
The tunnel ahead should lead to the surface. I should follow it and return to Solitude.
Svana is discussing strategy with Lyris and Fenn. I should listen to their exchange.
To stop the harrowstorm and save Solitude, I need to kill High King Svargrim.
I should check on Svana and then we need to get back to Lyris and Fenn.
Now that the immediate threat to Solitude is behind us, I should talk to Svana and see what else we need to do.
Priest Bavian asked me to go to the Kilkreath Temple stables and look for Acolyte Hjolt, Priest Direnna, and Roligmolf the pilgrim.
I found the three people Priest Bavian sent me in search of. Now I should meet her at the Pilgrims' Lodge, west of the temple, and tell her of their fates.
I found Priest Bavian in the lodge with one of the acolytes. I should talk to Priest Bavian.
I should enter Kilkreath Temple to search for High Priest Varkour.
Vampires have invaded Meridia's temple. Priest Bavian wants to make sure any remaining temple priests are all right, so we need to search for them.
Priest Bavian ran off. I should follow her.
Priest Bavian ran off. I should talk to her and make sure she's all right.
Priest Bavian thinks that High Priest Varkour went to the catacombs to secure a Meridia relic. I need to reach the chamberlain's sanctum and retrieve the key to open the door to the catacombs.
I located the chamberlain's sanctum. I should look around and find the key that opens the door to the catacombs.
Priest Bavian wants me to use the key and open the door to the catacombs.
I need to search the catacombs and find High Priest Varkour and the relic called Meridia's Brilliance.
High Priest Varkour has fallen to the same corruption as the rest of the priests and pilgrims. I need to retrieve the relic called Meridia's Brilliance.
Now that I have the Meridian relic, I should follow Priest Bavian and exit the catacombs through the old airshaft.
Priest Bavian asked me to meet her in the cave where all this began so I can present her with Meridia's Brilliance.
I should talk to Priest Bavian and give her the relic known as Meridia's Brilliance.
Priest Bavian met me near the door to the catacombs. I should talk to her before we proceed.
Fenn's message indicated that he apparently found something important and returned to Dusktown to investigate. Lyris and I should look for him in the Blackreach mining settlement.
We arrived at Fennorian's lodgings on the south side of Dusktown, but there's no sign of Fenn. I should look around and see if there's any indication of where Fenn may have gone.
We didn't find Fenn but we did notice signs of a struggle in his lodgings. I should talk to Lyris about what we discovered.
Fenn's notes mentioned he was going to meet with someone named Edjar at a camp east of the Dusktown bridge. I should look for this Edjar there.

I agreed to finish what Fenn started and use the Dwarven key to set Edjar's pack mates free. I need to make my way to the work camp on the western side of the Lightless Hollow and unlock their chains.
I should talk to Svana in her private chamber in the Blue Palace and tell her what we uncovered in Blackreach.
Edjar directed Lyris and me to a hidden door. He says it leads to a Dwarven lift that will take us into the tower. Then he can ride it to the top and escape into the wilds of Western Skyrim.
The crew of The Silver Cormorant are close to starving to death. I should gather meat for them so they have something to eat.
I found a camp. I should look around and see if anything belonging to Rasir is near by.

Brondold was investigating Icereach Coven activity on behalf of Lyris Titanborn. He was supposed to bring her his evidence at the Blue Palace in Solitude, but he never made it. I should look for Lyris at the palace and deliver Brondold's findings.
I informed Lyris of Brondold's death just as Queen Gerhyld arrived. Lyris asked me to take Brondold's place and introduce myself to the queen.

I informed the queen about what I learned from Brondold's documents. While she seems to believe us, she thinks we need more proof before High King Svargrim will trust an envoy from Jorunn the Skald-King. Now I should talk to Lyris.

Lyris suggested we follow Brondold's leads. I need to search the back alleys for Greyga, a local snitch, and ask about the smugglers. Then I need to go to the Lonely Troll and ask Maugh if he knows what the Reachmen were up to.

We learned that the smuggler Kasalla accepted smuggled goods at the docks and that a Breton working with Reachmen recruited half a dozen Nord laborers. I should talk to Lyris about which lead she wants to follow up on first.
Lyris suggested we pay a visit to Kasalla's warehouse at the docks below Solitude and see what she's been smuggling into the city before we check on our other lead.
A lone sentry guards Kasalla's warehouse. I should speak to him and see if I can convince him to let us into the warehouse.
The sentry recognized Lyris. Turns out he's a huge admirer. He ran off to get an item for her to autograph. With him gone, I can pick the warehouse lock at my leisure.
Kasalla's warehouse contains marked crates like the one I encountered on the docks. I should search these crates and see what's inside.
I recovered some strange urns and Reach fetishes from the marked crates, but Kasalla has arrived. She seems willing to talk things out. I should speak with her.

Kasalla smuggled the urns for an unnamed collector, but took on additional shipments recently that contained arcane materials. She mentioned that a Breton came by and took some of the crates to an abandoned lodge. I should discuss this with Lyris.
Lyris wants me to go check out the abandoned lodge in the foothills north of the city. She's going to circle around and meet me there.
I arrived at the remote lodge. I should look around for clues.

The laborers and the shipment from Kasalla's warehouse weren't at the lodge, but I found a letter ordering the Breton to send "the shipment" on to Kilkreath Temple. I need to find Lyris and let her know.
I met Lyris on the road not far from the lodge. I should speak to her about what I learned.
While Lyris heads to Solitude to try again to warn High King Svargrim, I need to go to Kilkreath Temple.
I was stopped by Fennorian on my way to Kilkreath Temple. I should talk to him.
Fennorian asked me to help him examine the strange witch pikes erected around the perimeter of the temple.
Fennorian spotted pilgrims leading a cart away from the temple before the storm struck. He wants to check that there were no members of the coven hiding among the pilgrims.
Now it's time to head to Kilkreath Temple and see what additional damage the harrowstorm caused.
We need to retrieve Fennorian's alchemical equipment, which he hid within a nearby copse of trees.
Lyris caught up with us but thinks Fennorian is a threat. I should talk to her and introduce her to the House Ravenwatch agent.
Lyris spotted an Icereach Coven witch called Sister Ambritt on the cliffs overlooking the temple. We need to get up there and catch her before she disappears.
We found the Icereach Coven witch. We need to kill Sister Ambritt before she can summon another harrowstorm.
We defeated the coven witch but Fennorian found something. I should follow him and see what he discovered.
Fennorian led me to an altar of some sort. I should ask him what he found.
Fennorian and I learned a lot here at the Kilkreath Temple. I should talk to Lyris and see if she thinks we have enough to take to the queen so she can convince High King Svargrim now.
I should investigate the cavern Rasir mentioned in his journal to see if he's inside.
I killed Hakgrym the Howler. Now, I should continue my journey deeper into the Unhallowed Grave.
I encountered a door locked behind a glowing Pyre Watch ward. I should search for a way to open it.
With the civilians safely returned, I should check in with Hafskjar.
I need to enter the old barrow on the west side of town. Fenrar says I might find survivors there.
I should search the barrow for any surviving townsfolk. Fenrar's brother Hafskjar escorted them there for safety.
I found Hafskjar hiding alone inside the barrow. I should talk to him and learn about the rest of the survivors.
Hafskjar told me Reachmen dragged the survivors deeper into the barrow. I need to follow their trail and find where they took the villagers.
I found tunnels that the Reachmen mined through the caves beneath Karthwatch. I should follow them to see where they lead.
