Now that we selected our formal attire, I should talk to Eveli and see if she's ready to go.
Bastian and I entered Deepscorn Hollow. This does not appear to be a common smuggler's cave. I should continue exploring.
Bastian and I found some people locked in a cage in the second cavern. We should help them.

The prisoners we freed told us that these caves are occupied by a cult dedicated to Sithis, not smugglers. They believe the cultists are planning to sacrifice people to their god. I should confer with Bastian.

The tailor Percius Loche can supply us with formal attire. I can either pay for the outfits with gold, or trade for them by gathering bluewhisper moth silk from their nests along the river north of Leyawiin.
Amalia told me I'll find Phalevon's relics within Undertow Cavern. I need to venture into the cave.
We retrieved the last of Phalevon's relics. We should leave Undertow Cavern before the horn causes any more trouble.
As promised, I helped <<1>> recover Phalevon's relics. I should leave them in her care and claim my reward.
Place Smoke Bombs
Lyranth says she can open a portal back to Nirn for us, but she can only do it in the entry hall. I need to follow Eveli and Sombren and get to that location.
Governor Keshu asked me to speak with the Ambitions and see if we can figure out a better place to hide them than in Gideon. I'll find them in the Temple of Dibella.
I arrived at the temple to see Calia's powers rage out of control. Luckily, Sombren was able to contain them before too much damage occurred. I should talk to Sombren.
Now that I informed Eveli as to our plans, I need to meet the Ambitions at a shrine in the marsh to the north and west of Gideon.
Sombren revealed that his mentor is a Dremora. He wants me to speak to Xynaa and find out if she thinks she can help the twins as she helped Sombren.
Xynaa said she can prevent Calia and Destron from destroying themselves. I should speak with Sombren. He can tell me more about the process and finding Xynaa's sanctuary.
Before we can take the twins into the Deadlands to meet with Xynaa, they have to be attuned to the plane. We need to gather fragments of the Deadlands that have made their way to Tamriel.
Calia, Destron, and I gathered two slivers of fragments from the Deadlands. Now we need to meet Sombren on the road south of Gideon.
We met Sombren on the road south of Gideon. Now to talk to him and see what we need to do next.
Sombren and the twins opened a portal to the Deadlands. I should follow them to the other side.
We arrived in the Deadlands and were greeted by another projection of Xynaa. I should talk to her.
Xynaa instructed Calia and Destron to find obelisks that will reveal hidden truths. Since the Ambitions can't use their power without risking disaster, I must protect them as they walk this path.
We reached the first of the obelisks. I need to activate the obelisk in my role as witness to the truths that Calia and Destron are about to learn.
The first obelisk showed us a vision of the twins' past. Now to get them safely to the next obelisk.
We reached the second obelisk. I need to activate it in my role as witness to the truths that Calia and Destron are about to learn.
The second obelisk showed us a vision of the twins' past. Now to get them safely to the final obelisk.
To get to Farrul Lupus, we need to meet with Renna at the Mages Guildhall in Riften. I can take the cart or make my own way there and rendezvous with Eveli at the Mages Guild.
We found the last obelisk and a portal opened when we arrived. It seems Calia, Destron, and I must enter that portal to see the final vision.

The last obelisk's portal took me to the Imperial Throne Room in the White-Gold Tower. Vandacia sits on the throne, and Mehrunes Dagon watches outside. How is this possible? I should speak with Vandacia.
I spoke with Emperor Vandacia in a vision of a terrible future. He claimed that he destroyed me many years ago. However, Sombren arrived and offered a way out. I should take it.
Now that we completed the three visions of the obelisks, I should talk to the Ambitions and make sure everyone is ready for what comes next.
We need to enter Xynaa's sanctuary so that she can show the twins how to control their powers.
We entered Xynaa's sanctuary. Now I should talk to the Dremora.
Xynaa is ready to teach the twins to control their power. We should follow her.
Xynaa betrayed us! She used some sort of magic to teleport me and Sombren into a dungeon. Sombren appears to be wounded. I should check on him.
Xynaa drained Sombren's power. He suggested I retrieve the skull of a Daedric lord from Xynaa's treasure chamber. He believes he can use the energy within it to recharge his power.
I recovered the skull of Xynaa's enemy. Now I should head to the door in the north and meet up with Sombren.
I found Sombren in a meditative state, just like he told me. I should present the skull to him so it can recharge his power.
Now that Sombren's power has been recharged, we need to return to Xynaa's sanctuary and find Calia and Destron.
Xynaa appears to be about to sacrifice the twins. While Sombren protects them, I need to deal with Xynaa.
Calia and Destron opened a portal to Gideon. I should follow them.
Sombren made a mistake and led us to a Dremora loyal to Mehrunes Dagon. We escaped, but not before she tried to sacrifice the twins and kill us. I should talk to Sombren.
Eveli asked me to talk to Renna while she keeps watch. She has a feeling that someone has been following her and doesn't want us being caught by surprise. I should go talk to Renna.
A frightened prisoner is anxious to get out of these caves, but he seems willing to speak to me. I should see if he knows anything.
Deepscorn Hollow appears to be a maze of caves and passages. We should continue our search.
We came upon culists of Sithis performing a ritual in one of the caves. We should interrupt the ritual and attempt to corner a cultist for information.
We interrupted cultists performing some ritual in the lower cavern. One cultist was hiding and tried to sneak away. Bastian thinks we should grab him and interrogate him.
I cornered a cultist who was participating in a ritual in the cavern nearby. He might know something about where Quistley Silvelle is being held.
To participate, I need to travel through Elsweyr and accomplish a set of tasks.
Renna explained that Farrul Lupus and her live in a house here in Riften, around the corner from the bank. Eveli and I should go there and talk to the late emperor's steward.
Farrul Lupus called out from inside the house. He sounds hurt and in need of help. We must find a way inside and quickly.

I interrogated a captured cultist. He told me that the Daughter of Sithis, leader of this cult, has Quistley. He also says that Tenarei Vels may have been caught by the Sithis cult. I should see what Bastian suggests.

Bastian and I agreed to split up. He wants to question the cultist more closely about the Daughter of Sithis, but it sounds like Tenarei Vels is in immediate danger of being sacrificed. I need to find her.
I found Tenarei Vels suspended in the middle of some ritual. I should free her before the Cult of Sithis completes their sacrificial rite.
I freed Tenarei Vels from the cultists' ritual. She suggested that we find a safe place to talk. I should follow her.
Tenarei offered to help me find Quistley Silvelle. I should continue to explore the lower caverns of Deepscorn Hollow.
The cultists have a vampire imprisoned. He may be able to help us.
The hidden passage led us to a door. If Tenarei is right, this should lead to the inner sanctum of this cult. I should continue on.

I explored the lower levels of Deepscorn Hollow. Tenarei Vels believes we are drawing close to the lair of the Daughter of Sithis, but she wants to speak with me before we go on. I should see what's on her mind.
We found Quistley Silvelle and the Daughter of Sithis. It's time to save Quistley, whether he wants to be saved or not.

The Daughter of Sithis had Quistley Silvelle, but she wasn't holding him prisoner. He was very upset when he saw Bastian and fled into another room. I need to talk to him and see if I can sort this out.
Quistley Silvelle had no idea what sort of danger he was in. I must decide whether I allow Tenarei Vels to take him back to the gangster Larz-Tul, or let Bastian get him away from Blackwood.
Both Bastian and Tenarei have a claim on Quistley Silvelle, but it sounds as though Bastian has an idea on how to solve this dilemma. I should talk to him.
I should speak with Eveli and see if she has any ideas on how we go about finding the remaining Ambitions.

Farrul Lupus has been murdered and I found a sheet of paper decorated with a bloody hand print on his body. Renna and Eveli have arrived. I should talk to Renna and see if she has any idea what happened here.
I should talk to Revus Demnevanni at his camp outside the Ayleid ruins of Veyond.
Revus Demnevanni urged me to meet him at his field laboratory inside the ruins of Veyond.
Revus Demnevanni wants me to paint a series of stabilizing runes around his experiment site. I should also speak with his student, Tiras Tirethi.
I finished painting the stabilizing runes. I should talk to Revus about what comes next.
Revus needs me to help him prepare for his experiment by re-attuning any instruments that stop working during the kindling process. I should listen to him for instructions as I work.
Revus Demnevanni is performing his experiment. I should wait for him to complete it.
It appears that Revus Demnevanni's experiment failed. I should speak to him about what to do next.

Revus Demnavanni thinks there's something magical in Veyond's lower chambers that's disrupting his experiment. He urged me to take Tiras deeper into the ruin to root out the source of the interference.
Tiras and I found a number of clouded varla stones in Veyond's lower vaults. I should wait for the young Dark Elf to analyze the situation.
Tiras drained the energies from the clouded varla stones and encouraged me to smash them. Hopefully, breaking them will resolve Revus's issue.
Revus Demnevanni arrived. He seems intent on speaking with Tiras about our next move. I should listen in.
Tiras Tirethi vanished in a freak accident. I should speak to Revus Demnevanni about our next course of action.
Tiras Tirethi may still be still alive, but cursed in some way. I should follow Revus and try to find him in deeper inside Veyond.
Revus's attempt to free Tiras failed. Now, some force has dragged the student deeper into the ruin. I should talk to Revus Demnevanni about what is happening to his pupil.
Something is drawing Tiras Tirethi through Veyond. I need to follow him and help Revus Demnevanni undo the curse on his student before it's too late.
Revus thinks the greatest source of disruptive energy is somewhere nearby. We should look for this central lode. If we find it, we might have a chance of rescuing Tiras Terethi from his fate.
We found a clouded Ayleid Well which may tear Tiras to pieces if we don't destroy it. I should speak to Revus Demnavanni about what to do next.
Tiras survived the destruction of the well, and seemed genuinely grateful. Revus urged me to meet him back on the surface near his camp. I should make my way there.
I should speak to Revus Demnevanni at his camp outside Veyond.
I should talk to Revus Demnevanni and learn how I can help with his experiment.
Enter the Festival Arena by obtaining a King Boar Invitational ticket.
Collect fermented mudcrab apples by gathering them during the King Boar challenge in the <<1>>. Gaining access to the Arena requires an Invitation.
I gathered some fermented mudcrab apples, I can gather more or return to <<1>> to see if she can use them.
I have fermented mudcrab apples for <<1>>. I should speak to her about getting my cider.
Return to the <<1>> to find fermented mudcrab apples. You may need to acquire another King Boar Invitational ticket.
I found another hidden annex entrance but the ward was already removed. The cultists must be inside. I should enter and secure the cache before they can acquire it.
Eveli wants to go to Gideon and talk to Keshu the Black Fin, governor of the city. I should meet her there.
I arrived in Gideon. Now I should meet Eveli at the governor's mansion so we can talk to Keshu.

According to Governor Keshu, ojel-bak refers to a natural formation in Sul-Xan territory. It translates roughly to "the pit of the outsider." I need to meet Eveli on the edge of the area to begin our search.
I arrived at the border of the Sul-Xan territory. I should talk to Eveli before we venture any farther.
We believe that the vault containing the Four Ambitions is located in the area referred to as the ojel-bak, or the pit of the outsider. We need to find this place before Vandacia and his cultists do.
The Dremora Lyranth appeared as we approached the location. She wants to talk to us. I should speak to her.
Lyranth explained that the vault is warded, so I need to find a way to remove the wards before we can enter and search for the Four Ambitions.
We removed the first ward and opened the door to the vault. Now to go inside and see what else awaits us.
We entered the vault, but Lyranth went on ahead. Before we proceed, I should talk to Eveli.
Now that we're inside, we should explore the vault and try to find the Four Ambitions before Vandacia and the Waking Flame cultists arrive.
Eveli spotted another warded door ahead of us. I should talk to her before I attempt to disrupt the ward.
The ward cubes and lectern are arranged similarly to the ones outside the vault. With the book in place, I need to turn the ward cubes to match the symbols, disrupt the ward, and open the door.
I disrupted the ward and opened the inner door. Now to keep exploring the vault. We need to find the Four Ambitions.
We need to find a way to lower the bridge so we can cross the chasm and continue our search. I should look around the area for a switch or a lever.
One more ward stands between us and the inner vault. Eveli has placed the book on the lectern. Now I need to rotate the cubes to disrupt the ward.
I disrupted the ward and unlocked the door. Now to see what waits inside the vault's inner chamber.
Instead of a cache of Daedric weapons, we found two people inside the inner vault. I should talk to them and discover who they are.
Eveli called out. Sounds like she's in trouble. I better go find her while Lyranth gets the twins to safety.
I reached Eveli. I should find out what she knows about the Waking Flame cultists that used portals to enter the vault.
We need to track down the Waking Flame cultists who entered the vault via portals after we took down all the wards.
We found Lyranth and the twins just as a group of cultists were about to grab them. Instead, Destron unleashed immense power and eliminated the threat. I should ask him how he accomplished that.
Now that the cultists here have been dealt with and the twins were confirmed to be two of the Ambitions, I should talk to Eveli and see if we can figure out what to do with the twins.
Eveli decided to bring the twins to Gideon so that Governor Keshu can help protect them. I should meet them there.
I returned to Gideon. Eveli said to meet at the governor's mansion so we could bring Keshu up to speed on the Ambitions. I should head there and talk to her.
I have fermented mudcrab apples for <<1>>. I should speak to her about getting my cider.
I have fermented mudcrab apples for <<1>>. I should speak to her about getting my cider.
I delivered the fermented mudcrab apples to <<1>>. I should speak to her about getting my cider.
Stone walls surround the Silent Halls, but there is an entryway we can use to get inside.
Adrahawn appears to have brought Bevene back from the brink of death. I should speak to him now that the ordeal is over.
I arrived at Renna's house. I should knock twice on the door or Farrul Lupus won't respond.
The vampire held prisoner in this dead end told me there's a switch concealed beneath a crate nearby that opens a hidden passage. I should look around for it.
We were too late to save Farrul Lupus and now the trail seems to have grown cold. I should meet Eveli under the docks and see if she has any idea what we should do next.
We discovered the inner sanctum of the cult. Quistley should be somewhere inside â€¦ and possibly the woman who calls herself the Daughter of Sithis.
While Eveli and I have run into a dead end, Lyranth arrived and claims to have important information to share. I should talk to her.

Adrahawn reacted to something the moment we entered the ruins. He claims the plants are shouting, but I can't hear anything. He suggested we search the overgrowth for some clue as to what the issue is.
Upon entering the Silent Halls, we discovered some signs of recent occupancy. I should search the items left here for some clue about who's been here.
Adrahawn and I decided to resume our search for the source of the harrada creeper growth, wary that we might not be alone down here.
We found a wounded Dark Elf among the bodies of some people who were recently killed. I should speak to her about what happened to them.
The Dark Elf begged me to rescue her family still being held captive by a tribe of hostile Argonians called the Sul-Xan. I should speak to Adrahawn about this.
Adrahawn believes that helping the people held captive by the Sul-Xan should be our first priority. We need to locate where they are being held prisoner.
The Sul-Xan's prisoners are being forced to tend to the harrada creepers vines throughout a large cavern. I need to undo their chains and release them.
Adrahawn will catch up once he's finished dealing with the seeds and Bevene. I should head outside to join the escapees.
Commander Ortin asked Eveli and I to investigate the missing servant and her connection to the councilor's murder. He suggested we ask the other servants working in the kitchen and dining hall.

Lyranth has opened a portal to the Imperial sewers. Apparently, the scroll recovered in the first cache annex we explored provided her with the location of another cache below the Imperial City. I should step through the portal and investigate.

Eveli and I are inside the annex hidden in the Imperial Sewers, but the Waking Flame cult is already here. I need to find more clues relating to Leovic's secret and try to determine what the cult is doing down here.

According to Leovic's journal, his father built a shrine to Mehrunes Dagon in this hidden complex. And the ritual I recovered indicates that the cult plans to use this shrine to learn the location of the Ambitions. I should find the shrine.
Doombringer Eshil stepped through a portal behind the large statue. We need to follow him before the portal closes.
Doombringer Eshil stepped through a portal behind the large statue. We need to follow him before the portal closes.
We followed Doombringer Eshil into the Deadlands, the Oblivion realm of Mehrunes Dagon! We need to find the cult leader and stop him.
We found Doombringer Eshil. We should kill him and put a stop to whatever evil he's doing.
We defeated Doombringer Eshil. A voice claiming to be Mehrunes Dagon opened a portal and told us to leave this realm. I guess we should oblige.
The portal returned us to Elden Root. Lyranth is here. I should tell her what we uncovered.
Yisara asked me to meet her in the city gardens. According to the locals, a ghostly presence wanders the area. This might be a perfect opportunity to test her magic lantern.
Yisara seems eager to accept Mathen's proposal. I should speak with her.
I found Yisara in the city gardens. I should talk to her before we try to contact the spirit with her magic lantern.
Yisara's lantern seems to be reacting to something. I should give it a shake to see if it works.
Yisara's lantern worked! A ghost appeared and is speaking. I should talk to her.
The ghost of Duchess Astella insisted that someone named Alizinda placed a curse on Castle Giovesse. I should speak with Yisara about what we discovered and what comes next.

Yisara wants to investigate the cottage Duchess Astella told us about. It should be northeast of Gideon. If we can summon the ghost of the duchess's son, we might learn more about the curse of Castle Giovesse.
We found the cottage where Mathen and his lover, Alizinda, used to meet. I should have a look around.
Eveli wants to review what we learned by questioning the servants. I should talk to her.
Talaise the servant was murdered. I should talk to Eveli about this development.
I purchased outfits for myself and Eveli. I should select the formal attire I want to wear to the event while Eveli does the same.

It seems that the missing servant may have visited the pantry before taking Councilor Abor's meal to the watchtower. We should take a look and see if we can find any indication of what happened to her there.
Now that we are out of Bloodrun Cave, I should speak to Mim-Jasa about what just occurred.
I should enter Bloodrun Cave so I can help Mim-Jasa destroy the remains of the dead Shadowscales.
Mim-Jasa and I need to find the remains of the Shadowscales and destroy them in order to protect their spirits from Tumma-Maxath.
I destroyed the skull of the Shadowscale Ajum-Shei. I should leave Bloodrun Cave and meet Mim-Jasa outside.
We destroyed the remains of the Shadowscales, but found one skeleton without a head. Mim-Jasa seems worried about this. I should speak with him about it.
Mim-Jasa fears the necromancer Tumma-Maxath took the missing skull of the Shadowscale Ajum-Shei in order to power his ritual. We need to locate the skull and destroy it.
I found a tarnished ring and the frayed remains of an old journal. I should show these items to Yisara.
I should light the spirit lantern to summon Mathen's ghost. Hopefully he can shed some light on the origin of the curse.
The lantern illuminated another restless spirit: Duchess Astella's son, Mathen. I should speak with him.
Mathen is not sure if his missing regalia is tied to his spirit being bound to this plane, but suggested we investigate the chapel in the ruins of the once-proud Castle Giovesse.
We found the chapel in Castle Giovesse where Duchess Astella laid Mathen to rest. I should search for Mathen's golden armor. With any luck, it will provide the means to break the castle's curse.
I discovered a curious incantation scrawled on a dusty scroll. This may be related to the Giovesse curse. I should share it with Yisara.

Yisara seems confident that Alizinda did not write this incantation, which means someone else is responsible for the curse. I should ignite the spirit lantern again. With any luck, a nearby ghost can shed some more light on this mystery.
Duchess Astella appeared when I ignited the lantern. I should find out what she's doing in the chapel.

Duchess Astella, not Alizinda, inadvertently placed the curse on Castle Giovesse during a botched necromantic ritual. Finding the duchess' notes may be our only means of reversing the spell and liberating the souls trapped here.

In order to break the curse on Castle Giovesse, we need to find Mathen's golden armor. According to Duchess Astella's notes, we'll find his helm, breastplate, and shield hidden under clumps of heartsbane all around the castle grounds.
Yisara feels uneasy about collecting Mathen's armor and wants to try contacting him again to get his opinion. I should ignite the spirit lantern to see if he'll appear.
We found piece of Mathen's armor, but Yisara wants to speak before we continue our search.

Alchemy tells me that the people in town have been reluctant to speak to her and her troupe. She asked me to speak with several people in town who had their loved ones vanish to try and get the whole story.

Maelle Favraud said her daughter ran away recently and she worries that Annyce may fall victim to the same circumstances that befell the other townfolk. I agreed to search for Annyce and she told me I might want to start my search at their home.
Maelle suspects that Annyce might have run off to her childhood play fort. I should look for her there.
We found Annyce's old play fort, but it's still in very good condition and shows signs of recent use. I should look around.

Alchemy feels confident that she's got a read on Annyce's motivations and she noticed some clues that Annyce may have had help running away. There are some tracks leading out into the marsh. We should take our search that way.
Annyce's trail lead to a small ruin in the marsh, filled with books. There's no sign of Annyce, but I should search the small ruin for clues.
There are signs that someone has been to this ruin recently and burned some things. I should see what Alchemy makes of what we found.

Alchemy believes that some sort of ritual was conducted at the ruin, but Annyce's trail ends here. Alchemy wants to remain at the ruin a while longer to study things in more detail. She suggests I go back to town and keep an eye out for Annyce.
It appears that Annyce has returned to Farmer's Nook. She's at the Happy Crow Inn. I should speak to her.
I spoke to Annyce, but she didn't seem to want to share any details about what happened to her. Alchemy pulled me aside to talk in private, I should hear what she has to say.

Alchemy informed me that the ruin where we found the ritual was one of many Ayleid ruins in the area devoted to Hermaeus Mora, the Daedric Prince of Forbidden Knowledge. Alchemy wants to investigate another, larger ruin north of town.
Alchemy and I found the Ayleid ruin she mentioned. She'd like me to lead the way in case there's danger. I should try the door.

When I tried to open the tomb, a magical ward repelled me and a guardian appeared. Alchemy seemed to recognize them as a character from the book we found. I should speak to the guardian to see about gaining entry to the ruin.
I dealt with all of the guardians preventing me from entering the Ayleid ruin. Time to explore it.
We found all the people who had vanished from Farmer's Nook in the ruin, alive and well, but locked in a deep sleep. I should speak to Alchemy about this.
Alchemy seems more confident that she can safely break the spell on the dreamers. I should wait for her to finish her attempt.
Annyce and the others are awake, but they aren't happy about it. I should speak to Annyce and find out how she wound up like this.
Annyce's mother arrived while I was questioning Annyce. I should speak to Maelle about the imposter, Cres.
With Annynce and the others awakened from their supernatural dream, I should head back to Farmer's Nook and confront Cres about their involvement in this.
I arrived to find Bradon searching for Annyce. I should find out what happened from him.
Bradon said that "Annyce" suddenly rushed out of the inn and ran out of town, but he couldn't keep up with her. I should head after her and see if I can catch Cres.
I found "Annyce" hiding in the small Ayleid ruin we found before. Time to confront Cres.

Cres tried to maintain their ruse, but became desperate as it became clear their plan was foiled. Cres wanted to bargain with me, but Alchemy has had enough of the deception. She's trying to unmask the imposter.

Cres confessed that they do not enjoy their existence in the service of Hermaeus Mora and was bargaining with the disillusioned townsfolk to take over their lives in Farmer's Nook. I should speak to Alchemy about what we should do with the Daedra.

Alchemy sympathizes with Cres's plight and suggested that she might be able to give them the life they desire as a part of the House of Reveries. I need to decide whether that's a good idea or if it would be safer to send Cres back to Oblivion.
I decided that it would be best to send Cres back to Oblivion. Alchemy will banish them.
I agreed that Alchemy should offer Cres a place in the House of Reveries. She will make a pact with the Daedra and give them a life as a member of her troupe.
While Eveli returns to Leyawiin to consult with Councilor Lovidicus, I need to go to Tidewater Cave to talk to Councilor Faleria, and to Gideon to warn Councilor Vandacia.
I arrived in Gideon and it seems that Councilor Vandacia survived an attack. I should speak to him and find out what happened.
I need to make sure that Councilor Faleria finished her business at Tidewater Cave and will return to Leyawiin for her safety.
I warned everyone I could. Now to return to Leyawiin Castle and report to Councilor Lovidicus.
Mathen appeared. I should speak to him about Yisara's concerns.
Driven by romantic passion, Mathen whisked Yisara away and vanished. I need to find the rest of his armor quickly. Hopefully performing the duchess's ritual will bring him and Yisara back.
I found Mathen's breastplate and shield. I should ignite the spirit lantern to summon Duchess Astella. Hopefully she can help me break the curse and rescue Yisara.
Duchess Astella appeared. I should talk to her about how to break the curse and how to free Yisara.
Duchess Astella requires one last item to break the curse: the Sword of Giovesse. I need to delve into the castle's mausoleum to reclaim the blade.
I found the Sword of Giovesse. I should take it and Mathen's armor to Tavia's Tower. Hopefully we can break the curse and return Yisara to the land of the living.
I should use the spirit lantern one last time to summon the spirits of Castle Giovesse.

The Duchess, Mathen, and Yisara all appeared when I used the spirit lantern. Duchess Astella urged me to lay out Mathen's armor and the Sword of Giovesse. Hopefully this will free both the spirits of Giovesse and Yisara.
Duchess Astella vanished when I returned Mathen's regalia to the altar in Tavia's Tower, but Mathen himself remains. I should talk to him about what happened.
Mathen believes his soul is bound to the ring of Mara he intended to give to Alizinda all those years ago. He wants to speak with Yisara about what he should do.

Mathen declared his love for Yisara and told her that the ring she carries has the power to bind him to her. If she destroys the ring, his spirit will fade to Aetherius and his soul will be at peace. The choice is hers. I should talk to her.
Yisara was moved by Mathen's proposal, but her conscience moved her to destroy the ring that bound Mathen to the mortal plane. I should talk to her about what comes next.
I need to ensure that Councilor Faleria finished her business at Tidewater Cave and will return to Leyawiin.
I need to go to Gideon and warn Councilor Vandacia about the assassination attempts. Eveli suggested I could find him in the Gideon courthouse.
Councilor Vandacia says his personal guard thwarted his assassin and he's been imprisoned in a cell in the courthouse basement. I should go down and interrogate the prisoner.
The assassin somehow disabled the cell lock and escaped. I should examine the lock and determine what happened.
Whatever acid the assassin used to destroy the lock appears to have dripped as he escaped and left a trail. I should follow it.
The assassin's trail led to a hidden chamber. I should look around.
The assassin wishes to speak with me.
The assassin, Elam Drals, claims the Dark Brotherhood didn't kill the councilors and that he never attacked Councilor Vandacia. I should return to the courthouse and show Vandacia the letter I found.
I helped Hokatsei restore her brother Deet-Loh and lift the Nereid's curse. Now I should talk to her about the reward she promised me.
We bathed Deet-Loh in three different pools, but nothing seemed to appease the Nereid. I should talk to Hokatsei and see if she has any other bright ideas.
I arrived at Leyawiin Castle. Now I should report to Councilor Lovidicus and let him know what I uncovered.
<<1>> has more information about this competition I've been invited to participate in.
<<1>> informed me that I'm officially entered to participate in bouts with King Boar. Now I need to defeat him to claim my prize.
A ward bars the door into a hidden annex and apparently it is extremely dangerous to Daedra. She gave me an amulet that should allow me to destroy the ward. I should use it and see what happens.
Perhaps Alchemy will have some idea what is going on.
I agreed to escort Hokatsei through the ruins of Vunalk to bathe her brother Deet-Loh in the Nereid's waters. I should enter the ruins.
Hokatsei suggests we need to bathe her brother in at least three different pools within the ruins to appease Sister of Pools. I should find some suitable locations.

Hokatsei thinks that if Deet-Loh sings with the Nereid's frog, that will show the water spirit that they're happy and make her forgive her brother. I just need to escort Deet-Loh deeper into the ruins.
Now that Deet-Loh has been restored to his natural form, I should meet him and his sister outside the ruins.
I should listen to <<1>> sing.
I destroyed the protective ward. Now I should enter the hidden annex and see what's waiting inside.
I need to search the crypt for the entrance to the Ayleid ruin if I hope to stop the Painted Eye. Teldundindo said the entrance should be in one of the chapel's tombs.
I gathered bluewhisper moth silk. I should bring it to the tailor and trade it for the formal attire we need.

I entered the Ayleid ruin with Seeks-the-Dark to find the Painted Eye's leader conducting a ritual and drawing power from some kind of crystals to fuel it. They might be key to disrupting whatever the Painted Eye is doing.
The letter I found indicates that the Dark Brotherhood sanctuary is somewhere inside Bloodrun Cave. I should meet Eveli there so we can renew our investigation.
I reached the site of the Ayleid ruin marked on the map. I should enter Ne Salas and look for another Imperial cache.
I should visit these places and overcome challenges there.\n\nCraglorn world events include Anka-Ra burial sites, magical Anomalies, and Nirncrux mines.
I completed tasks in each of the places the notice mentioned. I should report the result of my adventures to <<1>>.
We found a crack in the cave wall that led to some sort of ancient ruin. Eveli thinks we may have found the entrance to the sanctuary. I should talk to her before we proceed.
A Wood Elf named Eveli Sharp-Arrow confronted me just inside Ne Salas. I should talk to her.
Eveli thinks the black door ahead of us leads to the Dark Brotherhood sanctuary. I should examine the door and try to open it. Maybe the letter I found will help with that.
I should search the Ne Salas ruin and see if I can find another Imperial cache.
Eveli killed the cultist scholar before she could break the ward protecting the cache. I should use Lyranth's amulet and try to destroy the ward.
We lowered the bridge. Now we should go across it and continue exploring the vault.
Eveli wants to try to open the cache. I should wait and see what happens.
The Imperial cache contained Emperor Leovic's signet ring and a scroll written in some sort of Imperial code. I should talk to Eveli and show her what I found.
Lyranth opened a portal to take us to Elden Root so we can meet Eveli's contact. I should use the portal now.
Eveli thinks she has someone who can help us decipher the coded scroll. I should inform Lyranth and see if she made any progress with the sealed scroll we found in the other annex.
Eveli introduced me to her contact, Beragon. I should show him the coded Imperial scroll and see if he can decipher it.
We opened the black door. Now to enter the sanctuary and see what we can find.
Elam Drals and a few other Dark Brotherhood assassins were waiting for us inside. I should talk to him.
The Order of the Waking Flame cultists have invaded the sanctuary. I need to explore the rest of the installation and figure out what's going on here.
<<1>> told me she's looking for the sword, armor, and helm of Phalevon the Magnificent. I should search for the hero's relics.
I gathered three worn relics from Phalevon's tomb. I should check with <<1>> and see what's next.
<<1>> explained that the last and most important of the relics she seeks, <<2>>, remains missing â€¦ and might be cursed. I should search deeper in Undertow Cavern.
I should get more information from <<1>> about how to go about setting up a prank.
I should look for the <<1>> in <<2>> and carry out the prank.
I need to pick up a Prank Kit at <<1>>'s workshop.
I need to place the prank book without <<1>> noticing.
I should hide nearby to see if my prank is successful.
I carried out the prank. I should return to <<1>> to share my success.
My prank was successful. I should talk to <<1>>.
The cultists are attempting to retreat, but Elam Drals killed one before they could close the portal. I should talk to Elam and see if he knows why the cultists attacked.
Elam Drals plans to enter the cultists' portal and make them pay for attacking and killing his Dark Brotherhood brothers and sisters. I should accompany him to learn more about the cult's plans.
Now that the ritual is complete, I should speak to Druid Jend.
I should speak to Druid Jend and find out what he learned.
The portal deposited us in what appears to be an old Ayleid ruin. We need to look around and see if we can find any sign of the Order of the Waking Flame or what their true agenda happens to be.
I uncovered several clues in the ruins. I should talk to Elam about what we discovered.
Daluion suggested we search for clues within Zenithar's Abbey to unearth the ultimate fate of the Golden Anvil.
Elam suggests we continue to explore the ruins and see if we can find the high priest of the Order of the Waking Flame.
Elam noticed two Waking Flame cultists just ahead. We should listen to see if they reveal any pertinent information.

The cultists revealed they found hidden documents in the sanctuary that pointed them to the location of one of the Ambitions. They also claimed one of the councilors is secretly their high priest. We need to find a pedestal so we can follow them.
We found another pedestal. I should see what Elam has to say before I try to use the amulet to open a portal.
I should try to use the Waking Flame amulet on the pedestal to see if it will really open a portal.
The amulet opened a portal. I should enter the portal and see where it leads.
I explored Undertow Cavern with <<1>>, recovering several relics belonging to Phalevon. I need to speak to <<1>> and give her the things we gathered.
As promised, I helped <<1>> recover Phalevon's relics. I should leave them in her care and claim my reward.
We reached a chamber that appears to be some sort of shrine to Mehrunes Dagon. I should look around.
A woman approached me while I was questioning the locals about the strange disappearances. I should see what she wants.
I found a few unusual things around Maelle and Annyce's home, but I don't have a clear picture of how they fit together. I should speak to Maelle and see what she makes of things.
I should discuss what we found in the shrine chamber with Elam Drals.
I need to return to Leyawiin and warn the remaining council members of Councilor Vandacia's betrayal and imminent attack.

The deal I made with Daluion seems to have a positive effect on the Golden Anvil. With the seal on the adytum broken, Gavos wishes to see the outdoors again. Daluion and I should escort him out the rear doors.
Castle Leyawiin is already under siege. With the main gates blocked, Captain Rian suggests I meet Eveli at the barracks and try to get inside that way.
I need to enter Leyawiin Castle to try to save the remaining councilors and legates.
Now that I'm inside Leyawiin Castle, I need to find Councilors Lovidicus and Faleria and make sure they're all right.
We witnessed Vandacia strike down Councilor Faleria before he vanished. We need to keep looking and find Councilor Lovidicus before Vandacia gets to him as well.
I should speak with the Duke of Crows and make sure the Blackfeather Court is all right.
I need to enter the ruins at Arpenia to rescue the trapped members of the Blackfeather Court.
There is one final room where the cultists plan to open their gate to the Evergloam. I need to shatter the last mirror to free the remaining members of the Blackfeather Court and the Duke himself.
I disrupted the ritual and freed the remaining members of the Blackfeather Court. The Duke wishes to speak to me outside the ruins.
The notice directed me to talk to <<1>> in the city of Leyawiin for more details.
I should ask <<1>> how I go about signing up for one of these daily jobs.
For Leric's blessing, I need to gather toxicodor petals, bog dog dung, and death hopper bile from the ruins of Vunalk.
I doused Leric with the blessing solution. I should speak to <<1>> about my reward.
I defeated the twin Minotaurs Bhrum and Koska, and retrieved the heirlooms unearthed by the unlucky scholars. I should claim my reward.
I need to defeat Bhrum-Koska the Minotaur. I should also recover any unearthed heirlooms or curios I find in the area.
Jela says we must free her friends in order to disrupt the Sul-Xan rituals. I should find them and rescue them.
Now that Jela's friends are safe, we need to locate the Idol of Xulunaht and destroy it.
I met Eveli at the Mages Guild. I should talk to her and find out if she knows where to find the mage named Renna.
I should look for <<1>> in <<2>> to carry out the prank.
I should look for <<1>> in <<2>> and carry out the prank.
I need to place the stinkpot prank under <<1>>'s seat without him noticing.
I need to set up the prank without <<1>> noticing.
I found my way to the Keywright's Gallery with the help of <<1>>. I should talk to her about what to do next.
I should investigate the performers camped near Farmer's Nook.
I entered Renna's house and found Farrul Lupus lying on the floor. I should check and see if he's as dead as he appears to be.
Lyranth was able to read the ensorcelled scroll, which indicated that another cache annex is hidden here in the Imperial sewers. I should look around for the entrance.
We found the entrance to the annex, but the ward has already been broken. The cultists must be inside. I should go in and investigate.
The note said to deliver it to <<1>> along with a ring he never got to give her. I should retrieve the ring from his pack.
I should talk to <<1>> about the news of her lover's death.
I found <<1>>. I should speak to her about what happened to <<2>>.
I need to find <<1>> in Leyawiin and deliver Aloysius's letter and ring to her.
I found an Imperial's corpse. I should read the note next to his body to find out what happened.
I found Eveli at the barracks entrance. I should speak with her about what's happening.
Sombren asked me to head up the path to the portal site and make sure it's clear while he finishes attuning the twins.
Hokatsei thinks if I bathe Deet-Loh one more time in this pool, it will start him singing. If that makes the frogs happy, then maybe Sister of Pools will finally forgive him.
While Eveli investigates Councilor Jirich's manor, I need to warn two other councilors, Councilor Sophus and Councilor Faleria, about the threat on their lives.
I discovered Duchess Astella's notes. I should discuss their contents with Yisara.
Before I go to meet the Ambitions outside the city, I should return to the governor's mansion and let Eveli know what's going on.
While Sombren finishes recovering, I should examine the book he found as he made his way through Xynaa's cellar.
Elossi seeks to release a group of prisoners from cages up on the wall. She needs my help to activate a release lever. I should pull the lever to help her open the cages.
The assassin's trail leads into the Twyllbek Ruins. I should continue to follow him.
Otumi-Ra is here, and it looks like he could use some assistance. I should see if I can offer my help.
While Eveli trails behind to watch our backs, I should head deeper into Bloodrun Cave and see if I can locate the entrance to the Dark Brotherhood sanctuary.
I arrived at Bloodrun Cave. I should speak with Eveli about what to do next.
Revus and I heard Tiras's voice echoing from deeper within the ruins of Veyond. We should look for him.
Revus Demnevanni and I briefly saw Tiras, who was somehow afflicted by Revus's experiment. I should talk to Revus about what to do next.
We stopped all of the cult's rituals, but that is likely little consolation to Mirri after the death of her brother. I should speak to her.
It's unclear whether the owner of this note traveled to the ruin, but the aforementioned expedition could be an opportunity worth exploring. I should look for it.
Mirri says she and her brother were betrayed by some cultists, led by someone named <<1>>. I should find out more from her before we go inside the ruin.
I successfully poisoned the harrada creeper. Adrahawn told me to meet up with him farther back in the ruin. I should speak to him.
Beragon has deciphered the scroll Eveli and I found. I should see what it has to say.
We succeeded in releasing all the Sul-Xan's prisoners and Adrahawn called out for me to meet. I should speak to him about our next move.
I should look for the body of Khud af-Hadajja's comrade, Morgane. According to Khud, she carries a sending stone that will allow us communicate.
I should enter the doomvault.
I destroyed the Dagon-worshipers' device. I should make my way back to Khud af-Hadajja to inform him of my success.

Mirri Elendis informed me that she was hired to explore this ruin along with her brother and several others, but it was a trap that only she managed to escape. She claims the others are soon to be sacrificed by a cult. I agreed to help stop them.

Adrahawn believes the harrada creeper has grown too vast to be removed, but it can't be left to continue growing out of control, he's given me a variety of herbicides to try to kill it. I need to pour the poisons on vines throughout the cave.
I should try to use the Phantasmal Censer to free Tiras.
We need to head through the ruin's entryway to reach the expedition's base camp.
The entry of the ruin opened into an outdoor courtyard, though there's something odd going on in the sky and the bridge that was here collapsed. I need to use my grapple bow to get across the gap.
Mirri claims that the expedition's base camp should be close. We just need to reach it.
We reached the outskirts of the base camp, but Mirri spotted the cultists at work on some kind of ritual. I should speak to her about how to proceed.
Mirri explained that it looks like Eolaf, one of her betrayed colleagues, is having his soul fed upon by a Daedric ritual. We need to stop the ritual but she fears that could kill him.
Eolaf did not survive the interruption of the ritual, just as Mirri feared. I should speak to her about our next course of action.
We succeeded in freeing Eolaf from the ritual without killing him. I should speak to Mirri about what she wants to do next.
Regardless of whether Ardia was successful in her escape attempt, Mirri thinks we should locate the cult's nearby camp if for no other reason than to destroy it.

With the Hist's help, we found some remaining harrada seeds, but the Dark Elf woman Adrahawn is trying to rescue won't survive without the immediate treatment of potent medicine. I need to convince him to save her or the seeds.
Adrahawn will catch up once he's finished dealing with the seeds and Bevene. I should head outside to join the escapees.
Adrahawn informed the survivors of Bevene's death. I should speak to him now that we've recovered the seeds he was searching for.
Ardia's escape attempt was unsuccessful and she's being used as a sacrifice in another Daedric ritual. I need to put a stop to it before it drains her soul entirely.
There are several focal points around the ritual drawing power from the victim. Destroying them may slow the drain on their soul.
Ardia did not survive the disruption of the ritual. I should speak to Mirri about our next move.
We succeeded in freeing Ardia from the ritual without killing her. I should speak to Mirri about what comes next.
Having his soul drained by the cultist's ritual left Ghalor a soul shriven, essentially an empty husk. Alive, but not. We'll need to find the others quickly or they will wind up like him.
We found Deejos trapped in another of the cult's rituals. I need to stop it before it consumes her soul like Ghalor.
We saved Deejos from the ritual. I should speak to Mirri about what we do next.
Deejos did not survive the disruption of the ritual. I should speak to Mirri about what we do now.
Mirri's little brother, Liam, is the only missing adventurer unaccounted for. We need to keep searching.
I need to stop this last ritual before it consumes Liam's soul.
Xigira has Liam captive and she sealed the gateway leading to him. We need to remove the magical seal if we hope to reach him.
The path to Mirri's brother is open. Now we just need to find him.
Liam survived the disruption of the last ritual and fled with Mirri out of the ruin. I should follow suit.
I stopped the last of the cult's rituals, but Liam didn't survive and Mirri fled the ruin. I should follow suit.
I disrupted all of the cult's rituals and reunited Mirri with her brother Liam. I should speak to her.
I found the strange Daedric machine. Now, I must destroy it.
According to Khud af-Hadajja, the device is very close. I need to find it.
Some force dragged Tiras Tirethi deeper into Veyond. I need to follow him and help Revus Demnevanni undo the curse on his student before it's too late.
Tiras Tirethi has descended into the lower depths of Veyond. I should speak with Revus Demnevanni about what's happening to his student.
I defeated War Chief Zathmoz and retrieved the researcher's lost notes. I should claim my reward.
I need to find the Toad-Tongue encampment and defeat War Chief Zathmoz, leader of the Goblin tribe. I should also recover any research notes I can find in the area.
Revus encouraged me to push the clouded varla stones out of position while he attunes the Phantasmal Censer to their power. If we do it correctly, we might be able to bring Tiras back.
I need to locate the trapped members of the Blackfeather Court and free them.
Revus and I found Tiras ensnared in another cluster of clouded varla stones. I should help Revus destroy them so we can continue our search for the central lode of this accursed glass.
Yisara couldn't bring herself to destroy the ring and asked me to do it.
I stopped the Sul-Xan ritualists and saved several captives. I should return to Leyawiin to claim my reward.
I need to go to the Sul-Xan encampment and defeat the cultists there. I should also save any captives I find.
I survived the excursion to Old Deathwart's lake. I collected several singing frogs and defeated the giant death hopper. I should talk to <<1>> and collect my reward.
Old Deathwart's lake lies in northeast Blackwood. I need to defeat the giant death hopper and collect singing frogs.
I defeated the Trophy-Taker and retrieved tokens from his fallen challengers. I should return to Leyawiin to claim my reward.
I should go to the lair of Xeemhok the Trophy-Taker and put an end to his reign of terror. I also need to collect tokens from the bodies of challengers he defeated.
I defeated Ghemvas the Harbinger and anointed the bodies of its victims with sanctifying oil. I should return for my reward.
I need to defeat Ghemvas and sanctify any dead bodies I find.
We discovered several strange, dangerous vines growing among the native plants. I should speak to Adrahawn about this.
The items seem to indicate that they once belonged to caravanners, but it's unclear how they got here. I should speak to Adrahawn about this.
I freed some members of the Blackfeather Court. I should speak with the Duke about what comes next.
Elam Drals of the Dark Brotherhood was waiting for me at Amnis Manor when I arrived. It appears he sent the courier. I should speak to him.
Adrahawn confirmed his suspicion that the harrada creeper seed he was searching for seems to have sprouted. Its vines are growing out from deeper inside the Silent Halls.
I heard a voice. I should look around to find out who's speaking.
I spied an Elf on the other side of my cell door. I should speak with her.
I should wait for Norianwe to open the cell door.
Norianwe unlocked the door. I should exit my cell.
I successfully escaped my cell. I should follow my liberator, Norianwe.
Norianwe wants to speak with me before we proceed. I should talk to her and find out what she wants.
Norianwe wants to make sure I can defend myself. I should pick up a weapon.
I claimed a weapon. Now, I should equip it.
With my weapon equipped, I'm ready to fight. I should follow <<1>> to the next room.
I should make my way to the surface and meet <<1>> outside.
I should defeat the magical construct that <<1>> summoned.
Norianwe seems confident that the source of this incursion is a mysterious vault called the Keywright's Gallery. We should make our way there.
A locked gate blocks our progress. I should talk to <<1>> about what to do next.
Now that I defeated her magical construct, I should talk to <<1>> about what to do next.
According to Norianwe, we need a fresh skyshard to open the gate. I should collect one from a nearby vault so we can repair the gate mechanism.
I must use the power of the skyshard to repair the gate.
With the gate repaired, we're free to progress further into the ruin. I should enter the gate and see what lies beyond.
As soon as I passed through the gate, I encountered the Daedric monster, Shyazzel. I should defeat this creature.
I killed Shyazzel the Traveler. Now, I should enter The Keywright's Gallery.
The Keywright's Gallery is full of magic doorways! I should talk to <<1>> to find out what she knows about this strange chamber.
Beragon said he had something important to tell me about the investigation. I should speak with him.
I killed Kinras Ironeye. I should meet up with Eveli and find the entrance to hidden library.
I should travel to Leyawiin in Blackwood and speak to Felande about the inn room located within the Kaladas Inn.
Felande has offered me a free inn room at the Kaladas Inn in Leyawiin. I should speak to her to learn more about the offer.
I've agreed to become Felande's newest tenant. I should speak to her to finalize the deal.
I should read the courier's letter and see if it can help us figure out our next move.
I read the letter. Now I should talk to Eveli and let her know what it said.
Dust-On-Scales, the stone-talker for the local tribe, tells me he suspects I can find Flame-Herald Bahsei within the xanmeer. I need to find her there and stop Xalvakka before it crosses over.
I killed Xalvakka, freed the Argonian souls, and closed the portal to the Deadlands. I should talk to Dust-On-Scales about my reward.
I killed Xalvakka, freed the Argonian souls, and closed the portal to the Deadlands. I should talk to Dust-On-Scales about my reward.
I killed Xalvakka, freed the Argonian souls, and closed the portal to the Deadlands. I should talk to Dust-On-Scales about my reward.
Dust-On-Scales, the stone-talker for the local tribe, tells me he suspects I can find Flame-Herald Bahsei within the xanmeer. I need to find her there and stop Xalvakka before it crosses over.
Dust-On-Scales, the stone-talker for the local tribe, tells me he suspects I can find Flame-Herald Bahsei within the xanmeer. I need to find her there and stop Xalvakka before she crosses over.
I removed Xalvakka's head from her corpse. I should give it to Dust-On-Scales as proof she is dead.
I removed Xalvakka's head from her corpse. I should give it to Dust-On-Scales as proof she is dead.
I removed Xalvakka's heart from her corpse. I should give it to Dust-On-Scales as proof she is dead.
Malosza suggested that I speak to Im-Makka, a village guard in Rockgrove. I should make contact with her to find out how to reclaim the village.
A cart outside of Leyawiin can take me to Rockgrove. Once there, I should check in with Im-Makka.
The vampire directed me to a switch that revealed a hidden passage. I should see where it leads.
Alchemy was waiting for me outside Maelle's house. I should bring her up to speed on what I learned.
Alchemy seems to have a theory about Annyce. I should speak to her about what she's thinking.
Alchemy and I found a few things around the fort but nothing obviously pointing to Annyce's whereabouts. They have inspired Alchemy, however, and she seems to be channeling Annyce's motivations.
Alchemy believes she can help me enter Annyce's dream. She asked me to make contact with Annyce and convince her to wake up.
I found Annyce in her dream. I should speak with her and convince her to wake up.
Annyce has agreed to give up her dream, though she wants a few more moments to enjoy it. I should return to the waking world and report to Alchemy.
Annyce has agreed to give up her dream, though she wants a few more moments to enjoy it. I should report to Alchemy.
I entered the Ne Selas annex and discovered that Eveli Sharp-Arrow had gotten here ahead of me. She seems to have found something. I should talk to her.
Alchemy's spell revealed Cres to actually be a small Daedra. I should question the creature about its intentions.
I believe I'm close to finding Quistley Silvelle. Bastian has just caught up with Tenarei and me. I should talk to him.
I activated the floor plates and returned to the first hall, but Lady Laurent says the main doors remain locked. I should talk to her.
I should speak to Yisara in Gideon's inn, to see what sort of assistance she requires.
Now that we stopped one of these rituals Mirri may have greater insight into their workings. I should speak to her about how best to proceed.
Revus needs me to help him prepare for his experiment by re-attuning any instruments that stop working during the kindling process. I should signal him when I'm ready to help.
I repaired the gate. Now, I should talk to <<1>> about what to do next.
Captain Rian marked two locations on my map, places where he wants me to start looking for the missing councilor. I should investigate the sites.
I found Councilor Jirich, gravely wounded, not far from the city's eastern gate. I need to speak with her and find out what happened.
The councilor's aide said she last saw Jirich heading back to Leyawiin by way of the city's eastern gate. I should see if I can find any sign of the councilor between here and the gate.
I entered the Ne Salas annex. It appears to be a much bigger vault than the first one. I should explore it and find what it contains.
Iulius wants me to steal a business ledger to help release the Fang-Furls' grip on Blackwood's trade. I may be able to find one in the home of the gang's bookkeeper, but I will need to be stealthy.
Scipion Averno wants to take a look at the Fang-Furls' ledger I stole. I should speak with him.

I need to draw out the leader of the Fang-Furls, Pungent Adder. After looking at the ledger, Scipion suggested I befoul his prized cask of wine at the Leyawiin docks, and also sabotage numerous dead drops around the Blackwood region.
I should return to the brothers at the Happy Averno Shipping Company office and see what our next move is.
I can't find Iulius or Scipion. There's a note on the table, I should read it to figure out where they went.
Pungent Adder, leader of the Fang-Furls, kidnapped the Avernos and summoned me to a place called the Ruction Ring. I should go there and rescue the brothers.
I reached the Ruction Ring. I should find where Iulius and Scipion are being held.
I found Iulius and Scipion bound in the arena of the Ruction Ring. I should free them.
I freed Iulius and Scipion. They asked me to meet them back at the Happy Averno Shipping Company office in Leyawiin.
I killed Pungent Adder and freed the Avernos from the Ruction Room. I should speak to Iulius to see how he and his brother are doing.
The merchant lords sigil keys unsealed the adytum allegedly housing the Golden Anvil.
I stole the ledger outlining the Fang-Furls' criminal enterprises in Blackwood. I should bring it back to the Averno brothers.
I freed the Averno twins from the Ruction Room. I should speak to Iulius to see how he and his brother are doing.
Faric asked me to escort him to the Dibellaseumâ€”a refurbished mansion and place of worship in the center of town. He believes our investigation should start there.
We entered the Dibellaseum. I should speak to Faric about our next move.

Apparently, Faric carries a rare bauble called a memory stone. He believes that if we take the stone to the right place, it will conjure up a memory for us to observe. We should start our investigation on the ground floor.
When we entered a room on the Dibellaseum's ground floor, the memory stone resonated. I should try to activate it and observe the results.
The memory stone revealed a horrific vision of a shadowy figure murdering someone in the Dibellaseum. I should speak with Faric about what we witnessed.
We know the memory stone contains a visual record of at least one murder. We should search the second floor of the Dibellaseum for more memories.
The memory stone flashed again. I should use it to conjure up another memory.
We witnessed another gruesome murder. Someone definitely killed the novitiates here in the Dibellaseum. There might be more to learn on the top floor. We should take the memory stone upstairs.
The stone sparked to life again. I should activate it and see what memory it reveals.
Repeating the killer's gestures revealed a strange portal  in the wall. I should step through and see where it leads.
The portal led to a small room hidden between the walls of the manse. I found skeletons, a ledger, and a map inside. I should examine these documents.
I discovered a musty ledger revealing that the serial killer murdered people in the Dibellaseum and trapped their souls in black soul gems. I should speak to Faric about what I found.
I should wait while Faric reads the ledger I discovered.
Faric recognized the names in the ledger. I should speak to him and find out what he knows.

The unidentified killer murdered the novitiates and trapped their souls in black soul gems. This same person may have murdered Priestess Rolaine. With luck, the map we discovered will lead us to Rolaine's missing carriage.
We found the mud-caked wreckage of a carriage in a pool of water. I should examine the skeleton and chest inside.
I found a ring on the skeleton and black soul gems in the chest. I should show Faric what I've found.
Shortly after we discovered Priestess Rolaine's remains, a ghost appeared across the pond. I should see what the ghost wants.
The ghost seems to want me to follow it. I should see where it leads.
The ghost led me to a small cave. Inside, I found another skeleton and a remarkably well-preserved scroll. I should examine both.
I found Cerise's final words committed to paper. Priestess Rolaine was the killer, and Cerise died stopping her. I should tell Faric the news.

With the ledger, Cerise's written testimony, the memories saved in the memory stone, the black soul gems, and Rolaine's signet ring, we now have proof that Cerise died a hero. If I bring this evidence to Fire-From-Nowhere we can clear Cerise's name.

Fire-From-Nowhere has promised to make the truth about Priestess Rolaine and Cerise known to all, no matter the controversy it causes. He will also protect Faric Gemain. My work is complete, but I should speak to Faric one last time.
I stopped the ritual that was feeding on Eolaf. I should follow Mirri ahead and ask about our next course of action.
I stopped another ritual. I should follow Mirri and speak to her about our next move.
I stopped another of the cult's rituals. I should follow Mirri and speak to her about our next plan of action.
I need to go to the Temple of Dibella in Gideon so I can find Sombren and Calia and escort them to Governor Keshu's victory celebration.
I made it to the temple. Now to find Sombren and Calia.
One of the Dibella priests said that Sombren and Calia have left the temple. I should ask her if she knows where they went.
The priest of Dibella told me that Sombren and Calia went off to some ruin outside Gideon. I should go look for them there.
The Dibella priest said Sombren and Calia went to a ruin just north of the city. I should be able to find them there.
I found Sombren and Calia. It appears that Sombren is doing something with the Mysterium Xarxes. I should talk to him.
Sombren and Calia decided to go to the Deadlands. Sombren thinks he can safely teach her to control her power there. I should talk to Eveli before we return to Gideon.
It's time to return to Gideon and go to the victory celebration. It's being held in the gardens behind the governor's mansion.
I arrived at the celebration. I should let Governor Keshu know that I'm here.
I should talk to Eveli before Governor Keshu addresses the crowd.
The people of Blackwood have gathered in Gideon to celebrate our victory. Eveli wants a few final words before Governor Keshu addresses the crowd.
I conjured another memory of the person who murdered the novitiates of Dibella. I should observe the shade's movements.
Quistley asked Bastian to meet him at the Rosy Lion Inn in Daggerfall. He supposedly has a letter about Bastian's late mother. I agreed to accompany Bastian to Daggerfall.
We found Quistley in Daggerfall. Bastian doesn't really trust him, and doesn't trust himself to keep his temper around Quistley. I should speak to Quistley and see what this is all about.
Quistley has an old letter for Bastian from a Hallix family servant. But he won't part with it until Bastian retrieves a family heirloom that Quistley gambled away to a bandit from Illessan Tower.
Somewhere within Illessan Tower is Grenetta, the gambler who won the Silvelle ring from Quistley. We need to find her to get the ring back for Quistley.
We found Grenetta â€¦ dead. Fortunately, the Silvelles' heirloom ring was close by. Now to return it to Quistley so that Bastian can get the letter Quistley found about Lady Hallix.
Quistley took the Silvelle ring and left Bastian the letter he found in Lord Silvelle's papers. Bastian asked me to read the letter. He's afraid to.
The letter was written by Inalieth, a servant employed by Lady Hallix. She looked after Bastian when his mother died and was supposed to take him to his sister. I need to talk to Bastian.
The old letter to Bastian came from a Hallix family servant named Inalieth. Bastian wants to go to Redfur Trading Post in Grahtwood, where she went to work after the Silvelles dismissed her.
Inalieth's letter is more than ten years old. Bastian hopes that she still lives in Redfur Trading Post. We should start by asking someone at the inn.
We learned that Inalieth was fired from the Hearty Hoarvor, perhaps unfairly. She told a fellow employee that she was heading out into the Grahtwood. We should find her.
We found Inalieth near Redfur. Bastian is worried that she might want nothing more to do with Hallixes and Silvelles. He wants me to ask her what she remembers.
Inalieth cleared up some of the mystery about how Bastian ended up with the Silvelles. Yet there are questions that remain unanswered. I should talk to him about what comes next.
We found Inalieth, an old Hallix family servant, who cleared up some of the mystery of how Bastian ended up with the Silvelles. I should talk to him about all of this.
We found Illessan Tower just outside Daggerfall. Bastian wants to speak to me before we go in. I should talk to him.
Mirri says that most of the others were led farther into the ruin and we should find another camp nearby.
Mirri spotted a notebook belonging to one of her fellows. I should examine it.
Ardia appears to have dropped this notebook during her own escape attempt from the cult. I should speak to Mirri about this.
There are still three others missing from Mirri's party. We need to continue our search for more of the cult's rituals.
Mirri spotted Ghalor, one of the other missing adventurers, but something is obviously wrong with him and she's shaken by it. She asked that I examine him.
Ghalor is completely glassy-eyed and unresponsive to my presence. I should speak to Mirri about it.
The shade of the killer approached a nearby wall and cast some sort of magic spell. Faric suggested I try to mimic the murderer's gestures to reveal any secrets hidden within the wall.
I need to find Captain Rian Liore and talk to him to get more information. I should tell him that Brigadine Antonius sent me.
A woman mistook me for Councilor Jirich. I should speak to her and see what she knows about the missing councilor.
A woman mistook me for Councilor Jirich. I should speak to her and see what she knows about the missing councilor.
I should talk to Orthus Pontanian.
I found Orthus Pontanian. I should talk to him and tell him what I found in the Deadlands.
I should find Orthus Pontanian and deliver the bad news and the rune-etched stone to him. He'll be in Leyawiin.
I entered the manor and found Eveli Sharp-Arrow. I should tell her about the secret compartment in the nightstand that Councilor Faleria informed me about.
I found Councilor Jirich's records in a compartment in her nightstand. I should see what they actually pertain to.
I should inform Commander Ortin about Councilor Abor and let him know there was no sign of the servant in the watchtower.

Bastian asked me to accompany him to Wayrest. He hopes to find Count Elmonde Auzin, his sister's husband. Bastian thinks it might be wise to see what he knows before surprising a sister he's never met.
We found Count Auzin at an inn in Wayrest. He looks rather distraught about something. I should speak to him.
Count Auzin told us that Bastian's sister was captured by slavers near Koeglin Village. He asked us to rescue her. We should go to Koeglin and find the slavers.
Bastian believes the slavers who captured Countess Clairene may be hiding in this old mine. We should search for her.
Bastian and his sister Clairene are strangers to each other. A meeting such as this is something I need to see.
Bastian learned about his family and reunited with his older sister. I should speak to him about what comes next.
Count Auzin allowed Bastian's sister to believe he was deadâ€”but that isn't important at the moment. Clairene has been captured by slavers. I should talk to Bastian about what we've learned.
We rescued Clairene from the slavers in Koeglin Mine. I should talk to her and tell her that Bastian is her long-lost younger brother.
Bastian and his sister seem to be off to a good start. Bastian wants to speak to me now.

Inalieth told us that Bastian's older sister Clairene is alive! Many years ago Inalieth was supposed to take Bastian to live with her, but Lord Silvelle dismissed Inalieth instead. I should talk to Bastian about all of this.
Eveli is waiting for me in Leyawiin Castle. I should go and meet her there.
Captain Rian informed me that Eveli is waiting near the entrance to Leyawiin Castle. I should go there and talk to her.
Revus lost his Phantasmal Censer in the accident. I should recover it for him.
We found Bastian's older sister Clairene, tied to a post deep in the mine. We need to get her to safety before we can talk.
I found a spectral version of Tiras encircled by more clouded Varla stones. He suggested I use the lantern to reverse his state.
I should go to Gideon. I need to meet Eveli Sharp-Arrow at the governor's mansion.
I arrived at Gideon. I should talk to Eveli at the governor's mansion and find out what our next step is.
I absorbed the power of a skyshard. I should return to the Gallery foyer and use this power to repair the gate.
Governor Keshu wants to speak to me at the governor's mansion in Gideon. I should head there as soon as possible.
I need to travel to Gideon and meet with Governor Keshu.
I should speak with Elam about the conversation we just overheard.
The portal took us to another section of the Ayleid ruin. I should keep exploring.
Instead of weapons, we found the twins Destron and Calia living inside the vault. They invited us to look around and see if we can find what we came for. I should search the area.
Vandacia escaped, but at least Councilor Lovidicus is still alive. I should leave the castle courtyard now.
Councilor Lovidicus may know more about the clue Beragon deciphered. I should speak with him.
Mirri's mother was due to meet with someone at the Mages Guild in Stormhold, which can be found in Shadowfen. We should start there.
Mirtulivon is the contact that Irenni Elendis was due to meet in Stormhold. We should talk to him.
Mirtulivon is only willing to share his information if we retrieve the item that Irenni neglected to for him. I should speak to Mirri about this.

Mirtulivon has some information we need, but won't give it up unless we get an item that Irenni Elendis was supposed to retrieve for him: an antique inkwell now belonging to a banker in Stormhold. We need to acquire it somehow.
We retrieved Mirtulivon's coveted inkwell. I should return it to him and find out what he knows of Irenni Elendis.
Mirtulivon said that he had given Irenni information about a lead on a Dwarven relics. He sent her to meet with Edvilda Stone-Stalker, who is camped near Steamfont in Stonefalls.
Mirri had hoped to find either her mother, or a contact that her mother was to meet at Steamfont. It appears that something may have happened. I should look around.
I found a homemade scarf Mirri recognized and read through Edvilda's log book. I should discuss what we found with Mirri.
Our best lead is a place not too far from here, the Inner Sea Armature, which is rumored to be overrun by bandits. Mirri thinks her mother may have been taken captive when Edvilda was killed.
Now that Irenni is free I should speak with Mirri about what comes next.
I need to find the Morag Tong documents inside Bloodrun Cave and destroy them.
I destroyed the Morag Tong documents. I should report back to Deetum-Jas for my reward.
Mirri suggests we speak with her grandfather's ancestor spirit and see if he knows something that can aid in our search.
Mirri's grandfather has appeared, but he's not happy to see her. I might have better luck as a neutral party.
Mirri's grandfather claimed that he was murdered by a friend who stole his prized possession. I should speak to Mirri about this.
Mirri suggests we pay a visit to the Vulkhel Guard Mages Guild and search for her late grandfather's former friend, Onimiril.
We arrived at the Mages Guild Hall where Onimiril was a member. We should look around for someone who knows him.

We met one of Onimiril's apprentices, Takaano, who said he can help us find his former instructor, but he needs our help first. Takaano accidentally turned one of Onimiril's other apprentices into a chicken and she ran off. We need to bring her back.
We found a dejected looking chicken that matched the description that Takaano gave us. We should bring it to him.
Mirri is attempting to call upon her ancestor's spirit. I should wait to see if she's successful.
While it wasn't the reunion they might have hoped, Mirri is content with the outcome. I should see what she wants to do now that the matter is concluded.
There is a man tied up on the island. I should talk to him and find out what happened.
Zeechis told me that Deepscorn Hollow is said to be a smuggler's den on the coast. I should go there to investigate the rumors. It might be profitable.
Olik suggested I track down Heem-Jas in the northern swamps. I should meet up with Heem-Jas there and see what we can find.
I need to take notes on things I observe as I explore the Daedric ruin.
I gathered the notes, and now I should report back for my reward.
I should speak with Heem-Jas about our success.

Councilor Abor has taken up residence in the watchtower at Fort Blueblood and asked not to be disturbed. I have permission from Commander Ortin to enter the tower so I can convince her to return to Leyawiin.
The Inner Sea Armature is a Dwarven ruin, but a group of outlaws have taken up residence in part of it. Mirri and I hope to find her mother, Irenni, held captive here.
Irenni is free, but we aren't out of danger just yet. I should escort Irenni safely out of the Inner Sea Armature.
Mirri and her mother argued briefly, but seem to have come to an understanding. I should speak to Mirri.
I found the Nightwielder's Tome in Xi-Tsei. I should deliver it to Walks-Under-Shadow.
I should search the ruins of Xi-Tsei for the Nightwielder's Tome.
I need to go to Gideon to find Sombren and Calia so I can escort them to Governor Keshu's victory celebration.
The assassin's trail ends at a bookshelf in the drainworks. I should investigate the area.
I found the location mentioned in the pirate's note. Digging here should uncover the treasure.
The clues in the pirate's note will lead me to where he buried his treasure.
Now that I've returned the Shade Sickle, I should talk to Millona Brolus.
Giovanni Corvus may know where the sickle is. Millona said to look for him in Leyawiin.
I should follow Giovanni Corvus to his meeting with Darene Gavendier. He may become suspicious if I draw too close, so I should keep my distance.
I followed Giovanni Corvus to his secret meeting. Eavesdropping might tell me what happened to the Shade Sickle.
Tumma-Maxath kept the Shade Sickle close to him. I should retrieve it for Nocturnal.
According to Nocturnal, Millona Brolus was in the shrine when the Shade Sickle was stolen. I should talk to her to see what she knows.
The necromancer Tumma-Maxath took Nocturnal's Shade Sickle to Bloodrun Cave. I should search the cavern for the Prince's stolen relic.
I recovered the Shade Sickle from Bloodrun Cave. I should return it to the Shrine of Nocturnal.
I should place the Shade Sickle on the altar of Nocturnal.
With the Shade Sickle safely returned, I should talk to Millona Brolus.
Millona asked me to convince her friends to abandon their criminal lifestyle. Maybe they'll listen to reason. Or threats.
I decided to have Xocin summon Xyria. I should speak to Tee-Wan before the summoning begins.
Tee-Wan awaits me in the graveyard outside Gideon. I should speak with him.

Tee-Wan asked for my help locating a missing ambassador of the Black Fin Legion, Xocin. He was last seen speaking to Melyn Drad in the Egg and Hammer Inn. I should go there and see if I can get any information from Melyn Drad.

Melyn Drad said Xocin went to a vault in the border marshes east of Gideon searching for some kind of ritual stone. I should return to Tee-Wan and Vos-Huruk and let them know where their egg-brother has gone.

Vos-Huruk told me about Xocin's history with a Dremora called Xyria, who he fell in love with when the Black Fin Legion went to war. Now that Tee-Wan is back, I should speak to him about what to do next.
Tee-Wan asked me to go to Doomvault Porcixid in the border marshes east of Gideon to find Xocin.
I found Xocin deep inside Doomvault Porcixid. He looks injured. I should see if he needs my help.
Xocin says the Kynaz stone is spent. I need to find trees with runes in order to charge the Kynaz stone with power.
Xocin communicated to me that the Kynaz stone should be charged now, and that he would meet me back in Gideon's graveyard with Tee-Wan and Vos-Huruk.
Now that I'm here, I should speak with Xocin.
I decided to tell Xocin that he should not summon Xyria. I should speak to Tee-Wan about this decision.
Xocin wants to try summoning Xyria once more, but Tee-Wan and Vos-Huruk are divided on the matter. Xocin wants my advice about what he should do.
Now that Irenni is safe, it might be a good time to speak with her about what she was doing out here.
I chose to destroy the eggs. I should speak to <<1>> and collect my reward.
According to Takaano, Onimiril has some sort of getaway in Auridon, north and west of Skywatch, and that's likely where he retreated after his expulsion from the Mages Guild.
We found Onimiril's little escape in the wilderness. We should search his camp for some clue of where the puzzle box may be.
