Some of Onimiril's writings spoke of taking the puzzle box to Avanchnzel, a Dwarven ruin in the Rift. We should head there and see if we can find it.
We know Onimiril brought the Dwarven puzzle box to this ruin for some sort of experiment. Hopefully it's still here to be found.
We found the puzzle box amidst what remained of Onimiril's experiment and his assistants. We should get to safety and discuss what to do with it.
Mirri's grandfather accepted the return of the puzzle box, but it seems neither he nor his descendants are willing to forgive each other's insults. He might be willing to speak with me again.
Mirri's grandfather considers Irenni's obligation fulfilled, but doesn't believe it even begins to make up for the many wrongs done to him. I should talk to Mirri about this.
I should head inside <<1>> and find the crow eggs the clients are interested in.
Now that I have the eggs, I need to decide what to do with them. I can save the eggs by handing them over to Allereth, or destroy them by giving them to Rugrol.
I chose to save the eggs by handing them over to Allereth. I should talk to Deetum-Jas about my reward.
I need to get inside Xi-Tsei and destroy the Sul-Xan's ritual tools that they use for their sacrifices.
I destroyed the Sul-Xan ritual tools. I should return to <<1>> and receive my reward.
I gathered the torchbugs from Undertow Cavern. I should return to Deetum-Jas for my reward.
I need to find and catch a special kind of torchbug inside Undertow Cavern.
I can talk to <<1>>, the bug enthusiast, and ask her more about these torchbugs.
Mirri has some things she needs to say to her mother. I should let them talk.
I should talk to <<1>> and get his opinion on the matter.
Now that I have all the ingredients, I should return to Leyawiin and mix them into the into the blessing solution.
I mixed the ingredients into the blessing solution. It's time to bless Leric with it.
I should talk with Mirri before we head into the ruin.
I met an Argonian near the side of the road who said her village was attacked by raiders. She pleaded with me to find Nuxul, who is apparently helping with the recovery effort.
Mirri wants to meet her mother, Irenni, at her family plot in Othrenis, so she can deliver the puzzle box and free her mother from her filial duty. We should head there now.
The letter instructed us to go to Amnis Manor on the south side of Gideon. I should head there now.
We ran into Gracian Salvitto, but he turned and fled. I need to catch him before he gets away.
Arbitrator Gavos Douar appears to have survived his time locked away in the adytum. I should speak with him to learn more about what happened here.
Vinnus's note said the stone is important. I shouldn't leave it here.
I spoke with Gavos about the downfall of the abbey and the deterioration of the anvil. I should speak to Daluion about what we learned.
I freed Irenni from her bond. She wants to speak with me.
We found Irenni, but the outlaws have her chained to a post to prevent escape. I need to free her.
Nuxul and I have entered Elossi's hut, but she doesn't seem to be here. I should speak with Nuxul and see if he has any clues as to her whereabouts.
Mirri asked me to light the candles at the shrine while she tries to summon her ancestor's spirit.
I got the key to unlock Sombren's chains, but Eveli is waiting for me in the hall. Something's wrong. I should talk to her.
A woman approached me while I was questioning the locals about the strange disappearances. I should see what she wants.
Annyce's dream is taking place on a ship in the middle of the sea. I should search the boat and talk to her.
Annyce will not speak to me until I've found Prince Vaugr's treasure. It should be in his cabin.
I found Prince Vaugr's treasureâ€”a copy of the book that inspired Annyce's dream. I should show it to her and convince her to wake up.
Alchemy's spell is ready. She instructed me to wake Annyce to dispel her dream and those of the other villagers.
I should report to Commander Ortin before I leave Fort Blueblood and let him know what happened to the missing servant.

Weylin sensed powerful emanation beyond a magically warded door leading deeper into the bastion. Lyranth suggested splitting up and finding the sources of power sustaining the ward. I should check a nearby room.
I found a magical source for the warded door, but it's being guarded by several knights wielding Daedric artifacts. I must defeat them in order to deactivate the ward.

The Ayleid ruins beneath Red Petal Bastion is filled to overflowing with Daedric relics and their unholy emanations. Weylin wishes to attempt to cleanse the corruption, so I need to deal with the corrupted knights first.
We defeated the power-mad leader of the Knights of the Silver Rose and cleansed the last of the lingering corruption in the vault. I should speak to Weylin about this.
We succeeded in deactivating the ward on the door that was barring our path but Weylin still senses the emanation beyond it. We should investigate and see if it leads us to the stolen relics.

Before we can search for the stolen artifacts we need to breach Red Petal Bastion's outer defense. Weylin warned that the knights will meet us with deadly force. I need to clear a path for him and Lyranth.
An odd knight came out to challenge me as I reached the entrance to the keep and Lyranth has joined me in the courtyard. Together we need to defeat the knight blocking our path.

After studying records found in the keep seneschal's home, Weylin learned that the Knights of the Silver Rose have been aggressively claiming Daedric items for quite some time. We need to search the keep for signs of these plundered items.
I should speak to Weylin about the trouble at Red Petal Bastion.
I reached the deepest part of the vault with Lyranth, but the knight-commander of the Silver Rose burst in to stop us. If we want to reclaim Weylin's relics we will have to go through him.
I need to complete Red Petal Bastion.
I defeated foes in Red Petal Bastion.\n\nI should find <<1>> in my alliance's capital city.
<<1>> presented me with another challenge: plant the Undaunted Banner before fighting Prior Thierric Sarazan.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
We encountered another Imperial Battlemage inside the prison who seemed to know Martus, but it wasn't a friendly reunion. We need to kill the rogue mage to proceed.

Martus has a history with the Dread Cellar that he hadn't disclosed and Lucilla hasn't taken the news well. Despite this, the mission remains unchanged. We need to find out what all the energy being gathered here is being used for.
Lucilla plans to leave Martus and the Battlespire behind. I should speak to her about what comes next.

We discovered a giant Daedric machine in the depths of the Dread Cellar, coursing with the terrible energy being gathered in the prison. A frightening Daedra emerged from the machine thanks to this power. Our only hope is to slay it.
Martus tasked me with clearing the path ahead while he tends to Lucilla's wounds. I should forge a path through the Dread Cellar for them to follow.
A large, monstrous Daedra appears to be protecting more of the unusual stones we encountered earlier. I need to kill it if we are to learn more from them.
Martus asked me to continue clearing a way through the Daedra while he and Lucilla study the energized stones the monster was guarding.
I should talk to Martus to brief myself about what is occurring in the Dread Cellar.
I need to complete the Dread Cellar.
I defeated foes in the Dread Cellar.\n\nI should find <<1>> in my alliance's capital city.
<<1>> presented me with another challenge: plant the Undaunted Banner before killing the <<2>>.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
Chanil-Jei wants me to explore Blackwood. I need to participate in a great hunt, visit a forgotten place, and answer the call of petitioners.
I ventured through Blackwood and did everything Chanil-Jei asked of me. I should speak with him.
Otumi-Ra asked me to follow him into his hut where he will test my mettle. I should head there to find out more about what he wants.
Elossi is somewhere in this keep. I should find her and see if she needs any help as well.
I should continue through the keep and see if anyone else needs my help.
I should seek out Chanil-Jei and get more information about this message.
Vandacia tossed Councilor Loviducus from the balcony before teleporting away, but he summoned a champion of Mehrunes Dagon to block our path. I must confront the creature.
I should speak with Eveli before she addresses the gathered crowd.
Now that I have an admission from Tarvyn, I should speak with Noroth to inform him of this development.
I need to gather cursed feathers from plunder skulls.
Now that I have enough cursed feathers, I need to go to Olyve's Brewery to combine them into an effigy that resembles the Crowborne Horror.
Now that I have the effigy, I should show it to Witchmother Taerma.
I need to douse the Crowborne Horror effigy in the brazier in order to imbue it with energy from the Evergloam.
Now that the effigy is imbued with energy, I can use it to open a portal to the pocket realm and lure the Crowborne Horror inside.
I must defeat the Crowborne Horror within the pocket realm Witchmother Taerma and I created.
I defeated the Crowborne Horror. I should speak to Witchmother Taerma.
I returned to Fargrave. I should talk to Lyranth about what we need to do next.
I should speak with Eveli about our victory.
Lyranth wants me to show the Daedric relic we found in the vault to the Anchorite. Perhaps it will trigger a memory and tell us more about the egonymic.
I need to go to the House of Whims in Fargrave to meet with Lyranth and the others.
Tufeh deserves to know what the Waking Flame cult did to her sister in the Brandfire Reformatory.
I should enter the Brandfire Reformatory.
I should search the Brandfire Reformatory to find out what happened to Tufeh's sister, Pibiha.
I should speak to Lyranth about what transpired in Deadlight.
We defeated Valkynaz Nokvroz, rescued the Anchorite, and ended the threat of the cataclysts and the Incarnates. I should speak with Lyranth and see if anything else remains to do.
Lyranth wants me to find Rynkyus in the Plaza of Portals and determine if his scouts have had any luck tracking down Sister Celdina or locating the lost realm of Deadlight.

Rynkyus marked my map with locations in the Sever and the Burn where his scouts spotted Waking Flame activity. I need to investigate these sites and find a portal key, a cipher, and the portal to Deadlight.
I found the portal key, the cipher, and the location of the portal to Deadlight. Now to head there and hope the others can find me.
I met the rest of my companions at the Deadlight portal. Lyranth wants to confer with me about what happens next.

The portal to Deadlight is warded against Daedra. The Anchorite and I must use the portal key and the cipher to venture through the portal without our Daedric allies in order to find and destroy Sister Celdina.
The portal led to a forgotten realm. Some sort of citadel lies ahead of us. Perhaps we'll find Sister Celdina inside.
Talk to the Anchorite
I arrived at Lyranth's camp in the Marbruk Outlaws Refuge. I should talk to her to find out how she wants to use what we found to deal with the Order of the Waking Flame.
I arrived in Dead Man's Drop. I should use the pendant to search for Lyranth's hidden lair.
I arrived in Silumm. I should use the pendant to search for Lyranth's hidden lair.
I should find Rogatina Cinna and find out what Lyranth the Dremora wants with me.
I arrived in Fort Greenwall. I should use the pendant to search for Lyranth's hidden lair.
The pendant revealed a portal, just like Rogatina indicated. I should enter it and see if Lyranth is waiting on the other side.
The portal deposited me in some sort of ruin. I see Lyranth ahead of me, but she appears to be injured. I should check on her.
Lyranth has been wounded by some sort of enchanted blade. I should remove it.
When I removed the enchanted blade, Lyranth seemed to recover. I should talk to her and find out what this is all about.
Lyranth asked me to search her coffer and make sure the cultist didn't take the contents contained in a velvet pouch.
Lyranth arrived and suggested I check the body of the dead cultist. She wants me to see if I can find her missing item.
The cultist carried a letter that indicates they were to take whatever they found here to a location in Greenshade, though the specifics are lacking. I should show the note to Lyranth.
Lyranth opened a portal to Greenshade. I should use it and meet her there.
Now that we arrived in Greenshade, I should ask Lyranth how she wants to proceed.

Lyranth believes that the note I discovered indicates that the Waking Flame cultists have a base near Shadows Crawl. She wants me to use the pendant to find traces of their portal magic and follow it to wherever they are hiding.
Lyranth chased the Waking Flame cultists through a portal. I should follow after them.
The portal deposited us in a cave that the Waking Flame seems to be using as a base of sorts. I should look around and try to find the relic they stole from Lyranth's hidden lair.
We reached the center of the Waking Flame camp in the depths of the cave. Lyranth thinks her relic is hidden here somewhere. I should look for it.
A search of the Waking Flame camp turned up a set of unusual schematics and a note concerning Lyranth's relic. I also recovered the relic. I should talk to Lyranth and discuss what we found.
Lyranth opened a portal to take us away from the Waking Flame camp. I should use it and meet her on the other side.
With the information we learned in Fargrave concerning the cataclyst and the plans of the Waking Flame, I should discuss our next steps with Lyranth.

Rogatina Cinna brought me a message from Lyranth. She wants my help with preparations before we use the portal key and discover exactly what the Waking Flame is up to. I should meet her at the Marbruk Outlaws Refuge in Greenshade.
I need to gather fluster fume root and a tincture of befuddlement so Lyranth can make a potion to disguise me to look like one of the Waking Flame cultists.
I added the components to the cauldron as Lyranth instructed. Now I should talk to her.
Lyranth has Eveli looking through the notes of the Longhouse Emperors. I need to meet her in Fargrave's Plaza of Portals to see if she's learned anything new.
Lyranth has Eveli looking through the notes of the Longhouse Emperors. I need to meet her in Fargrave's Plaza of Portals to see if she's learned anything new.
Lyranth used the portal key. Now that I'm disguised as Devastator Rullen of the Order of the Waking Flame, I should step through the portal and find out what the Dagonists are up to.
The portal deposited us in a cave. I should explore and see if I can figure out where we are.
Lyranth tasked Eveli with combing through the Longhouse Emperors' documents we found to see if she could learn anything new about the Fourth Ambition. I should talk to her and see what she uncovered.
The portal key was supposed to lead us to some sort of Waking Flame base. I need to find the cultists and turn over Lyranth so we can execute our plan.
We encountered a sentry who recognized me as the Waking Flame cultist I'm disguised as. I should talk to her.
The sentry directed me to Sister Celdina. I should find her and present Lyranth to her so we can advance our plan.
Sister Celdina is addressing other members of the cult. It appears she's one of their leaders, at least of this cell of the order. I should talk to her and present Lyranth as my prisoner.
Sister Celdina took Lyranth and headed for the cataclyst chamber. I should head inside and get ready for whatever Lyranth has planned.
I should move forward and approach the Fargrave cataclyst.
Sister Celdina has given me the privilege of activating the Fargrave cataclyst and Lyranth has signaled that she's ready. I should activate the device now.
I need to defeat the Havocrel and then follow Lyranth out of here.
Now that the Havocrel has been defeated, I need to find Lyranth so we can return to Nirn.
Lyranth opened a portal back to the Marbruk Outlaws Refuge. I should enter it.

Since Eveli's search didn't turn up anything new and Lyranth hasn't figured out where to go to find Sombren and Calia, she wants us to meet her at the House of Whims so we can investigate the Anchorite's memories next.

Before Kastav died, he told me that the Ravener finds prey using an orb powered by blood. Occasionally he heard the creature roar from a tower in the north. I should search around to see if I can learn anything more.
I entered a drainage grate and found Khazasha waiting inside the Daedric citadel. We should follow Atrozu closely as he tracks the Ravener.
We escaped Ardent Hope with our lives, but at the cost of Khazasha's totem spirit, Atrozu. I should speak with her for my reward.
I should speak to Selveni about what just happened.
Selveni said he would meet me inside the False Martyrs' Folly.
Everyone is present and Madam Whim is ready to begin the ritual to pull forth the Anchorite's memories. I should follow her instructions and retrieve the memory vessel.
I need to take the memory fragments from the Anchorite as Madam Whim performs the ritual.
Selveni has three magical rocks called the Mother Stones that he needs to fill with power from energy fonts in the Folly. He said that we should start looking for the fonts in the northwest.
The ritual to recover the Anchorite's memories did not go as expected. I should speak to Madam Whim to see if she can give us any information on the memory fragments we were able to collect.
I met the Anchorite at the Brandfire Reformatory. Now to use the Anchorite's amulet to locate the soul of Emperor Moricar.
We followed the wisp produced by the amulet to a hidden door. We need to enter it and see where it leads.
The Anchorite and I went through the hidden door. Now we need to look around and figure out where we are.
The only thing we see inside the open furnace is a chunk of iron slag. I should examine it.
The Anchorite and I heard voices from inside the furnace. We need to figure out a way to open the furnace door.
When I examined the slag, the voice of Emperor Moricar emanated from inside it. The Anchorite wants to talk to me before we attempt anything else.
The Anchorite believes we can free the souls from the metal slag by melting it down. To do that, I need to activate the furnace.
Now that I have the mysterious substance, I should find Noroth at the town hall in the spire.
Noroth wants me to talk to Faven. I should ask him what he spoke to Tephilaz about before he died.
Lyranth suggests we bring Arox the Mutilator with us to find the Bladebearer clan. I should talk to Arox.

Our search of the Deadlands uncovered Nokvroz's plans to create his own cataclyst, located Elegian, and determined the hiding place of Sister Celdina's Riven Cataclyst. We still haven't found the missing Bladebearers, but we have a new destination.
Lyranth told me to gather Arox and prepare myself for the journey to Annihilarch's Summit. I should talk to the daedrat and have him hop into my pack.

We rescued the missing Bladebearers, defeated a new Incarnate, and destroyed the Riven Cataclyst. Sister Celdina escaped, but we dealt the Order of the Waking Flame a serious setback. I should talk to Lyranth about what's next.

Lyranth suggested we seek out Rynkyus of the Bladebearer clan. He might know how a Bladebearer's sword ended up in Burning Gyre Keep. I should meet her at Wretched Spire, in the Sever section of the Deadlands.
I caught up to Lyranth in Wretched Spire and found her speaking with Rynkyus of the Bladebearer clan. She wants me to talk to him.
Rynkyus told me that his clan sent scouts to look for his missing clan members. The scouts did not report back from two locations. Rynkyus wants to investigate.
The Xivilai Zynoahz oversees a gaol somewhere in the Burn. Rynkyus will meet me nearby.

Rynkyus and I found a number of clues in Jynd's foundry and Zynoahz's gaol, but we're no closer to learning the location of the Riven Cataclyst. Fortunately, Lyranth and the Anchorite have something to share.
Faven mentioned someone named Vontan that Tephilaz was concerned with. He lives in the Fleapits, a district of Wretched Spire. I should go speak with him to find out what he knows.
I entered the Fleapits district, a dangerous worn-down shanty town outside of Wretched Spire. I should try to find Vontan to interrogate him.
I arrived at Vontan's home just in time to watch him die. Perhaps something in the area could offer clues. I should search for anything that can tell us about his connection to Tephilaz.
I told Noroth about the Waking Flame infiltrating the town. He says he must inform Faven so he can start a defense. I should go to town hall and speak to Faven.
I found several documents at Vontan's hovel that claim the Order of the Waking Flame have infiltrated Wretched Spire and that a local is assisting them. I should relay this to Noroth.
Someone murdered Faven. While Noroth translates the documents I found, I should search for clues.
I should speak with Noroth to let him know what I found at the crime scene, and to find out if he learned anything from the evidence found at Vontan's.
Noroth was able to decipher the location of the Waking Flame's nearby camp. It's located southwest of town. I should head there at once.
I located the Waking Flame's camp outside Wretched Spire. I should enter it immediately.
I entered the Waking Flame camp. I should search for evidence that will implicate the ones responsible for the murders.
I defeated the frightening Daedra and the machine that gave birth to it has ceased to function. Lucilla wishes to speak with me now that the mission is over.
After we melted the slag, the souls of the Longhouse Emperors appeared before us. I should speak to Emperor Moricar.
This was clearly a gathering room of sorts. I should be able to find the evidence I'm looking for here.
I discovered some of the same toxic substance that killed Tephilaz, as well as a note that appears to be from the culprit. I should continue searching the base to find the murderer.
I overheard Tarvyn admit to the murders. I should find him and make sure he is brought to justice.
Tarvyn admitted he killed Tephilaz, Vontan, and his father. Now that I have him cornered, I should speak with him to find out why he committed all these murders.
The foundry of Kynmarcher Jynd is somewhere in the Sever. I should meet Rynkyus there to investigate Nokvroz's Dremora underling.
Rynkyus waited for me outside of Kynmarcher Jynd's foundry. I should speak with him before we go inside.

We learned that the cataclyst plans are the work of a blind seer. The Anchorite recalled a name: Elegian. Arox claims that Elegian is held prisoner in a place called the Blood Pit. I should talk to Arox.

We found a way inside Deadlight Citadel and came upon an archive of old relics and writings related to the Order of the Waking Flame. I should see if there's anything that might interest Lyranth hidden among the trove.
We uncovered several writings that relate to the creation of the cataclysts and the secrets of the Waking Flame cult. I should discuss the implications of these items with the Anchorite.

The writings we found in the archives revealed that Sister Celdina intends to help Mehrunes Dagon destroy the mortal world, but we haven't found her yet. We need to keep searching the Deadlight Citadel.

We entered a shrine deep inside the citadel. The Anchorite seems to recognize this place, and she feels a connection between the altar in the center of the chamber and the amulet Elegian gave her. I should examine the altar.
The Anchorite thinks there may be a connection between her amulet and this altar. I should talk to her about that.
The Anchorite channeled her magic into the amulet Elegian gave her. She suspects that the items around the shrine will reveal her memories of this place. I should examine these items.
The magic of the amulet showed me key memories related to items from the Anchorite's past. What will the amulet reveal if I examine it directly?

According to the Anchorite's released memories, she's the daughter of Emperor Moricar and Sister Celdina. She was created to help Mehrunes Dagon destroy the world, but Elegian helped her escape. I should talk to her about all this.
Still reeling from the ordeal of having her memories flood back, the Anchoriteâ€”Maireadâ€”ran off to confront her mother, Sister Celdina. I should follow after her.
It sounds like the Anchorite and Sister Celdina are just up ahead. I should keep going and intervene before it's too late.
I must defeat Sister Celdina. Her plans to use the Anchorite to help Mehrunes Dagon destroy Nirn must be stopped, no matter what.
I defeated Sister Celdina, but Valkynaz Nokvroz appeared and captured the Anchorite. It looks like she dropped her amulet. I should retrieve it for safekeeping.
Valkynaz Nokvroz's forces are swarming Deadlight Citadel, but Lyranth just opened a portal nearby. I'd better leave while I can.
Lyranth opened a portal and Sombren, Calia, and Eveli stepped through. Sombren seems angry with the Longhouse Emperors' souls. I should wait and see what happens next.
Eveli wants to talk to me about what just happened. I should speak to her.

I discovered several interesting items: a disintegrating claw from the Ravener, Kastav's journal which mentions the Ravener losing his strength, and blood on the pedestal that held the orb. I should bring this information to Khazasha.

I gave Khazasha the items I found, which strengthened her determination to take revenge. Atrozu once again found the Ravener's trail and began to chase it. I should follow the ghostly bear to find our prey.
Atrozu continues to track the Ravener, but a locked gate blocks our path. I should search the area to find a way around.

Emperor Moricar's spirit said the Longhouse Emperors had a contingency plan in case Mehrunes Dagon failed to live up to his part of their bargain. He said we could find the details at a retreat in the Deadlands called the Isle of Joys.
Rynkyus said he would be waiting for me outside of Kynmarcher Jynd's foundry near an old shrine. We should compare notes.
I found Rynkyus waiting for me outside Zynoahz's gaol. I should speak with him before we venture inside.
I discovered a tunnel burrowed through the courtyard wall. It's just wide enough that we can crawl through. I should use it to bypass the locked gate and continue tracking the Ravener.
I met Eveli at the Isle of Joys. Now to look around and try to find the details of the Longhouse Emperors' contingency plan so we can use it against Mehrunes Dagon.
We made it through the tunnel and into the courtyard of a large tower. I should continue pursuing the Ravener's trail.
I should discuss what we found on the Isle of Joys with Eveli.
Emperor Moricar's journal indicates that the key to the egonymic, his contingency plan against Mehrunes Dagon, can be found in the Anchorite's vault in northern Blackwood. I should meet Eveli there.
Eveli and I need to look around the vault and see if we can find any clues as to the Longhouse Emperors' plan.
Strange runes appeared when Eveli and I got close to the location indicated on the map. The runes are similar to those etched into the ring we found. I should see if there's a connection.
The portal brought Eveli and me to a hidden chamber. We need to look around.
Atrozu sounds worried, and Khazasha appears concerned about our hunt. She paused and asked to speak with me. I should listen to what she has to say.
Lyranth appeared and she's distressed about something. I should speak with her and find out what's wrong.
Lyranth says Sombren has the Anchorite and Calia and is attempting to take their power. I should travel to Annihilarch's Summit with her and try to stop to him.
Sombren is trying to force Calia and the Anchorite to go with him. I need to stop him.
I defeated the echo of Destron that Sombren called forth. Then the Anchorite banished Sombren. It's time to return to Fargrave and determine our next move.
Now that the Mother Stones have been attuned to the energy of the Sever, I should speak to Selveni to find out what our next step is.
Selveni told me that there is an altar in the Folly that we can use to locate the statues where the spirits are trapped. We need to find the altar first.
Khazasha grows more obsessed with destroying the Ravener. She refuses to leave until she has her revenge. I should lead her and Atrozu up the tower until we find the creature.
We reached a dead end but found a room with a strange machine. Khazasha believes activating it will allow us to proceed. I should find the missing components and turn it on.
I returned to the House of Whims in Fargrave. Now I should talk to Lyranth and tell her what happened to the Anchorite.
I found Sombren's diary, He must have left it behind when he and Calia visited this place. I should tell Eveli what it says.
Activating the machine opened a portal. Khazasha's intuition tells her that we must enter it to find the Ravener. I should go through the portal to continue our hunt.
Beyond the portal, we found an ornate room that looks like a ritual chamber. At the center is a lectern displaying a book. I should read the book for any clues.

The book describes the Ravener's vow to hunt down Atrozu and devour him. It cannot stop until the hunt is complete. Khazasha appears distraught from this news. I should talk to her and learn her thoughts.

Madam Whim used the Anchorite's memory fragments to scry the location of the soul of the Longhouse Emperor, Moricar. The Anchorite and I need to travel to the Brandfire Reformatory in the Deadlands to determine the significance of this memory.

Khazasha thinks that destroying the scrying orb should stop the Ravener from finding Atrozu. Perhaps starving it will destroy the creature. I should leave the vow chamber to continue exploring the tower.
I obtained the fluster fume root and tincture of befuddlement. I should return to the Marbruk Outlaws Refuge and give them to Lyranth.
I returned to Lyranth and she ordered me to add the fluster fume root and the tincture of befuddlement in the cauldron.
After leaving the vow chamber, we entered a large courtyard with ponds of lava. Atrozu warned us that the Ravener may be near. I should move quickly to find the scrying orb.
The notice directed me to talk to Hewlet Hexos in the city of Fargrave for more details.
I should ask Hewlet Hexos how I go about signing up for one of these daily jobs.
I can see the Ravener's scrying orb just past a closed metal gate. I should enter so we can deal with the orb and destroy the Ravener for good.
I should return to Luna Beriel and let her know that I destroyed the propaganda the Waking Flame Cult created.
I should return to Luna Beriel and let her know I found the relics for appraisal.
I should return to Luna Beriel and let her know I found the valuables.
I should return to Luna and let her know I found the martyrs' copperleaf she requested.
I should return to Luna Beriel and let her know that I delivered the letters.
I should return to Luna Beriel and bring her the goods I recovered from the Shambles.
Lyranth's potion of disguise is ready. I should drink it while she prepares to use the portal key to open a portal.

Khazasha asked for council on how to deal with the scrying orb. I advised leaving it intact so that Atrozu stays with her, even though it means the Ravener stays alive. I should pour this vial of her blood on it to drain its power so we can escape.
Inside the lair, we found the scrying orb on top an ornate pedestal. I should get closer to examine it.

Khazasha asked me to decide how to deal with the scrying orb. I recommended destroying it despite the cost of losing Atrozu. She regretfully agreed. I should smash the orb once she starts draining it.
We have destroyed the Ravener's scrying orb, dooming it to starvation. Khazasha used what remains of her power to open an escape portal. I should go through it to leave Ardent Hope.
Arox told me that the seer we need to speak with is a prisoner in the Blood Pit. The Anchorite will meet us there.
I should continue to explore the Blood Pit as I search for Elegian, the blind seer.
Selveni asked me to make the choice between freeing Ordinator Nilera or Grandmother Sovisa Andalor for him. I should find their statues and choose one.
Arox suggested that we search the Warden's Overlook. Something there may point us to the location of Elegian's cell.
We found a prisoner list and the warden's instructions at the Warden's Overlook. Elegian is held in a part of the prison called the Durance Vile and guarded by Fivax the Oppressor.
We entered the Durance Vile, but Elegian's cell is blocked by a glowing door. I should talk to the Anchorite and see if she has any ideas on how to open it.
We unlocked the cell where we believe Elegian is being held. Time to meet the mad genius who supposedly designed the Riven Cataclyst.
We found the blind seer Elegian. He doesn't seem well. The Anchorite wants me to talk to him.

We heard Valkynaz Nokvroz mention an elixir. We think they use it to clear Elegian's mind when they interrogate him. There are several bottles strewn about in this cell, but which one is the right elixir?
Pouring the elixir on the braziers created fumes that seem to have cleared Elegian's head. I should talk to him before the effect wears off.
Elegian told us that the Riven Cataclyst is hidden at Annihilarch's Summit. I should return to Wretched Spire and report this news to Lyranth and Rynkyus.

We returned from the Blood Pit with information about the Riven Cataclyst's location: it's hidden at Annihilarch's Summit. We also learned something about the Anchorite's mask. I should talk to Lyranth and let her know what we learned.

I need to figure out how to activate the device that will unseal the door to Elegian's prison cell. The Anchorite suggested I gather lucents, and I can always ask her for more information if I need to.
I found a green tonic that doesn't seem to be poisonous or disgusting. I should pour it into the braziers and see if the fumes clear Elegian's mind.
Lyranth believes we can use the Waking Flame portal key to open a way into Ardent Hope. I need to talk to Madam Whim to see if she will help us re-attune the key to this location.
Madam Whim agreed to attune the Waking Flame portal key. I need to meet her at an old portal dais in the Deadlands, in the Burn and south of Ardent Hope.
Madam Whim needs me to reawaken the old portal dais while she works on re-attuning the key. I need to turn the Daedric stones so they match the nearby runes.
The portal dais has been activated. I should talk to Madam Whim and retrieve the portal key.
The Anchorite asked me to place the relic on the table so she can study it further.
The relic seemed to react to the Anchorite's presence. I should pay attention to what secrets it reveals.

The relic contained a message from Emperor Moricar about the egonymic and the creation of the Ambitions. The egonymic is Mehrunes Dagon's true name and each Ambition holds one of the four pieces. I should see what Lyranth thinks.
Lucilla has decided to take Martus's judgment into her own hands. I should speak to her about what comes next.
With the dais activated and the portal key in hand, we can now use this portal to reach the interior of Ardent Hope, Valkynaz Nokvroz's fortress.

Now that we know what the egonymic is and what it is used for, Lyranth wants us to find Sombren and recover all four parts of it. To do that, we need a guide, so I need to go to the Shambles and recruit Arox the Mutilator.
I freed Arox from the Grasp. Now I need to speak with him about breaking into Destruction's Solace.
Lyranth wants me to meet her at the base of Annihilarch's Summit. I should make my way there now.
Lyranth wants me and Rynkyus to lead the way up to the summit. She'll follow behind us, along with the Anchorite and the rest of the Bladebearers.
Arox dashed into a nearby passage to follow Nokvroz's scent. He thinks it may be a shortcut to the summit. I should follow him.
Arox led us into a cave and ran on ahead. I should follow him before he gets into trouble.
Arox reached the end of the cave and lost Nokvroz's scent. I should talk to him.
Arox said that he smelled mortal blood in this cave. We should look around and figure out what happened here.
I found an unusual key beside a dead cultist, and a strange twisted rod of metal. Arox seems keenly interested in the rod. I should show these items to Rynkyus and see what he thinks.
I should talk to Arox and get him to hop back into my pack so we can continue our journey to the summit.
Arox agreed to help us get into Destruction's Solace. We need to meet up with Lyranth in Wretched Spire.
We teleported inside the walls of Ardent Hope. While Rynkyus and the Bladebearers distract the defenders with a frontal attack, we need to find a way into the inner keep.
Valkynaz Nokvroz holds the Anchorite prisoner somewhere in this fortress. Now that we reached the inner keep, I should search for signs of her.
We found Valkynaz Nokvroz's blood adepts with the Anchorite, her hands bound behind her. I should listen in to see what I can learn of their plans for her.
The blood adepts are taking the Anchorite to the volcano where Valkynaz Nokvroz is waiting. I need to reach her before it's too late.
Rynkyus and his Bladebearers are in trouble. I should talk to Lyranth and see if she has any ideas on how we can help them.
Arox saved the Bladebearers, and the battle is on again. He said that if I can get to the Path of Cinders, he'll help me reach the Anchorite inside the volcano.
I need to follow the path up the volcano and find a way inside.
Nokvroz's mages defend the volcanic path with gates of fire. I can't reach the Dremora, but I can call on Arox to deal with them.
Another fiery gate blocks my path up the volcano. I should summon Arox to strike down the Dremora mages who hold the gate against me.
One more gate stands between me and the top of the volcanic path. More of Nokvroz's mages defend the gate. I should call on Arox to clear my way.
Arox shattered the final barrier. Now to make my way to the heart of the volcano to find Valkynaz Nokvroz and the Anchorite.
Lyranth gathered allies for the upcoming assault on Destruction's Solace. I should speak with her about our next steps.
While Lyranth and Arox get the army into Destruction's Solace, I need to make my own way inside and find Sombren.
Valkynaz Nokvroz used his Perfected Cataclyst on himself! I need to defeat this new type of Incarnate before I can destroy the Perfected Cataclyst.
Mehrunes Dagon appeared! I need to escape Ardent Hope and return to Fargrave. Luckily, Lyranth arrived to open a portal. I should use it.
Lyranth's portal returned us to Fargrave. I should make my way to the House of Whims and rendezvous with my companions.
With the Anchorite's help I defeated Valkynaz Nokvroz, but the last cataclyst device remains. I need to help the Anchorite shut it down for good.
The gates into Destructon's Solace were unlocked and unguarded. Inside, the fortress is shrouded in a dense fog. I must lead the charge across the inner plaza.
Lyranth rescued me from the fog, but the two of us are alone somewhere within Dagon's city. I should speak to her about what happened to the rest of our allies.

Lyranth has left us to pursue her own goals, but I still need to defeat Sombren and keep Mehrunes Dagon from using the power of the Ambitions to conquer Nirn. I should move on and try to find my allies.
I found Eveli up on the battlements. She said the Anchorite ran on ahead, through the door to the west. I should try to catch up with her.
The Anchorite can sense Sombren up ahead. I should follow her in order to reach him.
I should continue the journey to the summit.
An imposing gate made of wind blocks the narrow passage that leads to Annihilarch's Summit. We need to open this wind-gate to proceed to the summit.
The key I found beside the dead cultist opened the wind-gate. Now to continue on to the summit.
We reached the summit and found a portal anchored here instead of a Waking Flame stronghold. Maybe it leads to the Riven Cataclyst. I should talk to Lyranth before going through.
Lyranth is blocked from using the portal at the summit. The Anchorite and I will go through and attempt to find the Riven Cataclyst and the missing Bladebearers.
The portal atop Annihilarch's Summit led us to a fort somewhere on Nirn. Wherever in the world we are, it appears to be a Waking Flame stronghold. We should look around.
We came across some of Rynkyus's missing Bladebearers. We should free them.
The Bladebearer Hadri confirmed that the cult is feeding Dremora to a device elsewhere in the fort. While Rynkyus gets them to safety, I should continue to explore.
We found more Bladebearer captives. I should free them.
Rynkyus suggested I talk to his scout, Dothaz, and find out what he learned during his time in captivity. I should ask Dothaz about the Riven Cataclyst and what he observed in his time here.
Dothaz said that his Kyn were taken into the Fort Grief Citadel when it was time to sacrifice them to the cataclyst. I should enter the citadel and try to find the Riven Cataclyst.
I entered the Fort Grief Citadel. Now to look around and find the Riven Cataclyst.
Nokvroz left, but Sister Celdina unleashed an Incarnate of lightning and thunder upon us. I need to defeat the Storm Incarnate.
The Anchorite found a way to interfere with the Riven Cataclyst and stop it from fully empowering the Incarnate. I need to destroy the runic crux that controls the Riven Cataclyst now.
The destruction of the Riven Cataclyst damaged Fort Grief. The citadel is crumbling around us, but Lyranth just opened a portal. We need to go now!
I need to find Sombren and prevent him from turning his power over to Mehrunes Dagon.
Sombren followed Mehrunes Dagon through a portal to Nirn. I need to follow after them.
I found Lyranth struggling with Sombren. I should try to help her before Sombren escapes through that portal.
With the Anchorite's help, I banished Mehrunes Dagon. Lyranth opened a portal to Wretched Spire. Now that the fight is over, I should meet my allies back there.
I need to find the fine wine Samuel said would entice the minstrels and recruit them for the festival.
I helped Samuel liven up the Jesters Festival with music performed by captive Daedra. I should speak with him now that the performance is over.
I made it to the Bearer's Rest, the inn in Fargrave. Now I should find the Anchorite and see if she knows of anyone in the city who can decipher the encoded note we found.

The Anchorite wants me to talk to Madam Whim at the House of Whims in Fargrave and Initiate Tilgo in the Deadlands to see what they know about Lyranth, the votive runes, or the Order of the Waking Flame.
I should go to the Fargrave Crafting Plaza and find the Anchorite. I need to let her know what I learned from Madam Whim and Initiate Tilgo.
I arrived at the Fargrave Crafting Plaza. Now I should talk to the Anchorite and tell her what I learned from Madam Whim and Initiate Tilgo.
Eveli and I need to head to Fargrave to speak to Madam Whim and Calia and inform them of Mehrunes Dagon's defeat.
I should go to the House of Whims to talk to Calia and Madam Whim.
I should speak with Madam Whim and inform her of the rendezvous in Leyawiin.
Madam Whim informed me that Lyranth might be in Fargrave. I may be able to get some answers from Lyranth if I find her. I should begin the search.
I found Lyranth. I should speak with her and get some answers.
I spoke to Lyranth. Now that she's gone, I should find Eveli and inform her.
I should speak with Eveli and tell her what I learned about Lyranth.
Our allies are gathering in Leyawiin. I should head there to meet up with them and discuss Mehrunes Dagon's defeat.

The Anchorite thinks that the cult leader, Sister Celdina, might be using the old baths in the Shambles as a headquarters. Since Lyranth seems to be hunting her, we might find her there. So it's time to head into the Shambles.

We entered the area known as the Shambles. Now to make our way to the old bathhouse. The Anchorite suggested three paths we could take: the western warrens, through the central plazas, or east through Skein Row.
We located a cave entrance into the bathhouse undercroft. I should explore the area and look for a way to enter the bathhouse proper through the undercroft.
We reached the bathhouse. I should check the door and see if it's unlocked.
We made it into the courtyard. I should search the area and see if I can find a way into the bathhouse from here.

The Anchorite wants me to find a lucent, charge it in a dynamus font, and then place the charged crystal on the discharge labrum beside the door. She says this will release the energy and dispel the ward.
We found another door, but it's protected by a ward of some sort. I should discuss our options with the Anchorite.
We found Lyranth as we were making our way into the old bathhouse. I should talk to her.
Now that the Anchorite and I have met up with Lyranth the Dremora, we can accompany her into the old bathhouse and look for the cult leader, Sister Celdina.

We encountered Sister Celdina in the middle of casting some sort of powerful spell. I need to find a way to disrupt the ritual. Lyranth suggested I destroy the votive runes positioned around the chamber.
I should talk to Lyranth and see what she thinks we should do now.
Sister Celdina escaped, but Lyranth thinks she may have left something behind that will help us locate her. I should search the bathhouse and see what I can find.
I found a note written in a language or code I don't understand. I should show the note to Lyranth. Maybe she can decipher it.
Lyranth suggested we leave the bathhouse and return to Fargrave before the cult returns in force. The Anchorite suggested we meet at Fargrave's inn, the Bearer's Rest. I should head there now.
I should talk to <<1>> about what we need to do next.
I arrived at the House of Whims. I should talk to Madam Whim and see if she knows anyone who can decipher the coded message we found at the bathhouse.
Lyranth asked me to take the coded message we found in the bathhouse to Madam Whim to see if she knows anyone who might be able to decipher it.
I should locate the Anchorite and see what she knows about this Collector before we go to their villa.
I found the Anchorite on the main level of the House of Whims. Now I should talk to her and see what she knows about Gazmod the Collector and their villa.

Madam Whim suggested that Gazmod the Collector might have something in their collection that can help us decipher the Waking Flame's encoded message. I should go to their villa on the west side of the city.
We entered the Collector's villa. Now I should speak to Gazmod the Collector and find out if there's anything in their collection that can help us decipher the Waking Flame code.
While the Anchorite keeps the Collector occupied, Lyranth and I need to explore the villa's galleries, search the collection, and find the item that can help us decipher the encoded note.
The Collector mentioned something in their collection that could decipher Dagonic codes. They called it the Arox. I need to search through the collection and locate it.
We think we found what we sought, but it isn't a relic. Arox is a talking daedrat! Lyranth wants me to honor its request and set it free.
I released Arox from his confinement. Now I should talk to him and see if he can actually help us decipher the encoded note.
We acquired a daedrat named Arox who claims to be able to decipher the encoded note. Now we should locate the Anchorite and get out of here before the Collector sends anything else against us.
We found the Anchorite, who seems to have been taken captive by the Collector. I should figure out how to release her.
We set the Anchorite free and acquired Arox. Now to get out of the Collector's Villa and return to Madam Whim's.
We escaped from the Collector's villa and returned to Madam Whim's. Now I should talk to Arox and find out more about the encoded note he deciphered.

The deciphered note indicates that the Waking Flame's Daedric allies are gathering troops at a fortress in the Deadlands known as Burning Gyre Keep. We should go there and see if we can stop the invasion of Fargrave before it begins.
We entered Burning Gyre Keep. Now to look around and see what the Waking Flame and their Daedric allies are up to in here.
Sister Celdina ordered her Incarnate to destroy us. I need to try to stop it while Lyranth does what she can to weaken it.
We defeated the Incarnate, but Sister Celdina and Valkynaz Nokroz escaped again. Lyranth opened a portal back to Fargrave. I should use it.
I should find Lyranth at the House of Whims and go over what we learned at Burning Gyre Keep.
Now that we're back at the House of Whims, I should talk to Lyranth and review what we learned at Burning Gyre Keep.
I need to enter the Unmaker's den, kill it and the Havocrels, and retrieve any chests of goods I find.
I killed the Unmaker, took out the Havocrels, and grabbed all the treasure in its den. I should go talk to Vaveli Indavel for my reward.
I killed the Unmaker and retrieved all the weapons and armor I could find. I should go talk to Vaveli Indavel in Fargrave for my reward.
I found Ordinator Nilera and Priest Sovisa in the Folly. I should ask Selveni how we should use the remaining Mother Stones.
I can talk to Rayna Falas, the Saraathu Tong's treasurer if I want more information.
I can talk to Ravam Drom if I want to know more about the equipment he wants retrieved.
I need to enter the Unmaker's den, kill it and the Havocrels, and gather any equipment I can scrounge up.
I placed all the stones and killed the Unmaker. I should go talk to Vaveli Indavel for my reward.
I need to enter the Unmaker's den, place the seeing stones, and then kill it.
I can talk to Vares Dredayn if I want to learn more.
I need to go to Taupezu Azzida's lair, kill it, and collect samples from the bodies of its prey.
I killed Taupezu Azzida and brought back the victims that I found. I should talk to Vaveli Indavel for my reward.
I should locate and destroy the batches of propaganda before the cultists send them out.
I can talk to Verdam Sedri if I have any questions about the poison or the Mantikora.
I need to enter the Brandfire Reformatory.
I need to enter the False Martyrs' Folly and find valuable items that have been left there.
I should enter the False Martyrs' Folly to seek out the rare plant there.
I should make my way to the Blood Pit.
I should make my way into the Shambles.
I need to find the Brandfire Reformatory.
I should search the Brandfire Reformatory for relics.
I need to go to Taupezu Azzida's lair, kill it, and destroy the rods there.
I killed Taupezu Azzida and destroyed the liminal rods. I should talk to Vaveli Indavel for my reward.
I should talk to Ulvena Daren if I have any questions.
Elegian told us that he designed the Riven Cataclyst in his madness. He bitterly regrets it, and hopes we can destroy his work. I should listen while he and the Anchorite share a final moment.
I need to go to the Mantikora's lair, kill it, and use the quick cordial on the drugged prisoners.
If I want to know more about scrying for the prisoners or the quick cordial antidote, I should find Senise Valno, the Saraathu Tong scryer.
I killed Taupezu Azzida and used the quick cordial antidote on the prisoners I found. I should talk to Vaveli Indavel about my reward.
All of the minstrels have been gathered for the Jester's Festival, I should return to Samuel.
The minstrels made it to the Jester's Festival. I should talk to Samuel to see if there's anything else he needs.
Samuel decided to let me do the honors and ring the nearby bell to tell the minstrels to start their performance.
I should look around the statues to see if any of them have some reclaimable valuables.
A Grasp of the Stricture guard mentioned a daedrat, and the mortal with him said it talked. They must be discussing Arox! I should talk to the guard and find out what happened.
I should search the Folly for the martyrs' coppyleaf the Gleaners of Aurbis need.
I should search for the Gleaners gleam. Luna Beriel said that would mark where the letters should be dropped.
I need to pick up the goods from the three drop sites.
I agreed to help Khazasha hunt down the Ravener. Atrozu, her clan's totem, can track the creature. She mentioned a drainage grate on the northern wall where I can slip inside and meet her.
I convinced Bakh and Elisa to return to Fargrave and recovered the stolen Redmaiden. I should speak with Zyr for my reward.
I met one of the criminals, Bakh, hiding in the wilds of the Sever. Bakh asked me to find the other two criminals in his group and send them to meet him at the portal to Fargrave.
Sombren was interested in the contents of this rune-locked chest, but he couldn't open it. Eveli thinks the ring may unlock it. I should examine the chest and find out.
Lyranth wounded one of the cultists. She thinks he may have been the one who stole her item from the velvet pouch. I should look around the lair and see if he's still here.
We returned from the Waking Flame base in Fargrave. I should talk to Lyranth and discuss what we learned.
I agreed to help Noroth investigate the murder. He asked me to start by canvassing the area for witnesses. I should talk to any mortals around to find out what they know.
I learned that Tephilaz was coming from a treaty discussion, and no one was around when he died. Noroth will have delivered the body to the necrologist by now. I should meet him there.

I informed Noroth of what I learned from talking to the witnesses. In my absence, he apparently volunteered my help with Miksotet's examination. I should follow the necrologist's instructions so we can learn what killed Tephilaz.
I need to search the Sever for the thieves Grasp-Kyn Zyr asked me to apprehend.
I found Bakh's allies. I should meet them near the portal to Fargrave, in the Sever.
I should speak to Bakh about what happens next.
I told Bakh and Elisa to stay on the run. I need to speak with Grasp-Kyn Zyr and tell her that I did not complete the task.
Through Miksotet's examination ritual, we learned that someone poisoned Tephilaz. I should speak to Noroth to decide what to do next.
Noroth asked me to collect a sample of the mysterious substance that poisons Daedra. I should find the substance growing on the blighted tree to the northwest of town.
Madam Whim's messenger said I need to meet Lyranth at Wretched Spire. The assault on Annihilarch's Summit is about to get underway.
I met up with Noroth. Now I should talk to him and give him the toxic substance.
We found the scrying orb unprotected. However, Khazasha's resolve seems to have waned for some reason. I should talk to her to learn her thoughts.

Using her knowledge of blood magic, Khazasha weakened the scrying orb enough to escape without the Ravener finding us. She then opened a portal with the last bit of her power. I should enter it to escape Ardent Hope.
We escaped Ardent Hope with our lives and temporarily disabled the scrying orb by using Khazasha's blood. I should speak to her for my reward.
Rynkyus marked my map with locations where his scouts spotted Waking Flame activity. I should collect Arox and head out.
According to the note next to the body, Mikget gathered a planestone for Nass in Fargrave. I should pick up the planestone so I can deliver it.
Mikget's note mentions getting 'shiny money' from Nass. I should ask about the payment.
I found Nass in Fargrave. I should deliver the planestone and tell her Mikget is dead.
I got the planestone. I should take it to Fargrave and let Nass know what happened to Mikget.
I should read the note next to the body.
According to the dairy I found, Telofasa gathered a planestone for Nass in Fargrave. I should find it and deliver it to Nass at the House of Whims.
Telofasa's diary said that Nass would pay her for the planestone. I should talk to Nass about being compensated for my trouble.
I found Nass in Fargrave. I should deliver the gem and tell her Telofasa is dead.
I have the planestone. I should take it to Fargrave and let Nass know what happened to Telofasa.
I should read the note next to the body.
I should venture out into Vvardenfell, Summerset, Clockwork City and Artaeum to face adversaries, explore striking locales, and overcome incursions to gather experiences for Calonir's brochure.
I should find adventure in Vvardenfell, Summerset, Clockwork City and Artaeum.
I should visit a great city and take in the sights.
I finished an array of activities in Vvardenfell, Clockwork City, and Summerset. I should talk to <<1>> at an Impresario camp and describe my adventures.
According to the note I found nearby, this Robhir was bringing a planestone to Madam Whim's assistant. I should pick up the planestone and finish the delivery.
Robhir's letter mentioned that Nass would pay him for the delivery. I should ask Nass if she will pay me too.
I found Nass in Fargrave. I should give her the planestone and let her know that Robhir is dead.
I have the planestone. I should take it to Fargrave and let Nass know what happened to Robhir.
There's a dirty note lying next to the body. I should read it to see what the Redguard was doing out here.
I found an ornate box where Uxark's treasure is supposedly located. I should take it and return to Nass.
I found Uxark's lost treasure. I should return to Nass in Fargrave and give it to her.
Now that I'm in the right spot, I should place the planestones.
Arox suddenly picked up the scent of Valkynaz Nokvroz. I should give him a moment to investigate.
When I presented the ring to the runes, a hidden portal was revealed. I should see where this portal leads.
I should speak with Fynaâ€”the merchant who comissioned the Gleaners for this jobâ€”and see what she has to say.
I should speak Airlur, the Gleaner who discovered the items in the Brandfire Reformatory if I have questions about the job.
I should speak with the healer, Tuleenith, and see what she has to say.
I should speak with Luna Beriel's contact, Dahliah, and see what she has to say.
I should speak with the client, Glayamen, and see what he has to say.
I should speak with the Gleaner's founder, Pieron Desant, and see what he has to say.
Now that the ward has been dealt with, we should see what's beyond the door as we make our way to the bathhouse.
Sister Celdina and Valkynaz Nokvroz appear to be arguing in the chamber below. I need to find a way to reach them.
Skoedal told me where to place the gems to open a portal to the hidden treasure. I should head there now.
The planestones created a portal. I should use it to travel to the lair where the treasure's hidden.
I should return to Nass.
Tarvyn escaped his captors and left the Waking Flame camp. I should catch up to him before he escapes.
I should talk to Divayth Fyr. With the mystery of the Ebony Blade solved, we can complete our business.
I gathered some clues and a key in the auction house. I should make my way to the market near the Shambles' north entrance and tell <<1>> what I discovered.
I should make my way to the auction house Divayth mentioned to search for clues.
I should search the auction house for any information about the Ebony Blade.
I should ride one of Vvardenfell's colossal silt striders.
I should search the Shambles for the warehouse containing the Hexos Gallery Vault.
The door to the vault is locked behind a magical ward that prevents entry. I should use the key I found to dispel the barrier.
I dispelled the arcane ward. I should make my way into the Hexos Gallery Vault.
As we entered the Blood Pit, we spotted Valkynaz Nokvroz speaking with one of the Blood Pit's overseers. We should listen to what they're saying.
Kaleen and I found Jakarn bound up in the ruins, but he's under guard. I need to fight off the Ascendant Order while Kaleen works to free him.
Kaleen and I rescued Jakarn, but we still need to find the items that the Ascendant Order stole. Jakarn suggested Sarydil and Varallion might have them in their possession. We need to find them.
We recovered the stolen letter from Sarydil, but the medallion that was with it isn't in her possession. We need to find Varallion.
Varallion is dead and we recovered everything he took. I should speak to Captain Kaleen now that the job is done.
I found Sarydil waiting to ambush the invading yaghra. Unfortunately, I'm now in her trap. I need to defeat her.

Captain Kaleen needs me to help her reach the ruins that the order is using as a hideout. She said that the only unsecured entrance is just ahead, but that's because the area is crawling with yaghra. I need to clear a path through.
The back entrance is under attack by a huge yaghra monstrosity. I need to kill it to get by.
Kaleen suspects that Jakarn may be held deeper in the ruins. I need to push through the fighting yaghra and Ascendant Order to reach it.
I should speak to Captain Kaleen.
We found Varallion with his gryphons at the rear of the cove. He's not going to give up the medallion without a fight. I need to defeat him.
I need to complete <<1>>.
I defeated foes in <<1>>.\n\nI should find <<2>> in my alliance's capital city.
<<1>> presented me with another challenge: plant the Undaunted Banner before fighting <<2>>.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.

We found Za'ji's first mate, Caska, safe and sound, if a bit irritated with her captain. We'll need to fight through the wild beings growing throughout the logging camp to reach the shipyards that Za'ji hopes contain his treasured plans.
We were ambushed by a massive spriggan inhabiting the old mill and Za'ji was dragged inside. I need to destroy the creature while Caska holds off its spawn.

The Sea Elves appear to have ransacked the master shipbuilder's office and taken everything of value. Za'ji believes that includes the plans he's after. We need to recover them from the Maormer before they escape.
I defeated the Sea Elves' leader and he seems to have had the plans Za'ji sought. I should speak to him about it.
We cleared a path to the derelict shipyard. Now to continue the search for the plans Za'ji is after.
The shipwrights' ruined village lies ahead. Za'ji wishes to give it another look for signs of his treasure.
We encountered a hostile wraith blocking the path out of the shipwrights' village. I need to destroy it to get by.
Za'ji said he was separated from his first mate at the old mill deeper in the woods. We should try to find out what happened to her.
I should speak to Captain Za'ji.
The Sea Elves are escaping with their plunder, but one of their leaders is staying to hold us off. I need to defeat him.
I need to complete Shipwright's Regret.
I defeated my foes in Shipwright's Regret.\n\nI should find <<1>> in my alliance's capital city.
<<1>> presented me with another challenge: plant the Undaunted Banner before fighting <<2>>.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
<<1>> is waiting to speak to me once again in my alliance capital.
The note said that Telofasa left a planestone in the False Martyrs' Folly. I should travel there.
I found the Ebony Blade in the gallery vault. I should claim it so Divayth can inspect it.
I should show the blade to Divayth Fyr so he can inspect it.
According to Divayth Fyr, there's a Spiderkith named Skrix that might be able to help us discover where this counterfeit blade came from. We can find him in the Wishbone, the Shambles' tavern.
I should talk to <<1>>. Hopefully, he can help us find out where the counterfeit blade came from.
I should place the sword on the table so <<1>> can cast his signal line spell on it.
I followed the spectral spider to the source of the counterfeit bladeâ€”an eerie lair in Skein Row. I should enter the building and investigate.
Skrix cast his spell and a spectral spider leapt from the table. I should talk to <<1>> before I follow it.
I discovered another Ebony Blade resting on some kind of artificer's table. I should investigate.
Skrix betrayed us! I should use the sundial Divayth Fyr gave me before I set out.
Now that Divayth Fyr is free, I should exit Skrix's lair.
Skrix's spectral spider appears to be leading us to the source of the counterfeit blade. I should follow it.
I should head out into the Shambles.
I need charged lucents to place on the discharge labrums. This should reveal the means to unseal Elegian's prison door.
Before I can create the portal, I need to know the location of the secret lair. Nass directed me to Wretched Spire where Skoedal, one of Uxark's companions, is. He should know where the treasure is.
I should talk to Skoedal.
Skoedal doesn't give away information for free. I either need to figure out how to get him to tell me what I want to know or do him a favor.
Madam Whim's assistant Hezehk told me that Lyranth wants to see me. I can find her in the room above the House of Whims.
Lyranth's portal returned us to Wretched Spire. I should talk to Lyranth and let her know what happened at Fort Grief.

While Lyranth was angry that I had to destroy the Riven Cataclyst, she seemed to think Deadlight was important. I need to go to Fargrave and meet her at Madam Whim's so we can figure out how to get to Deadlight.

Atrozu led us to a large pit where we saw the Ravener performing a strange ritual with a dying prisoner. Our target disappeared before we reached it. I should speak to the prisoner to see what he knows.

As we approached the tower, we heard the Ravener's shouts come from within. Inside, we found stacks of books scattered everywhere. I should lead Khazasha and Atrozu up the tower in search of our prey.
With a little help, Valsirenn was able to adapt to the overwhelming change that swept her out of phase. I should speak to her now that she's realigned with reality.
Valsirenn said one of Master Rrvenk's disciples, Morah, should be somewhere near Windswept Crag. She may have information that will lead us to him.
Morah isn't inclined to help us, but she seemed interested in an apocalypse seed from an End Times ash tree. I should find one.
Valsirenn and I found an End Times ash tree. I should speak to her about acquiring an apocalypse seed.
Valsirenn believes we can coax the End Times ash tree into renewing its life cycle with the right application of elements. She has conjured some for me to apply to the tree.
We acquired the apocalypse seed Morah mentioned. Hopefully she'll help us in exchange for it.
I should offer Morah the apocalypse seed and see if she'll tell us where to find Master Rrvenk.
Morah doesn't know where Master Rrvenk is, but she suggested that someone named Shiro-dar might be able to tell us. She said he should be somewhere near Wretched Spire.
Valsirenn found Shiro-dar, but her ghostly appearance terrifies him. I should speak to him.
Shiro-dar is on the run from someone named Gilfrex over an unpaid debt. He suggested he'd tell us where to find Master Rrvenk if we solved his debt woes. I should speak to Gilfrex about it.
I have the Slave Choker that Gilfrex wanted. I should bring it to him.
I convinced Gilfrex to forgive Shiro-dar's debt. I should speak to the Khajiit about Master Rrvenk.

Shiro-dar admitted that he doesn't know exactly where Master Rrvenk is, but he mentioned that the sage was supposed to meet a doubter named Hyxo and we might catch up to him there. We should find Hyxo.

We didn't find Master Rrvenk with Hyxo. The huge Daedra won't tell us where the sage went until we prove the sage's wisdom. Hyxo says Rrvenk told him about stones that changed their form at a Dremora outpost nearby. I need to bring them to him.
I have the changed stones that Rrvenk spoke of. I should show them to Hyxo to prove the sage's words true.
Hyxo claimed that Master Rrvenk awaits us nearby. We should find the sage while we can.
We found a Banekin where Master Rrvenk is supposed to be. Valsirenn seems to be communicating with him.
Now that we have found Master Rrvenk, I should see what Valsirenn makes of this.
Lyranth spotted a sword bearing the mark of the Bladebearer's clan among a pile of discarded junk. I should examine the sword.

We found a discarded weapon belonging to the Dremora clan known as the Bladebearers, but the significance of this item remains unclear. We should continue to explore the keep and try to determine what's going on here.
Something is growing in the dirt where the tree once stood. I should see if it is the apocalypse seed.
Explore the Shambles
Arox attacked the mortal servant of a powerful Daedra, invoking the wrath of the Grasp. I must pay his fine or grovel for his forgiveness if I want him released.

Lyranth the Dremora wants me to meet her in Fargrave, a city in Oblivion, so I can help her determine the scope of the threat posed by the Mehrunes Dagon cult, the Order of the Waking Flame. She should be waiting outside the city's southern gate.
Lyranth isn't here, but I saw a person take down a Waking Flame cultist. Then both her hands and mine began to glow. I should talk to her and find out what's going on here.
After I used the Sundial, I appeared back outside Skrix's lair. I should reenter the building and try to puzzle out a solution to the Spiderkith's trap.
I should investigate the artificer's table again.
I convinced the thieves to return to Fargrave. I should speak with Grasp-Kyn Zyr for my reward.
I let the thieves go. I need to speak with Grasp-Kyn Zyr and tell her that I did not complete the task.
I should free Divayth.
I met Lyranth and the Anchorite at Burning Gyre Keep. Some sort of energy was unleashed inside the fortress and Lyranth thinks we should investigate. Time to enter the keep.
I need to talk to Arox and collect him before we use the portal to enter Ardent Hope.
Madam Whim's messenger said that Lyranth is waiting for me in Fargrave, at the House of Whims. I should go there and talk to her.
Madam Whim's servant Hezehk said Lyranth is waiting for me at the House of Whims in Fargrave. I should go and talk to her.
I met the Anchorite outside the Blood Pit, a terrible prison for Mehrunes Dagon's enemies. Elegian, creator of the Riven Cataclyst, is held somewhere inside.
The main door to the bathhouse is locked with some sort of magic, but the Anchorite believes there may be another way in. I should search the area and see if I can find a way into the courtyard.
I stopped Sister Celdina's ritual before it could be unleashed on Fargrave, but she got away. I should follow Lyranth into the bathhouse.
I arrived at the lab of the necrologist, Miksotet. He has not yet started investigating the corpse. I should speak with Noroth to find out what to do next.
I need to take back those siege weapons so we can distract Mehrunes Dagon.
Sombren is dead. I must now complete the egonymic the Anchorite has called forth and banish Mehrunes Dagon.
Sombren holds three pieces of the egonymic. I must defeat him so the Anchorite can claim his power.
I should speak to Selveni about what just happened.
With the third stone broken, there's no way to free both spirits and get Selveni back to Mournhold. It's a sacrifice he is willing to make. We should find and free the spirits.
I should speak to Selveni about what just happened.
I should make my way to where Ordinator Nilera and Priest Sovisa's statues are located.
I arrived in Leyawiin. Now I should locate my allies.
A concerned citizen witnessed a Dremora get murdered. If I wish to assist, I should speak with Noroth near the murder scene.
I found my allies. I should speak to the Anchorite first.
I learned that Gilfrex hired Shiro-dar to retrieve a relic called the Slave Choker from False Martyrs' Folly. If I can't persuade him to forgive the debt, I'll have to retrieve it myself.
I should talk to Selveni about what just happened and why one of the Mother Stones exploded.
I need to take the remaining Mother Stones and help Selveni find Ordinator Nilera and Priest Sovisa.
Selveni asked me to meet him outside the Folly. I should find him outside and see what he wants.
Selveni asked me to meet him outside the Folly. I should find him outside and see what he wants.
Selveni asked me to meet him outside the Folly. I should find him outside and see what he wants.
I have the changed stones that Rrvenk told Hyxo about. I should return to Valsireen and Hyxo.
Hezehk told me Eveli wants me to meet her in Wretched Spire. I should go there to speak with her.
I returned to the House of Whims in Fargrave. I should speak with Lyranth.
I should go to the Bearer's Rest, the inn in Fargrave, and meet with Lyranth the Dremora.
I should speak with <<1>>.
Rogatina Cinna provided a mount to take me to Lyra. I should ride the mount and see where it takes me.
Rogatina Cinna provided a mount to take me to Lyra. I should ride the mount and see where it takes me.
Rogatina Cinna provided a mount to take me to Lyra. I should ride the mount and see where it takes me.
The Offering to Zenithar has been burned. Amminus will know how Zenithar received it, I should talk to him.

Amminus Varo has a plan to craft a basket and fill it with deliciously baked apples, but he can't cook. He asked me to handle that aspect of the gift. I should go to the nearest cooking fire and make the baked apples for Zenithar's offering.
Fasaria said that the first step is to get Zenithar's attention through prayer. Either I can kneel at the altar myself or I can ask Fasaria to help.
I successfully completed an act worthy of Zenithar's blessing. I should return to Fasaria for my reward.
Amminus has asked me to gather some wood for him to weave into a basket for the offering to Zenithar.
I gathered the wood that Amminus Varo requested. I should deliver it to his hands.

I proved myself worthy and Amminus told me about the last item he needs to assemble the offering: the blessed awl. He said that a group called the Greycloaks and their monstrous leader have the awl. I should bring it back to Amminus.
I found the blessed awl on the body of the Greycloak's leader. I should return it to Amminus Varo so he can finish assembling the offering for Zenithar.

Arox the Mutilator demands that I break the twisted rod and restore his original form. He'd rather have his vengeance now and lose the chance to permanently break the curse than forfeit the ability to strike back at Valkynaz Nokvroz.

If the Waking Flame cult is expanding their ranks with kidnapped victims, then they must be getting closer to putting their plans into motion. I should find the Brandfire Reformatory and find out how they're turning innocents into Dagonists.
I met a Khajiit, Tufeh, near the Brandfire Reformatory. She wants to speak to me about something.
Selveni's journal page said that he was headed to the False Martyrs' Folly. I should head there and see what I can learn from him.
If I want to help Khazasha, I should look for her near Ardent Hope.
Amminus finished creating the offering to Zenithar. He's moving it to the shrine, I should follow him.
Amminus has asked me to burn the unique offering to Zenithar. I should light it on fire, as he asked.
I have all the medallions in my possession. I should talk with Lady Arabelle and give her the medallions.
I should see if I can find Lady Arabelle's agent, Jakarn, in my capital city.
I should go over what we learned about the Ascendant Order and the missing delegates with Lady Arabelle.
I returned to Mandrake Manor. Now I should speak to Lady Arabelle about what we discovered.
We now have collaborating evidence that the missing royals may have washed ashore on Amenos. I should talk to Lady Arabelle about our next move.
We entered the hideout. Jakarn and I need to look for Valessea.
I should enter Pulk to search for Jakarn's friend Valessea.
I should enter Zainsipilu to search for Jakarn's friend Valessea.
I should enter Khartag Point to search for Jakarn's friend Valessea.
Jakarn and I need to search for signs of the Ascendant Order and the lantern Tarazka left near the cave they disappeared into.
Jakarn and I need to search for signs of the Ascendant Order and the lantern Tarazka left near the cave they disappeared into.
Jakarn and I need to search for signs of the Ascendant Order and the lantern Tarazka left near the cave they disappeared into.
Jakarn and I arrived at the place Jakarn's contact specified. I should speak with Tarazka and see if he knows anything about Valessea.
Tarazka says he witnessed a group called the Ascendant Order traveling with an unwilling prisoner. I should speak with Jakarn and see what he thinks about this.
We found Tarazka's lantern and the entrance to the Ascendant Order hideout. We need to go inside and explore further.
One of Jakarn's contacts, Tarazka, sent word that he wishes to speak with him, and may have information about Valessea. We should make our way to meet him.
One of Jakarn's contacts, Tarazka, sent word that he wishes to speak with him, and may have information about Valessea. We should make our way to meet him.
One of Jakarn's contacts, Tarazka, sent word that he wishes to speak with him, and may have information about Valessea. We should make our way to meet him.
We found Valessea. I should speak with her and find out what happened.
Valessea mentioned that she was brought here with the medallions, but she doesn't know what became of them after she was imprisoned. I should look for clues deeper in the Ascendant Order's hideout.
I didn't find the medallions, but I did find a note written by the Ascendant Order. I should discuss my findings with Valessea.
I need to make my way to Sareloth Grotto. Jakarn said he will meet up with me after he escorts Valessea to Lady Arabelle's camp.
I reached the grotto and Jakarn's waiting outside. I should speak with him.
I should enter Sareloth Grotto with Jakarn and search for the stolen medallions.
Jakarn and I need to search for the stolen medallions inside Sareloth Grotto.
Jakarn and I need to use Valessea's shell to locate the stolen medallions inside Sareloth Grotto.
I located the remaining medallions. I should speak with Jakarn now.
Jakarn asked me to meet him at Lady Arabelle's camp. I should make my way there.
I should search the cave for the vulk'esh scoria and for Tarrinore.
Now that I'm out of the Firepot, I should talk to Vinilsare.
I completed the task. Now I should talk to Sir Nathain Galien about my reward.
Moric asked me to enter Breakwater Cave to retrieve Privette. He hopes to reach a peaceful solution, but I'm not so sure. I should enter Breakwater Cave to begin my search.
We entered Breakwater Cave. I should explore the cave to find signs of Privette.
Moric and I found skeletal remains throughout the cave. And we found Privette's sash. But no signs of the sheep yet. I should discuss our next steps with Moric.
Moric seems convinced that none of the bones we found belong to Privette. He holds onto hope that she's still alive. We should continue through the cave tunnels to find Moric's sheep.
We found Privette alive, but in a pen near a large Hadolid nest. I should free her so we can escape.
