I collected the remaining three lesser welkynd stones. I should return to the great welkynd stone and place each one in its proper socket.
Reawakening the great welkynd stone of Niryastare revealed the entrance to a vault. Perhaps we'll find the Skein of Secrets within.
A collapsed staircase blocks our exploration of the vault, but this looks like a problem I can solve with the blade Abolisher.
I reached the relic known as the Skein of Secrets in Niryastare's vaults. I should take it.
The wispy manifestation of a memory-echo appeared nearby. I should see what the Echonir reveals here.
We observed the memory of an ancient confrontation between Ithelia and Hermaeus Mora. I should talk to Beragon about what we learned.
We recovered the Skein of Secrets from Niryastare. We should return to Beragon's house in Skingrad.
Legionary Caepio told me that Beragon, Tribune Alea, and Leramil are waiting for me at Beragon's townhouse in Skingrad. I should go see what they need.
Beragon believes that we need to find Ithelia, who may have returned to her long-lost Oblivion plane, Mirrormoor. Perhaps the Skein of Secrets can help us find a way there.
I used Abolisher to open a portal. I should step through and see where the portal leads.
The portal led us to a strange desert ruin in a place Leramil called Fargrave. Beragon and Tribune Alea haven't yet emerged from the portal. I should talk to Leramil before we proceed.
Masses of crystal encrust the ruins here. Leramil thinks they may be a a sign Ithelia passed through this area. I should follow the crystals and see where they lead.
We found a door leading to the Inner Quarter of Fargrave. We should continue inside.
The crystal path continues through this section of Fargrave. I should keep following it as I look for Shardmarshal Vargas and Ithelia.

Shardmarshal Vargas banished Beragon and Tribune Alea to the Many Paths, so Leramil and I continued on our own. We found a lingering memory in the ruins. I should use the Echonir and see what it reveals.
The Echonir memory revealed a long-ago conversation between Torvesard and Shardmarshal Vargas. I should consult with Leramil the Wise about what we heard.
Leramil believes Ithelia came here for the Loom of the Untraveled Road that Shardmarshal Vargas was fixated with in that ancient memory. We need to find a way to reactivate this dormant portal.
I used the mirrors to activate the dormant portal. Shardmarshal Vargas said the Loom of the Untraveled Road lies beyond it. I should enter the portal.
I entered the Loom of the Untraveled Road. It's not an apparatus, but a place. I should explore this area.
We appear to have reached a dead end. I should use the Skein of Secrets to locate Ithelia and find us a path.
We encountered another Echonir memory inside the Loom of the Untraveled Road. I should see what it shows.
Something went wrong when I tried to use the Skein of Secrets. I should let Leramil examine the Skein and talk to her about what happened.
Shardmarshal Vargas redirected Leramil's portal, depositing us in Ithelia's ancient prison. However, there's a memory here. I should use the Echonir to reveal it.
We appear to be trapped in Ithelia's ancient prison. Leramil the Wise wants us to look around for a way to escape.
I found Beragon trapped within the broken mirrors of Ithelia's prison! Leramil thinks the Lamp of Clarity can pull him out of the Many Paths and back to our reality.
I used Abolisher to create a portal out of Ithelia's prison. We should continue through the portal.
We escaped from the prison Shardmarshal Vargas trapped us in. Ithelia and her scions are here. We need to reach the Loom's core.

To reach the Loom, it appears I first need to go through Shardmarshal Vargas. I need to defeat her if I'm going to have a chance of destroying the Loom and stopping Ithelia from changing history and destroying this reality.
Shardmarshal Vargas has fallen. Now I need to use Abolisher and destroy the Loom of the Untraveled Road.
I defeated Shardmarshal Vargas and destroyed the Loom of the Untraveled Road. Now that West Weald and reality itself are safe, I should leave this place.
According to <<1>> I will find Narsis Dren skulking around the local ruins. I should look for him there.
<<1>> seeks to recover his lost notes, as well as information from the Recollection on what they've found so far. We should search the area for these items.
I found a Recollection map and some documents. This may be valuable intelligence. I should gather whatever I can.
I think there's a memory nearby. I should use the Echonir to reveal it and see what it contains.
Search the Offices
The strange shawl we found activated an Echonir memory.
I should head into the underground ruins and confer with <<1>> about what we found.
I should talk to <<1>> about what we hope to find in Wendir.

According to Narsis Dren, there is an altar inside the ruin that will grant us access to the Emblem of the Last King. To operate it, I need to collect three items from the Recollection: a Vial of Blood, Aromatic Wine, and Sacred Water.
Scruut opened a portal to the instability she wants us to investigate. I should enter the portal and see where it leads.
When I approached the reality tear, something happened. Scruut wants to talk to me about it.
We found the altar that <<1>> had mentioned earlier. I should go to it with items we've gathered.

We found the altar that <<1>>  mentioned earlier. Now I need to figure out which of these items is the correct one for activating the altar. I could talk to <<1>> for more information about the items.
Now that the altar has been activated, we can find out what it is protecting ahead. I should catch up with <<1>>.
I should check in with <<1>>. He seems excited about some kind of epitaph he's found.
We found a tile puzzle in the center of Wendir. <<1>> thinks the solution is related to the nearby epitaph. I should take a look at the epitaph.
Solving the tile puzzle disabled the magic surrounding the Emblem of the Last King. <<1>> wants to take it. I should probably keep him out of trouble.
<<1>> wants to take the Emblem of the Last King, but there seems to be one final trap that he hasn't caught on to. I could warn him or just see what happens.
I disarmed the final trap protecting the Emblem of the Last King. I should take the Emblem and bring it to Elfbetta, Narsis Dren's assistant, at her southern camp.
<<1>> was petrified by the trap. I can use a nearby switch to disarm the mechanism and recover the Emblem without meeting a similar fate.
I warned <<1>> before he triggered the trap, but he disregarded me. I should use that a nearby switch to disarm the trap before grasping the Emblem, so that I don't meet a similar fate.

Beragon said to listen for calls for help as we search Ostumir for survivors. He asked that we keep a look out for his friend, Greenspeaker Sorilen, as well. I should search for any survivors I can aid.
We found Greenspeaker Sorilen while rescuing survivors. She invited Beragon to Ostumir to show him something she found in the nearby Ayleid ruins. She wants us to meet her there.
We arrived at the ruins but Greenspeaker Sorilen is nowhere to be seen. Beragon pointed out a dead body wearing the gear of the Recollection. I should examine the note lying next to the body.
The note contained orders to the Recollection to take something called a wildburn seed from beneath the Ayleid ruins near Ostumir. I should talk to Beragon about what that might mean.
Greenspeaker Sorilen wrote a note on the Recollection orders we found telling us she went deeper into the ruins. Beragon and I should enter the Ayleid ruins and search for his friend.

Beragon and I entered the Ayleid ruins near Ostumir. While he wants to find out more about the wildburn seed and what the Recollection is up to, he's more anxious about finding his friend. I should search the ruins for Greenspeaker Sorilen.
We found Greenspeaker Sorilen. I should talk to her and find out what she brought Beragon and I into these ruins to see.
Greenspeaker Sorilen told Beragon and I that we can find the wildburn seed deeper inside the ruins. I should explore the area and hunt down this mysterious seed.
Greenspeaker Sorilen revealed herself as a member of the Recollection. Beragon told me to get the wildburn seed while he goes after his friend. I should take the wildburn seed and follow after him.
A villager fleeing Ostumir told me to find Beragon in a camp on the northern road out of the village. I should find the camp and talk to Beragon.
The Echonir revealed a recent memory of Ithelia. I should observe it.
We witnessed the memory of an event that occurred after we destroyed the Loom. I should talk to Leramil about what we just saw.
Leramil believes we are in Fargrave, a planar crossroads of sorts. We should explore the area.
Leramil can't get any closer to the inn because of the pain the tangle she perceives inflicts on her heightened senses. I should be able to cross the barrier formed by the tangle and get inside.
Unlike Leramil, I was able to cross the barrier created by the tangled threads of fate. I can now enter the Outcast Inn and search for the source of the threat that initiated this disturbance.
Strange shadowy figures wander inside the Outcast Inn. The innkeeper sounded nervous when he called me over. I should talk to him and find out what's happening.

Innkeeper Brynmir told me the strange events around the inn scared his customers. It all started when the woman by the fire entered the inn. He asked me to get water from the well so he can make her a drink and get her talking.
I fetched water from the well. I should bring it back to Innkeeper Brynmir so he can make a drink for the woman sitting by the fire.
When I returned to the Outcast Inn, the woman asked for help. I should find out what she wants.

The woman is the Daedric Prince, Ithelia. She lost control of her powers which created the threat around the inn. A name of a drink came to her mindâ€”Sage's Dream. I should ask Innkeeper Brynmir about this drink.
Innkeeper Brynmir believes he saw a book of obscure and ancient recipes in the back courtyard. It might contain a recipe for the Sage's Dream drink. I should search the courtyard to find the book.
I found the book of obscure and ancient recipes in the courtyard's outbuilding. I should head back to Innkeeper Brynmir and show him the recipe for Sage's Dream.
The innkeeper thinks he can make some substitutions for the traditional Sage's Dream ingredients. He asked that I find some sugar from the supplies in the cellar. I should head down there now.
I went down into the cellar beneath the inn. It connects to some old ruins. I should look around for the sugar that Innkeeper Brynmir requested.
Ithelia followed me into the cellar and we watched as a strange lamp appeared in front of us. I should talk to Ithelia to find out why she doesn't like this lamp.
Ithelia feels disgust and hatred for the lamp in a way she doesn't understand. She asked that I pick up the lamp for her. I should take the lamp so we can examine it.

After I picked up the lamp, glowing lights appeared on one side of the chamber. Ithelia said there's a path that wants to be explored and suggested I shine the lamp on it. I should use the lamp's light and see what happens.
Shining the lamp's light on the anchor produced a portal. Ithelia tells me it's a door to another reality. She called it the Many Paths. I should go through the portal and see where it leads.
Ithelia says we entered the Many Paths. I should explore this path and see where it leads.
At the center of a large chamber containing a shrine, I found a different Ithelia from the one I met at the inn. She called me over to speak. I should talk to this alternate Ithelia.

The Ithelia of this path tells me that Sage's Dream will help the Ithelia of my reality regain control of her power and disperse the tangled threads hanging over the inn. I can gather tirum weed here.
I gathered the tirum weed and the alternate Ithelia opened a portal back to my reality. I should step through the portal and return to the inn's cellar.
Leramil and Scruut prepared a ritual circle. I should place the Shattered Titan fragment in the center.
I need to place the Daedric relics around the fragment to begin the ritual.
The Lamp of Clarity helped Beragon escape whatever reality Vargas trapped him in. I should talk to him about where he's been.
I freed Beragon and Tribune Alea with the Lamp of Clarity. Now I need to find a way to escape Ithelia's prison.
Ithelia directed me to another path in the ruins. I should use the Lamp of Clarity to reveal the doorway to the Many Paths.
The Lamp of Clarity revealed another doorway to the Many Paths. I should step through and see where this path leads.

Ithelia and I arrived at different location in the same shrine as before. However, the place feels gloomy this time. Ithelia urged me forward to find the next ingredient. I should explore this new path.

This alternate Ithelia seems depressed and resentful over her approaching imprisonment. However, she directed me to the next ingredient, harkfruit. I should take the harkfruit so I can leave this path.
I gathered the harkfruit for Sage's Dream. Ithelia learned to open a portal and created a doorway back to the inn. I should step through.
Ithelia directed me to another path in the ruins. I should use the Lamp of Clarity to reveal the doorway to the Many Paths.
The Lamp of Clarity revealed another doorway to the Many Paths. I should step through and see where this path leads.
This time the Many Paths led us to a shrine caught in the midst of battle as the forces of Ithelia and Hermaeus Mora clash. I need to explore this path and find the final ingredient.
Torvesard directed me to the ingredient we need, lute berries. I should gather them and leave before the Ithelia of this realm destroys everything that exists upon this path.
I gathered the lute berries. Now I should use the portal opened by the Ithelia of my reality to return to the inn's cellar.
I successfully created a Sage's Dream drink. Maybe the first one in thousands of years. I should go upstairs so I can present the drink to Ithelia.
Ithelia drank the Sage's Dream and instantly seems better. I should talk to her and find out what she's thinking.

<<1>> is suspicious of the note. The facts in the note do not line upâ€”<<2>> was not working the day <<3>> died and, with the discovery of the memorial, the visiting Uriel Weatherleah may be an imposter. Mizzik thinks we should speak to him.
I should seek out Leramil the Wise in the Elden Root Outlaws Refuge. She can tell me what we must do to stop Torvesard.
I should find Leramil the Wise in the Mournhold Outlaws Refuge. She can tell me what we must do to stop Torvesard.
I disarmed the final trap protecting the Emblem. I should bring it to Elfbetta, Narsis Dren's assistant, at her southern camp.
Narsis did not heed my warning, but I recovered the Emblem. I should deliver it to Dren's assistant, Elfbetta, at her southern camp.

Constable Yabren asked me to interview a few of the townsfolk, notably Ghrakug, the ranch overseer, and the quarry bossâ€”all people her father was planning to interview before he died. She also asked me to examine her father's office.
Constable Yabren's father's journal noted that he planned to interview the owners of the ranch and the quarry next. Yabren asked me to do that while she looks into the death of the town healer.
I met with Baron Carvain and Lady Raxalee. Now I should meet Constable Yabren at the Stonechip Gambling Den to tell her about my investigations.
Ghrakug passed along a message from Constable Yabren. She wants me to meet her at Carvain Manor and Lady Raxalee's tower to help her search for evidence pertaining to fatigue fever.
Letters and other documents found at Carvain Manor and Raxalee Tower suggest they might be involved in the suspicious deaths associated with fatigue fever. I need to investigate Zeggar's Blind next.
I reached the location northeast of Ontus known as Zeggar's Blind. I should look around and see what's going on out here.
Now that I destroyed the alchemical equipment used to make the fatigue fever elixir, I should meet Constable Yabren at the Stonechip Gambling Den.
Constable Yabren isn't here and Ghrakug has been injured. I should talk to him.
Before he succumbed to his wounds, Ghrakug told me the mercenaries that attacked him took Constable Yabren to the Ontus reservoir, north of town near the river. I should get there as soon as I can.
Baron Carvain and Lady Raxalee are issuing orders to their mercenaries. I should hear what they're talking about before I act.
Baron Carvain ordered his mercenaries to kill me and dump the barrels of elixir into the reservoir. I need to deal with them before I can catch up with Constable Yabren.
I stopped the mercenaries. Now to catch up with Constable Yabren and find Baron Carvain and Lady Raxalee.
Inside the Ontus Reservoir, Baron Carvain and Lady Raxalee are issuing orders and I see Constable Yabren bound nearby. I should set her free.
Looks like Constable Yabren caught Baron Carvain and Lady Raxalee. I should talk to her.
I helped Constable Yabren learn the truth about her father's death and bring his killers to justice. Now I should talk to her about what happens next for her and the town of Ontus.
I arrived at the Stonechip Gambling Den but Constable Yabren isn't here. Ghrakug called out to me, however. I should hear what he has to say.
<<1>> discovered <<2>> dead in the library. I should investigate the scene.
I should travel to Fort Colovia and find a way inside.
Betu the dog has been poisoned! Otho seems to have an idea of how to help Betu. I should speak to him.
I destroyed the wildburn seed before the ritual was completed. I should listen to what Nantharion is saying, because something is going very wrong.
We came upon a desk and Constable Yabren spotted a key. I should take the key.
I need to enter Varen's Watch and look for these rubble piles.
I need to find the desk that this key opens and see if I can learn anything about what's going on here.
The key unlocked the desk and revealed a letter from Baron Carvain and Lady Raxalee to Alchemist Surius.
I should enter Legion's Rest so I can look for crystaljack venom crystals.
I need to go to the Haldain Lumber Camp south of Skingrad and recover Legion tool packs loaned to the camp workers while they awaited the arrival of their own supplies.
I should enter Fyrelight Cave and see if I can find evidence of tharrikers inside.
I should enter Nonungalo so I can begin my investigation of the ruins.
Tribune Alea Idolus wants to survey the attack before deciding on a plan. She told me of an overlook near the entrance where a marketplace is often held. I should go to the overlook with her.

We arrived at the marketplace overlook near Feldagard Keep's entrance. Daedra already surround the area with a large force grouped at a breach in the wall. I should discuss next steps with Tribune Alea.
Entering the keep from the front looks impossible. Tribune Alea knows of a side entrance, though. I should find the entrance and enter Feldagard Keep.
I recovered the remedy for Betu from the pantry. I need to return to the hall to help Betu.
Betu seems to be recovering from the poison thanks to the remedy! I should talk to Mizzik about the note I found with the imposter.
Elfbetta asked me to help Narsis Dren recover the Ayleid treasure from the ruins of Wendir. I should talk to him.
Beragon figured out the Recollection is interested in the Ayleid ruin of Niryastare and asked me to meet him there. However, Leramil the Wise wants to talk to me before I leave.
Hermaeus Mora appeared and wishes to speak with me. I should see what the Prince of Fate has to say.
Tribune Alea and I made it into Feldagard Keep through the side entrance. She wants us to track down Commander Merian who leads the legionaries here. I should search the keep for the commander.

We found Commander Merian leading legionaries in the keep's defense. He warned us about Daedra climbing the walls to get in and asked us to stop them. I should slow their assault by burning the ropes and setting traps.
I set traps against the Daedric forces and burned the ropes they used to climb into the keep. It appears I slowed their assault. I should find the main courtyard and meet up with Commander Merian.

Tribune Alea and I found Commander Merian near a broken ballista. He ordered the tribune to start repairs and told me that I get the fun part. I should talk to the commander to find out what that means.
Commander Merian told me of his plan to hold back the Daedra with a wall of fire while peppering them with ballista bolts. He wants me to help with this plan. First, I should grab a bucket of oil.
Commander Merian plans to make a wall of fire to hold back the Daedra. I should use the bucket of oil to pour oil on the barricade.
I repaired the ballista with the parts I found. It's now ready for combat. I should get on the ballista and prepare to execute Commander Merian's plan.

The plan worked. We held back the waves of Daedra so I could target them with the ballista. Just when the weapon broke again, a group of Daedra stormed the courtyard through the north door. I should head there and take out the attackers.
We entered the keep's barracks, and Tribune Alea wants to talk to me. I should find out what's on her mind.
Tribune Alea believes the remaining Daedric forces have come from somewhere inside the keep. She suggested we go into the barracks below and look around. I should join her on the search.
Tribune Alea Idolus and I followed a trail of Daedra through the keep's barracks. We still haven't found the source of their incursion. I should enter the barracks armory and continue my search.
After a search through the barracks, Tribune Alea and I entered the armory below the keep. There, we found the commander of the Daedric forces. I should watch to see what she's up to.
While we watched, Shardmarshal Vargas used a blade to open a portal inside the armory. Daedric reinforcements came through and the portal closed. I should talk to Tribune Alea about this development.

We have a plan to defeat Shardmarshal Vargas and take the portal-opening blade from her. Tribune Alea told me get in place near the gateway, then we'll attack from both sides. I should get to my designated position as planned.
After Shardmarshal Vargas opened another portal, Tribune Alea impulsively attacked her. This wasn't the plan. I should try to get to Tribune Alea and help her.

Tribune Alea attacked Shardmarshal Vargas before we could execute the plan. They fell into the portal created by the blade. The last thing I heard was Tribune Alea telling me to follow her. I should go through the portal and find them both.
Tribune Alea Idolus and I defeated the Shardborn. Shardmarshal Vargas retreated and left her sword behind. She called it Abolisher. I should take the magical blade.

I entered the portal and arrived in a place very different than Feldagard Keep. As they fought, Tribune Alea Idolus knocked Abolisher from Shardmarshal Vargas's hand. In response, Vargas summoned Daedra to fight us. I should eliminate the enemy.
Now that I have Abolisher, I should try to open a portal the way we saw Shardmarshal Vargas do it. If I slash the blade through the air, maybe I can create a portal back to the keep.
I mimicked Shardmarshal Vargas and used Abolisher to open a portal. I should step through and hope it returns us to Feldagard Keep.
The portal returned us to Feldagard Keep. I should talk to Commander Merian to update him on what happened beneath the keep and with Shardmarshal Vargas.
Laeni asked me to speak to her Aunt Ciiril. Ciiril might be willing to help the couple start a new life away from Vashabar. I should be able to find her at the beer garden in the village.
I found Agawen Ciiril. I need to ask her if she can gather supplies for the couple.

Ciiril agreed to help the couple. She gave me some jagga and asked me to speak with Nedolir and Minth. Perhaps the fathers will see reason now that their children plan to leave town. They should be in pod houses near the village center.
Nedolir and Minth love their children but strongly oppose a marriage. I should find Agawen Ciiril at the stables to see how she's coming along with the supplies.
Agawen Ciiril asked that I speak to  <<1>> and <<2>>, family friends. She hopes they might be able to talk the couple into staying. Both should be near the center of the village.
I destroyed the wildburn seeds King Nantharion planted at the sites revealed by the Skein of Secrets. I should return to Beragon's townhouse in Skingrad and tell Beragon what I learned.
The survivor I found in Hastrel Hollow told me the Recollection attackers went into nearby ruins. I should investigate.
The old well led down to a cave with an underground stream. I should look around down here.

The High Elf is named Tanlorin. They're worried their friends may also have run into some trouble. Tanlorin asked me to join them at Monkey's Rest. I should go to Monkey's Rest and have a look around.
I should speak to Tanlorin to find out what they plan to do now that we saved their friends from the Ceythalmor threat.
Tanlorin indicated that the Gardener likes riddles, so likely there's something to figure out in this invitation he sent along. I should read it to see what it says.
With Snapdragon rescued and news of a traitor in the Garland Ring's ranks, Tanlorin wishes to talk about what's next.
We exposed Wisteria as the traitor within the Garland Ring. I should speak with Tanlorin again to see what they want to do next.
Tanlorin wants to use Snapdragon's journal to retrace Wisteria's steps. They want to start with a location along the coast, southwest of Seaside Sanctuary in Greenshade.
Wisteria and the Ceythalmor have been defeated. The Garland Ring is set to become something new, and Tanlorin feels ready to bring this chapter of their life to a close.

<<1>> mentioned a Wood Elf custom called the Rite of Propagation. He believes it might offer a solution to Laeni and Clendagal. He directed me to the Wilderhall, where the village preserves and honors its history.

I found an old scroll detailing the Rite of Propagation in the Wilderhall. The rite may offer the couple a way to appeal to the village for permission to marry. Spinner Belwelas suggested I talk to Agawen Ciiril before talking to Laeni and Clendagal.

Agawen Ciiril is excited about the possibility that Laeni and Clendagal might be able to stay in the village. I need to take the scroll detailing the rite to the couple. They should be in their hidden meeting spot within a nearby overgrown ruin.

The couple need to gather symbolic items to complete the Rite of Propagation. They asked me to help. Laeni and I will go to the site where the village began growing Vashabar, while Clendagal will accompany me into a nearby Ayleid ruin.
I need to return to the center of Vashabar and find Ciiril so I can assist Laeni and Clendagal complete the Rite of Propagation.
Nedolir called out, asking for an explanation of what's going on. I should speak to him before the Rite begins.
Everything is ready. I should assist Laeni and Clendagal in enacting the Rite of Propagation.
I found a campsite in Hastrel Hollow with several dead Wood Elves. There's one survivor here. I should talk to him.
Ithelia and Torvesard sealed the entrance to Hermaeus Mora's private sanctum with magical wards. I must use the Skein of Secrets to locate these wards.
The Skein of Secrets pointed me to a Colovian farmstead. I should investigate the site.
I should investigate Hastrel Hollow and see if I can determine what King Nantharion was doing there.
This farmstead looks abandoned. I should look around for clues about what happened here.
I found a note beside a dead farmer. The Recollection seemed to be interested in the nearby old well. I should investigate.
I should look at the Skein of Secrets. It may have new clues about King Nantharion's location.
We need to find Beragon and continue our search for King Nantharion or the ancient Ayleid well.
Fennorian made a counteragent to help the victims of Lord Gallio Valente's experiments. I should pick it up and pour it on on them.
The Skein of Secrets revealed the location of the Ayleid ruin of Wendir, but we have no idea why. We can only assume that we can pick up Ithelia's trail there, so I need to head to Wendir.
The spot marked by the Skein doesn't seem significant, but Leramil arrived and says she senses an anomaly. She suggests I use Abolisher and see what happens.
I need to fling the pies Apprentice Mogh gave me at the rival bakers, Chef Zee-Ram and Chef Banelle. I also need to recover Chef Dononlon's special flour blend and Mogh's mix of essential sugars.
With my help, Apprentice Mogh was able to finally create his Jubilee Cake. Now that he's finished, I should speak with him to receive my reward.
Tanlorin has a damaged lattice that should let them speak to another Garland Ring member by the name of Hyacinth. Tanlorin wants me to speak with Hyacinth while they try to fix it.
We found a few clues, but Tanlorin's friends aren't at Monkey's Rest. I should talk with Tanlorin and see what they think about the items we discovered here.
Constable Yabren asked me to start our investigation by becoming familiar with other recent deaths that have plagued the town. She suggested I start by examining the newer grave markers.
I examined the most-recent grave markers as Constable Yabren suggested. I should talk to her about anything I noticed.
I spoke to Ghrakug, the ranch overseer, and the quarry boss. And I found Constable Ulbren's notebook in the constable's office. I should return to Yabren and tell her what I learned.
I should watch the memory I revealed using the Echonir.

This arch was important to Shardmarshal Vargas. She was drawn to this place and spent a lot of time here in the centuries before she recovered her memories. Perhaps the Lamp of Clarity can reveal why.
Zerith-var wants to travel with me, it seems. I should speak to him once more before we get underway.
Beragon told me Leramil the Wise requested my help at a place called the Outcast Inn. I should investigate, and then return to Skingrad to check in with Beragon.
Beragon told me that Tribune Alea went to Feldagard Keep to warn them about the imminent attack we learned about at Hoperoot. I should go help her, and then return to check in with Beragon.
Beragon was concerned about situations at Feldagard Keep and the Outcast Inn. Since my investigation of those sites is complete, I should talk to him about what happened and what I learned.
Beragon told me my help is needed at Feldagard Keep and Outcast Inn. I must help Tribune Alea and Leramil the Wise, then return to Skingrad and check in with him.
Cantor Krin'ze suggested I look for the spirit of a little cat as I investigate the star that fell near Moonmont.
We found Lord Gallio Valente's laboratory. I should speak to Fennorian about our next steps.
I should search for Lord Gallio Valente's alchemical laboratory.
I halted the ritual by gathering the ritual items and burning the corrupted corpses. Priest Faric asked me to meet him outside the ruins.
The spirit cat I encountered at Moonmont seems to want me to follow it. I should see where it leads.
The spirit cat I met near Moonmont led me to the door of an old tomb. I should enter the tomb and see what's inside.
I encountered a Khajiit in this old tomb I was led to by the spirit cat. I should speak to him and find out what he's doing here.

The Khajiit I found in the tomb is Zerith-var. He asked for my help in finding his moonclaw, as well as anything else that might explain why he awoke in a tomb. I should search the tomb and see what I can find.
I found the armlet Zerith described to me, as well as a tablet bearing his name and an ancient crescent blade. I should bring the items I found to him.

Zerith-var wants to meet in Rawl'kha to see if the Order of the Hidden Moon still exists. Zerith wants to determine why Azurah sent him back after his death in what I assume was the First Era. I should make sure he doesn't get into any trouble.
Zerith-var told me the location of an old shrine for the Order of the Hidden Moon. It's hidden around back of the Temple of Two-Moons Dance. I should search for it.
The entrance to the Hidden Moon shrine was right where Zerith-var said it would be. I should go inside with him.
The Hidden Moon shrine Zerith-var sought in Rawl'kha appears to be abandoned and filled with the bodies of fallen members of his order. I should speak with Zerith-var about it.
Zerith-var wants me to look through a nearby book of rites of the Hidden Moon to refresh his memory for a simple consecration blessing.

Zerith-var wishes to sanctify the dead in this sanctuary and ask Azurah for guidance. To do this, he needs moon-sugar water. I should give Zerith a moment to mourn and search for moon-sugar water in the temple nearby.
I found some moon-sugar water. I should return it to Zerith-var at the Hidden Moon sanctuary in Rawl'kha.
I returned to Zerith-var with the moon-sugar water he asked for. Per his instructions, I should pour it into the basin so he can perform the rite to consecrate the remains here.
Zerith-var is performing the rite of purification and asking Azurah for guidance. I should wait for him to finish.
Tanlorin believes Wisteria and Oleander are somewhere inside Toothmaul Gully. We should head inside and use Tanlorin's tracker fly to search for them.

To find their friends, Tanlorin needs me to gather river lilies near Phaer and to purchase some silver dust from a friend of theirs named Chirrabi in Mathiisen. After I get the items, I should meet Tanlorin near the rock west of Skywatch.
I should talk to Tanlorin about what Hyacinth said. Perhaps they will have an idea about what to do next.
Tanlorin made the special resonating fluid keyed to Wisteria using the ingredients I gathered. I should collect it and meet her at Toothmaul Gully.
I found the river lilies and acquired the silver dust. I should meet Tanlorin near the big rock west of Skywatch.
Zerith-var asked Azurah for guidance and the basin in the sanctuary flared with blue flames. Zerith seemed surprised by this. I should speak with him.

Zerith-var explained that the blue flames are a signal of Rajaska piercing the veil of Nirn somewhere nearby. He marked my map at a ruin called Claw's Strike in Reaper's March. I should meet him there and help him find the Rajaska.
We encountered a Rajaska who turned Cantor Ta'khida into a type of dro-m'Athra called a Rajaska. I should help Zerith-var defeat Ta'khida-morna.
Cantor Krin'ze, the Twilight Cantor I met earlier, is here at Claw's Strike. It looks like she and her fellow Twilight Cantors are in trouble. I should talk to her and find out what the situation is.
After defeating the cantor-turned-Rajaska Ta'khida-morna, Zerith-var did something to cleanse her spirit. I should speak to him about what just happened.

Zerith explained that to help his people further, we need to restore the magic of his moonclaw. He says he can do this at the Temple of the Dark Moon in Khenarthia. I should travel through the portal he opened to go there.
Zerith-var's portal took me to Khenarthi's Roost. I should follow Zerith to the Temple of the Dark Moon.
We should find a safe spot inside Toothmaul Gully to activate Tanlorin's tracker fly.
I should follow the tracker fly through Toothmaul Gully. It should lead us to the missing Wisteria and Oleander.
The tracking fly led us to a side chamber deep in Toothmaul Gully. We should look for any sign of Wisteria and Oleander.
With Wisteria freed, Tanlorin thinks its best we speak outside of Toothmaul Gully. There's an exit nearby.
We found Wisteria locked in a cage. I should talk to her while Tanlorin works to unlock the cage door.
We saved Wisteria, but Oleander was killed by the interrogators. I should speak with Tanlorin and see what they want to do next.
Tanlorin showed me the entrance to Hyacinth's hideout, what the Garland Ring calls a greenhouse. I should go inside with Tanlorin.
Tanlorin thinks we should look around for any signs as to where Hyacinth was taken, in hopes he somehow left a clue behind.
After putting on armor, Tanlorin asked me to meet them at Rulanyil's Fall to search for Hyacinth.
I should search Rulanyil's Fall for the entrance to the Ceythalmor hideout where they are keeping Hyacinth. The note said the entrance would be marked by a red banner.
We found the Ceythalmor hideout, but we still need to find Hyacinth.
We freed Hyacinth from his magical restraints. He wants to speak with me.
Tanlorin wants to speak with me after everything we've done today to help their friends. Hyacinth also says Tanlorin is free to tell me the truth about the Garland Ring.
Tanlorin wants me to pour the resonating fluid into the tracker fly. They say we should be able to follow it to the missing Wisteria, and hopefully Tanlorin's friend Oleander, as well.
<<1>> instructed me to read the epitaph he has found. He thinks it holds a clue to solving the nearby tile puzzle and releasing the Emblem.
I need to continue my search for King Nantharion. He must be somewhere higher in the tree-fortress.
We found a strange page of orders, but still no sign of Wisteria or Oleander. We should continue deeper into the hidden chamber.
Count Calantius of Skingrad and Greenspeaker Darolith of Vashabar are here. The count wants to have a word with me. I should talk to him.
Beragon suggested I store the depleted relics in the display case. I should place them there now.
I should return to Beragon's townhouse in Skingrad and rejoin my allies.
Now that I returned to Beragon's townhouse, I should find Beragon and make sure he's all right.
Irnard opened a portal to Sunnamere, where Votary Nahlia is waiting for me. I should seek her out.
Votary Nahlia greeted me and suggested we head inside. I should proceed into the study to seek out this anomaly.
The unstable magic is a portal at the far end of the study. I need to speak to Votary Nahlia to find out what this is all about.
Votary Nahlia has stabilized the portal. We should enter together.
Votary Nahlia and I entered the strange portal. The source of the untamed magic seems to be coming from further in.
I need to meet my allies at Beragon's townhouse in Skingrad and figure out a way to repair the tears in the fabric of reality.
Leramil created a portal to help us navigate the Loom. I should enter it and continue exploring.
Tanlorin thinks something is wrong. The greenhouse is ransacked and there's a foul smell. I should speak with Tanlorin.
I found the Ithelia for this reality. She's kneeling on the floor and looks despondent. I should talk to her and learn what happened to her.

As I entered the large shrine room, I could see an enraged Ithelia in the background. A Daedra that I recognize from the first path approached and asked to speak. I should talk to him and find out what's going on.
Maerenah suggests we destroy the bloodfiend dens where Balandrus is assembling his army before we deal with the Terror himself.
We destroyed the weapon caches and collapsed the bloodfiend dens. Now I should speak to Maerenah about how we deal with Balandrus, the Terror of the Weald.
We need to find Balandrus, the Terror of the Weald, and end his reign of terror.
We found Maerenah's friend Tham. She asked me to talk to him while she composes herself.
A strange blast of magical energy blew through the unstable portal. Nahlia asked me to investigate a few things that appeared in the study while she stabilizes the threshold.
While Tanlorin weakens the ward holding Hyacinth, they want me to deactivate the control pillars so they can free him.
The Temple of the Dark Moon has been destroyed. This complicates Zerith-var's plan to restore the magic in his moonclaw. I should speak to Zerith about our next steps.

Zerith-var believes something imbued with the power of the Dark Moon could still be among the ruins of the temple. I should look through the ruins for something holding magic or of ritual significance.

I found an order of assassination for Zerith-var and myself issued by the grand inquisitor of the Torval Curiata. I also found a black pearl among the ruins of the Temple of the Dark Moon. I should speak with Zerith about both of these things.
Zerith-var and I restored the magic of his moonclaw. Now he senses another incursion of dro-m'Athra and opened a portal to take us to it. I should use Zerith's portal to learn more.

Zerith-var's portal dropped us outside the Vile Manse, where we found Cantor Krin'ze and High Cantor Viti of the Twilight Cantors. I should speak with Cantor Krin'ze to learn more about what's going on here.

Cantor Krin'ze says her fellow Twilight Cantors were dragged deep into the Vile Manse by dro-m'Athra and the Rajaska we witnessed in Claw's Strike. Krin'ze thinks it's too late to save them. I should speak to Zerith about what to do next.

Zerith-var seems confident that his Hidden Moon training can save the Twilight Cantors inside the Vile Manse. He asked for my help in saving them. I should head inside the Vile Manse to search for the lost Twilight Cantors.
Zerith-var and I found the undercroft prison. Since his moonclaw led us here, the Rajaska and the missing Twilight Cantors are probably inside. We should head inside and see what awaits us.
We were too late to stop Ravith-morna from turning Cantor Zayabi into a Rajaska. Now we have to defeat Zayabi-morna so that Zerith can use his moonclaw to cleanse her corrupted spirit.

We defeated Zayabi-morna. Just like with Cantor Ta'khida, Zerith-var cleansed her spirit from the Rajaska's corruption. Zerith opened a portal. I should leave with him and the surviving Twilight Cantors.
We seem to have found the source of the magical disturbance. I should speak to Votary Nahlia about what to do next.
Votary Nahlia ordered me to seal the doors in the library while she tries to stabilize the magic arcing off the altar.
A talking crow accused Votary Nahlia of causing this magical disturbance. I should speak to the Crow.
The Crow has a plan to fix the altar. I need to find a new focusing crystal in the east wing of the Scholarium.
I found a new focusing crystal for the altar. I should approach the altar and follow the Crow's instructions on what to do next.
The altar's crystal has been replaced, but one last step remains. I'll need to follow the Crow's instructions carefully.
I repaired the altar and scribed something called a Grimoire. I should speak to the Crow to understand what just happened.
The Crow wants me to continue on a journey to learn more about Scribing, but encouraged me to speak to Votary Nahlia first.
I found Zerith-var in Rawl'kha having a terse interaction with a guard. I should speak to him.
The message from the Gardener included some sort of riddle. I should talk to Tanlorin and see what they think it means.
The riddle pointed to Belarata in Malabal Tor, south of Vulkwasten. We should travel there and find a ring of some sort growing on a nearby islet.
We found another message in the middle of a ring of mushroom. I should examine it and see what it reveals.
The clue contains a sketch that appears to be a map of sorts. I should talk to Tanlorin and see if they recognize the location depicted.
Tanlorin thinks the sketch is directing us to a structure of woven branches somewhere near Deepwoods. I should search the area for a landmark that matches the sketch.
The illusory bird recited another riddle when I touched it. I should talk with Tanlorin and see what they make of the clue.
The illusory bird's clue seems to be directing us to the Ritual Mundus Stone in southern Malabal Tor. Once we find it, we'll need to gather some royal lavender to reveal a hidden door.
Tanlorin suggests I place the royal lavender in the prominently placed bowl near the Ritual Stone.
We entered the greenhouse. Tanlorin wants me to find and talk to the Gardener while they look around.

The Gardener asked us to find a former member of the Garland Ring. Lirinisse, code named Snapdragon. I should head for the Mages Guild in Skywatch, which is the last place the Gardener knew her to be.

The adepts told us that Snapdragon was arrested by a local reeve named Nardarmor. They don't know where she was taken, but we may be able to find more information in the reeve's office inside Skywatch Manor.
I found Reeve Nardarmor's private journal hidden behind a loose wall panel. They sent Snapdragon to Sunhold. I should talk to Tanlorin and show them what the reeve wrote.
Tanlorin contacted Hyacinth using one of those magicka lattices. They want me to talk with Hyacinth and tell him about Snapdragon's arrest and our plan to go to Sunhold.

Hyacinth had a magic circle set up on the beach. It allowed Tanlorin to focus their soul magic and enchant a nearby boat. Hyacinth believes the enchantment on the boat will allow us to quickly and safely reach Sunhold without being spotted.
We safely made it to Sunhold. The Skywatch reeve's journal mentioned a prison cell on the west side of the city. We should search the area for an entrance that leads to this Ceythalmor location.
Tanlorin opened the way to the Gardener's greenhouse using the portal curio Hyacinth provided. We should go through it before more Ceythalmor guards arrive.
With Snapdragon safe in the Gardener's greenhouse, she wishes to speak to me. I should talk to her.
A Ceythalmor prison warden guards the way to Snapdragon's cell. We need to deal with her if we're going to rescue Snapdragon..
The doors have been sealed, but the altar remains unstable. I should find Votary Nahlia to learn what to do next.
My first adventure with a Luminary has reached an end. I should talk to Nahlia and prepare for my next journey.
If anyone can help me learn about Scribing and the Luminaries, it's the Crow. I should speak with her about next steps.
The Crow said Ulfsild left echoes behind for whoever would follow in her footsteps. There should be an Echo in the main hall to start me on my path.
I found a pedestal with one of Ulfsild's echoes. I should listen to what it has to say.
Ulfsild's echo mentioned something called the True-Sight Lens, which should be awaiting me in the library's east wing. I should search for it.
I've read the Fable of the Indrik. Now the Crow wants me to look through Lens of True-Sight at a focal point.
By looking through the True-Sight Lens, I've revealed annotations within the Fable of the Indrik. I should read the book again and see what Ulfsild had to say.
I read the Fable of the Indrik and viewed the annotations left by Ulfsild. I should talk to the Crow about what comes next.
The Crow landed near the standing stone and seems eager to talk. I should see what comes next.

To enter the Indrik's domain I need to open its door. To do that, I need to form a key. I need to use the True-Sight Lens at focal points in the area to reveal wards, dispel them, and unveil the hidden key fragment nearby.
The wards are dispelled and the first key fragment has been revealed.
I'm on my own, the Crow has returned to the Scholarium. I need to find the set of wards hiding the second Indrik key fragment. I can use the fable in my pack as a guide.
The wards are dispelled and the second key fragment has been revealed.
With the first and second key fragments collected, I continue my journey for more Indrik wards. I should use the fable as a reference to see where to search next.
The wards are dispelled and the third key fragment has been revealed.
I collected the fragments and formed the key to the Indrik's door. To enter the Wing of the Indrik, I should make for the final location indicated in Ulfsild's annotations.
The door to the Wing of the Indrik has been revealed. Now to head inside and meet my first Luminary face to face.
The Indrik has asked that I place the Fable on a dais near a door. This will connect the path from his wing back to the Scholarium once more.
The Wing of the Indrik is connected back to the Scholarium. I should speak to the Indrik again to learn what comes next.

To prove my worth, the Indrik has presented me a number of challenges. I need to complete two from the list. I can decide which tasks I wish to take on and prove myself worthy of the Luminary's power.
I've completed the challenges set out by the Indrik. Time to return to the Luminary and see what comes next.

The Indrik has asked me to track down a fawn chased by a hunter, trapped in a wisp of its power. The Luminary told me that the southern Auridon cave called Del's Claim would be the place to pick up the trail.
I've found the indrik fawn. The Indrik has asked me to dispel its power from the beast, releasing it from this burden placed upon it.
The indrik fawn has been freed of the Luminary's power. It's time to return to the wing of the Indrik.
I should speak to Nahlia and catch her up on my adventures.
Before we can check the bank vault, Maerenah says we need a key to open the door. She thinks the bank clerk kept a spare vault key in a lockbox by their desk. I should look for it.
Rosalyn, one of only two survivors in the vault, told us that her husband, Grivier, has been escorting townsfolk to safety. We should leave the bank and try to find Grivier and the others.
I embarrassed the rival bakers and retrieved the sugar and flour they stole. I should speak with Apprentice Mogh now.
Felande has offered me a free inn room at the Fertile Respite Inn in Skingrad. I should speak to her to learn more about the offer.
I've agreed to become Felande's newest tenant. I should speak to her to finalize the deal.
I should travel to Skingrad in West Weald and speak to Felande about the inn room located within the Fertile Respite Inn.
I gave Apprentice Mogh his sugar and flour. Now I need to wait patiently as he prepares the Jubilee Cake.
<<1>>  instructed me to place all three items on top of the Altar so we can choose the correct one to offer.
Leramil's portal led somewhere she did not intend. I should look around.
I helped Legionary Calvo Dorso reach the bell tower and signal for reinforcements. Now I should talk to Captain Dromius about my reward.

We found more evidence that fatigue fever is being created here in this alchemical laboratory. We also found a letter ordering the alchemist to eliminate me and Ghrakug! While Yabren goes to warn him, I need to destroy this alchemical equipment.
We found the groundskeeper hiding in his residence. I should ask him about the key to the catacombs and what happened here.
Leramil believes Ithelia and Shardmarshal Vargas have reached the core of the Loom. We need to find them before Ithelia uses the Loom to rewrite history and destroy everything we know.
We found an illusory bird near the landmark of woven branches depicted in the sketch. I should interact with it and discover our next clue.

Legionary Caepio told us that the Recollection and their Daedric allies killed everyone but him. He says the Daedra opened a portal below the catacombs to bring in more soldiers. I need to find this portal.
Tribune Alea and I entered the ruins below the catacombs. We found more Recollection down here guarding the way. We need to keep searching to find the portal.
With the first fragment of the Indrik's key in my possession, the Crow wants to speak to me once more.
I met Beragon at Fort Dirich. I should look for clues as to what King Nantharion was doing here.
I found a passage leading down into the dungeons below the ruins of Fort Dirich. I should investigate.
Snapdragon believes there's a traitor in the ranks of the Garland Ring. Everyone seems stunned by the news. Meanwhile, Wisteria would like to have a word with Tanlorin. We should see what she wants.
I should check on Tanlorin and see what they make of all this talk of betrayals and traitors in the Garland Ring.
I witnessed a memory of Ithelia and King Nantharion discussing a hidden well of power in a place called Miscarcand. Beragon suggested we meet outside and discuss the implications of what we saw.
Hyacinth has a plan for getting us to Sunhold unnoticed. We should meet him at a beach south of South Beacon and find out what he has in mind.
I need to head to Beragon's townhouse in Skingrad and see how Leramil wants to resume the hunt for Ithelia, the Prince of Paths.
Lady Ursilia Valente caught me searching her husband's office. I should tell her what Lord Valente is really planning.
With the Ceythalmor prison warden dealt with, we need to look around for a key to unlock Snapdragon's cell.
We found Snapdragon alive in a cell. Once I free her, we can use the portal curio Hyacinth provided to return to the Gardener's greenhouse.
Pim said that one of the Bitterfish camps was nearby. That's where we should start our investigation into what has the Goblins so up in arms.
Before we depart for Apocrypha, Leramil suggested I retrieve the Daedric relicsâ€”Abolisher, the Lamp of Clarity, the Skein of Secrets, and the Mirror of Truth.
We arrived at a goblin camp that Pim says belongs to the Bitterfish Tribe. We should look for signs of any struggle or disturbance that would have provoked the Goblins.
After investigating the Sharp Tooth camp, Pim and I heard a voice cry out for help. Pim thinks it's Bella and asked me to help.
We reached the site near the Bone Orchard. It appears there was a struggle, but no sign of Hyacinth or Snapdragon. We should look around.

Tanlorin noted there's a good amount of blood nearby but no bodies. They think we can follow to trail to a survivor of the battle that took place here. I should crouch down so I can follow the trail better.
The trail of blood led us to a severely wounded Snapdragon. Tanlorin asked me to talk to her.

Snapdragon died from her injuries. She said the Ceythalmor attacked her, and Hyacinth was with them. She accused him of being the traitor. Before she died, she told us they were planning to take her to the tunnels beneath a tower in Southpoint.
We found an injured Ceythalmor agent hiding in the tunnels beneath Southpoint, but there's still no sign of Hyacinth. Perhaps we can convince the agent to talk to us.
I should talk to Tanlorin about the journal and metal disk I found while searching the Ceythalmor captain's quarters.
Pim said that the hunters are camping out at Gray's Hollow. I should find Pim at Gray's Hollow so we can stop the hunters.
Jerntann is keeping the Goblin tribe's totems somewhere in Gray's Hollow. I have to find them if Pim is going to end this Goblin war.
I've defeated Tho'at Replicanum. I should talk to Master Malkhest to see if I've solved his problem.
Tanlorin is eager to save Hyacinth from the Ceythalmor. We need to make our way to Malabal Tor to reach Crimson Cove and find him.
We freed Hyacinth. Now we should exit Crimson Cove and talk to him outside.
I should speak with Hyacinth and find out what that was all about.

Wisteria tortured Hyacinth for information about the Garland Ring. He convinced her there was a journal at his greenhouse in Greenshade that contained valuable information about the Ring. If we hurry we might be able to confront her.
Wisteria departed. I should talk to Tanlorin about what we learned and how they're dealing with all this.
I need to find a Mirrormoor incursion and join forces with other adventurers to fight off the attacking Daedra. If I defeat the incursion leader, I can repel the attack.
The Dragon's power has amplified the altar, and another Wing of the Scholarium has been restored. I should speak with Votary Nahlia.
Pim and I found several signs of antagonism at the Bitterfish camp. She has some suspicions on what is going on and wants to talk to me.
The Netch's power has amplified the altar, and another Wing of the Scholarium has been restored. I should speak with Votary Nahlia.
I helped defeat a Mirrormoor incursion. I should return to <<1>> to report my success.
I need to find a Mirrormoor incursion and join forces with other adventurers to fight off the attacking Daedra. If I defeat the incursion leader, I can repel the attack.
I met Bella Vestum. She asked me to find a Goblin researcher called Pim who's looking into the aggressive Goblins.
We defeated the Ceythalmor agents, but Wisteria got away. We should help Hyacinth get free from his bonds.
Pim has concerns after seeing what happened at the Bitterfish camp. She asked me to join her at the nearest Sharp Tooth camp to investigate further.
I arrived at the Sharp Tooth Goblin camp. Pim and I need to investigate the camp.
Nahlia saw me pick up the Fable of the Dragon and came over to chat. I should see what she wants to talk about.
Nahlia suggested I listen to an echo in the east wing that might have advice for how to contend with the Dragon Luminary.
I should listen to the Echo of Ulfsild to hear her advice about the Dragon Luminary.

The Echo of Ulfsild said to seek her annotated fable "at the meeting of many paths. A room full of doors with no hinges." I should seek this location in the Scholarium or ask Nahlia for help with to decipher this riddle.
I found Ulfsild's annotated fable. I can use the hints in Ulfsild's annotations to find the Dragon wards in Reaper's March. I can also ask my allies in the Scholarium for help.
I freed Bella. I should talk to her and see if we can find out any other information.
The wards are dispelled and the first key fragment has been revealed.
With the first key fragment collected, I continue my journey for more Dragon wards. I should use the fable as a reference to see where to search next.
The wards are dispelled and the second key fragment has been revealed.
With the second key fragment collected, I continue my journey for more Dragon wards. I should use the fable as a reference to see where to search next.
The wards are dispelled and the third key fragment has been revealed.
I collected the fragments and formed the key to the Dragon's door. To enter the Wing of the Dragon, I should make for the final location indicated in Ulfsild's annotations.
I found the secret door to the Wing of the Dragon. I should enter and speak to the Dragon Luminary. As I do, I should keep in mind what Ulfsild told me about how to answer the Dragon's questions.
The Dragon has asked that I place the Fable on a dais near a door. This will connect the path from its wing back to the Scholarium once more.
The Wing of the Dragon is connected back to the Scholarium. I should speak to the Dragon again to learn what comes next.

To prove my worth, the Dragon has presented me a number of riddle challenges. I need to complete three from the list. I can decide which tasks to take on. I can also ask my allies in the Scholarium for help.
I've completed the riddles set out by the Dragon. Time to return to the Luminary and see what comes next.
I spoke with Nahlia and the Crow. Nahlia seems to recall a hidden detail in the Mizbi fable and the Crow suggested I follow in Ulfsild's footsteps to discover how she overcame this trial.
Nahlia thinks Ulfsild laid the groundwork for an unsolveable riddle we can present to the Dragon. I should enter the Dragon's Wing and present my riddle: "Am I Ulfsild's inheritor?"
I opened the Wing of the Dragon and amplified the Scribing Altar with the power of the Dragon. I should speak to Nahlia.
I should find Apprentice Mogh and see how I can help.
Tanlorin appears to be doing something unusual. I should wait to see what happens.

Tanlorin thinks that if we can find another object connected to Wisteria, they may be able to learn more about the Ceythalmor's plans. We should head to the Labyrinth, the next location mentioned in Snapdragon's journal.
Tanlorin was able to manifest a glimpse of Wisteria's time here. I should see what Tanlorin thinks about what we heard.
We learned the name of the Ceythalmor mustering point: Dusk Keep. We have one more lead to follow at Echo Pond in Greenshade. We should head there to see what else we can learn.
<<1>> brought me to the altar. He has something to say about the items we found and how they can be used at the altar.
The True-Sight lens was right where the echo of Ulfsild said it would be. I should bring it to the Crow to see what comes next.
The Crow instructed me to read the Fable of the Indrik. The text should be somewhere right here in the Scholarium Main Hall.
We found another bottle of Shimmerene Rose near the Echo Pond. We should see if Tanlorin can conjure a glimpse of Wisteria's time here.
The Indrik wants me to complete a few challenges to prove my commitment. I should review the challenges he's set out.
We found a Ceythalmor encampment at the location described in Snapdragon's journal. We should search the area for anything that could shed light on Wisteria's plan.
The Skein of Secrets revealed a path. I should follow it and see where it leads.
Hooke asked me to find three old members of his gang and convince them to meet him at the Skingrad Outlaws Refuge.
I met with Hooke's former comrades. I should report back to him. I can find him at the Skingrad Outlaws Refuge.
Hooke found the location of another former Scarlets member, Naku. I can make contact with him at his mining claim south of Skingrad.
I found a letter at Naku's camp. It instructed Naku to go to a meeting in Fyrelight Cave. I should see what I can learn there.
I found Naku arguing with someone cloaked up on a mining scaffolding deeper inside Fyrelight Cave, but there's no way up. I should learn what I can from their argument.
Naku was killed right before my eyes. I should see if I can find anything near his corpse to help me learn more about the killer.
I found the killer's knife beside Naku's corpse. It bears a strange symbol on it. I should bring it to Hooke in the Skingrad Outlaws Refuge and see what he makes of it.
Hooke believes the killer is Marcan Caelum, master of a manor the Scarlets accidentally burned down years ago. He asked me to meet him there along with the rest of the Scarlets.
Hooke wants my help searching the ruins of Caelum Vineyard for signs of Marcan. I should search the vineyard.
After discovering signs of Marcan's presence at Caelum Vineyard, Hooke wants to discuss our plans. I should talk to him.
Hooke believes Marcan is hiding in the abandoned cellars below the ruins of Caelum Vineyard. We need to find the cellar entrance.
With Hooke's help, I found the entrance to the cellars below Caelum Vineyard. I should go in and find Marcan Caelum.
I learned that Marcan Caelum captured Valenia while we were searching the ruins of the vineyard. Hooke thinks he took her to the cellars. We have to find them!
The door to the cellars is locked. I should search for anything that might help while Big Urm batters down the door.
I found Marcan Caelum holding Valenia with a knife to her throat. I need to confront him and save Valenia before it's too late.
Hooke asked me to keep Marcan distracted so he can free Valenia and get her to safety. I need to keep the killer talking until Hooke has freed her.
I distracted the killer, but Marcan decided to set the cellar on fire and meet the same fate as his wife and child. I need to find a way out of the cellar.
With Hooke's help, we were able to save Valenia and escape the cellar underneath Caelum Vineyard unharmed. I should speak with Hooke.

I prepared the barricade to set it on fire. Commander Merian ordered Tribune Alea to get in position as lookout. He wants me to finish repairing the ballista. I should grab the necessary parts to fix the weapon.
The way forward appears blocked, but Leramil suggests I use the Lamp of Clarity and see what it reveals.
Ithelia's very presence seems to be transforming Apocrypha into Mirrormoor. I need to keep going and reach Hermaeus Mora's private sanctum.
The way forward appears blocked, but Leramil suggests I use the Lamp of Clarity and see what it reveals.
Ithelia's very presence seems to be transforming Apocrypha into Mirrormoor. I need to keep going and reach Hermaeus Mora's private sanctum.
We strengthened our bond of friendship and recovered Moon-Singer Talbira's song. Now all we need to do is figure out how to find Ravith-morna. I should talk to Zerith-var.
I gathered the adolescent guzzard from the trap. I should finish the job and bring it to <<1>> for payment.
I gathered the old guzzard from Marcien's trap. I should finish the job and bring it to <<1>> for payment.
I gathered Versidue from the trapper's snare. I should finish the job and return it to Star-Gazer Sariyaah for payment.
I found Trapper Marcien. I should report my findings to Sariyaah in Ontus.
The arcane knot isn't stable outside of the null arca. The faster I can get the knot to the null arca, the better.
I made it out of the citadel and placed the arcane knot into the null arca. I should talk to Keshargo now.
I made it out of the citadel and placed the arcane knot into the null arca. I should talk to Keshargo now.
I made it out of the citadel and placed the arcane knot into the null arca. I should talk to Keshargo now.
Keshargo will want to see what I found, but it won't be safe enough to show him until the arcane knot is in the null arca.
Keshargo will want to see what I found, but it won't be safe enough to show him until the arcane knot is in the null arca.
I recovered a Ghost Light Bottle. I should give it to Keshargo.
I have recovered a Ghost Light Bottle. I should give it to Keshargo.
I have recovered a piece of Living Glass from Xoryn. I should give it to Keshargo.
Valaria Calidius said that someone named Neletai would know what happened to the expedition and their attackers. I should find Neletai and talk to her.
I need to talk to Neletai outside the Lucent Citadel.
The portal that Valaria Calidius made can take me to Lucent Citadel.
Torvesard left to go find his Prince. Hermaeus Mora called for us to return to the Mythos Vault and speak with him. There's nothing left to do in Ithelia's prison.
I recovered the Goblin tribes' totems. I should give them to Pim as soon as possible.

Ithelia and Hermaeus Mora have agreed to send the Prince of Paths to a distant reality where her power doesn't exist instead of simply returning her to prison and starting the cycle again. I should watch what happens.
Cantor Krin'ze asked to meet with us at Redfur Trading Post in Grahtwood. We should head there now.
Zerith and I found Cantor Krin'ze at Redfur Trading Post. I should speak with her.

Cantor Krin'ze told us that a cantor named Izalgo disappeared after being summoned to attend an exorcism in the area. Zerith and I should ask around the Redfur Trading Post for any information on his whereabouts.

Zerith and I questioned the residents of Redfur about Cantor Izalgo. We learned that he and the Inquisitors of the Torval Curiata accompanying him headed for Goldfolly, just south of Redfur Trading Post.
Zerith and I arrived at Goldfolly in search of the missing Twilight Cantor Izalgo and his Inquisitor escorts. We should search Goldfolly for more information.
Zerith and I found a recently deceased Inquisitor of the Torval Curiata. Zerith believes he can communicate with the Inquisitor's spirit to get more information about what happened here.

Zerith called forth the spirit of a recently deceased Inquisitor of the Torval Curiata. I should speak with the spirit to get more information on what happened to it and the rest of Cantor Izalgo's party.
Zerith and I learned from a deceased Inquisitor that Izalgo, the missing Twilight Cantor, was apparently lured beneath Goldfolly by a Rajaska. I should search behind the stables for the entrance.
It seems there's an old mining tunnel beneath Goldfolly. I should search it for any sign of Cantor Izalgo and the missing Inquisitors.
Zerith and I discovered a journal belonging to the missing Twilight Cantor, Izalgo. We should return to Cantor Krin'ze at Redfur Trading Post and tell her what we learned.
Cantor Krin'ze suggests we learn more about Ravith-morna. I should speak to Zerith-var and find out what he knows about the leader of the Rajaska.
Zerith wants to share his memories of Ravith-morna with me and Krin'ze. We need to travel to Jode's Light in Reaper's March, where he can enact a ritual to show us his memories.
Zerith and I made it to Jode's Light. I should make my way to ritual room to witness Zerith's memories.
Cantor Krin'ze made it to the ritual chamber in Jode's Light before us. She prepared the chamber for Zerith, who has instructed me to ignite the braziers to begin the ritual.
Cantor Krin'ze and I are going to witness Zerith's memories of Ravith-morna through a ritual. I should kneel before the meditation altar to begin.

I entered Zerith's first memory of Ravith-morna. Zerith told me by peering into the light of memory we can walk through his past, side by side. I should touch the light of memory to experience this event.
I entered Zerith's second memory of Ravith-morna. By peering into the light of memory, we can walk through his past. I should touch the light of memory to experience the next event.
I entered Zerith's third memory of Ravith-morna. By peering into the light of memory, we can walk through his past. I should touch the light of memory to experience the next event.

Zerith abruptly ended the memory and demanded we stop the ritual. He needs a moment to gather himself and suggested I speak with Cantor Krin'ze. Maybe she understands what we just saw and knows what we should do next.

After witnessing Moon-Singer Talbira's control over the Rajaska, Cantor Krin'ze wants to visit the Tomb of the Moon-Singers in Rimmen Necropolis. There we can try to commune with Talbira's spirit. Zerith opened a portal. Time to step inside.
We arrived at the Rimmen Necropolis. We should search for the Tomb of the Moon-Singers, which lies somewhere to the northeast.
Izalgo-morna, the fallen Twilight Cantor we sought at Goldfolly, ambushed us in Rimmen Necropolis. I should help Zerith defeat him so we can free him from Ravith-morna's control.
We entered the Tomb of the Moon-Singers. Now we need to find Moon-Singer Talbira's resting place.
Something strange happened when Zerith summoned the spirit of Moon-Singer Talbira. I should speak to Cantor Krin'ze to find out more.
Cantor Krin'ze went through a portal that Zerith-var opened for her. Now that we dealt with Cantor Izalgo's spirit, we should follow through the portal and meet up with Krin'ze.
I should speak with Cantor Krin'ze about what happened in the Tomb of the Moon-Singers.
Captain Dartorius said she ordered her legionaries to retreat to Fort Hastrel. I should head there and see if I can determine what happened to Legionary Ulrath and the rest of the squadron.
I decided to tell Captain Dartorius the lie Legionary Ulrath suggested. That he died along with the rest of the squad. I should give his report to the captain and collect my pay.
Inside Fort Hastrel, I located Legionary Ulrath and a number of fallen legionaries. I should speak with Ulrath and get his side of the story.
I should talk to the Gardener about Tanlorin's plan and inform him about the plot against the Proxy Queen.
I should gather the adolescent guzzard from the trap and bring it to <<1>>.
Beragon wants to warn King Nantharion that he may have a Recollection spy in his midst. I need to rendezvous with Beragon and Tribune Alea near Hoperoot.
With the aid of the Gardener and Hyacinth, Tanlorin is building a connection with Wisteria strong enough to bring push us to her side.
Another obstacle in our path as we see increasing evidence of Ithelia's realm-altering power. Leramil suggests I use the Lamp of Clarity and see what it reveals.
The Mythos changes and warps as Ithelia's hold on Apocrypha strengthens. I must reach Hermaeus Mora's private sanctum and find a way to stop the Forgotten Prince.
Once again the path forward is blocked. I should use the Lamp of Clarity to find a way to continue.
The Mythos changes and warps as Ithelia's hold on Apocrypha strengthens. I must reach Hermaeus Mora's private sanctum and find a way to stop the Forgotten Prince.
Legionary Caepio asked me to go to Beragon's townhouse and see how I can help him continue his investigation of the Recollection.
It worked, Tanlorin was able to teleport us into Dusk Keep. We should search the keep for Wisteria so we can put a stop to the Ceythalmor plan to assassinate the Proxy Queen.
Wisteria and her agents have teleported away. We may be able to empower the ritual site to follow them. We should try to reactive it.
I reactivated the Ceythalmor ritual. I should use it to follow Wisteria and stop the assassination of the Proxy Queen.
Wisteria is dead and the Ceythalmor attempt on the Proxy Queen's life has ended. I should talk to Tanlorin and see how they're handling this victory.
We stopped the Ceythalmor attack on the Proxy Queen and killed Wisteria. Now that we're in the safety of the Gardener's greenhouse, I should talk with him.
The Gardener asked me to burn a bouquet of flowers as part of a ceremony. I should place them in the brazier.
The Gardener has decided to disband the Garland Ring, hoping to integrate it into the Proxy Queen's court. I should speak with Tanlorin and see how they feel about this development.
Tanlorin's connection to Wisteria is as strong as it will ever be. I should tap into Tanlorin's magic to hopefully draw us to Dusk Keep.
I should gather the old guzzard from Marcien's trap and bring it to <<1>>.
We arrived in the Alinor throne room just after Wisteria. Unless Tanlorin can convince her to surrender, we'll have to end her to stop the assassination.
I should gather Versidue from the trap and deliver it to Star-Gazer Sariyaah.
Sariyaah said Trapper Marcien's camp is to the north of Ontus. I should travel there and see what I can learn.
I got the guzzards to disperse. Now, I should free Marcien from their net.
I freed Marcien from their net. I should talk to them to find out what happened.
The Dragon wants me to complete a few riddle challenges to prove my commitment. I should review the challenges it has set out.
Now that I'm inside the manor, I need to find Lord Gallio Valente's office to search for clues regarding the purpose of the wine he's put up for auction.
Beragon noticed Recollection notes near the great welkynd stone. I should examine them to see what we might learn.
The Dragon has tasked me with crafting a riddle she cannot solve. I should speak with Nahlia and the Crow for help on completing this trial.
I took the bait from Marcien. I should throw it away or remove it from the area so the guzzards will leave them alone.
Ulfsild's notes led us back to Sunnamere, which once belonged to Ulfsild. I should search for a focal point to find the next hidden piece of the puzzle.
Ulfsild's notes at Sunnamere led us to the distant ruin of Paragon's Remembrance. I should seek out her final set of notes on the Dragon's trial.
The Crow advised me to search for Ulfsild's notes in the east wing of the Scholarium.
Nahlia opened a portal to Dov-Vahl Shrine, where Ulfsild hid a series of notes on crafting a riddle for the Dragon. I should search for a focal point to find these notes.
I followed  leads from Nahlia and the Crow and learned more about how Ulfsild developed a riddle that stumped the Dragon. I should speak to Nahlia to decide my way forward.
I found Trapper Marcien tangled in their own net, swarmed by hungry guzzards. I should take the guzzard bait off Marcien.
I found a false book with a message from Ulfsild that unlocked an echo she had hidden away.
Tribune Alea and I reached a deeper section of Miscarcand, but we still haven't caught up with King Nantharion. We should keep going.
The Echonir revealed a memory of Ithelia cornered by Hermaeus Mora. In the memory, she retreated to the north. I should investigate that section of the ruins.
This book titled Nable of the Fetch doesn't appear to be the fable that I was looking for. I should speak to the Crow to see what I can do.
The Crow has directed me to an Echo of Ulfsild. I should see if it holds any clues as to where the Fable of the Netch has gone.
I activated the echo, but the Netch has replaced it with one of its own design. I should see what it has to say.
Nahlia helped me provoke a reaction from the Netch. I should follow the Luminary's illusionary squirrels to see where they lead me.
I found the real Fable of the Netch. I should use the hints in Ulfsild's annotations to find the Netch's wards in Vvardenfell. I can also ask my allies in the Scholarium for help.
The wards are dispelled and the first key fragment has been revealed.
With the first key fragment collected, I continue my journey for more Netch wards. I should use the fable as a reference to see where to search next.
The wards are dispelled and the second key fragment has been revealed.
With the second key fragment collected, I continue my journey for more Netch wards. I should use the fable as a reference to see where to search next.
The wards are dispelled and the third key fragment has been revealed.
I collected the fragments and formed the key to the Netch's door. To enter the Wing of the Netch, I should make for the final location indicated in Ulfsild's annotations.
I found the secret door to the Wing of the Netch. I should enter and speak to the Netch Luminary.
The Netch has asked that I place the Fable on a dais near a door. This will connect the path from its wing back to the Scholarium once more.
The Wing of the Netch is connected back to the Scholarium. I should speak to the Netch again to learn what comes next.
The Netch wants me to complete a few game challenges to prove my commitment. I should review the challenges it has set out.

To prove my worth, the Netch has presented me a number of game challenges. I need to complete three from the list. I can decide which tasks I wish to take on to prove myself worthy of the Luminary's power.
I've completed the games set out by the Netch. Time to return to the Luminary and see what comes next.
I've completed the Luminary's trial. I should return to the Wing of the Netch and see what it has to say.
I opened the Wing of the Netch and amplified the Scribing Altar with the power of the Netch. I should speak to Nahlia.
The Netch told me that Nahlia and I are going to allow a man a chance to speak with his son one last time. I need to speak with Nahlia before traveling to the dying man's side.
I found and spoke with three fragments of the dying man's soul and urged them back to Suran. I should speak to Elic to see how things are going.
I was pranked by the Netch, and Nahlia came to investigate the noise. I should speak to her.
We found Beragon, but Nantharion and Ithelia have reached the Ayleid well. I need to use Abolisher to get past a locked gate and reach them.
The arcane knot is somewhere within the Lucent Citadel. I should explore the citadel to find it.
Nahlia found me in Suran, apparently after a briefing from the Netch. I should speak to her.
I need to find and speak to the dying man's son at the clinic in Suran, on the isle of Vvardenfell.
Nahlia put a magical ink on Elic's father, which connected her to the fragments of the dying man. Working with the Netch, she will open portals that will lead me to the fragments of the man's soul.
We arrived at the site of the instability that Scruut detected, but all we found was a man whose connection to the threads of fate is frayed. I should speak to him.
I found the tear in reality inside Faro's Cavern. I should examine it.
The forager described a tear that could be the instability we're looking for. I should enter Faro's Cavern and take a look.
I should take Legionary Ulrath's report to Captain Dartorius and tell her what happened to Ulrath. I can either tell her the truth or make up a lie.
